ON Full: Despite Sentence (2), the lighting provided for illumination may be controlled by motion sensors installed in accordance with the Building Code.
ON Variations: Despite Sentence (2), the lighting provided for illumination may be controlled by motion sensors installed in accordance with the Building Code.

ON Full: Except as required by Sentence (5), the space above a mezzanine need not be considered as a storey in calculating building height provided, the aggregate area of mezzanines that are not superimposed does not exceed 40% of the open area of the room in which they are located, and (See Appendix A.) except as permitted in Sentence (8) and Sentence 3.3.2.11.(3) the space above the mezzanine is used as an open area without partitions or subdividing walls higher than 1 070 mm above the mezzanine floor.
ON Variations: Except as required by Sentence (5), the space above a mezzanine need not be considered as a storey in calculating building height provided, the aggregate area of mezzanines that are not superimposed does not exceed 40% of the open area of the room in which they are located, and (See Appendix A.) except as permitted in Sentence (8) and Sentence 3.3.2.11.(3) the space above the mezzanine is used as an open area without partitions or subdividing walls higher than 1 070 mm above the mezzanine floor.

ON Full: The emergency reporting devices required in Sentence (1) are permitted to be public telephones with an emergency no charge capability and their location shall be plainly indicated by appropriate signs.
ON Variations: The emergency reporting devices required in Sentence (1) are permitted to be public telephones with an emergency no charge capability and their location shall be plainly indicated by appropriate signs.

ON Full: Where doors are provided between the vault described in Sentence (16) and the rest of the building, they shall have suitable seals such as weatherstripping to minimize the entrance of dust into the vault.
ON Variations: Where doors are provided between the vault described in Sentence (16) and the rest of the building, they shall have suitable seals such as weatherstripping to minimize the entrance of dust into the vault.

ON Full: Alternating siphons shall not be installed in a sewage system.
ON Variations: Alternating siphons shall not be installed in a sewage system.

ON Full: A fire alarm system is not required in a hotel 3 storeys or less in building height provided each suite has direct access to an exterior exit facility leading to ground level.
ON Variations: A fire alarm system is not required in a hotel 3 storeys or less in building height provided each suite has direct access to an exterior exit facility leading to ground level.

ON Full: Containers for flammable liquids or combustible liquids stored indoors shall be stored in conformance with Subsection 4.2.7.
ON Variations: Containers for flammable liquids or combustible liquids stored indoors shall be stored in conformance with Subsection 4.2.7.

ON Full: The public address system and the communication system described in Sentences (9) and (10) shall be interconnected.
ON Variations: The public address system and the communication system described in Sentences (9) and (10) shall be interconnected.

ON Full: Closures in fire separations shall not be obstructed, blocked, wedged open, or altered in any way that would prevent the intended operation of the closure.
ON Variations: Closures in fire separations shall not be obstructed, blocked, wedged open, or altered in any way that would prevent the intended operation of the closure.

ON Full: Except as required by Sentence (5), the requirements in this Subsection are permitted to be applied to each portion of a building not more than 3 storeys in building height, in which a vertical fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h separates the portion from the remainder of the building as if it were a separate building, provided there are no openings through the fire separation, other than those for piping, tubing, wiring and totally enclosed noncombustible raceways.
ON Variations: Except as required by Sentence (5), the requirements in this Subsection are permitted to be applied to each portion of a building not more than 3 storeys in building height, in which a vertical fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h separates the portion from the remainder of the building as if it were a separate building, provided there are no openings through the fire separation, other than those for piping, tubing, wiring and totally enclosed noncombustible raceways.

ON Full: A building classified as Group C other than a retirement home is permitted to conform to Sentence (2) provided, it is not more than 3 storeys in building height, and it has a building area not more than the value in Table 3.2.2.46.
ON Variations: A building classified as Group C other than a retirement home is permitted to conform to Sentence (2) provided, it is not more than 3 storeys in building height, and it has a building area not more than the value in Table 3.2.2.46.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (2), where the use of an area of floor or roof is not provided for in Article 4.1.5.3., the specified live loads due to the use and occupancy of the area shall be determined from an analysis of the loads resulting from the weight of, (a) the probable assembly of persons, (b) the probable accumulation of equipment and furnishings, and (c) the probable storage of materials.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (2), where the use of an area of floor or roof is not provided for in Article 4.1.5.3., the specified live loads due to the use and occupancy of the area shall be determined from an analysis of the loads resulting from the weight of, (a) the probable assembly of persons, (b) the probable accumulation of equipment and furnishings, and (c) the probable storage of materials.

ON Full: Air-supported structures shall be constructed of material conforming to CAN/ULC-S109, "Flame Tests of Flame-Resistant Fabrics and Films", or NFPA 701, "Fire Tests for Flame Propagation of Textiles and Films".
ON Variations: Air-supported structures shall be constructed of material conforming to CAN/ULC-S109, "Flame Tests of Flame-Resistant Fabrics and Films", or NFPA 701, "Fire Tests for Flame Propagation of Textiles and Films".

ON Full: In a building that is not more than 3 storeys in building height, a self-closing device is not required on a door that is located between a classroom and a corridor providing access to exit from the classroom, except that a self-closing device is required on a door between a hazardous classroom and the corridor in an elementary or secondary school.
ON Variations: In a building that is not more than 3 storeys in building height, a self-closing device is not required on a door that is located between a classroom and a corridor providing access to exit from the classroom, except that a self-closing device is required on a door between a hazardous classroom and the corridor in an elementary or secondary school.

ON Full: Every pressure vessel that is part of a plumbing system or connected to a plumbing system shall be equipped with a pressure relief valve designed to open when the water pressure in the tank reaches the rated working pressure of the tank, and so located that the pressure in the tank shall not exceed 1 100 kPa or one-half the maximum test pressure sustained by the tank, whichever is the lesser.
ON Variations: Every pressure vessel that is part of a plumbing system or connected to a plumbing system shall be equipped with a pressure relief valve designed to open when the water pressure in the tank reaches the rated working pressure of the tank, and so located that the pressure in the tank shall not exceed 1 100 kPa or one-half the maximum test pressure sustained by the tank, whichever is the lesser.

ON Full: Where collective venting of multiple installations of laundry-drying equipment is used, the ventilation system shall,(a) be connected to a common exhaust duct that is vented by one central exhaust fan and incorporates one central lint trap, (b) include an interlock to activate the central exhaust fan when laundry-drying equipment is in use, and (c) where required by Article 9.32.3.8., be provided with make-up air.
ON Variations: Where collective venting of multiple installations of laundry-drying equipment is used, the ventilation system shall,(a) be connected to a common exhaust duct that is vented by one central exhaust fan and incorporates one central lint trap, (b) include an interlock to activate the central exhaust fan when laundry-drying equipment is in use, and (c) where required by Article 9.32.3.8., be provided with make-up air.

ON Full: Except as permitted in Sentence (6), exhaust systems shall discharge directly to the outdoors. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Except as permitted in Sentence (6), exhaust systems shall discharge directly to the outdoors. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (2), each exterior wall in each storey shall be braced with at least one diagonal brace conforming to Sentence (3).
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (2), each exterior wall in each storey shall be braced with at least one diagonal brace conforming to Sentence (3).

ON Full: This Subsection applies to the indoor storage of combustible fibres.
ON Variations: This Subsection applies to the indoor storage of combustible fibres.

ON Full: Where an emergency power system is installed, instructions shall be provided for switching on essential loads and for starting the generator when this is not done automatically.
ON Variations: Where an emergency power system is installed, instructions shall be provided for switching on essential loads and for starting the generator when this is not done automatically.

ON Full: A room intended for the storage of flammable liquids and combustible liquids shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating in conformance with the Fire Code made under the Fire Protection and Prevention Act, 1997.
ON Variations: A room intended for the storage of flammable liquids and combustible liquids shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating in conformance with the Fire Code made under the Fire Protection and Prevention Act, 1997.

ON Full: All handrails shall be constructed so as to be continually graspable along their entire length with no obstruction on or above them to break a handhold. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: All handrails shall be constructed so as to be continually graspable along their entire length with no obstruction on or above them to break a handhold. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: No more than 500 L of flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be stored in a cabinet.
ON Variations: No more than 500 L of flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be stored in a cabinet.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentences (4) to (7), a standpipe system shall be installed in every building that, is more than 3 storeys in building height, is more than 14 m high measured between grade and the ceiling of the top storey, or is not more than 14 m high measured between grade and the ceiling of the top storey but has a building area exceeding the area shown in Table 3.2.9.1. for the applicable building height if the building is not sprinklered.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentences (4) to (7), a standpipe system shall be installed in every building that, is more than 3 storeys in building height, is more than 14 m high measured between grade and the ceiling of the top storey, or is not more than 14 m high measured between grade and the ceiling of the top storey but has a building area exceeding the area shown in Table 3.2.9.1. for the applicable building height if the building is not sprinklered.

ON Full: Every sewage system shall be operated and maintained so that,(a) the sewage system or any part of it shall not emit, discharge or deposit sanitary sewage or effluent onto the surface of the ground, (b) sanitary sewage or effluent shall not emit, discharge, seep, leak or otherwise escape from the sewage system or any part of it other than from a place or part of the sewage system where the system is designed or intended to discharge the sanitary sewage or effluent, and (c) except as provided in Sentence (2), sanitary sewage or effluent shall not emit, discharge, seep, leak or otherwise escape from the sewage system or any part of it into a piped water supply, well water supply, a watercourse, ground water or surface water.
ON Variations: Every sewage system shall be operated and maintained so that,(a) the sewage system or any part of it shall not emit, discharge or deposit sanitary sewage or effluent onto the surface of the ground, (b) sanitary sewage or effluent shall not emit, discharge, seep, leak or otherwise escape from the sewage system or any part of it other than from a place or part of the sewage system where the system is designed or intended to discharge the sanitary sewage or effluent, and (c) except as provided in Sentence (2), sanitary sewage or effluent shall not emit, discharge, seep, leak or otherwise escape from the sewage system or any part of it into a piped water supply, well water supply, a watercourse, ground water or surface water.

ON Full: The bonding connection required in Sentence (1) shall be fixed to the tank vehicle or storage tank before dome covers are raised and shall remain in place until filling is completed and all dome covers have been closed and secured.
ON Variations: The bonding connection required in Sentence (1) shall be fixed to the tank vehicle or storage tank before dome covers are raised and shall remain in place until filling is completed and all dome covers have been closed and secured.

ON Full: Except as provided in Article 9.8.4.5A., at least one stair between each floor level within a dwelling unit and exterior stairs serving a house or an individual dwelling unit shall have a width of not less than 860 mm.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Article 9.8.4.5A., at least one stair between each floor level within a dwelling unit and exterior stairs serving a house or an individual dwelling unit shall have a width of not less than 860 mm.

ON Full: This Subsection does not apply if the stored tires or shredded tires in the storage yard are covered by a minimum depth of 150 mm of noncombustible material.
ON Variations: This Subsection does not apply if the stored tires or shredded tires in the storage yard are covered by a minimum depth of 150 mm of noncombustible material.

ON Full: Aisles required in Sentence (3) may be reduced in width to 750 mm when serving 60 seats or less, or 900 mm when serving seats on one side only.
ON Variations: Aisles required in Sentence (3) may be reduced in width to 750 mm when serving 60 seats or less, or 900 mm when serving seats on one side only.

ON Full: Washrooms need not conform to Sentence (4) provided, they are located within suites of residential occupancy, other barrier-free washrooms are provided on the same floor level within 45 m, or (See Appendix A.) they are located in an individual suite that is, used for a business and personal services occupancy, a mercantile occupancy or an industrial occupancy, less than 300 m2 in area, and completely separated from, and without access to, the remainder of the building.
ON Variations: Washrooms need not conform to Sentence (4) provided, they are located within suites of residential occupancy, other barrier-free washrooms are provided on the same floor level within 45 m, or (See Appendix A.) they are located in an individual suite that is, used for a business and personal services occupancy, a mercantile occupancy or an industrial occupancy, less than 300 m2 in area, and completely separated from, and without access to, the remainder of the building.

ON Full: Deck-mounted, hand-held, flexible-hose spray attachments are exempt from the thermal shock requirements of Sentences (1) and (4).
ON Variations: Deck-mounted, hand-held, flexible-hose spray attachments are exempt from the thermal shock requirements of Sentences (1) and (4).

ON Full: A storage garage for more than five cars shall be ventilated in accordance with Part 6.
ON Variations: A storage garage for more than five cars shall be ventilated in accordance with Part 6.

ON Full: For buildings having fundamental lateral periods, Ta, of 1.0 s or greater and where IEFvSa(1.0) is greater than 0.25, shear walls that are other than wood-based and form part of the SFRS shall be continuous from their top to the foundation and shall not have irregularities of Type 4 or 5 as described in Table 4.1.8.6.
ON Variations: For buildings having fundamental lateral periods, Ta, of 1.0 s or greater and where IEFvSa(1.0) is greater than 0.25, shear walls that are other than wood-based and form part of the SFRS shall be continuous from their top to the foundation and shall not have irregularities of Type 4 or 5 as described in Table 4.1.8.6.

ON Full: Every wave action pool shall have a public address system that shall be clearly audible in all portions of the pool.
ON Variations: Every wave action pool shall have a public address system that shall be clearly audible in all portions of the pool.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (10) and except for self-contained systems serving individual dwelling units, exhaust ducts serving rooms containing residential cooking equipment shall be independent of other exhaust ducts.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (10) and except for self-contained systems serving individual dwelling units, exhaust ducts serving rooms containing residential cooking equipment shall be independent of other exhaust ducts.

ON Full: This Subsection applies to coating operations involving the use of combustible dry powders applied by powder spray guns or electrostatic powder spray guns.
ON Variations: This Subsection applies to coating operations involving the use of combustible dry powders applied by powder spray guns or electrostatic powder spray guns.

ON Full: Within 100 mm of the bottom of each floor or roof assembly where the cavity extends below the assemblies, the ties described in Sentence (7) shall be spaced not more than 600 mm apart horizontally.
ON Variations: Within 100 mm of the bottom of each floor or roof assembly where the cavity extends below the assemblies, the ties described in Sentence (7) shall be spaced not more than 600 mm apart horizontally.

ON Full: Pits for subsurface pumps for piping systems or for piping connected to submersible pumps shall be designed to withstand the forces to which they may be subjected without causing damage to the system.
ON Variations: Pits for subsurface pumps for piping systems or for piping connected to submersible pumps shall be designed to withstand the forces to which they may be subjected without causing damage to the system.

ON Full: A change in the occupancy of a building or part of a building to a residential occupancy does not reduce the performance level of the building or part of the building where,(a) the building is sprinklered, and (b) the building does not exceed 6 storeys in building height.
ON Variations: A change in the occupancy of a building or part of a building to a residential occupancy does not reduce the performance level of the building or part of the building where,(a) the building is sprinklered, and (b) the building does not exceed 6 storeys in building height.

ON Full: All ducting connected to supply and exhaust fans shall be constructed so as to inhibit air leakage at joints.
ON Variations: All ducting connected to supply and exhaust fans shall be constructed so as to inhibit air leakage at joints.

ON Full: Means of egress shall be provided from every roof that is intended for occupancy, and from every podium, terrace, platform or contained open space.
ON Variations: Means of egress shall be provided from every roof that is intended for occupancy, and from every podium, terrace, platform or contained open space.

ON Full: Where openings for doors in non-loadbearing fire separations required to have a fire-resistance rating do not exceed 1.2 m in width,(a) the width of steel studs shall be not less than 63 mm, and (b) the steel thickness shall be not less than 0.46 mm.
ON Variations: Where openings for doors in non-loadbearing fire separations required to have a fire-resistance rating do not exceed 1.2 m in width,(a) the width of steel studs shall be not less than 63 mm, and (b) the steel thickness shall be not less than 0.46 mm.

ON Full: A building classified as Group B, Division 2 or Division 3 is permitted to be of combustible construction or noncombustible construction used singly or in combination, provided, except as permitted by Sentence 3.2.2.7.(1), the building is sprinklered, it is not more than 1 storey in building height, and it has a building area not more than 500 m2.
ON Variations: A building classified as Group B, Division 2 or Division 3 is permitted to be of combustible construction or noncombustible construction used singly or in combination, provided, except as permitted by Sentence 3.2.2.7.(1), the building is sprinklered, it is not more than 1 storey in building height, and it has a building area not more than 500 m2.

ON Full: The required platform clearance time shall be 4 min less the travel time between the platform and the entry into the protected route based on travel speeds of, 38 m/min for horizontal travel, and 21 m/min or vertical rise.
ON Variations: The required platform clearance time shall be 4 min less the travel time between the platform and the entry into the protected route based on travel speeds of, 38 m/min for horizontal travel, and 21 m/min or vertical rise.

ON Full: Where the supplemental exhaust is provided by an exhaust fan serving multiple exhaust air intakes required in rooms described in Sentence (2), the exhaust fan shall be controlled by a manual switch located in each room served by that exhaust fan and wired in parallel.
ON Variations: Where the supplemental exhaust is provided by an exhaust fan serving multiple exhaust air intakes required in rooms described in Sentence (2), the exhaust fan shall be controlled by a manual switch located in each room served by that exhaust fan and wired in parallel.

ON Full: The design and installation of central heating systems, including requirements for combustion air, shall conform to Part 6 and this Section.
ON Variations: The design and installation of central heating systems, including requirements for combustion air, shall conform to Part 6 and this Section.

ON Full: Installed air admittance valves shall be,(a) accessible, and (b) located in a space that allows air to enter the valve.
ON Variations: Installed air admittance valves shall be,(a) accessible, and (b) located in a space that allows air to enter the valve.

ON Full: Flooring need not comply with Section 9.30., but tight-fitting floors shall be provided to support the live and dead loads.
ON Variations: Flooring need not comply with Section 9.30., but tight-fitting floors shall be provided to support the live and dead loads.

ON Full: Prefabricated flashing for vent pipes shall be certified to CSA B272, "Prefabricated Self-Sealing Roof Vent Flashings".
ON Variations: Prefabricated flashing for vent pipes shall be certified to CSA B272, "Prefabricated Self-Sealing Roof Vent Flashings".

ON Full: If a food scrap interceptor has been installed upstream of the grease interceptor, equipment discharging waste with organic solids may discharge through a grease interceptor.
ON Variations: If a food scrap interceptor has been installed upstream of the grease interceptor, equipment discharging waste with organic solids may discharge through a grease interceptor.

ON Full: No vertical soil or waste pipe shall conduct both sanitary sewage and storm sewage.
ON Variations: No vertical soil or waste pipe shall conduct both sanitary sewage and storm sewage.

ON Full: Any distribution boxes, header lines, absorption trenches, distribution pipes or leaching chambers shall be installed only after the leaching bed fill has been compacted in accordance with Sentence (7).
ON Variations: Any distribution boxes, header lines, absorption trenches, distribution pipes or leaching chambers shall be installed only after the leaching bed fill has been compacted in accordance with Sentence (7).

ON Full: Except where the platforms or walkways are of open construction, any openings for egress stairs shall be protected by noncombustible draft stops not less than 450 mm below the floors above.
ON Variations: Except where the platforms or walkways are of open construction, any openings for egress stairs shall be protected by noncombustible draft stops not less than 450 mm below the floors above.

ON Full: If an eave overhang is completely separated from the remainder of the attic or roof space by fire blocks, the requirements of Sentence (1) do not apply.
ON Variations: If an eave overhang is completely separated from the remainder of the attic or roof space by fire blocks, the requirements of Sentence (1) do not apply.

ON Full: This Section applies to excavations and foundation systems for buildings.
ON Variations: This Section applies to excavations and foundation systems for buildings.

ON Full: Runners required in Sentence (1) shall be securely attached to the building at approximately 50 mm from the ends, and at intervals of not more than 610 mm o.c. for interior walls and 305 mm o.c. for exterior walls.
ON Variations: Runners required in Sentence (1) shall be securely attached to the building at approximately 50 mm from the ends, and at intervals of not more than 610 mm o.c. for interior walls and 305 mm o.c. for exterior walls.

ON Full: Where the nominally horizontal offset in a soil or waste stack is 1 500 mm or more, the hydraulic load that is served by it shall conform to Table 7.4.10.8.
ON Variations: Where the nominally horizontal offset in a soil or waste stack is 1 500 mm or more, the hydraulic load that is served by it shall conform to Table 7.4.10.8.

ON Full: In addition to the requirements of Sentences (1) to (3), the installation of battery-operated emergency lighting in health care facilities shall conform to the appropriate requirements of CSA Z32, "Electrical Safety and Essential Electrical Systems in Health Care Facilities".
ON Variations: In addition to the requirements of Sentences (1) to (3), the installation of battery-operated emergency lighting in health care facilities shall conform to the appropriate requirements of CSA Z32, "Electrical Safety and Essential Electrical Systems in Health Care Facilities".

ON Full: Except for stairs or ramps serving a house or an individual dwelling unit, at least one required handrail shall be continuous throughout the length of the stair or ramp, including at the landings, except where interrupted by doorways.
ON Variations: Except for stairs or ramps serving a house or an individual dwelling unit, at least one required handrail shall be continuous throughout the length of the stair or ramp, including at the landings, except where interrupted by doorways.

ON Full: The switches required in Sentences (2) and (3) shall be centrally located in the dwelling unit and shall be identified with the words VENTILATION FAN.
ON Variations: The switches required in Sentences (2) and (3) shall be centrally located in the dwelling unit and shall be identified with the words VENTILATION FAN.

ON Full: Glass in doors and glass sidelights that could be mistaken for doors, within or at the entrances to dwelling units and in public areas, shall conform to the requirements of Article 9.6.1.4.
ON Variations: Glass in doors and glass sidelights that could be mistaken for doors, within or at the entrances to dwelling units and in public areas, shall conform to the requirements of Article 9.6.1.4.

ON Full: When loading or unloading of Class I liquids is done without the use of the engine of the tank vehicle, the engine ignition shall be shut off during the transfer operations.
ON Variations: When loading or unloading of Class I liquids is done without the use of the engine of the tank vehicle, the engine ignition shall be shut off during the transfer operations.

ON Full: Ventilation shall be provided in areas where floor finishing operations are done to prevent the accumulation of flammable vapours.
ON Variations: Ventilation shall be provided in areas where floor finishing operations are done to prevent the accumulation of flammable vapours.

ON Full: Where the building control valve required by Sentence (1) is of 1 in. trade size or smaller, the drain port may be an integral part of the building control valve in the form of a stop and waste valve and the drain port shall be located on the water distribution system side of the stop and waste valve.
ON Variations: Where the building control valve required by Sentence (1) is of 1 in. trade size or smaller, the drain port may be an integral part of the building control valve in the form of a stop and waste valve and the drain port shall be located on the water distribution system side of the stop and waste valve.

ON Full: The scope of this Part shall be as described in Subsection 1.1.2. of Division A.
ON Variations: The scope of this Part shall be as described in Subsection 1.1.2. of Division A.

ON Full: In buildings containing a hotel, a standpipe and hose system shall not be shut down, disconnected or otherwise impaired without notifying the Chief Fire Official in accordance with a schedule identified in the approved fire safety plan.
ON Variations: In buildings containing a hotel, a standpipe and hose system shall not be shut down, disconnected or otherwise impaired without notifying the Chief Fire Official in accordance with a schedule identified in the approved fire safety plan.

ON Full: Except as permitted by Articles 3.2.2.74. to 3.2.2.83., a building classified as Group F, Division 3 shall conform to Sentence (2).
ON Variations: Except as permitted by Articles 3.2.2.74. to 3.2.2.83., a building classified as Group F, Division 3 shall conform to Sentence (2).

ON Full: Where up to three portable extinguishers rated for Class B fires are used to satisfy the extinguisher rating specified in Table 6.2.6.B., the sum of the basic extinguisher ratings shall satisfy the requirements in Table 6.2.6.B.
ON Variations: Where up to three portable extinguishers rated for Class B fires are used to satisfy the extinguisher rating specified in Table 6.2.6.B., the sum of the basic extinguisher ratings shall satisfy the requirements in Table 6.2.6.B.

ON Full: The fire separations required in Sentence 3.3.1.1.(1) need not be provided between individual rental spaces.
ON Variations: The fire separations required in Sentence 3.3.1.1.(1) need not be provided between individual rental spaces.

ON Full: In other than residential occupancies, no fire-resistance rating is required for fire separations between a public corridor and the remainder of the building if,(a) the floor area is sprinklered, (b) the sprinkler system is electrically supervised in conformance with Sentence 3.2.4.10.(3), and (c) the operation of the sprinkler system will cause a signal to be transmitted to the fire department in conformance with Sentence 3.2.4.8.(4).
ON Variations: In other than residential occupancies, no fire-resistance rating is required for fire separations between a public corridor and the remainder of the building if,(a) the floor area is sprinklered, (b) the sprinkler system is electrically supervised in conformance with Sentence 3.2.4.10.(3), and (c) the operation of the sprinkler system will cause a signal to be transmitted to the fire department in conformance with Sentence 3.2.4.8.(4).

ON Full: In this Subsection,Other fenestration assemblies means curtain walls, window walls, storefronts and glazed architectural structures.
ON Variations: In this Subsection,Other fenestration assemblies means curtain walls, window walls, storefronts and glazed architectural structures.

ON Full: Where an air-handling system is used for venting floor areas in the event of a fire to comply with the requirements of the Building Code, the system shall be inspected annually to ensure that air is exhausted to the outdoors.
ON Variations: Where an air-handling system is used for venting floor areas in the event of a fire to comply with the requirements of the Building Code, the system shall be inspected annually to ensure that air is exhausted to the outdoors.

ON Full: Except as permitted by Article 3.2.2.16., the building referred to in Sentence (1) shall be of noncombustible construction, and, floor assemblies shall be fire separations with a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, mezzanines shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, and loadbearing walls, columns and arches shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the supported assembly.
ON Variations: Except as permitted by Article 3.2.2.16., the building referred to in Sentence (1) shall be of noncombustible construction, and, floor assemblies shall be fire separations with a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, mezzanines shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, and loadbearing walls, columns and arches shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the supported assembly.

ON Full: Corrosion protection systems shall be maintained in operating condition when a storage tank is temporarily out of service and during seasonal shutdowns.
ON Variations: Corrosion protection systems shall be maintained in operating condition when a storage tank is temporarily out of service and during seasonal shutdowns.

ON Full: Moveable partitions or screens, including acoustical screens, shall have a flame-spread rating equal to that required for the interior finish of the area in which they are located as determined in the Building Code.
ON Variations: Moveable partitions or screens, including acoustical screens, shall have a flame-spread rating equal to that required for the interior finish of the area in which they are located as determined in the Building Code.

ON Full: Rigidly connected buildings shall be assumed to have the lowest RdRo value of the buildings connected.
ON Variations: Rigidly connected buildings shall be assumed to have the lowest RdRo value of the buildings connected.

ON Full: Except as required by Sentence (7), combustible piping is permitted to penetrate a vertical or horizontal fire separation, provided the fire compartments on each side of the fire separation are sprinklered and the piping is sealed at the penetration by a fire stop in conformance with Clause 3.1.9.1.(1)(a).
ON Variations: Except as required by Sentence (7), combustible piping is permitted to penetrate a vertical or horizontal fire separation, provided the fire compartments on each side of the fire separation are sprinklered and the piping is sealed at the penetration by a fire stop in conformance with Clause 3.1.9.1.(1)(a).

ON Full: This Subsection applies to the storage and handling of flammable liquids and combustible liquids in buildings classified as assembly or residential occupancies, except that it shall not apply to nonresidential schools, universities or colleges covered in Subsection 4.2.6.
ON Variations: This Subsection applies to the storage and handling of flammable liquids and combustible liquids in buildings classified as assembly or residential occupancies, except that it shall not apply to nonresidential schools, universities or colleges covered in Subsection 4.2.6.

ON Full: Except for the requirements of Article 3.3.2.7. for bench-type seats and except as required or permitted by Sentence (2) and Articles 3.3.2.9. and 3.3.2.10., fixed seats in places of assembly shall be, attached or secured to the floor, platform or platform riser, provided with arms and back, and arranged in rows having an unobstructed passage not less than 400 mm wide measured horizontally between plumb lines from the backs of the seats in one row and the edges of the furthest forward projection of the seats in the next row in the unoccupied position.
ON Variations: Except for the requirements of Article 3.3.2.7. for bench-type seats and except as required or permitted by Sentence (2) and Articles 3.3.2.9. and 3.3.2.10., fixed seats in places of assembly shall be, attached or secured to the floor, platform or platform riser, provided with arms and back, and arranged in rows having an unobstructed passage not less than 400 mm wide measured horizontally between plumb lines from the backs of the seats in one row and the edges of the furthest forward projection of the seats in the next row in the unoccupied position.

ON Full: Except as provided by Clause 3.2.4.23.(3)(a), in a care and treatment occupancy an alert signal is permitted to be silenced automatically after 1 min.
ON Variations: Except as provided by Clause 3.2.4.23.(3)(a), in a care and treatment occupancy an alert signal is permitted to be silenced automatically after 1 min.

ON Full: A manhole shall have a minimum horizontal dimension of 1 200 mm, except that the top 1 500 mm may be tapered from 1 200 mm down to a minimum of 600 mm at the top.
ON Variations: A manhole shall have a minimum horizontal dimension of 1 200 mm, except that the top 1 500 mm may be tapered from 1 200 mm down to a minimum of 600 mm at the top.

ON Full: Where the longest horizontal dimension of the roof projection, l0, is less than 3 m, the drift surcharge adjacent to the projection need not be considered.
ON Variations: Where the longest horizontal dimension of the roof projection, l0, is less than 3 m, the drift surcharge adjacent to the projection need not be considered.

ON Full: Foundation walls enclosing crawl spaces shall conform to Section 9.15.
ON Variations: Foundation walls enclosing crawl spaces shall conform to Section 9.15.

ON Full: Not less than 190 mm depth of solid masonry or concrete shall be provided under the beam or column referred to in Sentence (1).
ON Variations: Not less than 190 mm depth of solid masonry or concrete shall be provided under the beam or column referred to in Sentence (1).

ON Full: Where fire separations between rooms, corridors, shafts and other spaces are damaged so as to affect the integrity of their fire-resistance rating, the damaged fire separations shall be repaired so that the integrity of the fire separations is maintained.
ON Variations: Where fire separations between rooms, corridors, shafts and other spaces are damaged so as to affect the integrity of their fire-resistance rating, the damaged fire separations shall be repaired so that the integrity of the fire separations is maintained.

ON Full: The header line and leaching chambers within a leaching bed shall be designed and constructed so that they can be detected by,(a) magnetic means, (b) means of a 14 gauge TW solid copper light coloured plastic coated tracer wire, or (c) other means of subsurface detection.
ON Variations: The header line and leaching chambers within a leaching bed shall be designed and constructed so that they can be detected by,(a) magnetic means, (b) means of a 14 gauge TW solid copper light coloured plastic coated tracer wire, or (c) other means of subsurface detection.

ON Full: Where an agreement referred to in Sentence (4) is registered against the title of a property, the limiting distance for exposing building faces in respect of the construction of any buildings on the property shall be measured to the point referred to in the agreement.
ON Variations: Where an agreement referred to in Sentence (4) is registered against the title of a property, the limiting distance for exposing building faces in respect of the construction of any buildings on the property shall be measured to the point referred to in the agreement.

ON Full: Where rectangular duct is used in place of round duct, it shall be selected according to Table 9.32.3.10.B.
ON Variations: Where rectangular duct is used in place of round duct, it shall be selected according to Table 9.32.3.10.B.

ON Full: No double Y, double TY, double T or double waste fitting shall be installed in a nominally horizontal soil or waste pipe.
ON Variations: No double Y, double TY, double T or double waste fitting shall be installed in a nominally horizontal soil or waste pipe.

ON Full: Valves and controls for a special fire suppression system shall be clearly marked to indicate their function and shall be accessible at all times.
ON Variations: Valves and controls for a special fire suppression system shall be clearly marked to indicate their function and shall be accessible at all times.

ON Full: Solders for solder joint fittings shall conform to ASTM B32, "Solder Metal" in accordance with the recommended use.
ON Variations: Solders for solder joint fittings shall conform to ASTM B32, "Solder Metal" in accordance with the recommended use.

ON Full: Pump houses and pump rooms shall not be used for any purpose other than to serve the pumping equipment.
ON Variations: Pump houses and pump rooms shall not be used for any purpose other than to serve the pumping equipment.

ON Full: Gaskets shall be used in all hose joints and pipe couplings to prevent leakage.
ON Variations: Gaskets shall be used in all hose joints and pipe couplings to prevent leakage.

ON Full: The straps described in Sentence (1) may be installed against one of the sheathings listed in Table 9.23.16.2.A. provided that, (a) the tie is in contact with the exterior surface of the sheathing, and (b) the sheathing beneath the tie is not compressed.
ON Variations: The straps described in Sentence (1) may be installed against one of the sheathings listed in Table 9.23.16.2.A. provided that, (a) the tie is in contact with the exterior surface of the sheathing, and (b) the sheathing beneath the tie is not compressed.

ON Full: Despite Sentence (1), bitumen kettles may be located on concrete roofs if roof openings within 15 m are diked to prevent spilled asphalt run-off.
ON Variations: Despite Sentence (1), bitumen kettles may be located on concrete roofs if roof openings within 15 m are diked to prevent spilled asphalt run-off.

ON Full: Except as permitted by Sentences (2) and (3), a room or space within a floor area for the storage of janitorial supplies shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.
ON Variations: Except as permitted by Sentences (2) and (3), a room or space within a floor area for the storage of janitorial supplies shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.

ON Full: Where joints in the reinforcing referred to in Sentence (1) occur, the bars shall be lapped not less than 150 mm.
ON Variations: Where joints in the reinforcing referred to in Sentence (1) occur, the bars shall be lapped not less than 150 mm.

ON Full: The automatic sprinkler system shall be designed, constructed, installed and tested in conformance with NFPA 13, "Installation of Sprinkler Systems" or the appropriate NFPA sprinkler standard for the most severe hazard to which the storage system is exposed.
ON Variations: The automatic sprinkler system shall be designed, constructed, installed and tested in conformance with NFPA 13, "Installation of Sprinkler Systems" or the appropriate NFPA sprinkler standard for the most severe hazard to which the storage system is exposed.

ON Full: Storage rooms referred to in Sentence (1) shall be designed to accommodate possible spills of flammable liquids and combustible liquids in conformance with Subsection 4.1.6.
ON Variations: Storage rooms referred to in Sentence (1) shall be designed to accommodate possible spills of flammable liquids and combustible liquids in conformance with Subsection 4.1.6.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentences (6) and (7), the number of water closets required for dining rooms, restaurants and cafeteria shall conform to Table 3.7.4.3.D.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentences (6) and (7), the number of water closets required for dining rooms, restaurants and cafeteria shall conform to Table 3.7.4.3.D.

ON Full: Strippable coatings or removable combustible coverings, such as thin paper and static dissipative plastic sheets, may be used on walls and floors in spray booths and spray rooms to facilitate cleaning operations.
ON Variations: Strippable coatings or removable combustible coverings, such as thin paper and static dissipative plastic sheets, may be used on walls and floors in spray booths and spray rooms to facilitate cleaning operations.

ON Full: Wood members more than 50 mm but not more than 375 mm high applied directly to or set into a noncombustible floor slab are permitted for the construction of a raised platform in a building required to be of noncombustible construction provided the concealed spaces created are divided into compartments by fire blocks in conformance with Sentence 3.1.11.3.(2).
ON Variations: Wood members more than 50 mm but not more than 375 mm high applied directly to or set into a noncombustible floor slab are permitted for the construction of a raised platform in a building required to be of noncombustible construction provided the concealed spaces created are divided into compartments by fire blocks in conformance with Sentence 3.1.11.3.(2).

ON Full: If access is provided from a storage garage to a stair tower or elevator serving occupancies above the level of the storage garage, the access shall be through a vestibule conforming to Sentence 3.3.5.7.(3).
ON Variations: If access is provided from a storage garage to a stair tower or elevator serving occupancies above the level of the storage garage, the access shall be through a vestibule conforming to Sentence 3.3.5.7.(3).

ON Full: Membrane roofing assemblies with proven past performance for the anticipated wind loads need not comply with Sentence (4).
ON Variations: Membrane roofing assemblies with proven past performance for the anticipated wind loads need not comply with Sentence (4).

ON Full: Except as permitted in Subsection 9.9.6. and Article 9.8.7.6., no fixture, turnstile or construction shall project within the required width of an exit.
ON Variations: Except as permitted in Subsection 9.9.6. and Article 9.8.7.6., no fixture, turnstile or construction shall project within the required width of an exit.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentences (2) and (3), diaphragms, collectors, chords, struts and connections shall be designed so as not to yield, and the design shall account for the shape of the diaphragm, including openings, and for the forces generated in the diaphragm due to the following cases, whichever one governs: (See Appendix A.) (a) forces due to loads determined in Article 4.1.8.11. or 4.1.8.12. applied to the diaphragm are increased to reflect the lateral load capacity of the SFRS, plus forces in the diaphragm due to the transfer of forces between elements of the SFRS associated with the lateral load capacity of such elements and accounting for discontinuities and changes in stiffness in these elements, or (b) a minimum force corresponding to the design-based shear divided by N for the diaphragm at level x.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentences (2) and (3), diaphragms, collectors, chords, struts and connections shall be designed so as not to yield, and the design shall account for the shape of the diaphragm, including openings, and for the forces generated in the diaphragm due to the following cases, whichever one governs: (See Appendix A.) (a) forces due to loads determined in Article 4.1.8.11. or 4.1.8.12. applied to the diaphragm are increased to reflect the lateral load capacity of the SFRS, plus forces in the diaphragm due to the transfer of forces between elements of the SFRS associated with the lateral load capacity of such elements and accounting for discontinuities and changes in stiffness in these elements, or (b) a minimum force corresponding to the design-based shear divided by N for the diaphragm at level x.

ON Full: A standpipe and hose system conforming to the requirements of Subsection 3.2.9. shall be installed in a rapid transit station, except as otherwise required or permitted in this Article.
ON Variations: A standpipe and hose system conforming to the requirements of Subsection 3.2.9. shall be installed in a rapid transit station, except as otherwise required or permitted in this Article.

ON Full: Except as permitted by Articles 3.2.2.43. to 3.2.2.48., a building classified as Group C other than a retirement home shall conform to Sentence (2).
ON Variations: Except as permitted by Articles 3.2.2.43. to 3.2.2.48., a building classified as Group C other than a retirement home shall conform to Sentence (2).

ON Full: The storage and handling of flammable liquids and combustible liquids shall be in conformance with Part 4.
ON Variations: The storage and handling of flammable liquids and combustible liquids shall be in conformance with Part 4.

ON Full: Except when in use or being inspected in accordance with Article 6.4.3.7., fire department connections shall be equipped with plugs or caps that are secured wrench-tight.
ON Variations: Except when in use or being inspected in accordance with Article 6.4.3.7., fire department connections shall be equipped with plugs or caps that are secured wrench-tight.

ON Full: The floor assembly of a mezzanine that is required to be considered as a storey in calculating building height shall be constructed in conformance with the fire separation requirements for floor assemblies in Articles 3.2.2.20. to 3.2.2.83.
ON Variations: The floor assembly of a mezzanine that is required to be considered as a storey in calculating building height shall be constructed in conformance with the fire separation requirements for floor assemblies in Articles 3.2.2.20. to 3.2.2.83.

ON Full: Clean-up shall conform with Part X (Spills) of the Environmental Protection Act.
ON Variations: Clean-up shall conform with Part X (Spills) of the Environmental Protection Act.

ON Full: Where protective materials are applied to assemblies to provide the required protection from precipitation, the materials shall be installed so as to shed precipitation or otherwise minimize its entry into the assembly and prevent its penetration through the assembly. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Where protective materials are applied to assemblies to provide the required protection from precipitation, the materials shall be installed so as to shed precipitation or otherwise minimize its entry into the assembly and prevent its penetration through the assembly. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: When the gauge or alarm indicates that the air velocity is less than that required by Article 5.12.3.2. or 5.12.3.3., immediate corrective action shall be taken to remedy the condition that has resulted in the reduction of the ventilation.
ON Variations: When the gauge or alarm indicates that the air velocity is less than that required by Article 5.12.3.2. or 5.12.3.3., immediate corrective action shall be taken to remedy the condition that has resulted in the reduction of the ventilation.

ON Full: The effective area of the surface of the filter medium in each filter bed shall be at least 10 m2 and not more than 50 m2.
ON Variations: The effective area of the surface of the filter medium in each filter bed shall be at least 10 m2 and not more than 50 m2.

ON Full: A public or private water supply shall be provided so that any part of the storage yard can be reached by using not more than 150 m of hose.
ON Variations: A public or private water supply shall be provided so that any part of the storage yard can be reached by using not more than 150 m of hose.

ON Full: This Article does not apply to, (a) a farm building, (b) a building that does not use electrical power or fossil fuel, (c) a manufactured building described in Article 9.1.1.9., or (d) a seasonal recreational building described in Section 9.36. or 9.38.
ON Variations: This Article does not apply to, (a) a farm building, (b) a building that does not use electrical power or fossil fuel, (c) a manufactured building described in Article 9.1.1.9., or (d) a seasonal recreational building described in Section 9.36. or 9.38.

ON Full: Leakage during the test shall not exceed 2 L/h per 100 joints for pipe laid with rubber gasketted joints, and 30 mL/h per 25 mm of pipe diameter per joint for pipe laid with caulked lead or lead substitute joints.
ON Variations: Leakage during the test shall not exceed 2 L/h per 100 joints for pipe laid with rubber gasketted joints, and 30 mL/h per 25 mm of pipe diameter per joint for pipe laid with caulked lead or lead substitute joints.

ON Full: The space above a diving board or diving platform shall be unobstructed and shall consist of at least, a space having a width of 2 500 mm on each side of the centre line of the board or platform, a length equal to the sum of the horizontal distance the board or platform projects over the water plus 3 m, and a height of, 3.65 m above a diving board 3.65 m or less in length, 5 m above a diving board greater than 3.65 m in length, or 3 m above a diving platform, and the space below the planes originating from the front and sides of the uppermost horizontal plane of the space determined under Clause (a) and sloping downwards at 30° from the horizontal.
ON Variations: The space above a diving board or diving platform shall be unobstructed and shall consist of at least, a space having a width of 2 500 mm on each side of the centre line of the board or platform, a length equal to the sum of the horizontal distance the board or platform projects over the water plus 3 m, and a height of, 3.65 m above a diving board 3.65 m or less in length, 5 m above a diving board greater than 3.65 m in length, or 3 m above a diving platform, and the space below the planes originating from the front and sides of the uppermost horizontal plane of the space determined under Clause (a) and sloping downwards at 30° from the horizontal.

ON Full: The Chief Fire Official shall be notified within 24 h of detection of a leak referred to in Sentence (1).
ON Variations: The Chief Fire Official shall be notified within 24 h of detection of a leak referred to in Sentence (1).

ON Full: Subject to Sentence (2), this Subsection applies to outdoor storage yards where wood chips are stored.
ON Variations: Subject to Sentence (2), this Subsection applies to outdoor storage yards where wood chips are stored.

ON Full: Except when being transported, acetylene cylinders shall be kept in an upright position.
ON Variations: Except when being transported, acetylene cylinders shall be kept in an upright position.

ON Full: The lack of certification markings on a product or plumbing component shall be regarded as proof, in the absence of evidence to the contrary, that no certification exists.
ON Variations: The lack of certification markings on a product or plumbing component shall be regarded as proof, in the absence of evidence to the contrary, that no certification exists.

ON Full: Cleanouts that allow rodding in one direction only shall be installed to permit rodding in the direction of flow.
ON Variations: Cleanouts that allow rodding in one direction only shall be installed to permit rodding in the direction of flow.

ON Full: The number of water closets required for employees in Group B, Division 2 or 3 occupancies shall conform to Table 3.7.4.4.
ON Variations: The number of water closets required for employees in Group B, Division 2 or 3 occupancies shall conform to Table 3.7.4.4.

ON Full: The second plane of protection shall consist of a drainage plane with appropriate inner boundary and flashing to dissipate rainwater to the exterior.
ON Variations: The second plane of protection shall consist of a drainage plane with appropriate inner boundary and flashing to dissipate rainwater to the exterior.

ON Full: For the purpose of identifying the pipe material where plastic water pipe is used underground for a service pipe, the end of the pipe inside the building shall be brought above ground for a distance not less than 300 mm and not greater than 450 mm. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: For the purpose of identifying the pipe material where plastic water pipe is used underground for a service pipe, the end of the pipe inside the building shall be brought above ground for a distance not less than 300 mm and not greater than 450 mm. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: For the purpose of determining specified loads S, W or E in Subsections 4.1.6. to 4.1.8., buildings shall be assigned an Importance Category based on intended use and occupancy, in accordance with Table 4.1.2.1.B. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: For the purpose of determining specified loads S, W or E in Subsections 4.1.6. to 4.1.8., buildings shall be assigned an Importance Category based on intended use and occupancy, in accordance with Table 4.1.2.1.B. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Leaching chambers shall comply with the dimension requirements for either a Type I or Type II leaching chamber listed in Table 8.7.2.3.
ON Variations: Leaching chambers shall comply with the dimension requirements for either a Type I or Type II leaching chamber listed in Table 8.7.2.3.

ON Full: The capacity of a salvage tank shall be 20% greater than the capacity of the dip tank or tanks to which it is connected.
ON Variations: The capacity of a salvage tank shall be 20% greater than the capacity of the dip tank or tanks to which it is connected.

ON Full: A high temperature limit switch shall be provided to sound an alarm, shut off heat and stop conveyors when a flammable liquid or combustible liquid reaches 28°C below its flash point in a quench tank.
ON Variations: A high temperature limit switch shall be provided to sound an alarm, shut off heat and stop conveyors when a flammable liquid or combustible liquid reaches 28°C below its flash point in a quench tank.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (6), in an elementary or secondary school, a hazardous classroom containing an auto repair shop shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire-separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than, 2 h where the building is not sprinklered, or 1 h where the building is sprinklered.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (6), in an elementary or secondary school, a hazardous classroom containing an auto repair shop shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire-separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than, 2 h where the building is not sprinklered, or 1 h where the building is sprinklered.

ON Full: At least one water closet or privy shall be provided for every, 10 campers of each sex in a recreational camp, and 10 employees of each sex in a camp for housing of workers.
ON Variations: At least one water closet or privy shall be provided for every, 10 campers of each sex in a recreational camp, and 10 employees of each sex in a camp for housing of workers.

ON Full: Where a vent pipe passes through a roof or an outside wall of a building, it shall be protected from frost closure by increasing its diameter at least one size, but not less than 3 in. in size, immediately before it penetrates the roof or the wall.
ON Variations: Where a vent pipe passes through a roof or an outside wall of a building, it shall be protected from frost closure by increasing its diameter at least one size, but not less than 3 in. in size, immediately before it penetrates the roof or the wall.

ON Full: Except as provided for in Sentence 4.1.6.2.(1), loads due to rain need not be considered to act simultaneously with loads due to snow. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Except as provided for in Sentence 4.1.6.2.(1), loads due to rain need not be considered to act simultaneously with loads due to snow. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Solders and fluxes having a lead content in excess of 0.2 percent shall not be used in a potable water system.
ON Variations: Solders and fluxes having a lead content in excess of 0.2 percent shall not be used in a potable water system.

ON Full: For the purposes of this Section and Sentences 11.4.2.1.(1) and 11.4.2.5.(4), the changes of use set out in Subclauses (1)(a)(ii) to (iv) and (vi) shall also be deemed to constitute a change in major occupancy.
ON Variations: For the purposes of this Section and Sentences 11.4.2.1.(1) and 11.4.2.5.(4), the changes of use set out in Subclauses (1)(a)(ii) to (iv) and (vi) shall also be deemed to constitute a change in major occupancy.

ON Full: Except for a modified pool, a wave action pool and a pool used exclusively for scuba diving, the slope of the bottom of any portion of a public pool shall not exceed, 8% where the water depth is 1 350 mm or less, 33% where the water depth is more than 1 350 mm and less than 2 000 mm, and 50% where the water depth is 2 000 mm or more.
ON Variations: Except for a modified pool, a wave action pool and a pool used exclusively for scuba diving, the slope of the bottom of any portion of a public pool shall not exceed, 8% where the water depth is 1 350 mm or less, 33% where the water depth is more than 1 350 mm and less than 2 000 mm, and 50% where the water depth is 2 000 mm or more.

ON Full: Portable extinguishers that are provided to protect a building shall be suitable for fighting Class A fires and be available for use at all times.
ON Variations: Portable extinguishers that are provided to protect a building shall be suitable for fighting Class A fires and be available for use at all times.

ON Full: Where more than one telephone is provided for public use in a normally occupied floor area that is not required by Article 3.8.2.1. to have a barrier-free path of travel, a built-in shelf or counter that conforms to Sentences (2), (3) and (4) shall be provided for at least one telephone.
ON Variations: Where more than one telephone is provided for public use in a normally occupied floor area that is not required by Article 3.8.2.1. to have a barrier-free path of travel, a built-in shelf or counter that conforms to Sentences (2), (3) and (4) shall be provided for at least one telephone.

ON Full: The requirements of Subsection 3.16.2. apply to a shelf and rack storage system for the storage of Class I, II, III and IV commodities as defined in NFPA 13, "Installation of Sprinkler Systems".
ON Variations: The requirements of Subsection 3.16.2. apply to a shelf and rack storage system for the storage of Class I, II, III and IV commodities as defined in NFPA 13, "Installation of Sprinkler Systems".

ON Full: Materials installed to provide required dampproofing shall be,(a) capable of protecting assemblies against moisture transfer from the ground, (b) compatible with adjoining materials, and (c) resistant to mechanisms of deterioration that may reasonably be expected, given the nature, function and exposure of the materials.
ON Variations: Materials installed to provide required dampproofing shall be,(a) capable of protecting assemblies against moisture transfer from the ground, (b) compatible with adjoining materials, and (c) resistant to mechanisms of deterioration that may reasonably be expected, given the nature, function and exposure of the materials.

ON Full: Access doors or panels shall be provided to permit inspection, cleaning and maintenance of ovens and associated ductwork.
ON Variations: Access doors or panels shall be provided to permit inspection, cleaning and maintenance of ovens and associated ductwork.

ON Full: Solder-joint fittings for water systems not made by casting or the wrought process shall conform to the applicable requirements of ASME B16.18, "Cast Copper Alloy Solder Joint Pressure Fittings".
ON Variations: Solder-joint fittings for water systems not made by casting or the wrought process shall conform to the applicable requirements of ASME B16.18, "Cast Copper Alloy Solder Joint Pressure Fittings".

ON Full: Industrial ovens shall be constructed of noncombustible materials with smooth interior surfaces to permit cleaning.
ON Variations: Industrial ovens shall be constructed of noncombustible materials with smooth interior surfaces to permit cleaning.

ON Full: Not more than 450 kg of raw material used for the manufacture of finished cellulose nitrate plastic goods shall be stored in cabinets in any one workroom, not more than 225 kg stored in any one cabinet and not more than 112 kg in any one compartment of the cabinet.
ON Variations: Not more than 450 kg of raw material used for the manufacture of finished cellulose nitrate plastic goods shall be stored in cabinets in any one workroom, not more than 225 kg stored in any one cabinet and not more than 112 kg in any one compartment of the cabinet.

ON Full: A motorized vehicle operating in a storage yard shall be equipped with at least one portable extinguisher having a minimum rating of 2A:30B:C.
ON Variations: A motorized vehicle operating in a storage yard shall be equipped with at least one portable extinguisher having a minimum rating of 2A:30B:C.

ON Full: Empty bags shall be disposed of by burning outdoors where permitted in a safe area, or by burial.
ON Variations: Empty bags shall be disposed of by burning outdoors where permitted in a safe area, or by burial.

ON Full: The discharge pipe from every pumped storm sewage sump shall be equipped with,(a) a union and a check valve installed in that sequence in the direction of discharge and pumped to above grade level, or (b) a union, a check valve and a shut-off valve installed in that sequence in the direction of discharge.
ON Variations: The discharge pipe from every pumped storm sewage sump shall be equipped with,(a) a union and a check valve installed in that sequence in the direction of discharge and pumped to above grade level, or (b) a union, a check valve and a shut-off valve installed in that sequence in the direction of discharge.

ON Full: The minimum value of the illumination required by Sentences (1) and (2) shall not be less than 1 lx.
ON Variations: The minimum value of the illumination required by Sentences (1) and (2) shall not be less than 1 lx.

ON Full: The size and spacing of non-loadbearing steel studs for exterior walls shall conform to Table 9.24.2.5.
ON Variations: The size and spacing of non-loadbearing steel studs for exterior walls shall conform to Table 9.24.2.5.

ON Full: Doors referred to in Sentence (1) shall be identified by a permanently mounted sign on the stair side to indicate that they are openable from that side.
ON Variations: Doors referred to in Sentence (1) shall be identified by a permanently mounted sign on the stair side to indicate that they are openable from that side.

ON Full: A door in an access to exit shall be readily openable in travelling to an exit without requiring keys, special devices or specialized knowledge of the door opening mechanism, except that this requirement does not apply to a door serving a contained use area, or an impeded egress zone, provided the locking devices conform to Sentence (6).
ON Variations: A door in an access to exit shall be readily openable in travelling to an exit without requiring keys, special devices or specialized knowledge of the door opening mechanism, except that this requirement does not apply to a door serving a contained use area, or an impeded egress zone, provided the locking devices conform to Sentence (6).

ON Full: Subject to Sentence (7), fire compartments referred to in Sentence (4) shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min.
ON Variations: Subject to Sentence (7), fire compartments referred to in Sentence (4) shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min.

ON Full: Coatings applied to gypsum wallboard to provide required resistance to vapour diffusion shall conform to the requirements of Sentence (1) when tested in accordance with CAN/CGSB-1.501-M, "Method for Permeance of Coated Wallboard".
ON Variations: Coatings applied to gypsum wallboard to provide required resistance to vapour diffusion shall conform to the requirements of Sentence (1) when tested in accordance with CAN/CGSB-1.501-M, "Method for Permeance of Coated Wallboard".

ON Full: Underground piping shall be located so it will not be damaged as a result of vibrations or settling of an adjacent building or structure.
ON Variations: Underground piping shall be located so it will not be damaged as a result of vibrations or settling of an adjacent building or structure.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (2), a 14 gauge TW solid copper light coloured plastic coated tracer wire shall be attached to every non-metallic water service pipe or fire service main.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (2), a 14 gauge TW solid copper light coloured plastic coated tracer wire shall be attached to every non-metallic water service pipe or fire service main.

ON Full: For the design of individual walls and wall cladding, the values of CpCg are provided in Figure 4.1.7.6.B.
ON Variations: For the design of individual walls and wall cladding, the values of CpCg are provided in Figure 4.1.7.6.B.

ON Full: Where unusual conditions exist such as excessively corrosive soil or water, only materials suited for use in such locations shall be used.
ON Variations: Where unusual conditions exist such as excessively corrosive soil or water, only materials suited for use in such locations shall be used.

ON Full: No obstruction shall be permitted in any occupancy that would restrict the width of a normal means of egress from any part of a floor area to less than 750 mm unless an unobstructed alternative means of egress is provided adjacent to, accessible from, and plainly visible from the obstructed means of egress. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: No obstruction shall be permitted in any occupancy that would restrict the width of a normal means of egress from any part of a floor area to less than 750 mm unless an unobstructed alternative means of egress is provided adjacent to, accessible from, and plainly visible from the obstructed means of egress. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Electrical components, including transformers, power packs and control equipment for electrostatic spray applications, shall be located in an area where the vapour concentration of flammable liquids or combustible liquids cannot exceed 25% of the lower explosive limit.
ON Variations: Electrical components, including transformers, power packs and control equipment for electrostatic spray applications, shall be located in an area where the vapour concentration of flammable liquids or combustible liquids cannot exceed 25% of the lower explosive limit.

ON Full: The performance level of a building is reduced where the building after the change of major occupancy will not comply with Article 3.1.3.2. or 9.10.9.12.
ON Variations: The performance level of a building is reduced where the building after the change of major occupancy will not comply with Article 3.1.3.2. or 9.10.9.12.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (4), the fundamental lateral period, Ta, in the direction under consideration in Sentence (2) shall be determined as, (a) for moment-resisting frames that resist 100% of the required lateral forces and where the frame is not enclosed by or adjoined by more rigid elements that would tend to prevent the frame from resisting lateral forces, and where hn is in metres, (i) 0.085 (hn)3/4 for steel moment frames, (ii) 0.075 (hn)3/4 for concrete moment frames, or (iii) 0.1 N for other moment frames, (b) 0.025 hn for braced frames where hn is in metres, (c) 0.05 (hn)3/4 for shear wall and other structures where hn is in metres, or (d) other established methods of mechanics using a structural model that complies with the requirements of Sentence 4.1.8.3.(8), except that, (i) for moment-resisting frames, Ta shall not be taken greater than 1.5 times that determined in Clause (a), (ii) for braced frames, Ta shall not be taken greater than 2.0 times that determined in Clause (b), (iii) for shear wall structures, Ta shall not be greater than 2.0 times that determined in Clause (c), (iv) for other structures, Ta shall not be taken greater than that determined in Clause (c), and (v) for the purpose of calculating the deflections, the period without the upper limit specified in Subclauses (d)(i) to (iv) may be used, except that, for walls, coupled walls and wall-frame systems, Ta shall not exceed 4.0 s, and for moment-resisting frames, braced frames, and other systems, Ta shall not exceed 2.0 s. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (4), the fundamental lateral period, Ta, in the direction under consideration in Sentence (2) shall be determined as, (a) for moment-resisting frames that resist 100% of the required lateral forces and where the frame is not enclosed by or adjoined by more rigid elements that would tend to prevent the frame from resisting lateral forces, and where hn is in metres, (i) 0.085 (hn)3/4 for steel moment frames, (ii) 0.075 (hn)3/4 for concrete moment frames, or (iii) 0.1 N for other moment frames, (b) 0.025 hn for braced frames where hn is in metres, (c) 0.05 (hn)3/4 for shear wall and other structures where hn is in metres, or (d) other established methods of mechanics using a structural model that complies with the requirements of SentenceÃ 4.1.8.3.(8), except that, (i) for moment-resisting frames, Ta shall not be taken greater than 1.5 times that determined in Clause (a), (ii) for braced frames, Ta shall not be taken greater than 2.0 times that determined in Clause (b), (iii) for shear wall structures, Ta shall not be greater than 2.0 times that determined in Clause (c), (iv) for other structures, Ta shall not be taken greater than that determined in Clause (c), and (v) for the purpose of calculating the deflections, the period without the upper limit specified in Subclauses (d)(i) to (iv) may be used, except that, for walls, coupled walls and wall-frame systems, Ta shall not exceed 4.0 s, and for moment-resisting frames, braced frames, and other systems, Ta shall not exceed 2.0 s. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Basements and rooms referred to in Sentence (2) shall be separated from the remainder of the building with a vapour-tight separation.
ON Variations: Basements and rooms referred to in Sentence (2) shall be separated from the remainder of the building with a vapour-tight separation.

ON Full: Booths and kiosks that are more than 20 m2 in area and are used only by the transit agency for fare collection, dissemination of information or similar non-mercantile occupancies shall be, sprinklered, and separated from the remainder of the floor area by a fire separation of noncombustible construction that is not required to have a fire-resistance rating.
ON Variations: Booths and kiosks that are more than 20 m2 in area and are used only by the transit agency for fare collection, dissemination of information or similar non-mercantile occupancies shall be, sprinklered, and separated from the remainder of the floor area by a fire separation of noncombustible construction that is not required to have a fire-resistance rating.

ON Full: For the purposes of this Article and Article 4.1.8.20., the following terms shall have the meaning stated herein: (a) "seismic isolation" is an alternative seismic design concept that consists of installing an isolation system with low horizontal stiffness, thereby substantially increasing the fundamental period of the structure, (b) "isolation system" is a collection of structural elements at the level of the isolation interface that includes all individual isolator units, all structural elements that transfer force between elements of the isolation system, all connections to other structural elements, and may also include a wind-restraint system, energy-dissipation devices, and a displacement restraint system, (c) "seismically isolated structure" includes the upper portion of the structure above the isolation system, the isolation system, and the portion of the structure below the isolation system, (d) "isolator unit" is a structural element of the isolation system that permits large lateral deformations under lateral earthquake design forces and is characterized by vertical-load-carrying capability combined with increased horizontal flexibility and high vertical stiffness, energy dissipation (hysteretic or viscous), self-centering capability, and lateral restraint (sufficient elastic under non-seismic service lateral loads, (e) "isolation interface" is the boundary between the isolated upper portion of the structure above the isolation system and the lower portion of the structure below the isolation system, and (f) "wind-restraint system" is the collection of structural elements of the isolation system that provides restraint of the seismically isolated structure for wind loads and is permitted to be either an integral part of the isolator units or a separate device.
ON Variations: For the purposes of this Article and Article 4.1.8.20., the following terms shall have the meaning stated herein: (a) "seismic isolation" is an alternative seismic design concept that consists of installing an isolation system with low horizontal stiffness, thereby substantially increasing the fundamental period of the structure, (b) "isolation system" is a collection of structural elements at the level of the isolation interface that includes all individual isolator units, all structural elements that transfer force between elements of the isolation system, all connections to other structural elements, and may also include a wind-restraint system, energy-dissipation devices, and a displacement restraint system, (c) "seismically isolated structure" includes the upper portion of the structure above the isolation system, the isolation system, and the portion of the structure below the isolation system, (d) "isolator unit" is a structural element of the isolation system that permits large lateral deformations under lateral earthquake design forces and is characterized by vertical-load-carrying capability combined with increased horizontal flexibility and high vertical stiffness, energy dissipation (hysteretic or viscous), self-centering capability, and lateral restraint (sufficient elastic under non-seismic service lateral loads, (e) "isolation interface" is the boundary between the isolated upper portion of the structure above the isolation system and the lower portion of the structure below the isolation system, and (f) "wind-restraint system" is the collection of structural elements of the isolation system that provides restraint of the seismically isolated structure for wind loads and is permitted to be either an integral part of the isolator units or a separate device.

ON Full: Except as permitted in Sentences (2) and (3), storage tanks shall be installed on shore in conformance with Subsections 4.3.2. to 4.3.7.
ON Variations: Except as permitted in Sentences (2) and (3), storage tanks shall be installed on shore in conformance with Subsections 4.3.2. to 4.3.7.

ON Full: The device required in Sentence (1) shall be designed to provide suitable advance warning to the building occupants considering,(a) the total daily design sanitary sewage flow, (b) the location of the Class 5 sewage system, and (c) the response time of the hauled sewage system contractor.
