ON Variations: The device required in Sentence (1) shall be designed to provide suitable advance warning to the building occupants considering,(a) the total daily design sanitary sewage flow, (b) the location of the Class 5 sewage system, and (c) the response time of the hauled sewage system contractor.

ON Full: An access route constructed in conformance with Subsection 3.2.5. in Division B of the Building Code shall be provided in outdoor storage areas to permit the approach of fire department vehicles to within 60 m of any storage tank.
ON Variations: An access route constructed in conformance with Subsection 3.2.5. in Division B of the Building Code shall be provided in outdoor storage areas to permit the approach of fire department vehicles to within 60 m of any storage tank.

ON Full: Where the performance level of an existing building is reduced under Sentence 11.4.2.2.(1), (2) or (3), the building shall be evaluated, and the early warning and evacuation systems shall be upgraded, in conformance with the applicable requirements of Table 11.4.3.3.
ON Variations: Where the performance level of an existing building is reduced under Sentence 11.4.2.2.(1), (2) or (3), the building shall be evaluated, and the early warning and evacuation systems shall be upgraded, in conformance with the applicable requirements of Table 11.4.3.3.

ON Full: Measures identified in Sentence (2) shall be implemented in conformance with good engineering practices to prevent fires and explosions from occurring.
ON Variations: Measures identified in Sentence (2) shall be implemented in conformance with good engineering practices to prevent fires and explosions from occurring.

ON Full: A room or space intended to be used as sleeping quarters shall not open directly into any room where food or drink for human consumption, or an ingredient of food or drink for human consumption, is manufactured, processed, prepared, stored, displayed, handled, served, distributed, sold or offered for sale.
ON Variations: A room or space intended to be used as sleeping quarters shall not open directly into any room where food or drink for human consumption, or an ingredient of food or drink for human consumption, is manufactured, processed, prepared, stored, displayed, handled, served, distributed, sold or offered for sale.

ON Full: Sentence (1) does not apply to a fixture located in a heritage building.
ON Variations: Sentence (1) does not apply to a fixture located in a heritage building.

ON Full: The thickness of grooved or textured plywood shall be measured at the point of least thickness.
ON Variations: The thickness of grooved or textured plywood shall be measured at the point of least thickness.

ON Full: Every grease interceptor referred to in Article 8.1.3.1. shall be maintained in accordance with CSA B481.4, "Maintenance of Grease Interceptors".
ON Variations: Every grease interceptor referred to in Article 8.1.3.1. shall be maintained in accordance with CSA B481.4, "Maintenance of Grease Interceptors".

ON Full: This Subsection applies to every means of egress except,(a) exits that serve a house or an individual dwelling unit, and (b) access to exits within a house or an individual dwelling unit.
ON Variations: This Subsection applies to every means of egress except,(a) exits that serve a house or an individual dwelling unit, and (b) access to exits within a house or an individual dwelling unit.

ON Full: Equipment shall be installed to continuously disinfect the water in a public pool by means of, a chlorination or hypochlorination system provided with a chemical controller for regulating the dosage of chlorine and capable of providing not less than, in the case of an outdoor pool, other than a wave action pool, 300 g of chlorine per day per 10 000 L of total pool capacity, in the case of an indoor pool, other than a wave action pool, 200 g of chlorine per day per 10 000 L of total pool capacity, in the case of an outdoor wave action pool, 1 200 g of chlorine per day per 10 000 L of total pool capacity, and in the case of an indoor wave action pool, 800 g of chlorine per day per 10 000 L of total pool capacity, or a bromination system capable of maintaining in the pool water a total bromine residual of 3 mg/L.
ON Variations: Equipment shall be installed to continuously disinfect the water in a public pool by means of, a chlorination or hypochlorination system provided with a chemical controller for regulating the dosage of chlorine and capable of providing not less than, in the case of an outdoor pool, other than a wave action pool, 300 g of chlorine per day per 10 000 L of total pool capacity, in the case of an indoor pool, other than a wave action pool, 200 g of chlorine per day per 10 000 L of total pool capacity, in the case of an outdoor wave action pool, 1 200 g of chlorine per day per 10 000 L of total pool capacity, and in the case of an indoor wave action pool, 800 g of chlorine per day per 10 000 L of total pool capacity, or a bromination system capable of maintaining in the pool water a total bromine residual of 3 mg/L.

ON Full: Where the sash of a window referred to in Sentence (5) swings towards the window well, the operation of the sash shall not reduce the clearance in a manner that would restrict escape in an emergency.
ON Variations: Where the sash of a window referred to in Sentence (5) swings towards the window well, the operation of the sash shall not reduce the clearance in a manner that would restrict escape in an emergency.

ON Full: An outdoor pool that is intended to be open for use after sundown and an indoor pool shall be equipped with an independent emergency lighting system that automatically operates whenever the normal electrical power supply to a public pool lighting system fails.
ON Variations: An outdoor pool that is intended to be open for use after sundown and an indoor pool shall be equipped with an independent emergency lighting system that automatically operates whenever the normal electrical power supply to a public pool lighting system fails.

ON Full: Smoking shall not take place in storage yards, except as provided in Subsection 2.4.3.
ON Variations: Smoking shall not take place in storage yards, except as provided in Subsection 2.4.3.

ON Full: A clearance of not less than 400 mm shall be maintained between stored flammable liquids and combustible liquids and walls, except that where the width of storage adjacent to the wall is not more than 1.5 m, such wall clearance is not required.
ON Variations: A clearance of not less than 400 mm shall be maintained between stored flammable liquids and combustible liquids and walls, except that where the width of storage adjacent to the wall is not more than 1.5 m, such wall clearance is not required.

ON Full: A building classified as Group A, Division 3 is permitted to be of combustible construction or noncombustible construction used singly or in combination, provided, it is not more than 1 storey in building height, and it has a building area not more than, 1 000 m2 if facing one street, 1 250 m2 if facing two streets, or 1 500 m2 if facing three streets.
ON Variations: A building classified as Group A, Division 3 is permitted to be of combustible construction or noncombustible construction used singly or in combination, provided, it is not more than 1 storey in building height, and it has a building area not more than, 1 000 m2 if facing one street, 1 250 m2 if facing two streets, or 1 500 m2 if facing three streets.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (6), openable windows in buildings of residential occupancy shall be protected by,(a) a guard in accordance with this Subsection, or (b) a mechanism capable of controlling the free swinging or sliding of the openable part of the window so as to limit any clear unobstructed opening to a size that will prevent the passage of a sphere having a diameter more than 100 mm. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (6), openable windows in buildings of residential occupancy shall be protected by,(a) a guard in accordance with this Subsection, or (b) a mechanism capable of controlling the free swinging or sliding of the openable part of the window so as to limit any clear unobstructed opening to a size that will prevent the passage of a sphere having a diameter more than 100 mm. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (5), the performance level of an existing building is reduced where a change in use will result in a change of the major occupancy of all or part of an existing building to another major occupancy of a greater hazard index.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (5), the performance level of an existing building is reduced where a change in use will result in a change of the major occupancy of all or part of an existing building to another major occupancy of a greater hazard index.

ON Full: Where tapered treads are located at the bottom of a mixed-tread flight described in Sentence (1), the run of the tapered treads when measured at a point 300 mm from the centre line of the inside handrail is permitted to exceed the run of the rectangular treads.
ON Variations: Where tapered treads are located at the bottom of a mixed-tread flight described in Sentence (1), the run of the tapered treads when measured at a point 300 mm from the centre line of the inside handrail is permitted to exceed the run of the rectangular treads.

ON Full: Where a storage tank is suspended, rather than supported on a foundation, supports shall be designed and installed in conformance with good engineering practice.
ON Variations: Where a storage tank is suspended, rather than supported on a foundation, supports shall be designed and installed in conformance with good engineering practice.

ON Full: If a service room referred to in Sentence (7) contains a limited quantity of service equipment, and the service equipment neither constitutes a fire hazard nor is essential to the operation of fire safety systems in the building, the requirements for a fire separation shall not apply.
ON Variations: If a service room referred to in Sentence (7) contains a limited quantity of service equipment, and the service equipment neither constitutes a fire hazard nor is essential to the operation of fire safety systems in the building, the requirements for a fire separation shall not apply.

ON Full: Where soffit venting is used, measures shall be taken, (a) to prevent loose-fill insulation from blocking the soffit vents and to maintain an open path for circulation of air from the vents into the attic or roof space, and (b) to minimize air flow into the loose-fill insulation near the soffit vents to maintain the thermal performance of the material.
ON Variations: Where soffit venting is used, measures shall be taken, (a) to prevent loose-fill insulation from blocking the soffit vents and to maintain an open path for circulation of air from the vents into the attic or roof space, and (b) to minimize air flow into the loose-fill insulation near the soffit vents to maintain the thermal performance of the material.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentences (4) and (5), dwelling units that contain 2 or more storeys including basements shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 1 h.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentences (4) and (5), dwelling units that contain 2 or more storeys including basements shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 1 h.

ON Full: The walls of a masonry chimney shall be built of solid masonry units not less than 70 mm thick.
ON Variations: The walls of a masonry chimney shall be built of solid masonry units not less than 70 mm thick.

ON Full: Dry wells are permitted to be used only when located in areas where the natural groundwater level is below the bottom of the dry well.
ON Variations: Dry wells are permitted to be used only when located in areas where the natural groundwater level is below the bottom of the dry well.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (2) and Article 9.8.4.5., where a flight within a house or individual dwelling unit consists of both tapered treads and rectangular treads, all the treads shall have a uniform run when measured at a point 300 mm from the centre line of the inside handrail.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (2) and Article 9.8.4.5., where a flight within a house or individual dwelling unit consists of both tapered treads and rectangular treads, all the treads shall have a uniform run when measured at a point 300 mm from the centre line of the inside handrail.

ON Full: The telephone number of the fire department and location of the nearest telephones shall be posted conspicuously in working locations in the open yard and in each building.
ON Variations: The telephone number of the fire department and location of the nearest telephones shall be posted conspicuously in working locations in the open yard and in each building.

ON Full: Except as permitted in Sentence (3), storage garages containing 5 motor vehicles or fewer shall be separated from other occupancies by a fire separation of not less than 1 h.
ON Variations: Except as permitted in Sentence (3), storage garages containing 5 motor vehicles or fewer shall be separated from other occupancies by a fire separation of not less than 1 h.

ON Full: Countertop splash boards or back plates that extend above the level of the heating elements or burners need not be protected as described in Sentence (1).
ON Variations: Countertop splash boards or back plates that extend above the level of the heating elements or burners need not be protected as described in Sentence (1).

ON Full: Ventilation air inlets and outlets within a room or enclosed space referred to in Article 4.1.7.1. shall be arranged to provide air movement in all areas of the room or enclosed space.
ON Variations: Ventilation air inlets and outlets within a room or enclosed space referred to in Article 4.1.7.1. shall be arranged to provide air movement in all areas of the room or enclosed space.

ON Full: Horizontal joints in cladding referred to in Sentence (1) shall be lapped not less than 25 mm or shall be suitably flashed.
ON Variations: Horizontal joints in cladding referred to in Sentence (1) shall be lapped not less than 25 mm or shall be suitably flashed.

ON Full: A chimney flue that serves a solid fuel-burning appliance shall not be connected to an oil-burning appliance unless the solid fuel-burning appliance is listed for such installation and the installation of both appliances meets their respective installation requirements.
ON Variations: A chimney flue that serves a solid fuel-burning appliance shall not be connected to an oil-burning appliance unless the solid fuel-burning appliance is listed for such installation and the installation of both appliances meets their respective installation requirements.

ON Full: Where larger quantities than are permitted by Sentence (1) are required, such quantities shall be in storage tanks installed in conformance with Sentence 4.3.12.4.(2).
ON Variations: Where larger quantities than are permitted by Sentence (1) are required, such quantities shall be in storage tanks installed in conformance with Sentence 4.3.12.4.(2).

ON Full: All tapered treads within a flight shall turn in the same direction.
ON Variations: All tapered treads within a flight shall turn in the same direction.

ON Full: Solid blocking shall be installed between floor joists beneath dwarf walls referred to in Sentence (5) that enclose finished rooms.
ON Variations: Solid blocking shall be installed between floor joists beneath dwarf walls referred to in Sentence (5) that enclose finished rooms.

ON Full: Aisles leading to exits shall be provided so that there are not more than seven seats between any seat and the nearest aisle.
ON Variations: Aisles leading to exits shall be provided so that there are not more than seven seats between any seat and the nearest aisle.

ON Full: Subject to Sentences (2) to (5), where a smoke control system is designed to meet the requirements of the Building Code, the inspections and tests for equipment shall be carried out in accordance with procedures established by the designer of the system.
ON Variations: Subject to Sentences (2) to (5), where a smoke control system is designed to meet the requirements of the Building Code, the inspections and tests for equipment shall be carried out in accordance with procedures established by the designer of the system.

ON Full: Fire dampers are permitted to penetrate a fire separation or a membrane forming part of an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating without having to meet the fire stop requirements of Sentence (1), provided the fire damper is, (a) installed in conformance with NFPA 80, "Fire Doors and Other Opening Protectives," or (b) designed specifically with a fire stop.
ON Variations: Fire dampers are permitted to penetrate a fire separation or a membrane forming part of an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating without having to meet the fire stop requirements of Sentence (1), provided the fire damper is, (a) installed in conformance with NFPA 80, "Fire Doors and Other Opening Protectives," or (b) designed specifically with a fire stop.

ON Full: Except as otherwise provided in this Subsection, the slope factor, Cs, shall be 1.0 when used in conjunction with accumulation factors for increased snow loads.
ON Variations: Except as otherwise provided in this Subsection, the slope factor, Cs, shall be 1.0 when used in conjunction with accumulation factors for increased snow loads.

ON Full: Ductwork for cooking appliance exhaust fans shall, (a) be of noncombustible, corrosion-resistant material, and (b) lead directly to the outdoors without connection to other exhaust fans or ducts.
ON Variations: Ductwork for cooking appliance exhaust fans shall, (a) be of noncombustible, corrosion-resistant material, and (b) lead directly to the outdoors without connection to other exhaust fans or ducts.

ON Full: In a Group B, Division 1 occupancy, or in an impeded egress zone in other occupancies, sliding doors used in an access to exit need not conform to Sentence (1) and Article 3.3.1.10.
ON Variations: In a Group B, Division 1 occupancy, or in an impeded egress zone in other occupancies, sliding doors used in an access to exit need not conform to Sentence (1) and Article 3.3.1.10.

ON Full: Except as permitted by Sentence (3), a revolving door shall not be considered to have an exiting capacity for more than 45 persons.
ON Variations: Except as permitted by Sentence (3), a revolving door shall not be considered to have an exiting capacity for more than 45 persons.

ON Full: The bottom of a modified pool shall be marked with continuous black contour lines, 150 mm wide located where the water depth is 600 mm, and 300 mm wide located where the water depth is 1 200 mm.
ON Variations: The bottom of a modified pool shall be marked with continuous black contour lines, 150 mm wide located where the water depth is 600 mm, and 300 mm wide located where the water depth is 1 200 mm.

ON Full: An exhaust air intake shall be installed in each kitchen, bathroom and water closet room.
ON Variations: An exhaust air intake shall be installed in each kitchen, bathroom and water closet room.

ON Full: Except for stairs within a dwelling unit, at least three risers shall be provided in interior flights.
ON Variations: Except for stairs within a dwelling unit, at least three risers shall be provided in interior flights.

ON Full: The cementitious material described in Sentence (1) shall be mixed with no fewer than three nor more than five parts of aggregate per part of cementitious material by volume.
ON Variations: The cementitious material described in Sentence (1) shall be mixed with no fewer than three nor more than five parts of aggregate per part of cementitious material by volume.

ON Full: If the building is 84 m or more high, measured between grade and the ceiling level of the top storey, the building shall be served by no fewer than two sources of water supply from a public water system.
ON Variations: If the building is 84 m or more high, measured between grade and the ceiling level of the top storey, the building shall be served by no fewer than two sources of water supply from a public water system.

ON Full: To ensure proper operation, frequent inspections and tests shall be made of all safety shut-off valves and other fire safety devices, with particular attention directed to normally open, fusible-link operated valves, float valves and automatic controls.
ON Variations: To ensure proper operation, frequent inspections and tests shall be made of all safety shut-off valves and other fire safety devices, with particular attention directed to normally open, fusible-link operated valves, float valves and automatic controls.

ON Full: Individual elements within the guard, including solid panels and pickets, shall be designed for a load of 0.5 kN applied outward over an area of 100 mm by 100 mm located at any point in the element or elements so as to produce the most critical effect.
ON Variations: Individual elements within the guard, including solid panels and pickets, shall be designed for a load of 0.5 kN applied outward over an area of 100 mm by 100 mm located at any point in the element or elements so as to produce the most critical effect.

ON Full: Except as permitted for dwelling units and by Sentence 3.4.7.5.(1) for fire escapes, steps in flights shall have a run of not less than 280 mm and not more than 355 mm between successive steps.
ON Variations: Except as permitted for dwelling units and by Sentence 3.4.7.5.(1) for fire escapes, steps in flights shall have a run of not less than 280 mm and not more than 355 mm between successive steps.

ON Full: Valves installed to control the filling of tank vehicles or tank cars shall be of the self-closing type.
ON Variations: Valves installed to control the filling of tank vehicles or tank cars shall be of the self-closing type.

ON Full: The fire safety plan shall be reviewed as often as necessary, but at least every 12 months, and shall be revised as necessary so that it takes into account changes in the use or other characteristics of the building or premises.
ON Variations: The fire safety plan shall be reviewed as often as necessary, but at least every 12 months, and shall be revised as necessary so that it takes into account changes in the use or other characteristics of the building or premises.

ON Full: Lighting required in Sentence (1) shall be designed to be automatically actuated for a period of not less than 30 min when the electric lighting in the affected area is interrupted.
ON Variations: Lighting required in Sentence (1) shall be designed to be automatically actuated for a period of not less than 30 min when the electric lighting in the affected area is interrupted.

ON Full: In a building required to be of noncombustible construction, a mezzanine located within a live/work unit is permitted to be of combustible construction, provided the area of the mezzanine is not more than 25% of the floor area of the live/work unit or 20 m2, whichever is less, and has no obstructions more than 1 070 mm above the floor.
ON Variations: In a building required to be of noncombustible construction, a mezzanine located within a live/work unit is permitted to be of combustible construction, provided the area of the mezzanine is not more than 25% of the floor area of the live/work unit or 20 m2, whichever is less, and has no obstructions more than 1 070 mm above the floor.

ON Full: An exit door need not swing in the direction of exit travel where it serves,(a) a room, suite or floor area having an occupant load of not more than 60 persons, or (b) as part of a means of egress from more than one floor area and the floor areas so served have a total occupant load of not more than 60 persons.
ON Variations: An exit door need not swing in the direction of exit travel where it serves,(a) a room, suite or floor area having an occupant load of not more than 60 persons, or (b) as part of a means of egress from more than one floor area and the floor areas so served have a total occupant load of not more than 60 persons.

ON Full: For a structure with supplemental energy dissipation, the following criteria shall apply: (a) the value of Sa(0.2) used in Sentence (1) shall be determined from the mean 5% damped floor spectral acceleration values at 0.2 s by averaging the individual 5% damped floor spectra at the base of the structure determined using Non-Linear Dynamic Analysis, and (b) the value of Fa used in Sentence (1) shall be 1.
ON Variations: For a structure with supplemental energy dissipation, the following criteria shall apply: (a) the value of Sa(0.2) used in Sentence (1) shall be determined from the mean 5% damped floor spectral acceleration values at 0.2 s by averaging the individual 5% damped floor spectra at the base of the structure determined using Non-Linear Dynamic Analysis, and (b) the value of Fa used in Sentence (1) shall be 1.

ON Full: Hydrant water flow shall be inspected annually in accordance with Article 6.6.5.7.
ON Variations: Hydrant water flow shall be inspected annually in accordance with Article 6.6.5.7.

ON Full: A visual inspection routine for the prompt detection of obviously abnormal conditions shall be established and shall be performed at least once each shift.
ON Variations: A visual inspection routine for the prompt detection of obviously abnormal conditions shall be established and shall be performed at least once each shift.

ON Full: Heating, ventilating and air-conditioning systems shall be designed to minimize growth and spread of bio-contaminants.
ON Variations: Heating, ventilating and air-conditioning systems shall be designed to minimize growth and spread of bio-contaminants.

ON Full: Treads and landings of interior and exterior stairs and ramps, other than those within dwelling units, shall have a slip-resistant finish or be provided with slip-resistant strips that extend not more than 1 mm above the surface.
ON Variations: Treads and landings of interior and exterior stairs and ramps, other than those within dwelling units, shall have a slip-resistant finish or be provided with slip-resistant strips that extend not more than 1 mm above the surface.

ON Full: Where sheathing membrane required in Sentence (1) is applied horizontally, the upper sheets shall overlap the lower sheets.
ON Variations: Where sheathing membrane required in Sentence (1) is applied horizontally, the upper sheets shall overlap the lower sheets.

ON Full: The soil or leaching bed fill around the perimeter of the cesspool shall be raised or mounded to a height of at least 150 mm above ground level.
ON Variations: The soil or leaching bed fill around the perimeter of the cesspool shall be raised or mounded to a height of at least 150 mm above ground level.

ON Full: Except as permitted by Articles 3.2.2.24. to 3.2.2.28., a building classified as Group A, Division 2 shall conform to Sentence (2).
ON Variations: Except as permitted by Articles 3.2.2.24. to 3.2.2.28., a building classified as Group A, Division 2 shall conform to Sentence (2).

ON Full: The size of every vent pipe for a macerating toilet system with a sump or tank shall be not less than 1 ½ in.
ON Variations: The size of every vent pipe for a macerating toilet system with a sump or tank shall be not less than 1 ½ in.

ON Full: The performance level of an existing building is reduced where proposed construction will increase the occupant load by 15% or less and the new occupant load will be more than 15% above the existing exit capacity as required under Article 3.4.3.2.
ON Variations: The performance level of an existing building is reduced where proposed construction will increase the occupant load by 15% or less and the new occupant load will be more than 15% above the existing exit capacity as required under Article 3.4.3.2.

ON Full: Except as permitted in Sentence 7.1.5.3.(3), an outlet from a non-potable water system shall not be located where it can discharge into,(a) a sink or lavatory, (b) a fixture into which an outlet from a potable water system is discharged, or (c) a fixture that is used for a purpose related to the preparation, handling or dispensing of food, drink or products that are intended for human consumption.
ON Variations: Except as permitted in Sentence 7.1.5.3.(3), an outlet from a non-potable water system shall not be located where it can discharge into,(a) a sink or lavatory, (b) a fixture into which an outlet from a potable water system is discharged, or (c) a fixture that is used for a purpose related to the preparation, handling or dispensing of food, drink or products that are intended for human consumption.

ON Full: Sanitary sewage shall pass from one compartment to another of the septic tank as follows:(a) by means of a device similar to that described in CSA B66, "Design, Material, and Manufacturing Requirements for Prefabricated Septic Tanks and Sewage Holding Tanks" for outlet devices, or (b) through two or more openings through the partition located in a horizontal line, and evenly spaced across the width of the partition, centred at approximately 40% of the liquid depth below the surface of the liquid, and having a total area of between three and five times that of the cross-sectional area of the inlet pipe.
ON Variations: Sanitary sewage shall pass from one compartment to another of the septic tank as follows:(a) by means of a device similar to that described in CSA B66, "Design, Material, and Manufacturing Requirements for Prefabricated Septic Tanks and Sewage Holding Tanks" for outlet devices, or (b) through two or more openings through the partition located in a horizontal line, and evenly spaced across the width of the partition, centred at approximately 40% of the liquid depth below the surface of the liquid, and having a total area of between three and five times that of the cross-sectional area of the inlet pipe.

ON Full: The pit shall be surrounded on all sides and on its bottom by at least 600 mm of soil having a percolation time of less than 50 minutes.
ON Variations: The pit shall be surrounded on all sides and on its bottom by at least 600 mm of soil having a percolation time of less than 50 minutes.

ON Full: Hydromassage bathtubs shall conform to ASME A112.19.7 / CSA B45.10, "Hydromassage Bathtub Systems".
ON Variations: Hydromassage bathtubs shall conform to ASME A112.19.7 / CSA B45.10, "Hydromassage Bathtub Systems".

ON Full: All loadbearing walls, columns and arches supporting a floor assembly immediately above a basement shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than that required by Sentence (1) for the floor assembly.
ON Variations: All loadbearing walls, columns and arches supporting a floor assembly immediately above a basement shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than that required by Sentence (1) for the floor assembly.

ON Full: Gypsum sheathing, rigid insulation and fibreboard shall not be used for the attachment of siding materials.
ON Variations: Gypsum sheathing, rigid insulation and fibreboard shall not be used for the attachment of siding materials.

ON Full: Portable extinguishers shall be located in or adjacent to corridors or aisles that provide access to exits.
ON Variations: Portable extinguishers shall be located in or adjacent to corridors or aisles that provide access to exits.

ON Full: Equipment requiring periodic maintenance and forming part of a heating, ventilating or air-conditioning system shall be installed with provision for access for inspection, maintenance, repair and cleaning. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Equipment requiring periodic maintenance and forming part of a heating, ventilating or air-conditioning system shall be installed with provision for access for inspection, maintenance, repair and cleaning. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: A spill control procedure shall be approved and implemented for any occupancy where flammable liquids or combustible liquids are stored, handled, processed or used.
ON Variations: A spill control procedure shall be approved and implemented for any occupancy where flammable liquids or combustible liquids are stored, handled, processed or used.

ON Full: This Section applies to industrial baking and drying ovens which during operation contain flammable vapours given off by the products being baked or dried.
ON Variations: This Section applies to industrial baking and drying ovens which during operation contain flammable vapours given off by the products being baked or dried.

ON Full: Except as permitted by Sentence (5), the clear height of doorways shall not be less than 2 030 mm.
ON Variations: Except as permitted by Sentence (5), the clear height of doorways shall not be less than 2 030 mm.

ON Full: Where a change in direction of more than 45° occurs in a soil or waste pipe that serves more than one clothes washer, and in which pressure zones are created by detergent suds, no other soil or waste pipe shall be connected to it within a length less than, (a) 40 times the size of the soil or waste pipe or 2.44 m maximum vertical, whichever is less, before the change in direction, and (b) 10 times the size of the nominally horizontal soil or waste pipe after the change in direction. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Where a change in direction of more than 45° occurs in a soil or waste pipe that serves more than one clothes washer, and in which pressure zones are created by detergent suds, no other soil or waste pipe shall be connected to it within a length less than, (a) 40 times the size of the soil or waste pipe or 2.44 m maximum vertical, whichever is less, before the change in direction, and (b) 10 times the size of the nominally horizontal soil or waste pipe after the change in direction. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: The requirements of this Subsection are in addition to the requirements of Subsection 8.9.1.
ON Variations: The requirements of this Subsection are in addition to the requirements of Subsection 8.9.1.

ON Full: Waste water from a kitchen equipped with a garbage grinder may be directed to the sewage system provided the system has been designed to accept such waste water.
ON Variations: Waste water from a kitchen equipped with a garbage grinder may be directed to the sewage system provided the system has been designed to accept such waste water.

ON Full: A bell trap or an S-trap shall not be installed in a drainage system.
ON Variations: A bell trap or an S-trap shall not be installed in a drainage system.

ON Full: The swing of doors described in Sentence (1) shall not reduce the width of the path of travel to less than,(a) the required exit width in exit corridors and passageways, and (b) 750 mm on exit stairs or landings.
ON Variations: The swing of doors described in Sentence (1) shall not reduce the width of the path of travel to less than,(a) the required exit width in exit corridors and passageways, and (b) 750 mm on exit stairs or landings.

ON Full: Nails for fastening particleboard, OSB or waferboard shall be not less than 38 mm casing or finishing nails spaced not more than 150 mm o.c. along edge supports and 300 mm o.c. along intermediate supports.
ON Variations: Nails for fastening particleboard, OSB or waferboard shall be not less than 38 mm casing or finishing nails spaced not more than 150 mm o.c. along edge supports and 300 mm o.c. along intermediate supports.

ON Full: Venting systems for drain piping or dilution tanks conveying corrosive waste shall extend independently and terminate in open air.
ON Variations: Venting systems for drain piping or dilution tanks conveying corrosive waste shall extend independently and terminate in open air.

ON Full: The building referred to in Sentence (1) is permitted to be of combustible construction or noncombustible construction used singly or in combination, and, floor assemblies shall be fire separations with a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min, mezzanines shall have, if of combustible construction, a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min, roof assemblies shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min, except that in a building not more than 1 storey in building height, the fire-resistance rating is permitted to be waived provided the roof assembly is of noncombustible construction or is constructed as a fire-retardant treated wood roof system conforming to Article 3.1.14.1., loadbearing walls, columns and arches supporting an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating shall, have a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min, or be of noncombustible construction, and loadbearing walls, columns and arches supporting a fire separation shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the fire separation.
ON Variations: The building referred to in Sentence (1) is permitted to be of combustible construction or noncombustible construction used singly or in combination, and, floor assemblies shall be fire separations with a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min, mezzanines shall have, if of combustible construction, a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min, roof assemblies shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min, except that in a building not more than 1 storey in building height, the fire-resistance rating is permitted to be waived provided the roof assembly is of noncombustible construction or is constructed as a fire-retardant treated wood roof system conforming to Article 3.1.14.1., loadbearing walls, columns and arches supporting an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating shall, have a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min, or be of noncombustible construction, and loadbearing walls, columns and arches supporting a fire separation shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the fire separation.

ON Full: The platform occupant load for each platform in a rapid transit station shall be the greater of the a.m. or p.m. peak period loads calculated in accordance with Sentences (3) to (5).
ON Variations: The platform occupant load for each platform in a rapid transit station shall be the greater of the a.m. or p.m. peak period loads calculated in accordance with Sentences (3) to (5).

ON Full: A camp for housing of workers shall include, at least one shower or other area of bathing, and provisions for at least one washing machine or laundry tub for every 15 beds.
ON Variations: A camp for housing of workers shall include, at least one shower or other area of bathing, and provisions for at least one washing machine or laundry tub for every 15 beds.

ON Full: The total length of distribution pipe shall,(a) not be less than 30 m when constructed as a shallow buried trench, or (b) not be less than 40 m for any other absorption trench.
ON Variations: The total length of distribution pipe shall,(a) not be less than 30 m when constructed as a shallow buried trench, or (b) not be less than 40 m for any other absorption trench.

ON Full: The building referred to in Sentence (1) is permitted to be of combustible construction or noncombustible construction used singly or in combination, and, except as permitted by Sentences (3) and (4), floor assemblies shall be fire separations with a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, mezzanines shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, and loadbearing walls, columns and arches shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the supported assembly.
ON Variations: The building referred to in Sentence (1) is permitted to be of combustible construction or noncombustible construction used singly or in combination, and, except as permitted by Sentences (3) and (4), floor assemblies shall be fire separations with a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, mezzanines shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, and loadbearing walls, columns and arches shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the supported assembly.

ON Full: Type 5 hardboard cladding shall be not less than 9.0 mm thick when applied over sheathing that provides continuous support or over furring or framing members spaced not more than 406 mm o.c.
ON Variations: Type 5 hardboard cladding shall be not less than 9.0 mm thick when applied over sheathing that provides continuous support or over furring or framing members spaced not more than 406 mm o.c.

ON Full: Where an enclosed terminal serves vehicles powered by combustible fuels, and the terminal has direct access to a rapid transit station, the terminal shall be sprinklered, and the terminal shall be separated from the rapid transit station, by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, or by wired glass assemblies conforming to MMAH Supplementary Standard SB-2, "Fire Performance Ratings", with wired glass doors equipped with self-closing devices.
ON Variations: Where an enclosed terminal serves vehicles powered by combustible fuels, and the terminal has direct access to a rapid transit station, the terminal shall be sprinklered, and the terminal shall be separated from the rapid transit station, by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, or by wired glass assemblies conforming to MMAH Supplementary Standard SB-2, "Fire Performance Ratings", with wired glass doors equipped with self-closing devices.

ON Full: Gateways shall be kept clear of obstructions so that gates may be opened fully at all times.
ON Variations: Gateways shall be kept clear of obstructions so that gates may be opened fully at all times.

ON Full: Where an at-level conveyor cross-over is incorporated along an egress route, not more than two at-level conveyor cross-overs shall be within a single egress route, handrails spaced not more than 1 m apart and parallel to the direction of egress shall be provided on both sides of the at-level cross-over, flat, metal inserts shall be placed between each roller over the required egress width at each at-level conveyor cross-over to provide a walking surface, at least two inserts not less than 100 mm wide shall be arranged symmetrically between the handrails serving the at-level cross-over, inserts shall be sized to support loads specified in Part 4, a clearly identified and easily accessible switch that will stop the conveyor shall be located at each at-level cross-over, and stairs approaching at-level conveyor cross-overs shall be marked to indicate that they are readily identifiable as part of the egress route.
ON Variations: Where an at-level conveyor cross-over is incorporated along an egress route, not more than two at-level conveyor cross-overs shall be within a single egress route, handrails spaced not more than 1 m apart and parallel to the direction of egress shall be provided on both sides of the at-level cross-over, flat, metal inserts shall be placed between each roller over the required egress width at each at-level conveyor cross-over to provide a walking surface, at least two inserts not less than 100 mm wide shall be arranged symmetrically between the handrails serving the at-level cross-over, inserts shall be sized to support loads specified in Part 4, a clearly identified and easily accessible switch that will stop the conveyor shall be located at each at-level cross-over, and stairs approaching at-level conveyor cross-overs shall be marked to indicate that they are readily identifiable as part of the egress route.

ON Full: In this Section, a crawl space refers to an enclosed space between the underside of a floor assembly and the ground cover directly below, with a clearance less than 1 800 mm in height.
ON Variations: In this Section, a crawl space refers to an enclosed space between the underside of a floor assembly and the ground cover directly below, with a clearance less than 1 800 mm in height.

ON Full: Where the performance level of an existing building is reduced under Sentence 11.4.2.1.(1),(a) remedial measures shall be taken to support the proposed loads, or (b) the portion of the floor affected by the proposed loads shall be restricted to the loading it will support and signs stating the restrictions shall be posted. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Where the performance level of an existing building is reduced under Sentence 11.4.2.1.(1),(a) remedial measures shall be taken to support the proposed loads, or (b) the portion of the floor affected by the proposed loads shall be restricted to the loading it will support and signs stating the restrictions shall be posted. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Helicopter landing areas on roofs shall be constructed in conformance with the requirements for heliports contained in Part III of the Canadian Aviation Regulations made under the Aeronautics Act (Canada).
ON Variations: Helicopter landing areas on roofs shall be constructed in conformance with the requirements for heliports contained in Part III of the Canadian Aviation Regulations made under the Aeronautics Act (Canada).

ON Full: Self-closing devices are not required between public corridors and suites in business and personal services occupancies, except in,(a) dead-end corridors, or (b) a corridor that serves a hotel.
ON Variations: Self-closing devices are not required between public corridors and suites in business and personal services occupancies, except in,(a) dead-end corridors, or (b) a corridor that serves a hotel.

ON Full: Where the quantity of combustible material present is such that fires of small size may be expected, such as in offices, schoolrooms, churches, assembly halls and telephone exchanges, the occupancy shall be graded as light hazard.
ON Variations: Where the quantity of combustible material present is such that fires of small size may be expected, such as in offices, schoolrooms, churches, assembly halls and telephone exchanges, the occupancy shall be graded as light hazard.

ON Full: Studs described in Sentence (1) shall be fastened together by screws, crimping or welding to act as a single structural unit in resisting transverse loads.
ON Variations: Studs described in Sentence (1) shall be fastened together by screws, crimping or welding to act as a single structural unit in resisting transverse loads.

ON Full: The size of every soil stack that serves more than six water closets shall be at least 4 in.
ON Variations: The size of every soil stack that serves more than six water closets shall be at least 4 in.

ON Full: When vehicular impact or physical damage is possible, protective guarding devices shall be provided for piping referred to in Sentence (1) and for fill pipes for storage tanks.
ON Variations: When vehicular impact or physical damage is possible, protective guarding devices shall be provided for piping referred to in Sentence (1) and for fill pipes for storage tanks.

ON Full: In buildings not required to be equipped with a standpipe system by the Building Code, hose stations conforming to Articles 3.2.9.2. to 3.2.9.7. of the Building Code, as it read on August 21, 2000, shall be provided in the vicinity of the storage room, such that all parts of the room are within reach of a hose stream.
ON Variations: In buildings not required to be equipped with a standpipe system by the Building Code, hose stations conforming to Articles 3.2.9.2. to 3.2.9.7. of the Building Code, as it read on August 21, 2000, shall be provided in the vicinity of the storage room, such that all parts of the room are within reach of a hose stream.

ON Full: Despite Clause 2(a), where storage consists of more than one class of liquid, placards that indicate the danger symbol or individual placards for each class of liquid shall be acceptable.
ON Variations: Despite Clause 2(a), where storage consists of more than one class of liquid, placards that indicate the danger symbol or individual placards for each class of liquid shall be acceptable.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (2), normal and emergency vents for storage tanks in buildings shall be provided in conformance with Subsections 4.3.4. and 4.3.5.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (2), normal and emergency vents for storage tanks in buildings shall be provided in conformance with Subsections 4.3.4. and 4.3.5.

ON Full: Where a wall mounted tactile sign is provided in a storey that is not required by Article 3.8.2.1. to have a barrier-free path of travel, characters, symbols or pictographs on the sign shall conform to Sentence (5).
ON Variations: Where a wall mounted tactile sign is provided in a storey that is not required by Article 3.8.2.1. to have a barrier-free path of travel, characters, symbols or pictographs on the sign shall conform to Sentence (5).

ON Full: Except as required in Sentence (2) and Article 9.23.13.10., the spans for wood joists and rafters shall conform to the spans shown in Tables A-1 to A-7 for the uniform live loads shown in the Tables.
ON Variations: Except as required in Sentence (2) and Article 9.23.13.10., the spans for wood joists and rafters shall conform to the spans shown in Tables A-1 to A-7 for the uniform live loads shown in the Tables.

ON Full: One handrail shall be provided on each side of, straight flights that are 1 100 mm or more in width, curved flights, and ramps.
ON Variations: One handrail shall be provided on each side of, straight flights that are 1 100 mm or more in width, curved flights, and ramps.

ON Full: Except as permitted by Sentence (2), for the purposes of this Subsection, travel distance means the distance from any point in the floor area to an exit measured along the path of travel to the exit.
ON Variations: Except as permitted by Sentence (2), for the purposes of this Subsection, travel distance means the distance from any point in the floor area to an exit measured along the path of travel to the exit.

ON Full: Except as permitted by Sentences (2) to (4), a mezzanine shall be provided with exits on the same basis as required for floor areas by this Section.
ON Variations: Except as permitted by Sentences (2) to (4), a mezzanine shall be provided with exits on the same basis as required for floor areas by this Section.

ON Full: The inner boundary of the drainage plane shall comply with,(a) Articles 9.27.3.2. to 9.27.3.6., or (b) Subsection 9.27.13.
ON Variations: The inner boundary of the drainage plane shall comply with,(a) Articles 9.27.3.2. to 9.27.3.6., or (b) Subsection 9.27.13.

ON Full: Despite Articles 3.2.1.4. and 3.2.1.5., other approved storage pile arrangements may be used to prevent the spread of fire.
ON Variations: Despite Articles 3.2.1.4. and 3.2.1.5., other approved storage pile arrangements may be used to prevent the spread of fire.

ON Full: Where egress doors from a rental space open onto a corridor and swing in the direction of exit travel, the corridor shall be not less than 1 500 mm wide, and the doors shall be not more than 914 mm wide.
ON Variations: Where egress doors from a rental space open onto a corridor and swing in the direction of exit travel, the corridor shall be not less than 1 500 mm wide, and the doors shall be not more than 914 mm wide.

ON Full: Crane-supporting structures shall be designed for the appropriate load combinations listed in Article 4.1.3.2.
ON Variations: Crane-supporting structures shall be designed for the appropriate load combinations listed in Article 4.1.3.2.

ON Full: A corridor in a Group B, Division 3 occupancy that contains sleeping accommodation for not more than 10 persons and not more than six occupants require assistance in evacuation in case of an emergency need not comply with Sentence (3).
ON Variations: A corridor in a Group B, Division 3 occupancy that contains sleeping accommodation for not more than 10 persons and not more than six occupants require assistance in evacuation in case of an emergency need not comply with Sentence (3).

ON Full: Enclosing material in crawl spaces described in Sentence (1), including insulation, shall have a surface flame-spread rating not greater than 150.
ON Variations: Enclosing material in crawl spaces described in Sentence (1), including insulation, shall have a surface flame-spread rating not greater than 150.

ON Full: Preserved wood foundation walls shall be dampproofed as described in CSA S406, "Permanent Wood Foundations for Housing and Small Buildings".
ON Variations: Preserved wood foundation walls shall be dampproofed as described in CSA S406, "Permanent Wood Foundations for Housing and Small Buildings".

ON Full: Except as provided in Article 9.20.9.5 for masonry veneer, masonry walls that consist of two or more wythes shall have the wythes bonded or tied together with masonry bonding units as described in Article 9.20.9.3. or with metal ties as described in Articles 9.20.9.4.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Article 9.20.9.5 for masonry veneer, masonry walls that consist of two or more wythes shall have the wythes bonded or tied together with masonry bonding units as described in Article 9.20.9.3. or with metal ties as described in Articles 9.20.9.4.

ON Full: A kitchen exhaust duct not equipped with a filter at the inlet end shall be designed and installed so that the entire duct can be cleaned.
ON Variations: A kitchen exhaust duct not equipped with a filter at the inlet end shall be designed and installed so that the entire duct can be cleaned.

ON Full: The shear and overturning resistances of the foundation determined using a bearing stress equal to 1.5 times the factored bearing strength of the soil or rock and all other resistances equal to 1.3 times the factored resistances need not exceed the design forces determined in Sentence 4.1.8.7.(1) using RdRo = 1.0 except that the factor of 1.3 shall not apply to the portion of the resistance to uplift or overturning resulting from gravity loads.
ON Variations: The shear and overturning resistances of the foundation determined using a bearing stress equal to 1.5 times the factored bearing strength of the soil or rock and all other resistances equal to 1.3 times the factored resistances need not exceed the design forces determined in Sentence 4.1.8.7.(1) using RdRo = 1.0 except that the factor of 1.3 shall not apply to the portion of the resistance to uplift or overturning resulting from gravity loads.

ON Full: A backwater valve may be installed in a building drain provided that,(a) it is a "normally open" design conforming to, (i) CAN/CSA-B70, "Cast Iron Soil Pipe, Fittings, and Means of Joining", (ii) CAN/CSA-B181.1, "Acrylonitrile-Butadiene-Styrene (ABS) Drain, Waste, and Vent Pipe and Pipe Fittings", (iii) CAN/CSA-B181.2, "Polyvinylchloride (PVC) and Chlorinated Polyvinylchloride (CPVC) Drain, Waste, and Vent Pipe and Pipe Fittings", or (iv) CAN/CSA-B182.1, "Plastic Drain and Sewer Pipe and Pipe Fittings", and (b) it does not serve more than one dwelling unit.
ON Variations: A backwater valve may be installed in a building drain provided that,(a) it is a "normally open" design conforming to, (i) CAN/CSA-B70, "Cast Iron Soil Pipe, Fittings, and Means of Joining", (ii) CAN/CSA-B181.1, "Acrylonitrile-Butadiene-Styrene (ABS) Drain, Waste, and Vent Pipe and Pipe Fittings", (iii) CAN/CSA-B181.2, "Polyvinylchloride (PVC) and Chlorinated Polyvinylchloride (CPVC) Drain, Waste, and Vent Pipe and Pipe Fittings", or (iv) CAN/CSA-B182.1, "Plastic Drain and Sewer Pipe and Pipe Fittings", and (b) it does not serve more than one dwelling unit.

ON Full: All steel pipe of 4 in. size and smaller shall be schedule 40 or heavier and fittings of less than 2 in. size shall be galvanized screw fittings.
ON Variations: All steel pipe of 4 in. size and smaller shall be schedule 40 or heavier and fittings of less than 2 in. size shall be galvanized screw fittings.

ON Full: Where a window required in Sentence (1) opens into a window well, a clearance of not less than 550 mm shall be provided in front of the window. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Where a window required in Sentence (1) opens into a window well, a clearance of not less than 550 mm shall be provided in front of the window. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Bracing described in Sentence (3) shall be nailed to each stud and wall plate by at least two 63 mm nails.
ON Variations: Bracing described in Sentence (3) shall be nailed to each stud and wall plate by at least two 63 mm nails.

ON Full: Where a secondary receiver for oil is installed in conjunction with an oil interceptor, it shall be vented in accordance with the manufacturer's recommendations, and the vent pipe shall, (a) in no case be less than 1½ in. in size, (b) extend independently to open air, and (c) terminate not less than 2 000 mm above ground.
ON Variations: Where a secondary receiver for oil is installed in conjunction with an oil interceptor, it shall be vented in accordance with the manufacturer's recommendations, and the vent pipe shall, (a) in no case be less than 1½ in. in size, (b) extend independently to open air, and (c) terminate not less than 2 000 mm above ground.

ON Full: A hose station in a Group B, Division 1 major occupancy is permitted to be located in a secure area, or in a lockable cabinet provided that, identical keys for all cabinets are located at all guard stations, or electrical remote release devices are provided and are connected to an emergency power supply.
ON Variations: A hose station in a Group B, Division 1 major occupancy is permitted to be located in a secure area, or in a lockable cabinet provided that, identical keys for all cabinets are located at all guard stations, or electrical remote release devices are provided and are connected to an emergency power supply.

ON Full: Except as permitted by Sentences (2) and 3.4.6.12.(4), an exit door leading directly to outdoors at ground level is permitted to be a sliding door provided it is released in conformance with Sentence 3.3.1.11.(1).
ON Variations: Except as permitted by Sentences (2) and 3.4.6.12.(4), an exit door leading directly to outdoors at ground level is permitted to be a sliding door provided it is released in conformance with Sentence 3.3.1.11.(1).

ON Full: Except as permitted in Sentences (2) and (3), 90° elbows of 4 in. size or less that have a centre-line radius that is less than the size of the pipe shall not be used to join two soil or waste pipes.
ON Variations: Except as permitted in Sentences (2) and (3), 90° elbows of 4 in. size or less that have a centre-line radius that is less than the size of the pipe shall not be used to join two soil or waste pipes.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (2), ramps shall not be less than 1 100 mm wide.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (2), ramps shall not be less than 1 100 mm wide.

ON Full: Air contaminants released within buildings shall be removed insofar as possible at their points of origin and shall not be permitted to accumulate in concentrations greater than permitted by good engineering practice appropriate to the circumstances such as that described in the publications listed in Article 6.2.1.1." (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Air contaminants released within buildings shall be removed insofar as possible at their points of origin and shall not be permitted to accumulate in concentrations greater than permitted by good engineering practice appropriate to the circumstances such as that described in the publications listed in Article 6.2.1.1." (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Drip pans shall be placed under hose connections on piers and wharves, except where a sump pit or settling basin is provided.
ON Variations: Drip pans shall be placed under hose connections on piers and wharves, except where a sump pit or settling basin is provided.

ON Full: Flammable liquid or combustible liquid spills in a building shall be removed immediately with an absorbent material that will not increase the hazard and shall be disposed of in a safe manner.
ON Variations: Flammable liquid or combustible liquid spills in a building shall be removed immediately with an absorbent material that will not increase the hazard and shall be disposed of in a safe manner.

ON Full: Enamelled cast iron fixtures shall conform to ASME A112.19.1 / CSA B45.2, "Enamelled Cast Iron and Enamelled Steel Plumbing Fixtures".
ON Variations: Enamelled cast iron fixtures shall conform to ASME A112.19.1 / CSA B45.2, "Enamelled Cast Iron and Enamelled Steel Plumbing Fixtures".

ON Full: The width of every public corridor, corridor used by the public, and exit corridor shall be not less than 1 100 mm.
ON Variations: The width of every public corridor, corridor used by the public, and exit corridor shall be not less than 1 100 mm.

ON Full: All permanent and temporary structural members, including formwork and falsework of a building, shall be protected against loads exceeding the specified loads during the construction period except when, as verified by analysis or test, temporary overloading of a structural member would result in no impairment of that member or any other member.
ON Variations: All permanent and temporary structural members, including formwork and falsework of a building, shall be protected against loads exceeding the specified loads during the construction period except when, as verified by analysis or test, temporary overloading of a structural member would result in no impairment of that member or any other member.

ON Full: Open valleys shall be flashed with, (a) at least one layer of sheet metal not less than 600 mm wide, or (b) no fewer than two layers of roll roofing.
ON Variations: Open valleys shall be flashed with, (a) at least one layer of sheet metal not less than 600 mm wide, or (b) no fewer than two layers of roll roofing.

ON Full: If access is provided through a fire separation between a storage garage and a Group A, Division 1 or Group B occupancy or a retirement home, the access shall be through a vestibule conforming to Sentence (3).
ON Variations: If access is provided through a fire separation between a storage garage and a Group A, Division 1 or Group B occupancy or a retirement home, the access shall be through a vestibule conforming to Sentence (3).

ON Full: Water closets and urinals shall conform to the requirements in Article 7.6.4.2.
ON Variations: Water closets and urinals shall conform to the requirements in Article 7.6.4.2.

ON Full: The horizontal clearance measured from the maximum conductor swing to the building, including balconies, fire escapes, flat roofs or other accessible projections beyond the face of the building, shall, be not less than 1 m, for electrical conductors carrying voltages 750 V or less, except where necessary to connect to the electrical wiring of the building, be not less than 3 m, for electrical conductors carrying voltages greater than 750 V but not exceeding 46 kV, be not less than 3.7 m, for electrical conductors carrying voltages greater than 46 kV but not exceeding 69 kV, or conform to the requirements of CAN/CSA-C22.3 No.1, "Overhead Systems", for electrical conductors carrying voltages greater than 69 kV.
ON Variations: The horizontal clearance measured from the maximum conductor swing to the building, including balconies, fire escapes, flat roofs or other accessible projections beyond the face of the building, shall, be not less than 1 m, for electrical conductors carrying voltages 750 V or less, except where necessary to connect to the electrical wiring of the building, be not less than 3 m, for electrical conductors carrying voltages greater than 750 V but not exceeding 46 kV, be not less than 3.7 m, for electrical conductors carrying voltages greater than 46 kV but not exceeding 69 kV, or conform to the requirements of CAN/CSA-C22.3 No.1, "Overhead Systems", for electrical conductors carrying voltages greater than 69 kV.

ON Full: Municipal and private hydrants shall be maintained in operating condition.
ON Variations: Municipal and private hydrants shall be maintained in operating condition.

ON Full: Connections to storage tanks through which liquid can flow shall be provided with valves located as close as practical to the tank.
ON Variations: Connections to storage tanks through which liquid can flow shall be provided with valves located as close as practical to the tank.

ON Full: A daily check of the temperature of the tank enclosure for tanks in buildings shall be carried out during freezing weather to ensure that the temperature of the tank enclosure does not fall below 0°C.
ON Variations: A daily check of the temperature of the tank enclosure for tanks in buildings shall be carried out during freezing weather to ensure that the temperature of the tank enclosure does not fall below 0°C.

ON Full: Refuse burners or incinerators referred to in Article 3.2.2.17. shall be located at least 15 m from buildings, property lines or piles of logs or lumber.
ON Variations: Refuse burners or incinerators referred to in Article 3.2.2.17. shall be located at least 15 m from buildings, property lines or piles of logs or lumber.

ON Full: This Article applies to rental suites.
ON Variations: This Article applies to rental suites.

ON Full: The substrate on which an exterior insulation finish system is installed shall,(a) be compatible with that particular system, and (See Appendix A.) (b) comply with the structural requirements for sheathing materials set out in Section 9.23.
ON Variations: The substrate on which an exterior insulation finish system is installed shall,(a) be compatible with that particular system, and (See Appendix A.) (b) comply with the structural requirements for sheathing materials set out in Section 9.23.

ON Full: In addition to the procedures described in Sentences (1) and (2), elevators in an elevator shaft that is intended for use as a smoke shaft shall be inspected semi-annually to ensure that on activation of the fire alarm system they will return to the street floor and remain inoperative.
ON Variations: In addition to the procedures described in Sentences (1) and (2), elevators in an elevator shaft that is intended for use as a smoke shaft shall be inspected semi-annually to ensure that on activation of the fire alarm system they will return to the street floor and remain inoperative.

ON Full: When there is a change in size of a lead closet bend, the change shall be in the vertical section of the bend or made in such a manner that there shall be no retention of liquid in the bend.
ON Variations: When there is a change in size of a lead closet bend, the change shall be in the vertical section of the bend or made in such a manner that there shall be no retention of liquid in the bend.

ON Full: Piping systems referred to in Sentence 4.4.6.1.(3) shall be considered to be leaking when the test indicates a pressure drop or a volume loss within a 2 h period after steady temperature conditions have been established and the source of pressure had been removed.
ON Variations: Piping systems referred to in Sentence 4.4.6.1.(3) shall be considered to be leaking when the test indicates a pressure drop or a volume loss within a 2 h period after steady temperature conditions have been established and the source of pressure had been removed.

ON Full: Except as permitted in Sentence (3), a room containing plumbing fixtures for the public and employees in a restaurant shall be located in the restaurant.
ON Variations: Except as permitted in Sentence (3), a room containing plumbing fixtures for the public and employees in a restaurant shall be located in the restaurant.

ON Full: If, on December 31, 2014, any appliance, equipment, system, installation or construction met the requirements of the edition that was designated in Table 1.2.1.A. of this Code as it read on December 31, 2014, the appliance, equipment, system, installation or construction is deemed to comply with the requirements of the edition referred to in Sentence (1).
ON Variations: If, on December 31, 2014, any appliance, equipment, system, installation or construction met the requirements of the edition that was designated in Table 1.2.1.A. of this Code as it read on December 31, 2014, the appliance, equipment, system, installation or construction is deemed to comply with the requirements of the edition referred to in Sentence (1).

ON Full: Fire access routes and access panels or windows provided to facilitate access for fire fighting operations shall not be obstructed by vehicles, gates, fences, building materials, vegetation, signs or any other form of obstruction.
ON Variations: Fire access routes and access panels or windows provided to facilitate access for fire fighting operations shall not be obstructed by vehicles, gates, fences, building materials, vegetation, signs or any other form of obstruction.

ON Full: Except as permitted in Sentence (4), the sprinkler system shall be subjected to a hydrostatic pressure test of a minimum of 1400 kPa (gauge), or 350 kPa (gauge) in excess of the maximum static pressure to which the system may be subjected, for a period of 2 h without loss of pressure.
ON Variations: Except as permitted in Sentence (4), the sprinkler system shall be subjected to a hydrostatic pressure test of a minimum of 1400 kPa (gauge), or 350 kPa (gauge) in excess of the maximum static pressure to which the system may be subjected, for a period of 2 h without loss of pressure.

ON Full: This Part applies to all buildings covered in this Code.
ON Variations: This Part applies to all buildings covered in this Code.

ON Full: Where a Class B pool is constructed for use solely in conjunction with an establishment or institution for the treatment of persons with disabilities or persons who are ill, the pool shall be exempt from the requirements of Sentences (6) and (7), Clause (9)(a) and Sentences (13) and (14).
ON Variations: Where a Class B pool is constructed for use solely in conjunction with an establishment or institution for the treatment of persons with disabilities or persons who are ill, the pool shall be exempt from the requirements of Sentences (6) and (7), Clause (9)(a) and Sentences (13) and (14).

ON Full: Where practical, valves referred to in Sentence (1) shall be located outdoors or be immediately accessible from outdoors.
ON Variations: Where practical, valves referred to in Sentence (1) shall be located outdoors or be immediately accessible from outdoors.

ON Full: Electromagnetic locks are permitted to be installed on an exit door that serves only a gaming premises if, the gaming premises is located within a sprinklered floor area, smoke detectors are installed in each room and each corridor accessible to the public, a force of not more than 90 N applied to the door opening hardware initiates an irreversible process that will release the locking device within 15 s and not relock until the door has been opened, and a legible sign conforming with Clause (4)(h) is permanently mounted on the exit door to indicate that the locking device will release within 15 s of applying pressure to the door release hardware.
ON Variations: Electromagnetic locks are permitted to be installed on an exit door that serves only a gaming premises if, the gaming premises is located within a sprinklered floor area, smoke detectors are installed in each room and each corridor accessible to the public, a force of not more than 90 N applied to the door opening hardware initiates an irreversible process that will release the locking device within 15 s and not relock until the door has been opened, and a legible sign conforming with Clause (4)(h) is permanently mounted on the exit door to indicate that the locking device will release within 15 s of applying pressure to the door release hardware.

ON Full: Where the installation of heating supply ducts in walls and floors creates a space between the duct and construction material, the space shall be fire stopped with noncombustible material at each end.
ON Variations: Where the installation of heating supply ducts in walls and floors creates a space between the duct and construction material, the space shall be fire stopped with noncombustible material at each end.

ON Full: This Part applies to resource conservation and environmental integrity in the design and construction of buildings.
ON Variations: This Part applies to resource conservation and environmental integrity in the design and construction of buildings.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (4), fill beneath floors-on-ground shall be compacted.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (4), fill beneath floors-on-ground shall be compacted.

ON Full: Every existing building or part of it shall be classified according to its major occupancy in accordance with the requirements of Subsection 3.1.2.
ON Variations: Every existing building or part of it shall be classified according to its major occupancy in accordance with the requirements of Subsection 3.1.2.

ON Full: Where a fire alarm system is monitored to transmit a signal to the fire department, the owner shall record whether all signals from the tests conducted in Sentence (1), or other events, are received by the monitoring station, and records shall be kept in accordance with Subsection 1.1.2.
ON Variations: Where a fire alarm system is monitored to transmit a signal to the fire department, the owner shall record whether all signals from the tests conducted in Sentence (1), or other events, are received by the monitoring station, and records shall be kept in accordance with Subsection 1.1.2.

ON Full: All buildings shall conform to the water efficiency requirements of Subsection 7.6.4.
ON Variations: All buildings shall conform to the water efficiency requirements of Subsection 7.6.4.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (4), glass in entrance doors to houses or individual dwelling units and in public areas, other than the entrance doors described in Sentence (1), shall be safety glass or wired glass of the type described in Sentence (1) where the glass area exceeds 0.5 m2 and extends to less than 900 mm from the bottom of the door.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (4), glass in entrance doors to houses or individual dwelling units and in public areas, other than the entrance doors described in Sentence (1), shall be safety glass or wired glass of the type described in Sentence (1) where the glass area exceeds 0.5 m2 and extends to less than 900 mm from the bottom of the door.

ON Full: Floor finishing operations involving the use of flammable liquids shall not be performed below grade.
ON Variations: Floor finishing operations involving the use of flammable liquids shall not be performed below grade.

ON Full: Stiff elements that are not considered part of the SFRS, such as concrete, masonry, brick or pre-cast walls or panels, shall be, (a) separated from all structural elements of the building such that no interaction takes place as the building undergoes deflections due to earthquake effects as calculated in this Subsection, or (b) made part of the SFRS and satisfy the requirements of this Subsection. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Stiff elements that are not considered part of the SFRS, such as concrete, masonry, brick or pre-cast walls or panels, shall be, (a) separated from all structural elements of the building such that no interaction takes place as the building undergoes deflections due to earthquake effects as calculated in this Subsection, or (b) made part of the SFRS and satisfy the requirements of this Subsection. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: A public spa shall be equipped with a water circulation system that is capable of both completely and partially draining and refilling the public spa water.
ON Variations: A public spa shall be equipped with a water circulation system that is capable of both completely and partially draining and refilling the public spa water.

ON Full: Sheathing membrane required in Sentence (1) shall be applied so that joints are lapped not less than 100 mm.
ON Variations: Sheathing membrane required in Sentence (1) shall be applied so that joints are lapped not less than 100 mm.

ON Full: Where the bottom wall plate or sole plate of an exterior wall is not nailed to joists or blocking in conformance with Table 9.23.3.4., the exterior wall may be fastened to the floor framing by,(a) having plywood, OSB or waferboard sheathing extend down over floor framing and fastened to the floor framing by nails or staples conforming to Article 9.23.3.5., or (b) tying the wall framing to the floor framing by 50 mm wide galvanized-metal strips, (i) not less than 0.41 mm in thickness, (ii) spaced not more than 1.2 m apart, and (iii) fastened at each end with at least two 63 mm nails.
ON Variations: Where the bottom wall plate or sole plate of an exterior wall is not nailed to joists or blocking in conformance with Table 9.23.3.4., the exterior wall may be fastened to the floor framing by,(a) having plywood, OSB or waferboard sheathing extend down over floor framing and fastened to the floor framing by nails or staples conforming to Article 9.23.3.5., or (b) tying the wall framing to the floor framing by 50 mm wide galvanized-metal strips, (i) not less than 0.41 mm in thickness, (ii) spaced not more than 1.2 m apart, and (iii) fastened at each end with at least two 63 mm nails.

ON Full: A diving board or diving platform greater in height than 3 m above the water surface shall be equipped with a gate, barrier or other device capable of preventing access to the diving board or diving platform.
ON Variations: A diving board or diving platform greater in height than 3 m above the water surface shall be equipped with a gate, barrier or other device capable of preventing access to the diving board or diving platform.

ON Full: Aisles and other access paths shall be maintained to permit the unobstructed movement of personnel and fire department apparatus so that fire fighting operations can be carried out in any part of an area used for the storage, use or handling of flammable liquids or combustible liquids.
ON Variations: Aisles and other access paths shall be maintained to permit the unobstructed movement of personnel and fire department apparatus so that fire fighting operations can be carried out in any part of an area used for the storage, use or handling of flammable liquids or combustible liquids.

ON Full: Flashing required in Sentence (1) shall be installed so that it extends up the wall not less than 75 mm behind the sheathing paper, and extends not less than 75 mm horizontally.
ON Variations: Flashing required in Sentence (1) shall be installed so that it extends up the wall not less than 75 mm behind the sheathing paper, and extends not less than 75 mm horizontally.

ON Full: For the purpose of using Table 9.10.15.4. to determine the maximum permitted area of glazed openings in an irregularly-shaped or skewed exterior wall, the location of the exposing building face shall be taken as a vertical plane located so that there are no glazed openings between the vertical plane and the line to which the limiting distance is measured.
ON Variations: For the purpose of using Table 9.10.15.4. to determine the maximum permitted area of glazed openings in an irregularly-shaped or skewed exterior wall, the location of the exposing building face shall be taken as a vertical plane located so that there are no glazed openings between the vertical plane and the line to which the limiting distance is measured.
