ON Variations: A privy as described in Subsections 8.3.3. to 8.3.5. shall be enclosed with a superstructure that,(a) is constructed of strong durable weatherproof materials, (b) has a solid floor supported by a sill constructed of treated timber, masonry or other material of at least equal strength and durability, (c) is easily sanitized, (d) unless it is equipped solely as a urinal, is equipped with one or more seats each having a cover and being supported by an enclosed bench or riser that is lined with an impervious material on all interior vertical surfaces, (e) is equipped with a self-closing door, (f) has one or more openings for purposes of ventilation, all of which are screened, (g) has a ventilation duct that is screened at the top end and that extends from the underside of the bench or riser to a point above the roof of the superstructure, and (h) shall not have any openings for the reception of human body waste, other than urinals and those constructed in accordance with Clause (1)(d).

ON Full: No part of a leaching bed shall be sloped steeper than 1 unit vertically to 4 units horizontally.
ON Variations: No part of a leaching bed shall be sloped steeper than 1 unit vertically to 4 units horizontally.

ON Full: Passenger elevators shall conform to Appendix E of ASME A17.1 / CSA B44, "Safety Code for Elevators and Escalators".
ON Variations: Passenger elevators shall conform to Appendix E of ASME A17.1 / CSA B44, "Safety Code for Elevators and Escalators".

ON Full: In this Subsection, a converging aisle is an aisle into which the occupants of two or more aisles converge in travelling to an exit.
ON Variations: In this Subsection, a converging aisle is an aisle into which the occupants of two or more aisles converge in travelling to an exit.

ON Full: Where flammable liquids or combustible liquids are stored, storage shall be in conformance with Subsections 4.2.4. to 4.2.11.
ON Variations: Where flammable liquids or combustible liquids are stored, storage shall be in conformance with Subsections 4.2.4. to 4.2.11.

ON Full: No plumbing serving a dwelling unit shall be installed in or under another unit of the building unless the piping is located in a tunnel, pipe corridor, common basement or parking garage, so that the piping is accessible for servicing and maintenance throughout its length without encroachment on any private living space, but this Sentence does not prevent plumbing serving a unit located above another unit from being installed in or under the lower unit.
ON Variations: No plumbing serving a dwelling unit shall be installed in or under another unit of the building unless the piping is located in a tunnel, pipe corridor, common basement or parking garage, so that the piping is accessible for servicing and maintenance throughout its length without encroachment on any private living space, but this Sentence does not prevent plumbing serving a unit located above another unit from being installed in or under the lower unit.

ON Full: In the vault ventilation system in Sentence (10), the inlet for fresh air shall lead from an outdoor area and shall terminate at a point not more than 1 000 mm above the floor level of the vault.
ON Variations: In the vault ventilation system in Sentence (10), the inlet for fresh air shall lead from an outdoor area and shall terminate at a point not more than 1 000 mm above the floor level of the vault.

ON Full: A telephone accessible for emergency use shall be installed for every Class B pool within 30 m of the pool.
ON Variations: A telephone accessible for emergency use shall be installed for every Class B pool within 30 m of the pool.

ON Full: Weeds, grass and similar vegetation shall be removed from the yard.
ON Variations: Weeds, grass and similar vegetation shall be removed from the yard.

ON Full: An exhaust system shall not serve an operation that generates sparks or combustible vapours.
ON Variations: An exhaust system shall not serve an operation that generates sparks or combustible vapours.

ON Full: Conveyor systems utilized in conjunction with dip tanks shall be designed to stop automatically with the actuation of an automatic fixed extinguishing system or a manual fire alarm.
ON Variations: Conveyor systems utilized in conjunction with dip tanks shall be designed to stop automatically with the actuation of an automatic fixed extinguishing system or a manual fire alarm.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (4), every glass or transparent door accessible to the public shall be equipped with hardware, bars or other permanent fixtures designed so that the existence and position of such doors is readily apparent.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (4), every glass or transparent door accessible to the public shall be equipped with hardware, bars or other permanent fixtures designed so that the existence and position of such doors is readily apparent.

ON Full: Wall studs that support only a load from an attic not accessible by a stairway are permitted to be placed on the flat within the limits permitted in Article 9.23.10.1. provided, (a) the studs are clad on at least one side with plywood, OSB or waferboard sheathing fastened to the face of the studs with a structural adhesive, and (b) the portion of the roof supported by the studs does not exceed 2.1 m in width.
ON Variations: Wall studs that support only a load from an attic not accessible by a stairway are permitted to be placed on the flat within the limits permitted in Article 9.23.10.1. provided, (a) the studs are clad on at least one side with plywood, OSB or waferboard sheathing fastened to the face of the studs with a structural adhesive, and (b) the portion of the roof supported by the studs does not exceed 2.1 m in width.

ON Full: Except as provided in Article 9.27.3.6., where no sheathing is used, at least two layers of sheathing membrane shall be applied beneath the cladding. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Except as provided in Article 9.27.3.6., where no sheathing is used, at least two layers of sheathing membrane shall be applied beneath the cladding. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Where two or more tanks are used to meet the requirement of Sentence (2), they shall be deemed to be one holding tank provided they are connected in such a manner as will allow the sanitary sewage contained in them to flow between the tanks.
ON Variations: Where two or more tanks are used to meet the requirement of Sentence (2), they shall be deemed to be one holding tank provided they are connected in such a manner as will allow the sanitary sewage contained in them to flow between the tanks.

ON Full: Chimney liners used in chimneys for oil- or gas-burning appliances shall be laid in a full bed of mortar consisting of one part Portland cement to three parts sand by volume.
ON Variations: Chimney liners used in chimneys for oil- or gas-burning appliances shall be laid in a full bed of mortar consisting of one part Portland cement to three parts sand by volume.

ON Full: Suites of residential occupancy are permitted to be equipped with smoke detectors in lieu of smoke alarms, provided the smoke detectors, (a) are capable of independently sounding audible signals within the individual suites, (b) except as provided by Sentence (4), are installed in conformance with CAN/ULC-S524, "Installation of Fire Alarm Systems", and (c) form part of the fire alarm system.
ON Variations: Suites of residential occupancy are permitted to be equipped with smoke detectors in lieu of smoke alarms, provided the smoke detectors, (a) are capable of independently sounding audible signals within the individual suites, (b) except as provided by Sentence (4), are installed in conformance with CAN/ULC-S524, "Installation of Fire Alarm Systems", and (c) form part of the fire alarm system.

ON Full: Tanks, other than tanks supplied by a potable water supply, shall be inspected for accumulations of sediment at least every two years and cleaned as required.
ON Variations: Tanks, other than tanks supplied by a potable water supply, shall be inspected for accumulations of sediment at least every two years and cleaned as required.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentences (2) and (3), for the purposes of this Subsection, travel distance means the distance from any point in the floor area to an exit measured along the path of exit travel.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentences (2) and (3), for the purposes of this Subsection, travel distance means the distance from any point in the floor area to an exit measured along the path of exit travel.

ON Full: Work stations in Article 5.14.5.2. shall have no source of ignition located within 6 m horizontally of the work area or in the area above it.
ON Variations: Work stations in Article 5.14.5.2. shall have no source of ignition located within 6 m horizontally of the work area or in the area above it.

ON Full: If a fire alarm system in a building is required by Sentence 3.2.4.9.(1) to have an annunciator, each valve controlling water supplies in a standpipe system, except for hose valves, shall be equipped with an electrically supervised switch for transmitting a trouble signal to the annunciator in the event of movement of the valve handle.
ON Variations: If a fire alarm system in a building is required by Sentence 3.2.4.9.(1) to have an annunciator, each valve controlling water supplies in a standpipe system, except for hose valves, shall be equipped with an electrically supervised switch for transmitting a trouble signal to the annunciator in the event of movement of the valve handle.

ON Full: Except as otherwise provided in this Part, fire protection equipment and life safety systems shall not be decommissioned or permanently taken out of service without approval.
ON Variations: Except as otherwise provided in this Part, fire protection equipment and life safety systems shall not be decommissioned or permanently taken out of service without approval.

ON Full: A separate lavatory for the handwashing of employees shall be constructed in a location convenient for employees in each manufacturing, processing and preparation area.
ON Variations: A separate lavatory for the handwashing of employees shall be constructed in a location convenient for employees in each manufacturing, processing and preparation area.

ON Full: Automobile undercoating materials shall have a flash point of not less than 37.8°C.
ON Variations: Automobile undercoating materials shall have a flash point of not less than 37.8°C.

ON Full: A building referred to in Sentence (1), shall be designed so that, during a period of 2 h after the start of a fire, each exit stair serving storeys below the lowest exit level will not contain more than 1% by volume of contaminated air from the fire floor, assuming an outdoor temperature equal to the January design temperature on a 2.5% basis determined in conformance with MMAH Supplementary Standard SB-1, "Climatic and Seismic Data".
ON Variations: A building referred to in Sentence (1), shall be designed so that, during a period of 2 h after the start of a fire, each exit stair serving storeys below the lowest exit level will not contain more than 1% by volume of contaminated air from the fire floor, assuming an outdoor temperature equal to the January design temperature on a 2.5% basis determined in conformance with MMAH Supplementary Standard SB-1, "Climatic and Seismic Data".

ON Full: If a fire-retardant treated wood roof system is used to comply with the requirements of Subsection 3.2.2., the roof deck assembly shall meet the conditions of acceptance of CAN/ULC-S126, "Test for Fire Spread Under Roof-Deck Assemblies".
ON Variations: If a fire-retardant treated wood roof system is used to comply with the requirements of Subsection 3.2.2., the roof deck assembly shall meet the conditions of acceptance of CAN/ULC-S126, "Test for Fire Spread Under Roof-Deck Assemblies".

ON Full: Horizontal exits conforming to Sentence (4) may provide all of the required egress capacity from a rapid transit station.
ON Variations: Horizontal exits conforming to Sentence (4) may provide all of the required egress capacity from a rapid transit station.

ON Full: Medical gas piping systems shall conform to Subsection 3.7.5.
ON Variations: Medical gas piping systems shall conform to Subsection 3.7.5.

ON Full: Where it is not practicable to support piping as required in Sentence (1) on undisturbed soil, it shall be supported on not less than 150 mm of clean sand, pea gravel or washed, crushed stone.
ON Variations: Where it is not practicable to support piping as required in Sentence (1) on undisturbed soil, it shall be supported on not less than 150 mm of clean sand, pea gravel or washed, crushed stone.

ON Full: This Article applies to a mechanical ventilation system in a dwelling unit that,(a) does not contain a forced air heating system, or (b) contains a forced air heating system which is not used for circulation of the ventilation air.
ON Variations: This Article applies to a mechanical ventilation system in a dwelling unit that,(a) does not contain a forced air heating system, or (b) contains a forced air heating system which is not used for circulation of the ventilation air.

ON Full: Flights shall consist solely of, straight flights, or curved flights complying with Sentence (2).
ON Variations: Flights shall consist solely of, straight flights, or curved flights complying with Sentence (2).

ON Full: The fire-resistance rating of the fire separation referred to in Sentence (1) need not be more than 2 h.
ON Variations: The fire-resistance rating of the fire separation referred to in Sentence (1) need not be more than 2 h.

ON Full: Except as permitted by Articles 3.1.9.3. and 3.1.9.4., pipes, ducts, electrical outlet boxes, totally enclosed raceways or other similar service equipment that penetrate an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating shall be noncombustible unless the assembly has been tested incorporating that service equipment. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Except as permitted by Articles 3.1.9.3. and 3.1.9.4., pipes, ducts, electrical outlet boxes, totally enclosed raceways or other similar service equipment that penetrate an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating shall be noncombustible unless the assembly has been tested incorporating that service equipment. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (3), a vapour barrier shall be installed to provide the principal resistance to water vapour diffusion.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (3), a vapour barrier shall be installed to provide the principal resistance to water vapour diffusion.

ON Full: A washroom described in Sentence 3.8.2.3.(6) shall be provided with a lavatory conforming to Clauses (1)(e), (g) and (h).
ON Variations: A washroom described in Sentence 3.8.2.3.(6) shall be provided with a lavatory conforming to Clauses (1)(e), (g) and (h).

ON Full: Brazing alloys shall conform to ANSI/AWS A5.8M / A5.8, "Filler Metals for Brazing and Brazed Welding", BCuP range.
ON Variations: Brazing alloys shall conform to ANSI/AWS A5.8M / A5.8, "Filler Metals for Brazing and Brazed Welding", BCuP range.

ON Full: A second means of egress as required by Sentence 3.13.4.3.(1) is permitted to be not less than 1 100 mm wide.
ON Variations: A second means of egress as required by Sentence 3.13.4.3.(1) is permitted to be not less than 1 100 mm wide.

ON Full: Areas where cellulose nitrate plastic finished products are stored shall be ventilated so that any decomposition gases produced by the plastics will be vented outdoors to an area where they will not re-enter the building.
ON Variations: Areas where cellulose nitrate plastic finished products are stored shall be ventilated so that any decomposition gases produced by the plastics will be vented outdoors to an area where they will not re-enter the building.

ON Full: No compression fitting connecting to plain end pipe or tube shall be used in a plumbing system unless the pipe or tube and fittings are sufficiently stayed, clamped, anchored or buttressed so as to prevent separation during normal service of the system allowing for surge pressures.
ON Variations: No compression fitting connecting to plain end pipe or tube shall be used in a plumbing system unless the pipe or tube and fittings are sufficiently stayed, clamped, anchored or buttressed so as to prevent separation during normal service of the system allowing for surge pressures.

ON Full: Portable extinguishers shall be replaced or recharged after use in conformance with instructions given on the extinguisher nameplate.
ON Variations: Portable extinguishers shall be replaced or recharged after use in conformance with instructions given on the extinguisher nameplate.

ON Full: This Part applies to high buildings as described in Article 3.2.6.1. of Division B of the Building Code.
ON Variations: This Part applies to high buildings as described in Article 3.2.6.1. of Division B of the Building Code.

ON Full: Despite Sentence (1), if, on July 1, 2018, fire department connection piping has not been hydrostatically tested within the previous five years, the first test required by Sentence (1) shall be completed before January 1, 2019.
ON Variations: Despite Sentence (1), if, on July 1, 2018, fire department connection piping has not been hydrostatically tested within the previous five years, the first test required by Sentence (1) shall be completed before January 1, 2019.

ON Full: Where a water closet is located in accordance with Clause (2)(a), a grab bar conforming to Sentences (5) and (7) shall be provided on the side wall referred to in Subclause (2)(a)(i), a fold-down grab bar may be provided and, if one is provided, it shall conform to Sentence (8) and be provided on the side of the water closet opposite the grab bar described in Clause (a), and a grab bar conforming to Sentences (6) and (7) shall be provided on the wall behind the water closet.
ON Variations: Where a water closet is located in accordance with Clause (2)(a), a grab bar conforming to Sentences (5) and (7) shall be provided on the side wall referred to in Subclause (2)(a)(i), a fold-down grab bar may be provided and, if one is provided, it shall conform to Sentence (8) and be provided on the side of the water closet opposite the grab bar described in Clause (a), and a grab bar conforming to Sentences (6) and (7) shall be provided on the wall behind the water closet.

ON Full: The distribution pipes shall be spaced not more than 1.2 m apart with the outermost pipe spaced not more than 600 mm from the edge of the bed.
ON Variations: The distribution pipes shall be spaced not more than 1.2 m apart with the outermost pipe spaced not more than 600 mm from the edge of the bed.

ON Full: The storage facilities shall be ventilated and shall be equipped with a water hose connection and a floor drain.
ON Variations: The storage facilities shall be ventilated and shall be equipped with a water hose connection and a floor drain.

ON Full: Where sheet steel is required to be galvanized, it shall be metallic-coated with zinc or an alloy of 55% aluminum-zinc meeting the requirements of,(a) ASTM A653 / A653M, "Steel Sheet, Zinc-Coated (Galvanized) or Zinc-Iron Alloy-Coated (Galvannealed) by the Hot-Dip Process", or (b) ASTM A792 / A792M, "Sheet Steel, 55% Aluminum-Zinc Alloy-Coated by the Hot-Dip Process".
ON Variations: Where sheet steel is required to be galvanized, it shall be metallic-coated with zinc or an alloy of 55% aluminum-zinc meeting the requirements of,(a) ASTM A653 / A653M, "Steel Sheet, Zinc-Coated (Galvanized) or Zinc-Iron Alloy-Coated (Galvannealed) by the Hot-Dip Process", or (b) ASTM A792 / A792M, "Sheet Steel, 55% Aluminum-Zinc Alloy-Coated by the Hot-Dip Process".

ON Full: This Section applies to,(a) glass in, (i) interior windows and interior doors and their sidelights, (ii) clothes closets, (iii) site-built exterior windows, doors and skylights, (iv) shower or bathtub enclosures, (v) glazed panels and partitions, and (b) the protection of glass.
ON Variations: This Section applies to,(a) glass in, (i) interior windows and interior doors and their sidelights, (ii) clothes closets, (iii) site-built exterior windows, doors and skylights, (iv) shower or bathtub enclosures, (v) glazed panels and partitions, and (b) the protection of glass.

ON Full: An aisle shall terminate at, a converging aisle, an egress doorway from the seating area, or an exit from the seating area.
ON Variations: An aisle shall terminate at, a converging aisle, an egress doorway from the seating area, or an exit from the seating area.

ON Full: Approved signs shall be displayed to indicate fire access routes.
ON Variations: Approved signs shall be displayed to indicate fire access routes.

ON Full: Wood used in foundations or in support of soil or rock shall conform to the appropriate requirements of Subsection 4.3.1.
ON Variations: Wood used in foundations or in support of soil or rock shall conform to the appropriate requirements of Subsection 4.3.1.

ON Full: Piping connections for drains and overflow lines shall be designed so as to allow for easy access to their interiors for cleaning purposes.
ON Variations: Piping connections for drains and overflow lines shall be designed so as to allow for easy access to their interiors for cleaning purposes.

ON Full: Openings through any guard that is required by Sentences (2) and (3) shall be of a size that will prevent the passage of a sphere having a diameter more than 300 mm.
ON Variations: Openings through any guard that is required by Sentences (2) and (3) shall be of a size that will prevent the passage of a sphere having a diameter more than 300 mm.

ON Full: When transfer operations are completed, the valves on the hose connections shall be closed, and unless the cargo hose is equipped with a device that automatically prevents liquid from draining from the hose upon disconnection of the hose, the hose shall be drained so as to not create a fire or explosion hazard.
ON Variations: When transfer operations are completed, the valves on the hose connections shall be closed, and unless the cargo hose is equipped with a device that automatically prevents liquid from draining from the hose upon disconnection of the hose, the hose shall be drained so as to not create a fire or explosion hazard.

ON Full: This Section applies to the energy efficiency of a building or part of a building of residential occupancy that is within the scope of Part 9 and is intended for occupancy on a continuing basis during the winter months.
ON Variations: This Section applies to the energy efficiency of a building or part of a building of residential occupancy that is within the scope of Part 9 and is intended for occupancy on a continuing basis during the winter months.

ON Full: A voice communication system referred to in Sentence (1) that is installed in a building that is not intended to be staffed, at times when the building will be occupied, with persons trained to provide instructions over the system shall include a pre-recorded message.
ON Variations: A voice communication system referred to in Sentence (1) that is installed in a building that is not intended to be staffed, at times when the building will be occupied, with persons trained to provide instructions over the system shall include a pre-recorded message.

ON Full: The areas of rooms in dwelling units, dormitories, boarding houses and rooming houses shall conform to Part 9.
ON Variations: The areas of rooms in dwelling units, dormitories, boarding houses and rooming houses shall conform to Part 9.

ON Full: Branch ducts shall be supported at suitable spacings to maintain alignment and prevent sagging.
ON Variations: Branch ducts shall be supported at suitable spacings to maintain alignment and prevent sagging.

ON Full: Live/work units shall be mechanically ventilated in accordance with the requirements of Sentence (1).
ON Variations: Live/work units shall be mechanically ventilated in accordance with the requirements of Sentence (1).

ON Full: Where a vent pipe terminates above the surface of a roof, it shall be supported or braced to prevent misalignment.
ON Variations: Where a vent pipe terminates above the surface of a roof, it shall be supported or braced to prevent misalignment.

ON Full: Flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall not be stored in or adjacent to exits, including outdoors, elevators or principal routes that provide access to exits.
ON Variations: Flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall not be stored in or adjacent to exits, including outdoors, elevators or principal routes that provide access to exits.

ON Full: Fixture drains from fixtures that are listed in Subclauses 7.4.2.1.(1)(d)(i) and (ii) may be directly connected to a pipe that,(a) is terminated to form an air break above the flood level rim of a fixture that is directly connected to a sanitary drainage system, and (b) is extended through the roof when fixtures that are on 3 or more storeys are connected to it.
ON Variations: Fixture drains from fixtures that are listed in Subclauses 7.4.2.1.(1)(d)(i) and (ii) may be directly connected to a pipe that,(a) is terminated to form an air break above the flood level rim of a fixture that is directly connected to a sanitary drainage system, and (b) is extended through the roof when fixtures that are on 3 or more storeys are connected to it.

ON Full: Where mineral fibre insulation, crushed rock backfill or other drainage layer medium is provided adjacent to the exterior surface of a foundation wall,(a) the insulation, backfill or other drainage layer medium shall extend to the footing level to facilitate drainage of ground water to the foundation drainage system, and (b) any pyritic material in the crushed rock shall be limited to a concentration that will not damage the building to a degree that would adversely affect its stability or the performance of assemblies separating dissimilar environments.
ON Variations: Where mineral fibre insulation, crushed rock backfill or other drainage layer medium is provided adjacent to the exterior surface of a foundation wall,(a) the insulation, backfill or other drainage layer medium shall extend to the footing level to facilitate drainage of ground water to the foundation drainage system, and (b) any pyritic material in the crushed rock shall be limited to a concentration that will not damage the building to a degree that would adversely affect its stability or the performance of assemblies separating dissimilar environments.

ON Full: A cleanout serving a fixture in health care facilities, mortuaries, laboratories and similar occupancies, where contamination by body fluids is likely, shall be located a minimum of 150 mm above the flood level rim of the fixture.
ON Variations: A cleanout serving a fixture in health care facilities, mortuaries, laboratories and similar occupancies, where contamination by body fluids is likely, shall be located a minimum of 150 mm above the flood level rim of the fixture.

ON Full: Where the sump or tank receives sanitary sewage it shall be water and air-tight and shall be vented.
ON Variations: Where the sump or tank receives sanitary sewage it shall be water and air-tight and shall be vented.

ON Full: Except as provided in Article 4.1.8.18., the structural loads referred to in Sentence (1) and their related effects shall include,(a) dead loads transferred from structural elements, (b) wind, snow, rain, hydrostatic and earth pressures, (c) earthquake effects for post-disaster buildings, depending on their intended function, (See Appendix A.) (d) live loads due to use and occupancy, and (e) loads due to thermal or moisture-related expansion and contraction, deflection, deformation, creep, shrinkage, settlement, and differential movement.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Article 4.1.8.18., the structural loads referred to in Sentence (1) and their related effects shall include,(a) dead loads transferred from structural elements, (b) wind, snow, rain, hydrostatic and earth pressures, (c) earthquake effects for post-disaster buildings, depending on their intended function, (See Appendix A.) (d) live loads due to use and occupancy, and (e) loads due to thermal or moisture-related expansion and contraction, deflection, deformation, creep, shrinkage, settlement, and differential movement.

ON Full: Metal-framed glazed assemblies need not comply with Sentence (2) where these assemblies are, (a) storm windows or doors, or (b) windows or doors that are required to have a fire-protection rating. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Metal-framed glazed assemblies need not comply with Sentence (2) where these assemblies are, (a) storm windows or doors, or (b) windows or doors that are required to have a fire-protection rating. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Every interior leader shall be provided with a cleanout fitting at the bottom of the leader or not more than 1 000 mm upstream from the bottom of the leader.
ON Variations: Every interior leader shall be provided with a cleanout fitting at the bottom of the leader or not more than 1 000 mm upstream from the bottom of the leader.

ON Full: Plumbing fixtures need not be provided in a building that is not normally occupied by persons where such installations are impractical and other fixtures are available in nearby buildings when the subject building is in use.
ON Variations: Plumbing fixtures need not be provided in a building that is not normally occupied by persons where such installations are impractical and other fixtures are available in nearby buildings when the subject building is in use.

ON Full: Portable extinguishers suitable for Class C fires shall be provided in or near service rooms containing electrical equipment.
ON Variations: Portable extinguishers suitable for Class C fires shall be provided in or near service rooms containing electrical equipment.

ON Full: The occupant load of a room in which a dance floor is situated shall be calculated in respect of that portion of the room that is not occupied by the dance floor.
ON Variations: The occupant load of a room in which a dance floor is situated shall be calculated in respect of that portion of the room that is not occupied by the dance floor.

ON Full: For each means of egress, the required egress capacity at the platform shall be maintained for the entire length of the means of egress.
ON Variations: For each means of egress, the required egress capacity at the platform shall be maintained for the entire length of the means of egress.

ON Full: For the purposes of Sentence (1), a retirement home is deemed to be a separate major occupancy.
ON Variations: For the purposes of Sentence (1), a retirement home is deemed to be a separate major occupancy.

ON Full: A fire safety plan shall be prepared, approved and implemented in buildings and premises to which this Section applies.
ON Variations: A fire safety plan shall be prepared, approved and implemented in buildings and premises to which this Section applies.

ON Full: A stack vent serving a wet vent stack that is over 4 storeys high shall extend the full size of the wet vent to open air.
ON Variations: A stack vent serving a wet vent stack that is over 4 storeys high shall extend the full size of the wet vent to open air.

ON Full: Pumps for piping systems shall be provided with duplicate control switches to shut down the pumps in case of emergency, with one located in the operating area and the other at a remote location.
ON Variations: Pumps for piping systems shall be provided with duplicate control switches to shut down the pumps in case of emergency, with one located in the operating area and the other at a remote location.

ON Full: A grab bar described in Clause (3)(c) or (4)(b) shall, be at least 600 mm in length, and be wall mounted horizontally from 840 mm to 920 mm above the finished floor and, where the water closet has a water tank, be wall mounted 150 mm above the tank.
ON Variations: A grab bar described in Clause (3)(c) or (4)(b) shall, be at least 600 mm in length, and be wall mounted horizontally from 840 mm to 920 mm above the finished floor and, where the water closet has a water tank, be wall mounted 150 mm above the tank.

ON Full: The requirements of Articles 3.2.2.20. to 3.2.2.83. do not apply to this Part.
ON Variations: The requirements of Articles 3.2.2.20. to 3.2.2.83. do not apply to this Part.

ON Full: Where a water test is made, all air shall be expelled from the system before fixture control valves or faucets are closed.
ON Variations: Where a water test is made, all air shall be expelled from the system before fixture control valves or faucets are closed.

ON Full: The joint connections used in trusses described in Sentence (1) shall be designed in conformance with the requirements in Subsection 4.3.1. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: The joint connections used in trusses described in Sentence (1) shall be designed in conformance with the requirements in Subsection 4.3.1. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Piping adjacent to railway tracks shall be installed in conformance with Flammable Liquids Bulk Storage Regulations made under the Canada Transportation Act.
ON Variations: Piping adjacent to railway tracks shall be installed in conformance with Flammable Liquids Bulk Storage Regulations made under the Canada Transportation Act.

ON Full: In an enclosed or underground station, the protection for the protected route shall consist of, a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, construction having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, or wired glass assemblies conforming to MMAH Supplementary Standard SB-2, "Fire Performance Ratings".
ON Variations: In an enclosed or underground station, the protection for the protected route shall consist of, a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, construction having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, or wired glass assemblies conforming to MMAH Supplementary Standard SB-2, "Fire Performance Ratings".

ON Full: Stainless steel fixtures shall conform to ASME A112.19.3 / CSA B45.4, "Stainless Steel Plumbing Fixtures".
ON Variations: Stainless steel fixtures shall conform to ASME A112.19.3 / CSA B45.4, "Stainless Steel Plumbing Fixtures".

ON Full: CPVC hot and cold water pipe, fittings and solvent cements shall be certified to CSA B137.6, "Chlorinated Polyvinylchloride (CPVC) Pipe, Tubing and Fittings for Hot and Cold Water Distribution Systems".
ON Variations: CPVC hot and cold water pipe, fittings and solvent cements shall be certified to CSA B137.6, "Chlorinated Polyvinylchloride (CPVC) Pipe, Tubing and Fittings for Hot and Cold Water Distribution Systems".

ON Full: Except for storm doors or screen doors, doors described in Sentence (1) that swing outward shall be provided with hinges or pins so that the doors cannot be removed when they are in the closed position. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Except for storm doors or screen doors, doors described in Sentence (1) that swing outward shall be provided with hinges or pins so that the doors cannot be removed when they are in the closed position. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Lateral deflections of elements or components shall be based on the loads defined in Sentence (1) and lateral deflections obtained from an elastic analysis shall be multiplied by Rp/IE to give realistic values of the anticipated deflections.
ON Variations: Lateral deflections of elements or components shall be based on the loads defined in Sentence (1) and lateral deflections obtained from an elastic analysis shall be multiplied by Rp/IE to give realistic values of the anticipated deflections.

ON Full: Subject to Subsection 4.4.10., flammable liquids and combustible liquids shall not be transferred by means of pressure applied to a container or storage tank.
ON Variations: Subject to Subsection 4.4.10., flammable liquids and combustible liquids shall not be transferred by means of pressure applied to a container or storage tank.

ON Full: In a building permitted to be of combustible construction, in a combustible roof system permitted by Sentence 3.1.5.3.(2), and in a raised platform permitted by Sentence 3.1.5.8.(2), fire blocks are permitted to be, solid lumber or a structural composite lumber product conforming to ASTM D5456, "Evaluation of Structural Composite Lumber Products", not less than 38 mm thick, phenolic bonded plywood, OSB or waferboard not less than 12.5 mm thick with joints supported, or two thicknesses of lumber or a structural composite lumber product conforming to ASTM D5456, "Evaluation of Structural Composite Lumber Products", each not less than 19 mm thick with joints staggered, where the width or height of the concealed space requires more than one piece of lumber or structural composite lumber product not less than 38 mm thick to block off the space.
ON Variations: In a building permitted to be of combustible construction, in a combustible roof system permitted by Sentence 3.1.5.3.(2), and in a raised platform permitted by Sentence 3.1.5.8.(2), fire blocks are permitted to be, solid lumber or a structural composite lumber product conforming to ASTM D5456, "Evaluation of Structural Composite Lumber Products", not less than 38 mm thick, phenolic bonded plywood, OSB or waferboard not less than 12.5 mm thick with joints supported, or two thicknesses of lumber or a structural composite lumber product conforming to ASTM D5456, "Evaluation of Structural Composite Lumber Products", each not less than 19 mm thick with joints staggered, where the width or height of the concealed space requires more than one piece of lumber or structural composite lumber product not less than 38 mm thick to block off the space.

ON Full: Where both hot and cold water is supplied to fixtures in a house containing only one dwelling unit, the water service pipe is permitted to be a minimum of ¾ in. in size provided,(a) a minimum ¾ in. water supply piping located in the basement or lower level is extended to the base of every hot and cold riser that serves a maximum of one bathroom group and to the last water supply branch serving any basement bathroom group, fixture supply or hose bibb, and (b) the total hydraulic load is not more than 26 fixture units, using the values given in Table 7.6.3.2.A.
ON Variations: Where both hot and cold water is supplied to fixtures in a house containing only one dwelling unit, the water service pipe is permitted to be a minimum of ¾ in. in size provided,(a) a minimum ¾ in. water supply piping located in the basement or lower level is extended to the base of every hot and cold riser that serves a maximum of one bathroom group and to the last water supply branch serving any basement bathroom group, fixture supply or hose bibb, and (b) the total hydraulic load is not more than 26 fixture units, using the values given in Table 7.6.3.2.A.

ON Full: Where water, snow or ice can accumulate on a building, provision shall be made to minimize the likelihood of hazardous conditions arising from such accumulation.
ON Variations: Where water, snow or ice can accumulate on a building, provision shall be made to minimize the likelihood of hazardous conditions arising from such accumulation.

ON Full: The thickness or rating of roof sheathing on a flat roof used as a walking deck shall conform to either Table 9.23.14.5.A. or Table 9.23.14.5.B. for subfloors.
ON Variations: The thickness or rating of roof sheathing on a flat roof used as a walking deck shall conform to either Table 9.23.14.5.A. or Table 9.23.14.5.B. for subfloors.

ON Full: Fasteners on vertical surfaces shall be spaced not more than,(a) 150 mm o.c. vertically and 406 mm o.c. horizontally, or (b) 100 mm o.c. vertically and 610 mm o.c. horizontally.
ON Variations: Fasteners on vertical surfaces shall be spaced not more than,(a) 150 mm o.c. vertically and 406 mm o.c. horizontally, or (b) 100 mm o.c. vertically and 610 mm o.c. horizontally.

ON Full: If a public corridor conforming to Clause 3.4.2.5.(1)(d) contains an occupancy, the occupancy shall be located so that for pedestrian travel there is an unobstructed width not less than 3 m at all times adjacent and parallel to all rooms and suites that front onto the public corridor, and the combined area of all occupancies in the public corridor shall be not more than 15% of the area of the public corridor.
ON Variations: If a public corridor conforming to Clause 3.4.2.5.(1)(d) contains an occupancy, the occupancy shall be located so that for pedestrian travel there is an unobstructed width not less than 3 m at all times adjacent and parallel to all rooms and suites that front onto the public corridor, and the combined area of all occupancies in the public corridor shall be not more than 15% of the area of the public corridor.

ON Full: Items being electrostatically sprayed shall be neither held by hand nor suspended in such a manner as to reduce the proper operating distance from the atomizing heads.
ON Variations: Items being electrostatically sprayed shall be neither held by hand nor suspended in such a manner as to reduce the proper operating distance from the atomizing heads.

ON Full: Processing equipment shall be designed and arranged to prevent the unintentional escape of liquids and vapours, and minimize the quantity escaping in the event of accidental release.
ON Variations: Processing equipment shall be designed and arranged to prevent the unintentional escape of liquids and vapours, and minimize the quantity escaping in the event of accidental release.

ON Full: A public corridor shall comply with Sentences 6.2.3.9.(4) and (5).
ON Variations: A public corridor shall comply with Sentences 6.2.3.9.(4) and (5).

ON Full: If the vertical distance between seating platforms in bleachers is more than 280 mm, an intermediate step shall be provided the full width of the aisle and proportioned to provide two equal risers between platforms.
ON Variations: If the vertical distance between seating platforms in bleachers is more than 280 mm, an intermediate step shall be provided the full width of the aisle and proportioned to provide two equal risers between platforms.

ON Full: A recirculation system shall be equipped with a flow meter registering the rate of water flow.
ON Variations: A recirculation system shall be equipped with a flow meter registering the rate of water flow.

ON Full: Columns for applications other than as described in Sentence (1) shall be designed in accordance with Part 4.
ON Variations: Columns for applications other than as described in Sentence (1) shall be designed in accordance with Part 4.

ON Full: Where sheet metal roofing is not supported by roof decking but spans between spaced supports, the panels shall be designed to support the specified live loads for roofs.
ON Variations: Where sheet metal roofing is not supported by roof decking but spans between spaced supports, the panels shall be designed to support the specified live loads for roofs.

ON Full: Changes in equipment or occupancy that might result in temperatures at sprinklers being more than 38°C or less than 4°C with wet pipe systems shall not be made without previously making provisions to alter the sprinkler system to prevent premature operation or freezing.
ON Variations: Changes in equipment or occupancy that might result in temperatures at sprinklers being more than 38°C or less than 4°C with wet pipe systems shall not be made without previously making provisions to alter the sprinkler system to prevent premature operation or freezing.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (2), the thickness of the back and sides of a fireplace, including the thickness of any firebrick liner, shall be not less than 190 mm where a metal liner or a firebrick liner less than 51 mm thick is used.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (2), the thickness of the back and sides of a fireplace, including the thickness of any firebrick liner, shall be not less than 190 mm where a metal liner or a firebrick liner less than 51 mm thick is used.

ON Full: Except as required by Sentence (4), for single-layer application on walls, screws shall be spaced, (a) not more than 300 mm o.c. on vertical wall supports where the supports are more than 406 mm o.c., or (b) not more than 400 mm o.c. on vertical wall supports where the supports are not more than 406 mm o.c.
ON Variations: Except as required by Sentence (4), for single-layer application on walls, screws shall be spaced, (a) not more than 300 mm o.c. on vertical wall supports where the supports are more than 406 mm o.c., or (b) not more than 400 mm o.c. on vertical wall supports where the supports are not more than 406 mm o.c.

ON Full: No person shall disable a smoke alarm.
ON Variations: No person shall disable a smoke alarm.

ON Full: Portable extinguishers for Class B fires shall be provided for flammable liquid and combustible liquid hazards when flammable liquids or combustible liquids are stored in open containers to a depth greater than 6 mm.
ON Variations: Portable extinguishers for Class B fires shall be provided for flammable liquid and combustible liquid hazards when flammable liquids or combustible liquids are stored in open containers to a depth greater than 6 mm.

ON Full: Where laundry waste is not more than 20% of the total daily design sanitary sewage flow, it may discharge to a sewage system.
ON Variations: Where laundry waste is not more than 20% of the total daily design sanitary sewage flow, it may discharge to a sewage system.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (2), framing, finishes and cabinetry installed directly above the location of the cooktop shall be not less than 750 mm above the level of cooktop burners or elements.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (2), framing, finishes and cabinetry installed directly above the location of the cooktop shall be not less than 750 mm above the level of cooktop burners or elements.

ON Full: Glass for site-built windows, doors, sidelights for doors, and skylights shall comply with Section 9.6.
ON Variations: Glass for site-built windows, doors, sidelights for doors, and skylights shall comply with Section 9.6.

ON Full: Floor and roof structural elements providing lateral support for walls as required in Sentence (1) shall be constructed to transfer lateral loads to walls or buttresses approximately at right angles to the laterally supported walls.
ON Variations: Floor and roof structural elements providing lateral support for walls as required in Sentence (1) shall be constructed to transfer lateral loads to walls or buttresses approximately at right angles to the laterally supported walls.

ON Full: The specified load on a roof or any other building surface subject to snow and associated rain shall be the snow load specified in Article 4.1.6.2., or the rain load specified in Article 4.1.6.4., whichever produces the more critical effect.
ON Variations: The specified load on a roof or any other building surface subject to snow and associated rain shall be the snow load specified in Article 4.1.6.2., or the rain load specified in Article 4.1.6.4., whichever produces the more critical effect.

ON Full: A dead-end public corridor is permitted in an occupancy shown in Table 9.9.7.3., where,(a) the dead-end corridor, (i) does not exceed the distance of travel measured from the most remote point of the dead-end to a point where it is possible to go in opposite directions to each of two separate exits, and (ii) is provided with doors equipped with self-closing devices, or (b) there is a second and separate egress doorway from each room or suite not leading into the dead-end corridor.
ON Variations: A dead-end public corridor is permitted in an occupancy shown in Table 9.9.7.3., where,(a) the dead-end corridor, (i) does not exceed the distance of travel measured from the most remote point of the dead-end to a point where it is possible to go in opposite directions to each of two separate exits, and (ii) is provided with doors equipped with self-closing devices, or (b) there is a second and separate egress doorway from each room or suite not leading into the dead-end corridor.

ON Full: The specified wind loads for a building and its components shall be determined using the Static, Dynamic or Wind Tunnel Procedure as provided in Sentences (2) to (5).
ON Variations: The specified wind loads for a building and its components shall be determined using the Static, Dynamic or Wind Tunnel Procedure as provided in Sentences (2) to (5).

ON Full: The building structure shall be designed for lateral deflection due to E, in accordance with Article 4.1.8.13.
ON Variations: The building structure shall be designed for lateral deflection due to E, in accordance with Article 4.1.8.13.

ON Full: At every opening in a wall made of logs in a horizontal position where shrinkage can occur there shall be a clearance between the rough buck header and the lintel log of not less than 13 mm in width for each 300 mm of height to allow for settlement.
ON Variations: At every opening in a wall made of logs in a horizontal position where shrinkage can occur there shall be a clearance between the rough buck header and the lintel log of not less than 13 mm in width for each 300 mm of height to allow for settlement.

ON Full: Except as provided in Article 4.1.2.2., the categories of loads, specified loads and effects set out in Table 4.1.2.1.A. shall be taken into consideration in the design of a building and its structural members and connections. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Except as provided in Article 4.1.2.2., the categories of loads, specified loads and effects set out in Table 4.1.2.1.A. shall be taken into consideration in the design of a building and its structural members and connections. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: The clearance between a handrail and any surface behind it shall be not less than, 60 mm, if the surface behind the handrail is rough or abrasive, or 50 mm, in all other cases.
ON Variations: The clearance between a handrail and any surface behind it shall be not less than, 60 mm, if the surface behind the handrail is rough or abrasive, or 50 mm, in all other cases.

ON Full: Where bonding is used to satisfy the requirements of Sentence (1), 50% of the adjacent masonry units in the intersecting wall, distributed uniformly over the height of the intersection, shall be embedded in the laterally supported wall.
ON Variations: Where bonding is used to satisfy the requirements of Sentence (1), 50% of the adjacent masonry units in the intersecting wall, distributed uniformly over the height of the intersection, shall be embedded in the laterally supported wall.

ON Full: The design and construction required by Clause (1)(b) shall comply with Subsection 5.2.2., with regard to, (a) materials, components and assemblies, and associated loads, that are identified in Part 4, (b) air pressure loads imposed on air barrier systems, (c) wind up-lift imposed on roofing, and (d) hydrostatic pressure imposed on the means of protection from moisture in the ground.
ON Variations: The design and construction required by Clause (1)(b) shall comply with Subsection 5.2.2., with regard to, (a) materials, components and assemblies, and associated loads, that are identified in Part 4, (b) air pressure loads imposed on air barrier systems, (c) wind up-lift imposed on roofing, and (d) hydrostatic pressure imposed on the means of protection from moisture in the ground.

ON Full: A barrier-free entrance shall, be designed in accordance with Article 3.8.3.3., and lead from, the outdoors at sidewalk level, or a ramp that conforms to Article 3.8.3.4. and leads from a sidewalk.
ON Variations: A barrier-free entrance shall, be designed in accordance with Article 3.8.3.3., and lead from, the outdoors at sidewalk level, or a ramp that conforms to Article 3.8.3.4. and leads from a sidewalk.

ON Full: No more than 50 L of flammable liquids and combustible liquids, of which not more than 30 L may be Class I liquids, shall be stored in a garage or shed attached to a dwelling unit.
ON Variations: No more than 50 L of flammable liquids and combustible liquids, of which not more than 30 L may be Class I liquids, shall be stored in a garage or shed attached to a dwelling unit.

ON Full: Every sewage system shall be operated in accordance with,(a) the basis on which the construction and use of the sewage system was approved or required under the Act or predecessor legislation, as the case may be, and (b) the requirements of the manufacturer of the sewage system.
ON Variations: Every sewage system shall be operated in accordance with,(a) the basis on which the construction and use of the sewage system was approved or required under the Act or predecessor legislation, as the case may be, and (b) the requirements of the manufacturer of the sewage system.

ON Full: Each portable extinguisher shall have a tag securely attached to it showing the maintenance or recharge date, the servicing agency and the signature of the person who performed the service.
ON Variations: Each portable extinguisher shall have a tag securely attached to it showing the maintenance or recharge date, the servicing agency and the signature of the person who performed the service.

ON Full: A readily accessible valve to shut off the supply from shore shall be provided in each pipeline within 7.5 m of piers and wharves.
ON Variations: A readily accessible valve to shut off the supply from shore shall be provided in each pipeline within 7.5 m of piers and wharves.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (3), the hydraulic load of a fixture or device that is listed in Table 7.6.3.2.A. shall be the number of fixture units given in the Table.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (3), the hydraulic load of a fixture or device that is listed in Table 7.6.3.2.A. shall be the number of fixture units given in the Table.

ON Full: The sound transmission loss measured in accordance with ASTM E90, "Laboratory Measurement of Airborne Sound Transmission Loss of Building Partitions and Elements", shall be used in lieu of the sound reduction index required in ISO 15712-1, "Building Acoustics - Estimation of Acoustic Performance of Buildings From the Performance of Elements - Part 1: Airborne Sound Insulation Between Rooms".
ON Variations: The sound transmission loss measured in accordance with ASTM E90, "Laboratory Measurement of Airborne Sound Transmission Loss of Building Partitions and Elements", shall be used in lieu of the sound reduction index required in ISO 15712-1, "Building Acoustics - Estimation of Acoustic Performance of Buildings From the Performance of Elements - Part 1: Airborne Sound Insulation Between Rooms".

ON Full: Despite Sentence (1), other interior finish materials may be approved.
ON Variations: Despite Sentence (1), other interior finish materials may be approved.

ON Full: The water service pipe may be closer than 2 440 mm or be placed in the same trench with the building drain or building sewer if,(a) the following conditions are met: (i) the bottom of the water service pipe at all points is at least 500 mm above the top of the building drain or building sewer, and (ii) when in a common trench with the building drain or building sewer, the water service pipe is placed on a shelf at one side of the common trench, (b) the water service pipe is constructed of a single run of pipe with no joints or fittings between the street line or source of supply on the property and the inside face of the building, or (c) the building drain or building sewer is constructed of piping which is pressure tested in accordance with Subsection 7.3.7. at 345 kPa.
ON Variations: The water service pipe may be closer than 2 440 mm or be placed in the same trench with the building drain or building sewer if,(a) the following conditions are met: (i) the bottom of the water service pipe at all points is at least 500 mm above the top of the building drain or building sewer, and (ii) when in a common trench with the building drain or building sewer, the water service pipe is placed on a shelf at one side of the common trench, (b) the water service pipe is constructed of a single run of pipe with no joints or fittings between the street line or source of supply on the property and the inside face of the building, or (c) the building drain or building sewer is constructed of piping which is pressure tested in accordance with Subsection 7.3.7. at 345 kPa.

ON Full: Exit stairs that serve interconnected floor spaces as provided in Articles 3.2.8.3. to 3.2.8.11. shall conform to the requirements in Article 3.2.8.4. and in this Section.
ON Variations: Exit stairs that serve interconnected floor spaces as provided in Articles 3.2.8.3. to 3.2.8.11. shall conform to the requirements in Article 3.2.8.4. and in this Section.

ON Full: Where the performance level of an existing building is reduced under Article 11.4.2.6., the building shall be sprinklered.
ON Variations: Where the performance level of an existing building is reduced under Article 11.4.2.6., the building shall be sprinklered.

ON Full: Skylights and their components shall be designed, constructed and installed so that, when in the closed position, they resist snow loads.
ON Variations: Skylights and their components shall be designed, constructed and installed so that, when in the closed position, they resist snow loads.

ON Full: Except as permitted in Sentence (2), the deflections and specified loading due to earthquake motions shall be determined according to the requirements of Articles 4.1.8.2. to 4.1.8.22.
ON Variations: Except as permitted in Sentence (2), the deflections and specified loading due to earthquake motions shall be determined according to the requirements of Articles 4.1.8.2. to 4.1.8.22.

ON Full: Except as permitted by Article 3.1.8.17., the maximum area of glass block and wired glass panels not in a door, used in the locations shown in Table 3.1.8.15., shall conform to the Table.
ON Variations: Except as permitted by Article 3.1.8.17., the maximum area of glass block and wired glass panels not in a door, used in the locations shown in Table 3.1.8.15., shall conform to the Table.

ON Full: Except as permitted in Sentence (5), an elevator referred to in Sentence (1) shall be capable of providing transportation from the storey containing the entrance for firefighter access referred to in Articles 3.2.5.4. and 3.2.5.5. to every floor that is above grade in the building and that is normally served by the elevator system.
ON Variations: Except as permitted in Sentence (5), an elevator referred to in Sentence (1) shall be capable of providing transportation from the storey containing the entrance for firefighter access referred to in Articles 3.2.5.4. and 3.2.5.5. to every floor that is above grade in the building and that is normally served by the elevator system.

ON Full: Open flames shall not be used in dining areas in care occupancies, care and treatment occupancies and retirement homes.
ON Variations: Open flames shall not be used in dining areas in care occupancies, care and treatment occupancies and retirement homes.

ON Full: The thickness of interior non-loadbearing walls shall be,(a) determined on the basis of the maximum lateral support spacing as provided in Sentences 9.20.10.1.(2) and (3), and (b) in any case, not less than 65 mm.
ON Variations: The thickness of interior non-loadbearing walls shall be,(a) determined on the basis of the maximum lateral support spacing as provided in Sentences 9.20.10.1.(2) and (3), and (b) in any case, not less than 65 mm.

ON Full: In areas where general cargo is handled or where piping might be subject to physical damage from vehicles, watercraft or floatplanes, the piping shall be protected by means of guarding devices.
ON Variations: In areas where general cargo is handled or where piping might be subject to physical damage from vehicles, watercraft or floatplanes, the piping shall be protected by means of guarding devices.

ON Full: A chimney need not be laterally braced provided,(a) no horizontal outside dimension is less than 400 mm, and (b) the chimney extends not more than 3.6 m above a roof or the masonry wall of which it forms a part. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: A chimney need not be laterally braced provided,(a) no horizontal outside dimension is less than 400 mm, and (b) the chimney extends not more than 3.6 m above a roof or the masonry wall of which it forms a part. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Where a topping course is provided for a concrete floor slab, it shall consist of 1 part cement to 2.5 parts clean, well graded sand by volume, with a water/cement ratio approximately equal to that of the base slab.
ON Variations: Where a topping course is provided for a concrete floor slab, it shall consist of 1 part cement to 2.5 parts clean, well graded sand by volume, with a water/cement ratio approximately equal to that of the base slab.

ON Full: Handrails and their supports shall be designed and constructed to withstand the following loads, which need not be considered to act simultaneously: (a) a concentrated load not less than 0.9 kN applied at any point and in any direction for all handrails, and (b) a uniform load not less than 0.7 kN/m applied in any direction to handrails not located within dwelling units.
ON Variations: Handrails and their supports shall be designed and constructed to withstand the following loads, which need not be considered to act simultaneously: (a) a concentrated load not less than 0.9 kN applied at any point and in any direction for all handrails, and (b) a uniform load not less than 0.7 kN/m applied in any direction to handrails not located within dwelling units.

ON Full: The vertical clearance described in Sentence (1) for framing, finishes and cabinets located directly above the location of the cooktop is permitted to be reduced to 600 mm above the level of the elements or burners provided the framing, finishes and cabinets,(a) are noncombustible, or (b) are are protected by a metal hood with a 125 mm projection beyond the framing, finishes and cabinets.
ON Variations: The vertical clearance described in Sentence (1) for framing, finishes and cabinets located directly above the location of the cooktop is permitted to be reduced to 600 mm above the level of the elements or burners provided the framing, finishes and cabinets,(a) are noncombustible, or (b) are are protected by a metal hood with a 125 mm projection beyond the framing, finishes and cabinets.

ON Full: Except where all salvage and scrap material is noncombustible and free of combustibles, water barrels of 200 L capacity with three 12 L pails or portable extinguishers having a 2A or higher rating conforming to the requirements of Section 6.2 shall be provided, so that the maximum distance travelled from any part of the yard to a barrel or extinguisher is 25 m.
ON Variations: Except where all salvage and scrap material is noncombustible and free of combustibles, water barrels of 200 L capacity with three 12 L pails or portable extinguishers having a 2A or higher rating conforming to the requirements of Section 6.2 shall be provided, so that the maximum distance travelled from any part of the yard to a barrel or extinguisher is 25 m.

ON Full: A fire alarm control unit installed in close proximity to a building entrance that faces a street or an access route for fire department vehicles that complies with Sentence 3.2.5.5.(1), is deemed to satisfy the requirement for an annunciator provided all indicators required for an annunciator or trouble signal device are included on the control unit. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: A fire alarm control unit installed in close proximity to a building entrance that faces a street or an access route for fire department vehicles that complies with Sentence 3.2.5.5.(1), is deemed to satisfy the requirement for an annunciator provided all indicators required for an annunciator or trouble signal device are included on the control unit. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Static collectors shall be installed where the material being coated leaves each rotating part.
ON Variations: Static collectors shall be installed where the material being coated leaves each rotating part.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentences (1) and (3), the hydraulic load of a fixture that is not listed in Table 7.6.3.2.A. is the number of fixture units listed in Table 7.6.3.2.D.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentences (1) and (3), the hydraulic load of a fixture that is not listed in Table 7.6.3.2.A. is the number of fixture units listed in Table 7.6.3.2.D.

ON Full: The normalized flanking level difference shall be measured in accordance with Parts 1 to 4 of ISO 10848, "Acoustics - Laboratory Measurement of the Flanking Transmission of Airborne and Impact Sound Between Adjoining Rooms".
ON Variations: The normalized flanking level difference shall be measured in accordance with Parts 1 to 4 of ISO 10848, "Acoustics - Laboratory Measurement of the Flanking Transmission of Airborne and Impact Sound Between Adjoining Rooms".

ON Full: Electrical wires or cables, single or grouped, with combustible insulation or jacketing that is not totally enclosed in raceways of noncombustible material, are permitted to partly or wholly penetrate an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating without being incorporated in the assembly at the time of testing as required in Sentence (3), provided the overall diameter of the wiring is not more than 25 mm.
ON Variations: Electrical wires or cables, single or grouped, with combustible insulation or jacketing that is not totally enclosed in raceways of noncombustible material, are permitted to partly or wholly penetrate an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating without being incorporated in the assembly at the time of testing as required in Sentence (3), provided the overall diameter of the wiring is not more than 25 mm.

ON Full: Spans provided in this Subsection for joists, beams and lintels supporting floors shall apply only where,(a) the floors serve residential areas as described in Table 4.1.5.3., or (b) the uniformly distributed live load on the floors does not exceed that specified for residential areas as described in Table 4.1.5.3.
ON Variations: Spans provided in this Subsection for joists, beams and lintels supporting floors shall apply only where,(a) the floors serve residential areas as described in Table 4.1.5.3., or (b) the uniformly distributed live load on the floors does not exceed that specified for residential areas as described in Table 4.1.5.3.

ON Full: Where egress doors from a rental space open onto a corridor and do not swing in the direction of exit travel, the corridor shall be not less than 1 100 mm in width.
ON Variations: Where egress doors from a rental space open onto a corridor and do not swing in the direction of exit travel, the corridor shall be not less than 1 100 mm in width.

ON Full: Operating pressures shall be controlled by a constant-level float valve or a pressure-regulating valve on the water supply side of the hydraulic transfer system referred to in Sentence (1).
ON Variations: Operating pressures shall be controlled by a constant-level float valve or a pressure-regulating valve on the water supply side of the hydraulic transfer system referred to in Sentence (1).

ON Full: Except for doors serving a house or an individual dwelling unit and except for doors to accessory buildings and to garages serving a house or an individual dwelling unit, door release hardware on doors in a means of egress shall be operable with one hand and the door shall be openable with not more than one releasing operation.
ON Variations: Except for doors serving a house or an individual dwelling unit and except for doors to accessory buildings and to garages serving a house or an individual dwelling unit, door release hardware on doors in a means of egress shall be operable with one hand and the door shall be openable with not more than one releasing operation.

ON Full: The requirements for noncombustible sills and combustible floor coverings in NFPA 80, "Fire Doors and Other Opening Protectives", do not apply to a door described in Sentence (1).
ON Variations: The requirements for noncombustible sills and combustible floor coverings in NFPA 80, "Fire Doors and Other Opening Protectives", do not apply to a door described in Sentence (1).

ON Full: Every fixture supplied with separate hot and cold water controls shall have the hot water control on the left and the cold on the right.
ON Variations: Every fixture supplied with separate hot and cold water controls shall have the hot water control on the left and the cold on the right.

ON Full: Chimney liners used in chimneys for solid fuel-burning appliances shall be laid in a full bed of,(a) high temperature cement mortar conforming to CAN/CGSB-10.3, "Air Setting Refractory Mortar", or (b) mortar consisting of one part Portland cement to three parts sand by volume.
ON Variations: Chimney liners used in chimneys for solid fuel-burning appliances shall be laid in a full bed of,(a) high temperature cement mortar conforming to CAN/CGSB-10.3, "Air Setting Refractory Mortar", or (b) mortar consisting of one part Portland cement to three parts sand by volume.

ON Full: Where flammable liquids are supplied to spray nozzles by positive displacement pumps, the pump discharge line shall be provided with a suitable relief valve discharging to the pump suction or to a safe remote location.
ON Variations: Where flammable liquids are supplied to spray nozzles by positive displacement pumps, the pump discharge line shall be provided with a suitable relief valve discharging to the pump suction or to a safe remote location.

ON Full: Where the height of a shelf and rack storage system, measured from the floor supporting the system to the topmost portion of the shelf, exceeds 18 m, a fire alarm and detection system conforming to Subsection 3.2.4. shall be installed with, pull stations located at all exit doors including exit doors serving elevated decks and walkways, and smoke detectors located, at the ceiling of all rooms and areas containing the shelf and rack storage system, within exit stair enclosures at the top, and at every third level of elevated deck or walkway, and the fire alarm and detection system required by Clause (a), shall be designed to notify the fire department upon activation, and the shelf and rack storage system shall be designed only for the storage of Class I, II and III commodities as defined in NFPA 13, "Installation of Sprinkler Systems".
ON Variations: Where the height of a shelf and rack storage system, measured from the floor supporting the system to the topmost portion of the shelf, exceeds 18 m, a fire alarm and detection system conforming to Subsection 3.2.4. shall be installed with, pull stations located at all exit doors including exit doors serving elevated decks and walkways, and smoke detectors located, at the ceiling of all rooms and areas containing the shelf and rack storage system, within exit stair enclosures at the top, and at every third level of elevated deck or walkway, and the fire alarm and detection system required by Clause (a), shall be designed to notify the fire department upon activation, and the shelf and rack storage system shall be designed only for the storage of Class I, II and III commodities as defined in NFPA 13, "Installation of Sprinkler Systems".

ON Full: A copper water distributing pipe of 1 in. size or larger may be mechanically swaged to permit the joining of other copper pipe of equal size.
ON Variations: A copper water distributing pipe of 1 in. size or larger may be mechanically swaged to permit the joining of other copper pipe of equal size.

ON Full: Each platform in a rapid transit station shall be served by no fewer than two means of egress that are independent of and remote from each other from the platform to the exterior of the station.
ON Variations: Each platform in a rapid transit station shall be served by no fewer than two means of egress that are independent of and remote from each other from the platform to the exterior of the station.

ON Full: For single-layer application on ceilings, nails shall be spaced,(a) not more than 180 mm o.c. on ceiling supports, or (b) every 300 mm o.c. along ceiling supports, in pairs about 50 mm apart.
ON Variations: For single-layer application on ceilings, nails shall be spaced,(a) not more than 180 mm o.c. on ceiling supports, or (b) every 300 mm o.c. along ceiling supports, in pairs about 50 mm apart.

ON Full: Used materials and equipment, including fixtures, shall not be reused unless they meet the requirements of this Part for new materials and equipment and are otherwise satisfactory for their intended use.
ON Variations: Used materials and equipment, including fixtures, shall not be reused unless they meet the requirements of this Part for new materials and equipment and are otherwise satisfactory for their intended use.

ON Full: Except as permitted by Article 3.2.2.16., the building referred to in Sentence (1) shall be of noncombustible construction, and, except as permitted by Sentence 3.2.2.7.(1), the building shall be sprinklered, except as permitted by Sentence (3), floor assemblies shall be fire separations with a fire-resistance rating not less than 2 h, mezzanines shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, and loadbearing walls, columns and arches shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the supported assembly.
ON Variations: Except as permitted by Article 3.2.2.16., the building referred to in Sentence (1) shall be of noncombustible construction, and, except as permitted by Sentence 3.2.2.7.(1), the building shall be sprinklered, except as permitted by Sentence (3), floor assemblies shall be fire separations with a fire-resistance rating not less than 2 h, mezzanines shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, and loadbearing walls, columns and arches shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the supported assembly.

ON Full: (2) The building referred to in Sentence (1) is permitted to be of combustible construction or noncombustible construction used singly or in combination, and, floor assemblies shall be fire separations and, if of combustible construction, shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min, and loadbearing walls, columns and arches supporting an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating shall, have a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min, or be of noncombustible construction.
ON Variations: (2) The building referred to in Sentence (1) is permitted to be of combustible construction or noncombustible construction used singly or in combination, and, floor assemblies shall be fire separations and, if of combustible construction, shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min, and loadbearing walls, columns and arches supporting an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating shall, have a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min, or be of noncombustible construction.

ON Full: The distance between individual unprotected openings described in Sentence (5) that serve a single room or space described in Sentence (7) shall not be less than, 2 m measured horizontally where the unprotected openings are on the same exposing building face, or 2 m measured vertically where the unprotected openings both serve, the single room or space, or another room or space on the same storey.
ON Variations: The distance between individual unprotected openings described in Sentence (5) that serve a single room or space described in Sentence (7) shall not be less than, 2 m measured horizontally where the unprotected openings are on the same exposing building face, or 2 m measured vertically where the unprotected openings both serve, the single room or space, or another room or space on the same storey.

ON Full: The requirements of this Code shall apply to,(a) building components designed and constructed outside the place of manufacture, and (b) site installation of such buildings.
ON Variations: The requirements of this Code shall apply to,(a) building components designed and constructed outside the place of manufacture, and (b) site installation of such buildings.

ON Full: The working capacity of the compartments required in Sentence (2) shall be sized such that, (a) the first compartment is at least 1.3 times the daily design sanitary sewage flow but in no case less than 2 400 L, and (b) each subsequent compartment shall be at least 50% of the first compartment.
ON Variations: The working capacity of the compartments required in Sentence (2) shall be sized such that, (a) the first compartment is at least 1.3 times the daily design sanitary sewage flow but in no case less than 2 400 L, and (b) each subsequent compartment shall be at least 50% of the first compartment.

ON Full: The flame-spread rating limits specified in Sentences (1) and (2) for corridors referred to in Sentence (1) do not apply to a corridor in which the flame-spread rating is not more than 150 provided the floor area is sprinklered.
ON Variations: The flame-spread rating limits specified in Sentences (1) and (2) for corridors referred to in Sentence (1) do not apply to a corridor in which the flame-spread rating is not more than 150 provided the floor area is sprinklered.

ON Full: Except for a shallow buried trench, the distribution pipe used in the construction of a leaching bed shall be,(a) not less than 3 in. trade size for gravity flow systems, (b) installed with a uniform downward slope from the inlet with a drop of not less than 30 mm and not more than 50 mm for each 10 m of distribution pipe for gravity flow systems, and (c) installed within a layer of stone conforming to Sentence (5).
ON Variations: Except for a shallow buried trench, the distribution pipe used in the construction of a leaching bed shall be,(a) not less than 3 in. trade size for gravity flow systems, (b) installed with a uniform downward slope from the inlet with a drop of not less than 30 mm and not more than 50 mm for each 10 m of distribution pipe for gravity flow systems, and (c) installed within a layer of stone conforming to Sentence (5).

ON Full: The values of the site coefficient for design spectral acceleration at period T, F(T), and of similar coefficients F(PGA) and F(PGV) shall conform to Tables 4.1.8.4.B. to 4.1.8.4.I. using linear interpolation for intermediate values of PGAref.
ON Variations: The values of the site coefficient for design spectral acceleration at period T, F(T), and of similar coefficients F(PGA) and F(PGV) shall conform to Tables 4.1.8.4.B. to 4.1.8.4.I. using linear interpolation for intermediate values of PGAref.

ON Full: A building classified as Group F, Division 3 is permitted to conform to Sentence (2) provided it is, not more than 1 storey in building height, used solely for low fire load occupancies such as, power generating plants, or plants for the manufacture or storage of noncombustible materials, and not limited in building area.
ON Variations: A building classified as Group F, Division 3 is permitted to conform to Sentence (2) provided it is, not more than 1 storey in building height, used solely for low fire load occupancies such as, power generating plants, or plants for the manufacture or storage of noncombustible materials, and not limited in building area.
