ON Full: For single-storey buildings with steel deck or wood roof diaphragms, the fundamental lateral period, Ta, in the direction under consideration is permitted to be taken as, (a) 0.05 (hn)3/4 + 0.004 L for shear walls, (b) 0.035 hn + 0.004 L for steel moment frames and steel braced frames, or (c) the value obtained from methods of mechanics using a structural model that complies with the requirements of Sentence 4.1.8.3.(8), except that Ta shall not be greater than 1.5 times the value determined in Clause (a) or (b), as applicable, where L is the shortest length of the diaphragm, in m, between adjacent vertical elements of the SFRS in the direction perpendicular to the direction under consideration.
ON Variations: For single-storey buildings with steel deck or wood roof diaphragms, the fundamental lateral period, Ta, in the direction under consideration is permitted to be taken as, (a) 0.05 (hn)3/4 + 0.004 L for shear walls, (b) 0.035 hn + 0.004 L for steel moment frames and steel braced frames, or (c) the value obtained from methods of mechanics using a structural model that complies with the requirements of Sentence 4.1.8.3.(8), except that Ta shall not be greater than 1.5 times the value determined in Clause (a) or (b), as applicable, where L is the shortest length of the diaphragm, in m, between adjacent vertical elements of the SFRS in the direction perpendicular to the direction under consideration.

ON Full: Hay, straw or similar combustible materials may be used if necessary for the daily feeding and care of animals.
ON Variations: Hay, straw or similar combustible materials may be used if necessary for the daily feeding and care of animals.

ON Full: Floors or walks in a barrier-free path of travel having a slope steeper than 1 in 20 shall be designed as ramps. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Floors or walks in a barrier-free path of travel having a slope steeper than 1 in 20 shall be designed as ramps. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Except as required by Sentence 3.8.3.3.(17) for power door operator controls, controls for the operation of building services or safety devices, including electrical switches, thermostats and intercom switches, intended to be operated by the occupant and located within a suite having a barrier-free path of travel required by Sentence (1) shall conform to Sentence 3.8.1.5.(1).
ON Variations: Except as required by Sentence 3.8.3.3.(17) for power door operator controls, controls for the operation of building services or safety devices, including electrical switches, thermostats and intercom switches, intended to be operated by the occupant and located within a suite having a barrier-free path of travel required by Sentence (1) shall conform to Sentence 3.8.1.5.(1).

ON Full: Manual operation of bottom drains shall be from an accessible location not affected by a fire in or around the dip tank.
ON Variations: Manual operation of bottom drains shall be from an accessible location not affected by a fire in or around the dip tank.

ON Full: The drift loads on the lower level roof against the two faces of an inside corner of an upper level roof or a parapet shall be calculated for each face and applied as far as the bisector of the corner angle as shown in Figure 4.1.6.8.B.
ON Variations: The drift loads on the lower level roof against the two faces of an inside corner of an upper level roof or a parapet shall be calculated for each face and applied as far as the bisector of the corner angle as shown in Figure 4.1.6.8.B.

ON Full: Each lavatory in a washroom with fixtures for public use shall be equipped with a device capable of automatically shutting off the flow of water when the lavatory is not in use. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Each lavatory in a washroom with fixtures for public use shall be equipped with a device capable of automatically shutting off the flow of water when the lavatory is not in use. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Explosion vents shall be provided for ovens where fuel or vapour hazards are present.
ON Variations: Explosion vents shall be provided for ovens where fuel or vapour hazards are present.

ON Full: The slope required in Sentence (4) shall be sufficient to maintain a positive slope,(a) after expected shrinkage of the building frame, where these surfaces are supported by exterior walls and on exterior columns, and (b) once design loading is taken into consideration, where these surfaces are cantilevered from exterior walls.
ON Variations: The slope required in Sentence (4) shall be sufficient to maintain a positive slope,(a) after expected shrinkage of the building frame, where these surfaces are supported by exterior walls and on exterior columns, and (b) once design loading is taken into consideration, where these surfaces are cantilevered from exterior walls.

ON Full: The distance travelled to reach a portable extinguisher required by Sentence (1) shall not exceed 15 m.
ON Variations: The distance travelled to reach a portable extinguisher required by Sentence (1) shall not exceed 15 m.

ON Full: The fire separation required by Sentence (1) is not required to have a fire-resistance rating if the floor area in which the room or space is located is sprinklered.
ON Variations: The fire separation required by Sentence (1) is not required to have a fire-resistance rating if the floor area in which the room or space is located is sprinklered.

ON Full: A cleanout fitting that as a result of normal maintenance operations cannot withstand the physical stresses of removal and reinstallation or cannot ensure a gas-tight seal shall not be installed.
ON Variations: A cleanout fitting that as a result of normal maintenance operations cannot withstand the physical stresses of removal and reinstallation or cannot ensure a gas-tight seal shall not be installed.

ON Full: Not more than one water closet to serve both sexes need be provided in a Group D occupancy having an occupant load of not more than 10 persons.
ON Variations: Not more than one water closet to serve both sexes need be provided in a Group D occupancy having an occupant load of not more than 10 persons.

ON Full: Each hose station shall have a 38 mm hose connection and a 65 mm hose connection.
ON Variations: Each hose station shall have a 38 mm hose connection and a 65 mm hose connection.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (2), the hydraulic load from a fixture that produces a continuous flow, such as a pump or an air-conditioning fixture, is 31.7 fixture units for each litre per second of flow.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (2), the hydraulic load from a fixture that produces a continuous flow, such as a pump or an air-conditioning fixture, is 31.7 fixture units for each litre per second of flow.

ON Full: Steel beams described in Sentence (6) shall be supported at each end by a steel column, and have a minimum 6 mm plate welded to the flange to support the masonry veneer.
ON Variations: Steel beams described in Sentence (6) shall be supported at each end by a steel column, and have a minimum 6 mm plate welded to the flange to support the masonry veneer.

ON Full: Where semi-solid or hollow units are used in a parapet wall, the cells of those units shall be filled with mortar, grout or concrete.
ON Variations: Where semi-solid or hollow units are used in a parapet wall, the cells of those units shall be filled with mortar, grout or concrete.

ON Full: Where the term pipe or piping and fittings is used, it shall also apply to tube or tubing and fittings unless otherwise stated.
ON Variations: Where the term pipe or piping and fittings is used, it shall also apply to tube or tubing and fittings unless otherwise stated.

ON Full: A fire separation is not required between a dwelling unit and an office where the office is not more than 50 m2 in area.
ON Variations: A fire separation is not required between a dwelling unit and an office where the office is not more than 50 m2 in area.

ON Full: Plies of selvage roofing shall be cemented together to ensure a water-tight joint.
ON Variations: Plies of selvage roofing shall be cemented together to ensure a water-tight joint.

ON Full: The performance level of an existing building is reduced where proposed construction will result in the change of a major occupancy of all or part of the existing building to another major occupancy and,(a) the total daily design sanitary sewage flow of the proposed major occupancy, calculated in accordance with Article 8.2.1.3., exceeds the capacity of any component of a sewage system serving the building, or (b) the type or amount of sanitary sewage which will, under the proposed major occupancy, be discharged to a sewage system serving the building, is prohibited by Article 8.1.3.1.
ON Variations: The performance level of an existing building is reduced where proposed construction will result in the change of a major occupancy of all or part of the existing building to another major occupancy and,(a) the total daily design sanitary sewage flow of the proposed major occupancy, calculated in accordance with Article 8.2.1.3., exceeds the capacity of any component of a sewage system serving the building, or (b) the type or amount of sanitary sewage which will, under the proposed major occupancy, be discharged to a sewage system serving the building, is prohibited by Article 8.1.3.1.

ON Full: Where the building is in a location where the spectral response acceleration, Sa(0.2), is greater than 0.55, service water heaters shall be secured to the structure to resist overturning and displacement. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Where the building is in a location where the spectral response acceleration, Sa(0.2), is greater than 0.55, service water heaters shall be secured to the structure to resist overturning and displacement. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Roof parking decks shall be designed for the uniformly distributed live loads specified in Table 4.1.5.3., the concentrated live loads listed in Table 4.1.5.9., or the roof snow load, whichever produces the most critical effect in the members concerned.
ON Variations: Roof parking decks shall be designed for the uniformly distributed live loads specified in Table 4.1.5.3., the concentrated live loads listed in Table 4.1.5.9., or the roof snow load, whichever produces the most critical effect in the members concerned.

ON Full: When nails are used, wood strip flooring shall be toe nailed or face nailed with at least one nail per strip at the spacings shown in Table 9.30.3.3., except that face nailed strips of more than 25 mm in width shall have at least two nails per strip.
ON Variations: When nails are used, wood strip flooring shall be toe nailed or face nailed with at least one nail per strip at the spacings shown in Table 9.30.3.3., except that face nailed strips of more than 25 mm in width shall have at least two nails per strip.

ON Full: When dwarf walls are used for rafter support, they shall be framed in the same manner as loadbearing walls and securely fastened top and bottom to the roof and ceiling framing to prevent overall movement.
ON Variations: When dwarf walls are used for rafter support, they shall be framed in the same manner as loadbearing walls and securely fastened top and bottom to the roof and ceiling framing to prevent overall movement.

ON Full: When framed into the side of a steel beam, joists referred to in Sentence (1) shall be supported on the bottom flange of the beam or on not less than 38 mm by 38 mm lumber bolted to the web with not less than 6.3 mm diam bolts spaced not more than 600 mm apart.
ON Variations: When framed into the side of a steel beam, joists referred to in Sentence (1) shall be supported on the bottom flange of the beam or on not less than 38 mm by 38 mm lumber bolted to the web with not less than 6.3 mm diam bolts spaced not more than 600 mm apart.

ON Full: When portable extinguishers are located on vehicles or in areas where they are subject to jarring or vibration, brackets designed to accommodate these effects shall be used.
ON Variations: When portable extinguishers are located on vehicles or in areas where they are subject to jarring or vibration, brackets designed to accommodate these effects shall be used.

ON Full: Except as provided in Article 3.2.4.16., if a fire alarm system is required, heat detectors shall be installed in, every room in portions of buildings classified as Group A, Division 1, except in a hotel, in every suite, and every room not located within a suite, in portions of buildings classified as Group C major occupancy and more than 3 storeys in building height, and in a floor area containing a hotel, in every room in a suite and in every room not located in a suite other than washrooms within a suite, saunas, refrigerated areas and swimming pools.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Article 3.2.4.16., if a fire alarm system is required, heat detectors shall be installed in, every room in portions of buildings classified as Group A, Division 1, except in a hotel, in every suite, and every room not located within a suite, in portions of buildings classified as Group C major occupancy and more than 3 storeys in building height, and in a floor area containing a hotel, in every room in a suite and in every room not located in a suite other than washrooms within a suite, saunas, refrigerated areas and swimming pools.

ON Full: Exhaust ducts for spray booths and spray rooms shall be securely supported and constructed of sheet steel in accordance with Table 5.12.4.A.
ON Variations: Exhaust ducts for spray booths and spray rooms shall be securely supported and constructed of sheet steel in accordance with Table 5.12.4.A.

ON Full: The weight of access floors shall include the dead load of the access floor and the weight of permanent equipment, which shall not be taken as less than 25% of the floor live load.
ON Variations: The weight of access floors shall include the dead load of the access floor and the weight of permanent equipment, which shall not be taken as less than 25% of the floor live load.

ON Full: Thickness listed in Table 9.29.6.1. shall permit a manufacturing tolerance of -0.4 mm.
ON Variations: Thickness listed in Table 9.29.6.1. shall permit a manufacturing tolerance of -0.4 mm.

ON Full: The pump chamber shall be sized to provide sufficient storage volume so that the effluent is evenly dosed on an hourly basis over a 24-hour period.
ON Variations: The pump chamber shall be sized to provide sufficient storage volume so that the effluent is evenly dosed on an hourly basis over a 24-hour period.

ON Full: The building referred to in Sentence (1) shall be of noncombustible construction.
ON Variations: The building referred to in Sentence (1) shall be of noncombustible construction.

ON Full: Storage rooms shall have exterior signs with minimum 50 mm high letters indicating the nature of the compressed gases.
ON Variations: Storage rooms shall have exterior signs with minimum 50 mm high letters indicating the nature of the compressed gases.

ON Full: The emergency stop button in Sentence (12) shall, when used, activate an audible and a visual signal located by the emergency stop.
ON Variations: The emergency stop button in Sentence (12) shall, when used, activate an audible and a visual signal located by the emergency stop.

ON Full: Steel beams supporting masonry veneer and wood stud walls above openings shall conform to Table 9.20.5.2.C.
ON Variations: Steel beams supporting masonry veneer and wood stud walls above openings shall conform to Table 9.20.5.2.C.

ON Full: The effluent shall be distributed through a pressurized distribution system having a pressure head of not less than 600 mm when measured to the most distant point from the pump.
ON Variations: The effluent shall be distributed through a pressurized distribution system having a pressure head of not less than 600 mm when measured to the most distant point from the pump.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (6), Ca for curved roofs shall be determined in accordance with the requirements for arch roofs stated in Sentences (3) and (4).
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (6), Ca for curved roofs shall be determined in accordance with the requirements for arch roofs stated in Sentences (3) and (4).

ON Full: The hydraulic load from a fixture that is listed in Table 7.4.9.3. is the number of fixture units set forth in the Table.
ON Variations: The hydraulic load from a fixture that is listed in Table 7.4.9.3. is the number of fixture units set forth in the Table.

ON Full: Hose stations are not required in the first storey.
ON Variations: Hose stations are not required in the first storey.

ON Full: Evaporative air coolers, misters, atomizers, air washers and humidifiers shall be designed in accordance with Sections 8 and 9 of ASHRAE Guideline 12, "Minimizing the Risk of Legionellosis Associated with Building Water Systems".
ON Variations: Evaporative air coolers, misters, atomizers, air washers and humidifiers shall be designed in accordance with Sections 8 and 9 of ASHRAE Guideline 12, "Minimizing the Risk of Legionellosis Associated with Building Water Systems".

ON Full: The space between overflow pipes and the tops of gravity tanks, the valve pits at the bottoms of the risers and the entire area around the bases of the columns of tanks shall be kept free of rubbish and waste materials.
ON Variations: The space between overflow pipes and the tops of gravity tanks, the valve pits at the bottoms of the risers and the entire area around the bases of the columns of tanks shall be kept free of rubbish and waste materials.

ON Full: Provision shall be made for maintaining the trap seal of a floor drain or a hub drain by the use of a trap seal primer, by using the drain as a receptacle for an indirectly connected drinking fountain, or by equally effective means.
ON Variations: Provision shall be made for maintaining the trap seal of a floor drain or a hub drain by the use of a trap seal primer, by using the drain as a receptacle for an indirectly connected drinking fountain, or by equally effective means.

ON Full: If mobile homes do not have individual plumbing facilities connected to a central water supply and drainage system, a service building shall be provided for public use.
ON Variations: If mobile homes do not have individual plumbing facilities connected to a central water supply and drainage system, a service building shall be provided for public use.

ON Full: Only piping that is too low to drain into a building sewer by gravity shall be drained to a sump or receiving tank.
ON Variations: Only piping that is too low to drain into a building sewer by gravity shall be drained to a sump or receiving tank.

ON Full: The requirements in Section 5.13 for dip tanks shall also apply to flow-coating operations described in Sentence (1).
ON Variations: The requirements in Section 5.13 for dip tanks shall also apply to flow-coating operations described in Sentence (1).

ON Full: Smoke dampers or combination smoke and fire dampers shall be installed in the vertical or horizontal position in which they were tested.
ON Variations: Smoke dampers or combination smoke and fire dampers shall be installed in the vertical or horizontal position in which they were tested.

ON Full: Shakes shall be spaced 6 mm to 9 mm apart and the joints in one course shall be separated not less than 40 mm from joints in adjacent courses.
ON Variations: Shakes shall be spaced 6 mm to 9 mm apart and the joints in one course shall be separated not less than 40 mm from joints in adjacent courses.

ON Full: Except where they serve storage garages, guards in industrial occupancies are permitted to consist of,(a) a top railing, and (b) one or more horizontal intermediate rails spaced such that the size of the openings through the guard prevents the passage of a spherical object having a diameter of 535 mm. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Except where they serve storage garages, guards in industrial occupancies are permitted to consist of,(a) a top railing, and (b) one or more horizontal intermediate rails spaced such that the size of the openings through the guard prevents the passage of a spherical object having a diameter of 535 mm. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Where the travel distance in Sentence (6) exceeds 45 m, an egress system serving the shelf and rack storage system shall be designed on the basis of a time-based egress analysis using the following criteria: occupant egress speed of 1 m/sec shall be used for horizontal egress routes within the shelf and rack storage system, occupant egress speed of 0.6 m/sec shall be used for vertical egress routes within the shelf and rack storage system, measured on the diagonal along the nosing of the stairs, occupant egress speed of 1.3 m/sec shall be used for horizontal egress routes along a main aisle on the ground floor level, each lift-gate shall be accorded an egress time of 10 seconds, each at-level conveyor cross-over shall be accorded a time of 5 seconds, and a safety factor of 1.5 shall be used in calculating the total egress time, the total egress time shall be calculated using the following formula:Total Egress Time = (Hp + Vp/0.6 + Hm/1.3 + 10Nlg + 5Nlc ) · 1.5 (in where: Hp = horizontal travel distance on the shelf and rack storage system, in metres, Vp = vertical travel distance on the shelf and rack storage system, in metres, Hm = horizontal travel distance on the main floor, in metres, Nlg = number of lift gates in the means of egress, Nlc = number of at-level cross overs in the means of egress, the total egress time from any point in the shelf and rack storage system shall be a maximum of 4 minutes, a fire alarm and detection system conforming to Subsection 3.2.4. shall be installed in the building, smoke detectors shall be provided under all solid decking and walkways, clearly identified and easily accessible pull stations shall be provided at egress stairs, conveyor cross-overs or lift-gates located along egress paths, and the occupant load on each level of the shelf and rack storage system shall not exceed 10 persons per egress stair. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Where the travel distance in Sentence (6) exceeds 45 m, an egress system serving the shelf and rack storage system shall be designed on the basis of a time-based egress analysis using the following criteria: occupant egress speed of 1 m/sec shall be used for horizontal egress routes within the shelf and rack storage system, occupant egress speed of 0.6 m/sec shall be used for vertical egress routes within the shelf and rack storage system, measured on the diagonal along the nosing of the stairs, occupant egress speed of 1.3 m/sec shall be used for horizontal egress routes along a main aisle on the ground floor level, each lift-gate shall be accorded an egress time of 10 seconds, each at-level conveyor cross-over shall be accorded a time of 5 seconds, and a safety factor of 1.5 shall be used in calculating the total egress time, the total egress time shall be calculated using the following formula:Total Egress Time = (Hp + Vp/0.6 + Hm/1.3 + 10Nlg + 5Nlc ) · 1.5 (in where: Hp = horizontal travel distance on the shelf and rack storage system, in metres, Vp = vertical travel distance on the shelf and rack storage system, in metres, Hm = horizontal travel distance on the main floor, in metres, Nlg = number of lift gates in the means of egress, Nlc = number of at-level cross overs in the means of egress, the total egress time from any point in the shelf and rack storage system shall be a maximum of 4 minutes, a fire alarm and detection system conforming to Subsection 3.2.4. shall be installed in the building, smoke detectors shall be provided under all solid decking and walkways, clearly identified and easily accessible pull stations shall be provided at egress stairs, conveyor cross-overs or lift-gates located along egress paths, and the occupant load on each level of the shelf and rack storage system shall not exceed 10 persons per egress stair. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Ventilation systems shall conform to Subsection 4.1.7. and Articles 4.12.8.2. to 4.12.8.5.
ON Variations: Ventilation systems shall conform to Subsection 4.1.7. and Articles 4.12.8.2. to 4.12.8.5.

ON Full: Torsional effects that are concurrent with the effects of the forces mentioned in Sentence (7) and are caused by the simultaneous actions of the following torsional moments shall be considered in the design of the structure according to Sentence (11): (a) torsional moments introduced by eccentricity between the centres of mass and resistance and their dynamic amplification, and (b) torsional moments due to accidental eccentricities.
ON Variations: Torsional effects that are concurrent with the effects of the forces mentioned in Sentence (7) and are caused by the simultaneous actions of the following torsional moments shall be considered in the design of the structure according to Sentence (11): (a) torsional moments introduced by eccentricity between the centres of mass and resistance and their dynamic amplification, and (b) torsional moments due to accidental eccentricities.

ON Full: Grease interceptors shall be selected and installed in conformance with,(a) CSA B481.0, "Material, Design, and Construction Requirements for Grease Interceptors", and (b) CSA B481.3, "Sizing, Selection, Location, and Installation of Grease Interceptors".
ON Variations: Grease interceptors shall be selected and installed in conformance with,(a) CSA B481.0, "Material, Design, and Construction Requirements for Grease Interceptors", and (b) CSA B481.3, "Sizing, Selection, Location, and Installation of Grease Interceptors".

ON Full: Except as permitted by this Section and by Sentence 3.4.2.1.(2), at the point where a doorway referred to in Sentence (8) opens onto a public corridor or exterior passageway, it shall be possible to go in opposite directions to each of two separate exits.
ON Variations: Except as permitted by this Section and by Sentence 3.4.2.1.(2), at the point where a doorway referred to in Sentence (8) opens onto a public corridor or exterior passageway, it shall be possible to go in opposite directions to each of two separate exits.

ON Full: The performance level of a building or part of a building is reduced where the new major occupancy in an existing building of multiple occupancy is not separated from adjoining major occupancies by fire separations having fire-resistance ratings conforming to Article 3.1.3.1., Subsection 9.10.9. or Table 10.3.2.2.B.
ON Variations: The performance level of a building or part of a building is reduced where the new major occupancy in an existing building of multiple occupancy is not separated from adjoining major occupancies by fire separations having fire-resistance ratings conforming to Article 3.1.3.1., Subsection 9.10.9. or Table 10.3.2.2.B.

ON Full: The cabinets and rooms referred to in Sentence 4.2.4.2.(4) shall not be located above or below the first storey.
ON Variations: The cabinets and rooms referred to in Sentence 4.2.4.2.(4) shall not be located above or below the first storey.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentences (2) and (3), the requirements in Subsection 3.2.4. shall apply.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentences (2) and (3), the requirements in Subsection 3.2.4. shall apply.

ON Full: The waterflow detecting devices required by Sentence (2) shall be connected to the fire alarm system to, initiate an alert signal in a two stage system or an alarm signal in a single stage system, and indicate separately on the fire alarm system annunciator the actuation of each device.
ON Variations: The waterflow detecting devices required by Sentence (2) shall be connected to the fire alarm system to, initiate an alert signal in a two stage system or an alarm signal in a single stage system, and indicate separately on the fire alarm system annunciator the actuation of each device.

ON Full: A shelf and rack storage system shall not exceed 7 m in height.
ON Variations: A shelf and rack storage system shall not exceed 7 m in height.

ON Full: For concrete block foundation walls required to be reinforced,(a) mortar shall be Type S, conforming to CSA A179, "Mortar and Grout for Unit Masonry", (b) grout shall be coarse, conforming to CSA A179, "Mortar and Grout for Unit Masonry", and (c) placement of grout shall conform to CSA A371, "Masonry Construction for Buildings".
ON Variations: For concrete block foundation walls required to be reinforced,(a) mortar shall be Type S, conforming to CSA A179, "Mortar and Grout for Unit Masonry", (b) grout shall be coarse, conforming to CSA A179, "Mortar and Grout for Unit Masonry", and (c) placement of grout shall conform to CSA A371, "Masonry Construction for Buildings".

ON Full: Where there is a possible source of ignition in a drying operation, interlocks shall be installed to provide for purging before the heating system can be started and for automatic shutdown if the ventilation system should fail.
ON Variations: Where there is a possible source of ignition in a drying operation, interlocks shall be installed to provide for purging before the heating system can be started and for automatic shutdown if the ventilation system should fail.

ON Full: Placards required in Sentence (1) shall identify the liquids stored as flammable liquids or combustible liquids, and capacities of the storage tanks.
ON Variations: Placards required in Sentence (1) shall identify the liquids stored as flammable liquids or combustible liquids, and capacities of the storage tanks.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentences (3) and (4), foundations shall be designed to have factored shear and overturning resistances greater than the lateral load capacity of the SFRS. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentences (3) and (4), foundations shall be designed to have factored shear and overturning resistances greater than the lateral load capacity of the SFRS. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: A public pool shall be equipped with lockable doors or other barriers capable of preventing public access to the pool deck.
ON Variations: A public pool shall be equipped with lockable doors or other barriers capable of preventing public access to the pool deck.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (2), strikeplates for deadbolts described in Sentence (4) shall be fastened,(a) to wood frames with wood screws that penetrate not less than 30 mm into solid wood, or (b) to metal frames with machine screws not smaller than No. 8 and not less than 10 mm long.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (2), strikeplates for deadbolts described in Sentence (4) shall be fastened,(a) to wood frames with wood screws that penetrate not less than 30 mm into solid wood, or (b) to metal frames with machine screws not smaller than No. 8 and not less than 10 mm long.

ON Full: An access to exit from an elevated platform level may be provided by means of open unenclosed stairs serving, not more than four platform levels, the highest of which shall be not more than 12 m above the main floor, where the shelf and rack storage system is intended for the storage of Class I, II, III and IV commodities, as defined in NFPA 13, "Installation of Sprinkler Systems", and not more than two platform levels, where the shelf and rack storage system is intended for the storage of Group A, B and C plastics and rubber tires, as defined in NFPA 13, "Installation of Sprinkler Systems".
ON Variations: An access to exit from an elevated platform level may be provided by means of open unenclosed stairs serving, not more than four platform levels, the highest of which shall be not more than 12 m above the main floor, where the shelf and rack storage system is intended for the storage of Class I, II, III and IV commodities, as defined in NFPA 13, "Installation of Sprinkler Systems", and not more than two platform levels, where the shelf and rack storage system is intended for the storage of Group A, B and C plastics and rubber tires, as defined in NFPA 13, "Installation of Sprinkler Systems".

ON Full: An interior linen chute or refuse chute shall extend not less than 1 m above the roof and shall be vented above the roof with a vent that, has an unobstructed area not less than the cross-sectional area of the chute, and is equipped with a cover that will open automatically, or that can be opened manually, in the event of a fire in the chute.
ON Variations: An interior linen chute or refuse chute shall extend not less than 1 m above the roof and shall be vented above the roof with a vent that, has an unobstructed area not less than the cross-sectional area of the chute, and is equipped with a cover that will open automatically, or that can be opened manually, in the event of a fire in the chute.

ON Full: Concrete thrust blocks shall have a minimum compressive strength of not less than 10 MPa after 28 days.
ON Variations: Concrete thrust blocks shall have a minimum compressive strength of not less than 10 MPa after 28 days.

ON Full: Where two or more wythes in walls other than cavity walls and masonry veneer/masonry back-up walls are tied together with metal ties of the individual rod type, the space between wythes shall be completely filled with mortar.
ON Variations: Where two or more wythes in walls other than cavity walls and masonry veneer/masonry back-up walls are tied together with metal ties of the individual rod type, the space between wythes shall be completely filled with mortar.

ON Full: Hardboard shall be not less than,(a) 3 mm thick where applied over continuous back-up, (b) 6 mm thick where applied to supports spaced not more than 406 mm o.c., and (c) 9 mm thick where applied to supports spaced not more than 610 mm o.c.
ON Variations: Hardboard shall be not less than,(a) 3 mm thick where applied over continuous back-up, (b) 6 mm thick where applied to supports spaced not more than 406 mm o.c., and (c) 9 mm thick where applied to supports spaced not more than 610 mm o.c.

ON Full: Combustible water distribution piping is permitted to partly or wholly penetrate a fire separation that is required to have a fire-resistance rating without being incorporated in the assembly at the time of testing as required in Sentence (3), provided the piping is protected with a fire stop in conformance with Sentence 3.1.9.4.(4).
ON Variations: Combustible water distribution piping is permitted to partly or wholly penetrate a fire separation that is required to have a fire-resistance rating without being incorporated in the assembly at the time of testing as required in Sentence (3), provided the piping is protected with a fire stop in conformance with Sentence 3.1.9.4.(4).

ON Full: The direct sound reduction index for the separating assembly in situ shall be determined from sound transmission loss in accordance with Clause (a) or (b), depending on the type of construction: (a) for a lightweight separating wall or floor assembly with wood or steel framing, the index shall be taken as equal to the sound transmission loss, without correction, (b) for a heavyweight separating wall or floor assembly of concrete or masonry, the index shall be determined in accordance with the detailed method for structure-borne transmission presented in ISO 15712-1, "Building Acoustics - Estimation of Acoustic Performance of Buildings From the Performance of Elements - Part 1: Airborne Sound Insulation Between Rooms".
ON Variations: The direct sound reduction index for the separating assembly in situ shall be determined from sound transmission loss in accordance with Clause (a) or (b), depending on the type of construction: (a) for a lightweight separating wall or floor assembly with wood or steel framing, the index shall be taken as equal to the sound transmission loss, without correction, (b) for a heavyweight separating wall or floor assembly of concrete or masonry, the index shall be determined in accordance with the detailed method for structure-borne transmission presented in ISO 15712-1, "Building Acoustics - Estimation of Acoustic Performance of Buildings From the Performance of Elements - Part 1: Airborne Sound Insulation Between Rooms".

ON Full: Despite Sentence (1), space between chip piles and exposing structures, yard equipment or stock shall not be less than 9 m.
ON Variations: Despite Sentence (1), space between chip piles and exposing structures, yard equipment or stock shall not be less than 9 m.

ON Full: Water service pipes and fire service mains shall be certified or conform to the standards for the materials listed in Table 7.2.11.2.
ON Variations: Water service pipes and fire service mains shall be certified or conform to the standards for the materials listed in Table 7.2.11.2.

ON Full: Asphalt and gravel or coal tar and gravel roofs may be constructed with lower slopes than required in Sentence (1) when effective drainage is provided by roof drains located at the lowest points on the roofs.
ON Variations: Asphalt and gravel or coal tar and gravel roofs may be constructed with lower slopes than required in Sentence (1) when effective drainage is provided by roof drains located at the lowest points on the roofs.

ON Full: OSB subflooring conforming to CSA O325, "Construction Sheathing", or to O-1 and O-2 grades in CSA O437.0, "OSB and Waferboard", and waferboard subflooring conforming to R-1 grade in CSA O437.0 shall be installed so that the direction of face orientation is at right angles to the joists and the joints parallel to the floor joists are staggered. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: OSB subflooring conforming to CSA O325, "Construction Sheathing", or to O-1 and O-2 grades in CSAÃ O437.0, "OSB and Waferboard", and waferboard subflooring conforming to R-1 grade in CSA O437.0 shall be installed so that the direction of face orientation is at right angles to the joists and the joints parallel to the floor joists are staggered. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Placards conforming to the Transportation of Dangerous Goods Regulations made under the Transportation of Dangerous Goods Act, 1992 (Canada) shall be posted in a conspicuous location outside the room containing storage tanks.
ON Variations: Placards conforming to the Transportation of Dangerous Goods Regulations made under the Transportation of Dangerous Goods Act, 1992 (Canada) shall be posted in a conspicuous location outside the room containing storage tanks.

ON Full: Type K or L copper tube shall be used for the potable water side of a heat exchanger in a pre-engineered wastewater heat recovery system.
ON Variations: Type K or L copper tube shall be used for the potable water side of a heat exchanger in a pre-engineered wastewater heat recovery system.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (2), wood-based panels for subfloors shall conform to,(a) CSA O121, "Douglas Fir Plywood", (b) CSA O151, "Canadian Softwood Plywood", (c) CSA O153, "Poplar Plywood", (d) CSA O325, "Construction Sheathing", or (e) CSA O437.0, "OSB and Waferboard".
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (2), wood-based panels for subfloors shall conform to,(a) CSA O121, "Douglas Fir Plywood", (b) CSA O151, "Canadian Softwood Plywood", (c) CSA O153, "Poplar Plywood", (d) CSA O325, "Construction Sheathing", or (e) CSA O437.0, "OSB and Waferboard".

ON Full: During demolition, fire fighting access routes shall be maintained in accordance with Section 2.5.
ON Variations: During demolition, fire fighting access routes shall be maintained in accordance with Section 2.5.

ON Full: An alarm line subject to freezing shall be cleared of all obstructions susceptible to freezing after the test specified in Sentence (1).
ON Variations: An alarm line subject to freezing shall be cleared of all obstructions susceptible to freezing after the test specified in Sentence (1).

ON Full: The termination of fixed piping for loading and unloading flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be not less than 60 m from a bridge or from an entrance to a tunnel.
ON Variations: The termination of fixed piping for loading and unloading flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be not less than 60 m from a bridge or from an entrance to a tunnel.

ON Full: Penetrations of the air barrier system, such as those created by the installation of electrical wiring, electrical boxes, piping or ductwork, shall be sealed with compatible material such as tape or caulking to maintain the integrity of the air barrier system over the entire surface.
ON Variations: Penetrations of the air barrier system, such as those created by the installation of electrical wiring, electrical boxes, piping or ductwork, shall be sealed with compatible material such as tape or caulking to maintain the integrity of the air barrier system over the entire surface.

ON Full: OSB conforming to CSA O325, "Construction Sheathing", shall meet the minimum panel mark of,(a) W16, on supports not more than 406 mm o.c., (b) W24, on supports not more than 610 mm o.c., and (c) W16, on supports not more than 610 mm o.c. where blocking is provided at midwall height.
ON Variations: OSB conforming to CSA O325, "Construction Sheathing", shall meet the minimum panel mark of,(a) W16, on supports not more than 406 mm o.c., (b) W24, on supports not more than 610 mm o.c., and (c) W16, on supports not more than 610 mm o.c. where blocking is provided at midwall height.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentences (9) and 4.1.7.6.(1), the gust effect factor, Cg, shall be one of the following values: (a) 2.0 for the building as a whole and main structural members, or (b) 2.5 for external pressures and suctions on secondary structural members including cladding.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentences (9) and 4.1.7.6.(1), the gust effect factor, Cg, shall be one of the following values: (a) 2.0 for the building as a whole and main structural members, or (b) 2.5 for external pressures and suctions on secondary structural members including cladding.

ON Full: In a Group B, Division 2 or 3 occupancy, the minimum clear width of doorways through which it is necessary to move a patient or resident in a bed shall be 1 050 mm. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: In a Group B, Division 2 or 3 occupancy, the minimum clear width of doorways through which it is necessary to move a patient or resident in a bed shall be 1 050 mm. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: The bottom of the cesspool shall be at least 900 mm above the high ground water table.
ON Variations: The bottom of the cesspool shall be at least 900 mm above the high ground water table.

ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentences (2) to (4), portable extinguishers shall be provided in conformance with Section 6.2.

ON Variations: Where a public pool is equipped with a diving board or a diving platform, the board or platform shall have a non-slip surface.

ON Variations: Where a washroom required in Sentence 3.13.6.2.(1) contains only one water closet and one lavatory, the washroom shall be designed in conformance with the requirements in Article 3.8.3.12.

ON Variations: Except as permitted in Sentence (2), roof systems of wood frame construction shall be tied to exterior masonry walls by not less than 12.7 mm diam anchor bolts,(a) spaced not more than 2.4 m apart, (b) embedded not less that 90 mm into the masonry, and (c) fastened to a rafter plate of not less than 38 mm thick lumber.

ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (2), heat recovery ventilators with rated capacities of not less than 25 L/s and not more than 200 L/s shall be installed in accordance with Article 9.32.3.11.

ON Variations: Portable extinguishers shall be inspected monthly.

ON Variations: If cylinders containing compressed gas are stored indoors, the cylinders shall be stored in a storage area or room that is dry and ventilated.

ON Variations: Separate containers shall be used exclusively for the storage of resin and organic peroxide.

ON Variations: The temperature of pump rooms shall be checked daily during freezing weather.

ON Variations: The penetration of a floor assembly by an exit or a vertical service space shall conform to the requirements of Sections 3.4. to 3.6.

ON Variations: Rectangular duct connections shall be made with S and drive cleats.

ON Variations: Landings for ramps in a barrier-free path of travel shall conform to the requirements in Article 3.8.3.4.

ON Variations: Masonry over openings shall be supported by steel, reinforced concrete lintels or masonry arches designed to support the imposed loads.

ON Full: The discharge piping from a pump or ejector shall be sized for optimum flow velocities at pump design conditions.
ON Variations: The discharge piping from a pump or ejector shall be sized for optimum flow velocities at pump design conditions.

ON Variations: This Section applies to the construction and use of joints and connections, and the arrangement, protection, support and testing of piping.

ON Full: For all arch roofs, curved roofs and domes, the wind exposure factor, Cw, shall be as prescribed in Table 4.1.6.10.
ON Variations: For all arch roofs, curved roofs and domes, the wind exposure factor, Cw, shall be as prescribed in Table 4.1.6.10.

ON Variations: Valves shall be closed and lines bled when equipment is not in actual use.

ON Variations: Where because of wet site conditions soil becomes mixed with the granular drainage material, sufficient additional granular material shall be provided so that the top 125 mm is kept free of soil.

ON Variations: Drains shall conform to Section 9.14.

ON Variations: Not less than a 3 mm gap shall be provided between sheets in cladding described in Sentence (1).

ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (3), below ground exterior environmental loads not described in MMAH Supplementary Standard SB-1, "Climatic and Seismic Data", shall be determined from existing geological and hydrological data or from site tests.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (6), maintenance shall not be carried out on piping systems while they are under pressure.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (6), maintenance shall not be carried out on piping systems while they are under pressure.

ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (3) and Article 9.13.3.1., floors-on-ground shall be dampproofed.

ON Variations: Single or multiple exhaust ducts serving the principal exhaust fan required by Sentence (1) shall be sized according to Part 6 except that they may be sized according to Table 9.32.3.4.B. where, (a) the longest total duct length, from intake grille to outdoor hood, does not exceed 12 m, and (b) the number of elbows does not exceed 4, but, in any case, they shall not be smaller than recommended by the manufacturer of the fan.

ON Full: Partitions or walls shall be provided to ensure privacy of dressing rooms, washrooms and shower areas.
ON Variations: Partitions or walls shall be provided to ensure privacy of dressing rooms, washrooms and shower areas.

ON Variations: Except where no space is provided between ladder treads and the spa wall, the space between the spa wall and submerged portions of any treads of a ladder for entry into and egress from the water shall be not more than 150 mm and not less than 75 mm.

ON Variations: Each door to an electrical equipment vault shall be provided with a substantial lock or padlock.

ON Variations: For the purpose of calculating deflections, it is permitted to use a value for V based on the value for Ta determined in Clause 4.1.8.11.(3)(d) to obtain Vd in Sentences (8) and (9).

ON Full: Accumulations of waste dust from dry powder finishes shall be removed by vacuum cleaning equipment.
ON Variations: Accumulations of waste dust from dry powder finishes shall be removed by vacuum cleaning equipment.

ON Full: Public amusement areas located in buildings shall be designed so that they do not create a fire hazard to the public using the facility.
ON Variations: Public amusement areas located in buildings shall be designed so that they do not create a fire hazard to the public using the facility.

ON Variations: Tanks built in conformance with Clauses (1)(a), (b) and (c) shall be used only for the storage of crude petroleum at oil fields.

ON Variations: Access required in Sentence (1) is also permitted to be provided by an interior stair accessible from the outdoors.

ON Variations: Structures not classified as irregular according to Sentence 4.1.8.6.(1) may be considered regular.

ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (2), the requirements in Subsection 3.7.4. shall apply.

ON Full: The trip time for the tests described in Sentences (2) and (4) may exceed the acceptance trip time by not more than 10%.
ON Variations: The trip time for the tests described in Sentences (2) and (4) may exceed the acceptance trip time by not more than 10%.

ON Variations: Access routes shall be provided to a building so that, for a building provided with a fire department connection, a fire department pumper vehicle can be located adjacent to the hydrants referred to in Article 3.2.5.16., for a building not provided with a fire department connection, a fire department pumper vehicle can be located so that the length of the access route from a hydrant to the vehicle plus the unobstructed path of travel for the firefighter from the vehicle to the building is not more than 90 m, and the unobstructed path of travel for the firefighter from the vehicle to the building is not more than 45 m.

ON Full: Not less than a 100 mm clearance shall be provided between the back and sides of a solid fuel-burning fireplace and combustible framing, except that a 50 mm clearance is permitted where the fireplace is located in an exterior wall.
ON Variations: Not less than a 100 mm clearance shall be provided between the back and sides of a solid fuel-burning fireplace and combustible framing, except that a 50 mm clearance is permitted where the fireplace is located in an exterior wall.

ON Full: Where a ceiling construction has a suspended membrane ceiling with lay-in panels or tiles that contribute to the required fire-resistance rating, hold down clips or other means shall be provided to prevent the lifting of such panels or tiles in the event of a fire.
ON Variations: Where a ceiling construction has a suspended membrane ceiling with lay-in panels or tiles that contribute to the required fire-resistance rating, hold down clips or other means shall be provided to prevent the lifting of such panels or tiles in the event of a fire.

ON Full: Screening shall be of rust-proof material.
ON Variations: Screening shall be of rust-proof material.

ON Full: Cement-mortar shall not be used for jointing.
ON Variations: Cement-mortar shall not be used for jointing.

ON Full: Subject to Sentence (5), connections used as part of normal operating conditions for filling or emptying underground storage tanks shall be located outside buildings, at a location free of sources of ignition, and not less than 1.5 m away from building openings.
ON Variations: Subject to Sentence (5), connections used as part of normal operating conditions for filling or emptying underground storage tanks shall be located outside buildings, at a location free of sources of ignition, and not less than 1.5 m away from building openings.

ON Full: A ventilation system required in this Subsection shall be provided with monitoring devices that,(a) indicate that the ventilation system is in operation, and (b) sound an alarm if the ventilation system is malfunctioning.
ON Variations: A ventilation system required in this Subsection shall be provided with monitoring devices that,(a) indicate that the ventilation system is in operation, and (b) sound an alarm if the ventilation system is malfunctioning.

ON Full: Where leased areas are located on opposite sides of a means of egress, the width of the means of egress shall not be reduced to less than 5 m.
ON Variations: Where leased areas are located on opposite sides of a means of egress, the width of the means of egress shall not be reduced to less than 5 m.

ON Full: Where a covered mall is used for the display of fueled equipment, batteries shall be disconnected and caps for fuel tanks shall be locked or secured against tampering.
ON Variations: Where a covered mall is used for the display of fueled equipment, batteries shall be disconnected and caps for fuel tanks shall be locked or secured against tampering.

ON Full: An exposing building face of an open-air storey in a storage garage is permitted to have unlimited unprotected openings provided it has a limiting distance not less than 3 m.
ON Variations: An exposing building face of an open-air storey in a storage garage is permitted to have unlimited unprotected openings provided it has a limiting distance not less than 3 m.

ON Full: Where self-contained emergency lighting units are used, they shall conform to CSA C22.2 No. 141, "Emergency Lighting Equipment".
ON Variations: Where self-contained emergency lighting units are used, they shall conform to CSA C22.2 No. 141, "Emergency Lighting Equipment".

ON Full: In single-course application, joints in succeeding courses shall be offset at least 40 mm so that joints in any two of three consecutive courses are staggered.
ON Variations: In single-course application, joints in succeeding courses shall be offset at least 40 mm so that joints in any two of three consecutive courses are staggered.

ON Full: Despite Article 3.2.1.9., other water supply systems or other measures may be used if the systems or measures will provide sufficient fire suppression capability in the circumstances and if the systems or measures are approved.
ON Variations: Despite Article 3.2.1.9., other water supply systems or other measures may be used if the systems or measures will provide sufficient fire suppression capability in the circumstances and if the systems or measures are approved.

ON Full: Where a water service pipe is supplied with water by more than one drinking water system, a check valve shall be installed at each connection with a drinking water system.
ON Variations: Where a water service pipe is supplied with water by more than one drinking water system, a check valve shall be installed at each connection with a drinking water system.

ON Full: A fire damper shall be installed in the vertical or horizontal position in which it was tested.
ON Variations: A fire damper shall be installed in the vertical or horizontal position in which it was tested.

ON Full: A fire pump having a rated net head pressure greater than 280 kPa shall be installed in accordance with the requirements of NFPA 20, "Installation of Stationary Pumps for Fire Protection". (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: A fire pump having a rated net head pressure greater than 280 kPa shall be installed in accordance with the requirements of NFPA 20, "Installation of Stationary Pumps for Fire Protection". (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentences (4) and (5), a relief vent shall be connected to the branch that forms part of a circuit vented system, downstream of the connection of the most downstream circuit vented fixture.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentences (4) and (5), a relief vent shall be connected to the branch that forms part of a circuit vented system, downstream of the connection of the most downstream circuit vented fixture.

ON Full: Waterproof finish shall be provided to a height of not less than,(a) 1 800 mm above the floor in shower stalls, (b) 1 200 mm above the rims of bathtubs equipped with showers, and (c) 400 mm above the rims of bathtubs not equipped with showers.
ON Variations: Waterproof finish shall be provided to a height of not less than,(a) 1 800 mm above the floor in shower stalls, (b) 1 200 mm above the rims of bathtubs equipped with showers, and (c) 400 mm above the rims of bathtubs not equipped with showers.

ON Full: A rooftop enclosure for elevator machinery or for a service room shall be constructed in accordance with the type of construction required by Articles 3.2.2.20. to 3.2.2.83.
ON Variations: A rooftop enclosure for elevator machinery or for a service room shall be constructed in accordance with the type of construction required by Articles 3.2.2.20. to 3.2.2.83.

ON Full: If a fixed ladder is installed to provide access to a roof of a building, the design and installation of the attachment and anchorage system for the ladder shall be as described in MMAH Supplementary Standard SB-8, "Design, Construction and Installation of Anchorage System for Fixed Access Ladders".
ON Variations: If a fixed ladder is installed to provide access to a roof of a building, the design and installation of the attachment and anchorage system for the ladder shall be as described in MMAH Supplementary Standard SB-8, "Design, Construction and Installation of Anchorage System for Fixed Access Ladders".

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentences (2) to (4) and (6), each exposing building face and any exterior wall located above an exposing building face that encloses an attic or roof space shall be constructed in conformance with Subsection 9.10.8.,(a) for the exposing building face as a whole, or (b) for any number of separate portions of the exposing building face.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentences (2) to (4) and (6), each exposing building face and any exterior wall located above an exposing building face that encloses an attic or roof space shall be constructed in conformance with Subsection 9.10.8.,(a) for the exposing building face as a whole, or (b) for any number of separate portions of the exposing building face.

ON Full: Where a screen or grille required by Sentences (8) and (10) has a screen mesh less than 6 mm, the screen or grille shall be removable for cleaning.
ON Variations: Where a screen or grille required by Sentences (8) and (10) has a screen mesh less than 6 mm, the screen or grille shall be removable for cleaning.

ON Full: Except for doors and corridors, the width of every exit facility shall be not less than 900 mm.
ON Variations: Except for doors and corridors, the width of every exit facility shall be not less than 900 mm.

ON Full: Where the imposed load does not exceed 36 kN, adjustable steel columns shall conform to CAN/CGSB-7.2, "Adjustable Steel Columns".
ON Variations: Where the imposed load does not exceed 36 kN, adjustable steel columns shall conform to CAN/CGSB-7.2, "Adjustable Steel Columns".

ON Full: Windows, doors, skylights and their components shall be designed and constructed in accordance with,(a) Article 5.10.2.2., where they are covered in the scope of the standards listed in Sentence 5.10.2.2.(1), or (b) Article 5.1.4.1. and Sections 5.4. and 5.6., in other cases. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Windows, doors, skylights and their components shall be designed and constructed in accordance with,(a) Article 5.10.2.2., where they are covered in the scope of the standards listed in Sentence 5.10.2.2.(1), or (b) Article 5.1.4.1. and Sections 5.4. and 5.6., in other cases. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Class I liquids shall be dispensed or transferred inside buildings only in conformance with Subsections 4.1.7. and 4.1.8.
ON Variations: Class I liquids shall be dispensed or transferred inside buildings only in conformance with Subsections 4.1.7. and 4.1.8.

ON Full: When an aboveground storage tank will be out of service or unsupervised for a period not exceeding 180 days, the piping from the tank shall be capped or the valves necessary to achieve similar isolation of the tank shall be closed and securely locked.
ON Variations: When an aboveground storage tank will be out of service or unsupervised for a period not exceeding 180 days, the piping from the tank shall be capped or the valves necessary to achieve similar isolation of the tank shall be closed and securely locked.

ON Full: Except as permitted by Sentence (4), the required fire-resistance rating of a firewall, except for closures, shall be provided by masonry or concrete.
ON Variations: Except as permitted by Sentence (4), the required fire-resistance rating of a firewall, except for closures, shall be provided by masonry or concrete.

ON Full: Communication, interaction and coordination between the designer and the person responsible for the geotechnical aspects of the project shall take place to a degree commensurate with the complexity and requirements of the project.
ON Variations: Communication, interaction and coordination between the designer and the person responsible for the geotechnical aspects of the project shall take place to a degree commensurate with the complexity and requirements of the project.

ON Full: The length of a landing described in Sentence (2) shall be measured perpendicular to the nosings of adjacent treads or to the end of the ramp, at a distance equal to half the length required by Sentence (2) from the narrow edge of the landing.
ON Variations: The length of a landing described in Sentence (2) shall be measured perpendicular to the nosings of adjacent treads or to the end of the ramp, at a distance equal to half the length required by Sentence (2) from the narrow edge of the landing.

ON Full: Air-supported structures not occupied by the public need not be separated from one another, and are permitted to be erected closer than 3 m from other structures on the same property where such closer spacing does not create a hazard to the building occupants or the public.
ON Variations: Air-supported structures not occupied by the public need not be separated from one another, and are permitted to be erected closer than 3 m from other structures on the same property where such closer spacing does not create a hazard to the building occupants or the public.

ON Full: Where there are a number of similar components, the net increase in force is permitted to be based on the total area for all similar components as opposed to the summation of forces of individual elements.
ON Variations: Where there are a number of similar components, the net increase in force is permitted to be based on the total area for all similar components as opposed to the summation of forces of individual elements.

ON Full: Sprinklers shall be protected by sprinkler guards where there is the possibility of mechanical damage.
ON Variations: Sprinklers shall be protected by sprinkler guards where there is the possibility of mechanical damage.

ON Full: Handrails shall be provided in aisles with steps in conformance with Table 3.3.2.8A.
ON Variations: Handrails shall be provided in aisles with steps in conformance with Table 3.3.2.8A.

ON Full: Where no exit is visible from a public corridor, from a corridor used by the public in a Group A or B major occupancy or from principal routes serving an open floor area having an occupant load of more than 150, an exit sign conforming to Clauses (2)(b) and (c) with an arrow or other indicator pointing at the direction of egress shall be provided.
ON Variations: Where no exit is visible from a public corridor, from a corridor used by the public in a Group A or B major occupancy or from principal routes serving an open floor area having an occupant load of more than 150, an exit sign conforming to Clauses (2)(b) and (c) with an arrow or other indicator pointing at the direction of egress shall be provided.

ON Full: Where the air barrier system consists of flexible sheet material, all joints shall be,(a) sealed with compatible material such as tape or flexible sealant, or (b) except as required by Sentence (3), lapped not less than 100 mm and clamped, such as between framing members, furring or blocking and rigid panels.
ON Variations: Where the air barrier system consists of flexible sheet material, all joints shall be,(a) sealed with compatible material such as tape or flexible sealant, or (b) except as required by Sentence (3), lapped not less than 100 mm and clamped, such as between framing members, furring or blocking and rigid panels.

ON Full: The water level in gravity tanks shall be inspected monthly.
ON Variations: The water level in gravity tanks shall be inspected monthly.

ON Full: Subject to Sentence (3), piping systems shall not be made of materials that are subject to failure from internal stress or rupture by mechanical damage, or are subject to failure in fires because they are combustible or have a low melting point.
ON Variations: Subject to Sentence (3), piping systems shall not be made of materials that are subject to failure from internal stress or rupture by mechanical damage, or are subject to failure in fires because they are combustible or have a low melting point.

ON Full: Portable extinguishers shall supplement fixed fire protection in Part 5 in accordance with Article 6.2.6.9. where a flammable liquid or combustible liquid is stored in an open container and where the liquid surface area exceeds 0.4 m2.
ON Variations: Portable extinguishers shall supplement fixed fire protection in Part 5 in accordance with Article 6.2.6.9. where a flammable liquid or combustible liquid is stored in an open container and where the liquid surface area exceeds 0.4 m2.

ON Full: This Subsection applies to flow-coating operations using flammable liquids or combustible liquids.
ON Variations: This Subsection applies to flow-coating operations using flammable liquids or combustible liquids.

ON Full: Ribbon boards referred to in Sentence (1) shall be not less than 19 mm by 89 mm lumber let into the studs.
ON Variations: Ribbon boards referred to in Sentence (1) shall be not less than 19 mm by 89 mm lumber let into the studs.

ON Full: Where the quantity of combustible material present is such that fires of severe magnitude may be expected, such as in woodworking, auto repair, aircraft servicing, mercantile storage areas, warehouses with high-piled combustibles and processes incorporating flammable liquids or combustible liquids, the occupancy shall be graded as extra hazard.
ON Variations: Where the quantity of combustible material present is such that fires of severe magnitude may be expected, such as in woodworking, auto repair, aircraft servicing, mercantile storage areas, warehouses with high-piled combustibles and processes incorporating flammable liquids or combustible liquids, the occupancy shall be graded as extra hazard.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (2), the specified live load on an area of floor or roof depends on the intended use and occupancy, and shall not be less than whichever of the following loads produces the most critical effect: (a) the uniformly distributed load patterns listed in Article 4.1.5.3., (b) the loads due to the intended use and occupancy, or (c) the concentrated loads listed in Article 4.1.5.9. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (2), the specified live load on an area of floor or roof depends on the intended use and occupancy, and shall not be less than whichever of the following loads produces the most critical effect: (a) the uniformly distributed load patterns listed in Article 4.1.5.3., (b) the loads due to the intended use and occupancy, or (c) the concentrated loads listed in Article 4.1.5.9. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Steel used in foundations or in support of soil or rock shall conform with the appropriate requirements of Subsections 4.3.3. or 4.3.4., unless otherwise specified in this Section.
ON Variations: Steel used in foundations or in support of soil or rock shall conform with the appropriate requirements of Subsections 4.3.3. or 4.3.4., unless otherwise specified in this Section.

ON Full: Mechanical joints shall be made with compounded elastomeric couplings or rings held by stainless steel or cast iron clamps or contained within a compression connection or groove and shoulder type mechanical coupling. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Mechanical joints shall be made with compounded elastomeric couplings or rings held by stainless steel or cast iron clamps or contained within a compression connection or groove and shoulder type mechanical coupling. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentences (2) to (5) and 3.3.3.2.(5), every door in a fire separation shall be equipped with a self-closing device designed to return the door to the closed position after each use.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentences (2) to (5) and 3.3.3.2.(5), every door in a fire separation shall be equipped with a self-closing device designed to return the door to the closed position after each use.

ON Full: Unit masonry pilasters required in Sentence (1) shall be not less than 100 mm by 290 mm.
ON Variations: Unit masonry pilasters required in Sentence (1) shall be not less than 100 mm by 290 mm.

ON Full: Subject to Sentences (2) and (3), hay, straw, shavings or similar combustible materials shall not be used within a tent or air-supported structure used for an assembly occupancy.
ON Variations: Subject to Sentences (2) and (3), hay, straw, shavings or similar combustible materials shall not be used within a tent or air-supported structure used for an assembly occupancy.

ON Full: A manhole shall be provided with,(a) a cover which shall provide an airtight seal if located within a building, (b) a rigid ladder of a corrosion-resistant material where the depth exceeds 1 000 mm, and (c) a vent to the exterior if the manhole is located within a building.
ON Variations: A manhole shall be provided with,(a) a cover which shall provide an airtight seal if located within a building, (b) a rigid ladder of a corrosion-resistant material where the depth exceeds 1 000 mm, and (c) a vent to the exterior if the manhole is located within a building.

ON Full: An emergency power supply conforming to Article 3.2.7.8. shall be provided for the fire alarm system.
ON Variations: An emergency power supply conforming to Article 3.2.7.8. shall be provided for the fire alarm system.

ON Full: An aisle serving a shelf and rack storage system shall have a clear-aisle width of not less than 760 mm.
ON Variations: An aisle serving a shelf and rack storage system shall have a clear-aisle width of not less than 760 mm.

ON Full: The earthquake importance factor, IE, shall be determined according to Table 4.1.8.5.
ON Variations: The earthquake importance factor, IE, shall be determined according to Table 4.1.8.5.

ON Full: Except when the insulation provides the drainage layer required in Clause (2)(a), when exterior insulation is provided, the drainage layer shall be installed on the exterior face of the insulation.
ON Variations: Except when the insulation provides the drainage layer required in Clause (2)(a), when exterior insulation is provided, the drainage layer shall be installed on the exterior face of the insulation.

ON Full: Except as provided in Articles 5.12.9.3. and 5.12.9.4., drying or curing equipment that utilizes components capable of producing ignition, such as an open flame, a spark, or a hot surface, shall not be installed in or near a spraying area.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Articles 5.12.9.3. and 5.12.9.4., drying or curing equipment that utilizes components capable of producing ignition, such as an open flame, a spark, or a hot surface, shall not be installed in or near a spraying area.

ON Full: Except as permitted in Sentence (2), wood framing members that are not pressure-treated with a wood preservative and that are supported on concrete in contact with the ground or fill shall be separated from the concrete by not less than 0.05 mm polyethylene film or Type S roll roofing.
ON Variations: Except as permitted in Sentence (2), wood framing members that are not pressure-treated with a wood preservative and that are supported on concrete in contact with the ground or fill shall be separated from the concrete by not less than 0.05 mm polyethylene film or Type S roll roofing.

ON Full: Every chamber or leaching chamber shall contain only one pressurized distribution pipe.
ON Variations: Every chamber or leaching chamber shall contain only one pressurized distribution pipe.

ON Full: For buildings other than post-disaster buildings, seismically isolated buildings and buildings with supplemental energy dissipation systems, where IEFaSa(0.2) is less than 0.35, the requirements of Sentence (1) need not apply to Categories 6 through 22 of Table 4.1.8.18.
ON Variations: For buildings other than post-disaster buildings, seismically isolated buildings and buildings with supplemental energy dissipation systems, where IEFaSa(0.2) is less than 0.35, the requirements of Sentence (1) need not apply to Categories 6 through 22 of Table 4.1.8.18.

ON Full: Where a pump or siphon is required, the pump or siphon shall be equipped with a device that shall produce an audible and visual alarm signal that indicates a high water level in the pump or siphon chamber.
ON Variations: Where a pump or siphon is required, the pump or siphon shall be equipped with a device that shall produce an audible and visual alarm signal that indicates a high water level in the pump or siphon chamber.

ON Full: Measures shall be taken to limit movement of smoke from a fire in a floor area below the lowest exit storey into upper storeys.
ON Variations: Measures shall be taken to limit movement of smoke from a fire in a floor area below the lowest exit storey into upper storeys.

ON Full: The deflection limits required in Sentence (3) do not apply to industrial buildings or sheds if experience has proven that greater movement will have no significant adverse effects on the strength and function of the building.
ON Variations: The deflection limits required in Sentence (3) do not apply to industrial buildings or sheds if experience has proven that greater movement will have no significant adverse effects on the strength and function of the building.

ON Full: If buildings are separated by a firewall, combustible projections on the exterior of one building, including balconies, platforms, canopies, eave projections and stairs, that extend outward beyond the end of the firewall, shall not be permitted within 2.4 m of combustible projections and window or door openings of the adjacent building.
ON Variations: If buildings are separated by a firewall, combustible projections on the exterior of one building, including balconies, platforms, canopies, eave projections and stairs, that extend outward beyond the end of the firewall, shall not be permitted within 2.4 m of combustible projections and window or door openings of the adjacent building.

ON Full: Except as otherwise stated, requirements for containers in this Part shall also apply to portable tanks described in Sentence (1).
ON Variations: Except as otherwise stated, requirements for containers in this Part shall also apply to portable tanks described in Sentence (1).

ON Full: Strapping described in Sentence (1) and Clause (3)(b) is not required where,(a) furring strips complying with Table 9.29.3.1. are fastened directly to the joists, or (b) a panel-type ceiling finish complying with Subsection 9.29.5., 9.29.6., 9.29.7., 9.29.8., or 9.29.9. is attached directly to the joists.
ON Variations: Strapping described in Sentence (1) and Clause (3)(b) is not required where,(a) furring strips complying with Table 9.29.3.1. are fastened directly to the joists, or (b) a panel-type ceiling finish complying with Subsection 9.29.5., 9.29.6., 9.29.7., 9.29.8., or 9.29.9. is attached directly to the joists.

ON Full: In an elementary or secondary school, if there is a group of hazardous classrooms or a group of hazardous classrooms and ancillary rooms of a complementary use, the fire separation required by Sentence (4) or (5) need not be provided within the group but the fire separation is required between the group and the remainder of the building.
ON Variations: In an elementary or secondary school, if there is a group of hazardous classrooms or a group of hazardous classrooms and ancillary rooms of a complementary use, the fire separation required by Sentence (4) or (5) need not be provided within the group but the fire separation is required between the group and the remainder of the building.

ON Full: If a fill piping system has an offset component from the fill point on the underground storage tank, fill pipes shall be double-walled, sloped to the storage tank, and electronically monitored for leak detection.
ON Variations: If a fill piping system has an offset component from the fill point on the underground storage tank, fill pipes shall be double-walled, sloped to the storage tank, and electronically monitored for leak detection.

ON Full: Exit doors shall be clearly identifiable. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Exit doors shall be clearly identifiable. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Sentence (2) does not apply to any leaching bed fill added as backfill above the stone layer in which the distribution pipe is located.
ON Variations: Sentence (2) does not apply to any leaching bed fill added as backfill above the stone layer in which the distribution pipe is located.

ON Full: The size of the opening between any two adjacent vertical elements within a guard shall not exceed the limits required by Part 3 when each of these elements is subjected to a specified live load of 0.1 kN applied in opposite directions in the in-plane direction of the guard so as to produce the most critical effect.
ON Variations: The size of the opening between any two adjacent vertical elements within a guard shall not exceed the limits required by Part 3 when each of these elements is subjected to a specified live load of 0.1 kN applied in opposite directions in the in-plane direction of the guard so as to produce the most critical effect.

ON Full: Except as provided by Sentences (2) to (16) and Sentence 3.7.4.2.(9), the number of water closets required for assembly occupancies shall conform to Table 3.7.4.3.A.
ON Variations: Except as provided by Sentences (2) to (16) and Sentence 3.7.4.2.(9), the number of water closets required for assembly occupancies shall conform to Table 3.7.4.3.A.

ON Full: Systems through which tank cars or tank vehicles discharge into storage tanks by means of a pump shall be provided with backflow preventers located to prevent spills and inadvertent mixing of liquids.
ON Variations: Systems through which tank cars or tank vehicles discharge into storage tanks by means of a pump shall be provided with backflow preventers located to prevent spills and inadvertent mixing of liquids.

ON Full: Where existing interior walls or ceilings or floor assemblies or roof assemblies are substantially removed and new interior walls, ceilings, floor assemblies or roof assemblies are installed in an existing building or part of an existing building that is a retirement home, the following requirements apply: the retirement home shall be sprinklered, a voice communication system conforming to Article 3.2.4.23. shall be provided in the building, if Clause 3.2.6.8.(1)(b) or (c), as applicable, requires that such a voice communication system be provided in the building, and doors to suites and sleeping rooms not within suites in the retirement home, other than doors leading directly to the exterior, shall be equipped with self-closing devices.
