mm if the pipe size is less than 6 in., (b) lead pipe is supported throughout its length, (c) cast iron pipe is supported, (i) at or adjacent to each hub or joint, (ii) at intervals not exceeding 3 m, and (iii) at intervals not exceeding 1 000 mm if the pipe has mechanical joints and the length of pipe between adjacent fittings is 300 mm or less, (d) reserved (e) ABS or PVC plastic DWV pipe is supported, (i) at intervals not exceeding 1 200 mm, (ii) at the ends of branches, (iii) at changes of direction or elevation, and (iv) if the pipe is a fixture drain that is more than 1 000 mm in length, as close as possible to the trap, (f) plastic water pipe is supported at intervals not exceeding 1 000 mm, (g) copper tube and copper and brass pipe is supported at intervals not exceeding, (i) 3 m if the tube or pipe is hard temper and larger than 1 in. in size, (ii) 2 500 mm if the tube or pipe is hard temper and 1 in. in size or less, and (iii) 2 500 mm if the tube is soft temper, (h) aluminum DWV pipe is supported, (i) at intervals not greater than 3 m, (ii) at both sides of all joints, (iii) at all branch ends, (iv) at all points where there is a change in direction, and (v) as close to all traps as possible, (i) supports and hangers for aluminum DWV pipe shall have a broad support base and shall be free of burrs and rough edges to prevent abrasion of the pipe, (j) where joints in the piping are less rigid than the pipe, the support points shall be selected so as to minimize the shear and bending forces imposed on the joints, (k) PE/AL/PE or PEX/AL/PEX composite pipe is supported at intervals not exceeding 1 000 mm, (l) PP-R plastic pipe is supported, (i) at intervals not exceeding 1 000 mm, (ii) at the end of branches, and (iii) at changes of direction and elevation, and (m) stainless steel pipe or tube is supported at intervals not exceeding, (i) 3 000 mm if the pipe or tube size is 1 in. or more, and (ii) 2 500 mm if the pipe or tube size is less than 1 in.
ON Variations: Nominally horizontal piping shall be supported so that,(a) galvanized iron or steel pipe is supported at intervals not exceeding, (i) 3.75 m if the pipe size is 6 in. or more, and (ii) 2 500 mm if the pipe size is less than 6 in., (b) lead pipe is supported throughout its length, (c) cast iron pipe is supported, (i) at or adjacent to each hub or joint, (ii) at intervals not exceeding 3 m, and (iii) at intervals not exceeding 1 000 mm if the pipe has mechanical joints and the length of pipe between adjacent fittings is 300 mm or less, (d) reserved (e) ABS or PVC plastic DWV pipe is supported, (i) at intervals not exceeding 1 200 mm, (ii) at the ends of branches, (iii) at changes of direction or elevation, and (iv) if the pipe is a fixture drain that is more than 1 000 mm in length, as close as possible to the trap, (f) plastic water pipe is supported at intervals not exceeding 1 000 mm, (g) copper tube and copper and brass pipe is supported at intervals not exceeding, (i) 3 m if the tube or pipe is hard temper and larger than 1 in. in size, (ii) 2 500 mm if the tube or pipe is hard temper and 1 in. in size or less, and (iii) 2 500 mm if the tube is soft temper, (h) aluminum DWV pipe is supported, (i) at intervals not greater than 3 m, (ii) at both sides of all joints, (iii) at all branch ends, (iv) at all points where there is a change in direction, and (v) as close to all traps as possible, (i) supports and hangers for aluminum DWV pipe shall have a broad support base and shall be free of burrs and rough edges to prevent abrasion of the pipe, (j) where joints in the piping are less rigid than the pipe, the support points shall be selected so as to minimize the shear and bending forces imposed on the joints, (k) PE/AL/PE or PEX/AL/PEX composite pipe is supported at intervals not exceeding 1 000 mm, (l) PP-R plastic pipe is supported, (i) at intervals not exceeding 1 000 mm, (ii) at the end of branches, and (iii) at changes of direction and elevation, and (m) stainless steel pipe or tube is supported at intervals not exceeding, (i) 3 000 mm if the pipe or tube size is 1 in. or more, and (ii) 2 500 mm if the pipe or tube size is less than 1 in.

ON Full: Except for storeys below the first storey, direct access for firefighting shall be provided from the outdoors to every storey that is not sprinklered and whose floor level is less than 25 m above grade, by at least one unobstructed window or access panel for each 15 m of wall in each wall required to face a street by Subsection 3.2.2.
ON Variations: Except for storeys below the first storey, direct access for firefighting shall be provided from the outdoors to every storey that is not sprinklered and whose floor level is less than 25 m above grade, by at least one unobstructed window or access panel for each 15 m of wall in each wall required to face a street by Subsection 3.2.2.

ON Full: Soft storage beds may be used for logs where embedment of stones or cinders may cause damage to cutting knives.
ON Variations: Soft storage beds may be used for logs where embedment of stones or cinders may cause damage to cutting knives.

ON Full: Stairways, handrails and guards in a means of egress shall conform to the requirements in 9.8. as well as to the requirements in this Section.
ON Variations: Stairways, handrails and guards in a means of egress shall conform to the requirements in 9.8. as well as to the requirements in this Section.

ON Full: In addition to the requirements of Sentence (2), in a care occupancy, a care and treatment occupancy or a retirement home, a fire drill for supervisory staff shall be carried out at least once during each 12-month period for an approved scenario representing the lowest staffing level complement in the occupancy in order to confirm that the requirements of Sentence 2.8.2.2.(1) have been met.
ON Variations: In addition to the requirements of Sentence (2), in a care occupancy, a care and treatment occupancy or a retirement home, a fire drill for supervisory staff shall be carried out at least once during each 12-month period for an approved scenario representing the lowest staffing level complement in the occupancy in order to confirm that the requirements of Sentence 2.8.2.2.(1) have been met.

ON Full: Except as required in Article 6.2.6.5., portable extinguishers for Class A fires shall be provided in conformance with Table 6.2.6.A.
ON Variations: Except as required in Article 6.2.6.5., portable extinguishers for Class A fires shall be provided in conformance with Table 6.2.6.A.

ON Full: A grease interceptor shall not serve as a fixture trap and each fixture discharging through the interceptor shall be trapped and vented.
ON Variations: A grease interceptor shall not serve as a fixture trap and each fixture discharging through the interceptor shall be trapped and vented.

ON Full: If a fire alarm system is required to be installed and a two stage system is provided, the system shall be designed to notify the fire department, in conformance with Sentence (4), that an alert signal has been initiated.
ON Variations: If a fire alarm system is required to be installed and a two stage system is provided, the system shall be designed to notify the fire department, in conformance with Sentence (4), that an alert signal has been initiated.

ON Full: A building shall not be constructed over an existing buried flammable gas main unless the gas main is encased in a gas-tight conduit in conformance with CAN/CSA-Z662, "Oil and Gas Pipeline Systems".
ON Variations: A building shall not be constructed over an existing buried flammable gas main unless the gas main is encased in a gas-tight conduit in conformance with CAN/CSA-Z662, "Oil and Gas Pipeline Systems".

ON Full: Foundations need not be designed to resist the lateral load overturning capacity of the SFRS, provided the design and the Rd and Ro for the type of SFRS used conform to Table 4.1.8.9. and the foundation is designed in accordance with Sentence 4.1.8.16.(4).
ON Variations: Foundations need not be designed to resist the lateral load overturning capacity of the SFRS, provided the design and the Rd and Ro for the type of SFRS used conform to Table 4.1.8.9. and the foundation is designed in accordance with Sentence 4.1.8.16.(4).

ON Full: Where an adjacent building provides substantial sheltering effect, the wind loads for the main structural system shall be no lower than 80% of the loads determined from tests described in Sentence (1) with the effect of the sheltering building removed as applied to, (a) the base shear force for buildings with ratio of height to minimum effective width, as described in Sentence 4.1.7.2.(2), less than or equal to 1.0, or (b) the base moment for buildings with a ratio of height to minimum effective width greater than 1.0.
ON Variations: Where an adjacent building provides substantial sheltering effect, the wind loads for the main structural system shall be no lower than 80% of the loads determined from tests described in Sentence (1) with the effect of the sheltering building removed as applied to, (a) the base shear force for buildings with ratio of height to minimum effective width, as described in Sentence 4.1.7.2.(2), less than or equal to 1.0, or (b) the base moment for buildings with a ratio of height to minimum effective width greater than 1.0.

ON Full: Smoke alarms required in Sentences (1) and (2) shall be installed on or near the ceiling.
ON Variations: Smoke alarms required in Sentences (1) and (2) shall be installed on or near the ceiling.

ON Full: The location of portable extinguishers shall be prominently indicated by signs or markings in large floor areas and in locations where visual obstructions cannot be avoided.
ON Variations: The location of portable extinguishers shall be prominently indicated by signs or markings in large floor areas and in locations where visual obstructions cannot be avoided.

ON Full: Where more than one telephone is provided for public use, a built-in shelf or counter shall be provided for at least one telephone.
ON Variations: Where more than one telephone is provided for public use, a built-in shelf or counter shall be provided for at least one telephone.

ON Full: The reference height, h, shall be determined as follows: (a) for buildings with height less than or equal to 20 m and less than the smaller plan dimension, h shall be the mid-height of the roof above grade, but shall not be less than 6 m, (b) for other buildings, h shall be, (i) the actual height above grade of the point on the windward wall for which external pressures are being calculated, (ii) the mid-height of the roof for pressures on surfaces parallel to the wind direction, and (iii) the mid-height of the building for pressures on the leeward wall, and (c) for any structural element exposed to wind, h shall be the mid-height of the element above the ground.
ON Variations: The reference height, h, shall be determined as follows: (a) for buildings with height less than or equal to 20 m and less than the smaller plan dimension, h shall be the mid-height of the roof above grade, but shall not be less than 6 m, (b) for other buildings, h shall be, (i) the actual height above grade of the point on the windward wall for which external pressures are being calculated, (ii) the mid-height of the roof for pressures on surfaces parallel to the wind direction, and (iii) the mid-height of the building for pressures on the leeward wall, and (c) for any structural element exposed to wind, h shall be the mid-height of the element above the ground.

ON Full: A rooftop enclosure for a stairway shall be constructed in accordance with the type of construction required by Articles 3.2.2.20. to 3.2.2.83.
ON Variations: A rooftop enclosure for a stairway shall be constructed in accordance with the type of construction required by Articles 3.2.2.20. to 3.2.2.83.

ON Full: Sets of steps or ladders recessed into pool side walls and having continuous vertical grab bars on each side of them shall be located at intervals of not more than 7.5 m along portions of the pool where the still water depth exceeds 1 000 mm, except that no steps or ladders shall be located within 3 m of the corners at the deep end of the pool.
ON Variations: Sets of steps or ladders recessed into pool side walls and having continuous vertical grab bars on each side of them shall be located at intervals of not more than 7.5 m along portions of the pool where the still water depth exceeds 1 000 mm, except that no steps or ladders shall be located within 3 m of the corners at the deep end of the pool.

ON Full: Where a mechanical ventilation system serves a Type II dwelling unit, the system shall include a heat recovery ventilator, coupled to the forced air heating system, installed in accordance with Article 9.32.3.11.
ON Variations: Where a mechanical ventilation system serves a Type II dwelling unit, the system shall include a heat recovery ventilator, coupled to the forced air heating system, installed in accordance with Article 9.32.3.11.

ON Full: Footing thickness shall be not less than the greater of,(a) 100 mm, or (b) the width of the projection of the footing beyond the supported element.
ON Variations: Footing thickness shall be not less than the greater of,(a) 100 mm, or (b) the width of the projection of the footing beyond the supported element.

ON Full: Torches, regulators, hoses and other oxyacetylene hot work equipment which have been damaged shall not be used.
ON Variations: Torches, regulators, hoses and other oxyacetylene hot work equipment which have been damaged shall not be used.

ON Full: Hot work equipment shall be tested monthly for leaks with a leak test solution.
ON Variations: Hot work equipment shall be tested monthly for leaks with a leak test solution.

ON Full: Hydrostatic pressure tests shall be conducted at the original test pressure as stated on the nameplate.
ON Variations: Hydrostatic pressure tests shall be conducted at the original test pressure as stated on the nameplate.

ON Full: (2) The building referred to in Sentence (1) shall be of noncombustible construction, and, floor assemblies shall be fire separations with a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, mezzanines shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, roof assemblies shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, and loadbearing walls, columns and arches shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the supported assembly.
ON Variations: (2) The building referred to in Sentence (1) shall be of noncombustible construction, and, floor assemblies shall be fire separations with a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, mezzanines shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, roof assemblies shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, and loadbearing walls, columns and arches shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the supported assembly.

ON Full: Lighting provided for illumination in exits and access to exits, including corridors used by the public, shall be maintained.
ON Variations: Lighting provided for illumination in exits and access to exits, including corridors used by the public, shall be maintained.

ON Full: Manholes shall be located at all junctions and all changes in grade, size or alignment (except for curvilinear on a sanitary building sewer that is 8 in. or larger in size.
ON Variations: Manholes shall be located at all junctions and all changes in grade, size or alignment (except for curvilinear on a sanitary building sewer that is 8 in. or larger in size.

ON Full: All branch supply ducts that are not fitted with diffusers with adjustable balance stops shall be supplied with accessible dampers that can be adjusted and fixed in their adjusted positions and that include devices to indicate the positions of the dampers.
ON Variations: All branch supply ducts that are not fitted with diffusers with adjustable balance stops shall be supplied with accessible dampers that can be adjusted and fixed in their adjusted positions and that include devices to indicate the positions of the dampers.

ON Full: A diving board greater than 600 mm in height above the water surface shall project over the water a horizontal distance of at least 1 500 mm from the vertical projection of the pool wall under it.
ON Variations: A diving board greater than 600 mm in height above the water surface shall project over the water a horizontal distance of at least 1 500 mm from the vertical projection of the pool wall under it.

ON Full: The cantilevered portions referred to in Sentence (1) shall not support floor loads from other storeys unless calculations are provided to show that the design resistances of the cantilevered joists are not exceeded.
ON Variations: The cantilevered portions referred to in Sentence (1) shall not support floor loads from other storeys unless calculations are provided to show that the design resistances of the cantilevered joists are not exceeded.

ON Full: The flow rates of fittings that supply water to a fixture shall not exceed the maximum flow rates at the test pressures listed for that fitting in Table 7.6.4.1.
ON Variations: The flow rates of fittings that supply water to a fixture shall not exceed the maximum flow rates at the test pressures listed for that fitting in Table 7.6.4.1.

ON Full: If cartridge-type filters are used for a public spa, the filters shall be a surface-type that is designed for a maximum flow rate of 0.27 L/s/m2 effective filter area.
ON Variations: If cartridge-type filters are used for a public spa, the filters shall be a surface-type that is designed for a maximum flow rate of 0.27 L/s/m2 effective filter area.

ON Full: Chimneys, flues and flue pipes that constitute a fire hazard shall be repaired or replaced in accordance with the Building Code.
ON Variations: Chimneys, flues and flue pipes that constitute a fire hazard shall be repaired or replaced in accordance with the Building Code.

ON Full: Joints between floors and walls shall be coved in areas described in Sentence (9) and in dressing and locker rooms.
ON Variations: Joints between floors and walls shall be coved in areas described in Sentence (9) and in dressing and locker rooms.

ON Full: The interceptor required in Sentence (4) shall, (a) have a minimum flow rate as required by Sentence 7.4.4.3.(8) using a 60 second drain down time, and (b) conform to, (i) CSA B481.1, "Testing and Rating of Grease Interceptors Using Lard", or (ii) CSA B481.2, "Testing and Rating of Grease Interceptors Using Oil".
ON Variations: The interceptor required in Sentence (4) shall, (a) have a minimum flow rate as required by Sentence 7.4.4.3.(8) using a 60 second drain down time, and (b) conform to, (i) CSA B481.1, "Testing and Rating of Grease Interceptors Using Lard", or (ii) CSA B481.2, "Testing and Rating of Grease Interceptors Using Oil".

ON Full: The treatment unit shall be connected to a leaching bed constructed in accordance with the requirements of Section 8.7.
ON Variations: The treatment unit shall be connected to a leaching bed constructed in accordance with the requirements of Section 8.7.

ON Full: Open-air burning of tires or shredded tires shall not take place in storage yards.
ON Variations: Open-air burning of tires or shredded tires shall not take place in storage yards.

ON Full: This Part does not apply to industrial process systems unless the industrial process system is interconnected with the plumbing system, in which case the interconnection shall be so designed and installed so that the plumbing system is protected against contamination or malfunction that may be caused by the industrial system.
ON Variations: This Part does not apply to industrial process systems unless the industrial process system is interconnected with the plumbing system, in which case the interconnection shall be so designed and installed so that the plumbing system is protected against contamination or malfunction that may be caused by the industrial system.

ON Full: Bracing is not required where the walls,(a) have an interior finish conforming to the requirements of Section 9.29., or (b) where the walls are, (i) clad with panel-type siding, (ii) diagonally sheathed with lumber, or (iii) sheathed with plywood, OSB, waferboard, gypsum or fibreboard sheathing.
ON Variations: Bracing is not required where the walls,(a) have an interior finish conforming to the requirements of Section 9.29., or (b) where the walls are, (i) clad with panel-type siding, (ii) diagonally sheathed with lumber, or (iii) sheathed with plywood, OSB, waferboard, gypsum or fibreboard sheathing.

ON Full: The elevator referred to in Sentence (1) shall have a useable platform area not less than 2.2 m2 and shall be capable of carrying a load of 900 kg to the top floor that it serves from a landing on the storey containing the entrance for firefighter access referred to in Articles 3.2.5.4. and 3.2.5.5. within 1 min.
ON Variations: The elevator referred to in Sentence (1) shall have a useable platform area not less than 2.2 m2 and shall be capable of carrying a load of 900 kg to the top floor that it serves from a landing on the storey containing the entrance for firefighter access referred to in Articles 3.2.5.4. and 3.2.5.5. within 1 min.

ON Full: Eave protection is not required,(a) over unheated garages, carports and porches, (b) where the roof overhang exceeds 900 mm measured along the roof slope from the edge of the roof to the inner face of the exterior wall, (c) on roofs of asphalt shingles installed in accordance with Subsection 9.26.8., (d) on roofs with slopes of 1 in 1.5 or greater, or (e) in regions with 3 500 or fewer degree-days.
ON Variations: Eave protection is not required,(a) over unheated garages, carports and porches, (b) where the roof overhang exceeds 900 mm measured along the roof slope from the edge of the roof to the inner face of the exterior wall, (c) on roofs of asphalt shingles installed in accordance with Subsection 9.26.8., (d) on roofs with slopes of 1 in 1.5 or greater, or (e) in regions with 3 500 or fewer degree-days.

ON Full: Ovens and associated ductwork shall be inspected, cleaned and maintained internally and externally at intervals sufficient to prevent the accumulation of combustible deposits.
ON Variations: Ovens and associated ductwork shall be inspected, cleaned and maintained internally and externally at intervals sufficient to prevent the accumulation of combustible deposits.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (9), the load factor 1.25 for dead load, D, for soil, superimposed earth, plants and trees given in Tables 4.1.3.2.A. and 4.1.3.2.B. shall be increased to 1.5, except that when the soil depth exceeds 1.2 m, the factor may be reduced to 1 + 0.6/hs but not less than 1.25, where hs is the depth of soil in metres supported by the structure.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (9), the load factor 1.25 for dead load, D, for soil, superimposed earth, plants and trees given in Tables 4.1.3.2.A. and 4.1.3.2.B. shall be increased to 1.5, except that when the soil depth exceeds 1.2 m, the factor may be reduced to 1 + 0.6/hs but not less than 1.25, where hs is the depth of soil in metres supported by the structure.

ON Full: A bottle trap may be used on a laboratory sink or other fixture equipped with corrosion resistant fittings.
ON Variations: A bottle trap may be used on a laboratory sink or other fixture equipped with corrosion resistant fittings.

ON Full: Pneumatic leakage tests shall not be performed on field-erected aboveground storage tanks.
ON Variations: Pneumatic leakage tests shall not be performed on field-erected aboveground storage tanks.

ON Full: Fire separations separating contiguous stairs described in Sentence (2) shall not be pierced by doorways, ductwork, piping or any other openings that affect the continuity of the separation.
ON Variations: Fire separations separating contiguous stairs described in Sentence (2) shall not be pierced by doorways, ductwork, piping or any other openings that affect the continuity of the separation.

ON Full: The required exit width for an exit stair in an assembly hall or theatre serving more than one balcony level shall conform to the appropriate requirements for stairs serving interconnected floor spaces in Article 3.2.8.4.
ON Variations: The required exit width for an exit stair in an assembly hall or theatre serving more than one balcony level shall conform to the appropriate requirements for stairs serving interconnected floor spaces in Article 3.2.8.4.

ON Full: If wood lath is not used, the butts of the under-course shingles or shakes of the application referred to in Sentence (1) shall be located 12 mm above the butts of the outer course.
ON Variations: If wood lath is not used, the butts of the under-course shingles or shakes of the application referred to in Sentence (1) shall be located 12 mm above the butts of the outer course.

ON Full: Portable extinguishers that are subject to corrosion shall not be installed in a corrosive environment unless they are provided with appropriate corrosion protection.
ON Variations: Portable extinguishers that are subject to corrosion shall not be installed in a corrosive environment unless they are provided with appropriate corrosion protection.

ON Full: Where a foundation is erected on filled ground, peat or sensitive clay, the footing sizes shall be designed in conformance with Section 4.2.
ON Variations: Where a foundation is erected on filled ground, peat or sensitive clay, the footing sizes shall be designed in conformance with Section 4.2.

ON Full: If the grain of the face ply is at right angles to the supporting members, the groove is permitted to extend into the plies below the face ply provided the thickness of the plywood exceeds the value shown in Table 9.29.6.1. by an amount equal to not less than the depth of penetration of the grooves into the plies below the face ply.
ON Variations: If the grain of the face ply is at right angles to the supporting members, the groove is permitted to extend into the plies below the face ply provided the thickness of the plywood exceeds the value shown in Table 9.29.6.1. by an amount equal to not less than the depth of penetration of the grooves into the plies below the face ply.

ON Full: If a demolition site is fenced so as to prevent general entry, provision shall be made for access by fire department equipment and personnel.
ON Variations: If a demolition site is fenced so as to prevent general entry, provision shall be made for access by fire department equipment and personnel.

ON Full: A minimum clearance of 22 m shall be provided around the perimeter of each group of storage piles.
ON Variations: A minimum clearance of 22 m shall be provided around the perimeter of each group of storage piles.

ON Full: A hearth for a fireplace with an opening raised not less than 200 mm from a combustible floor is permitted to be supported on that floor provided the requirements of Clauses 5.3.6.5. to 5.3.6.7. of CAN/CSA-A405-M, "Design and Construction of Masonry Chimneys and Fireplaces", are followed.
ON Variations: A hearth for a fireplace with an opening raised not less than 200 mm from a combustible floor is permitted to be supported on that floor provided the requirements of Clauses 5.3.6.5. to 5.3.6.7. of CAN/CSA-A405-M, "Design and Construction of Masonry Chimneys and Fireplaces", are followed.

ON Full: Where more than one drinking fountain is provided in a normally occupied floor area that is not required by Article 3.8.2.1. to have a barrier-free path of travel, at least one shall be a barrier-free fountain that conforms to Sentences (2) and (3).
ON Variations: Where more than one drinking fountain is provided in a normally occupied floor area that is not required by Article 3.8.2.1. to have a barrier-free path of travel, at least one shall be a barrier-free fountain that conforms to Sentences (2) and (3).

ON Full: Except as required by Sentence (8), single storey dwelling units in an apartment building need not lead to a public corridor or exterior passageway on the same storey provided the dwelling units are served by private stairways leading directly to a public access to exit on the storey, immediately above, and immediately below.
ON Variations: Except as required by Sentence (8), single storey dwelling units in an apartment building need not lead to a public corridor or exterior passageway on the same storey provided the dwelling units are served by private stairways leading directly to a public access to exit on the storey, immediately above, and immediately below.

ON Full: Where a Class B pool is constructed for use solely in conjunction with a club, child care facility, day camp or establishment or institution for the care of persons who are infirm, aged or in custodial care, the pool shall be exempt from the requirements of Clause (9)(a) and Sentences (13) and (14).
ON Variations: Where a Class B pool is constructed for use solely in conjunction with a club, child care facility, day camp or establishment or institution for the care of persons who are infirm, aged or in custodial care, the pool shall be exempt from the requirements of Clause (9)(a) and Sentences (13) and (14).

ON Full: Where the Building Code or this Code require a fire alarm system to be monitored to transmit a signal to the fire department, the building owner shall ensure the continuation of the monitoring.
ON Variations: Where the Building Code or this Code require a fire alarm system to be monitored to transmit a signal to the fire department, the building owner shall ensure the continuation of the monitoring.

ON Full: Sentence (1) does not apply to unprotected openings of fire compartments within a building that is sprinklered, but shall apply to, unprotected openings of fire compartments on opposite sides of a firewall, and exposure from unprotected openings of a fire compartment that is not protected by an automatic sprinkler system.
ON Variations: Sentence (1) does not apply to unprotected openings of fire compartments within a building that is sprinklered, but shall apply to, unprotected openings of fire compartments on opposite sides of a firewall, and exposure from unprotected openings of a fire compartment that is not protected by an automatic sprinkler system.

ON Full: Combustible material shall not be placed on or near the face of a fireplace within 150 mm of the fireplace opening, except that where the combustible material projects more than 38 mm out from the face of the fireplace above the opening, such material shall be at least 300 mm above the top of the opening.
ON Variations: Combustible material shall not be placed on or near the face of a fireplace within 150 mm of the fireplace opening, except that where the combustible material projects more than 38 mm out from the face of the fireplace above the opening, such material shall be at least 300 mm above the top of the opening.

ON Full: The exposure of wood shakes shall not exceed,(a) 190 mm for shakes not less than 450 mm long, and (b) 240 mm for shakes not less than 600 mm long.
ON Variations: The exposure of wood shakes shall not exceed,(a) 190 mm for shakes not less than 450 mm long, and (b) 240 mm for shakes not less than 600 mm long.

ON Full: Sentence (1) does not apply where,(a) the limiting distance is not less than 1.2 m, (b) the limiting distance is less than 1.2 m but not less than 0.6 m, provided that the exposing building face has a fire-resistance rating of not less than 45 min, or (c) the limiting distance is less than 0.6 m, provided that the exposing building face has a fire-resistance rating of not less than 45 min and is clad with noncombustible material.
ON Variations: Sentence (1) does not apply where,(a) the limiting distance is not less than 1.2 m, (b) the limiting distance is less than 1.2 m but not less than 0.6 m, provided that the exposing building face has a fire-resistance rating of not less than 45 min, or (c) the limiting distance is less than 0.6 m, provided that the exposing building face has a fire-resistance rating of not less than 45 min and is clad with noncombustible material.

ON Full: Except as required in Article 9.10.18.1., a fire alarm system is not required in a storage garage conforming to Article 3.2.2.83. provided there are no other occupancies in the building.
ON Variations: Except as required in Article 9.10.18.1., a fire alarm system is not required in a storage garage conforming to ArticleÃ 3.2.2.83. provided there are no other occupancies in the building.

ON Full: Cylinders stored inside buildings shall conform to the requirements in Section 5.6.
ON Variations: Cylinders stored inside buildings shall conform to the requirements in Section 5.6.

ON Full: Where the building is sprinklered, the maximum aggregate area of unprotected openings shall be not more than twice the area determined according to Sentence (1) provided all rooms, including closets and bathrooms, that are adjacent to the exposing building face and that have unprotected openings are sprinklered, notwithstanding any exemptions in the sprinkler standards referenced in Article 3.2.5.13.
ON Variations: Where the building is sprinklered, the maximum aggregate area of unprotected openings shall be not more than twice the area determined according to Sentence (1) provided all rooms, including closets and bathrooms, that are adjacent to the exposing building face and that have unprotected openings are sprinklered, notwithstanding any exemptions in the sprinkler standards referenced in Article 3.2.5.13.

ON Full: Glass shall conform to,(a) CAN/CGSB-12.1-M, "Tempered or Laminated Safety Glass," (b) CAN/CGSB-12.2-M, "Flat, Clear Sheet Glass", (c) CAN/CGSB-12.3-M, "Flat, Clear Float Glass", (d) CAN/CGSB-12.4-M, "Heat Absorbing Glass," (e) CAN/CGSB-12.8, "Insulating Glass Units", (f) CAN/CGSB-12.10-M, "Glass, Light and Heat Reflecting", (g) CAN/CGSB-12.11-M, "Wired Safety Glass", or (h) ASTM E2190, "Insulating Glass Unit Performance and Evaluation".
ON Variations: Glass shall conform to,(a) CAN/CGSB-12.1-M, "Tempered or Laminated Safety Glass," (b) CAN/CGSB-12.2-M, "Flat, Clear Sheet Glass", (c) CAN/CGSB-12.3-M, "Flat, Clear Float Glass", (d) CAN/CGSB-12.4-M, "Heat Absorbing Glass," (e) CAN/CGSB-12.8, "Insulating Glass Units", (f) CAN/CGSB-12.10-M, "Glass, Light and Heat Reflecting", (g) CAN/CGSB-12.11-M, "Wired Safety Glass", or (h) ASTM E2190, "Insulating Glass Unit Performance and Evaluation".

ON Full: If non-fixed row seating is provided for more than 200 persons in an assembly occupancy, the seats shall be fastened in units of not less than 4 and not more than 12 seats, or each end seat abutting an aisle shall be securely fastened to the floor.
ON Variations: If non-fixed row seating is provided for more than 200 persons in an assembly occupancy, the seats shall be fastened in units of not less than 4 and not more than 12 seats, or each end seat abutting an aisle shall be securely fastened to the floor.

ON Full: Not more than two dwelling units shall be contained within one of the buildings on the property.
ON Variations: Not more than two dwelling units shall be contained within one of the buildings on the property.

ON Full: All ductwork and fittings shall be constructed and installed in conformance with SMACNA Manuals and ASHRAE Handbooks.
ON Variations: All ductwork and fittings shall be constructed and installed in conformance with SMACNA Manuals and ASHRAE Handbooks.

ON Full: Portable extinguishers shall be located so that there is one portable extinguisher having a 20B:C rating immediately accessible to each work station described in Article 5.14.5.2.
ON Variations: Portable extinguishers shall be located so that there is one portable extinguisher having a 20B:C rating immediately accessible to each work station described in Article 5.14.5.2.

ON Full: The values of storey shears, storey forces, member forces, and deflections used in the design of all structural framing elements and components of the isolation system shall be obtained from analysis conforming to Sentence 4.1.8.19.(3) using one of the following values, whichever produces the most critical effect: (a) mean plus IE times the standard deviation of the results of all Non-Linear Dynamic Analyses, or (b) times the mean of the results of all Non-Linear Dynamic Analyses.
ON Variations: The values of storey shears, storey forces, member forces, and deflections used in the design of all structural framing elements and components of the isolation system shall be obtained from analysis conforming to Sentence 4.1.8.19.(3) using one of the following values, whichever produces the most critical effect: (a) mean plus IE times the standard deviation of the results of all Non-Linear Dynamic Analyses, or (b) times the mean of the results of all Non-Linear Dynamic Analyses.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentences (3) and (4), PE/AL/PE pipe and fittings shall not be used in a hot water system.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentences (3) and (4), PE/AL/PE pipe and fittings shall not be used in a hot water system.

ON Full: A foundation is permitted to have a factored overturning resistance less than the lateral load overturning capacity of the supported SFRS, provided the following requirements are met: (a) neither the foundation nor the supported SFRS are constrained against rotation, and (b) the design overturning moment of the foundation is, (i) not less than 75% of the overturning capacity of the supported SFRS, and (ii) not less than that determined in Sentence 4.1.8.7.(1) using RdRo = 2.0. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: A foundation is permitted to have a factored overturning resistance less than the lateral load overturning capacity of the supported SFRS, provided the following requirements are met: (a) neither the foundation nor the supported SFRS are constrained against rotation, and (b) the design overturning moment of the foundation is, (i) not less than 75% of the overturning capacity of the supported SFRS, and (ii) not less than that determined in Sentence 4.1.8.7.(1) using RdRo = 2.0. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Tanks of marine vessels shall be electrically connected to the shore piping prior to the connection of cargo hose, except when cathodic protection facilities are operating.
ON Variations: Tanks of marine vessels shall be electrically connected to the shore piping prior to the connection of cargo hose, except when cathodic protection facilities are operating.

ON Full: When the roof slope is 1 in 4 or less, the ceiling joist sizes referred to in Sentence (1) shall be determined from the span tables for roof joists.
ON Variations: When the roof slope is 1 in 4 or less, the ceiling joist sizes referred to in Sentence (1) shall be determined from the span tables for roof joists.

ON Full: Sprinkler systems shall be maintained in operating condition.
ON Variations: Sprinkler systems shall be maintained in operating condition.

ON Full: Floors in garages, floors in unenclosed portions of buildings and floors installed over granular fill in conformance with Article 9.16.2.1. need not be dampproofed.
ON Variations: Floors in garages, floors in unenclosed portions of buildings and floors installed over granular fill in conformance with Article 9.16.2.1. need not be dampproofed.

ON Full: Materials used to provide a barrier to soil gas ingress through floors-on-ground shall conform to CAN/CGSB51.34M, "Vapour Barrier, Polyethylene Sheet, for Use in Building Construction".
ON Variations: Materials used to provide a barrier to soil gas ingress through floors-on-ground shall conform to CAN/CGSB51.34M, "Vapour Barrier, Polyethylene Sheet, for Use in Building Construction".

ON Full: The opening required in Sentence (1) shall not contain doors or windows.
ON Variations: The opening required in Sentence (1) shall not contain doors or windows.

ON Full: If the bulk volume of stored tires and shredded tires is more than 600 m3, the storage yard shall be surrounded by a firmly anchored fence or other approved method of security that controls unauthorized access to the storage yard.
ON Variations: If the bulk volume of stored tires and shredded tires is more than 600 m3, the storage yard shall be surrounded by a firmly anchored fence or other approved method of security that controls unauthorized access to the storage yard.

ON Full: Except as permitted in Article 4.1.5.9., Class I liquids shall not be handled or used in basements.
ON Variations: Except as permitted in Article 4.1.5.9., Class I liquids shall not be handled or used in basements.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (2), studs shall be doubled on each side of openings so that the inner studs extend from the lintel to the bottom wall plate and the outer studs extend from the top wall plates to the bottom wall plate.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (2), studs shall be doubled on each side of openings so that the inner studs extend from the lintel to the bottom wall plate and the outer studs extend from the top wall plates to the bottom wall plate.

ON Full: Audible signal appliances need not be installed in a rapid transit station.
ON Variations: Audible signal appliances need not be installed in a rapid transit station.

ON Full: A quench tank shall be designed so that the maximum workload is incapable of raising the working temperature of the cooling medium to within 28°C of its flash point.
ON Variations: A quench tank shall be designed so that the maximum workload is incapable of raising the working temperature of the cooling medium to within 28°C of its flash point.

ON Full: Facilities for flushing and drainage shall be provided where filters are designed to be washed in place.
ON Variations: Facilities for flushing and drainage shall be provided where filters are designed to be washed in place.

ON Full: The floor system for the raised platform referred to in Sentence (2) is permitted to include combustible subfloor and combustible finished flooring.
ON Variations: The floor system for the raised platform referred to in Sentence (2) is permitted to include combustible subfloor and combustible finished flooring.

ON Full: Site-specific evaluation is required to determine F(T), F(PGA) and F(PGV) for Site Class F. (See Appendix Note A-4.1.8.4.(3))
ON Variations: Site-specific evaluation is required to determine F(T), F(PGA) and F(PGV) for Site Class F. (See Appendix Note A-4.1.8.4.(3))

ON Full: Smoking shall not take place and open flames shall not be used in buildings used for the storage of ammonium nitrate.
ON Variations: Smoking shall not take place and open flames shall not be used in buildings used for the storage of ammonium nitrate.

ON Full: Where material alterations or repairs concern any pool fitting passing water and/or air in or out of the pool tank, the affected fitting shall comply with Sentences 3.11.8.1.(14) to (20).
ON Variations: Where material alterations or repairs concern any pool fitting passing water and/or air in or out of the pool tank, the affected fitting shall comply with Sentences 3.11.8.1.(14) to (20).

ON Full: Every drainage system shall have one vent that terminates to open air in conformance with Sentence 7.5.6.5.(1).
ON Variations: Every drainage system shall have one vent that terminates to open air in conformance with Sentence 7.5.6.5.(1).

ON Full: A portable extinguisher that complies with Subsection 6.2.6. or a garden-type hose shall be provided within 7.5 m of any machine that produces sawdust, particles or shavings.
ON Variations: A portable extinguisher that complies with Subsection 6.2.6. or a garden-type hose shall be provided within 7.5 m of any machine that produces sawdust, particles or shavings.

ON Full: Members referred to in Sentence (6) are permitted to be fastened together either directly or through a gusset plate.
ON Variations: Members referred to in Sentence (6) are permitted to be fastened together either directly or through a gusset plate.

ON Full: There shall be a curb along the perimeter of a pool described in Sentence (1) except at steps, ladders and ramp entrances.
ON Variations: There shall be a curb along the perimeter of a pool described in Sentence (1) except at steps, ladders and ramp entrances.

ON Full: Where a manually operated flushing device is installed, it shall serve only one fixture.
ON Variations: Where a manually operated flushing device is installed, it shall serve only one fixture.

ON Full: Except as permitted by Sentence 9.10.18.7.(1), a central vacuum system shall serve not more than one suite.
ON Variations: Except as permitted by Sentence 9.10.18.7.(1), a central vacuum system shall serve not more than one suite.

ON Full: Where a dwelling unit is not located above or below another suite, the travel limit from a floor level in the dwelling unit to an exit or egress door is permitted to exceed 1 storey where that floor level is served by an openable window or door,(a) providing an unobstructed opening of not less than 1 000 mm in height and 550 mm in width, and (b) located so that the sill is not more than, (i) 1 000 mm above the floor, and (ii) 7 m above adjacent ground level.
ON Variations: Where a dwelling unit is not located above or below another suite, the travel limit from a floor level in the dwelling unit to an exit or egress door is permitted to exceed 1 storey where that floor level is served by an openable window or door,(a) providing an unobstructed opening of not less than 1 000 mm in height and 550 mm in width, and (b) located so that the sill is not more than, (i) 1 000 mm above the floor, and (ii) 7 m above adjacent ground level.

ON Full: The travel distance from any point within each fire compartment referred to in Sentence (2) to a door to an adjoining fire compartment shall be not more than 45 m.
ON Variations: The travel distance from any point within each fire compartment referred to in Sentence (2) to a door to an adjoining fire compartment shall be not more than 45 m.

ON Full: In the case of a soffit described in Sentence (1) that is at the edge of an attic or roof space, and completely separated from the remainder of the attic or roof space by fire blocks, the requirements in Sentence (2) do not apply.
ON Variations: In the case of a soffit described in Sentence (1) that is at the edge of an attic or roof space, and completely separated from the remainder of the attic or roof space by fire blocks, the requirements in Sentence (2) do not apply.

ON Full: A closure in a fire separation between fire compartments referred to in Sentence (2) shall be weatherstripped or otherwise designed and installed to retard the passage of smoke.
ON Variations: A closure in a fire separation between fire compartments referred to in Sentence (2) shall be weatherstripped or otherwise designed and installed to retard the passage of smoke.

ON Full: Additional circuit vents shall be sized in accordance with Table 7.5.7.1. and Sentence 7.5.7.3.(1).
ON Variations: Additional circuit vents shall be sized in accordance with Table 7.5.7.1. and Sentence 7.5.7.3.(1).

ON Full: Columns shall be securely fastened to the supported member to reduce the likelihood of lateral differential movement between the column and the supported member.
ON Variations: Columns shall be securely fastened to the supported member to reduce the likelihood of lateral differential movement between the column and the supported member.

ON Full: The shower water system shall have one or more tempering devices capable of being adjusted to ensure that water supplied to shower heads does not exceed 40°C.
ON Variations: The shower water system shall have one or more tempering devices capable of being adjusted to ensure that water supplied to shower heads does not exceed 40°C.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentences (2) and (3), the requirements in Section 3.4. shall apply.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentences (2) and (3), the requirements in Section 3.4. shall apply.

ON Full: Refrigerators described in Sentence 4.1.4.1.(2) shall be identified as containing flammable liquids or combustible liquids.
ON Variations: Refrigerators described in Sentence 4.1.4.1.(2) shall be identified as containing flammable liquids or combustible liquids.

ON Full: The top 200 mm of pilasters required in Sentence (1) shall be solid masonry with the cells of hollow or semi-solid units filled with mortar, grout or concrete.
ON Variations: The top 200 mm of pilasters required in Sentence (1) shall be solid masonry with the cells of hollow or semi-solid units filled with mortar, grout or concrete.

ON Full: For all applications in Subsection 4.1.8., Fa = F(0.2) and Fv = F(1.0).
ON Variations: For all applications in Subsection 4.1.8., Fa = F(0.2) and Fv = F(1.0).

ON Full: Every pedestal urinal, floor-mounted water closet or S-trap standard shall be connected to a fixture drain by a floor flange or other means of connection, except that a cast iron trap standard may be caulked to a cast iron pipe.
ON Variations: Every pedestal urinal, floor-mounted water closet or S-trap standard shall be connected to a fixture drain by a floor flange or other means of connection, except that a cast iron trap standard may be caulked to a cast iron pipe.

ON Full: Except as permitted in Sentences (2) and (3), all studs shall be placed at right angles to the wall face.
ON Variations: Except as permitted in Sentences (2) and (3), all studs shall be placed at right angles to the wall face.

ON Full: Plywood cladding shall be exterior type conforming to,(a) ANSI/HPVA HP-1, "Hardwood and Decorative Plywood", (b) CSA O121, "Douglas Fir Plywood", (c) CSA O151, "Canadian Softwood Plywood", or (d) CSA O153, "Poplar Plywood".
ON Variations: Plywood cladding shall be exterior type conforming to,(a) ANSI/HPVA HP-1, "Hardwood and Decorative Plywood", (b) CSA O121, "Douglas Fir Plywood", (c) CSA O151, "Canadian Softwood Plywood", or (d) CSA O153, "Poplar Plywood".

ON Full: Where a fire-resistance rating is determined based on Table 1 of MMAH Supplementary Standard SB-3, "Fire and Sound Resistance of Building Assemblies", Sentence (4) need not apply for the purpose of fire protection.
ON Variations: Where a fire-resistance rating is determined based on Table 1 of MMAH Supplementary Standard SB-3, "Fire and Sound Resistance of Building Assemblies", Sentence (4) need not apply for the purpose of fire protection.

ON Full: The slope of the bottom of any portion of a wave action pool, shall not exceed 1 in 12 where the still water depth is less than 1 000 mm, and shall not exceed 1 in 9 where the still water depth is 1 000 mm or more.
ON Variations: The slope of the bottom of any portion of a wave action pool, shall not exceed 1 in 12 where the still water depth is less than 1 000 mm, and shall not exceed 1 in 9 where the still water depth is 1 000 mm or more.

ON Full: Smoking shall not take place in powder-coating areas and in powder storage rooms.
ON Variations: Smoking shall not take place in powder-coating areas and in powder storage rooms.

ON Full: The voice communication system required by Sentence (1) shall meet the silencing and transmission requirements of Sentences 3.2.4.23.(2) to (5).
ON Variations: The voice communication system required by Sentence (1) shall meet the silencing and transmission requirements of Sentences 3.2.4.23.(2) to (5).

ON Full: A standpipe and hose system shall be installed in conformance with the Building Code and equipped with spray nozzles so that all parts of an oven structure can be reached by a hose stream.
ON Variations: A standpipe and hose system shall be installed in conformance with the Building Code and equipped with spray nozzles so that all parts of an oven structure can be reached by a hose stream.

ON Full: Except as permitted by Article 3.1.8.17., the maximum area of wired glass in a door used in the locations shown in Table 3.1.8.15. shall conform to the Table. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Except as permitted by Article 3.1.8.17., the maximum area of wired glass in a door used in the locations shown in Table 3.1.8.15. shall conform to the Table. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Where the distance between the framing over the opening referred to in Sentence (3) and the top runner exceeds 400 mm in such walls, intermediate support shall be installed at intervals of not more than 400 mm above the opening.
ON Variations: Where the distance between the framing over the opening referred to in Sentence (3) and the top runner exceeds 400Ã mm in such walls, intermediate support shall be installed at intervals of not more than 400 mm above the opening.

ON Full: If a set of steps is provided for entry into and egress from the public spa water, the steps, shall be equipped with a handrail, shall have a non-slip surface, and shall have a band of contrasting colour along the entire juncture of the side and top of the edges.
ON Variations: If a set of steps is provided for entry into and egress from the public spa water, the steps, shall be equipped with a handrail, shall have a non-slip surface, and shall have a band of contrasting colour along the entire juncture of the side and top of the edges.

ON Full: Openings through any guard that is required by Sentence (1) and that is installed in a building of industrial occupancy shall be of a size that will prevent the passage of a sphere having a diameter more than 200 mm unless it can be shown that the location and size of openings that exceed this limit do not represent a hazard.
ON Variations: Openings through any guard that is required by Sentence (1) and that is installed in a building of industrial occupancy shall be of a size that will prevent the passage of a sphere having a diameter more than 200 mm unless it can be shown that the location and size of openings that exceed this limit do not represent a hazard.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentences (2) and (3), the minimum size of the vent pipe for a sanitary sewage sump or tank, or dilution tank shall be one size smaller than the size of the largest branch or fixture drain draining to the sump or tank.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentences (2) and (3), the minimum size of the vent pipe for a sanitary sewage sump or tank, or dilution tank shall be one size smaller than the size of the largest branch or fixture drain draining to the sump or tank.

ON Full: Except for noncombustible construction required by Subclauses 3.2.2.43A.(2)(c)(i) and 3.2.2.50A.(2)(c)(i), if an assembly is required to be of noncombustible construction and have a fire resistance rating, it shall be supported by noncombustible construction.
ON Variations: Except for noncombustible construction required by Subclauses 3.2.2.43A.(2)(c)(i) and 3.2.2.50A.(2)(c)(i), if an assembly is required to be of noncombustible construction and have a fire resistance rating, it shall be supported by noncombustible construction.

ON Full: Where stucco is installed as cladding on wood frame or masonry walls exposed to precipitation, the cladding assembly shall comply with,(a) Subsections 9.27.2. to 9.27.4., and Section 9.28., or (b) Part 5.
ON Variations: Where stucco is installed as cladding on wood frame or masonry walls exposed to precipitation, the cladding assembly shall comply with,(a) Subsections 9.27.2. to 9.27.4., and Section 9.28., or (b) Part 5.

ON Full: Spans for built-up wood and glued-laminated timber floor beams shall conform to the spans in Tables A-8 to A-11.
ON Variations: Spans for built-up wood and glued-laminated timber floor beams shall conform to the spans in Tables A-8 to A-11.

ON Full: Where the quantity of combustible material present is such that fires of moderate size may be expected, such as in mercantile occupancies, display rooms, auto showrooms, parking garages, light manufacturing, warehouses not classified as extra hazard and school shop areas, the occupancy shall be graded as ordinary hazard.
ON Variations: Where the quantity of combustible material present is such that fires of moderate size may be expected, such as in mercantile occupancies, display rooms, auto showrooms, parking garages, light manufacturing, warehouses not classified as extra hazard and school shop areas, the occupancy shall be graded as ordinary hazard.

ON Full: Narrower aisles may be approved where the building is sprinklered and the sprinkler design is based on aisle widths less than required by Sentence (4) but in no case shall the aisle width be less than the aisle width on which the sprinkler design is based.
ON Variations: Narrower aisles may be approved where the building is sprinklered and the sprinkler design is based on aisle widths less than required by Sentence (4) but in no case shall the aisle width be less than the aisle width on which the sprinkler design is based.

ON Full: Shavings, sawdust and refuse materials shall be burned only in boilers or furnaces, or in incinerators or refuse burners conforming to Subsection 2.6.3.
ON Variations: Shavings, sawdust and refuse materials shall be burned only in boilers or furnaces, or in incinerators or refuse burners conforming to Subsection 2.6.3.

ON Full: The limits on the area of unprotected openings need not apply to the exposing building face of a detached garage or accessory building facing a house, where, (a) the detached garage or accessory building serves the house or an individual dwelling unit in the house, (b) the detached garage or accessory building is located on the same property as the house, and (c) the house is the only major occupancy on the property.
ON Variations: The limits on the area of unprotected openings need not apply to the exposing building face of a detached garage or accessory building facing a house, where, (a) the detached garage or accessory building serves the house or an individual dwelling unit in the house, (b) the detached garage or accessory building is located on the same property as the house, and (c) the house is the only major occupancy on the property.

ON Full: Joist, rafter, lintel and beam members up to 5% less than the actual Canadian standard sizes are permitted to be used provided the allowable spans for the grade and species of lumber under consideration are reduced 5% from those shown in the span tables for full size members. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Joist, rafter, lintel and beam members up to 5% less than the actual Canadian standard sizes are permitted to be used provided the allowable spans for the grade and species of lumber under consideration are reduced 5% from those shown in the span tables for full size members. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Except as permitted by Sentence (5) and Article 3.3.1.11., a door that opens into a corridor or other facility providing access to exit from a suite, or a room not located within a suite, shall swing on a vertical axis.
ON Variations: Except as permitted by Sentence (5) and Article 3.3.1.11., a door that opens into a corridor or other facility providing access to exit from a suite, or a room not located within a suite, shall swing on a vertical axis.

ON Full: An underground storage tank subject to vehicular traffic may be installed under a 150 mm reinforced concrete slab or a 200 mm unreinforced concrete slab over not less than 450 mm of sand if the slab extends at least 300 mm beyond the underground storage tank.
ON Variations: An underground storage tank subject to vehicular traffic may be installed under a 150 mm reinforced concrete slab or a 200 mm unreinforced concrete slab over not less than 450 mm of sand if the slab extends at least 300 mm beyond the underground storage tank.

ON Full: Analysis for design earthquake actions shall be carried out in accordance with the Dynamic Analysis Procedure described in Article 4.1.8.12., except that the Equivalent Static Force Procedure described in Article 4.1.8.11. may be used for structures that meet any of the following criteria: (See Appendix A.) (a) in cases where IEFaSa(0.2) is less than 0.35, (b) regular structures that are less than 60 m in height and have a fundamental lateral period, Ta, less than 2 s in each of two orthogonal directions as defined in Article 4.1.8.8., or (c) structures with structural irregularity, of Type 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6 or 8 as defined in Table 4.1.8.6., that are less than 20 m in height and have a fundamental lateral period, Ta, less than 0.5 s in each of two orthogonal directions as defined in Article 4.1.8.8.
ON Variations: Analysis for design earthquake actions shall be carried out in accordance with the Dynamic Analysis Procedure described in Article 4.1.8.12., except that the Equivalent Static Force Procedure described in Article 4.1.8.11. may be used for structures that meet any of the following criteria: (See Appendix A.) (a) in cases where IEFaSa(0.2) is less than 0.35, (b) regular structures that are less than 60 m in height and have a fundamental lateral period, Ta, less than 2 s in each of two orthogonal directions as defined in Article 4.1.8.8., or (c) structures with structural irregularity, of Type 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6 or 8 as defined in Table 4.1.8.6., that are less than 20 m in height and have a fundamental lateral period, Ta, less than 0.5 s in each of two orthogonal directions as defined in Article 4.1.8.8.

ON Full: Hoses referred to in Sentence (1) shall be not less than 19 mm inside diam and shall be connected to a central water supply or to a storage tank having a capacity of at least 4 500 L with a pumping system capable of supplying a flow of at least 5 L/s at a gauge pressure of 300 kPa.
ON Variations: Hoses referred to in Sentence (1) shall be not less than 19 mm inside diam and shall be connected to a central water supply or to a storage tank having a capacity of at least 4 500 L with a pumping system capable of supplying a flow of at least 5 L/s at a gauge pressure of 300 kPa.

ON Full: Laundry facilities or a space for laundry facilities shall be provided in every dwelling unit or grouped elsewhere in the building in a location conveniently accessible to occupants of every dwelling unit.
ON Variations: Laundry facilities or a space for laundry facilities shall be provided in every dwelling unit or grouped elsewhere in the building in a location conveniently accessible to occupants of every dwelling unit.

ON Full: The number of employees in Sentences (6) to (8) shall be the maximum number of employees who are normally present on the premises at one time and shall include only those who are present for more than 25 per cent of the working day.
ON Variations: The number of employees in Sentences (6) to (8) shall be the maximum number of employees who are normally present on the premises at one time and shall include only those who are present for more than 25 per cent of the working day.

ON Full: A standpipe system is not required to be installed in a storage garage conforming to Article 3.2.2.83. provided the building is not more than 15 m high.
ON Variations: A standpipe system is not required to be installed in a storage garage conforming to Article 3.2.2.83. provided the building is not more than 15 m high.

ON Full: Electrical installations shall conform to the Electrical Safety Code made under the Electricity Act, 1998.
ON Variations: Electrical installations shall conform to the Electrical Safety Code made under the Electricity Act, 1998.

ON Full: A written spill procedure shall be provided for laboratories in conformance with Article 4.1.6.4.
ON Variations: A written spill procedure shall be provided for laboratories in conformance with Article 4.1.6.4.

ON Full: For the purposes of this Article and Article 4.1.8.22., the following terms shall have the meaning stated herein: (a) "supplemental energy dissipation device" is a dedicated structural element of the supplemental energy dissipation system that dissipates energy due to relative motion of each of its ends or by alternative means, and includes all pins, bolts, gusset plates, brace extensions and other components required to connect it to the other elements of the structure; a device may be classified as either displacement-dependent or velocity-dependent, or a combination thereof, and may be configured to act in either a linear or non-linear manner, and (b) "supplemental energy dissipation system" is a collection of energy dissipation devices installed in a structure that supplement the energy dissipation of the SFRS.
ON Variations: For the purposes of this Article and Article 4.1.8.22., the following terms shall have the meaning stated herein: (a) "supplemental energy dissipation device" is a dedicated structural element of the supplemental energy dissipation system that dissipates energy due to relative motion of each of its ends or by alternative means, and includes all pins, bolts, gusset plates, brace extensions and other components required to connect it to the other elements of the structure; a device may be classified as either displacement-dependent or velocity-dependent, or a combination thereof, and may be configured to act in either a linear or non-linear manner, and (b) "supplemental energy dissipation system" is a collection of energy dissipation devices installed in a structure that supplement the energy dissipation of the SFRS.

ON Full: Electrical equipment in a location where flammable liquids or combustible liquids are present shall conform to the Electrical Safety Code made under the Electricity Act, 1998.
ON Variations: Electrical equipment in a location where flammable liquids or combustible liquids are present shall conform to the Electrical Safety Code made under the Electricity Act, 1998.

ON Full: Screwed cast iron water fittings shall not be used in a drainage system.
ON Variations: Screwed cast iron water fittings shall not be used in a drainage system.

ON Full: A manhole including the cover shall be designed to support all loads imposed upon it.
ON Variations: A manhole including the cover shall be designed to support all loads imposed upon it.

ON Full: Materials providing required thermal resistance shall have sufficient inherent resistance to air flow or be positioned in the assembly so as to prevent convective air flow through and around the material. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Materials providing required thermal resistance shall have sufficient inherent resistance to air flow or be positioned in the assembly so as to prevent convective air flow through and around the material. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Where a vent pipe is located 2 000 mm or more above a roof, it shall be so constructed as to be stable and secure.
ON Variations: Where a vent pipe is located 2 000 mm or more above a roof, it shall be so constructed as to be stable and secure.

ON Full: The structural design of the foundation of a building, the procedures and construction practices shall conform with the appropriate Sections of this Code unless otherwise specified in this Section.
ON Variations: The structural design of the foundation of a building, the procedures and construction practices shall conform with the appropriate Sections of this Code unless otherwise specified in this Section.

ON Full: Sumps for air washer and evaporative cooling sections shall be constructed and installed so that they can be flushed and drained.
ON Variations: Sumps for air washer and evaporative cooling sections shall be constructed and installed so that they can be flushed and drained.

ON Full: Every Class 4 sewage system shall be operated in accordance with the literature required by Sentence 8.6.2.2.(6).
ON Variations: Every Class 4 sewage system shall be operated in accordance with the literature required by Sentence 8.6.2.2.(6).

ON Full: Except as required in Sentence (2), the thickness of foundation walls made of unreinforced concrete block or solid concrete and subject to lateral earth pressure shall conform to Table 9.15.4.2.A. for walls not exceeding 3.0 m in unsupported height.
ON Variations: Except as required in Sentence (2), the thickness of foundation walls made of unreinforced concrete block or solid concrete and subject to lateral earth pressure shall conform to Table 9.15.4.2.A. for walls not exceeding 3.0 m in unsupported height.

ON Full: Except as required by this Part, a building permitted to be of combustible construction is permitted to be constructed of combustible materials, with or without noncombustible components. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Except as required by this Part, a building permitted to be of combustible construction is permitted to be constructed of combustible materials, with or without noncombustible components. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Aboveground outdoor piping shall not be located above roofs except above roofs of impermeable and noncombustible construction, with provision for accidental spillage provided in conformance with Subsection 4.1.6.
ON Variations: Aboveground outdoor piping shall not be located above roofs except above roofs of impermeable and noncombustible construction, with provision for accidental spillage provided in conformance with Subsection 4.1.6.

ON Full: Smoking shall not take place and open flames, spark-producing devices and heated surfaces having a temperature sufficient to ignite vapours shall not be used in the vapour area of a dip tank.
ON Variations: Smoking shall not take place and open flames, spark-producing devices and heated surfaces having a temperature sufficient to ignite vapours shall not be used in the vapour area of a dip tank.

ON Full: Except within dwelling units, corridors that provide access to exit from sleeping rooms and that have a fire-resistance rating of not less than 45 min shall have a flame-spread rating conforming to the appropriate requirements in Subsection 9.10.17.
ON Variations: Except within dwelling units, corridors that provide access to exit from sleeping rooms and that have a fire-resistance rating of not less than 45 min shall have a flame-spread rating conforming to the appropriate requirements in Subsection 9.10.17.

ON Full: All sides of an excavation, supported and unsupported, shall be continuously maintained and protected from possible deterioration by construction activity or by the action of frost, rain and wind.
ON Variations: All sides of an excavation, supported and unsupported, shall be continuously maintained and protected from possible deterioration by construction activity or by the action of frost, rain and wind.

ON Full: Firebrick liners shall conform to ASTM C27, "Fireclay and High Alumina Refractory Brick".
ON Variations: Firebrick liners shall conform to ASTM C27, "Fireclay and High Alumina Refractory Brick".

ON Full: In addition to other requirements in this Division for the installation of automatic fire extinguishing systems, an appropriate fire extinguishing system shall be installed in every industrial occupancy floor area to provide protection if required by, the Fire Code made under the Fire Protection and Prevention Act, 1997, or the CCBFC NRCC 56192, "National Fire Code of Canada", in the absence of provisions referred to in Clause (a).
ON Variations: In addition to other requirements in this Division for the installation of automatic fire extinguishing systems, an appropriate fire extinguishing system shall be installed in every industrial occupancy floor area to provide protection if required by, the Fire Code made under the Fire Protection and Prevention Act, 1997, or the CCBFC NRCC 56192, "National Fire Code of Canada", in the absence of provisions referred to in Clause (a).

ON Full: Storm sewage or greywater that is free of solids and treated to conform to Article 7.7.4.1. is permitted to be used as a water supply for,(a) water closets, (b) urinals, (c) sub-surface irrigation, or (d) the priming of traps.
ON Variations: Storm sewage or greywater that is free of solids and treated to conform to Article 7.7.4.1. is permitted to be used as a water supply for,(a) water closets, (b) urinals, (c) sub-surface irrigation, or (d) the priming of traps.

ON Full: Except as provided in this Section, all sign structures shall be designed in accordance with Part 4.
ON Variations: Except as provided in this Section, all sign structures shall be designed in accordance with Part 4.

ON Full: Unless a closure used to protect an opening in an exposing building face has a protective performance equivalent to that required for the wall assembly in which it is located, an equivalent area of unprotected opening, determined in accordance with the procedures of Sentence (9) shall be added to the greater of, the actual area of unprotected openings, or the corrected area of unprotected openings.
ON Variations: Unless a closure used to protect an opening in an exposing building face has a protective performance equivalent to that required for the wall assembly in which it is located, an equivalent area of unprotected opening, determined in accordance with the procedures of Sentence (9) shall be added to the greater of, the actual area of unprotected openings, or the corrected area of unprotected openings.

ON Full: An automatic sprinkler system shall be installed in a service space referred to in Sentence 3.2.1.1.(9) if flooring for access within the service space is other than catwalks.
ON Variations: An automatic sprinkler system shall be installed in a service space referred to in Sentence 3.2.1.1.(9) if flooring for access within the service space is other than catwalks.

ON Full: Where closures are damaged so as to affect the integrity of their fire-protection rating, the damaged closures shall be repaired so that the integrity of the closures is maintained.
ON Variations: Where closures are damaged so as to affect the integrity of their fire-protection rating, the damaged closures shall be repaired so that the integrity of the closures is maintained.

ON Full: Each fire compartment referred to in Sentence (2) shall be capable of accommodating, in addition to its own occupants, the occupants of the largest adjacent fire compartment based on a clear floor space of 2.5 m2 per patient or resident in the adjacent fire compartment.
ON Variations: Each fire compartment referred to in Sentence (2) shall be capable of accommodating, in addition to its own occupants, the occupants of the largest adjacent fire compartment based on a clear floor space of 2.5 m2 per patient or resident in the adjacent fire compartment.

ON Full: The annual inspection referenced in Sentence (3) shall be recorded and kept in accordance with Subsection 1.1.2.
ON Variations: The annual inspection referenced in Sentence (3) shall be recorded and kept in accordance with Subsection 1.1.2.

ON Full: Where a water service pipe or fire service main is detectable without the tracer wire referenced in Sentence (1), the tracer wire may be omitted.
ON Variations: Where a water service pipe or fire service main is detectable without the tracer wire referenced in Sentence (1), the tracer wire may be omitted.

ON Full: The requirements of Subsection 3.16.3. apply to a shelf and rack storage system for the storage of Group A, B and C plastics and rubber tires as defined in NFPA 13, "Installation of Sprinkler Systems".
ON Variations: The requirements of Subsection 3.16.3. apply to a shelf and rack storage system for the storage of Group A, B and C plastics and rubber tires as defined in NFPA 13, "Installation of Sprinkler Systems".

ON Full: If intended for occasional use for trade shows and similar exhibition purposes, the building referred to in Sentence (1) that is more than 1 500 m2 in building area shall be sprinklered.
ON Variations: If intended for occasional use for trade shows and similar exhibition purposes, the building referred to in Sentence (1) that is more than 1 500 m2 in building area shall be sprinklered.

ON Full: Stainless steel butt weld pipe fittings shall be made of a material that matches the grade of the pipe material used.
ON Variations: Stainless steel butt weld pipe fittings shall be made of a material that matches the grade of the pipe material used.

ON Full: Cast iron, copper and aluminum floor flanges shall be suitable for the purpose.
ON Variations: Cast iron, copper and aluminum floor flanges shall be suitable for the purpose.

ON Full: Measures shall be taken to prevent access to laboratories by unauthorized persons.
ON Variations: Measures shall be taken to prevent access to laboratories by unauthorized persons.

ON Full: A public corridor may be used as part of an engineered smoke control system.
ON Variations: A public corridor may be used as part of an engineered smoke control system.

ON Full: A building classified as Group D is permitted to conform to Sentence (2) provided, except as permitted by Sentence 3.2.2.7.(1), the building is sprinklered, it is not more than 2 storeys in building height, and it has a building area not more than, 3 000 m2 if 1 storey in building height, or 2 400 m2 if 2 storeys in building height.
ON Variations: A building classified as Group D is permitted to conform to Sentence (2) provided, except as permitted by Sentence 3.2.2.7.(1), the building is sprinklered, it is not more than 2 storeys in building height, and it has a building area not more than, 3 000 m2 if 1 storey in building height, or 2 400 m2 if 2 storeys in building height.

ON Full: A Class 3 sewage system shall be designed to receive only the contents of a Class 1 sewage system or effluent from a Class 1 sewage system for disposal.
ON Variations: A Class 3 sewage system shall be designed to receive only the contents of a Class 1 sewage system or effluent from a Class 1 sewage system for disposal.

ON Full: The accumulation factor, Ca, shall be 1.0, which corresponds to the uniform snow load case, except that where appropriate for the shape of the roof, it shall be assigned other values that account for, (a) increased non-uniform snow loads due to snow drifting onto a roof that is at a level lower than other parts of the same building or at a level lower than another building within 5 m of it horizontally, as prescribed in Articles 4.1.6.5., 4.1.6.6. and 4.1.6.8., (b) increased non-uniform snow loads on areas adjacent to roof projections, such as penthouses, large chimneys and equipment, as prescribed in Articles 4.1.6.7. and 4.1.6.8., (c) non-uniform snow loads on, (i) gable roofs, as prescribed in Article 4.1.6.9., and (ii) arched roofs, curved roofs and domes, as prescribed in Article 4.1.6.10., (d) increased snow or ice loads due to snow sliding, as prescribed in Article 4.1.6.11., (e) increased snow loads in roof valleys, as prescribed in Article 4.1.6.12., and (f) increased snow or ice loads due to meltwater draining from adjacent building elements and roof projections.
