ON Variations: The accumulation factor, Ca, shall be 1.0, which corresponds to the uniform snow load case, except that where appropriate for the shape of the roof, it shall be assigned other values that account for, (a) increased non-uniform snow loads due to snow drifting onto a roof that is at a level lower than other parts of the same building or at a level lower than another building within 5 m of it horizontally, as prescribed in Articles 4.1.6.5., 4.1.6.6. and 4.1.6.8., (b) increased non-uniform snow loads on areas adjacent to roof projections, such as penthouses, large chimneys and equipment, as prescribed in Articles 4.1.6.7. and 4.1.6.8., (c) non-uniform snow loads on, (i) gable roofs, as prescribed in Article 4.1.6.9., and (ii) arched roofs, curved roofs and domes, as prescribed in Article 4.1.6.10., (d) increased snow or ice loads due to snow sliding, as prescribed in Article 4.1.6.11., (e) increased snow loads in roof valleys, as prescribed in Article 4.1.6.12., and (f) increased snow or ice loads due to meltwater draining from adjacent building elements and roof projections.

ON Full: Where a building is sprinklered in conformance with the Building Code, small hose (38 stations are permitted to be supplied from interior sprinkler piping.
ON Variations: Where a building is sprinklered in conformance with the Building Code, small hose (38 stations are permitted to be supplied from interior sprinkler piping.

ON Full: The general ventilation system described in Sentence (8) is not required when tail pipes of vehicles are directly connected to local mechanical exhaust systems that terminate outdoors.
ON Variations: The general ventilation system described in Sentence (8) is not required when tail pipes of vehicles are directly connected to local mechanical exhaust systems that terminate outdoors.

ON Full: Drainage requirements beneath floors-on-ground shall conform to Section 9.16.
ON Variations: Drainage requirements beneath floors-on-ground shall conform to Section 9.16.

ON Full: Windows, doors and skylights, with or without storm doors or sash, that are installed in portions of buildings where the intended use of the interior space will result in high moisture generation shall be designed in conformance with Subsection 5.3.
ON Variations: Windows, doors and skylights, with or without storm doors or sash, that are installed in portions of buildings where the intended use of the interior space will result in high moisture generation shall be designed in conformance with Subsection 5.3.

ON Full: Where the vertical edges of interior finishes at wall intersections are supported at vertical intervals by blocking or furring, the vertical distance between such supports shall not exceed the maximum distance between supports specified in Section 9.29.
ON Variations: Where the vertical edges of interior finishes at wall intersections are supported at vertical intervals by blocking or furring, the vertical distance between such supports shall not exceed the maximum distance between supports specified in Section 9.29.

ON Full: Granular fill shall not contain pyritic material in a concentration that would adversely affect its stability or the performance of assemblies separating dissimilar environments.
ON Variations: Granular fill shall not contain pyritic material in a concentration that would adversely affect its stability or the performance of assemblies separating dissimilar environments.

ON Full: Nails used in attaching the materials listed in Sentence (1) shall be not less than 3.2 mm diam with a minimum head diameter of 11 mm.
ON Variations: Nails used in attaching the materials listed in Sentence (1) shall be not less than 3.2 mm diam with a minimum head diameter of 11 mm.

ON Full: Exterior steel columns susceptible to corrosion shall be treated on the outside surface with at least one coat of rust-inhibitive paint.
ON Variations: Exterior steel columns susceptible to corrosion shall be treated on the outside surface with at least one coat of rust-inhibitive paint.

ON Full: A locking device with a local release permitted by Sentence (3) shall be capable of being unlocked with a key from both sides of the door.
ON Variations: A locking device with a local release permitted by Sentence (3) shall be capable of being unlocked with a key from both sides of the door.

ON Full: Where exterior or interior handrails serving a house or an individual dwelling unit are attached to wood studs or blocking, the attachment shall be deemed to comply with Sentence (1), where,(a) the attachment points are spaced not more than 1.2 m apart measured on the horizontal plane, (b) the first attachment point at either end is located not more than 300 mm from the end of the handrail, and (c) the fasteners consist of no fewer than two No. 8 wood screws at each point, penetrating not less than 32 mm into solid wood.
ON Variations: Where exterior or interior handrails serving a house or an individual dwelling unit are attached to wood studs or blocking, the attachment shall be deemed to comply with Sentence (1), where,(a) the attachment points are spaced not more than 1.2 m apart measured on the horizontal plane, (b) the first attachment point at either end is located not more than 300 mm from the end of the handrail, and (c) the fasteners consist of no fewer than two No. 8 wood screws at each point, penetrating not less than 32 mm into solid wood.

ON Full: Sentence (3) does not apply if the horizontal concealed space within the floor assembly or roof assembly is entirely filled with noncombustible insulation such that any air gap between the top of the insulation and the underside of the floor or roof deck does not exceed 50 mm.
ON Variations: Sentence (3) does not apply if the horizontal concealed space within the floor assembly or roof assembly is entirely filled with noncombustible insulation such that any air gap between the top of the insulation and the underside of the floor or roof deck does not exceed 50 mm.

ON Full: The maximum length and minimum slope of every trap arm shall conform to Table 7.5.6.3.
ON Variations: The maximum length and minimum slope of every trap arm shall conform to Table 7.5.6.3.

ON Full: Standpipe and hose system equipment shall be used for fire protection only.
ON Variations: Standpipe and hose system equipment shall be used for fire protection only.

ON Full: Systems serving spaces that contain sources of contamination and systems serving other occupied parts of the building but located in or running through spaces that contain sources of contamination shall be designed in such a manner as to prevent the spread of such contamination to other occupied parts of the building. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Systems serving spaces that contain sources of contamination and systems serving other occupied parts of the building but located in or running through spaces that contain sources of contamination shall be designed in such a manner as to prevent the spread of such contamination to other occupied parts of the building. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: The clearance between masonry or concrete chimneys and combustible framing material shall be not less than,(a) 50 mm for interior chimneys, and (b) 12 mm for exterior chimneys. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: The clearance between masonry or concrete chimneys and combustible framing material shall be not less than,(a) 50 mm for interior chimneys, and (b) 12 mm for exterior chimneys. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Exit doors shall be hung so that, when open, they shall neither diminish nor obstruct the required width of the exit by more than 50 mm for each door leaf.
ON Variations: Exit doors shall be hung so that, when open, they shall neither diminish nor obstruct the required width of the exit by more than 50 mm for each door leaf.

ON Full: Steel liners for fireplaces shall conform to CAN/ULC-S639M, "Steel Liner Assemblies for Solid-Fuel Burning Masonry Fireplaces", and shall be installed in accordance with the installation instructions in that standard.
ON Variations: Steel liners for fireplaces shall conform to CAN/ULC-S639M, "Steel Liner Assemblies for Solid-Fuel Burning Masonry Fireplaces", and shall be installed in accordance with the installation instructions in that standard.

ON Full: A material, assembly of materials or a structural member is permitted to be assigned a fire-resistance rating on the basis of MMAH Supplementary Standard SB-2, "Fire Performance Ratings".
ON Variations: A material, assembly of materials or a structural member is permitted to be assigned a fire-resistance rating on the basis of MMAH Supplementary Standard SB-2, "Fire Performance Ratings".

ON Full: Where either of the two aboveground storage tanks contains unstable liquids, the distance required in Sentences (1) and (2) shall be doubled.
ON Variations: Where either of the two aboveground storage tanks contains unstable liquids, the distance required in Sentences (1) and (2) shall be doubled.

ON Full: Electrostatic spraying equipment shall be located 1.5 m from processing equipment and isolated from other areas by grounded guards and fences of conducting material.
ON Variations: Electrostatic spraying equipment shall be located 1.5 m from processing equipment and isolated from other areas by grounded guards and fences of conducting material.

ON Full: The identification and classification of soil, rock and groundwater and descriptions of their engineering and physical properties shall be in accordance with a widely accepted system.
ON Variations: The identification and classification of soil, rock and groundwater and descriptions of their engineering and physical properties shall be in accordance with a widely accepted system.

ON Full: Vertical joints in adjacent masonry courses shall be offset unless each wythe of masonry is reinforced with the equivalent of no fewer than two corrosion-resistant steel bars of 3.76 mm diam placed in the horizontal joints at vertical intervals not exceeding 460 mm.
ON Variations: Vertical joints in adjacent masonry courses shall be offset unless each wythe of masonry is reinforced with the equivalent of no fewer than two corrosion-resistant steel bars of 3.76 mm diam placed in the horizontal joints at vertical intervals not exceeding 460 mm.

ON Full: A clearance space that is equivalent to twice the sparking distance shall be maintained between articles being deteared and electrodes or conductors.
ON Variations: A clearance space that is equivalent to twice the sparking distance shall be maintained between articles being deteared and electrodes or conductors.

ON Full: At least a 3 mm clearance shall be provided between OSB and waferboard cladding and door or window frames.
ON Variations: At least a 3 mm clearance shall be provided between OSB and waferboard cladding and door or window frames.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (1), where the leaching bed is constructed as a shallow buried trench, the total length of the distribution pipe shall not be less than the value determined by Table 8.7.3.1.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (1), where the leaching bed is constructed as a shallow buried trench, the total length of the distribution pipe shall not be less than the value determined by Table 8.7.3.1.

ON Full: Every solid fuel-fired fireplace, including a factory-built fireplace, shall have a supply of combustion air from outdoors in accordance with Sentences (2) to (7).
ON Variations: Every solid fuel-fired fireplace, including a factory-built fireplace, shall have a supply of combustion air from outdoors in accordance with Sentences (2) to (7).

ON Full: The foundations of a building shall be capable of resisting all the loads stipulated in Section 4.1., in accordance with limit states design in Subsection 4.1.3.
ON Variations: The foundations of a building shall be capable of resisting all the loads stipulated in Section 4.1., in accordance with limit states design in Subsection 4.1.3.

ON Full: Only grade 304/304L or 316/316L stainless steel tubes shall be used.
ON Variations: Only grade 304/304L or 316/316L stainless steel tubes shall be used.

ON Full: The top plate required in Sentence (1) need not be provided where a column supports a steel beam and provision is made for the attachment of the column to the beam.
ON Variations: The top plate required in Sentence (1) need not be provided where a column supports a steel beam and provision is made for the attachment of the column to the beam.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentences (13) and (14), dead-end aisles shall be not more than 6 m long.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentences (13) and (14), dead-end aisles shall be not more than 6 m long.

ON Full: Large size timbers and flat-piled stock may be stored or piled on the perimeter of the yard.
ON Variations: Large size timbers and flat-piled stock may be stored or piled on the perimeter of the yard.

ON Full: Dead-end aisles are permitted to be more than 6 m long, but not more than 10 m long if, the seating area is separated from other seating areas and adjacent occupancies, including a corridor serving any seating area, by a fire separation in accordance with Sentences 3.3.2.2.(1) and (2), the travel distance is not more than 25 m measured along the path of travel from any seat to an exit, to an egress doorway or to an opening into a vomitory, at least one means of egress, comprising not less than 30 per cent of the required exit capacity, is through an exterior exit, an exit stairway or a corridor not containing an occupancy, each row served by the dead-end aisle has a minimum unobstructed width of 400 mm plus 6.1 mm for each additional seat above seven seats in a row, but not more than 550 mm, the minimum ceiling height above the seating area is 3 m, the activation of a fire detector or a sprinkler head in the seating area will, cause the shutdown of the projection system serving the seating area, and turn on the normal lighting in the seating area, and the floor area is sprinklered.
ON Variations: Dead-end aisles are permitted to be more than 6 m long, but not more than 10 m long if, the seating area is separated from other seating areas and adjacent occupancies, including a corridor serving any seating area, by a fire separation in accordance with Sentences 3.3.2.2.(1) and (2), the travel distance is not more than 25 m measured along the path of travel from any seat to an exit, to an egress doorway or to an opening into a vomitory, at least one means of egress, comprising not less than 30 per cent of the required exit capacity, is through an exterior exit, an exit stairway or a corridor not containing an occupancy, each row served by the dead-end aisle has a minimum unobstructed width of 400 mm plus 6.1 mm for each additional seat above seven seats in a row, but not more than 550 mm, the minimum ceiling height above the seating area is 3 m, the activation of a fire detector or a sprinkler head in the seating area will, cause the shutdown of the projection system serving the seating area, and turn on the normal lighting in the seating area, and the floor area is sprinklered.

ON Full: During alteration of a building required to have a standpipe and hose system, the system shall be installed or dismantled progressively so as to provide protection to all floor areas.
ON Variations: During alteration of a building required to have a standpipe and hose system, the system shall be installed or dismantled progressively so as to provide protection to all floor areas.

ON Full: Where the heat transfer loop of the solar domestic hot water system consists of direct flow-through of potable water only, protection against backflow is not required.
ON Variations: Where the heat transfer loop of the solar domestic hot water system consists of direct flow-through of potable water only, protection against backflow is not required.

ON Full: Insulating fibreboard shall conform to CAN/ULC-S706.1, "Wood Fibre Insulating Boards for Buildings".
ON Variations: Insulating fibreboard shall conform to CAN/ULC-S706.1, "Wood Fibre Insulating Boards for Buildings".

ON Full: Where the static pressure at any fixture may exceed 550 kPa, a pressure reducing valve conforming to Article 7.2.10.12. shall be installed to limit the maximum static pressure at the fixture to 550 kPa.
ON Variations: Where the static pressure at any fixture may exceed 550 kPa, a pressure reducing valve conforming to Article 7.2.10.12. shall be installed to limit the maximum static pressure at the fixture to 550 kPa.

ON Full: Except as required by Sentence (5), the sound pressure level from a fire alarm audible signal device in a floor area shall be not less than 10 dBA above the ambient noise level, but with a minimum value not less than 65 dBA.
ON Variations: Except as required by Sentence (5), the sound pressure level from a fire alarm audible signal device in a floor area shall be not less than 10 dBA above the ambient noise level, but with a minimum value not less than 65 dBA.

ON Full: Weak roof-to-side shell seams that are designed to rupture before the allowable design stress of the storage tank is reached shall not be used as a means of emergency venting of storage tanks inside buildings.
ON Variations: Weak roof-to-side shell seams that are designed to rupture before the allowable design stress of the storage tank is reached shall not be used as a means of emergency venting of storage tanks inside buildings.

ON Full: Where a Class B pool is installed, dressing rooms, locker rooms, shower heads, lavatories, water closets, drinking fountains and urinals are not required if, dressing, water closet and shower facilities are conveniently available elsewhere on the premises for bathers when the pool is open for use, and foot sprays are provided in accordance with Sentence 3.11.3.1.(17).
ON Variations: Where a Class B pool is installed, dressing rooms, locker rooms, shower heads, lavatories, water closets, drinking fountains and urinals are not required if, dressing, water closet and shower facilities are conveniently available elsewhere on the premises for bathers when the pool is open for use, and foot sprays are provided in accordance with Sentence 3.11.3.1.(17).

ON Full: A soil or waste pipe may serve as an additional circuit vent in accordance with Sentence (6) provided that the soil or waste pipe is sized as a wet vent in conformance with Article 7.5.8.1. and is not less than 2 in. in size.
ON Variations: A soil or waste pipe may serve as an additional circuit vent in accordance with Sentence (6) provided that the soil or waste pipe is sized as a wet vent in conformance with Article 7.5.8.1. and is not less than 2 in. in size.

ON Full: Except for overhead lighting that is totally enclosed and sealed with gaskets, electrical wiring and equipment within the area of hazard described in Article 5.14.5.3. shall conform to Article 5.1.3.1.
ON Variations: Except for overhead lighting that is totally enclosed and sealed with gaskets, electrical wiring and equipment within the area of hazard described in Article 5.14.5.3. shall conform to Article 5.1.3.1.

ON Full: Handling equipment, including spray guns, which is specifically designed for use with organic peroxides shall be used to apply such coatings.
ON Variations: Handling equipment, including spray guns, which is specifically designed for use with organic peroxides shall be used to apply such coatings.

ON Full: Portable extinguishers shall be provided in accordance with Section 6.2.
ON Variations: Portable extinguishers shall be provided in accordance with Section 6.2.

ON Full: The surfaces of ramps, landings and treads shall, have a finish that is slip-resistant, and if accessible to the public, have a colour contrast or a distinctive visual pattern to demarcate, the leading edge of the tread, the leading edge of the landing, and the beginning and end of a ramp.
ON Variations: The surfaces of ramps, landings and treads shall, have a finish that is slip-resistant, and if accessible to the public, have a colour contrast or a distinctive visual pattern to demarcate, the leading edge of the tread, the leading edge of the landing, and the beginning and end of a ramp.

ON Full: Except as permitted in Sentence (3), in maturing warehouses, at least one 4A:30B:C rated portable extinguisher shall be located adjacent to each exit.
ON Variations: Except as permitted in Sentence (3), in maturing warehouses, at least one 4A:30B:C rated portable extinguisher shall be located adjacent to each exit.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.14.6.(1), openings in a wall having a limiting distance of less than 1.2 m shall be protected by closures, of other than wired glass or glass block, whose fire protection rating is in conformance with the fire-resistance rating required for the wall.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.14.6.(1), openings in a wall having a limiting distance of less than 1.2 m shall be protected by closures, of other than wired glass or glass block, whose fire protection rating is in conformance with the fire-resistance rating required for the wall.

ON Full: Insulation on the interior of foundation walls enclosing a crawl space shall be applied so that there is not less than a 50 mm clearance above the crawl space floor if the insulation is of a type that may be damaged by water.
ON Variations: Insulation on the interior of foundation walls enclosing a crawl space shall be applied so that there is not less than a 50 mm clearance above the crawl space floor if the insulation is of a type that may be damaged by water.

ON Full: The top of a dip tank shall not be less than 150 mm above the floor of the room in which it is located.
ON Variations: The top of a dip tank shall not be less than 150 mm above the floor of the room in which it is located.

ON Full: When indoor piping for Class I flammable liquids is installed in a trench, the trench shall be,(a) provided with positive ventilation to the outdoors, or (b) designed to prevent the accumulation of flammable vapours.
ON Variations: When indoor piping for Class I flammable liquids is installed in a trench, the trench shall be,(a) provided with positive ventilation to the outdoors, or (b) designed to prevent the accumulation of flammable vapours.

ON Full: Class I liquids may be stored in dwelling units in accordance with Article 4.2.4.5.
ON Variations: Class I liquids may be stored in dwelling units in accordance with Article 4.2.4.5.

ON Full: A voice communication system conforming to Article 3.2.4.23. shall be provided in a building if, the floor of the top storey is more than 36 m above grade, a floor area or part of a floor area located above the third storey is designed or intended for use as a Group B, Division 2 or 3 occupancy, or a floor area or part of a floor area located more than 18 m above grade is designed or intended for use as a retirement home regulated under the Retirement Homes Act, 2010 that is a Group C occupancy.
ON Variations: A voice communication system conforming to Article 3.2.4.23. shall be provided in a building if, the floor of the top storey is more than 36 m above grade, a floor area or part of a floor area located above the third storey is designed or intended for use as a Group B, Division 2 or 3 occupancy, or a floor area or part of a floor area located more than 18 m above grade is designed or intended for use as a retirement home regulated under the Retirement Homes Act, 2010 that is a Group C occupancy.

ON Full: Rotating parts shall be grounded.
ON Variations: Rotating parts shall be grounded.

ON Full: Subject to Sentence (2), a tank vehicle shall not be left unattended by the vehicle operator outside a building for more than 1 h.
ON Variations: Subject to Sentence (2), a tank vehicle shall not be left unattended by the vehicle operator outside a building for more than 1 h.

ON Full: Enclosed pumping equipment designed in accordance with good engineering practice shall be used to transfer Class I liquids to or from the fuel tanks of vehicles inside buildings.
ON Variations: Enclosed pumping equipment designed in accordance with good engineering practice shall be used to transfer Class I liquids to or from the fuel tanks of vehicles inside buildings.

ON Full: Flashing described in Sentence (5) at the chimney shall be counterflashed as required by Article 9.26.4.4.
ON Variations: Flashing described in Sentence (5) at the chimney shall be counterflashed as required by Article 9.26.4.4.

ON Full: Where scuppers are provided and where the position, shape and deflection of the loaded surface make an accumulation of rainwater possible, the loads due to rain shall be the lesser of either the one-day rainfall determined in conformance with Subsection 1.1.2. or a depth of rainwater equal to 30 mm above the level of the scuppers, applied over the horizontal projection of the surface and tributary areas.
ON Variations: Where scuppers are provided and where the position, shape and deflection of the loaded surface make an accumulation of rainwater possible, the loads due to rain shall be the lesser of either the one-day rainfall determined in conformance with Subsection 1.1.2. or a depth of rainwater equal to 30 mm above the level of the scuppers, applied over the horizontal projection of the surface and tributary areas.

ON Full: Where structures have vertical variations of RdRo satisfying Sentence 4.1.8.9.(4), the elements of the SFRS below the level where the change in RdRo occurs shall be designed for the forces associated with the lateral load capacity of the SFRS above that level. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Where structures have vertical variations of RdRo satisfying Sentence 4.1.8.9.(4), the elements of the SFRS below the level where the change in RdRo occurs shall be designed for the forces associated with the lateral load capacity of the SFRS above that level. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Insulation and sealing of heating and ventilating ducts shall conform to Sections 9.32. and 9.33.
ON Variations: Insulation and sealing of heating and ventilating ducts shall conform to Sections 9.32. and 9.33.

ON Full: A handrail is not required for stairs and ramps serving a house or an individual dwelling unit, where, (a) interior stairs have not more than two risers, (b) exterior stairs have not more than three risers, or (c) ramps rise not more than 400 mm.
ON Variations: A handrail is not required for stairs and ramps serving a house or an individual dwelling unit, where, (a) interior stairs have not more than two risers, (b) exterior stairs have not more than three risers, or (c) ramps rise not more than 400 mm.

ON Full: Except as otherwise provided in this Section, where special fire suppression systems have been installed, inspection and maintenance shall be provided in conformance with the appropriate standards set out in Sentences 6.8.1.1. (3), (4) and (5).
ON Variations: Except as otherwise provided in this Section, where special fire suppression systems have been installed, inspection and maintenance shall be provided in conformance with the appropriate standards set out in Sentences 6.8.1.1. (3), (4) and (5).

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentences (4) and (5), the soffit described in Sentence (1) shall be protected in accordance with Sentence (3) where the soffit encloses,(a) a common attic or roof space that spans more than 2 suites of residential occupancy and projects beyond the exterior wall of the building, (b) a floor space where an upper storey projects beyond the exterior wall of a lower storey and a fire separation is required at the floor between the two storeys, or (c) a floor space where an upper storey projects beyond the exterior wall of a lower storey, and the projection is continuous across a vertical fire separation separating two suites.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentences (4) and (5), the soffit described in Sentence (1) shall be protected in accordance with Sentence (3) where the soffit encloses,(a) a common attic or roof space that spans more than 2 suites of residential occupancy and projects beyond the exterior wall of the building, (b) a floor space where an upper storey projects beyond the exterior wall of a lower storey and a fire separation is required at the floor between the two storeys, or (c) a floor space where an upper storey projects beyond the exterior wall of a lower storey, and the projection is continuous across a vertical fire separation separating two suites.

ON Full: Employees engaged in the operation of equipment for the transfer of flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be trained in the location, function and operation of valves used for the operation of fire protection equipment and manual emergency shut-off valves.
ON Variations: Employees engaged in the operation of equipment for the transfer of flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be trained in the location, function and operation of valves used for the operation of fire protection equipment and manual emergency shut-off valves.

ON Full: The distance of travel to an exit door by an aisle shall not be greater than 30 m, except in a sprinklered floor area where the distance of travel shall not be greater than 45 m.
ON Variations: The distance of travel to an exit door by an aisle shall not be greater than 30 m, except in a sprinklered floor area where the distance of travel shall not be greater than 45 m.

ON Full: Areas in rooms or spaces over which ceiling height is not less than the minimum specified in Table 9.5.3.1. shall be contiguous with the entry or entries to those rooms or spaces.
ON Variations: Areas in rooms or spaces over which ceiling height is not less than the minimum specified in Table 9.5.3.1. shall be contiguous with the entry or entries to those rooms or spaces.

ON Full: A screw cap or test cap shall not be used as a cleanout plug or cover.
ON Variations: A screw cap or test cap shall not be used as a cleanout plug or cover.

ON Full: Forest products shall not be piled on refuse-filled or sawdust-filled land except where the site is covered with a layer of compacted earth to a minimum depth of 150 mm.
ON Variations: Forest products shall not be piled on refuse-filled or sawdust-filled land except where the site is covered with a layer of compacted earth to a minimum depth of 150 mm.

ON Full: This Subsection does not apply to the design, construction and installation of air duct distribution systems serving heating, ventilating and air-conditioning systems that serve a house or an individual dwelling unit within the scope of Part 9.
ON Variations: This Subsection does not apply to the design, construction and installation of air duct distribution systems serving heating, ventilating and air-conditioning systems that serve a house or an individual dwelling unit within the scope of Part 9.

ON Full: The size of the soil or waste pipe acting as a relief vent in accordance with Sentence 7.5.3.1.(4) shall be in conformance with Table 7.4.10.6., 7.4.10.7. or 7.5.8.1. or Article 7.5.7.1., whichever size is the largest considering the hydraulic load drained into the soil or waste pipe.
ON Variations: The size of the soil or waste pipe acting as a relief vent in accordance with Sentence 7.5.3.1.(4) shall be in conformance with Table 7.4.10.6., 7.4.10.7. or 7.5.8.1. or Article 7.5.7.1., whichever size is the largest considering the hydraulic load drained into the soil or waste pipe.

ON Full: At least two portable extinguishers, each having a rating of not less than 80B:C, shall be provided at hazardous locations in bulk storage plants for flammable liquids and combustible liquids.
ON Variations: At least two portable extinguishers, each having a rating of not less than 80B:C, shall be provided at hazardous locations in bulk storage plants for flammable liquids and combustible liquids.

ON Full: Where a vent pipe is connected into a suds pressure zone referred to in Sentence (4), no other vent pipe shall be connected to that vent pipe within the height of the suds pressure zone.
ON Variations: Where a vent pipe is connected into a suds pressure zone referred to in Sentence (4), no other vent pipe shall be connected to that vent pipe within the height of the suds pressure zone.

ON Full: Where a leakage test incorporating a liquid test medium, including a flammable liquid or combustible liquid, is performed on an underground storage tank, the tank shall be considered to be leaking when, with compensation for volume differentials caused by effects of temperature and tank shell distortion, the test indicates a liquid loss.
ON Variations: Where a leakage test incorporating a liquid test medium, including a flammable liquid or combustible liquid, is performed on an underground storage tank, the tank shall be considered to be leaking when, with compensation for volume differentials caused by effects of temperature and tank shell distortion, the test indicates a liquid loss.

ON Full: The cesspool shall be provided with a tight strong cover that shall remain over the cesspool except when it is necessary to remove it for the purposes of adding sanitary sewage to or removing sanitary sewage from the cesspool or for purposes of maintenance of the cesspool.
ON Variations: The cesspool shall be provided with a tight strong cover that shall remain over the cesspool except when it is necessary to remove it for the purposes of adding sanitary sewage to or removing sanitary sewage from the cesspool or for purposes of maintenance of the cesspool.

ON Full: Hot works performed on or in close proximity to a tank vehicle shall conform to Section 5.17.
ON Variations: Hot works performed on or in close proximity to a tank vehicle shall conform to Section 5.17.

ON Full: Standpipe and hose systems shall be designed, constructed and installed in conformance with Article 3.2.5.18. and Subsection 3.2.9.
ON Variations: Standpipe and hose systems shall be designed, constructed and installed in conformance with Article 3.2.5.18. and Subsection 3.2.9.

ON Full: Gypsum board with a tightly adhering paper covering not more than 1 mm thick is permitted in a building required to be of noncombustible construction provided the flame-spread rating of the surface is not more than 25.
ON Variations: Gypsum board with a tightly adhering paper covering not more than 1 mm thick is permitted in a building required to be of noncombustible construction provided the flame-spread rating of the surface is not more than 25.

ON Full: If the caps are missing, the hydrant shall be examined for obstructions or accumulated refuse and flushed in accordance with Article 6.6.5.7. and the port caps shall be re-installed.
ON Variations: If the caps are missing, the hydrant shall be examined for obstructions or accumulated refuse and flushed in accordance with Article 6.6.5.7. and the port caps shall be re-installed.

ON Full: Where a public pool is constructed with a ledge, the ledge shall, be placed only in parts of the pool where the water depth is 1 350 mm or more, be not more than 200 mm wide, be at least 1 000 mm below the water surface, where located on the side of the pool, be gradually tapered towards the shallow end of the pool in such a manner as to prevent a harmful obstruction, and have a band of contrasting colour along the entire juncture of the side and top of the ledge.
ON Variations: Where a public pool is constructed with a ledge, the ledge shall, be placed only in parts of the pool where the water depth is 1 350 mm or more, be not more than 200 mm wide, be at least 1 000 mm below the water surface, where located on the side of the pool, be gradually tapered towards the shallow end of the pool in such a manner as to prevent a harmful obstruction, and have a band of contrasting colour along the entire juncture of the side and top of the ledge.

ON Full: Except as permitted by Sentence (3), the minimum aggregate required width of exits serving floor areas intended for assembly occupancies, residential occupancies, business and personal services occupancies, mercantile occupancies, and industrial occupancies shall be determined by multiplying the occupant load of the area served by, 6.1 mm per person for ramps with a slope of not more than 1 in 8, doorways, corridors and passageways, 8 mm per person for a stair consisting of steps whose rise is not more than 180 mm and whose run is not less than 280 mm, or 9.2 mm per person for, ramps with a slope of more than 1 in 8, or stairs, other than stairs conforming to Clause (b).
ON Variations: Except as permitted by Sentence (3), the minimum aggregate required width of exits serving floor areas intended for assembly occupancies, residential occupancies, business and personal services occupancies, mercantile occupancies, and industrial occupancies shall be determined by multiplying the occupant load of the area served by, 6.1 mm per person for ramps with a slope of not more than 1 in 8, doorways, corridors and passageways, 8 mm per person for a stair consisting of steps whose rise is not more than 180 mm and whose run is not less than 280 mm, or 9.2 mm per person for, ramps with a slope of more than 1 in 8, or stairs, other than stairs conforming to Clause (b).

ON Full: An air-supported structure designed for an assembly occupancy with an occupant load of more than 200 persons shall have either an automatic emergency engine-generator set capable of powering one blower continuously for 4 h, or a supplementary blower powered by an automatic internal combustion engine.
ON Variations: An air-supported structure designed for an assembly occupancy with an occupant load of more than 200 persons shall have either an automatic emergency engine-generator set capable of powering one blower continuously for 4 h, or a supplementary blower powered by an automatic internal combustion engine.

ON Full: The full width under each lap referred to in Sentence (1) shall be coated with bitumen so that in no place does felt touch felt.
ON Variations: The full width under each lap referred to in Sentence (1) shall be coated with bitumen so that in no place does felt touch felt.

ON Full: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.2.2.42.(3), 3.2.2.43.(3), 3.2.2.44.(3), 3.2.2.45.(3), 3.2.2.46.(3), 3.2.2.47.(3) or 3.2.2.48.(3), a floor assembly immediately above a basement shall be constructed as a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating conforming to the requirements of Articles 3.2.2.20. to 3.2.2.83. for a floor assembly, but not less than 45 min.
ON Variations: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.2.2.42.(3), 3.2.2.43.(3), 3.2.2.44.(3), 3.2.2.45.(3), 3.2.2.46.(3), 3.2.2.47.(3) or 3.2.2.48.(3), a floor assembly immediately above a basement shall be constructed as a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating conforming to the requirements of Articles 3.2.2.20. to 3.2.2.83. for a floor assembly, but not less than 45 min.

ON Full: Subject to Sentences (2), (3), (4) and (5), a fire drill shall be held for the supervisory staff at least once during each 12-month period.
ON Variations: Subject to Sentences (2), (3), (4) and (5), a fire drill shall be held for the supervisory staff at least once during each 12-month period.

ON Full: Except as permitted in Sentence (2), steel columns shall be fitted with not less than 100 mm by 100 mm by 6.35 mm thick steel plates at each end, and where the column supports a wooden beam, the top plate shall extend across the full width of the beam.
ON Variations: Except as permitted in Sentence (2), steel columns shall be fitted with not less than 100 mm by 100 mm by 6.35 mm thick steel plates at each end, and where the column supports a wooden beam, the top plate shall extend across the full width of the beam.

ON Full: In unfinished basements, the protection required in Sentence (7) need not be provided for mineral fibre insulation, provided it is covered with polyethylene vapour barrier of at least 0.15 mm in thickness.
ON Variations: In unfinished basements, the protection required in Sentence (7) need not be provided for mineral fibre insulation, provided it is covered with polyethylene vapour barrier of at least 0.15 mm in thickness.

ON Full: If contaminated, soil surrounding the storage tanks described in Sentence (1) shall be replaced with clean fill.
ON Variations: If contaminated, soil surrounding the storage tanks described in Sentence (1) shall be replaced with clean fill.

ON Full: Exhaust ducts serving the required kitchen, bathroom, water closet room and other supplemental exhaust air intakes shall be sized according to Part 6 except that they may be sized according to Table 9.32.3.5. where,(a) the total duct length does not exceed 9 m, and (b) the number of elbows does not exceed 4, but, in any case, they shall not be smaller than recommended by the manufacturer of the fans.
ON Variations: Exhaust ducts serving the required kitchen, bathroom, water closet room and other supplemental exhaust air intakes shall be sized according to Part 6 except that they may be sized according to Table 9.32.3.5. where,(a) the total duct length does not exceed 9 m, and (b) the number of elbows does not exceed 4, but, in any case, they shall not be smaller than recommended by the manufacturer of the fans.

ON Full: The strip footing widths for exterior walls shown in Table 9.15.3.4. shall be increased by,(a) 65 mm for each storey of masonry veneer over wood frame construction supported by the foundation wall, (b) 130 mm for each storey of masonry construction supported by the foundation wall, and (c) 150 mm for each storey of flat insulating concrete form wall construction supported by the foundation wall.
ON Variations: The strip footing widths for exterior walls shown in Table 9.15.3.4. shall be increased by,(a) 65 mm for each storey of masonry veneer over wood frame construction supported by the foundation wall, (b) 130 mm for each storey of masonry construction supported by the foundation wall, and (c) 150 mm for each storey of flat insulating concrete form wall construction supported by the foundation wall.

ON Full: Bow string, arch or semi-circular roof trusses having an unsupported span greater than 6 m shall be designed in conformance with the snow load requirements in Subsection 4.1.6.
ON Variations: Bow string, arch or semi-circular roof trusses having an unsupported span greater than 6 m shall be designed in conformance with the snow load requirements in Subsection 4.1.6.

ON Full: When framed into the side of a wood beam, joists referred to in Sentence (1) shall be supported on,(a) joist hangers or other acceptable mechanical connectors, or (b) not less than 38 mm by 64 mm ledger strips nailed to the side of the beam, except that 38 mm by 38 mm ledger strips may be used provided each joist is nailed to the beam by at least four 89 mm nails, in addition to the nailing for the ledger strip required in Table 9.23.3.4.
ON Variations: When framed into the side of a wood beam, joists referred to in Sentence (1) shall be supported on,(a) joist hangers or other acceptable mechanical connectors, or (b) not less than 38 mm by 64 mm ledger strips nailed to the side of the beam, except that 38 mm by 38 mm ledger strips may be used provided each joist is nailed to the beam by at least four 89 mm nails, in addition to the nailing for the ledger strip required in Table 9.23.3.4.

ON Full: This Article applies to the portion of any soffit enclosing a projection that is,(a) less than 2.5 m vertically above a window or door, and (b) less than 1.2 m from either side of the window or door. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: This Article applies to the portion of any soffit enclosing a projection that is,(a) less than 2.5 m vertically above a window or door, and (b) less than 1.2 m from either side of the window or door. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (3), a major occupancy classified as a residential occupancy, including live/work units, shall be separated from other major occupancies classified as mercantile or medium hazard industrial occupancies by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 2 h.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (3), a major occupancy classified as a residential occupancy, including live/work units, shall be separated from other major occupancies classified as mercantile or medium hazard industrial occupancies by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 2 h.

ON Full: Space-heating appliances, steam pipes and other hot surfaces shall not be located in an area subject to accumulation of deposits of combustible residue from spray operations.
ON Variations: Space-heating appliances, steam pipes and other hot surfaces shall not be located in an area subject to accumulation of deposits of combustible residue from spray operations.

ON Full: Where more than 1 level of mezzanine is provided in a storey, each level additional to the first shall be considered as a storey.
ON Variations: Where more than 1 level of mezzanine is provided in a storey, each level additional to the first shall be considered as a storey.

ON Full: In a building that is not sprinklered in accordance with Sentence 3.2.5.13.(1), an access to exit that is part of the principal entrance serving a dance hall or a licensed beverage establishment with an occupant load more than 250 shall be at least one-half of the required exit width.
ON Variations: In a building that is not sprinklered in accordance with Sentence 3.2.5.13.(1), an access to exit that is part of the principal entrance serving a dance hall or a licensed beverage establishment with an occupant load more than 250 shall be at least one-half of the required exit width.

ON Full: Where the waterproofing material is to be applied on insulating concrete form (ICF) walls, the instructions of the ICF wall manufacturer shall be followed.
ON Variations: Where the waterproofing material is to be applied on insulating concrete form (ICF) walls, the instructions of the ICF wall manufacturer shall be followed.

ON Full: Materials installed to protect combustible sprinkler piping, as required by the Building Code current at the time of installation, shall be maintained in accordance with the provisions of the same edition of the Building Code used for their installation.
ON Variations: Materials installed to protect combustible sprinkler piping, as required by the Building Code current at the time of installation, shall be maintained in accordance with the provisions of the same edition of the Building Code used for their installation.

ON Full: Pipes and fittings to be used for drainage and venting of acid and corrosive wastes shall conform to,(a) ASTM A518 / A518M, "Corrosion-Resistant High-Silicon Iron Castings", (b) ASTM C1053, "Borosilicate Glass Pipe and Fittings for Drain, Waste, and Vent (DWV) Applications", or (c) CAN/CSA-B181.3, "Polyolefin and Polyvinylidene Fluoride (PVDF) Laboratory Drainage Systems".
ON Variations: Pipes and fittings to be used for drainage and venting of acid and corrosive wastes shall conform to,(a) ASTM A518 / A518M, "Corrosion-Resistant High-Silicon Iron Castings", (b) ASTM C1053, "Borosilicate Glass Pipe and Fittings for Drain, Waste, and Vent (DWV) Applications", or (c) CAN/CSA-B181.3, "Polyolefin and Polyvinylidene Fluoride (PVDF) Laboratory Drainage Systems".

ON Full: At least one egress doorway shall be located within 23 m from any point in the dispensing room.
ON Variations: At least one egress doorway shall be located within 23 m from any point in the dispensing room.

ON Full: Where concrete in foundations may be subject to chemical attack, it shall be treated in conformance with the requirements in CSA A23.1, "Concrete Materials and Methods of Concrete Construction".
ON Variations: Where concrete in foundations may be subject to chemical attack, it shall be treated in conformance with the requirements in CSA A23.1, "Concrete Materials and Methods of Concrete Construction".

ON Full: Where conditions are corrosive to steel, adequate protection of exposed steel shall be provided.
ON Variations: Where conditions are corrosive to steel, adequate protection of exposed steel shall be provided.

ON Full: Exhaust ducts of nonmechanical ventilating systems serving similar occupancies may be combined immediately below the point of final delivery to the outside, such as at the base of a roof ventilator.
ON Variations: Exhaust ducts of nonmechanical ventilating systems serving similar occupancies may be combined immediately below the point of final delivery to the outside, such as at the base of a roof ventilator.

ON Full: Except as permitted by Articles 3.2.2.48B. to 3.2.2.48E., a retirement home shall conform to Sentence (2).
ON Variations: Except as permitted by Articles 3.2.2.48B. to 3.2.2.48E., a retirement home shall conform to Sentence (2).

ON Full: A sprinklered building shall be designed in accordance with Sentences (2) to (5.1) and MMAH Supplementary Standard SB-4, "Measures for Fire Safety in High Buildings", to limit the danger to occupants and firefighters from exposure to smoke in a building fire.
ON Variations: A sprinklered building shall be designed in accordance with Sentences (2) to (5.1) and MMAH Supplementary Standard SB-4, "Measures for Fire Safety in High Buildings", to limit the danger to occupants and firefighters from exposure to smoke in a building fire.

ON Full: Where a shallow foundation is to be placed on soil or rock, the soil or rock shall be cleaned of loose and unsound material and shall be adequate to support the design load taking into account temperature, precipitation, construction activities and other factors that may lead to changes of the properties of soil or rock.
ON Variations: Where a shallow foundation is to be placed on soil or rock, the soil or rock shall be cleaned of loose and unsound material and shall be adequate to support the design load taking into account temperature, precipitation, construction activities and other factors that may lead to changes of the properties of soil or rock.

ON Full: Single conductor metal sheathed cables with combustible jacketing that are more than 25 mm in overall diameter are permitted to penetrate a fire separation required to have a fire-resistance rating without being incorporated in the assembly at the time of testing as required by Article 3.1.9.2., provided the cables are not grouped and are spaced a minimum of 300 mm apart.
ON Variations: Single conductor metal sheathed cables with combustible jacketing that are more than 25 mm in overall diameter are permitted to penetrate a fire separation required to have a fire-resistance rating without being incorporated in the assembly at the time of testing as required by Article 3.1.9.2., provided the cables are not grouped and are spaced a minimum of 300 mm apart.

ON Full: The SFRS shall be designed to resist 100% of the earthquake loads and their effects. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: The SFRS shall be designed to resist 100% of the earthquake loads and their effects. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Optical fibre cables and electrical wires and cables with combustible insulation, jackets or sheathes, located in the space below a raised floor in a computer room, are permitted in a building required to be of noncombustible construction provided they do not convey flame or continue to burn for more than 1 min when tested in conformance with the Vertical Flame Test in Clause 4.11.1. of CSA C22.2 No. 0.3, "Test Methods for Electrical Wires and Cables", (FT1 Rating).
ON Variations: Optical fibre cables and electrical wires and cables with combustible insulation, jackets or sheathes, located in the space below a raised floor in a computer room, are permitted in a building required to be of noncombustible construction provided they do not convey flame or continue to burn for more than 1 min when tested in conformance with the Vertical Flame Test in Clause 4.11.1. of CSA C22.2 No. 0.3, "Test Methods for Electrical Wires and Cables", (FT1 Rating).

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentences (2) and (3), storage tanks for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be spaced so that each storage tank is accessible for fire fighting purposes.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentences (2) and (3), storage tanks for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be spaced so that each storage tank is accessible for fire fighting purposes.

ON Full: The centre line of the overflow connection to a dip tank shall be 150 mm below the top of the tank.
ON Variations: The centre line of the overflow connection to a dip tank shall be 150 mm below the top of the tank.

ON Full: A modified pool and its pool deck shall be constructed of hard-surfaced material that permits thorough cleaning.
ON Variations: A modified pool and its pool deck shall be constructed of hard-surfaced material that permits thorough cleaning.

ON Full: For buildings in the Low Importance Category as described in Table 4.1.2.1.B., a factor of 0.8 may be applied to the live load.
ON Variations: For buildings in the Low Importance Category as described in Table 4.1.2.1.B., a factor of 0.8 may be applied to the live load.

ON Full: The force-deformation and force-velocity characteristics and damping values of a representative sample of the supplemental energy dissipation devices installed in the building shall be validated by tests prior to their installation.
ON Variations: The force-deformation and force-velocity characteristics and damping values of a representative sample of the supplemental energy dissipation devices installed in the building shall be validated by tests prior to their installation.

ON Full: Except as permitted by Sentence (3) and Sentence 6.2.3.8.(6), air duct systems serving storage garages shall not be directly interconnected with ductwork serving other areas of the building.
ON Variations: Except as permitted by Sentence (3) and Sentence 6.2.3.8.(6), air duct systems serving storage garages shall not be directly interconnected with ductwork serving other areas of the building.

ON Full: All holding tanks used in residential dwellings shall have a minimum 7 day holding capacity based on the total daily design sanitary sewage flow.
ON Variations: All holding tanks used in residential dwellings shall have a minimum 7 day holding capacity based on the total daily design sanitary sewage flow.

ON Full: In doorways described in Sentence (1) that have multiple-leaf doors installed,(a) no active leaf shall be less than 810 mm wide where only one leaf is active, and (b) no single leaf shall be less than 610 mm wide where two leaves are active.
ON Variations: In doorways described in Sentence (1) that have multiple-leaf doors installed,(a) no active leaf shall be less than 810 mm wide where only one leaf is active, and (b) no single leaf shall be less than 610 mm wide where two leaves are active.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (2), buildings or parts thereof in which distilled beverage alcohol is distilled, processed or stored in bulk shall be classified as high hazard industrial occupancies.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (2), buildings or parts thereof in which distilled beverage alcohol is distilled, processed or stored in bulk shall be classified as high hazard industrial occupancies.

ON Full: Except as permitted in Sentence (2), metal frames and sash of windows, doors and skylights shall incorporate a thermal break.
ON Variations: Except as permitted in Sentence (2), metal frames and sash of windows, doors and skylights shall incorporate a thermal break.

ON Full: Where emergency power for the lights referred to in Sentence (5) is provided from a system of batteries, the batteries shall be inspected and tested in accordance with the procedures set out in Sentences (2) to (4).
ON Variations: Where emergency power for the lights referred to in Sentence (5) is provided from a system of batteries, the batteries shall be inspected and tested in accordance with the procedures set out in Sentences (2) to (4).

ON Full: In determining the fire safety requirements of a building in relation to each of the major occupancies contained in it, the building height and building area of the entire building shall be used.
ON Variations: In determining the fire safety requirements of a building in relation to each of the major occupancies contained in it, the building height and building area of the entire building shall be used.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (2), every water distribution system shall be connected,(a) to a watermain that is part of a municipal drinking water system, or (b) to a drinking water system, if a watermain described in Clause (a) is not available.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (2), every water distribution system shall be connected,(a) to a watermain that is part of a municipal drinking water system, or (b) to a drinking water system, if a watermain described in Clause (a) is not available.

ON Full: Staples used with wood shingles shall be not less than 29 mm long, 1.6 mm diam or thickness, with not less than a 9.5 mm crown and shall be stainless steel or aluminum.
ON Variations: Staples used with wood shingles shall be not less than 29 mm long, 1.6 mm diam or thickness, with not less than a 9.5 mm crown and shall be stainless steel or aluminum.

ON Full: This Section applies where wall, floor and roof planes are generally comprised of lumber frames of small repetitive structural members, or engineered components, and where,(a) roof and wall planes are clad, sheathed or braced on at least one side, (b) the small repetitive structural members are spaced not more than 610 mm o.c., (c) the walls do not serve as foundations, (d) the specified live load on supported subfloors and floor framing does not exceed 2.4 kPa, and (e) the span of any structural member does not exceed 12.20 m. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: This Section applies where wall, floor and roof planes are generally comprised of lumber frames of small repetitive structural members, or engineered components, and where,(a) roof and wall planes are clad, sheathed or braced on at least one side, (b) the small repetitive structural members are spaced not more than 610 mm o.c., (c) the walls do not serve as foundations, (d) the specified live load on supported subfloors and floor framing does not exceed 2.4 kPa, and (e) the span of any structural member does not exceed 12.20 m. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: In buildings constructed in conformance with Articles 3.2.8.4. to 3.2.8.11., the unprotected openings through floor assemblies in an interconnected floor space shall be of sufficient size and shall be positioned relative to each other so as to be capable of containing, within the full height of the interconnected floor space, a cylinder conforming to Sentence (2).
ON Variations: In buildings constructed in conformance with Articles 3.2.8.4. to 3.2.8.11., the unprotected openings through floor assemblies in an interconnected floor space shall be of sufficient size and shall be positioned relative to each other so as to be capable of containing, within the full height of the interconnected floor space, a cylinder conforming to Sentence (2).

ON Full: Except as permitted by Sentences (2) to (4), a corridor used by the public in an assembly occupancy as an access to exit shall be separated from the remainder of the floor area by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.
ON Variations: Except as permitted by Sentences (2) to (4), a corridor used by the public in an assembly occupancy as an access to exit shall be separated from the remainder of the floor area by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.

ON Full: At least one elevator shall be provided for use by firefighters in conformance with Sentences (2) to (6).
ON Variations: At least one elevator shall be provided for use by firefighters in conformance with Sentences (2) to (6).

ON Full: Except as permitted by Sentences (3) to (6) and (12), the minimum dimensions of wood elements in heavy timber construction shall conform to Table 3.1.4.7.
ON Variations: Except as permitted by Sentences (3) to (6) and (12), the minimum dimensions of wood elements in heavy timber construction shall conform to Table 3.1.4.7.

ON Full: A floor assembly immediately above a crawl space is not required to be constructed as a fire separation and is not required to have a fire-resistance rating provided the crawl space is not required to be considered as a basement by Sentence (1).
ON Variations: A floor assembly immediately above a crawl space is not required to be constructed as a fire separation and is not required to have a fire-resistance rating provided the crawl space is not required to be considered as a basement by Sentence (1).

ON Full: Doorways serving a house or an individual dwelling unit need not comply with Sentence (2).
ON Variations: Doorways serving a house or an individual dwelling unit need not comply with Sentence (2).

ON Full: The systems for control of smoke movement and mechanical venting required by Articles 3.2.6.2. and 3.2.6.6. shall be tested to ensure satisfactory operation in accordance with the procedures described in MMAH Supplementary Standard SB-4, "Measures for Fire Safety in High Buildings".
ON Variations: The systems for control of smoke movement and mechanical venting required by Articles 3.2.6.2. and 3.2.6.6. shall be tested to ensure satisfactory operation in accordance with the procedures described in MMAH Supplementary Standard SB-4, "Measures for Fire Safety in High Buildings".

ON Full: Interior construction contained within air-supported structures must meet the construction requirements of Articles 3.2.2.20. to 3.2.2.83.
ON Variations: Interior construction contained within air-supported structures must meet the construction requirements of Articles 3.2.2.20. to 3.2.2.83.

ON Full: Lintel members may be separated by filler pieces.
ON Variations: Lintel members may be separated by filler pieces.

ON Full: Thermosetting foamed plastic insulation having a flame-spread rating of not more than 200 is permitted to be used in factory-assembled doors in storage garages serving buildings of residential occupancy provided that,(a) the insulation is covered on the interior with a metallic foil, (b) the assembly has a surface flame-spread rating of not more than 200, and (c) the assembly incorporates no air spaces.
ON Variations: Thermosetting foamed plastic insulation having a flame-spread rating of not more than 200 is permitted to be used in factory-assembled doors in storage garages serving buildings of residential occupancy provided that,(a) the insulation is covered on the interior with a metallic foil, (b) the assembly has a surface flame-spread rating of not more than 200, and (c) the assembly incorporates no air spaces.

ON Full: Doors required to provide a 20 min fire-protection rating or permitted to be 45 mm solid core wood shall be mounted in a wood frame of at least 38 mm thickness where the frame has not been tested and rated.
ON Variations: Doors required to provide a 20 min fire-protection rating or permitted to be 45 mm solid core wood shall be mounted in a wood frame of at least 38 mm thickness where the frame has not been tested and rated.

ON Full: Where a header wrap is used as an air barrier, it shall be sealed or lapped to the wall air barrier above and below in accordance with Sentences (1) and (2).
ON Variations: Where a header wrap is used as an air barrier, it shall be sealed or lapped to the wall air barrier above and below in accordance with Sentences (1) and (2).

ON Full: Care shall be taken that no liquid is discharged on a pier or wharf or overboard during draining and emptying operations.
ON Variations: Care shall be taken that no liquid is discharged on a pier or wharf or overboard during draining and emptying operations.

ON Full: A party wall on a property line need not be constructed as a firewall provided it is constructed as a fire separation having not less than a 1 h fire-resistance rating if, (a) the property line is between houses, or (b) the property line is between dwelling units in a building of residential occupancy, other than a house, in which there is no dwelling unit above another dwelling unit.
ON Variations: A party wall on a property line need not be constructed as a firewall provided it is constructed as a fire separation having not less than a 1 h fire-resistance rating if, (a) the property line is between houses, or (b) the property line is between dwelling units in a building of residential occupancy, other than a house, in which there is no dwelling unit above another dwelling unit.

ON Full: Built-up roofing shall consist of at least three mopped-down layers of roofing felt flood coated with bitumen.
ON Variations: Built-up roofing shall consist of at least three mopped-down layers of roofing felt flood coated with bitumen.

ON Full: The keys required to recall elevators and to permit independent operation of each elevator shall be kept in the location required by the Building Code.
ON Variations: The keys required to recall elevators and to permit independent operation of each elevator shall be kept in the location required by the Building Code.

ON Full: Except as required by Sentence (16) and except where interrupted by doorways or newels at changes in direction, at least one handrail shall be continuous throughout the length of a stair or ramp, including at landings. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Except as required by Sentence (16) and except where interrupted by doorways or newels at changes in direction, at least one handrail shall be continuous throughout the length of a stair or ramp, including at landings. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Piping between the fire department connection and the check valve in the inlet pipe to the standpipe shall be hydrostatically tested in the same manner as the remainder of the system.
ON Variations: Piping between the fire department connection and the check valve in the inlet pipe to the standpipe shall be hydrostatically tested in the same manner as the remainder of the system.

ON Full: Except as permitted in Sentence (5), where washrooms in excess of those required by Subsection 3.7.4. are provided in a storey that is required by Article 3.8.2.1. to have a barrier-free path of travel, the additional washrooms shall be designed to accommodate persons with disabilities in conformance with the requirements of, Articles 3.8.3.8. to 3.8.3.11., or Article 3.8.3.12.
ON Variations: Except as permitted in Sentence (5), where washrooms in excess of those required by Subsection 3.7.4. are provided in a storey that is required by Article 3.8.2.1. to have a barrier-free path of travel, the additional washrooms shall be designed to accommodate persons with disabilities in conformance with the requirements of, Articles 3.8.3.8. to 3.8.3.11., or Article 3.8.3.12.

ON Full: In an assembly occupancy with fixed seats, the minimum number of spaces designated for wheelchair use and the minimum number of fixed seats designated for adaptable seating shall conform to Table 3.8.2.1. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: In an assembly occupancy with fixed seats, the minimum number of spaces designated for wheelchair use and the minimum number of fixed seats designated for adaptable seating shall conform to Table 3.8.2.1. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Combustible piping that is part of a system described in Sentence (1) shall not be located in a vertical service space.
ON Variations: Combustible piping that is part of a system described in Sentence (1) shall not be located in a vertical service space.

ON Full: If a fire alarm system is required in a building, electrical supervision shall be provided to indicate, on the fire alarm system annunciator, a loss of power to a heat tracing cable that is installed to heat, a standpipe riser, a sprinkler line as part of a fire suppression system, or an exit or means of egress to keep it free of ice and snow.
ON Variations: If a fire alarm system is required in a building, electrical supervision shall be provided to indicate, on the fire alarm system annunciator, a loss of power to a heat tracing cable that is installed to heat, a standpipe riser, a sprinkler line as part of a fire suppression system, or an exit or means of egress to keep it free of ice and snow.

ON Full: Before demolition of a building or part of a building is commenced, a safety plan for the demolition site shall be prepared and implemented.
ON Variations: Before demolition of a building or part of a building is commenced, a safety plan for the demolition site shall be prepared and implemented.

ON Full: The fire-resistance rating of the fire separation required by Sentence (1) is permitted to be less than 1 h but not less than 45 min provided the fire-resistance rating required by Subsection 3.2.2. is permitted to be less than 1 h for, the floor assembly above the floor area, or the floor assembly below the floor area, if there is no floor assembly above.
ON Variations: The fire-resistance rating of the fire separation required by Sentence (1) is permitted to be less than 1 h but not less than 45 min provided the fire-resistance rating required by Subsection 3.2.2. is permitted to be less than 1 h for, the floor assembly above the floor area, or the floor assembly below the floor area, if there is no floor assembly above.

ON Full: Enclosed processing buildings handling flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be ventilated as specified in Subsection 4.1.7.
ON Variations: Enclosed processing buildings handling flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be ventilated as specified in Subsection 4.1.7.

ON Full: In addition to the requirements of Subsection 3.13.3. the steel truss enclosure of an escalator shall be sprinklered.
ON Variations: In addition to the requirements of Subsection 3.13.3. the steel truss enclosure of an escalator shall be sprinklered.

ON Full: In order to supply energy to cooking appliances and clothes dryers, every kitchen and laundry space shall be provided with, (a) an electrical outlet, (b) a natural gas line, or (c) a propane line.
ON Variations: In order to supply energy to cooking appliances and clothes dryers, every kitchen and laundry space shall be provided with, (a) an electrical outlet, (b) a natural gas line, or (c) a propane line.

ON Full: Where kitchen waste water from a restaurant has passed through an operating grease interceptor, it may discharge to a leaching bed provided the sewage system has been designed in accordance with good engineering practice.
ON Variations: Where kitchen waste water from a restaurant has passed through an operating grease interceptor, it may discharge to a leaching bed provided the sewage system has been designed in accordance with good engineering practice.

ON Full: Any change in floor level from one side of a horizontal exit to the other side shall not exceed 2 000 mm.
ON Variations: Any change in floor level from one side of a horizontal exit to the other side shall not exceed 2 000 mm.

ON Full: Full sprinkler protection shall be restored or the provisions of Article 6.5.2.6. maintained when work on the system is discontinued.
ON Variations: Full sprinkler protection shall be restored or the provisions of Article 6.5.2.6. maintained when work on the system is discontinued.

ON Full: Structural wood elements used in retaining walls and cribbing shall be pressure-treated with a preservative to resist decay, where,(a) the retaining wall or cribbing supports ground that is critical to the stability of building foundations, or (b) the retaining wall or cribbing is greater than 1.2 m in height.
ON Variations: Structural wood elements used in retaining walls and cribbing shall be pressure-treated with a preservative to resist decay, where,(a) the retaining wall or cribbing supports ground that is critical to the stability of building foundations, or (b) the retaining wall or cribbing is greater than 1.2 m in height.

ON Full: Main entrance doors to dwelling units shall be provided with,(a) a door viewer or transparent glazing in the door, or (b) a sidelight.
ON Variations: Main entrance doors to dwelling units shall be provided with,(a) a door viewer or transparent glazing in the door, or (b) a sidelight.

ON Full: Where an outdoor pool is provided, a barrier-free path of travel shall be provided to and throughout the normally occupied portions of the pool deck.
ON Variations: Where an outdoor pool is provided, a barrier-free path of travel shall be provided to and throughout the normally occupied portions of the pool deck.

ON Full: Documents referred to in Sentence (1) shall be kept at two separate locations so that one copy remains readily available in the event the other is inaccessible due to fire.
ON Variations: Documents referred to in Sentence (1) shall be kept at two separate locations so that one copy remains readily available in the event the other is inaccessible due to fire.

ON Full: Where a hose bibb is installed outside a building, inside a garage, or where there is an identifiable risk of contamination, the potable water system shall be protected against backflow by a backflow preventer.
ON Variations: Where a hose bibb is installed outside a building, inside a garage, or where there is an identifiable risk of contamination, the potable water system shall be protected against backflow by a backflow preventer.

ON Full: At a barrier-free entrance that includes more than one doorway, only one of the doorways is required to be designed in accordance with Article 3.8.3.3.
ON Variations: At a barrier-free entrance that includes more than one doorway, only one of the doorways is required to be designed in accordance with Article 3.8.3.3.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (2), a dwelling unit shall be separated from every other space in a building in which noise may be generated by,(a) a separating assembly and adjoining construction, which, together, provide an apparent sound transmission class rating not less than 47, or (b) a separating assembly that provides a sound transmission class rating not less than 50 and adjoining construction that conforms to Article 9.11.1.4.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (2), a dwelling unit shall be separated from every other space in a building in which noise may be generated by,(a) a separating assembly and adjoining construction, which, together, provide an apparent sound transmission class rating not less than 47, or (b) a separating assembly that provides a sound transmission class rating not less than 50 and adjoining construction that conforms to Article 9.11.1.4.

ON Full: The sprinkler system in Sentences (3) and (4) shall be electrically supervised in conformance with Sentence 3.2.4.10.(3) and, upon operation, shall cause a signal to be transmitted to the fire department in conformance with Sentence 3.2.4.8.(4) when the corridor serves a Group E or Group F, Division 1 or 2 occupancy.
ON Variations: The sprinkler system in Sentences (3) and (4) shall be electrically supervised in conformance with Sentence 3.2.4.10.(3) and, upon operation, shall cause a signal to be transmitted to the fire department in conformance with Sentence 3.2.4.8.(4) when the corridor serves a Group E or Group F, Division 1 or 2 occupancy.

ON Full: Where alterations or repairs are made to feed mains, cross mains, or risers in sprinkler systems, the systems shall be tested in conformance with Sentences (2) to (8).
ON Variations: Where alterations or repairs are made to feed mains, cross mains, or risers in sprinkler systems, the systems shall be tested in conformance with Sentences (2) to (8).

ON Full: Where a hanger or support for copper tube or brass or copper pipe is of a material other than brass or copper, it shall be suitably separated and electrically insulated from the pipe or tube to prevent galvanic action.
ON Variations: Where a hanger or support for copper tube or brass or copper pipe is of a material other than brass or copper, it shall be suitably separated and electrically insulated from the pipe or tube to prevent galvanic action.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence 9.20.7.2.(2) and Article 9.20.7.4., the depth of any chase or recess shall not exceed one-third the thickness of the wall, and the width of the chase or recess shall not exceed 500 mm.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence 9.20.7.2.(2) and Article 9.20.7.4., the depth of any chase or recess shall not exceed one-third the thickness of the wall, and the width of the chase or recess shall not exceed 500 mm.

ON Full: An exposing building face of a building of low hazard industrial occupancy conforming to Article 3.2.2.82. is permitted to be of noncombustible construction without a fire-resistance rating provided, it is not a loadbearing wall, and the limiting distance is not less than 3 m.
ON Variations: An exposing building face of a building of low hazard industrial occupancy conforming to Article 3.2.2.82. is permitted to be of noncombustible construction without a fire-resistance rating provided, it is not a loadbearing wall, and the limiting distance is not less than 3 m.

ON Full: An adequate water supply for firefighting shall be provided for every building.
ON Variations: An adequate water supply for firefighting shall be provided for every building.

ON Full: Where rooms or spaces are intended for the storage, manufacture or use of hazardous or explosive material, such rooms or spaces shall conform to Part 3.
ON Variations: Where rooms or spaces are intended for the storage, manufacture or use of hazardous or explosive material, such rooms or spaces shall conform to Part 3.

ON Full: The weep holes required in Sentence (1) shall be in a location such that any water that collects in the cavity or space will be directed to the exterior of the building.
ON Variations: The weep holes required in Sentence (1) shall be in a location such that any water that collects in the cavity or space will be directed to the exterior of the building.

ON Full: The STC rating shall be used in lieu of the weighted sound reduction index required in ISO 15712-1, "Building Acoustics - Estimation of Acoustic Performance of Buildings From the Performance of Elements - Part 1: Airborne Sound Insulation Between Rooms".
ON Variations: The STC rating shall be used in lieu of the weighted sound reduction index required in ISO 15712-1, "Building Acoustics - Estimation of Acoustic Performance of Buildings From the Performance of Elements - Part 1: Airborne Sound Insulation Between Rooms".

ON Full: In a rapid transit station that is erected entirely above the adjoining finished ground level and is a stand-alone building, where the leased area on any floor level exceeds 20% of the public area on that level, the public area shall be sprinklered.
ON Variations: In a rapid transit station that is erected entirely above the adjoining finished ground level and is a stand-alone building, where the leased area on any floor level exceeds 20% of the public area on that level, the public area shall be sprinklered.

ON Full: The bottom of interior partitions in dressing rooms and washrooms shall be between 250 mm and 350 mm above the floor.
ON Variations: The bottom of interior partitions in dressing rooms and washrooms shall be between 250 mm and 350 mm above the floor.
