ON Full: The lobby referred to in Sentence (1) shall conform in all respects to the requirements for exits, except that rooms other than service rooms, storage rooms and rooms of residential or industrial occupancy are permitted to open directly onto such lobby.
ON Variations: The lobby referred to in Sentence (1) shall conform in all respects to the requirements for exits, except that rooms other than service rooms, storage rooms and rooms of residential or industrial occupancy are permitted to open directly onto such lobby.

ON Full: The review required in Sentence (1) shall be carried out, (a) on a continuous basis, (i) during the construction of all deep foundation units with all pertinent information recorded for each foundation unit, (ii) during the installation and removal of retaining structures and related backfilling operations, and (iii) during the placement of engineered fills that are to be used to support the foundation units, and (b) as required, unless otherwise directed by the chief building official, (i) in the construction of all shallow foundation units, and (ii) in excavating, dewatering and other related works.
ON Variations: The review required in Sentence (1) shall be carried out, (a) on a continuous basis, (i) during the construction of all deep foundation units with all pertinent information recorded for each foundation unit, (ii) during the installation and removal of retaining structures and related backfilling operations, and (iii) during the placement of engineered fills that are to be used to support the foundation units, and (b) as required, unless otherwise directed by the chief building official, (i) in the construction of all shallow foundation units, and (ii) in excavating, dewatering and other related works.

ON Full: Pipe or tubing assembled to comprise a standard drain waste and venting system shall be connected with drain, waste and vent fittings in conformance with Table 7.2.4.5.
ON Variations: Pipe or tubing assembled to comprise a standard drain waste and venting system shall be connected with drain, waste and vent fittings in conformance with Table 7.2.4.5.

ON Full: Prior to backfilling, the leaching chamber shall be,(a) installed level over the length of the absorption trench, (b) securely connected together, section to section, (c) free of structural damage, uncut and used full length, (d) equipped with end caps installed on both ends, (e) equipped with an integrated splash plate at the inlet end of each line of leaching chamber, to prevent soil scouring, and (f) protected in such a manner so as to prevent soil or leaching bed fill from entering the leaching chamber.
ON Variations: Prior to backfilling, the leaching chamber shall be,(a) installed level over the length of the absorption trench, (b) securely connected together, section to section, (c) free of structural damage, uncut and used full length, (d) equipped with end caps installed on both ends, (e) equipped with an integrated splash plate at the inlet end of each line of leaching chamber, to prevent soil scouring, and (f) protected in such a manner so as to prevent soil or leaching bed fill from entering the leaching chamber.

ON Full: In addition to the requirements of this Subsection, public spas shall comply with the requirements of Sentences 3.11.10.1.(1) to (6).
ON Variations: In addition to the requirements of this Subsection, public spas shall comply with the requirements of Sentences 3.11.10.1.(1) to (6).

ON Full: The width of a Type B dispersal bed shall not exceed 4 m.
ON Variations: The width of a Type B dispersal bed shall not exceed 4 m.

ON Full: Where the top of the septic tank is located more than 300 mm below the ground surface, it shall be equipped with risers that extend from the access opening of the septic tank to within 300 mm of the ground surface.
ON Variations: Where the top of the septic tank is located more than 300 mm below the ground surface, it shall be equipped with risers that extend from the access opening of the septic tank to within 300 mm of the ground surface.

ON Full: Copper tube shall not be used for the fixture drain or the portion of the vent pipe below the flood level rim of manually flushing or waterless urinals.
ON Variations: Copper tube shall not be used for the fixture drain or the portion of the vent pipe below the flood level rim of manually flushing or waterless urinals.

ON Full: In a food premises, where dressing rooms are provided for employees, there shall be separate dressing rooms for males and females that, are large enough for the employees to change and store their clothing, and are equipped with lockers or other facilities suitable for storing the clothing of the employees.
ON Variations: In a food premises, where dressing rooms are provided for employees, there shall be separate dressing rooms for males and females that, are large enough for the employees to change and store their clothing, and are equipped with lockers or other facilities suitable for storing the clothing of the employees.

ON Full: The voice communication system referred to in Sentence (1) shall be designed so that the alarm signal in a two-stage fire alarm system can be selectively transmitted to any zone or zones while maintaining an alert signal or selectively transmitting voice instructions to any other zone or zones in the building.
ON Variations: The voice communication system referred to in Sentence (1) shall be designed so that the alarm signal in a two-stage fire alarm system can be selectively transmitted to any zone or zones while maintaining an alert signal or selectively transmitting voice instructions to any other zone or zones in the building.

ON Full: If a horizontal service space or other concealed space is located above a required vertical fire separation other than a vertical shaft, this space need not be divided at the fire separation as required by Article 3.1.8.3. provided the construction between this space and the space below is a fire separation with a fire-resistance rating equivalent to that required for the vertical fire separation, except that the fire-resistance rating is permitted to be not less than 30 min if the vertical fire separation is not required to have a fire-resistance rating more than 45 min. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: If a horizontal service space or other concealed space is located above a required vertical fire separation other than a vertical shaft, this space need not be divided at the fire separation as required by Article 3.1.8.3. provided the construction between this space and the space below is a fire separation with a fire-resistance rating equivalent to that required for the vertical fire separation, except that the fire-resistance rating is permitted to be not less than 30 min if the vertical fire separation is not required to have a fire-resistance rating more than 45 min. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Roof and ceiling framing members bearing on cavity walls shall be supported on, (a) solid masonry units not less than 57 mm high, bridging the full thickness of the wall, or (b) a wood plate not less than 38 mm thick, bearing not less than 50 mm on each wythe.
ON Variations: Roof and ceiling framing members bearing on cavity walls shall be supported on, (a) solid masonry units not less than 57 mm high, bridging the full thickness of the wall, or (b) a wood plate not less than 38 mm thick, bearing not less than 50 mm on each wythe.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (2), vertical piping shall be supported at its base and at the floor level of alternate storeys by rests, each of which can bear the weight of pipe that is between it and the rest above it.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (2), vertical piping shall be supported at its base and at the floor level of alternate storeys by rests, each of which can bear the weight of pipe that is between it and the rest above it.

ON Full: Every pipe in a drainage system, except an external leader or fixture outlet pipe, shall be capable of withstanding without leakage a water test, air test and final test.
ON Variations: Every pipe in a drainage system, except an external leader or fixture outlet pipe, shall be capable of withstanding without leakage a water test, air test and final test.

ON Full: The butts of the under-course of the application referred to in Sentence (1) shall rest on the top edge of the lath.
ON Variations: The butts of the under-course of the application referred to in Sentence (1) shall rest on the top edge of the lath.

ON Full: The roofing membranes shall be carried over the edge of the roof before the gravel stop referred to in Sentence (4) is fastened and two plies of roofing membrane mopped to the top surface of the gravel stop before the flood coat is applied.
ON Variations: The roofing membranes shall be carried over the edge of the roof before the gravel stop referred to in Sentence (4) is fastened and two plies of roofing membrane mopped to the top surface of the gravel stop before the flood coat is applied.

ON Full: Openings in a fire separation shall be protected with closures, shafts or other means in conformance with Articles 3.1.8.4. to 3.1.8.18. and Subsections 3.1.9. and 3.2.8. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Openings in a fire separation shall be protected with closures, shafts or other means in conformance with Articles 3.1.8.4. to 3.1.8.18. and Subsections 3.1.9. and 3.2.8. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Smoke detectors required in sleeping rooms of care, care and treatment or detention occupancy shall upon actuation provide an audible and visible signal to staff serving those rooms so that the room or location containing the smoke detector can be easily identified. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Smoke detectors required in sleeping rooms of care, care and treatment or detention occupancy shall upon actuation provide an audible and visible signal to staff serving those rooms so that the room or location containing the smoke detector can be easily identified. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (4), the sampling required by Sentence (1) shall be conducted,(a) initially, once during the first 12 months after the sewage system was put into use, and (b) thereafter, once during every 12 month period, at least 10 months and not more than 18 months after the previous sampling has been completed.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (4), the sampling required by Sentence (1) shall be conducted,(a) initially, once during the first 12 months after the sewage system was put into use, and (b) thereafter, once during every 12 month period, at least 10 months and not more than 18 months after the previous sampling has been completed.

ON Full: Except as permitted in Sentence (2), built-up roofing applied over wood, plywood, OSB or waferboard roof sheathing shall be laid over an additional base layer of felt laid dry over the entire roof deck with at least a 50 mm headlap and a 50 mm sidelap between each sheet.
ON Variations: Except as permitted in Sentence (2), built-up roofing applied over wood, plywood, OSB or waferboard roof sheathing shall be laid over an additional base layer of felt laid dry over the entire roof deck with at least a 50 mm headlap and a 50Ã mm sidelap between each sheet.

ON Full: A swing-type door from a service room containing a boiler or incinerator shall swing outward from the room, except that the door shall swing inward if the door opens onto a corridor or any room used for an assembly occupancy.
ON Variations: A swing-type door from a service room containing a boiler or incinerator shall swing outward from the room, except that the door shall swing inward if the door opens onto a corridor or any room used for an assembly occupancy.

ON Full: Where the performance level of an existing building is reduced under Sentence 11.4.2.2.(1), additional construction shall be required in order that the building or part of the building subject to the increase in occupant load conforms to the requirements of Sentence 6.2.2.1.(2), Subsection 3.7.4. and Article 9.31.1.1.
ON Variations: Where the performance level of an existing building is reduced under Sentence 11.4.2.2.(1), additional construction shall be required in order that the building or part of the building subject to the increase in occupant load conforms to the requirements of Sentence 6.2.2.1.(2), Subsection 3.7.4. and Article 9.31.1.1.

ON Full: For dry-pipe systems, the clapper of the differential type dry-pipe valve shall be held off its seat, and the ball drip in the intermediate chamber shall be replaced by a plug during the test.
ON Variations: For dry-pipe systems, the clapper of the differential type dry-pipe valve shall be held off its seat, and the ball drip in the intermediate chamber shall be replaced by a plug during the test.

ON Full: In dwelling units, glazing installed over stairs, ramps and landings that extends to less than 900 mm above the surface of the treads, ramp or landing shall be,(a) protected by guards in accordance with this Subsection, or (b) non-openable and designed to withstand the specified lateral loads for guards as provided in Article 4.1.5.14.
ON Variations: In dwelling units, glazing installed over stairs, ramps and landings that extends to less than 900 mm above the surface of the treads, ramp or landing shall be,(a) protected by guards in accordance with this Subsection, or (b) non-openable and designed to withstand the specified lateral loads for guards as provided in Article 4.1.5.14.

ON Full: Except as permitted in Articles 9.10.9.5. to 9.10.9.7., openings in required fire separations shall be protected with closures conforming to Subsection 9.10.13.
ON Variations: Except as permitted in Articles 9.10.9.5. to 9.10.9.7., openings in required fire separations shall be protected with closures conforming to Subsection 9.10.13.

ON Full: When floor drains are required, the floor surface shall be sloped so that no water can accumulate.
ON Variations: When floor drains are required, the floor surface shall be sloped so that no water can accumulate.

ON Full: If a fuel-burning appliance or a fireplace is installed in a suite of residential occupancy, a carbon monoxide alarm shall be installed adjacent to each sleeping area in the suite.
ON Variations: If a fuel-burning appliance or a fireplace is installed in a suite of residential occupancy, a carbon monoxide alarm shall be installed adjacent to each sleeping area in the suite.

ON Full: The size of a branch vent, stack vent, vent stack or header shall be not less than the size of the vent pipe to which it is connected.
ON Variations: The size of a branch vent, stack vent, vent stack or header shall be not less than the size of the vent pipe to which it is connected.

ON Full: Surface water, all groundwater, perched groundwater and in particular artesian groundwater shall be kept under control at all phases of excavation and construction.
ON Variations: Surface water, all groundwater, perched groundwater and in particular artesian groundwater shall be kept under control at all phases of excavation and construction.

ON Full: Brass or bronze threaded water fittings shall conform to ASME B16.15, "Cast Copper Alloy Threaded Fittings: Classes 125 and 250".
ON Variations: Brass or bronze threaded water fittings shall conform to ASME B16.15, "Cast Copper Alloy Threaded Fittings: Classes 125 and 250".

ON Full: Every water pipe that supplies a hot water tank, pressure vessel, plumbing appliance or water using device shall be provided with a shut-off valve located close to the tank, pressure vessel, plumbing appliance or water using device.
ON Variations: Every water pipe that supplies a hot water tank, pressure vessel, plumbing appliance or water using device shall be provided with a shut-off valve located close to the tank, pressure vessel, plumbing appliance or water using device.

ON Full: Hose stations shall be inspected monthly to ensure that the hose is in proper position and that all of the equipment is in place and in operable condition.
ON Variations: Hose stations shall be inspected monthly to ensure that the hose is in proper position and that all of the equipment is in place and in operable condition.

ON Full: Mortar for glass block masonry shall be,(a) Type S Portland cement-lime where exposed to the exterior, or (b) Type S or N where protected from the exterior.
ON Variations: Mortar for glass block masonry shall be,(a) Type S Portland cement-lime where exposed to the exterior, or (b) Type S or N where protected from the exterior.

ON Full: An annunciator need not be provided for a fire alarm system if not more than one zone indicator is required in Sentence (2).
ON Variations: An annunciator need not be provided for a fire alarm system if not more than one zone indicator is required in Sentence (2).

ON Full: The cap required in Sentence (1) shall slope from the lining and be provided with a drip not less than 25 mm from the chimney wall.
ON Variations: The cap required in Sentence (1) shall slope from the lining and be provided with a drip not less than 25 mm from the chimney wall.

ON Full: Where there is a danger of blockage from ice or snow, an exit door, including a door serving a house or an individual dwelling unit, may open onto not more than one step provided the riser of such step does not exceed 150 mm.
ON Variations: Where there is a danger of blockage from ice or snow, an exit door, including a door serving a house or an individual dwelling unit, may open onto not more than one step provided the riser of such step does not exceed 150 mm.

ON Full: Metal liners shall be constructed of at least 0.3 mm thick stainless steel.
ON Variations: Metal liners shall be constructed of at least 0.3 mm thick stainless steel.

ON Full: The checking, inspecting and testing of central alarm and control facilities and voice communication systems for life safety shall be carried out in accordance with the requirements of Section 6.3.
ON Variations: The checking, inspecting and testing of central alarm and control facilities and voice communication systems for life safety shall be carried out in accordance with the requirements of Section 6.3.

ON Full: Fire department sprinkler and standpipe connections shall be clearly identified and maintained free of obstructions for use at all times.
ON Variations: Fire department sprinkler and standpipe connections shall be clearly identified and maintained free of obstructions for use at all times.

ON Full: Matches shall be classified, packaged and labelled in accordance with the Transportation of Dangerous Goods Act (Canada).
ON Variations: Matches shall be classified, packaged and labelled in accordance with the Transportation of Dangerous Goods Act (Canada).

ON Full: Counter flashing installed over the intersection referred to in Sentence (1) shall be embedded not less than 25 mm in the masonry, and shall be of sufficient length to extend down not less than 150 mm, lapping the membrane on the masonry not less than 100 mm.
ON Variations: Counter flashing installed over the intersection referred to in Sentence (1) shall be embedded not less than 25 mm in the masonry, and shall be of sufficient length to extend down not less than 150 mm, lapping the membrane on the masonry not less than 100 mm.

ON Full: Electrical conductors that are used in conjunction with systems referred to in Clause (1)(c) shall, conform to CAN/ULC-S139, "Fire Test for Evaluation of Integrity of Electrical Power, Data and Optical Fibre Cables", including the hose stream application, to provide a circuit integrity rating of not less than 2 h, or (See A-3.2.7.10.(2)(a) in Appendix be located in a service space that is separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation that has a fire-resistance rating of not less than 2 h.
ON Variations: Electrical conductors that are used in conjunction with systems referred to in Clause (1)(c) shall, conform to CAN/ULC-S139, "Fire Test for Evaluation of Integrity of Electrical Power, Data and Optical Fibre Cables", including the hose stream application, to provide a circuit integrity rating of not less than 2 h, or (See A-3.2.7.10.(2)(a) in Appendix be located in a service space that is separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation that has a fire-resistance rating of not less than 2 h.

ON Full: Every screw, bolt, nut and washer shall be of materials that are resistant to corrosion, when used,(a) to connect a water closet to a floor flange, (b) to anchor the floor flange to the floor, (c) to anchor the water closet to the floor, or (d) to hold cleanout covers or floor drain grates.
ON Variations: Every screw, bolt, nut and washer shall be of materials that are resistant to corrosion, when used,(a) to connect a water closet to a floor flange, (b) to anchor the floor flange to the floor, (c) to anchor the water closet to the floor, or (d) to hold cleanout covers or floor drain grates.

ON Full: Masonry veneer shall conform to Subsection 4.3.2. where the masonry units are required to be individually supported by the structural backing.
ON Variations: Masonry veneer shall conform to Subsection 4.3.2. where the masonry units are required to be individually supported by the structural backing.

ON Full: A fire damper shall be arranged to close automatically upon the operation of a fusible link conforming to ULC S505, "Fusible Links for Fire Protection Service", or other heat-actuated or smoke-actuated device.
ON Variations: A fire damper shall be arranged to close automatically upon the operation of a fusible link conforming to ULC S505, "Fusible Links for Fire Protection Service", or other heat-actuated or smoke-actuated device.

ON Full: Except as required for aisles by Article 3.3.2.4., the maximum slope of a ramp shall be, 1 in 10 in any assembly, care, care and treatment, detention or residential occupancy, 1 in 6 in an industrial occupancy, 1 in 8 in all other occupancies, and 1 in 10 for an exterior ramp.
ON Variations: Except as required for aisles by Article 3.3.2.4., the maximum slope of a ramp shall be, 1 in 10 in any assembly, care, care and treatment, detention or residential occupancy, 1 in 6 in an industrial occupancy, 1 in 8 in all other occupancies, and 1 in 10 for an exterior ramp.

ON Full: The number of water closets required shall conform to Table 3.7.4.3.C. for, motion picture theatres, Group A, Division 3 occupancies, Group A, Division 4 occupancies, and outdoor pools.
ON Variations: The number of water closets required shall conform to Table 3.7.4.3.C. for, motion picture theatres, Group A, Division 3 occupancies, Group A, Division 4 occupancies, and outdoor pools.

ON Full: Access aisles not less than 1.0 m wide shall be provided to exits, to fire department access panels and to fire protection equipment.
ON Variations: Access aisles not less than 1.0 m wide shall be provided to exits, to fire department access panels and to fire protection equipment.

ON Full: The performance level of an existing building is reduced where the existing building is extended or subject to material alteration or repair, and plumbing in the existing building is adversely affected by the extension, alteration or repair.
ON Variations: The performance level of an existing building is reduced where the existing building is extended or subject to material alteration or repair, and plumbing in the existing building is adversely affected by the extension, alteration or repair.

ON Full: Ducts shall be securely supported by metal hangers, straps, lugs or brackets, except that where zero clearance is permitted, wooden brackets may be used.
ON Variations: Ducts shall be securely supported by metal hangers, straps, lugs or brackets, except that where zero clearance is permitted, wooden brackets may be used.

ON Full: Openings for other than stairways, escalators or elevators are permitted to penetrate the fire separations required in Sentences (2) to (6) provided the openings are protected by a closure having a fire-protection rating not less than 45 min.
ON Variations: Openings for other than stairways, escalators or elevators are permitted to penetrate the fire separations required in Sentences (2) to (6) provided the openings are protected by a closure having a fire-protection rating not less than 45 min.

ON Full: Drainage for crawl spaces shall conform to Section 9.18.
ON Variations: Drainage for crawl spaces shall conform to Section 9.18.

ON Full: Wiped joints shall not be used except for sheet lead or lead pipe, or between such pipe and copper pipe or a ferrule.
ON Variations: Wiped joints shall not be used except for sheet lead or lead pipe, or between such pipe and copper pipe or a ferrule.

ON Full: The slope of ramps shall be not more than,(a) 1 in 10 for exterior ramps, (b) 1 in 10 for interior ramps serving residential occupancies, (c) 1 in 6 for industrial occupancies, and (d) 1 in 8 for all other occupancies.
ON Variations: The slope of ramps shall be not more than,(a) 1 in 10 for exterior ramps, (b) 1 in 10 for interior ramps serving residential occupancies, (c) 1 in 6 for industrial occupancies, and (d) 1 in 8 for all other occupancies.

ON Full: The upper end of every soil or waste stack shall terminate in a stack vent and the stack vent shall terminate in open air outside the building, or connect directly or through a header to another stack vent or vent stack that does terminate in open air outside the building.
ON Variations: The upper end of every soil or waste stack shall terminate in a stack vent and the stack vent shall terminate in open air outside the building, or connect directly or through a header to another stack vent or vent stack that does terminate in open air outside the building.

ON Full: This Article applies where the required protection is provided in accordance with Clause 9.11.1.1.(1)(b) and compliance is demonstrated in accordance with Clause 9.11.1.3.(2)(b).
ON Variations: This Article applies where the required protection is provided in accordance with Clause 9.11.1.1.(1)(b) and compliance is demonstrated in accordance with Clause 9.11.1.3.(2)(b).

ON Full: Main entrance doors and their components shall be designed, constructed and installed so that, when in the closed position, they, (a) control air leakage, (b) resist the ingress of insects and vermin, (c) resist forced entry, and (d) are easily operable.
ON Variations: Main entrance doors and their components shall be designed, constructed and installed so that, when in the closed position, they, (a) control air leakage, (b) resist the ingress of insects and vermin, (c) resist forced entry, and (d) are easily operable.

ON Full: Where a public pool is to be equipped with diving boards or diving platforms greater than 3 m in height above the water surface, the design of the diving boards or diving platforms and the corresponding water depths and clearances shall be in accordance with FINA, "Rules and Regulations - FINA Facilities Rules 2009-2013 - FR5 Diving Facilities".
ON Variations: Where a public pool is to be equipped with diving boards or diving platforms greater than 3 m in height above the water surface, the design of the diving boards or diving platforms and the corresponding water depths and clearances shall be in accordance with FINA, "Rules and Regulations - FINA Facilities Rules 2009-2013 - FR5 Diving Facilities".

ON Full: Spray booths and spray rooms shall be provided with overspray collection, such as filters or water wash, to prevent the build-up of combustible deposits on the exhaust fan and ductwork.
ON Variations: Spray booths and spray rooms shall be provided with overspray collection, such as filters or water wash, to prevent the build-up of combustible deposits on the exhaust fan and ductwork.

ON Full: Clause (4)(a) does not apply to a sprinkler system that met the requirements of this Code on December 31, 2014, as it read on that day.
ON Variations: Clause (4)(a) does not apply to a sprinkler system that met the requirements of this Code on December 31, 2014, as it read on that day.

ON Full: Mezzanines shall not be considered as storeys for the purpose of determining building height where the aggregate area of mezzanine floors does not exceed 10% of,(a) the suite in which it is located, where there is more than one suite in the storey, or (b) the storey in which it is located, in all other cases.
ON Variations: Mezzanines shall not be considered as storeys for the purpose of determining building height where the aggregate area of mezzanine floors does not exceed 10% of,(a) the suite in which it is located, where there is more than one suite in the storey, or (b) the storey in which it is located, in all other cases.

ON Full: Logs placed in vertical position shall be supported over window and door openings by lintels meeting the requirements of Tables A-12 to A-16.
ON Variations: Logs placed in vertical position shall be supported over window and door openings by lintels meeting the requirements of Tables A-12 to A-16.

ON Full: Salvage tanks shall be provided with vent pipes that meet the requirements of Subsection 4.3.5. for aboveground storage tanks or Subsection 4.3.10. for underground storage tanks.
ON Variations: Salvage tanks shall be provided with vent pipes that meet the requirements of Subsection 4.3.5. for aboveground storage tanks or Subsection 4.3.10. for underground storage tanks.

ON Full: A transfer wall providing barrier-free access for entry into and egress from a public spa shall, have a height not less than 405 mm and not more than 485 mm measured from the pool deck, have a depth of at least 300 mm and not more than 400 mm, be slip-resistant and have edges that are rounded, and have at least one grab bar that, is perpendicular to the pool and extends the full depth of the transfer wall, is located not less than 100 mm and not more than 150 mm above the transfer wall, has a clearance of at least 610 mm on both sides, complies with Clauses 3.8.3.8.(7)(a) and (b), and is made of a slip-resistant material.
ON Variations: A transfer wall providing barrier-free access for entry into and egress from a public spa shall, have a height not less than 405 mm and not more than 485 mm measured from the pool deck, have a depth of at least 300 mm and not more than 400 mm, be slip-resistant and have edges that are rounded, and have at least one grab bar that, is perpendicular to the pool and extends the full depth of the transfer wall, is located not less than 100 mm and not more than 150 mm above the transfer wall, has a clearance of at least 610 mm on both sides, complies with Clauses 3.8.3.8.(7)(a) and (b), and is made of a slip-resistant material.

ON Full: Except as permitted by Sentence (3), totally enclosed nonmetallic raceways conforming to Article 3.1.5.20., optical fibre cables, and electrical wires and cables, single or grouped, with combustible insulation, jackets or sheathes that conform to the requirements of Clause 3.1.5.18.(1)(a) and that are not installed in totally enclosed noncombustible raceways are permitted to penetrate an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating without being incorporated in the assembly at the time of testing as required by Article 3.1.9.2., provided the overall diameter of the single or grouped wires or cables, or the raceways is not more than 25 mm.
ON Variations: Except as permitted by Sentence (3), totally enclosed nonmetallic raceways conforming to Article 3.1.5.20., optical fibre cables, and electrical wires and cables, single or grouped, with combustible insulation, jackets or sheathes that conform to the requirements of Clause 3.1.5.18.(1)(a) and that are not installed in totally enclosed noncombustible raceways are permitted to penetrate an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating without being incorporated in the assembly at the time of testing as required by Article 3.1.9.2., provided the overall diameter of the single or grouped wires or cables, or the raceways is not more than 25 mm.

ON Full: Where materials, components or assemblies that separate dissimilar environments or are exposed to the exterior, or their connections, can be expected to be subject to loads or other effects not otherwise described in this Subsection or in Part 4, such loads or other effects shall be taken into account in the design based on the most current and applicable information available.
ON Variations: Where materials, components or assemblies that separate dissimilar environments or are exposed to the exterior, or their connections, can be expected to be subject to loads or other effects not otherwise described in this Subsection or in Part 4, such loads or other effects shall be taken into account in the design based on the most current and applicable information available.

ON Full: Chases and recesses shall be not less than,(a) four times the wall thickness apart, and (b) 600 mm away from any pilaster, cross wall, buttress or other vertical element providing required lateral support for the wall.
ON Variations: Chases and recesses shall be not less than,(a) four times the wall thickness apart, and (b) 600 mm away from any pilaster, cross wall, buttress or other vertical element providing required lateral support for the wall.

ON Full: Where an excavation is backfilled, the backfill shall be placed so as to, (a) provide lateral support to the soil adjacent to the excavation, and (b) prevent detrimental movements.
ON Variations: Where an excavation is backfilled, the backfill shall be placed so as to, (a) provide lateral support to the soil adjacent to the excavation, and (b) prevent detrimental movements.

ON Full: Copper tube in a plumbing system shall,(a) be certified to ASTM B88, "Seamless Copper Water Tube", or (b) comply with ASTM B306, "Copper Drainage Tube (DWV)".
ON Variations: Copper tube in a plumbing system shall,(a) be certified to ASTM B88, "Seamless Copper Water Tube", or (b) comply with ASTM B306, "Copper Drainage Tube (DWV)".

ON Full: Except for fuel-thawing pipes, every pipe designed to operate at a temperature of 50°C or above shall be located where fuel cannot be stored in contact with it.
ON Variations: Except for fuel-thawing pipes, every pipe designed to operate at a temperature of 50°C or above shall be located where fuel cannot be stored in contact with it.

ON Full: Flashing beneath weep holes in cavity walls and masonry veneer/masonry back-up walls shall,(a) be bedded not less than 25 mm in the inside wythe, (b) extend to not less than 5 mm beyond the outer face of the building element below the flashing, and (c) be installed with a nominally horizontal slope toward the outside wythe.
ON Variations: Flashing beneath weep holes in cavity walls and masonry veneer/masonry back-up walls shall,(a) be bedded not less than 25 mm in the inside wythe, (b) extend to not less than 5 mm beyond the outer face of the building element below the flashing, and (c) be installed with a nominally horizontal slope toward the outside wythe.

ON Full: Distribution of portable extinguishers for Class C fires shall conform to the applicable provisions for the distribution of extinguishers for Class A fires or Class B fires in the vicinity of the electrical equipment.
ON Variations: Distribution of portable extinguishers for Class C fires shall conform to the applicable provisions for the distribution of extinguishers for Class A fires or Class B fires in the vicinity of the electrical equipment.

ON Full: In a building under demolition that is over 84 m in height, the primary water supply serving the standpipe system, including fire pumps, shall be maintained in operating condition.
ON Variations: In a building under demolition that is over 84 m in height, the primary water supply serving the standpipe system, including fire pumps, shall be maintained in operating condition.

ON Full: Merchandising or public activities in a sprinklered covered mall described in Article 2.12.1.1. shall not be carried out where such activity will create a hazard exceeding the design criteria for which the sprinkler system was designed.
ON Variations: Merchandising or public activities in a sprinklered covered mall described in Article 2.12.1.1. shall not be carried out where such activity will create a hazard exceeding the design criteria for which the sprinkler system was designed.

ON Full: Piping supports shall consist of wood having no dimension less than 150 mm, steel, or concrete.
ON Variations: Piping supports shall consist of wood having no dimension less than 150 mm, steel, or concrete.

ON Full: In care occupancies, care and treatment occupancies and detention occupancies, the total quantity of flammable liquids and combustible liquids stored in cabinets in a single fire compartment shall not exceed the quantity permitted for one cabinet.
ON Variations: In care occupancies, care and treatment occupancies and detention occupancies, the total quantity of flammable liquids and combustible liquids stored in cabinets in a single fire compartment shall not exceed the quantity permitted for one cabinet.

ON Full: Except where back-slope will not adversely affect adjacent supported or supporting elements due to water ingress, roofs and elements that effectively serve as roofs shall be constructed with sufficient slope away from,(a) exterior walls, and (b) guards that are connected to the roof, or to an element that effectively serves as a roof, by more than pickets or posts.
ON Variations: Except where back-slope will not adversely affect adjacent supported or supporting elements due to water ingress, roofs and elements that effectively serve as roofs shall be constructed with sufficient slope away from,(a) exterior walls, and (b) guards that are connected to the roof, or to an element that effectively serves as a roof, by more than pickets or posts.

ON Full: If during construction, the soil, rock or groundwater is found not to be of the type or in the condition used in design, and as indicated on the drawings, the design shall be reassessed by the designer.
ON Variations: If during construction, the soil, rock or groundwater is found not to be of the type or in the condition used in design, and as indicated on the drawings, the design shall be reassessed by the designer.

ON Full: Sawdust and shavings may be used if kept damp.
ON Variations: Sawdust and shavings may be used if kept damp.

ON Full: Railway tracks on piers and wharves shall be bonded throughout their length and permanently grounded in conformance with Railway Prevention of Electric Sparks Regulations made under the Canada Transportation Act.
ON Variations: Railway tracks on piers and wharves shall be bonded throughout their length and permanently grounded in conformance with Railway Prevention of Electric Sparks Regulations made under the Canada Transportation Act.

ON Full: Pile heights for stickered lumber piles shall not exceed 6 m.
ON Variations: Pile heights for stickered lumber piles shall not exceed 6 m.

ON Full: A fire alarm system shall be installed.
ON Variations: A fire alarm system shall be installed.

ON Full: Sentence (1) does not apply to high voltage grids and their connections.
ON Variations: Sentence (1) does not apply to high voltage grids and their connections.

ON Full: A water-wash filtration system shall be used when applying materials known to be highly susceptible to spontaneous heating or spontaneous ignition.
ON Variations: A water-wash filtration system shall be used when applying materials known to be highly susceptible to spontaneous heating or spontaneous ignition.

ON Full: Except as provided in Article 7.5.7.1. and in Sentence 7.5.3.1.(7), the minimum size of an additional circuit vent or relief vent installed in conjunction with a circuit vent is permitted to be one size smaller than the required size of the circuit vent, but need not be larger than 2 in.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Article 7.5.7.1. and in Sentence 7.5.3.1.(7), the minimum size of an additional circuit vent or relief vent installed in conjunction with a circuit vent is permitted to be one size smaller than the required size of the circuit vent, but need not be larger than 2 in.

ON Full: Every wall mounted fixture shall be supported so that no strain is transmitted to the piping.
ON Variations: Every wall mounted fixture shall be supported so that no strain is transmitted to the piping.

ON Full: Except in the case of an external leader, after a section of drainage system or a venting system has been roughed in, and before any fixture is installed or piping is covered, a water or an air test shall be conducted.
ON Variations: Except in the case of an external leader, after a section of drainage system or a venting system has been roughed in, and before any fixture is installed or piping is covered, a water or an air test shall be conducted.

ON Full: Except for Group B, Division 1 and Group F, Division 1 major occupancies, a one-way voice communication system shall be installed in a building where, a fire alarm system is required under Subsection 3.2.4., a two-stage fire alarm system is installed, and the occupant load of the building exceeds 1 000.
ON Variations: Except for Group B, Division 1 and Group F, Division 1 major occupancies, a one-way voice communication system shall be installed in a building where, a fire alarm system is required under Subsection 3.2.4., a two-stage fire alarm system is installed, and the occupant load of the building exceeds 1 000.

ON Full: This Subsection, except Article 3.3.2.6., does not apply to special hazard commodities covered elsewhere in this Code.
ON Variations: This Subsection, except Article 3.3.2.6., does not apply to special hazard commodities covered elsewhere in this Code.

ON Full: Single conductor metal-sheathed cables with combustible jacketing that are more than 25 mm in overall diameter are permitted to penetrate a fire separation required to have a fire-resistance rating without being incorporated in the assembly at the time of testing as required in Sentence (3), provided the cables are not grouped and are spaced a minimum of 300 mm apart.
ON Variations: Single conductor metal-sheathed cables with combustible jacketing that are more than 25 mm in overall diameter are permitted to penetrate a fire separation required to have a fire-resistance rating without being incorporated in the assembly at the time of testing as required in Sentence (3), provided the cables are not grouped and are spaced a minimum of 300 mm apart.

ON Full: Cargo hose shall be supported where it is not run on a solid foundation.
ON Variations: Cargo hose shall be supported where it is not run on a solid foundation.

ON Full: A treatment unit is deemed to comply with Sentences (1) and (2) if it has been certified to CAN/BNQ 3680-600, "Onsite Residential Wastewater Treatment Technologies" using a temperature condition listed under option or of Clause 8.2.2. of that standard. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: A treatment unit is deemed to comply with Sentences (1) and (2) if it has been certified to CAN/BNQ 3680-600, "Onsite Residential Wastewater Treatment Technologies" using a temperature condition listed under option or of Clause 8.2.2. of that standard. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: When a leak is detected in a storage tank by a leakage test required in this Subsection or by a leakage detection measure required in Subsection 4.3.16., the storage tank shall be replaced, in the case of an underground tank, or be repaired or replaced in the case of an aboveground tank, and the escaped liquid shall be removed in conformance with Article 4.1.6.3.
ON Variations: When a leak is detected in a storage tank by a leakage test required in this Subsection or by a leakage detection measure required in Subsection 4.3.16., the storage tank shall be replaced, in the case of an underground tank, or be repaired or replaced in the case of an aboveground tank, and the escaped liquid shall be removed in conformance with Article 4.1.6.3.

ON Full: Ventilation shall be provided in pump houses in conformance with Subsection 4.1.7.
ON Variations: Ventilation shall be provided in pump houses in conformance with Subsection 4.1.7.

ON Full: Wired glass described in Sentence (1) shall be mounted in fixed steel frames having a minimum metal thickness of not less than 1.35 mm and a glazing stop of not less than 20 mm on each side of the glass.
ON Variations: Wired glass described in Sentence (1) shall be mounted in fixed steel frames having a minimum metal thickness of not less than 1.35 mm and a glazing stop of not less than 20 mm on each side of the glass.

ON Full: Except as provided for in Sentence (4), the wind exposure factor, Cw, shall be 1.0.
ON Variations: Except as provided for in Sentence (4), the wind exposure factor, Cw, shall be 1.0.

ON Full: In a building that is not sprinklered in accordance with Sentence 3.2.5.13.(1), the principal entrance serving a dance hall or a licensed beverage establishment with an occupant load more than 250 shall provide at least one-half of the required exit width.
ON Variations: In a building that is not sprinklered in accordance with Sentence 3.2.5.13.(1), the principal entrance serving a dance hall or a licensed beverage establishment with an occupant load more than 250 shall provide at least one-half of the required exit width.

ON Full: This Section applies to the construction of leaching beds.
ON Variations: This Section applies to the construction of leaching beds.

ON Full: For materials, components, assemblies and loads to which Sentence (3) does not apply, the design and construction required by Clause (1)(b) shall,(a) comply with Subsection 5.2.2. for individual applicable loads, or (b) in the case of common materials, components and assemblies, and their installation, be based on proven past performance over a period of several years for individual applicable loads. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: For materials, components, assemblies and loads to which Sentence (3) does not apply, the design and construction required by Clause (1)(b) shall,(a) comply with Subsection 5.2.2. for individual applicable loads, or (b) in the case of common materials, components and assemblies, and their installation, be based on proven past performance over a period of several years for individual applicable loads. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Equipment required to have a dust-collecting system shall be interlocked to prevent it from operating if the dust-collecting system is not in operation.
ON Variations: Equipment required to have a dust-collecting system shall be interlocked to prevent it from operating if the dust-collecting system is not in operation.

ON Full: Where provision is made for a fixture to be installed in the future, the drainage system and venting system shall be sized accordingly and provision made for the necessary future connections.
ON Variations: Where provision is made for a fixture to be installed in the future, the drainage system and venting system shall be sized accordingly and provision made for the necessary future connections.

ON Full: A roof or other building surface and its structural members subject to loads due to snow accumulation shall be designed for the specified load in Sentence 4.1.6.2.(1), distributed over the entire loaded area.
ON Variations: A roof or other building surface and its structural members subject to loads due to snow accumulation shall be designed for the specified load in Sentence 4.1.6.2.(1), distributed over the entire loaded area.

ON Full: Passenger elevators are permitted to open onto the lobby referred to in Sentence (1) provided the elevator doors are designed to remain closed except while loading and unloading.
ON Variations: Passenger elevators are permitted to open onto the lobby referred to in Sentence (1) provided the elevator doors are designed to remain closed except while loading and unloading.

ON Full: Pilot lights on emergency lighting unit equipment shall be checked monthly for operation.
ON Variations: Pilot lights on emergency lighting unit equipment shall be checked monthly for operation.

ON Full: Heating equipment for piping systems containing flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be designed not to overheat or create an ignition source for the liquids being heated.
ON Variations: Heating equipment for piping systems containing flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be designed not to overheat or create an ignition source for the liquids being heated.

ON Full: Flow control roof drains may be installed provided,(a) the maximum drain down time does not exceed 24 h, (b) the roof structure is designed to carry the load of the stored water, (c) one or more scuppers are installed not more than 30 m apart along the perimeter of the building so that, (i) the scuppers are designed to handle at least 200% of the 15-minute rainfall intensity, and (ii) the maximum depth of controlled water is limited to 150 mm, (d) they are located not more than 15 m from the edge of the roof and not more than 30 m from adjacent drains, and (e) there is at least one drain for each 900 m2.
ON Variations: Flow control roof drains may be installed provided,(a) the maximum drain down time does not exceed 24 h, (b) the roof structure is designed to carry the load of the stored water, (c) one or more scuppers are installed not more than 30 m apart along the perimeter of the building so that, (i) the scuppers are designed to handle at least 200% of the 15-minute rainfall intensity, and (ii) the maximum depth of controlled water is limited to 150 mm, (d) they are located not more than 15 m from the edge of the roof and not more than 30 m from adjacent drains, and (e) there is at least one drain for each 900 m2.

ON Full: Where make-up air for a mechanical ventilation system is taken from within the building, the opening into the room or enclosed space shall be provided with a fire damper.
ON Variations: Where make-up air for a mechanical ventilation system is taken from within the building, the opening into the room or enclosed space shall be provided with a fire damper.

ON Full: Where proposed construction will result in the change of major occupancy of all or part of an existing building to another major occupancy, the building shall be classified as to its,(a) construction on the basis of its construction index as provided for in this Part, including Table 11.2.1.1.A., and (See Appendix A.) (b) occupancy on the basis of its hazard index as provided for in this Part, including Tables 11.2.1.1.B. to 11.2.1.1.N. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Where proposed construction will result in the change of major occupancy of all or part of an existing building to another major occupancy, the building shall be classified as to its,(a) construction on the basis of its construction index as provided for in this Part, including Table 11.2.1.1.A., and (See Appendix A.) (b) occupancy on the basis of its hazard index as provided for in this Part, including Tables 11.2.1.1.B. to 11.2.1.1.N. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Type 1 expanded polystyrene insulation as described in CAN/ULC-S701, "Thermal Insulation, Polystyrene, Boards and Pipe Covering", shall not be used as roof insulation applied above the roofing membrane.
ON Variations: Type 1 expanded polystyrene insulation as described in CAN/ULC-S701, "Thermal Insulation, Polystyrene, Boards and Pipe Covering", shall not be used as roof insulation applied above the roofing membrane.

ON Full: No connection shall be made between a potable water system supplied with water from a drinking water system and any other potable water system without the consent of the water purveyor.
ON Variations: No connection shall be made between a potable water system supplied with water from a drinking water system and any other potable water system without the consent of the water purveyor.

ON Full: The butts of the shingles or shakes shall be so located that they project not less than 12 mm below the bottom edge of the lath referred to in Sentence (1).
ON Variations: The butts of the shingles or shakes shall be so located that they project not less than 12 mm below the bottom edge of the lath referred to in Sentence (1).

ON Full: Particleboard finish shall conform to ANSI A208.1, "Particleboard".
ON Variations: Particleboard finish shall conform to ANSI A208.1, "Particleboard".

ON Full: Where a solar domestic hot water system includes a single wall heat exchanger and contains only a relatively harmless heat transfer fluid as described in CAN/CSA-F379.1, "Packaged Solar Domestic Hot Water Systems (Liquid-to-Liquid Heat for All-Season Use", the backflow prevention required in Sentence (1) is permitted to be a dual check valve backflow preventer conforming to CSA B64.3, "Dual Check Valve Backflow Preventers with Atmospheric Port (DCAP)".
ON Variations: Where a solar domestic hot water system includes a single wall heat exchanger and contains only a relatively harmless heat transfer fluid as described in CAN/CSA-F379.1, "Packaged Solar Domestic Hot Water Systems (Liquid-to-Liquid Heat for All-Season Use", the backflow prevention required in Sentence (1) is permitted to be a dual check valve backflow preventer conforming to CSA B64.3, "Dual Check Valve Backflow Preventers with Atmospheric Port (DCAP)".

ON Full: Materials in Sentences (1) to (4) installed in a location where they may be subjected to excessive moisture shall have no appreciable loss of strength when wet and shall be corrosion-resistant.
ON Variations: Materials in Sentences (1) to (4) installed in a location where they may be subjected to excessive moisture shall have no appreciable loss of strength when wet and shall be corrosion-resistant.

ON Full: The fire safety plan shall be kept in the building or premises in an approved location.
ON Variations: The fire safety plan shall be kept in the building or premises in an approved location.

ON Full: The building referred to in Sentence (1) is permitted to be of heavy timber construction or noncombustible construction used singly or in combination, and, floor assemblies shall be fire separations, with a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min, or of heavy timber construction, and loadbearing walls, columns and arches shall, have a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the supported assembly, or be of heavy timber construction.
ON Variations: The building referred to in Sentence (1) is permitted to be of heavy timber construction or noncombustible construction used singly or in combination, and, floor assemblies shall be fire separations, with a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min, or of heavy timber construction, and loadbearing walls, columns and arches shall, have a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the supported assembly, or be of heavy timber construction.

ON Full: Despite Clause (2)(a), where storage consists of multiple products within the same class, placards that identify the class of liquids shall be acceptable.
ON Variations: Despite Clause (2)(a), where storage consists of multiple products within the same class, placards that identify the class of liquids shall be acceptable.

ON Full: Each neutralizing or diluting tank shall have a method for neutralizing the liquid.
ON Variations: Each neutralizing or diluting tank shall have a method for neutralizing the liquid.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (3), no obstructions, such as counter gates, that do not meet the requirements for exit doors, shall be placed in a required means of egress from a floor area or part of a floor area unless an alternate unobstructed means of egress is provided adjacent to and plainly visible from the restricted egress.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (3), no obstructions, such as counter gates, that do not meet the requirements for exit doors, shall be placed in a required means of egress from a floor area or part of a floor area unless an alternate unobstructed means of egress is provided adjacent to and plainly visible from the restricted egress.

ON Full: The requirements in this Subsection apply to a shelf and rack storage system intended for the storage of Class I, II, III and IV commodities as defined in NFPA 13, "Installation of Sprinkler Systems".
ON Variations: The requirements in this Subsection apply to a shelf and rack storage system intended for the storage of Class I, II, III and IV commodities as defined in NFPA 13, "Installation of Sprinkler Systems".

ON Full: Except where it can be shown to be unnecessary, where insulation is installed between a ceiling and the underside of the roof sheathing, a space shall be provided between the insulation and the sheathing, and vents shall be installed to permit the movement of air from the space to the exterior. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Except where it can be shown to be unnecessary, where insulation is installed between a ceiling and the underside of the roof sheathing, a space shall be provided between the insulation and the sheathing, and vents shall be installed to permit the movement of air from the space to the exterior. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Piping used for internal leaders, which may be subject to condensation, shall be installed in a manner that limits the risk of damage to the building due to condensation.
ON Variations: Piping used for internal leaders, which may be subject to condensation, shall be installed in a manner that limits the risk of damage to the building due to condensation.

ON Full: Except for motion picture theatres, the number of water closets required for Group A, Division 1 occupancies shall conform to Table 3.7.4.3.B.
ON Variations: Except for motion picture theatres, the number of water closets required for Group A, Division 1 occupancies shall conform to Table 3.7.4.3.B.

ON Full: The distance from the bottom of an air intake opening to finished ground level or to any nearer and lower permanent horizontal surface shall be not less than 450 mm or the depth of expected snow accumulation, whichever is greater.
ON Variations: The distance from the bottom of an air intake opening to finished ground level or to any nearer and lower permanent horizontal surface shall be not less than 450 mm or the depth of expected snow accumulation, whichever is greater.

ON Full: Systems permitted in Sentence (1) shall be installed and tested as complete units and unheated sections of piping shall be isolated from heated sections by means of nonconductive fittings, thermostatic controls, high temperature limit controls and fuses shall have the lowest practical rating to ensure satisfactory operation, all parts of the piping and fittings shall be enclosed by insulated coverings of a type which will prevent accidental grounding of the systems, and switches, transformers, contactors and other spark-producing equipment shall be located in an area not subject to flammable vapours.
ON Variations: Systems permitted in Sentence (1) shall be installed and tested as complete units and unheated sections of piping shall be isolated from heated sections by means of nonconductive fittings, thermostatic controls, high temperature limit controls and fuses shall have the lowest practical rating to ensure satisfactory operation, all parts of the piping and fittings shall be enclosed by insulated coverings of a type which will prevent accidental grounding of the systems, and switches, transformers, contactors and other spark-producing equipment shall be located in an area not subject to flammable vapours.

ON Full: Any part of a building where floor finishing operations are done shall not be open to the public.
ON Variations: Any part of a building where floor finishing operations are done shall not be open to the public.

ON Full: In this Part, Building system means a combination of elements or components that form a complete major division of construction in the design of a building or part of a building, including a structural or framing system, a waterproofing system, a drainage system, an exterior cladding system, a roofing system, a window system, a partition system, a corridor system, a stair system, a fire alarm and detection system, a sprinkler system or a heating, ventilation or air-conditioning system, a foundation system, a standpipe and hose system, a flooring system, a plumbing system, a sewage system or an electrical system.
ON Variations: In this Part, Building system means a combination of elements or components that form a complete major division of construction in the design of a building or part of a building, including a structural or framing system, a waterproofing system, a drainage system, an exterior cladding system, a roofing system, a window system, a partition system, a corridor system, a stair system, a fire alarm and detection system, a sprinkler system or a heating, ventilation or air-conditioning system, a foundation system, a standpipe and hose system, a flooring system, a plumbing system, a sewage system or an electrical system.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentences (2) and (5), a dust collector shall be located outside of a building.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentences (2) and (5), a dust collector shall be located outside of a building.

ON Full: Except as permitted by Articles 3.2.2.39. to 3.2.2.41., a building classified as Group B, Division 2 or Division 3 shall conform to Sentence (2).
ON Variations: Except as permitted by Articles 3.2.2.39. to 3.2.2.41., a building classified as Group B, Division 2 or Division 3 shall conform to Sentence (2).

ON Full: The static head imposed on a storage tank inside a building shall not exceed 70 kPa (gauge) at the bottom of the tank when the vent or fill pipe is filled with liquid unless the tank is designed for greater pressures.
ON Variations: The static head imposed on a storage tank inside a building shall not exceed 70 kPa (gauge) at the bottom of the tank when the vent or fill pipe is filled with liquid unless the tank is designed for greater pressures.

ON Full: Sheathing membranes shall conform to the performance requirements of CAN/CGSB-51.32-M, "Sheathing, Membrane, Breather Type".
ON Variations: Sheathing membranes shall conform to the performance requirements of CAN/CGSB-51.32-M, "Sheathing, Membrane, Breather Type".

ON Full: Where a hold-open device is used on closures other than those described in Sentences (3) and (4), it is permitted to be released upon actuation of a heat-actuated device.
ON Variations: Where a hold-open device is used on closures other than those described in Sentences (3) and (4), it is permitted to be released upon actuation of a heat-actuated device.

ON Full: Locking devices permitted by Sentence (6) that are electrically operated shall be, designed to operate on emergency power, and capable of manual release by security personnel.
ON Variations: Locking devices permitted by Sentence (6) that are electrically operated shall be, designed to operate on emergency power, and capable of manual release by security personnel.

ON Full: A pressure relief valve and temperature relief valve may be combined where Sentences (1) and (2) are complied with.
ON Variations: A pressure relief valve and temperature relief valve may be combined where Sentences (1) and (2) are complied with.

ON Full: Sentence (1) does not apply to hot water supplied to installed dishwashers or clothes washers.
ON Variations: Sentence (1) does not apply to hot water supplied to installed dishwashers or clothes washers.

ON Full: Sentence (1) does not apply where the existing situation is approved and does not endanger life safety or alternative measures to the requirements set out in Sentence (1) are taken to provide life safety.
ON Variations: Sentence (1) does not apply where the existing situation is approved and does not endanger life safety or alternative measures to the requirements set out in Sentence (1) are taken to provide life safety.

ON Full: Where a grease interceptor is required by Sentence 7.4.4.3.(1), the interceptor shall conform to, (a) CSA B481.1, "Testing and Rating of Grease Interceptors Using Lard", or (b) CSA B481.2, "Testing and Rating of Grease Interceptors Using Oil".
ON Variations: Where a grease interceptor is required by Sentence 7.4.4.3.(1), the interceptor shall conform to, (a) CSA B481.1, "Testing and Rating of Grease Interceptors Using Lard", or (b) CSA B481.2, "Testing and Rating of Grease Interceptors Using Oil".

ON Full: An elevated exterior passageway used as part of a means of egress shall conform to the requirements of Articles 3.2.2.20. to 3.2.2.83. for mezzanines.
ON Variations: An elevated exterior passageway used as part of a means of egress shall conform to the requirements of Articles 3.2.2.20. to 3.2.2.83. for mezzanines.

ON Full: The requirements of Sentence (4) do not apply to vent piping with an operational vent alarm if the vent piping met the requirements of this Code on December 31, 2014, as it read on that day.
ON Variations: The requirements of Sentence (4) do not apply to vent piping with an operational vent alarm if the vent piping met the requirements of this Code on December 31, 2014, as it read on that day.

ON Full: Protective breathing apparatus shall be made available at the premises undergoing fumigation or thermal insecticidal fogging for all persons in case of emergency.
ON Variations: Protective breathing apparatus shall be made available at the premises undergoing fumigation or thermal insecticidal fogging for all persons in case of emergency.

ON Full: Where more than one public spa is provided within a suite located on a storey that is required by Article 3.8.2.1. to have a barrier-free path of travel, a barrier-free access described in Sentence (2) shall be provided to at least one public spa.
ON Variations: Where more than one public spa is provided within a suite located on a storey that is required by Article 3.8.2.1. to have a barrier-free path of travel, a barrier-free access described in Sentence (2) shall be provided to at least one public spa.

ON Full: Except as required by Sentence 3.2.3.7.(8), the maximum area of unprotected openings in any exposing building face or fire compartment of a building that is not sprinklered is permitted to be doubled if the openings are glazed with, glass block conforming to the requirements of Article 3.1.8.14., or wired glass assemblies conforming to MMAH Supplementary Standard SB-2, "Fire Performance Ratings".
ON Variations: Except as required by Sentence 3.2.3.7.(8), the maximum area of unprotected openings in any exposing building face or fire compartment of a building that is not sprinklered is permitted to be doubled if the openings are glazed with, glass block conforming to the requirements of Article 3.1.8.14., or wired glass assemblies conforming to MMAH Supplementary Standard SB-2, "Fire Performance Ratings".

ON Full: Subject to Sentences (2) and (3), this Part does not apply to individual dwelling units.
ON Variations: Subject to Sentences (2) and (3), this Part does not apply to individual dwelling units.

ON Full: Any single platform or walkway in a shelf and rack storage system may be served by a single unenclosed stair leading to the platform or walkway level immediately below provided, the platform or walkway does not exceed 200 m2 in area, the travel distance on the platform or walkway to the level below, including the travel distance along the single unenclosed egress stair, does not exceed 25 m, and the platform or walkway below is provided with two separate egress stairs or exits.
ON Variations: Any single platform or walkway in a shelf and rack storage system may be served by a single unenclosed stair leading to the platform or walkway level immediately below provided, the platform or walkway does not exceed 200 m2 in area, the travel distance on the platform or walkway to the level below, including the travel distance along the single unenclosed egress stair, does not exceed 25 m, and the platform or walkway below is provided with two separate egress stairs or exits.

ON Full: Openings more than 3 m in width in non-loadbearing flat insulating concrete form walls shall be reinforced on all four sides with two 10M bars.
ON Variations: Openings more than 3 m in width in non-loadbearing flat insulating concrete form walls shall be reinforced on all four sides with two 10M bars.

ON Full: Where the cesspool extends to the ground surface, the cover required in Sentence (4) shall be lockable.
ON Variations: Where the cesspool extends to the ground surface, the cover required in Sentence (4) shall be lockable.

ON Full: This Subsection does not apply to the bulk storage of unpackaged grain, coal or similar commodities.
ON Variations: This Subsection does not apply to the bulk storage of unpackaged grain, coal or similar commodities.

ON Full: Except as permitted by Sentences (3) to (8), combustible piping shall not be used if any part of the piping system penetrates, a fire separation required to have a fire-resistance rating, or a membrane that forms part of an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating.
ON Variations: Except as permitted by Sentences (3) to (8), combustible piping shall not be used if any part of the piping system penetrates, a fire separation required to have a fire-resistance rating, or a membrane that forms part of an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating.

ON Full: A dwelling unit shall be provided with a second and separate means of egress where an egress door from the dwelling unit opens onto,(a) an exit stairway serving more than one suite, (b) a public corridor, (i) serving more than one suite, and (ii) served by a single exit, (c) an exterior passageway, (i) serving more than one suite, (ii) served by a single exit stairway or ramp, and (iii) more than 1.5 m above adjacent ground level, or (d) a balcony, (i) serving more than one suite, (ii) served by a single exit stairway or ramp, and (iii) more than 1.5 m above adjacent ground level.
ON Variations: A dwelling unit shall be provided with a second and separate means of egress where an egress door from the dwelling unit opens onto,(a) an exit stairway serving more than one suite, (b) a public corridor, (i) serving more than one suite, and (ii) served by a single exit, (c) an exterior passageway, (i) serving more than one suite, (ii) served by a single exit stairway or ramp, and (iii) more than 1.5 m above adjacent ground level, or (d) a balcony, (i) serving more than one suite, (ii) served by a single exit stairway or ramp, and (iii) more than 1.5 m above adjacent ground level.

ON Full: Existing conditions are acceptable with respect to Articles 4.3.2.1., 4.3.2.2., 4.3.2.3. and 4.3.8.2. and Sentence 4.3.8.1.(4) until replacement or relocation of a tank is carried out, at which time these requirements shall apply.
ON Variations: Existing conditions are acceptable with respect to Articles 4.3.2.1., 4.3.2.2., 4.3.2.3. and 4.3.8.2. and Sentence 4.3.8.1.(4) until replacement or relocation of a tank is carried out, at which time these requirements shall apply.

ON Full: This Section applies to piping and transfer systems for flammable liquids and combustible liquids.
ON Variations: This Section applies to piping and transfer systems for flammable liquids and combustible liquids.

ON Full: Where an aboveground storage tank will be out of service or unsupervised for a period exceeding 180 days, all liquid and vapours shall be removed from the storage tank and its connected piping, and the storage tank markings shall clearly indicate that the tank is empty.
ON Variations: Where an aboveground storage tank will be out of service or unsupervised for a period exceeding 180 days, all liquid and vapours shall be removed from the storage tank and its connected piping, and the storage tank markings shall clearly indicate that the tank is empty.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (2), a manufactured building intended for residential occupancy is deemed to comply with this Code if it is designed and constructed in compliance with,(a) CSA Z240.2.1, "Structural Requirements for Manufactured Homes", if the building is constructed in sections not wider than 4.88 m, or (b) CSA A277, "Procedures for Factory Certification of Buildings".
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (2), a manufactured building intended for residential occupancy is deemed to comply with this Code if it is designed and constructed in compliance with,(a) CSA Z240.2.1, "Structural Requirements for Manufactured Homes", if the building is constructed in sections not wider than 4.88 m, or (b) CSA A277, "Procedures for Factory Certification of Buildings".

ON Full: The width of clear space shall be based upon the severity of exposure that will vary with the area, height, occupancy, construction and protection of the exposing structure and the type of piling and height of adjacent lumber piles.
ON Variations: The width of clear space shall be based upon the severity of exposure that will vary with the area, height, occupancy, construction and protection of the exposing structure and the type of piling and height of adjacent lumber piles.

ON Full: Exhaust ducts or vents connected to laundry-drying equipment shall discharge directly to the outdoors.
ON Variations: Exhaust ducts or vents connected to laundry-drying equipment shall discharge directly to the outdoors.

ON Full: Except as permitted in Sentence (8), insulation and vapour barrier shall be protected from mechanical damage by a covering such as gypsum board, plywood, particleboard, OSB, waferboard or hardboard.
ON Variations: Except as permitted in Sentence (8), insulation and vapour barrier shall be protected from mechanical damage by a covering such as gypsum board, plywood, particleboard, OSB, waferboard or hardboard.

ON Full: A hose cabinet referred to in Sentence (3) shall be of sufficient size to, contain the equipment referred to in Sentence (3), contain a listed fire extinguisher, and provide sufficient clearance to permit the use of a standard fire department hose key.
ON Variations: A hose cabinet referred to in Sentence (3) shall be of sufficient size to, contain the equipment referred to in Sentence (3), contain a listed fire extinguisher, and provide sufficient clearance to permit the use of a standard fire department hose key.

ON Full: A vent stack, or stack vent shall be sized in accordance with Table 7.5.8.4. based on,(a) the length of the vent stack or stack vent, and (b) the total hydraulic load that is drained to the lowest section of soil or waste stack or stacks served by the vent pipe, plus any additional vent loads connected to the vent stack or stack vent.
ON Variations: A vent stack, or stack vent shall be sized in accordance with Table 7.5.8.4. based on,(a) the length of the vent stack or stack vent, and (b) the total hydraulic load that is drained to the lowest section of soil or waste stack or stacks served by the vent pipe, plus any additional vent loads connected to the vent stack or stack vent.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (2), fire separations enclosing grease ducts for commercial cooking operations shall conform to NFPA 96, "Ventilation Control and Fire Protection of Commercial Cooking Operations".
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (2), fire separations enclosing grease ducts for commercial cooking operations shall conform to NFPA 96, "Ventilation Control and Fire Protection of Commercial Cooking Operations".

ON Full: Piping for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be located aboveground where the piping enters a building.
ON Variations: Piping for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be located aboveground where the piping enters a building.

ON Full: Piles that include combustible salvage shall be 3 m from property lines, and not more than 3 m in height and 100 m2 in area.
ON Variations: Piles that include combustible salvage shall be 3 m from property lines, and not more than 3 m in height and 100 m2 in area.

ON Full: The requirements in this Subsection apply to all buildings except a 1 storey building that does not contain a basement or mezzanine.
ON Variations: The requirements in this Subsection apply to all buildings except a 1 storey building that does not contain a basement or mezzanine.

ON Full: In non-loadbearing walls and in loadbearing walls where the studs are located directly over framing members, the bottom wall plate may be 19 mm thick.
ON Variations: In non-loadbearing walls and in loadbearing walls where the studs are located directly over framing members, the bottom wall plate may be 19 mm thick.

ON Full: Every chamber or leaching chamber shall be as wide as the shallow buried trench in which it is contained, and the cross-sectional height of the chamber or leaching chamber at its centre point shall not be less than half the width of the trench.
ON Variations: Every chamber or leaching chamber shall be as wide as the shallow buried trench in which it is contained, and the cross-sectional height of the chamber or leaching chamber at its centre point shall not be less than half the width of the trench.

ON Full: The occupant load of a floor area or part of a floor area, or of a building or part of a building not having a floor area, shall be based on, the number of seats in an assembly occupancy having fixed seats, two persons per sleeping room or sleeping area in a dwelling unit or suite, or the number of persons, for which the area is designed, or determined from Table 3.1.17.1. for occupancies other than those described in Clauses (a) and (b).
ON Variations: The occupant load of a floor area or part of a floor area, or of a building or part of a building not having a floor area, shall be based on, the number of seats in an assembly occupancy having fixed seats, two persons per sleeping room or sleeping area in a dwelling unit or suite, or the number of persons, for which the area is designed, or determined from Table 3.1.17.1. for occupancies other than those described in Clauses (a) and (b).

ON Full: Any appliance, device or component of a device that does not operate or appear to operate as intended when checked, inspected or tested as required by this Code shall be repaired or replaced if the failure or malfunctioning of the appliance, device or component would adversely affect fire or life safety.
ON Variations: Any appliance, device or component of a device that does not operate or appear to operate as intended when checked, inspected or tested as required by this Code shall be repaired or replaced if the failure or malfunctioning of the appliance, device or component would adversely affect fire or life safety.

ON Full: In addition to the distribution in Sentence (1), flat roofs and shed roofs, gable roofs of 15° slope or less, and arched or curved roofs shall be designed for the specified uniform snow load indicated in Sentence 4.1.6.2.(1), which shall be calculated using Ca = 1.0, distributed on any one portion of the loaded area, and half of this load on the remainder of the loaded area, in such a way as to produce the most critical effects on the member concerned. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: In addition to the distribution in Sentence (1), flat roofs and shed roofs, gable roofs of 15° slope or less, and arched or curved roofs shall be designed for the specified uniform snow load indicated in Sentence 4.1.6.2.(1), which shall be calculated using Ca = 1.0, distributed on any one portion of the loaded area, and half of this load on the remainder of the loaded area, in such a way as to produce the most critical effects on the member concerned.
