(See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Piles shall not exceed 18 m in height, 90 m in width and 150 m in length unless temporary water pipes with hose connections are laid on the top surface of the pile.
ON Variations: Piles shall not exceed 18 m in height, 90 m in width and 150 m in length unless temporary water pipes with hose connections are laid on the top surface of the pile.

ON Full: Piping, fittings and joints used in pressure sewer, forcemain or sump pump discharge applications shall be capable of withstanding at least one and one-half times the maximum potential pressure.
ON Variations: Piping, fittings and joints used in pressure sewer, forcemain or sump pump discharge applications shall be capable of withstanding at least one and one-half times the maximum potential pressure.

ON Full: Every drinking fountain bubbler shall include a means of regulating the flow to the orifice.
ON Variations: Every drinking fountain bubbler shall include a means of regulating the flow to the orifice.

ON Full: Both sexes are permitted to be served by a single water closet if the occupant load is not more than 10 persons in an assembly occupancy referred to in Article 3.7.4.3. except for, elementary and secondary schools, child care facilities, places of worship, and undertaking premises.
ON Variations: Both sexes are permitted to be served by a single water closet if the occupant load is not more than 10 persons in an assembly occupancy referred to in Article 3.7.4.3. except for, elementary and secondary schools, child care facilities, places of worship, and undertaking premises.

ON Full: Detached garages of less than 55 m2 floor area and not more than 1 storey in height that are not of masonry or masonry veneer construction are permitted to be supported on,(a) wood mud sills, or (b) a concrete floor slab having a minimum thickness of not less than 100 mm.
ON Variations: Detached garages of less than 55 m2 floor area and not more than 1 storey in height that are not of masonry or masonry veneer construction are permitted to be supported on,(a) wood mud sills, or (b) a concrete floor slab having a minimum thickness of not less than 100 mm.

ON Full: Where a public corridor is not less than 9 m wide and conforms to Clause 3.4.2.5.(1)(d), the travel distance is permitted to be determined in accordance with that Clause.
ON Variations: Where a public corridor is not less than 9 m wide and conforms to Clause 3.4.2.5.(1)(d), the travel distance is permitted to be determined in accordance with that Clause.

ON Full: Emergency lighting shall be provided in,(a) exits, (b) principal routes providing access to exit in an open floor area, (c) corridors used by the public, (d) underground walkways, and (e) public corridors.
ON Variations: Emergency lighting shall be provided in,(a) exits, (b) principal routes providing access to exit in an open floor area, (c) corridors used by the public, (d) underground walkways, and (e) public corridors.

ON Full: Steel sheet cladding shall have a minimum thickness of 0.3 mm and conform to CAN/CGSB-93.3-M, "Prefinished Galvanized and Aluminum-Zinc Alloy Steel Sheet for Residential Use".
ON Variations: Steel sheet cladding shall have a minimum thickness of 0.3 mm and conform to CAN/CGSB-93.3-M, "Prefinished Galvanized and Aluminum-Zinc Alloy Steel Sheet for Residential Use".

ON Full: The minimum distance between exits referred to in Sentence (1) shall be the shortest distance that smoke would have to travel between the exits, assuming that the smoke will not penetrate an intervening fire separation.
ON Variations: The minimum distance between exits referred to in Sentence (1) shall be the shortest distance that smoke would have to travel between the exits, assuming that the smoke will not penetrate an intervening fire separation.

ON Full: Where a floor is required to support a concrete topping, joist spans are permitted to be selected from Table A-2 provided the concrete,(a) is 38 to 51 mm thick, (b) is normal weight, (c) is placed directly on the subflooring, and (d) has not less than 20 MPa compressive strength after 28 days.
ON Variations: Where a floor is required to support a concrete topping, joist spans are permitted to be selected from Table A-2 provided the concrete,(a) is 38 to 51 mm thick, (b) is normal weight, (c) is placed directly on the subflooring, and (d) has not less than 20 MPa compressive strength after 28 days.

ON Full: Except as permitted in Article 9.10.19.8., within a house that contains an interior shared means of egress or common area, a smoke alarm shall be installed in each shared means of egress and common area.
ON Variations: Except as permitted in Article 9.10.19.8., within a house that contains an interior shared means of egress or common area, a smoke alarm shall be installed in each shared means of egress and common area.

ON Full: Where the performance level of an existing building is reduced under Article 11.4.2.5., upgrading of a sewage system which is adversely affected by the construction, increase in occupant load, increase in the total daily design sanitary sewage flow or change in amount or type of sanitary sewage shall be required in conformance with Part 8.
ON Variations: Where the performance level of an existing building is reduced under Article 11.4.2.5., upgrading of a sewage system which is adversely affected by the construction, increase in occupant load, increase in the total daily design sanitary sewage flow or change in amount or type of sanitary sewage shall be required in conformance with Part 8.

ON Full: Non-loadbearing wall components need not have a minimum fire-resistance rating where, (a) the building is 1 storey in building height, (b) the building is of noncombustible construction, (c) the building is classified as low hazard industrial occupancy and is used only for low fire load occupancies such as power generating plants or plants for the manufacture or storage of noncombustible materials, and (d) the exposing building face has a limiting distance of 3 m or more.
ON Variations: Non-loadbearing wall components need not have a minimum fire-resistance rating where, (a) the building is 1 storey in building height, (b) the building is of noncombustible construction, (c) the building is classified as low hazard industrial occupancy and is used only for low fire load occupancies such as power generating plants or plants for the manufacture or storage of noncombustible materials, and (d) the exposing building face has a limiting distance of 3 m or more.

ON Full: Mortar types shall conform to Table 9.20.3.2.A.
ON Variations: Mortar types shall conform to Table 9.20.3.2.A.

ON Full: Signs with letters 50 mm high indicating that ammonium nitrate is being stored and that smoking is not permitted shall be prominently displayed near each entrance on the exterior of buildings identified in Sentence (1).
ON Variations: Signs with letters 50 mm high indicating that ammonium nitrate is being stored and that smoking is not permitted shall be prominently displayed near each entrance on the exterior of buildings identified in Sentence (1).

ON Full: A lockable, break-front glazed cabinet may be used for security purposes to store portable extinguishers and where portable extinguishers are located in a fire hose cabinet, an approved lockable, scored glass break-front cabinet may be used.
ON Variations: A lockable, break-front glazed cabinet may be used for security purposes to store portable extinguishers and where portable extinguishers are located in a fire hose cabinet, an approved lockable, scored glass break-front cabinet may be used.

ON Full: Where a building trap is installed, a fresh air inlet not less than 4 in. in size shall be connected upstream and within 1 200 mm of the building trap and downstream of any other connection.
ON Variations: Where a building trap is installed, a fresh air inlet not less than 4 in. in size shall be connected upstream and within 1 200 mm of the building trap and downstream of any other connection.

ON Full: Dehumidifying cooling coil assemblies and condensate-producing heat exchangers shall be equipped with drain pans beneath them that are,(a) designed in accordance with Section 5.11, Drain Pans, of ANSI/ASHRAE 62.1, "Ventilation for Acceptable Indoor Air Quality", (b) provided with an outlet that is piped to the outside of the airstream in a location where condensate can be eliminated, (c) installed so that water drains freely from the pan, and (d) provided with a drain line that is indirectly connected to a drainage system in accordance with Article 7.4.2.1.
ON Variations: Dehumidifying cooling coil assemblies and condensate-producing heat exchangers shall be equipped with drain pans beneath them that are,(a) designed in accordance with Section 5.11, Drain Pans, of ANSI/ASHRAE 62.1, "Ventilation for Acceptable Indoor Air Quality", (b) provided with an outlet that is piped to the outside of the airstream in a location where condensate can be eliminated, (c) installed so that water drains freely from the pan, and (d) provided with a drain line that is indirectly connected to a drainage system in accordance with Article 7.4.2.1.

ON Full: This subsection applies to hazardous extraction operations.
ON Variations: This subsection applies to hazardous extraction operations.

ON Full: Portable extinguishers having a 2A or higher rating conforming to the requirements of Section 6.2 may be provided in lieu of the requirements of Sentence (1).
ON Variations: Portable extinguishers having a 2A or higher rating conforming to the requirements of Section 6.2 may be provided in lieu of the requirements of Sentence (1).

ON Full: A standpipe system shall be installed in every basement of a building that requires a standpipe system above grade.
ON Variations: A standpipe system shall be installed in every basement of a building that requires a standpipe system above grade.

ON Full: The design and construction required by Clause (1)(a) shall comply with Subsection 5.2.1.
ON Variations: The design and construction required by Clause (1)(a) shall comply with Subsection 5.2.1.

ON Full: The portion of any log coming in contact with masonry or concrete at or below grade shall be treated with a wood preservative to prevent decay.
ON Variations: The portion of any log coming in contact with masonry or concrete at or below grade shall be treated with a wood preservative to prevent decay.

ON Full: Except as permitted in Sentence (7), hose stations shall be located so that it is not necessary to penetrate an exit with a hose in order to provide the design coverage required in Clause (5)(a).
ON Variations: Except as permitted in Sentence (7), hose stations shall be located so that it is not necessary to penetrate an exit with a hose in order to provide the design coverage required in Clause (5)(a).

ON Full: Unless it can be shown that the location and size of openings do not present a hazard, a guard shall be designed so that no member, attachment or opening located between 140 mm and 900 mm above the level being protected by the guard will facilitate climbing.
ON Variations: Unless it can be shown that the location and size of openings do not present a hazard, a guard shall be designed so that no member, attachment or opening located between 140 mm and 900 mm above the level being protected by the guard will facilitate climbing.

ON Full: Every waste pipe shall be installed and back vented at the same time.
ON Variations: Every waste pipe shall be installed and back vented at the same time.

ON Full: Spans and sizes of wood lintels shall conform to the spans shown in Tables A-12 to A-16,(a) for buildings of residential occupancy, (b) where the wall studs exceed 38 mm by 64 mm in size, (c) where the spans of supported joists do not exceed 4.9 m, and (d) where the spans of trusses do not exceed 9.8 m.
ON Variations: Spans and sizes of wood lintels shall conform to the spans shown in Tables A-12 to A-16,(a) for buildings of residential occupancy, (b) where the wall studs exceed 38 mm by 64 mm in size, (c) where the spans of supported joists do not exceed 4.9 m, and (d) where the spans of trusses do not exceed 9.8 m.

ON Full: Where aboveground piping crosses roadways or railway sidings, ample overhead clearance and warning signs indicating the clearance height shall be provided.
ON Variations: Where aboveground piping crosses roadways or railway sidings, ample overhead clearance and warning signs indicating the clearance height shall be provided.

ON Full: Floor finishing operations involving the use of flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall conform to Part 4 and this Subsection.
ON Variations: Floor finishing operations involving the use of flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall conform to Part 4 and this Subsection.

ON Full: The material used as backfill or fill supporting a footing, foundation or a floor on grade shall be of a type that is not subject to detrimental volume change with changes in moisture content and temperature.
ON Variations: The material used as backfill or fill supporting a footing, foundation or a floor on grade shall be of a type that is not subject to detrimental volume change with changes in moisture content and temperature.

ON Full: Every public spa shall be provided with dressing rooms, water closets and shower facilities that are conveniently available on the premises.
ON Variations: Every public spa shall be provided with dressing rooms, water closets and shower facilities that are conveniently available on the premises.

ON Full: Smoking shall not take place and open flame devices shall not be used in a tent or air-supported structure unless provisions have been made for such activities under the fire safety plan.
ON Variations: Smoking shall not take place and open flame devices shall not be used in a tent or air-supported structure unless provisions have been made for such activities under the fire safety plan.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (2), this Subsection applies to the design, construction and installation of air duct distribution systems serving heating, ventilating and air-conditioning systems.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (2), this Subsection applies to the design, construction and installation of air duct distribution systems serving heating, ventilating and air-conditioning systems.

ON Full: One trap may protect,(a) all the trays or compartments of a two or three compartment sink, (b) a two or three compartment laundry tray, or (c) two similar type single compartment fixtures located in the same room.
ON Variations: One trap may protect,(a) all the trays or compartments of a two or three compartment sink, (b) a two or three compartment laundry tray, or (c) two similar type single compartment fixtures located in the same room.

ON Full: The electrical system and equipment in a tent, including electrical fuses and switches, shall be inaccessible to the public.
ON Variations: The electrical system and equipment in a tent, including electrical fuses and switches, shall be inaccessible to the public.

ON Full: Only one handrail is required on exterior stairs having more than three risers, provided such stairs serve a house or an individual dwelling unit.
ON Variations: Only one handrail is required on exterior stairs having more than three risers, provided such stairs serve a house or an individual dwelling unit.

ON Full: To provide for fire fighting operations, the clear space permanently available shall not be less than 4.5 m.
ON Variations: To provide for fire fighting operations, the clear space permanently available shall not be less than 4.5 m.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (4), the total drift per storey under service wind and gravity loads shall not exceed 1/500 of the storey height unless other drift limits are specified in the design standards referenced in Section 4.3. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (4), the total drift per storey under service wind and gravity loads shall not exceed 1/500 of the storey height unless other drift limits are specified in the design standards referenced in Section 4.3. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: A landing may be omitted at the bottom of an exterior stair or ramp provided there is no obstruction, such as a gate or door, within the lesser of the width of the stair or ramp, or,(a) 900 mm for stairs or ramps serving a house or an individual dwelling unit, and (b) 1 100 mm for stairs or ramps not serving a house or an individual dwelling unit.
ON Variations: A landing may be omitted at the bottom of an exterior stair or ramp provided there is no obstruction, such as a gate or door, within the lesser of the width of the stair or ramp, or,(a) 900 mm for stairs or ramps serving a house or an individual dwelling unit, and (b) 1 100 mm for stairs or ramps not serving a house or an individual dwelling unit.

ON Full: The flame-spread rating limit specified in Sentence (1) does not apply to corridors referred to in Sentence (1) provided the flame-spread rating is not more than, 25 on the upper half of the wall, and 150 on the lower half of the wall.
ON Variations: The flame-spread rating limit specified in Sentence (1) does not apply to corridors referred to in Sentence (1) provided the flame-spread rating is not more than, 25 on the upper half of the wall, and 150 on the lower half of the wall.

ON Full: This Section applies to the storage and handling of any radioactive nuclear substance that is present in a quantity that exceeds the exemption quantity as defined in Section 1 of the Nuclear Substances and Radiation Devices Regulations made under the Nuclear Safety and Control Act (Canada).
ON Variations: This Section applies to the storage and handling of any radioactive nuclear substance that is present in a quantity that exceeds the exemption quantity as defined in Section 1 of the Nuclear Substances and Radiation Devices Regulations made under the Nuclear Safety and Control Act (Canada).

ON Full: Every grease interceptor shall be designed so that it does not become air bound.
ON Variations: Every grease interceptor shall be designed so that it does not become air bound.

ON Full: Except as provided by Sentences (2) and (3), every roof covering shall have a Class A, B or C classification as determined in accordance with Article 3.1.15.1.
ON Variations: Except as provided by Sentences (2) and (3), every roof covering shall have a Class A, B or C classification as determined in accordance with Article 3.1.15.1.

ON Full: Properties of windows and doors within exits shall conform to Section 9.9.
ON Variations: Properties of windows and doors within exits shall conform to Section 9.9.

ON Full: Collar ties referred to in Sentence (1) more than 2.4 m long shall be laterally supported near their centres by not less than 19 mm by 89 mm continuous members at right angles to the collar ties.
ON Variations: Collar ties referred to in Sentence (1) more than 2.4 m long shall be laterally supported near their centres by not less than 19 mm by 89 mm continuous members at right angles to the collar ties.

ON Full: Portable fire extinguishers shall be installed in all buildings, except within dwelling units, in conformance with the provisions of Part 6 of Division B of the Fire Code made under the Fire Protection and Prevention Act, 1997.
ON Variations: Portable fire extinguishers shall be installed in all buildings, except within dwelling units, in conformance with the provisions of Part 6 of Division B of the Fire Code made under the Fire Protection and Prevention Act, 1997.

ON Full: Granular material need not be installed under,(a) slabs in garages, carports or accessory buildings, or (b) buildings of industrial occupancy where the nature of the process contained in the occupancy permits or requires the use of large openings in the building envelope even during the winter.
ON Variations: Granular material need not be installed under,(a) slabs in garages, carports or accessory buildings, or (b) buildings of industrial occupancy where the nature of the process contained in the occupancy permits or requires the use of large openings in the building envelope even during the winter.

ON Full: Doors serving a house or an individual dwelling unit need not comply with Sentences (2) and (3).
ON Variations: Doors serving a house or an individual dwelling unit need not comply with Sentences (2) and (3).

ON Full: For buildings constructed with more than 4 storeys of continuous wood construction, having a timber SFRS consisting of shear walls with wood-based panels, braced frames or moment-resisting frames as defined in Table 4.1.8.9., and whose fundamental lateral period, Ta, is determined in accordance with Clause 4.1.8.11.(3)(d), the design base shear, Vd, shall be taken as the larger value of Vd determined in accordance with Sentence (7) and 100% of V. (See A-4.1.8.10.(4) in Appendix A.)
ON Variations: For buildings constructed with more than 4 storeys of continuous wood construction, having a timber SFRS consisting of shear walls with wood-based panels, braced frames or moment-resisting frames as defined in Table 4.1.8.9., and whose fundamental lateral period, Ta, is determined in accordance with Clause 4.1.8.11.(3)(d), the design base shear, Vd, shall be taken as the larger value of Vd determined in accordance with Sentence (7) and 100% of V. (See A-4.1.8.10.(4) in Appendix A.)

ON Full: Except as permitted by Article 3.2.2.16., the building referred to in Sentence (1) shall be of noncombustible construction, and, floor assemblies shall be fire separations with a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, mezzanines shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, if the building is not sprinklered, roof assemblies shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, and loadbearing walls, columns and arches shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the supported assembly.
ON Variations: Except as permitted by Article 3.2.2.16., the building referred to in Sentence (1) shall be of noncombustible construction, and, floor assemblies shall be fire separations with a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, mezzanines shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, if the building is not sprinklered, roof assemblies shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, and loadbearing walls, columns and arches shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the supported assembly.

ON Full: Interior masonry foundation walls not subject to lateral earth pressure shall conform to Section 9.20.
ON Variations: Interior masonry foundation walls not subject to lateral earth pressure shall conform to Section 9.20.

ON Full: Except as provided in this Section, the requirements in this Division apply to self-service storage buildings.
ON Variations: Except as provided in this Section, the requirements in this Division apply to self-service storage buildings.

ON Full: The occupant load of a room in which a dance floor is situated shall be based on that portion of the room that is not occupied by the dance floor except where the occupant load is determined using Subclause (3)(b)(i).
ON Variations: The occupant load of a room in which a dance floor is situated shall be based on that portion of the room that is not occupied by the dance floor except where the occupant load is determined using Subclause (3)(b)(i).

ON Full: Exit facilities complying with this Section shall be provided from every floor area that is intended for occupancy.
ON Variations: Exit facilities complying with this Section shall be provided from every floor area that is intended for occupancy.

ON Full: Ramps and stairways that do not conform to the requirements of Sentence (1) and are intended only for occasional use for servicing equipment and machinery are permitted, to serve service rooms and service spaces, and in industrial occupancies.
ON Variations: Ramps and stairways that do not conform to the requirements of Sentence (1) and are intended only for occasional use for servicing equipment and machinery are permitted, to serve service rooms and service spaces, and in industrial occupancies.

ON Full: All isolator units shall be, (a) designed for the forces described in Sentence (3), and (b) able to accommodate the TDD determined at the specific location of each isolator unit.
ON Variations: All isolator units shall be, (a) designed for the forces described in Sentence (3), and (b) able to accommodate the TDD determined at the specific location of each isolator unit.

ON Full: Operation and maintenance of sewage systems shall comply with Section 8.9.
ON Variations: Operation and maintenance of sewage systems shall comply with Section 8.9.

ON Full: Illumination from lighting required in Sentence (1) shall be provided to average levels of not less than 10 lx at floor or tread level.
ON Variations: Illumination from lighting required in Sentence (1) shall be provided to average levels of not less than 10 lx at floor or tread level.

ON Full: When piping and pumping systems have been used for the transfer of either flammable liquids or combustible liquids at loading or unloading facilities, the system shall be cleaned of vapours before the other class of liquid is introduced.
ON Variations: When piping and pumping systems have been used for the transfer of either flammable liquids or combustible liquids at loading or unloading facilities, the system shall be cleaned of vapours before the other class of liquid is introduced.

ON Full: Penetrations of a firewall or a horizontal fire separation that is required to have a fire-resistance rating in conformance with Article 3.2.1.2. shall be sealed at the penetration by a fire stop that, when subjected to the fire test method in CAN/ULC-S115, "Fire Tests of Firestop Systems", has an FT rating not less than the fire-resistance rating required for the fire separation.
ON Variations: Penetrations of a firewall or a horizontal fire separation that is required to have a fire-resistance rating in conformance with Article 3.2.1.2. shall be sealed at the penetration by a fire stop that, when subjected to the fire test method in CAN/ULC-S115, "Fire Tests of Firestop Systems", has an FT rating not less than the fire-resistance rating required for the fire separation.

ON Full: If one major occupancy is located above another major occupancy, the fire-resistance rating of the floor assembly between the major occupancies shall be determined on the basis of the requirements of this Subsection for the lower major occupancy.
ON Variations: If one major occupancy is located above another major occupancy, the fire-resistance rating of the floor assembly between the major occupancies shall be determined on the basis of the requirements of this Subsection for the lower major occupancy.

ON Full: Notwithstanding Sentences (12) to (16), where a public pool is constructed on any level surface with walls rising above that surface and has a constant water depth not exceeding 1 100 mm and a water surface area not exceeding 100 m2, the pool deck may be an elevated platform surrounding the pool if it has, an unobstructed width of not less than 900 mm, a height of at least 75 mm above grade or pavement elevation, 6 mm wide openings for drainage, and a non-slip surface that is capable of being kept clean and disinfected.
ON Variations: Notwithstanding Sentences (12) to (16), where a public pool is constructed on any level surface with walls rising above that surface and has a constant water depth not exceeding 1 100 mm and a water surface area not exceeding 100 m2, the pool deck may be an elevated platform surrounding the pool if it has, an unobstructed width of not less than 900 mm, a height of at least 75 mm above grade or pavement elevation, 6 mm wide openings for drainage, and a non-slip surface that is capable of being kept clean and disinfected.

ON Full: A modified pool shall be provided with two or more drain fittings covered with protective grilles with openings having an aggregate area of at least 10 times the internal cross-sectional area of the outlet pipe or pipes connected to the recirculation system that is capable of completely draining the pool.
ON Variations: A modified pool shall be provided with two or more drain fittings covered with protective grilles with openings having an aggregate area of at least 10 times the internal cross-sectional area of the outlet pipe or pipes connected to the recirculation system that is capable of completely draining the pool.

ON Full: In each rapid transit station located at the end of a line, a washroom for each sex, containing no fewer than three water closets and two lavatories, shall be provided for use by the public.
ON Variations: In each rapid transit station located at the end of a line, a washroom for each sex, containing no fewer than three water closets and two lavatories, shall be provided for use by the public.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (2), a treatment unit, other than a septic tank, shall be designed such that the effluent does not exceed, for the level of the treatment unit set out in Column 1 of Table 8.6.2.2., the maximum concentrations set out opposite it in Columns 2 and 3 of Table 8.6.2.2.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (2), a treatment unit, other than a septic tank, shall be designed such that the effluent does not exceed, for the level of the treatment unit set out in Column 1 of Table 8.6.2.2., the maximum concentrations set out opposite it in Columns 2 and 3 of Table 8.6.2.2.

ON Full: Areas in process plants need not conform to this Part where specific hazards are addressed by design and operational procedures that meet recognized standards and equivalent protection is provided.
ON Variations: Areas in process plants need not conform to this Part where specific hazards are addressed by design and operational procedures that meet recognized standards and equivalent protection is provided.

ON Full: Except for wash basins (lavatories), sanitary facilities in a food premises shall be mechanically ventilated and shall be capable of exhausting air at the rate of not less than 24 L/s for each sanitary fixture listed in Sentence (17).
ON Variations: Except for wash basins (lavatories), sanitary facilities in a food premises shall be mechanically ventilated and shall be capable of exhausting air at the rate of not less than 24 L/s for each sanitary fixture listed in Sentence (17).

ON Full: The requirements in Subsection 3.4.4. for fire separation of exits do not apply in a rapid transit station.
ON Variations: The requirements in Subsection 3.4.4. for fire separation of exits do not apply in a rapid transit station.

ON Full: Exhaust ducts connected to laundry drying equipment shall be,(a) independent of other exhaust ducts, (b) designed and installed so that the entire duct can be cleaned, and (c) constructed of smooth corrosion-resistant material. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Exhaust ducts connected to laundry drying equipment shall be,(a) independent of other exhaust ducts, (b) designed and installed so that the entire duct can be cleaned, and (c) constructed of smooth corrosion-resistant material. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: The roofing membrane shall be mopped over the cant strip referred to in Sentence (1).
ON Variations: The roofing membrane shall be mopped over the cant strip referred to in Sentence (1).

ON Full: Except for a fresh air inlet, where a vent pipe is terminated in open air, the terminal shall be located,(a) not less than 1 000 mm above or not less than 3.5 m in any other direction from every air inlet, openable window or door, (b) not less than 2 000 mm above or not less than 3.5 m in any other direction from a roof that supports an occupancy, and (c) not less than 2 000 mm above ground.
ON Variations: Except for a fresh air inlet, where a vent pipe is terminated in open air, the terminal shall be located,(a) not less than 1 000 mm above or not less than 3.5 m in any other direction from every air inlet, openable window or door, (b) not less than 2 000 mm above or not less than 3.5 m in any other direction from a roof that supports an occupancy, and (c) not less than 2 000 mm above ground.

ON Full: The voice communication system referred to in Sentence (1) shall be installed so that emergency communication devices are located in each floor area near exit stair shafts.
ON Variations: The voice communication system referred to in Sentence (1) shall be installed so that emergency communication devices are located in each floor area near exit stair shafts.

ON Full: In this Section,(a) "roof" means sloped or near-horizontal assemblies that protect the spaces beneath them and includes platforms that effectively serve as roofs with respect to the accumulation or drainage of precipitation, and (b) "roofing" means the primary covering for roofs. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: In this Section,(a) "roof" means sloped or near-horizontal assemblies that protect the spaces beneath them and includes platforms that effectively serve as roofs with respect to the accumulation or drainage of precipitation, and (b) "roofing" means the primary covering for roofs. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentences (1) to (4), emergency lights shall be inspected at intervals not greater than 12 months to ensure that they are functional.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentences (1) to (4), emergency lights shall be inspected at intervals not greater than 12 months to ensure that they are functional.

ON Full: Buildings described in Article 9.38.1.1. shall be supported and anchored in conformance with the manufacturer's installation instructions.
ON Variations: Buildings described in Article 9.38.1.1. shall be supported and anchored in conformance with the manufacturer's installation instructions.

ON Full: Fire dampers and fire-stop flaps shall be inspected annually or on an approved time schedule.
ON Variations: Fire dampers and fire-stop flaps shall be inspected annually or on an approved time schedule.

ON Full: Where insulation functions as the vapour barrier, it shall be sufficiently thick so as to meet the requirement of Sentence (1).
ON Variations: Where insulation functions as the vapour barrier, it shall be sufficiently thick so as to meet the requirement of Sentence (1).

ON Full: The link load for each platform shall be the sum of the link loads for each track serving that platform and, except as provided in Sentence (6), the link load for each track shall be based on the link load per train headway multiplied by, a factor of 1.3 to account for surges, and in the peak direction for each route, an additional factor of 2 to account for a missed headway.
ON Variations: The link load for each platform shall be the sum of the link loads for each track serving that platform and, except as provided in Sentence (6), the link load for each track shall be based on the link load per train headway multiplied by, a factor of 1.3 to account for surges, and in the peak direction for each route, an additional factor of 2 to account for a missed headway.

ON Full: The fire department connections required in Sentences (1) and (2) shall be, located on the outside of a building adjacent to a street or an access route, not less than 300 mm and not more than 900 mm above ground level, and provided with two 65 mm hose connections with female swivel hose couplings.
ON Variations: The fire department connections required in Sentences (1) and (2) shall be, located on the outside of a building adjacent to a street or an access route, not less than 300 mm and not more than 900 mm above ground level, and provided with two 65 mm hose connections with female swivel hose couplings.

ON Full: A daily check of the temperature of the water contained in tanks shall be carried out during freezing weather to ensure that it does not fall below the freezing temperature.
ON Variations: A daily check of the temperature of the water contained in tanks shall be carried out during freezing weather to ensure that it does not fall below the freezing temperature.

ON Full: Where more than 25000 L of distilled beverage alcohol in storage tanks, drums or barrels are stored inside buildings, such buildings shall be sprinklered.
ON Variations: Where more than 25000 L of distilled beverage alcohol in storage tanks, drums or barrels are stored inside buildings, such buildings shall be sprinklered.

ON Full: The combustion air shall be supplied by a noncombustible and corrosion-resistant supply duct.
ON Variations: The combustion air shall be supplied by a noncombustible and corrosion-resistant supply duct.

ON Full: The hydraulic load on a pipe is the total load from,(a) every fixture that is connected to the system upstream of the pipe, (b) every fixture for which provision is made for future connection upstream of the pipe, and (c) all roofs and paved surfaces that drain into the system upstream of the pipe.
ON Variations: The hydraulic load on a pipe is the total load from,(a) every fixture that is connected to the system upstream of the pipe, (b) every fixture for which provision is made for future connection upstream of the pipe, and (c) all roofs and paved surfaces that drain into the system upstream of the pipe.

ON Full: Voice communication systems are not required to be tested in conformance with Sentences (1) and (2) where the systems are regularly used as part of a paging system.
ON Variations: Voice communication systems are not required to be tested in conformance with Sentences (1) and (2) where the systems are regularly used as part of a paging system.

ON Full: The exterior wall of each fire compartment referred to in Sentence (1) within the distance, DO, shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the interior vertical fire separation between the fire compartment and the remainder of the building.
ON Variations: The exterior wall of each fire compartment referred to in Sentence (1) within the distance, DO, shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the interior vertical fire separation between the fire compartment and the remainder of the building.

ON Full: Where a subsoil drainage pipe may be connected to a sanitary drainage system, the connection shall be made on the upstream side of a trap with a cleanout or a trapped sump.
ON Variations: Where a subsoil drainage pipe may be connected to a sanitary drainage system, the connection shall be made on the upstream side of a trap with a cleanout or a trapped sump.

ON Full: Except for a modified pool, wave action pool and a pool described in Sentence 3.11.5.2.(1), the side and end walls of a public pool shall be vertical from the top of the walls to within 150 mm of the bottom except at steps or recessed ladders or in water depths of 1 350 mm or more.
ON Variations: Except for a modified pool, wave action pool and a pool described in Sentence 3.11.5.2.(1), the side and end walls of a public pool shall be vertical from the top of the walls to within 150 mm of the bottom except at steps or recessed ladders or in water depths of 1 350 mm or more.

ON Full: Where specific references to checking, inspection and testing of fire safety devices are not made in this Code, such devices shall be maintained to ensure they operate as per their design requirements.
ON Variations: Where specific references to checking, inspection and testing of fire safety devices are not made in this Code, such devices shall be maintained to ensure they operate as per their design requirements.

ON Full: All hardboard edges shall be supported by furring, blocking or framing where the back-up is not continuous.
ON Variations: All hardboard edges shall be supported by furring, blocking or framing where the back-up is not continuous.

ON Full: The maximum link load at each track shall be the maximum calculated train load.
ON Variations: The maximum link load at each track shall be the maximum calculated train load.

ON Full: Requirements for combustible piping in relation to fire safety shall conform to Sentences 3.1.5.16.(1) and 9.10.9.6.(2) to (8) and Articles 3.1.9.4. and 9.10.9.7.
ON Variations: Requirements for combustible piping in relation to fire safety shall conform to Sentences 3.1.5.16.(1) and 9.10.9.6.(2) to (8) and Articles 3.1.9.4. and 9.10.9.7.

ON Full: OSB roof sheathing conforming to CSA O325, "Construction Sheathing", or to O-1 and O-2 grades as specified in CSA O437.0, "OSB and Waferboard", shall be installed with the direction of face orientation at right angles to the roof framing members.
ON Variations: OSB roof sheathing conforming to CSA O325, "Construction Sheathing", or to O-1 and O-2 grades as specified in CSA O437.0, "OSB and Waferboard", shall be installed with the direction of face orientation at right angles to the roof framing members.

ON Full: When the mass of a tank plus its contents or the mass of a flexible or flexibly connected piece of machinery, fixture or equipment is greater than 10% of the mass of the supporting floor, the lateral forces shall be determined by rational analysis.
ON Variations: When the mass of a tank plus its contents or the mass of a flexible or flexibly connected piece of machinery, fixture or equipment is greater than 10% of the mass of the supporting floor, the lateral forces shall be determined by rational analysis.

ON Full: The deck area described in Clause (4)(c) shall be centred on, the grab bar where one grab bar is provided, or the clear space between the grab bars where more than one grab bar is provided.
ON Variations: The deck area described in Clause (4)(c) shall be centred on, the grab bar where one grab bar is provided, or the clear space between the grab bars where more than one grab bar is provided.

ON Full: The luminous intensity for visual signalling components required by Sentence (13) that are installed in sleeping rooms shall be a minimum of 175 cd.
ON Variations: The luminous intensity for visual signalling components required by Sentence (13) that are installed in sleeping rooms shall be a minimum of 175 cd.

ON Full: Carpeting may be used in areas where food is served.
ON Variations: Carpeting may be used in areas where food is served.

ON Full: This Subsection applies to the storage, handling and use of flammable liquids and combustible liquids in industrial occupancies, where storage in closed containers is the principal activity.
ON Variations: This Subsection applies to the storage, handling and use of flammable liquids and combustible liquids in industrial occupancies, where storage in closed containers is the principal activity.

ON Full: A tank vehicle shall not be parked on a street, shoulder or sidewalk while unloading at a fuel dispensing station.
ON Variations: A tank vehicle shall not be parked on a street, shoulder or sidewalk while unloading at a fuel dispensing station.

ON Full: The supply duct shall contain a tight-fitting damper that shall be located close to the interior outlet and be operable from the room containing the fireplace.
ON Variations: The supply duct shall contain a tight-fitting damper that shall be located close to the interior outlet and be operable from the room containing the fireplace.

ON Full: The building shall be of noncombustible construction and, floor assemblies shall be fire separations with a fire-resistance rating not less than 2 h, mezzanines shall have a fire-resistance rating not less 1 h, roof assemblies shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, and all loadbearing walls, columns and arches shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the supported assembly.
ON Variations: The building shall be of noncombustible construction and, floor assemblies shall be fire separations with a fire-resistance rating not less than 2 h, mezzanines shall have a fire-resistance rating not less 1 h, roof assemblies shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, and all loadbearing walls, columns and arches shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the supported assembly.

ON Full: Every sanitary building drain shall terminate at its upstream end in a stack of at least 3 in. size.
ON Variations: Every sanitary building drain shall terminate at its upstream end in a stack of at least 3 in. size.

ON Full: Screwed cast iron water fittings shall conform to ASME B16.4, "Gray Iron Threaded Fittings: Classes 125 and 250".
ON Variations: Screwed cast iron water fittings shall conform to ASME B16.4, "Gray Iron Threaded Fittings: Classes 125 and 250".

ON Full: Screens required in Sentence (3) shall be accessible for maintenance.
ON Variations: Screens required in Sentence (3) shall be accessible for maintenance.

ON Full: The port caps shall be removed and the connections inspected for wear, rust or obstructions that in any way hamper easy removal and corrective action shall be taken as needed.
ON Variations: The port caps shall be removed and the connections inspected for wear, rust or obstructions that in any way hamper easy removal and corrective action shall be taken as needed.

ON Full: The requirements in this Subsection apply to 1 storey buildings that do not contain a basement or mezzanine.
ON Variations: The requirements in this Subsection apply to 1 storey buildings that do not contain a basement or mezzanine.

ON Full: A universal washroom shall have, an emergency call system that consists of audible and visual signal devices inside and outside of the washroom that are activated by a control device inside the washroom, and an emergency sign that contains the words IN THE EVENT OF AN EMERGENCY PUSH EMERGENCY BUTTON AND AUDIBLE AND VISUAL SIGNAL WILL ACTIVATE in letters at least 25 mm high with a 5 mm stroke and that is posted above the emergency button.
ON Variations: A universal washroom shall have, an emergency call system that consists of audible and visual signal devices inside and outside of the washroom that are activated by a control device inside the washroom, and an emergency sign that contains the words IN THE EVENT OF AN EMERGENCY PUSH EMERGENCY BUTTON AND AUDIBLE AND VISUAL SIGNAL WILL ACTIVATE in letters at least 25 mm high with a 5 mm stroke and that is posted above the emergency button.

ON Full: Underground storage tanks shall be protected against hydrostatic forces which can cause uplift of the tanks when they are empty.
ON Variations: Underground storage tanks shall be protected against hydrostatic forces which can cause uplift of the tanks when they are empty.

ON Full: An access route not less than 6 m wide, constructed in conformance with Subsection 3.2.5. in Division B of the Building Code, shall be provided in outdoor storage areas to permit the approach of fire department vehicles to within 60 m of any part of a pile.
ON Variations: An access route not less than 6 m wide, constructed in conformance with Subsection 3.2.5. in Division B of the Building Code, shall be provided in outdoor storage areas to permit the approach of fire department vehicles to within 60 m of any part of a pile.

ON Full: Every place of assembly intended for the viewing of motion pictures or the performing arts, shall be equipped to provide an average level of illumination at floor level in the aisles of not less than 2 lx during the viewing.
ON Variations: Every place of assembly intended for the viewing of motion pictures or the performing arts, shall be equipped to provide an average level of illumination at floor level in the aisles of not less than 2 lx during the viewing.

ON Full: Where a deep foundation unit has not been placed within the permissible deviations referred to in Article 4.2.7.3., the condition of the foundation shall be assessed by the designer.
ON Variations: Where a deep foundation unit has not been placed within the permissible deviations referred to in Article 4.2.7.3., the condition of the foundation shall be assessed by the designer.

ON Full: For the purposes of Sentence (1), the minimum area is either of the following,(a) the area calculated based on the loading rates for Type 2 effluent set out in the Column headed "Type 2" found in Table 2-8 of the BCMOH, "Sewerage System Standard Practice Manual", or (b) the value determined by the formula, where, A = the area of contact in square metres between the stone layer and the underlying soil, Q = the total daily design sanitary sewage flow in litres, and T = the percolation time of the underlying soil.
ON Variations: For the purposes of Sentence (1), the minimum area is either of the following,(a) the area calculated based on the loading rates for Type 2 effluent set out in the Column headed "Type 2" found in Table 2-8 of the BCMOH, "Sewerage System Standard Practice Manual", or (b) the value determined by the formula, where, A = the area of contact in square metres between the stone layer and the underlying soil, Q = the total daily design sanitary sewage flow in litres, and T = the percolation time of the underlying soil.

ON Full: Leaching chambers shall conform to the requirements of IAPMO PS 63, "Plastic Leaching Chambers".
ON Variations: Leaching chambers shall conform to the requirements of IAPMO PS 63, "Plastic Leaching Chambers".

ON Full: In a building that contains an interconnected floor space, the area of the exposing building face for the interconnected floor space is permitted to be determined by considering each storey as a separate fire compartment notwithstanding openings through the floor assemblies.
ON Variations: In a building that contains an interconnected floor space, the area of the exposing building face for the interconnected floor space is permitted to be determined by considering each storey as a separate fire compartment notwithstanding openings through the floor assemblies.

ON Full: A building susceptible to lateral vibration under wind load shall be designed in accordance with Article 4.1.7.2. so that the vibrations will have no significant adverse effects on the intended use and occupancy of the building. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: A building susceptible to lateral vibration under wind load shall be designed in accordance with Article 4.1.7.2. so that the vibrations will have no significant adverse effects on the intended use and occupancy of the building. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: The partition weight allowance in Sentence (2) shall be determined from the actual or anticipated weight of the partitions placed in any probable position, but shall be not less than 1 kPa over the area of floor being considered.
ON Variations: The partition weight allowance in Sentence (2) shall be determined from the actual or anticipated weight of the partitions placed in any probable position, but shall be not less than 1 kPa over the area of floor being considered.

ON Full: The protection provided by the second plane of protection shall be maintained,(a) at wall penetrations created by the installation of components and services such as windows, doors, ventilation ducts, piping, wiring and electrical outlets, and (b) at the interface with other wall assemblies.
ON Variations: The protection provided by the second plane of protection shall be maintained,(a) at wall penetrations created by the installation of components and services such as windows, doors, ventilation ducts, piping, wiring and electrical outlets, and (b) at the interface with other wall assemblies.

ON Full: Except for a building of Group B major occupancy and elevator cars, the flame-spread rating and smoke developed classification of interior wall, floor and ceiling finishes need not conform to the values in Table 3.1.13.7., provided the building is sprinklered and the sprinkler system is electrically supervised in conformance with Sentences 3.2.4.10.(3) and 3.2.4.17.(1).
ON Variations: Except for a building of Group B major occupancy and elevator cars, the flame-spread rating and smoke developed classification of interior wall, floor and ceiling finishes need not conform to the values in Table 3.1.13.7., provided the building is sprinklered and the sprinkler system is electrically supervised in conformance with Sentences 3.2.4.10.(3) and 3.2.4.17.(1).

ON Full: Steel door frames forming part of a closure in a fire separation, including anchorage requirements, shall conform to CAN/ULC-S105, "Fire Door Frames Meeting the Performance Required by CAN/ULC-S104".
ON Variations: Steel door frames forming part of a closure in a fire separation, including anchorage requirements, shall conform to CAN/ULC-S105, "Fire Door Frames Meeting the Performance Required by CAN/ULC-S104".

ON Full: Storage facilities shall be provided for the safe storage of all chemicals required in pool operations.
ON Variations: Storage facilities shall be provided for the safe storage of all chemicals required in pool operations.

ON Full: If a water-based fire suppression system is not compatible with fire suppression for specific types of hazards, a special fire suppression system conforming to one of the standards set out in Sentence (3) is permitted to be installed in lieu of a water-based system.
ON Variations: If a water-based fire suppression system is not compatible with fire suppression for specific types of hazards, a special fire suppression system conforming to one of the standards set out in Sentence (3) is permitted to be installed in lieu of a water-based system.

ON Full: The exterior lighting outlet with fixture required by Sentence (1) may be controlled by a wall switch or panel accessible to authorized personnel only, where it serves,(a) a building entrance serving multiple suites of residential occupancy, (b) multiple dwelling unit entrances, (c) hotels, or (d) motels.
ON Variations: The exterior lighting outlet with fixture required by Sentence (1) may be controlled by a wall switch or panel accessible to authorized personnel only, where it serves,(a) a building entrance serving multiple suites of residential occupancy, (b) multiple dwelling unit entrances, (c) hotels, or (d) motels.

ON Full: Macerating toilet systems shall conform to ASME A112.3.4 / CSA B45.9, "Plumbing Fixtures with Pumped Waste and Macerating Toilet Systems".
ON Variations: Macerating toilet systems shall conform to ASME A112.3.4 / CSA B45.9, "Plumbing Fixtures with Pumped Waste and Macerating Toilet Systems".

ON Full: The hydraulic load that drains to a wet vent shall conform to Table 7.5.8.1.
ON Variations: The hydraulic load that drains to a wet vent shall conform to Table 7.5.8.1.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (2), all wall, roof and floor assemblies in contact with the ground shall be constructed to resist the leakage of soil gas from the ground into the building.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (2), all wall, roof and floor assemblies in contact with the ground shall be constructed to resist the leakage of soil gas from the ground into the building.

ON Full: Where tying is used to satisfy the requirements of Sentence (1), the ties shall be, (a) corrosion-resistant metal, (b) equivalent to not less than 4.76 mm by 40 mm steel strapping, (c) spaced not more than 800 mm o.c. vertically, and (d) shaped at both ends to provide sufficient mechanical key to develop the strength of the ties.
ON Variations: Where tying is used to satisfy the requirements of Sentence (1), the ties shall be, (a) corrosion-resistant metal, (b) equivalent to not less than 4.76 mm by 40 mm steel strapping, (c) spaced not more than 800 mm o.c. vertically, and (d) shaped at both ends to provide sufficient mechanical key to develop the strength of the ties.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (2), openings in non-loadbearing walls shall be framed with not less than 38 mm material the same width as the studs securely nailed to adjacent studs.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (2), openings in non-loadbearing walls shall be framed with not less than 38 mm material the same width as the studs securely nailed to adjacent studs.

ON Full: Screws for the application of cladding, sheathing or interior finish materials to steel studs, runners and furring channels shall conform to,(a) ASTM C954, "Steel Drill Screws for the Application of Gypsum Panel Products or Metal Plaster Bases to Steel Studs from 0.033 in. (0.84 to 0.112 in. (2.84 in Thickness", or (b) ASTM C1002, "Steel Self-Piercing Tapping Screws for the Application of Gypsum Panel Products or Metal Plaster Bases to Wood Studs or Steel Studs".
ON Variations: Screws for the application of cladding, sheathing or interior finish materials to steel studs, runners and furring channels shall conform to,(a) ASTM C954, "Steel Drill Screws for the Application of Gypsum Panel Products or Metal Plaster Bases to Steel Studs from 0.033 in. (0.84 to 0.112 in. (2.84 in Thickness", or (b) ASTM C1002, "Steel Self-Piercing Tapping Screws for the Application of Gypsum Panel Products or Metal Plaster Bases to Wood Studs or Steel Studs".

ON Full: Exterior walls exposed to precipitation shall be protected against ingress of precipitation with an exterior cladding assembly consisting of a first plane of protection and a second plane of protection where the wall encloses spaces of residential occupancy or spaces that directly serve spaces of residential occupancy. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Exterior walls exposed to precipitation shall be protected against ingress of precipitation with an exterior cladding assembly consisting of a first plane of protection and a second plane of protection where the wall encloses spaces of residential occupancy or spaces that directly serve spaces of residential occupancy. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (2), wall plates shall be,(a) not less than 38 mm thick, and (b) not less than the required width of the wall studs.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (2), wall plates shall be,(a) not less than 38 mm thick, and (b) not less than the required width of the wall studs.

ON Full: Except as permitted by Sentences (2) and (3), in a building of residential occupancy, a laundry room in a floor area that is not within a dwelling unit shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.
ON Variations: Except as permitted by Sentences (2) and (3), in a building of residential occupancy, a laundry room in a floor area that is not within a dwelling unit shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.

ON Full: The thickness or rating of roof sheathing on a roof not used as a walking deck shall conform to either Table 9.23.15.7.A. or Table 9.23.15.7.B.
ON Variations: The thickness or rating of roof sheathing on a roof not used as a walking deck shall conform to either TableÃ 9.23.15.7.A. or Table 9.23.15.7.B.

ON Full: Concealed spaces in interior walls, ceilings, floors and crawl spaces shall be separated by fire blocks from concealed spaces in exterior walls and attic or roof spaces.
ON Variations: Concealed spaces in interior walls, ceilings, floors and crawl spaces shall be separated by fire blocks from concealed spaces in exterior walls and attic or roof spaces.

ON Full: In a building in which an escalator or inclined moving walk provides access to any floor level above or below the entrance floor level, an interior barrier-free path of travel shall be provided to that floor level. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: In a building in which an escalator or inclined moving walk provides access to any floor level above or below the entrance floor level, an interior barrier-free path of travel shall be provided to that floor level. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Section 11.5. applies in respect of the requirements of Sentences 11.4.3.4.(1), (3) and (4).
ON Variations: Section 11.5. applies in respect of the requirements of Sentences 11.4.3.4.(1), (3) and (4).

ON Full: Where a stair or a ramp is required to be at least 2 200 mm wide due to the occupant load, a handrail shall be installed such that no position on the stair or ramp is more than 825 mm from a handrail. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Where a stair or a ramp is required to be at least 2 200 mm wide due to the occupant load, a handrail shall be installed such that no position on the stair or ramp is more than 825 mm from a handrail. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Where a building being demolished floor by floor is equipped with a standpipe system, the system, together with fire department connections, valves, couplings and hose, shall be maintained in operable condition on all storeys below the one being demolished, except for the storey immediately below it.
ON Variations: Where a building being demolished floor by floor is equipped with a standpipe system, the system, together with fire department connections, valves, couplings and hose, shall be maintained in operable condition on all storeys below the one being demolished, except for the storey immediately below it.

ON Full: A sheet metal leader shall not be used except above ground outside a building.
ON Variations: A sheet metal leader shall not be used except above ground outside a building.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (6), every circulation system in a public spa shall be served by a minimum of two suction or gravity outlets, that are interconnected to a full size manifold, and except as provided in Sentence (5), that are separated by a clear distance of not less than 900 mm.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (6), every circulation system in a public spa shall be served by a minimum of two suction or gravity outlets, that are interconnected to a full size manifold, and except as provided in Sentence (5), that are separated by a clear distance of not less than 900 mm.

ON Full: Post-disaster buildings shall, (a) not have any irregularities conforming to Types 1, 3, 4, 5 and 7 as described in Table 4.1.8.6., in cases where IEFaSa(0.2) is equal to or greater than 0.35, (b) not have a Type 6 irregularity as described in Table 4.1.8.6., (c) have an SFRS with an Rd of 2.0 or greater, and (d) have no storey with a lateral stiffness that is less than that of the storey above it.
ON Variations: Post-disaster buildings shall, (a) not have any irregularities conforming to Types 1, 3, 4, 5 and 7 as described in Table 4.1.8.6., in cases where IEFaSa(0.2) is equal to or greater than 0.35, (b) not have a Type 6 irregularity as described in Table 4.1.8.6., (c) have an SFRS with an Rd of 2.0 or greater, and (d) have no storey with a lateral stiffness that is less than that of the storey above it.

ON Full: Subject to Sentences (2) and (3), cylinders containing compressed gases that may react with one another shall be stored in separate fire compartments having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.
ON Variations: Subject to Sentences (2) and (3), cylinders containing compressed gases that may react with one another shall be stored in separate fire compartments having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.

ON Full: The storage batteries, lubrication systems, oil and fuel supplies shall be inspected once a week.
ON Variations: The storage batteries, lubrication systems, oil and fuel supplies shall be inspected once a week.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (2) and Article 9.8.4.5A., required exit stairs and public stairs serving buildings of residential occupancy shall have a width, measured between wall faces or guards, of not less than 900 mm.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (2) and Article 9.8.4.5A., required exit stairs and public stairs serving buildings of residential occupancy shall have a width, measured between wall faces or guards, of not less than 900 mm.

ON Full: In a building containing a hotel, a manual pull station shall be installed in the main reception area serving the hotel.
ON Variations: In a building containing a hotel, a manual pull station shall be installed in the main reception area serving the hotel.

ON Full: Admixtures shall conform to ASTM C260 / C260M, "Air-Entraining Admixtures for Concrete", or ASTM C494 / C494M, "Chemical Admixtures for Concrete", as applicable.
ON Variations: Admixtures shall conform to ASTM C260 / C260M, "Air-Entraining Admixtures for Concrete", or ASTM C494 / C494M, "Chemical Admixtures for Concrete", as applicable.

ON Full: Except as permitted in Sentence (2), the bearing surface of a foundation shall be below the level of potential damage, including damage resulting from frost action, and the foundation shall be designed to prevent damage resulting from adfreezing and frost jacking. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Except as permitted in Sentence (2), the bearing surface of a foundation shall be below the level of potential damage, including damage resulting from frost action, and the foundation shall be designed to prevent damage resulting from adfreezing and frost jacking. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: The design elastic base shear, Ved, shall be multiplied by the importance factor, IE, as determined in Article 4.1.8.5., and shall be divided by RdRo, as determined in Article 4.1.8.9., to obtain the design base shear, Vd.
ON Variations: The design elastic base shear, Ved, shall be multiplied by the importance factor, IE, as determined in Article 4.1.8.5., and shall be divided by RdRo, as determined in Article 4.1.8.9., to obtain the design base shear, Vd.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (4), thermal insulation, vapour barrier, air barrier construction, interior finishes, plumbing, heating, mechanical ventilation, air-conditioning and electrical facilities, need not be provided, but where any of these are provided, they shall comply with the requirements of this Part.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (4), thermal insulation, vapour barrier, air barrier construction, interior finishes, plumbing, heating, mechanical ventilation, air-conditioning and electrical facilities, need not be provided, but where any of these are provided, they shall comply with the requirements of this Part.

ON Full: A soil or waste pipe may serve as a wet vent provided that,(a) the hydraulic load is in accordance with Table 7.5.8.1., (b) the number of wet vented water closets does not exceed two, (c) when two water closets are installed, they are connected at the same level to a vertical part of the stack by means of a double fitting in accordance with Table 7.2.4.5., (d) the water closets are installed downstream of all other fixtures, (e) trap arms and fixture drains connected to the wet vent do not exceed 2 in. in size, except for connections from floor drains in accordance with Clauses 7.5.1.1.(3)(a) to (c), (f) the total hydraulic load on the wet vent does not exceed the limits stated in Table 7.5.8.1. when separately vented branches or fixture drains in the same storey, having a total hydraulic load not greater than two fixture units, are connected to a wet vent or a wet vented water closet trap arm, (g) the hydraulic load of separately vented fixtures that drain into the wet vent is not included when sizing the continuous vent that serves the wet vent, (h) where a wet vent extends through more than 1 storey, the total discharge from any 1 storey above the first storey does not exceed four fixture units, (i) where a wet vent extends through more than 1 storey, there is not more than one nominally horizontal offset in the wet vent, and, (i) the offset does not exceed 1 200 mm for pipes 2 in. or less in size, or (ii) the offset does not exceed 2 500 mm for pipes larger than 2 in. in size, (j) the wet vented portion is not reduced in size except for the portion that is upstream of floor drains in accordance with Clauses 7.5.1.1.(3)(a) to (c), (k) the highest fixture is connected to a vertical portion of the wet vent, upstream of any other fixtures, in the form of a continuous vent, and (l) the length of the wet vent is not limited.
ON Variations: A soil or waste pipe may serve as a wet vent provided that,(a) the hydraulic load is in accordance with Table 7.5.8.1., (b) the number of wet vented water closets does not exceed two, (c) when two water closets are installed, they are connected at the same level to a vertical part of the stack by means of a double fitting in accordance with Table 7.2.4.5., (d) the water closets are installed downstream of all other fixtures, (e) trap arms and fixture drains connected to the wet vent do not exceed 2 in. in size, except for connections from floor drains in accordance with Clauses 7.5.1.1.(3)(a) to (c), (f) the total hydraulic load on the wet vent does not exceed the limits stated in Table 7.5.8.1. when separately vented branches or fixture drains in the same storey, having a total hydraulic load not greater than two fixture units, are connected to a wet vent or a wet vented water closet trap arm, (g) the hydraulic load of separately vented fixtures that drain into the wet vent is not included when sizing the continuous vent that serves the wet vent, (h) where a wet vent extends through more than 1 storey, the total discharge from any 1 storey above the first storey does not exceed four fixture units, (i) where a wet vent extends through more than 1 storey, there is not more than one nominally horizontal offset in the wet vent, and, (i) the offset does not exceed 1 200 mm for pipes 2 in. or less in size, or (ii) the offset does not exceed 2 500 mm for pipes larger than 2 in. in size, (j) the wet vented portion is not reduced in size except for the portion that is upstream of floor drains in accordance with Clauses 7.5.1.1.(3)(a) to (c), (k) the highest fixture is connected to a vertical portion of the wet vent, upstream of any other fixtures, in the form of a continuous vent, and (l) the length of the wet vent is not limited.

ON Full: Storm sewage shall not be discharged into a sewage system.
ON Variations: Storm sewage shall not be discharged into a sewage system.

ON Full: Sprinkler system water supply pressure shall be tested annually with the main drain valve fully open to ensure that there are no obstructions or deterioration of the main water supply.
ON Variations: Sprinkler system water supply pressure shall be tested annually with the main drain valve fully open to ensure that there are no obstructions or deterioration of the main water supply.

ON Full: The height of handrails on stairs and ramps shall be measured vertically from the top of the handrail to,(a) a straight line drawn tangent to the tread nosings of the stair served by the handrail, or (b) the surface of the ramp, floor or landing served by the handrail.
ON Variations: The height of handrails on stairs and ramps shall be measured vertically from the top of the handrail to,(a) a straight line drawn tangent to the tread nosings of the stair served by the handrail, or (b) the surface of the ramp, floor or landing served by the handrail.

ON Full: Chlorination equipment for a public pool shall contain a mechanism whereby the chlorine feed shall automatically terminate whenever the recirculation system ceases to supply clean water to the pool.
ON Variations: Chlorination equipment for a public pool shall contain a mechanism whereby the chlorine feed shall automatically terminate whenever the recirculation system ceases to supply clean water to the pool.

ON Full: An open-air storey need not conform to Sentence (1).
ON Variations: An open-air storey need not conform to Sentence (1).

ON Full: A rooftop enclosure for elevator machinery or for a service room, not more than 1 storey high, is not required to have a fire-resistance rating.
ON Variations: A rooftop enclosure for elevator machinery or for a service room, not more than 1 storey high, is not required to have a fire-resistance rating.

ON Full: Corridors and ramps used by residents in a long-term care home shall be equipped with handrails on each side conforming to Sentences 3.4.6.5.(5) to (7) and (11) to (13).
ON Variations: Corridors and ramps used by residents in a long-term care home shall be equipped with handrails on each side conforming to Sentences 3.4.6.5.(5) to (7) and (11) to (13).

ON Full: When quantities greater than are permitted for incidental use in Subsection 4.2.8. are required for special process operations, storage tanks for flammable liquids or combustible liquids are permitted to be located outside of a storage room referred to in Sentence (1), provided that total quantities per fire compartment are not more than one-half the quantities permitted in Table 4.3.12.A., they are located on the first storey, and the installation conforms to Articles 4.3.12.7. to 4.3.12.10. and Article 4.3.13.4.
ON Variations: When quantities greater than are permitted for incidental use in Subsection 4.2.8. are required for special process operations, storage tanks for flammable liquids or combustible liquids are permitted to be located outside of a storage room referred to in Sentence (1), provided that total quantities per fire compartment are not more than one-half the quantities permitted in Table 4.3.12.A., they are located on the first storey, and the installation conforms to Articles 4.3.12.7. to 4.3.12.10. and Article 4.3.13.4.

ON Full: Wall, ceiling and floor assemblies that separate conditioned spaces from unconditioned spaces or from the ground shall be constructed so as to include an air barrier system that will provide a continuous barrier to air leakage,(a) from the interior of the building into wall, floor, attic or roof spaces sufficient to prevent excessive moisture condensation in such spaces during the heating season, and (b) from the exterior inward sufficient to prevent moisture condensation on the room side during the heating season. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Wall, ceiling and floor assemblies that separate conditioned spaces from unconditioned spaces or from the ground shall be constructed so as to include an air barrier system that will provide a continuous barrier to air leakage,(a) from the interior of the building into wall, floor, attic or roof spaces sufficient to prevent excessive moisture condensation in such spaces during the heating season, and (b) from the exterior inward sufficient to prevent moisture condensation on the room side during the heating season. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: The following shall be designed to carry not less than the specified load required for the occupancy they serve, provided they cannot be used by an assembly of people as a viewing area: (a) corridors, lobbies and aisles not more than 1 200 mm wide, (b) all corridors above the first storey of residential areas of apartments, hotels and motels, and (c) interior balconies and mezzanines.
ON Variations: The following shall be designed to carry not less than the specified load required for the occupancy they serve, provided they cannot be used by an assembly of people as a viewing area: (a) corridors, lobbies and aisles not more than 1 200 mm wide, (b) all corridors above the first storey of residential areas of apartments, hotels and motels, and (c) interior balconies and mezzanines.

ON Full: The concentration of CBOD5 and suspended solids in the grab sample described in Sentences (1) and (4) is deemed to comply with the maximum concentration requirements set out in Table 8.6.2.2. when it does not exceed 20 mg/L for each of these parameters.
ON Variations: The concentration of CBOD5 and suspended solids in the grab sample described in Sentences (1) and (4) is deemed to comply with the maximum concentration requirements set out in Table 8.6.2.2. when it does not exceed 20 mg/L for each of these parameters.

ON Full: If wood wall studs or sheet steel wall studs enclose the main bathroom in a dwelling unit, reinforcement shall be installed to permit the future installation of the following:(a) for a water closet, a grab bar described in Clauses 3.8.3.8.(3)(a) and a grab bar described in Clause 3.8.3.8.(3)(c), (b) for a shower, a grab bar described in Clause 3.8.3.13.(2)(g), and (c) for a bathtub, a grab bar described in Clause 3.8.3.13.(4)(e). (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: If wood wall studs or sheet steel wall studs enclose the main bathroom in a dwelling unit, reinforcement shall be installed to permit the future installation of the following:(a) for a water closet, a grab bar described in Clauses 3.8.3.8.(3)(a) and a grab bar described in Clause 3.8.3.8.(3)(c), (b) for a shower, a grab bar described in Clause 3.8.3.13.(2)(g), and (c) for a bathtub, a grab bar described in Clause 3.8.3.13.(4)(e). (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Where a covered mall described in Sentence (1) is used for merchandising or public activities, the fire safety plan described in Section 2.8 shall include additional provisions to offset any hazard that may be created by such activities.
ON Variations: Where a covered mall described in Sentence (1) is used for merchandising or public activities, the fire safety plan described in Section 2.8 shall include additional provisions to offset any hazard that may be created by such activities.

ON Full: A modified pool shall be surrounded on all sides by a hard-surfaced pool deck that shall, be at least 3 m wide, have a continuous crest surrounding the pool at least 100 mm above the pool water surface, and be sloped to shed water from the crest to the outer perimeter of the pool deck.
ON Variations: A modified pool shall be surrounded on all sides by a hard-surfaced pool deck that shall, be at least 3 m wide, have a continuous crest surrounding the pool at least 100 mm above the pool water surface, and be sloped to shed water from the crest to the outer perimeter of the pool deck.

ON Full: Compliance with Sentence (1) shall be demonstrated by conforming to, (a) this Section, or (b) Part 5.
ON Variations: Compliance with Sentence (1) shall be demonstrated by conforming to, (a) this Section, or (b) Part 5.

ON Full: A wave action pool shall be designed and constructed to comply with Sentences (3) to (11).
ON Variations: A wave action pool shall be designed and constructed to comply with Sentences (3) to (11).

ON Full: There shall be a hard-surfaced pool deck at least 3 m wide immediately adjacent to the pool wall at the shallow end of the pool and at least 1 500 mm wide immediately adjacent to all walls of the pool.
ON Variations: There shall be a hard-surfaced pool deck at least 3 m wide immediately adjacent to the pool wall at the shallow end of the pool and at least 1 500 mm wide immediately adjacent to all walls of the pool.

ON Full: One section of the hard-surfaced pool deck that does not exceed 25% of the perimeter of the public spa may have a minimum clear deck space of not more than 300 mm if, the public spa has an area less than 6 m2, and the public spa has no interior dimension more than 2.5 m.
ON Variations: One section of the hard-surfaced pool deck that does not exceed 25% of the perimeter of the public spa may have a minimum clear deck space of not more than 300 mm if, the public spa has an area less than 6 m2, and the public spa has no interior dimension more than 2.5 m.

ON Full: The air barrier system shall be continuous,(a) across construction, control and expansion joints, (b) across junctions between different building assemblies, and (c) around penetrations through the building assembly.
ON Variations: The air barrier system shall be continuous,(a) across construction, control and expansion joints, (b) across junctions between different building assemblies, and (c) around penetrations through the building assembly.
