ON Full: Electrically conductive objects within the charging influence of the electrodes of electrostatic fluidized beds shall be grounded.
ON Variations: Electrically conductive objects within the charging influence of the electrodes of electrostatic fluidized beds shall be grounded.

ON Full: For the purposes of Sentence (1), reduction of performance level shall be determined in accordance with Article 10.3.2.2.
ON Variations: For the purposes of Sentence (1), reduction of performance level shall be determined in accordance with Article 10.3.2.2.

ON Full: Except for stairs and ramps serving a house or an individual dwelling unit, at least one handrail at the sides of a stair or ramp shall extend horizontally not less than 300 mm beyond the top and bottom of each flight or ramp. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Except for stairs and ramps serving a house or an individual dwelling unit, at least one handrail at the sides of a stair or ramp shall extend horizontally not less than 300 mm beyond the top and bottom of each flight or ramp. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (4), where a soil or waste stack receives the discharge from fixtures located on more than 11 storeys, a yoke vent shall be,(a) installed for each section of 5 storeys or part of them counted from the top down, (b) installed at or immediately above each offset or double offset, and (c) sized in accordance with Sentence 7.5.7.5.(1).
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (4), where a soil or waste stack receives the discharge from fixtures located on more than 11 storeys, a yoke vent shall be,(a) installed for each section of 5 storeys or part of them counted from the top down, (b) installed at or immediately above each offset or double offset, and (c) sized in accordance with Sentence 7.5.7.5.(1).

ON Full: Loose sawdust, particles or shavings shall be swept up at frequent intervals and deposited in receptacles described in Sentence 2.4.1.3.(3).
ON Variations: Loose sawdust, particles or shavings shall be swept up at frequent intervals and deposited in receptacles described in Sentence 2.4.1.3.(3).

ON Full: A motion sensor shall not be used to control emergency lighting.
ON Variations: A motion sensor shall not be used to control emergency lighting.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentences (2) and (3), the requirements in Subsection 3.2.5. shall apply.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentences (2) and (3), the requirements in Subsection 3.2.5. shall apply.

ON Full: Pits provided in conformance with Sentence (1) shall not be larger than necessary for inspection and maintenance and shall be provided with a cover.
ON Variations: Pits provided in conformance with Sentence (1) shall not be larger than necessary for inspection and maintenance and shall be provided with a cover.

ON Full: Branch supply ducts leading from the main distribution trunk duct required by Sentence (5) to the rooms to which outdoor air is to be distributed shall be provided and shall be sized according to Part 6, except that the branch supply ducts may be sized according to Table 9.32.3.7.B. where, (a) the total duct length from the outdoor hood to any supply register does not exceed 21 m, and (b) the total number of fittings does not exceed 8.
ON Variations: Branch supply ducts leading from the main distribution trunk duct required by Sentence (5) to the rooms to which outdoor air is to be distributed shall be provided and shall be sized according to Part 6, except that the branch supply ducts may be sized according to Table 9.32.3.7.B. where, (a) the total duct length from the outdoor hood to any supply register does not exceed 21 m, and (b) the total number of fittings does not exceed 8.

ON Full: The priming water for dry-pipe systems shall be inspected at least every three months to ensure that the proper level above the dry-pipe valve is maintained.
ON Variations: The priming water for dry-pipe systems shall be inspected at least every three months to ensure that the proper level above the dry-pipe valve is maintained.

ON Full: If Sentence (1) permits a roof assembly to be of heavy timber construction, structural members in the storey immediately below the roof assembly are permitted to be of heavy timber construction.
ON Variations: If Sentence (1) permits a roof assembly to be of heavy timber construction, structural members in the storey immediately below the roof assembly are permitted to be of heavy timber construction.

ON Full: Fasteners referred to in Sentences (1) and (2) shall be located not less than 12 mm above the tops of the cutouts.
ON Variations: Fasteners referred to in Sentences (1) and (2) shall be located not less than 12 mm above the tops of the cutouts.

ON Full: If a fire escape serves any storey above the second, openings located in a zone described in Sentence (2), including access doorways in the exterior walls of the building to which the fire escape is attached, shall be protected by closures conforming to Subsection 3.1.8.
ON Variations: If a fire escape serves any storey above the second, openings located in a zone described in Sentence (2), including access doorways in the exterior walls of the building to which the fire escape is attached, shall be protected by closures conforming to Subsection 3.1.8.

ON Full: Studs for walls not listed in Table 9.23.10.1. and supporting roof loads shall conform to Tables A-30 to A-33, provided, (a) the studs are clad with not less than 9.5 mm thick plywood, OSB or waferboard sheathing on the exterior face, and not less than 12.5 mm gypsum board on the interior face, (b) solid bridging is provided at not more than 1.2 m o.c, (c) the studs are fastened to the top and bottom plates with no fewer than three 82 mm toe-nails, (d) the double top plates are fastened together with not less than 76 mm nails spaced not more than 200 mm o.c, (e) roof framing members spaced not more than 610 mm are fastened to the top plates with no fewer than four 82 mm toe-nails, and (f) the bottom plate is fastened to the floor joists, blocking or rim joist with not less than 82 mm nails spaced not more than 200 mm o.c. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Studs for walls not listed in Table 9.23.10.1. and supporting roof loads shall conform to Tables A-30 to A-33, provided, (a) the studs are clad with not less than 9.5 mm thick plywood, OSB or waferboard sheathing on the exterior face, and not less than 12.5 mm gypsum board on the interior face, (b) solid bridging is provided at not more than 1.2 m o.c, (c) the studs are fastened to the top and bottom plates with no fewer than three 82 mm toe-nails, (d) the double top plates are fastened together with not less than 76 mm nails spaced not more than 200 mm o.c, (e) roof framing members spaced not more than 610 mm are fastened to the top plates with no fewer than four 82 mm toe-nails, and (f) the bottom plate is fastened to the floor joists, blocking or rim joist with not less than 82 mm nails spaced not more than 200 mm o.c. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: When operating at the rate required in Article 9.32.3.4., the supply and exhaust airflow rates of the heat recovery ventilator shall be balanced so that the value of the lesser flow shall be at least 90% of the value of the greater flow, unless otherwise recommended by the manufacturer.
ON Variations: When operating at the rate required in Article 9.32.3.4., the supply and exhaust airflow rates of the heat recovery ventilator shall be balanced so that the value of the lesser flow shall be at least 90% of the value of the greater flow, unless otherwise recommended by the manufacturer.

ON Full: Buildings with non-rigid or energy-dissipating connections require special studies.
ON Variations: Buildings with non-rigid or energy-dissipating connections require special studies.

ON Full: The structure shall have a clearly defined, (a) SFRS, as defined in Article 4.1.8.2., to resist the earthquake loads and their effects, and (b) load path or paths that will transfer the inertial forces generated by the earthquake to the foundations and supporting ground.
ON Variations: The structure shall have a clearly defined, (a) SFRS, as defined in Article 4.1.8.2., to resist the earthquake loads and their effects, and (b) load path or paths that will transfer the inertial forces generated by the earthquake to the foundations and supporting ground.

ON Full: Except as required by Sentence (3), a fuel-fired appliance that serves only one room or suite is not required to be installed in a service room separated from the remainder of the building.
ON Variations: Except as required by Sentence (3), a fuel-fired appliance that serves only one room or suite is not required to be installed in a service room separated from the remainder of the building.

ON Full: A contained use area shall conform to Sentences (2) to (5).
ON Variations: A contained use area shall conform to Sentences (2) to (5).

ON Full: Adapters, connectors or mechanical joints used to join dissimilar materials shall be designed to accommodate the required transition.
ON Variations: Adapters, connectors or mechanical joints used to join dissimilar materials shall be designed to accommodate the required transition.

ON Full: Access to exits shall conform to Section 3.3.
ON Variations: Access to exits shall conform to Section 3.3.

ON Full: The storage, handling and use of flammable liquids and combustible liquids shall meet the requirements of Part 4.
ON Variations: The storage, handling and use of flammable liquids and combustible liquids shall meet the requirements of Part 4.

ON Full: In a building regulated by the provisions of Subsection 3.2.6., the indication of a supervisory signal in accordance with Sentence (3) shall be transmitted to a proprietary control centre or to an independent central station.
ON Variations: In a building regulated by the provisions of Subsection 3.2.6., the indication of a supervisory signal in accordance with Sentence (3) shall be transmitted to a proprietary control centre or to an independent central station.

ON Full: Dead end corridors are not permitted.
ON Variations: Dead end corridors are not permitted.

ON Full: Indoor piping for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall either be supported overhead or be located in trenches conforming to Article 4.4.7.9.
ON Variations: Indoor piping for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall either be supported overhead or be located in trenches conforming to Article 4.4.7.9.

ON Full: The base of the filter medium shall extend to a thickness of at least 250 mm over an area meeting the requirements of the following formula:where, A = the area of contact in square metres between the base of the filter medium and the underlying soil, Q = the total daily design sanitary sewage flow in litres, and T = the lesser of 50 and the percolation time of the underlying soil.
ON Variations: The base of the filter medium shall extend to a thickness of at least 250 mm over an area meeting the requirements of the following formula:where, A = the area of contact in square metres between the base of the filter medium and the underlying soil, Q = the total daily design sanitary sewage flow in litres, and T = the lesser of 50 and the percolation time of the underlying soil.

ON Full: Where an exit door leading directly to the outside is subject to being obstructed by a parked vehicle or storage because of its location, a visible sign prohibiting such obstructions shall be permanently mounted on the exterior side of the door.
ON Variations: Where an exit door leading directly to the outside is subject to being obstructed by a parked vehicle or storage because of its location, a visible sign prohibiting such obstructions shall be permanently mounted on the exterior side of the door.

ON Full: A subsurface investigation shall be carried out to the depth and extent to which the building or excavation will significantly change the stress in the soil or rock, or to such a depth and extent as to provide all the necessary information for the design and construction of the excavation or the foundations.
ON Variations: A subsurface investigation shall be carried out to the depth and extent to which the building or excavation will significantly change the stress in the soil or rock, or to such a depth and extent as to provide all the necessary information for the design and construction of the excavation or the foundations.

ON Full: In a hotel establishment regulated by Section 9.9, a cooking operation that meets the requirements of Article 9.9.2.19. is deemed to be in compliance with Sentence (1).
ON Variations: In a hotel establishment regulated by Section 9.9, a cooking operation that meets the requirements of Article 9.9.2.19. is deemed to be in compliance with Sentence (1).

ON Full: Spare sprinkler heads shall correspond to the types and temperature ratings of the sprinklers installed on the system.
ON Variations: Spare sprinkler heads shall correspond to the types and temperature ratings of the sprinklers installed on the system.

ON Full: Groups of lumber piles shall be arranged with a maximum width of 15 m and a maximum length of 45 m, with fire department access routes surrounding each group of piles.
ON Variations: Groups of lumber piles shall be arranged with a maximum width of 15 m and a maximum length of 45 m, with fire department access routes surrounding each group of piles.

ON Full: Plumbing fixtures shall not be installed in a room that is not lighted and ventilated in accordance with the appropriate requirements in Parts 3 and 9.
ON Variations: Plumbing fixtures shall not be installed in a room that is not lighted and ventilated in accordance with the appropriate requirements in Parts 3 and 9.

ON Full: If a component of a plumbing system is required to be certified to a standard, the certification shall be made by a testing agency accredited for that purpose by the Standards Council of Canada.
ON Variations: If a component of a plumbing system is required to be certified to a standard, the certification shall be made by a testing agency accredited for that purpose by the Standards Council of Canada.

ON Full: Where polyethylene is installed to serve as the vapour barrier, it shall conform to CAN/CGSB-51.34-M, "Vapour Barrier, Polyethylene Sheet for Use in Building Construction".
ON Variations: Where polyethylene is installed to serve as the vapour barrier, it shall conform to CAN/CGSB-51.34-M, "Vapour Barrier, Polyethylene Sheet for Use in Building Construction".

ON Full: The test prescribed in Article 6.5.5.5. shall be conducted after any sprinkler system control valve has been operated.
ON Variations: The test prescribed in Article 6.5.5.5. shall be conducted after any sprinkler system control valve has been operated.

ON Full: Combustible duct linings, duct coverings, duct insulation, vibration isolation connectors, duct tape, pipe insulation and pipe coverings are permitted to be used in a building required to be of noncombustible construction provided they conform to the appropriate requirements of Part 6.
ON Variations: Combustible duct linings, duct coverings, duct insulation, vibration isolation connectors, duct tape, pipe insulation and pipe coverings are permitted to be used in a building required to be of noncombustible construction provided they conform to the appropriate requirements of Part 6.

ON Full: Ductwork for cooking appliance exhaust fans shall be equipped with a grease filter at the intake.
ON Variations: Ductwork for cooking appliance exhaust fans shall be equipped with a grease filter at the intake.

ON Full: The design, construction, installation and material alteration of every indoor incinerator shall conform to NFPA 82, "Incinerators and Waste and Linen Handling Systems and Equipment".
ON Variations: The design, construction, installation and material alteration of every indoor incinerator shall conform to NFPA 82, "Incinerators and Waste and Linen Handling Systems and Equipment".

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (2), back-siphonage preventers and backflow preventers shall be certified to,(a) CSA B64.0, "Definitions, General Requirements and Test Methods for Vacuum Breakers and Backflow Preventers", (b) CSA B64.1.1, "Atmospheric Vacuum Breakers (AVB)", (c) CSA B64.1.2, "Pressure Vacuum Breakers (PVB)", (d) CSA B64.1.3, "Spill-resistant Pressure Vacuum Breakers (SRPVB)", (e) CSA B64.1.4, "Vacuum Breaker, Air Space Type (ASVB)", (f) CSA B64.2, "Hose Connection Vacuum Breakers (HCVB)", (g) CSA B64.2.1, "Hose Connection Vacuum Breakers (HCVB) with Manual Draining Feature", (h) CSA B64.2.1.1, "Hose Connection Dual Check Vacuum Breakers (HCDVB)", (i) CSA B64.2.2, "Hose Connection Vacuum Breakers (HCVB) with Automatic Draining Feature", (j) CSA B64.3, "Dual Check Valve Backflow Preventers with Atmospheric Port (DCAP)", (k) CSA B64.3.1, "Dual Check Valve Backflow Preventers with Atmospheric Port for Carbonators (DCAPC)", (l) CSA B64.4, "Reduced Pressure Principle (RP) Backflow Preventers", (m) CSA B64.5, "Double Check Valve (DCVA) Backflow Preventers", (n) CSA B64.6, "Dual Check Valve (DuC) Backflow Preventers", (o) CSA B64.7, "Laboratory Faucet Vacuum Breakers (LFVB)", (p) CSA B64.8, "Dual Check Valve Backflow Preventers with Intermediate Vent (DuCV)", or (q) CSA B64.10, "Selection and Installation of Backflow Preventers".
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (2), back-siphonage preventers and backflow preventers shall be certified to,(a) CSA B64.0, "Definitions, General Requirements and Test Methods for Vacuum Breakers and Backflow Preventers", (b) CSA B64.1.1, "Atmospheric Vacuum Breakers (AVB)", (c) CSA B64.1.2, "Pressure Vacuum Breakers (PVB)", (d) CSA B64.1.3, "Spill-resistant Pressure Vacuum Breakers (SRPVB)", (e) CSA B64.1.4, "Vacuum Breaker, Air Space Type (ASVB)", (f) CSA B64.2, "Hose Connection Vacuum Breakers (HCVB)", (g) CSA B64.2.1, "Hose Connection Vacuum Breakers (HCVB) with Manual Draining Feature", (h) CSA B64.2.1.1, "Hose Connection Dual Check Vacuum Breakers (HCDVB)", (i) CSA B64.2.2, "Hose Connection Vacuum Breakers (HCVB) with Automatic Draining Feature", (j) CSA B64.3, "Dual Check Valve Backflow Preventers with Atmospheric Port (DCAP)", (k) CSA B64.3.1, "Dual Check Valve Backflow Preventers with Atmospheric Port for Carbonators (DCAPC)", (l) CSA B64.4, "Reduced Pressure Principle (RP) Backflow Preventers", (m) CSA B64.5, "Double Check Valve (DCVA) Backflow Preventers", (n) CSA B64.6, "Dual Check Valve (DuC) Backflow Preventers", (o) CSA B64.7, "Laboratory Faucet Vacuum Breakers (LFVB)", (p) CSA B64.8, "Dual Check Valve Backflow Preventers with Intermediate Vent (DuCV)", or (q) CSA B64.10, "Selection and Installation of Backflow Preventers".

ON Full: PVC floor flanges shall be certified to CAN/CSA-B181.2, "Polyvinylchloride (PVC) and Chlorinated Polyvinylchloride (CPVC) Drain, Waste, and Vent Pipe and Pipe Fittings".
ON Variations: PVC floor flanges shall be certified to CAN/CSA-B181.2, "Polyvinylchloride (PVC) and Chlorinated Polyvinylchloride (CPVC) Drain, Waste, and Vent Pipe and Pipe Fittings".

ON Full: Supply, return and exhaust air openings located less than 2 000 mm above the floor in rooms or spaces in buildings shall be protected by grilles having openings of a size that will not allow the passage of a 15 mm diameter sphere.
ON Variations: Supply, return and exhaust air openings located less than 2 000 mm above the floor in rooms or spaces in buildings shall be protected by grilles having openings of a size that will not allow the passage of a 15 mm diameter sphere.

ON Full: Exhaust ducts for spray booths and spray rooms shall be provided with access doors for cleaning purposes.
ON Variations: Exhaust ducts for spray booths and spray rooms shall be provided with access doors for cleaning purposes.

ON Full: Test pressures exceeding 700 kPa (gauge) shall not be used except when the piping system is designed for such pressures.
ON Variations: Test pressures exceeding 700 kPa (gauge) shall not be used except when the piping system is designed for such pressures.

ON Full: Where an existing building is subject to extension, material alteration or repair, (a) the proposed construction shall comply with Section 11.3., and (b) the performance level of the building shall be evaluated and compensating construction shall be undertaken in accordance with Section 11.4.
ON Variations: Where an existing building is subject to extension, material alteration or repair, (a) the proposed construction shall comply with Section 11.3., and (b) the performance level of the building shall be evaluated and compensating construction shall be undertaken in accordance with Section 11.4.

ON Full: Private and public water supplies for fire protection installations shall be maintained to provide the required flow under fire conditions.
ON Variations: Private and public water supplies for fire protection installations shall be maintained to provide the required flow under fire conditions.

ON Full: Screwed malleable iron water fittings shall conform to ASME B16.3, "Malleable Iron Threaded Fittings: Classes 150 and 300".
ON Variations: Screwed malleable iron water fittings shall conform to ASME B16.3, "Malleable Iron Threaded Fittings: Classes 150 and 300".

ON Full: Concrete pilasters required in Sentence (1) shall be not less than 50 mm by 300 mm.
ON Variations: Concrete pilasters required in Sentence (1) shall be not less than 50 mm by 300 mm.

ON Full: Except as permitted by Sentence (5), where strapping is specified in Table A-1, it shall be,(a) not less than 19 mm by 64 mm, nailed to the underside of floor joists, (b) located not more than 2.1 m from each support or other rows of strapping, and (c) fastened at each end to a sill or header.
ON Variations: Except as permitted by Sentence (5), where strapping is specified in Table A-1, it shall be,(a) not less than 19 mm by 64 mm, nailed to the underside of floor joists, (b) located not more than 2.1 m from each support or other rows of strapping, and (c) fastened at each end to a sill or header.

ON Full: This Section applies to portable oxygen systems used for medical purposes in residential occupancies and health care facilities.
ON Variations: This Section applies to portable oxygen systems used for medical purposes in residential occupancies and health care facilities.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (6), if the hazard index of the new major occupancy is greater than the hazard index of the existing major occupancy, the performance level is not reduced where the hazard index of the new major occupancy is not greater than the construction index of the existing building.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (6), if the hazard index of the new major occupancy is greater than the hazard index of the existing major occupancy, the performance level is not reduced where the hazard index of the new major occupancy is not greater than the construction index of the existing building.

ON Full: Thermally insulated wall, ceiling and floor assemblies shall be constructed with a vapour barrier sufficient to prevent condensation in the wall spaces, floor spaces or attic or roof spaces.
ON Variations: Thermally insulated wall, ceiling and floor assemblies shall be constructed with a vapour barrier sufficient to prevent condensation in the wall spaces, floor spaces or attic or roof spaces.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentences (1) and (3), the total length of leaching chamber shall not be less than the value determined by the formula,L = QT/200, for a Type I leaching chamber, or L = QT/300, for a Type II leaching chamber, where, L = total length of leaching chamber in metres, Q = the total daily design sanitary sewage flow in litres, and T = the design percolation time. L = QT/300 where, L = total length of leaching chamber in metres, Q = the total daily design sanitary sewage flow in litres, and T = the design percolation time.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentences (1) and (3), the total length of leaching chamber shall not be less than the value determined by the formula,L = QT/200, for a Type I leaching chamber, or L = QT/300, for a Type II leaching chamber, where, L = total length of leaching chamber in metres, Q = the total daily design sanitary sewage flow in litres, and T = the design percolation time. L = QT/300 where, L = total length of leaching chamber in metres, Q = the total daily design sanitary sewage flow in litres, and T = the design percolation time.

ON Full: The filter medium shall be unsaturated for its entire depth.
ON Variations: The filter medium shall be unsaturated for its entire depth.

ON Full: A buried water service pipe shall be constructed of a single run of pipe with no joints or fittings between the street line or source of supply on the property and the inside face of the building if the water service pipe is less than 15 m from,(a) a private sewage disposal system, or (b) a source of pollution other than a private sewage disposal system.
ON Variations: A buried water service pipe shall be constructed of a single run of pipe with no joints or fittings between the street line or source of supply on the property and the inside face of the building if the water service pipe is less than 15 m from,(a) a private sewage disposal system, or (b) a source of pollution other than a private sewage disposal system.

ON Full: Where the performance level is reduced under Sentence 11.4.2.3.(5), the requirement for the building to be of noncombustible construction or to be constructed in accordance with Article 3.2.2.43A. or 3.2.2.50A. is satisfied if the building is sprinklered.
ON Variations: Where the performance level is reduced under Sentence 11.4.2.3.(5), the requirement for the building to be of noncombustible construction or to be constructed in accordance with Article 3.2.2.43A. or 3.2.2.50A. is satisfied if the building is sprinklered.

ON Full: A flashing may be omitted when the masonry at the sill of a wall opening or the top of a wall is protected by an impervious non-jointed masonry coping that conforms to Article 9.20.13.12.
ON Variations: A flashing may be omitted when the masonry at the sill of a wall opening or the top of a wall is protected by an impervious non-jointed masonry coping that conforms to Article 9.20.13.12.

ON Full: The use of stainless steel pipe and tube shall conform to Table 7.2.6.15.
ON Variations: The use of stainless steel pipe and tube shall conform to Table 7.2.6.15.

ON Full: The water stored in the vessels and pump tanks shall be protected from freezing.
ON Variations: The water stored in the vessels and pump tanks shall be protected from freezing.

ON Full: Chases or recesses shall not be cut into walls made with hollow units after the masonry units are in place.
ON Variations: Chases or recesses shall not be cut into walls made with hollow units after the masonry units are in place.

ON Full: Portable extinguishers shall be provided to protect every building, each hazardous occupancy inside the building and each hazardous process or operation located outside.
ON Variations: Portable extinguishers shall be provided to protect every building, each hazardous occupancy inside the building and each hazardous process or operation located outside.

ON Full: Where an existing building system is materially altered or repaired, the performance level of the building after the material alteration or repair shall be at least equal to the performance level of the building prior to the material alteration or repair. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Where an existing building system is materially altered or repaired, the performance level of the building after the material alteration or repair shall be at least equal to the performance level of the building prior to the material alteration or repair. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Dwarf walls and struts may be used to provide intermediate support to reduce the span for rafters and joists.
ON Variations: Dwarf walls and struts may be used to provide intermediate support to reduce the span for rafters and joists.

ON Full: Steel lintels described in Sentences (2) and (3) shall,(a) have even and level bearing and shall have not less than 150 mm length of bearing at end supports, and (b) bear on masonry, concrete or steel.
ON Variations: Steel lintels described in Sentences (2) and (3) shall,(a) have even and level bearing and shall have not less than 150 mm length of bearing at end supports, and (b) bear on masonry, concrete or steel.

ON Full: Except as permitted in Article 9.10.2.4., in any building containing more than 1 major occupancy in which one major occupancy is located entirely above another, the requirements of Article 9.10.8.1. for each portion of the building containing a major occupancy shall be applied to that portion as if the entire building was of that major occupancy.
ON Variations: Except as permitted in Article 9.10.2.4., in any building containing more than 1 major occupancy in which one major occupancy is located entirely above another, the requirements of Article 9.10.8.1. for each portion of the building containing a major occupancy shall be applied to that portion as if the entire building was of that major occupancy.

ON Full: The landlord shall test smoke alarms annually and after every change in tenancy.
ON Variations: The landlord shall test smoke alarms annually and after every change in tenancy.

ON Full: The total length of leaching chamber shall,(a) not be less than 30 m when constructed as a shallow buried trench, or (b) not be less than 40 m for any other absorption trench.
ON Variations: The total length of leaching chamber shall,(a) not be less than 30 m when constructed as a shallow buried trench, or (b) not be less than 40 m for any other absorption trench.

ON Full: A drum trap shall not be installed in a drainage system.
ON Variations: A drum trap shall not be installed in a drainage system.

ON Full: A Class 2 sewage system shall be designed only for the treatment and disposal of greywater.
ON Variations: A Class 2 sewage system shall be designed only for the treatment and disposal of greywater.

ON Full: Outdoor air intakes shall be located so that they are separated a minimum distance from sources of contaminants in accordance with Table 6.2.3.12.
ON Variations: Outdoor air intakes shall be located so that they are separated a minimum distance from sources of contaminants in accordance with Table 6.2.3.12.

ON Full: Every exterior exit passageway that has a drop of more than 500 mm on any side shall have guards on the open sides not less than 1 070 mm high.
ON Variations: Every exterior exit passageway that has a drop of more than 500 mm on any side shall have guards on the open sides not less than 1 070 mm high.

ON Full: Stainless steel pipe shall conform to,(a) ASME B36.19M, "Stainless Steel Pipe", and (b) ASTM A312 / A312M, "Seamless, Welded, and Heavily Cold Worked Stainless Steel Pipes".
ON Variations: Stainless steel pipe shall conform to,(a) ASME B36.19M, "Stainless Steel Pipe", and (b) ASTM A312 / A312M, "Seamless, Welded, and Heavily Cold Worked Stainless Steel Pipes".

ON Full: Connections to the structure of elements and components listed in Table 4.1.8.18. shall be designed to support the component or element for gravity loads, shall conform to the requirements of Sentence (1), and shall also satisfy these additional requirements: (a) friction due to gravity loads shall not be considered to provide resistance to seismic forces, (b) Rp for non-ductile connections, such as adhesives or power actuated fasteners, shall be taken as 1.0, (c) Rp for anchorage using shallow expansion, chemical, epoxy or cast-in place anchors shall be 1.5, where shallow anchors are those with a ratio of embedment length to diameter of less than 8, (d) power-actuated fasteners and drop-in anchors shall not be used for tension loads, (e) connections for non-structural elements or components of Category 1, 2 or 3 of Table 4.1.8.18. attached to the side of a building and above the first level above grade shall satisfy the following requirements: (i) for connections where the body of the connection is ductile, the body shall be designed for values of CP, Ar and Rp given in Table 4.1.8.18., and all of the other parts of the connection, such as anchors, welds, bolts and inserts, shall be capable of developing 2.0 times the nominal yield resistance of the body of the connection, and (ii) connections where the body of the connection is not ductile shall be designed for values of Cp = 2.0, Rp = 1.0 and Ar given in Table 4.1.8.18., and (f) a ductile connection is one where the body of the connection is capable of dissipating energy through cyclic inelastic behaviour.
ON Variations: Connections to the structure of elements and components listed in Table 4.1.8.18. shall be designed to support the component or element for gravity loads, shall conform to the requirements of Sentence (1), and shall also satisfy these additional requirements: (a) friction due to gravity loads shall not be considered to provide resistance to seismic forces, (b) Rp for non-ductile connections, such as adhesives or power actuated fasteners, shall be taken as 1.0, (c) Rp for anchorage using shallow expansion, chemical, epoxy or cast-in place anchors shall be 1.5, where shallow anchors are those with a ratio of embedment length to diameter of less than 8, (d) power-actuated fasteners and drop-in anchors shall not be used for tension loads, (e) connections for non-structural elements or components of Category 1, 2 or 3 of Table 4.1.8.18. attached to the side of a building and above the first level above grade shall satisfy the following requirements: (i) for connections where the body of the connection is ductile, the body shall be designed for values of CP, Ar and Rp given in Table 4.1.8.18., and all of the other parts of the connection, such as anchors, welds, bolts and inserts, shall be capable of developing 2.0 times the nominal yield resistance of the body of the connection, and (ii) connections where the body of the connection is not ductile shall be designed for values of Cp = 2.0, Rp = 1.0 and Ar given in Table 4.1.8.18., and (f) a ductile connection is one where the body of the connection is capable of dissipating energy through cyclic inelastic behaviour.

ON Full: Bags protecting sprinkler heads shall be replaced before they have accumulated deposits that impair the timely operation of the sprinkler head.
ON Variations: Bags protecting sprinkler heads shall be replaced before they have accumulated deposits that impair the timely operation of the sprinkler head.

ON Full: When underground storage tanks have no further use or have been out of service for two years or longer, such tanks, together with connected piping and dispensers, shall have all flammable liquids and combustible liquids removed from them, be purged of vapours, and except as permitted in Article 4.3.17.5., be removed from the ground.
ON Variations: When underground storage tanks have no further use or have been out of service for two years or longer, such tanks, together with connected piping and dispensers, shall have all flammable liquids and combustible liquids removed from them, be purged of vapours, and except as permitted in Article 4.3.17.5., be removed from the ground.

ON Full: The vent pipe from a water closet or any other fixture that has an integral siphonic flushing action may be connected to the vertical leg of its drainage pipe.
ON Variations: The vent pipe from a water closet or any other fixture that has an integral siphonic flushing action may be connected to the vertical leg of its drainage pipe.

ON Full: Openings for stairways and escalators used by passengers are permitted to penetrate the fire separations required in Sentences (2) to (6).
ON Variations: Openings for stairways and escalators used by passengers are permitted to penetrate the fire separations required in Sentences (2) to (6).

ON Full: No unauthorized person shall be permitted to enter a premises undergoing fumigation or thermal insecticidal fogging until the premises has been ventilated and is safe.
ON Variations: No unauthorized person shall be permitted to enter a premises undergoing fumigation or thermal insecticidal fogging until the premises has been ventilated and is safe.

ON Full: A pressure regulator shall be provided in the steam line with a relief valve on the downstream side of the regulator.
ON Variations: A pressure regulator shall be provided in the steam line with a relief valve on the downstream side of the regulator.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (3), a drain port shall be provided on the water distribution system immediately downstream of the building control valve required by Sentence (1) and if there is a meter, the drain port shall be installed immediately downstream of the meter on the water distribution system.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (3), a drain port shall be provided on the water distribution system immediately downstream of the building control valve required by Sentence (1) and if there is a meter, the drain port shall be installed immediately downstream of the meter on the water distribution system.

ON Full: Rainwater that is free of solids and treated to conform to Article 7.7.4.1. is permitted to be used as a water supply for,(a) clothes washers, (b) laundry trays, (c) mop sinks, (d) bedpan washers, (e) water closets, (f) urinals, (g) hose bibbs, (h) sub-surface irrigation, or (i) the priming of traps.
ON Variations: Rainwater that is free of solids and treated to conform to Article 7.7.4.1. is permitted to be used as a water supply for,(a) clothes washers, (b) laundry trays, (c) mop sinks, (d) bedpan washers, (e) water closets, (f) urinals, (g) hose bibbs, (h) sub-surface irrigation, or (i) the priming of traps.

ON Full: In-service atmospheric storage tanks that were installed on or before December 31, 2014 and that do not comply with Sentence (1) may remain in-service if they do not leak and if the tanks met the requirements of this Code on December 31, 2014, as it read on that day.
ON Variations: In-service atmospheric storage tanks that were installed on or before December 31, 2014 and that do not comply with Sentence (1) may remain in-service if they do not leak and if the tanks met the requirements of this Code on December 31, 2014, as it read on that day.

ON Full: The clear opening height under door closers and other devices in doorways described in Sentence (1) shall be not less than 1 980 mm.
ON Variations: The clear opening height under door closers and other devices in doorways described in Sentence (1) shall be not less than 1 980 mm.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (3), the wind load referred to in Sentence (1) shall be 100% of the specified wind load determined in accordance with Article 4.1.7.1.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (3), the wind load referred to in Sentence (1) shall be 100% of the specified wind load determined in accordance with Article 4.1.7.1.

ON Full: If the Building Code requires a visual signalling component that is integral with or connected to a smoke alarm, the landlord shall ensure that any test of the smoke alarm required by Sentences (2) to (4) activates the visible signalling component.
ON Variations: If the Building Code requires a visual signalling component that is integral with or connected to a smoke alarm, the landlord shall ensure that any test of the smoke alarm required by Sentences (2) to (4) activates the visible signalling component.

ON Full: Except in a retirement home, the fire-resistance rating of the fire separation located between a dwelling unit and an attached storage garage need not conform to that required by Sentence 3.3.5.6.(1) provided, the storage garage contains not more than five vehicles, the dwelling unit and the attached storage garage are sprinklered, the dwelling unit is separated from the remainder of the building in conformance with Sentences (1) to (3), there are no air duct systems connecting the storage garage and the dwelling unit, the construction between the storage garage and the dwelling unit provides an effective barrier to gas and exhaust fumes, and every door between the storage garage and the dwelling unit is, tight fitting and weather-stripped to provide an effective barrier against the passage of gas and exhaust fumes, fitted with a self-closing device, and not located in a room intended for sleeping.
ON Variations: Except in a retirement home, the fire-resistance rating of the fire separation located between a dwelling unit and an attached storage garage need not conform to that required by Sentence 3.3.5.6.(1) provided, the storage garage contains not more than five vehicles, the dwelling unit and the attached storage garage are sprinklered, the dwelling unit is separated from the remainder of the building in conformance with Sentences (1) to (3), there are no air duct systems connecting the storage garage and the dwelling unit, the construction between the storage garage and the dwelling unit provides an effective barrier to gas and exhaust fumes, and every door between the storage garage and the dwelling unit is, tight fitting and weather-stripped to provide an effective barrier against the passage of gas and exhaust fumes, fitted with a self-closing device, and not located in a room intended for sleeping.

ON Full: If an automatic sprinkler system is required by Articles 3.2.2.20. to 3.2.2.83., the system shall conform to the requirements of Articles 3.2.4.8. to 3.2.4.10. and 3.2.5.13. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: If an automatic sprinkler system is required by Articles 3.2.2.20. to 3.2.2.83., the system shall conform to the requirements of Articles 3.2.4.8. to 3.2.4.10. and 3.2.5.13. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: A door described in Sentence (1) shall have a clearance not more than 6 mm at the bottom and not more than 3 mm at the sides and top.
ON Variations: A door described in Sentence (1) shall have a clearance not more than 6 mm at the bottom and not more than 3 mm at the sides and top.

ON Full: A record for each storage tank showing the measurements and computations described in Sentence (3) shall be retained for examination by the Chief Fire Official, in conformance with Subsection 1.1.2.
ON Variations: A record for each storage tank showing the measurements and computations described in Sentence (3) shall be retained for examination by the Chief Fire Official, in conformance with Subsection 1.1.2.

ON Full: Piping shall be installed outdoors whenever possible and located so it will not create a hazard to buildings or equipment.
ON Variations: Piping shall be installed outdoors whenever possible and located so it will not create a hazard to buildings or equipment.

ON Full: Outdoor public amusement areas shall be designed so that they do not create a fire hazard to the public using them.
ON Variations: Outdoor public amusement areas shall be designed so that they do not create a fire hazard to the public using them.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentences (3) and (4), roofs shall be designed for the uniform live loads specified in Table 4.1.5.3., the concentrated live loads listed in Table 4.1.5.9., or the snow and rain loads prescribed in Subsection 4.1.6., whichever produces the most critical effects in the members concerned.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentences (3) and (4), roofs shall be designed for the uniform live loads specified in Table 4.1.5.3., the concentrated live loads listed in Table 4.1.5.9., or the snow and rain loads prescribed in Subsection 4.1.6., whichever produces the most critical effects in the members concerned.

ON Full: Where high strength steel is used for tendons in anchor systems used for the permanent support of a foundation or in the erection of temporary support of soil or rock adjacent to an excavation, it shall conform with the requirements of CSA A23.1, "Concrete Materials and Methods of Concrete Construction".
ON Variations: Where high strength steel is used for tendons in anchor systems used for the permanent support of a foundation or in the erection of temporary support of soil or rock adjacent to an excavation, it shall conform with the requirements of CSA A23.1, "Concrete Materials and Methods of Concrete Construction".

ON Full: Footings for masonry chimneys and concrete chimneys shall conform to the requirements in Section 9.15.
ON Variations: Footings for masonry chimneys and concrete chimneys shall conform to the requirements in Section 9.15.

ON Full: Backfill with material of any concentration that is susceptible to ice lensing is permitted where foundation walls are cast-in-place concrete, concrete block insulated on the exterior or concrete block protected from the backfill by a material that serves as a slip plane. (See A-9.4.4.4.(1) in Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Backfill with material of any concentration that is susceptible to ice lensing is permitted where foundation walls are cast-in-place concrete, concrete block insulated on the exterior or concrete block protected from the backfill by a material that serves as a slip plane. (See A-9.4.4.4.(1) in Appendix A.)

ON Full: A minimum of one shower head shall be provided for every 40 bathers.
ON Variations: A minimum of one shower head shall be provided for every 40 bathers.

ON Full: All grease and oil interceptors shall have an internal flow control and, where the head will exceed five feet, a secondary flow control shall be required.
ON Variations: All grease and oil interceptors shall have an internal flow control and, where the head will exceed five feet, a secondary flow control shall be required.

ON Full: Where a rapid transit station includes more than one standpipe riser there shall be a cross-connection pipe having a diameter not less than 100 mm between each standpipe riser so that supplying of water through any fire department connection will furnish water throughout each riser.
ON Variations: Where a rapid transit station includes more than one standpipe riser there shall be a cross-connection pipe having a diameter not less than 100 mm between each standpipe riser so that supplying of water through any fire department connection will furnish water throughout each riser.

ON Full: The size of the discharge pipe serving a macerating toilet system shall be at least ¾ in.
ON Variations: The size of the discharge pipe serving a macerating toilet system shall be at least ¾ in.

ON Full: Electrical heating cables including electrical induction heating, shall conform to Subsection 4.1.4.
ON Variations: Electrical heating cables including electrical induction heating, shall conform to Subsection 4.1.4.

ON Full: Except as provided by Sentences (3) to (6) and Articles 3.2.3.10. and 3.2.3.11, the fire-resistance rating, construction and cladding for exposing building faces of buildings or fire compartments shall comply with Table 3.2.3.7.
ON Variations: Except as provided by Sentences (3) to (6) and Articles 3.2.3.10. and 3.2.3.11, the fire-resistance rating, construction and cladding for exposing building faces of buildings or fire compartments shall comply with Table 3.2.3.7.

ON Full: Fire access routes shall be maintained so as to be immediately ready for use at all times by fire department vehicles.
ON Variations: Fire access routes shall be maintained so as to be immediately ready for use at all times by fire department vehicles.

ON Full: Except in a room for private use, water closets, urinals, lavatories, showers and bathtubs shall not be visible from the entrance to the room where it contains at least, two water closets, one water closet and one urinal, one shower stall, or one bathtub.
ON Variations: Except in a room for private use, water closets, urinals, lavatories, showers and bathtubs shall not be visible from the entrance to the room where it contains at least, two water closets, one water closet and one urinal, one shower stall, or one bathtub.

ON Full: The requirements of Sentences (1) and (2) are permitted to be waived for dwelling units having access to exit conforming to Sentences 3.3.4.4.(1) to (4) and (8).
ON Variations: The requirements of Sentences (1) and (2) are permitted to be waived for dwelling units having access to exit conforming to Sentences 3.3.4.4.(1) to (4) and (8).

ON Full: Flow and pressure tests shall be conducted at the highest and most remote hose valve or hose connection to ensure that the water supply for the standpipe system is provided as originally designed.
ON Variations: Flow and pressure tests shall be conducted at the highest and most remote hose valve or hose connection to ensure that the water supply for the standpipe system is provided as originally designed.

ON Full: In addition to the requirements in Sentence (1), if a standpipe system is required, 65 mm diam hose connections shall be installed in each storey in the building if the building, is more than 25 m high, measured between grade and the ceiling of the top storey, or has a building area of more than 4 000 m2.
ON Variations: In addition to the requirements in Sentence (1), if a standpipe system is required, 65 mm diam hose connections shall be installed in each storey in the building if the building, is more than 25 m high, measured between grade and the ceiling of the top storey, or has a building area of more than 4 000 m2.

ON Full: No diving board or diving platform shall be installed in a public pool unless the requirements of Sentences (5) to (17) are met but the requirements for a diving platform do not apply to a starting platform.
ON Variations: No diving board or diving platform shall be installed in a public pool unless the requirements of Sentences (5) to (17) are met but the requirements for a diving platform do not apply to a starting platform.

ON Full: Except when in use or being inspected in accordance with Sentence (2), fire department connections shall be equipped with plugs or caps that are secured wrench-tight.
ON Variations: Except when in use or being inspected in accordance with Sentence (2), fire department connections shall be equipped with plugs or caps that are secured wrench-tight.

ON Full: A single exit is permitted from a dwelling unit provided the exit is an exterior doorway not more than 1.5 m above adjacent ground level and, it is not necessary to travel up or down more than 1 storey to reach the exit door, or the uppermost floor level opens to a balcony not more than 6 m above adjacent ground level.
ON Variations: A single exit is permitted from a dwelling unit provided the exit is an exterior doorway not more than 1.5 m above adjacent ground level and, it is not necessary to travel up or down more than 1 storey to reach the exit door, or the uppermost floor level opens to a balcony not more than 6 m above adjacent ground level.

ON Full: The requirements of Sentence (1) are waived provided, the combustible material above the roof deck is protected, by not less than 12.7 mm thick gypsum board, mechanically fastened to a supporting assembly if located beneath the roof deck, or by a thermal barrier conforming to Clause 3.1.5.12.(4)(c) or (d) that is located on the underside of the combustible material or beneath the roof deck, the building is sprinklered, or the roof assembly has a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min.
ON Variations: The requirements of Sentence (1) are waived provided, the combustible material above the roof deck is protected, by not less than 12.7 mm thick gypsum board, mechanically fastened to a supporting assembly if located beneath the roof deck, or by a thermal barrier conforming to Clause 3.1.5.12.(4)(c) or (d) that is located on the underside of the combustible material or beneath the roof deck, the building is sprinklered, or the roof assembly has a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min.

ON Full: Wood shingles shall be not less than 400 mm long and not less than 75 mm nor more than 350 mm wide.
ON Variations: Wood shingles shall be not less than 400 mm long and not less than 75 mm nor more than 350 mm wide.

ON Full: Ashes shall be stored in receptacles that conform to Sentence (3) and combustible materials shall not be stored with ashes in the same receptacle.
ON Variations: Ashes shall be stored in receptacles that conform to Sentence (3) and combustible materials shall not be stored with ashes in the same receptacle.

ON Full: Bulk storage of ammonium nitrate shall be located indoors or in enclosed bin-type structures.
ON Variations: Bulk storage of ammonium nitrate shall be located indoors or in enclosed bin-type structures.

ON Full: A barrier-free path of travel shall be provided to the washrooms required in Article 3.13.6.2.
ON Variations: A barrier-free path of travel shall be provided to the washrooms required in Article 3.13.6.2.

ON Full: The linear loading rates of the underlying soil shall not be greater than,(a) the linear loading rates set out in Table 2-11 of BCMOH, "Sewerage System Standard Practice Manual", where the area of the Type B dispersal bed is determined in accordance with Clause (2)(a), or (b) the following linear loading rate, where the area of the Type B dispersal bed is determined in accordance with Clause (2)(b), (i) 40 L/m, for soil having a percolation time equal to or greater than 24 min, or (ii) 50 L/m, for soil having a percolation time less than 24 min.
ON Variations: The linear loading rates of the underlying soil shall not be greater than,(a) the linear loading rates set out in Table 2-11 of BCMOH, "Sewerage System Standard Practice Manual", where the area of the Type B dispersal bed is determined in accordance with Clause (2)(a), or (b) the following linear loading rate, where the area of the Type B dispersal bed is determined in accordance with Clause (2)(b), (i) 40 L/m, for soil having a percolation time equal to or greater than 24 min, or (ii) 50 L/m, for soil having a percolation time less than 24 min.

ON Full: Where a component of a plumbing system is required by this Code to comply with a standard and the compliance is not certified by a testing agency accredited by the Standards Council of Canada for the testing of the component in question and, when an inspector requests proof of the compliance, proof of compliance shall be produced by the person proposing to install or have installed the component, and without such proof the component shall not be installed as a permanent part of any plumbing system.
ON Variations: Where a component of a plumbing system is required by this Code to comply with a standard and the compliance is not certified by a testing agency accredited by the Standards Council of Canada for the testing of the component in question and, when an inspector requests proof of the compliance, proof of compliance shall be produced by the person proposing to install or have installed the component, and without such proof the component shall not be installed as a permanent part of any plumbing system.

ON Full: Access shall be provided to all tents for the purpose of firefighting.
ON Variations: Access shall be provided to all tents for the purpose of firefighting.

ON Full: No frozen material shall be used in the mortar mix.
ON Variations: No frozen material shall be used in the mortar mix.

ON Full: The structural design of prefabricated deep foundation units shall allow for all stresses resulting from driving, handling and testing.
ON Variations: The structural design of prefabricated deep foundation units shall allow for all stresses resulting from driving, handling and testing.

ON Full: Where the edges of panel-type subflooring are required to be supported, such support shall consist of tongue-and-groove panel edges or not less than 38 mm by 38 mm blocking securely nailed between framing members.
ON Variations: Where the edges of panel-type subflooring are required to be supported, such support shall consist of tongue-and-groove panel edges or not less than 38 mm by 38 mm blocking securely nailed between framing members.

ON Full: The unobstructed width of a hallway within a dwelling unit shall be not less than 860 mm, except that the hallway width is permitted to be 710 mm, where,(a) there are only bedrooms and bathrooms at the end of the hallway furthest from the living area, and (b) a second exit is provided, (i) in the hallway near the end furthest from the living area, or (ii) in each bedroom served by the hallway.
ON Variations: The unobstructed width of a hallway within a dwelling unit shall be not less than 860 mm, except that the hallway width is permitted to be 710 mm, where,(a) there are only bedrooms and bathrooms at the end of the hallway furthest from the living area, and (b) a second exit is provided, (i) in the hallway near the end furthest from the living area, or (ii) in each bedroom served by the hallway.

ON Full: Except as required by Sentence (7), combustible piping not more than 25 mm in diameter containing chlorine gas is permitted to penetrate a fire separation between a chlorine gas service room built in conjunction with a public pool or public spa and the remainder of the building, provided the piping is sealed at the penetration by a fire stop in conformance with Clause 3.1.9.1.(1)(a).
ON Variations: Except as required by Sentence (7), combustible piping not more than 25 mm in diameter containing chlorine gas is permitted to penetrate a fire separation between a chlorine gas service room built in conjunction with a public pool or public spa and the remainder of the building, provided the piping is sealed at the penetration by a fire stop in conformance with Clause 3.1.9.1.(1)(a).

ON Full: Unless specifically designed with a fire stop, fire dampers are permitted to penetrate a fire separation or a membrane forming part of an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating without having to meet the fire stop requirements of Sentence (1), (2) or (3), provided the fire damper is installed in conformance with NFPA 80, "Fire Doors and Other Opening Protectives".
ON Variations: Unless specifically designed with a fire stop, fire dampers are permitted to penetrate a fire separation or a membrane forming part of an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating without having to meet the fire stop requirements of Sentence (1), (2) or (3), provided the fire damper is installed in conformance with NFPA 80, "Fire Doors and Other Opening Protectives".

ON Full: The supply duct shall have, (a) a diameter of not less than 100 mm or equivalent area, and (b) an exterior intake for entry of air from the outdoors.
ON Variations: The supply duct shall have, (a) a diameter of not less than 100 mm or equivalent area, and (b) an exterior intake for entry of air from the outdoors.

ON Full: Flanking wall and ceiling assemblies connected to a separating wall assembly shall be constructed with,(a) concrete or concrete block having a mass per area greater than 300 kg/m2, or (b) gypsum board finish that, (i) is supported on wood or steel framing, and (ii) ends or is interrupted where it meets the structure of the separating wall assembly or, for double-stud walls, where it meets the space between the two lines of studs.
ON Variations: Flanking wall and ceiling assemblies connected to a separating wall assembly shall be constructed with,(a) concrete or concrete block having a mass per area greater than 300 kg/m2, or (b) gypsum board finish that, (i) is supported on wood or steel framing, and (ii) ends or is interrupted where it meets the structure of the separating wall assembly or, for double-stud walls, where it meets the space between the two lines of studs.

ON Full: Wood-based panels used for roof sheathing shall conform to the requirements of,(a) CSA O121, "Douglas Fir Plywood", (b) CSA O151, "Canadian Softwood Plywood", (c) CSA O153, "Poplar Plywood", (d) CSA O325, "Construction Sheathing", or (e) CSA O437.0, "OSB and Waferboard".
ON Variations: Wood-based panels used for roof sheathing shall conform to the requirements of,(a) CSA O121, "Douglas Fir Plywood", (b) CSA O151, "Canadian Softwood Plywood", (c) CSA O153, "Poplar Plywood", (d) CSA O325, "Construction Sheathing", or (e) CSA O437.0, "OSB and Waferboard".

ON Full: PVC water pipe and fittings in Sentence (1) shall not be used in a hot water system.
ON Variations: PVC water pipe and fittings in Sentence (1) shall not be used in a hot water system.

ON Full: The space required in Sentence (1) shall not be filled with mortar.
ON Variations: The space required in Sentence (1) shall not be filled with mortar.

ON Full: Sprinklers shall be installed in all spaces below tiers of seats in a building classified as Group A, Division 4 if those spaces are used for occupancy.
ON Variations: Sprinklers shall be installed in all spaces below tiers of seats in a building classified as Group A, Division 4 if those spaces are used for occupancy.

ON Full: Combustible ground cover used as enclosing material in Sentence (2) shall be covered with noncombustible material. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Combustible ground cover used as enclosing material in Sentence (2) shall be covered with noncombustible material. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Where the building is not provided with a fire alarm system, a hold-open device permitted by Sentence (1) shall release upon a signal from a smoke alarm located on either side of the fire separation at ceiling level within 1.5 m horizontally of the closure opening in the fire separation, where the hold-open device is used on closures described in Clauses (3)(a) to (e).
ON Variations: Where the building is not provided with a fire alarm system, a hold-open device permitted by Sentence (1) shall release upon a signal from a smoke alarm located on either side of the fire separation at ceiling level within 1.5 m horizontally of the closure opening in the fire separation, where the hold-open device is used on closures described in Clauses (3)(a) to (e).

ON Full: Not more than six shower heads shall be served by a single shower drain.
ON Variations: Not more than six shower heads shall be served by a single shower drain.

ON Full: A portable privy shall be constructed in the following manner: (a) the portable privy shall have a watertight receptacle that shall be suitable for the holding and storage of any sanitary sewage deposited in it, (b) the receptacle for the holding and storage of sewage shall be designed and constructed in such a manner as to allow it to be easily emptied and cleaned, and (c) the portable privy shall be constructed of such material and in such a manner that it can withstand the stresses to which it will be subjected during its transportation to and from sites where it is to be used and during loading and unloading from vehicles used for the transportation of the portable privy to and from sites where it is to be used.
ON Variations: A portable privy shall be constructed in the following manner: (a) the portable privy shall have a watertight receptacle that shall be suitable for the holding and storage of any sanitary sewage deposited in it, (b) the receptacle for the holding and storage of sewage shall be designed and constructed in such a manner as to allow it to be easily emptied and cleaned, and (c) the portable privy shall be constructed of such material and in such a manner that it can withstand the stresses to which it will be subjected during its transportation to and from sites where it is to be used and during loading and unloading from vehicles used for the transportation of the portable privy to and from sites where it is to be used.

ON Full: A field review shall be carried out by the designer or by another suitably qualified person to ascertain that the subsurface conditions are consistent with the design and that construction is carried out in accordance with the design and good engineering practice.
ON Variations: A field review shall be carried out by the designer or by another suitably qualified person to ascertain that the subsurface conditions are consistent with the design and that construction is carried out in accordance with the design and good engineering practice.

ON Full: Flared-joint fittings for copper tube water systems not made by casting shall conform to the applicable requirements of ASME B16.26, "Cast Copper Alloy Fittings for Flared Copper Tubes".
ON Variations: Flared-joint fittings for copper tube water systems not made by casting shall conform to the applicable requirements of ASME B16.26, "Cast Copper Alloy Fittings for Flared Copper Tubes".

ON Full: Insulators shall be kept clean and dry.
ON Variations: Insulators shall be kept clean and dry.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (4), the clear opening width of doorways shall comply with Sentence (2) at,(a) exit doors, and (b) doors that open into or are located, (i) within a public corridor, or (ii) within another facility that provides access to exit from a suite.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (4), the clear opening width of doorways shall comply with Sentence (2) at,(a) exit doors, and (b) doors that open into or are located, (i) within a public corridor, or (ii) within another facility that provides access to exit from a suite.

ON Full: Except at distilleries as provided in Section 4.9., vent piping materials and construction shall conform to Subsections 4.4.2., 4.4.3. and 4.4.5.
ON Variations: Except at distilleries as provided in Section 4.9., vent piping materials and construction shall conform to Subsections 4.4.2., 4.4.3. and 4.4.5.

ON Full: A sign shall be posted indicating the necessity of grounding equipment and objects identified in Sentences (1) and (2).
ON Variations: A sign shall be posted indicating the necessity of grounding equipment and objects identified in Sentences (1) and (2).

ON Full: Discharge outlets for special fire suppression systems shall be kept free of dirt and residue.
ON Variations: Discharge outlets for special fire suppression systems shall be kept free of dirt and residue.

ON Full: In processes where an explosion hazard is present and conditions exist that prevent adequate explosion venting as required in this Section, an explosion prevention system shall be provided.
ON Variations: In processes where an explosion hazard is present and conditions exist that prevent adequate explosion venting as required in this Section, an explosion prevention system shall be provided.

ON Full: Explosives shall not be used to break up caked ammonium nitrate.
ON Variations: Explosives shall not be used to break up caked ammonium nitrate.

ON Full: Except where fire dampers, window assemblies and glass block are used as closures, closures of the same fire-protection rating installed on opposite sides of the same opening are deemed to have a fire-protection rating equal to the sum of the fire-protection ratings of the closures.
ON Variations: Except where fire dampers, window assemblies and glass block are used as closures, closures of the same fire-protection rating installed on opposite sides of the same opening are deemed to have a fire-protection rating equal to the sum of the fire-protection ratings of the closures.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentences (2), (3) and (4) and Sentence 9.9.6.6.(2), a landing shall be provided,(a) at the top and bottom of each flight of interior and exterior stairs, including stairs in garages, (b) at the top and bottom of every ramp with a slope greater than 1 in 50, and (c) where a doorway opens onto a stair or ramp.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentences (2), (3) and (4) and Sentence 9.9.6.6.(2), a landing shall be provided,(a) at the top and bottom of each flight of interior and exterior stairs, including stairs in garages, (b) at the top and bottom of every ramp with a slope greater than 1 in 50, and (c) where a doorway opens onto a stair or ramp.

ON Full: Salvage tanks shall be located underground outside the building, or inside a building in an enclosure separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 2 h.
ON Variations: Salvage tanks shall be located underground outside the building, or inside a building in an enclosure separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 2 h.

ON Full: Access to fire alarm and voice communication system components requiring inspection or servicing shall be kept unobstructed.
ON Variations: Access to fire alarm and voice communication system components requiring inspection or servicing shall be kept unobstructed.

ON Full: When the occupant load as determined in Article 2.7.1.4. is more than 60 persons, the occupant load shall be posted in a conspicuous location.
ON Variations: When the occupant load as determined in Article 2.7.1.4. is more than 60 persons, the occupant load shall be posted in a conspicuous location.

ON Full: PVC water pipe, fittings and solvent cement shall be certified to CSA B137.3, "Rigid Polyvinylchloride (PVC) Pipe and Fittings for Pressure Applications" or CSA B137.2, "Polyvinylchloride (PVC) Injection-Moulded Gasketed Fittings for Pressure Applications", and have a minimum pressure rating of 1 100 kPa.
ON Variations: PVC water pipe, fittings and solvent cement shall be certified to CSA B137.3, "Rigid Polyvinylchloride (PVC) Pipe and Fittings for Pressure Applications" or CSA B137.2, "Polyvinylchloride (PVC) Injection-Moulded Gasketed Fittings for Pressure Applications", and have a minimum pressure rating of 1 100 kPa.

ON Full: Except as permitted in this Subsection, foundations conforming to Sections 9.12. and 9.15. shall be provided for the support of carport and garage super-structures, including that portion beneath garage doors.
ON Variations: Except as permitted in this Subsection, foundations conforming to Sections 9.12. and 9.15. shall be provided for the support of carport and garage super-structures, including that portion beneath garage doors.

ON Full: Bleacher seats shall be designed for a uniformly distributed live load of 1.75 kN for each linear metre or for a concentrated load of 2.2 kN distributed over a length of 750 mm, whichever produces the most critical effect on the supporting members.
ON Variations: Bleacher seats shall be designed for a uniformly distributed live load of 1.75 kN for each linear metre or for a concentrated load of 2.2 kN distributed over a length of 750 mm, whichever produces the most critical effect on the supporting members.

ON Full: Despite Sentences (1) and (3), other inspection and test procedures may be approved.
ON Variations: Despite Sentences (1) and (3), other inspection and test procedures may be approved.

ON Full: Any covering of an access opening through which a person could enter shall be openable from the inside without the use of keys where there is a possibility of the opening being accidentally closed while the system or equipment is being serviced.
ON Variations: Any covering of an access opening through which a person could enter shall be openable from the inside without the use of keys where there is a possibility of the opening being accidentally closed while the system or equipment is being serviced.

ON Full: Windows, doors and skylights shall conform to the performance grades selected under Sentence (1) when tested in accordance with AAMA/WDMA/CSA 101/I.S.2/A440, "NAFS - North American Fenestration Standard/Specification for Windows, Doors, and Skylights".
ON Variations: Windows, doors and skylights shall conform to the performance grades selected under Sentence (1) when tested in accordance with AAMA/WDMA/CSA 101/I.S.2/A440, "NAFS - North American Fenestration Standard/Specification for Windows, Doors, and Skylights".

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentences (2) to (7), the requirements in Subsection 3.2.5. shall not apply.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentences (2) to (7), the requirements in Subsection 3.2.5. shall not apply.

ON Full: Plain or reinforced masonry used in foundations or in support of soil or rock shall conform to the requirements of Subsection 4.3.2.
ON Variations: Plain or reinforced masonry used in foundations or in support of soil or rock shall conform to the requirements of Subsection 4.3.2.

ON Full: Piping for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall not be located in service tunnels that are used for pedestrian traffic other than for maintenance purposes.
ON Variations: Piping for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall not be located in service tunnels that are used for pedestrian traffic other than for maintenance purposes.

ON Full: Mechanical and electrical alarms shall be tested to ensure that they are in operating condition.
ON Variations: Mechanical and electrical alarms shall be tested to ensure that they are in operating condition.

ON Full: Except as permitted by Article 3.2.2.3., a building shall be constructed in conformance with this Subsection to prevent fire spread and collapse caused by the effects of fire.
ON Variations: Except as permitted by Article 3.2.2.3., a building shall be constructed in conformance with this Subsection to prevent fire spread and collapse caused by the effects of fire.

ON Full: This Section applies to heat, air and water vapour transfer and measures to control condensation.
ON Variations: This Section applies to heat, air and water vapour transfer and measures to control condensation.

ON Full: Combustible materials shall not be accumulated in or around a building in such quantity or such location as to create a fire hazard.
ON Variations: Combustible materials shall not be accumulated in or around a building in such quantity or such location as to create a fire hazard.

ON Full: Corrugated steel pipe and couplings shall be certified to CAN/CSA-G401, "Corrugated Steel Pipe Products".
ON Variations: Corrugated steel pipe and couplings shall be certified to CAN/CSA-G401, "Corrugated Steel Pipe Products".

ON Full: Except as permitted in Sentence (4), a cant strip shall be provided at the edges of roofs.
ON Variations: Except as permitted in Sentence (4), a cant strip shall be provided at the edges of roofs.

ON Full: Where children with disabilities are cared for, sufficient staff shall be present at all times during the period the children are in the centre to escort them to safety in the event of a fire emergency.
ON Variations: Where children with disabilities are cared for, sufficient staff shall be present at all times during the period the children are in the centre to escort them to safety in the event of a fire emergency.

ON Full: Externally illuminated exit signs shall be continuously illuminated by a light fixture supplied by an electrical circuit.
ON Variations: Externally illuminated exit signs shall be continuously illuminated by a light fixture supplied by an electrical circuit.

ON Full: No flight shall have a vertical rise of more than 3.7 m between floors or landings, except that a flight serving as an exit in a Group B, Division 2 or 3 occupancy shall have a vertical rise not more than 2.4 m between floors or landings.
ON Variations: No flight shall have a vertical rise of more than 3.7 m between floors or landings, except that a flight serving as an exit in a Group B, Division 2 or 3 occupancy shall have a vertical rise not more than 2.4 m between floors or landings.

ON Full: In storage garages subject to the requirements of Sentence (1), where motor vehicles are parked by mechanical means, the ventilation requirements may be reduced by one half.
ON Variations: In storage garages subject to the requirements of Sentence (1), where motor vehicles are parked by mechanical means, the ventilation requirements may be reduced by one half.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (2), hinges for doors described in Sentence (1) shall be fastened, (a) to wood doors with wood screws not less than 25 mm long and to wood frames with wood screws such that at least two screws per hinge penetrate not less than 30 mm into solid wood, or (b) to metal doors and metal frames with machine screws not smaller than No. 10 and not less than 10 mm long. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (2), hinges for doors described in Sentence (1) shall be fastened, (a) to wood doors with wood screws not less than 25 mm long and to wood frames with wood screws such that at least two screws per hinge penetrate not less than 30 mm into solid wood, or (b) to metal doors and metal frames with machine screws not smaller than No. 10 and not less than 10 mm long. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Cargo hose shall be maintained in satisfactory operating condition and be pressure tested, at intervals not greater than 12 months, to 1.5 times the maximum working pressure but not less than 350 kPa (gauge).
ON Variations: Cargo hose shall be maintained in satisfactory operating condition and be pressure tested, at intervals not greater than 12 months, to 1.5 times the maximum working pressure but not less than 350 kPa (gauge).

ON Full: Where different products are used for the vapour barrier and the insulation, the vapour barrier shall be installed sufficiently close to the warm side of the insulation to prevent condensation at design conditions. (See Appendix A and Appendix Note A-9.25.5.1.(1))
ON Variations: Where different products are used for the vapour barrier and the insulation, the vapour barrier shall be installed sufficiently close to the warm side of the insulation to prevent condensation at design conditions. (See Appendix A and Appendix Note A-9.25.5.1.(1))

ON Full: Where protection is not provided against fires or explosions in processing equipment, the distances in Sentences (2) and (3) shall be doubled.
ON Variations: Where protection is not provided against fires or explosions in processing equipment, the distances in Sentences (2) and (3) shall be doubled.

ON Full: Underground mains and connections shall be hydrostatically tested for 2 hours at a hydrostatic pressure of 350 kPa (gauge) in excess of the maximum hydrostatic pressure in service, but not less than 1400 kPa (gauge).
ON Variations: Underground mains and connections shall be hydrostatically tested for 2 hours at a hydrostatic pressure of 350 kPa (gauge) in excess of the maximum hydrostatic pressure in service, but not less than 1400 kPa (gauge).

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentences (3) and (6), steel angle lintels supporting masonry above openings shall conform to Table 9.20.5.2.A.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentences (3) and (6), steel angle lintels supporting masonry above openings shall conform to Table 9.20.5.2.A.

ON Full: Each connection that is located below the liquid level of the aboveground storage tank and through which liquid does not normally flow shall be provided with a liquid-tight closing device.
ON Variations: Each connection that is located below the liquid level of the aboveground storage tank and through which liquid does not normally flow shall be provided with a liquid-tight closing device.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (10) and except for self-contained systems serving individual dwelling units, exhaust ducts serving rooms containing water closets, urinals, basins, showers or slop sinks shall be independent of other exhaust ducts.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (10) and except for self-contained systems serving individual dwelling units, exhaust ducts serving rooms containing water closets, urinals, basins, showers or slop sinks shall be independent of other exhaust ducts.
