ON Full: Except as permitted by Sentences (7) and (9), the electrical conductors referred to in Sentence (1) are those that extend from the source of emergency power to, the equipment served, or the distribution equipment supplying power to the equipment served, if both are in the same room. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Except as permitted by Sentences (7) and (9), the electrical conductors referred to in Sentence (1) are those that extend from the source of emergency power to, the equipment served, or the distribution equipment supplying power to the equipment served, if both are in the same room. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Except as permitted by Sentence (2), a metal roof deck assembly shall meet the conditions of acceptance of CAN/ULC-S126, "Test for Fire Spread Under Roof-Deck Assemblies", if, it supports a combustible material above the deck that could propagate a fire beneath the roof deck assembly, and the deck is used to comply with the requirements of Sentences 3.2.2.25.(2), 3.2.2.32.(2), 3.2.2.53.(2), 3.2.2.59.(2), 3.2.2.70.(2) and 3.2.2.76.(2) for noncombustible construction.
ON Variations: Except as permitted by Sentence (2), a metal roof deck assembly shall meet the conditions of acceptance of CAN/ULC-S126, "Test for Fire Spread Under Roof-Deck Assemblies", if, it supports a combustible material above the deck that could propagate a fire beneath the roof deck assembly, and the deck is used to comply with the requirements of Sentences 3.2.2.25.(2), 3.2.2.32.(2), 3.2.2.53.(2), 3.2.2.59.(2), 3.2.2.70.(2) and 3.2.2.76.(2) for noncombustible construction.

ON Full: Stainless steel, monel metal or lined steel bodied valves are permitted to be used when special conditions warrant their use.
ON Variations: Stainless steel, monel metal or lined steel bodied valves are permitted to be used when special conditions warrant their use.

ON Full: This Part provides measures for the fire safety of persons and buildings, including the elimination or control of fire hazards in and around buildings, the maintenance of certain life safety systems in buildings, the establishment of a fire safety plan in certain buildings and the installation of smoke alarms and carbon monoxide alarms.
ON Variations: This Part provides measures for the fire safety of persons and buildings, including the elimination or control of fire hazards in and around buildings, the maintenance of certain life safety systems in buildings, the establishment of a fire safety plan in certain buildings and the installation of smoke alarms and carbon monoxide alarms.

ON Full: Except in an elementary or secondary school that is subdivided by a firewall, the floor area on each side of a horizontal exit shall be sufficient to accommodate the occupants of both floor areas, allowing not less than 0.5 m2 of clear floor space per person, except that 1.5 m2 shall be provided for each person in a wheelchair and 2.5 m2 for each patient in bed.
ON Variations: Except in an elementary or secondary school that is subdivided by a firewall, the floor area on each side of a horizontal exit shall be sufficient to accommodate the occupants of both floor areas, allowing not less than 0.5 m2 of clear floor space per person, except that 1.5 m2 shall be provided for each person in a wheelchair and 2.5 m2 for each patient in bed.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentences (2), (3) and (4), air-supported structures shall not be erected closer than 3 m to other structures on the same property or to the property line.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentences (2), (3) and (4), air-supported structures shall not be erected closer than 3 m to other structures on the same property or to the property line.

ON Full: At least one barrier-free path of travel shall be provided from a barrier-free entrance, into the fare-paid area, and to each platform.
ON Variations: At least one barrier-free path of travel shall be provided from a barrier-free entrance, into the fare-paid area, and to each platform.

ON Full: The distance in Clause (6)(b) may be reduced to 7.5 m if a firewall that has a fire-resistance rating not less than 2 h is provided between the storage facility and the building it exposes.
ON Variations: The distance in Clause (6)(b) may be reduced to 7.5 m if a firewall that has a fire-resistance rating not less than 2 h is provided between the storage facility and the building it exposes.

ON Full: Bracing required in Sentence (3) shall consist of not less than 19 mm by 89 mm lumber nailed at right angles to the web members near their centres with at least two 63 mm nails for each member.
ON Variations: Bracing required in Sentence (3) shall consist of not less than 19 mm by 89 mm lumber nailed at right angles to the web members near their centres with at least two 63 mm nails for each member.

ON Full: Vitrified clay pipe and fittings shall not be used except for an underground part of a drainage system.
ON Variations: Vitrified clay pipe and fittings shall not be used except for an underground part of a drainage system.

ON Full: Where the lighting outlet and fixture required in Sentence (1) are ceiling mounted above an area not normally occupied by a parked car, or are wall mounted, a fixture with a built-in switch is permitted to be used.
ON Variations: Where the lighting outlet and fixture required in Sentence (1) are ceiling mounted above an area not normally occupied by a parked car, or are wall mounted, a fixture with a built-in switch is permitted to be used.

ON Full: Except where a Group F Division 2 major occupancy is directly related to live/work units, not more than one suite of residential occupancy shall be contained within a building classified as Group F, Division 2 major occupancy.
ON Variations: Except where a Group F Division 2 major occupancy is directly related to live/work units, not more than one suite of residential occupancy shall be contained within a building classified as Group F, Division 2 major occupancy.

ON Full: Stucco lath shall conform to Table 9.28.4.3.
ON Variations: Stucco lath shall conform to Table 9.28.4.3.

ON Full: When the occupant load has been determined using Subclause 2.7.1.4.(3)(b)(i), a permanent sign indicating the occupant load shall be posted in a conspicuous location.
ON Variations: When the occupant load has been determined using Subclause 2.7.1.4.(3)(b)(i), a permanent sign indicating the occupant load shall be posted in a conspicuous location.

ON Full: Every identification tag shall be kept clean so that its colour and inscription are easily recognizable.
ON Variations: Every identification tag shall be kept clean so that its colour and inscription are easily recognizable.

ON Full: Flashing beneath weep holes in masonry veneer over masonry back-up walls shall conform to the flashing requirements for cavity walls and masonry veneer/masonry back-up walls in Article 9.20.13.5.
ON Variations: Flashing beneath weep holes in masonry veneer over masonry back-up walls shall conform to the flashing requirements for cavity walls and masonry veneer/masonry back-up walls in Article 9.20.13.5.

ON Full: All other controls installed in a shower described in Sentence (2) shall comply with Subclauses (2)(h)(i) to (iii).
ON Variations: All other controls installed in a shower described in Sentence (2) shall comply with Subclauses (2)(h)(i) to (iii).

ON Full: Where noncombustible piping pierces a fire separation or a fire block, the requirements for fire stopping of Subsection 3.1.9., Sentence 9.10.9.6.(1) and Article 9.10.16.4. shall apply.
ON Variations: Where noncombustible piping pierces a fire separation or a fire block, the requirements for fire stopping of Subsection 3.1.9., Sentence 9.10.9.6.(1) and Article 9.10.16.4. shall apply.

ON Full: The maximum piling height allowed in Sentence (1) shall be posted in conspicuous locations.
ON Variations: The maximum piling height allowed in Sentence (1) shall be posted in conspicuous locations.

ON Full: Upon completion of the installation, systems permitted in Sentence (1) shall be tested to ensure that all components are functioning as intended.
ON Variations: Upon completion of the installation, systems permitted in Sentence (1) shall be tested to ensure that all components are functioning as intended.

ON Full: Tapered treads in a flight shall have a uniform run in accordance with the tolerances described in Sentence (3) when measured at a point 300 mm from the centre line of the inside handrail.
ON Variations: Tapered treads in a flight shall have a uniform run in accordance with the tolerances described in Sentence (3) when measured at a point 300 mm from the centre line of the inside handrail.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (3) and except where space heating energy is provided by a solid fuel-burning appliance or a ground source heat pump,(a) where a house contains two dwelling units and each dwelling unit is served by a separate heating system, the indoor air temperature in each dwelling unit shall be controlled by at least one programmable thermostatic control device located in the dwelling unit, (b) where a house contains one dwelling unit or contains two dwelling units and both dwelling units are served by one heating system, the indoor air temperature in the house shall be controlled by at least one programmable thermostatic control device located in the house, and (c) the indoor air temperature in an individual dwelling unit in a building other than a house shall be controlled by at least one programmable thermostatic control device located in the dwelling unit.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (3) and except where space heating energy is provided by a solid fuel-burning appliance or a ground source heat pump,(a) where a house contains two dwelling units and each dwelling unit is served by a separate heating system, the indoor air temperature in each dwelling unit shall be controlled by at least one programmable thermostatic control device located in the dwelling unit, (b) where a house contains one dwelling unit or contains two dwelling units and both dwelling units are served by one heating system, the indoor air temperature in the house shall be controlled by at least one programmable thermostatic control device located in the house, and (c) the indoor air temperature in an individual dwelling unit in a building other than a house shall be controlled by at least one programmable thermostatic control device located in the dwelling unit.

ON Full: The treatment unit used in conjunction with a leaching bed constructed as a Type A dispersal bed shall provide an effluent quality that does not exceed the maximum concentrations set out opposite a Level IV treatment unit in Columns 2 and 3 of Table 8.6.2.2.
ON Variations: The treatment unit used in conjunction with a leaching bed constructed as a Type A dispersal bed shall provide an effluent quality that does not exceed the maximum concentrations set out opposite a Level IV treatment unit in Columns 2 and 3 of Table 8.6.2.2.

ON Full: The vestibule doors in Sentence (2), are not required to be equipped with latches, and shall swing in the direction of travel from the rapid transit station.
ON Variations: The vestibule doors in Sentence (2), are not required to be equipped with latches, and shall swing in the direction of travel from the rapid transit station.

ON Full: Lighting fixtures shall not be located adjacent to any cellulose nitrate plastic material so as to create a possible ignition hazard.
ON Variations: Lighting fixtures shall not be located adjacent to any cellulose nitrate plastic material so as to create a possible ignition hazard.

ON Full: Lumber shall conform to the appropriate requirements in Subsection 9.3.2.
ON Variations: Lumber shall conform to the appropriate requirements in Subsection 9.3.2.

ON Full: In a dwelling unit with a water distribution system, piping for hot and cold water shall be connected to every kitchen sink, lavatory, bathtub, shower, slop sink and laundry area.
ON Variations: In a dwelling unit with a water distribution system, piping for hot and cold water shall be connected to every kitchen sink, lavatory, bathtub, shower, slop sink and laundry area.

ON Full: Exterior concrete stairs with more than two risers and two treads shall be,(a) supported on unit masonry or concrete walls or piers not less than 150 mm in cross-section, or (b) cantilevered from the main foundation wall.
ON Variations: Exterior concrete stairs with more than two risers and two treads shall be,(a) supported on unit masonry or concrete walls or piers not less than 150 mm in cross-section, or (b) cantilevered from the main foundation wall.

ON Full: The internal pressure coefficient, Cpi, shall be as prescribed in Table 4.1.7.7.
ON Variations: The internal pressure coefficient, Cpi, shall be as prescribed in Table 4.1.7.7.

ON Full: The horizontal joints of siding described in Sentence (1) shall be lapped not less than 25 mm.
ON Variations: The horizontal joints of siding described in Sentence (1) shall be lapped not less than 25 mm.

ON Full: The person responsible for directing the operations shall prior to the transfer of cargo, ascertain that no unauthorized repair work is being carried out on the pier or wharf and that there are no open flames in the vicinity, during the transfer of cargo, monitor the progress of the loading and unloading to prevent overflow, and inspect the hose and connections for leakage and, if leakage occurs, stop the operations.
ON Variations: The person responsible for directing the operations shall prior to the transfer of cargo, ascertain that no unauthorized repair work is being carried out on the pier or wharf and that there are no open flames in the vicinity, during the transfer of cargo, monitor the progress of the loading and unloading to prevent overflow, and inspect the hose and connections for leakage and, if leakage occurs, stop the operations.

ON Full: Vent piping for an underground storage tank containing a Class I liquid shall not be connected to the vent piping for an underground storage tank containing a Class II or IIIA liquid unless an effective method is provided to prevent the vapours from the Class I liquid storage tank from entering the other tank.
ON Variations: Vent piping for an underground storage tank containing a Class I liquid shall not be connected to the vent piping for an underground storage tank containing a Class II or IIIA liquid unless an effective method is provided to prevent the vapours from the Class I liquid storage tank from entering the other tank.

ON Full: No freight or materials shall be placed on piers and wharves in such a manner as to obstruct the access openings required in Sentence (1).
ON Variations: No freight or materials shall be placed on piers and wharves in such a manner as to obstruct the access openings required in Sentence (1).

ON Full: Precautions shall be taken to prevent any mixing of foreign materials with dusts or overspray residues resulting from the sanding or spraying of finishing materials containing organic peroxides.
ON Variations: Precautions shall be taken to prevent any mixing of foreign materials with dusts or overspray residues resulting from the sanding or spraying of finishing materials containing organic peroxides.

ON Full: Salamanders, braziers or other open flames shall not be used in storage yards.
ON Variations: Salamanders, braziers or other open flames shall not be used in storage yards.

ON Full: Walls and ceilings of spray rooms that are susceptible to paint residue accumulations and interior surfaces of spray booths shall be smooth and continuous.
ON Variations: Walls and ceilings of spray rooms that are susceptible to paint residue accumulations and interior surfaces of spray booths shall be smooth and continuous.

ON Full: The washroom required in Sentence 3.13.6.2.(2) shall be designed in conformance with the requirements in Article 3.8.3.12.
ON Variations: The washroom required in Sentence 3.13.6.2.(2) shall be designed in conformance with the requirements in Article 3.8.3.12.

ON Full: The beach entry ramp permitted in Clause (4)(d) shall be protected with permanent barriers between 900 mm to 1 200 mm along the pool deck to prevent entry into the pool until the minimum water pool depth is 750 mm.
ON Variations: The beach entry ramp permitted in Clause (4)(d) shall be protected with permanent barriers between 900 mm to 1 200 mm along the pool deck to prevent entry into the pool until the minimum water pool depth is 750 mm.

ON Full: All treatment units referred to in Sentences (1) and (2) shall permit the sampling of the effluent.
ON Variations: All treatment units referred to in Sentences (1) and (2) shall permit the sampling of the effluent.

ON Full: Despite Subsections 11.3.1. to 11.3.3., where an existing septic tank is subject to material alteration, repair or replacement, the construction of the septic tank shall comply with Part 8.
ON Variations: Despite Subsections 11.3.1. to 11.3.3., where an existing septic tank is subject to material alteration, repair or replacement, the construction of the septic tank shall comply with Part 8.

ON Full: Where termites are known to exist, unless pressure-treated with a chemical that is toxic to such termites in accordance with Article 9.3.2.9., wood steps shall rest on a non-cellulosic base or apron extending at least 150 mm above the ground.
ON Variations: Where termites are known to exist, unless pressure-treated with a chemical that is toxic to such termites in accordance with Article 9.3.2.9., wood steps shall rest on a non-cellulosic base or apron extending at least 150 mm above the ground.

ON Full: The central alarm and control facility shall be checked daily for indication of trouble in the system.
ON Variations: The central alarm and control facility shall be checked daily for indication of trouble in the system.

ON Full: Ventilation required in Sentence (1) is permitted to be provided by mechanical systems if their use does not constitute a source of ignition.
ON Variations: Ventilation required in Sentence (1) is permitted to be provided by mechanical systems if their use does not constitute a source of ignition.

ON Full: A compliance alternative shown in Table 11.5.1.1.A., 11.5.1.1.B., 11.5.1.1.C., 11.5.1.1.D/E. or 11.5.1.1.F. may be substituted for a requirement contained in Part 9 or 12 without satisfying the chief building official that compliance with the requirement is impracticable.
ON Variations: A compliance alternative shown in Table 11.5.1.1.A., 11.5.1.1.B., 11.5.1.1.C., 11.5.1.1.D/E. or 11.5.1.1.F. may be substituted for a requirement contained in Part 9 or 12 without satisfying the chief building official that compliance with the requirement is impracticable.

ON Full: Except as required by Sentence 9.9.9.3.(1), each suite in a floor area occupied by more than one suite shall have,(a) an exterior exit doorway, (b) a doorway to a public corridor, or (c) a doorway to an exterior passageway.
ON Variations: Except as required by Sentence 9.9.9.3.(1), each suite in a floor area occupied by more than one suite shall have,(a) an exterior exit doorway, (b) a doorway to a public corridor, or (c) a doorway to an exterior passageway.

ON Full: The service spaces referred to in Clause (2)(b) or (3)(b) shall not contain any combustible materials other than the electrical conductors being protected.
ON Variations: The service spaces referred to in Clause (2)(b) or (3)(b) shall not contain any combustible materials other than the electrical conductors being protected.

ON Full: An individual storage area shall not exceed 500 m2 in buildings that are not sprinklered.
ON Variations: An individual storage area shall not exceed 500 m2 in buildings that are not sprinklered.

ON Full: Except for chimneys serving fireplaces, the size of a chimney flue shall conform to the requirements of the solid fuel-burning appliance installation standard referenced in Sentence 6.2.1.4.(1) and Article 9.33.1.2.
ON Variations: Except for chimneys serving fireplaces, the size of a chimney flue shall conform to the requirements of the solid fuel-burning appliance installation standard referenced in Sentence 6.2.1.4.(1) and Article 9.33.1.2.

ON Full: The treatment unit used in conjunction with a leaching bed constructed as a Type B dispersal bed shall provide an effluent quality that does not exceed the maximum concentrations set out opposite a Level IV treatment unit in Columns 2 and 3 of Table 8.6.2.2.
ON Variations: The treatment unit used in conjunction with a leaching bed constructed as a Type B dispersal bed shall provide an effluent quality that does not exceed the maximum concentrations set out opposite a Level IV treatment unit in Columns 2 and 3 of Table 8.6.2.2.

ON Full: In areas known to be infested by termites, the requirements in Articles 9.3.2.9., 9.12.1.1. and 9.15.5.1. shall apply.
ON Variations: In areas known to be infested by termites, the requirements in Articles 9.3.2.9., 9.12.1.1. and 9.15.5.1. shall apply.

ON Full: The distance from the bottom of an exhaust outlet to finished ground level or to any nearer and lower permanent horizontal surface shall be not less than 100 mm.
ON Variations: The distance from the bottom of an exhaust outlet to finished ground level or to any nearer and lower permanent horizontal surface shall be not less than 100 mm.

ON Full: Where a room, chute or bin is required to be sprinklered as indicated in Sentence 3.3.4.3.(1), Article 3.6.2.5. and Sentence 3.6.3.3.(6), the sprinklers may be supplied with water from the fire standpipe system provided that, except for a chute, not more than eight sprinklers are required to protect any room or bin based on a maximum coverage of 12 m2 per sprinkler, the standpipe riser is, not less than 6 in. in diameter, or hydraulically designed to meet combined water supply as specified in Clause (c), the water supply for a standpipe system, pumping capability and water storage facility, if required, is increased to supply 95 L/min for each sprinkler over and above the requirements for the standpipe system up to maximum 760 L/min for sprinklers, a waterflow detecting device shall be installed in the sprinkler main adjacent to the point of connection to the standpipe riser, and the activation of each waterflow detecting device in Clause (d) shall be indicated separately on the fire alarm system annunciator.
ON Variations: Where a room, chute or bin is required to be sprinklered as indicated in Sentence 3.3.4.3.(1), Article 3.6.2.5. and Sentence 3.6.3.3.(6), the sprinklers may be supplied with water from the fire standpipe system provided that, except for a chute, not more than eight sprinklers are required to protect any room or bin based on a maximum coverage of 12 m2 per sprinkler, the standpipe riser is, not less than 6 in. in diameter, or hydraulically designed to meet combined water supply as specified in Clause (c), the water supply for a standpipe system, pumping capability and water storage facility, if required, is increased to supply 95 L/min for each sprinkler over and above the requirements for the standpipe system up to maximum 760 L/min for sprinklers, a waterflow detecting device shall be installed in the sprinkler main adjacent to the point of connection to the standpipe riser, and the activation of each waterflow detecting device in Clause (d) shall be indicated separately on the fire alarm system annunciator.

ON Full: Except as permitted by Sentence (2) and except for doors serving a house or an individual dwelling unit, exit doors that are required to swing shall swing in the direction of exit travel.
ON Variations: Except as permitted by Sentence (2) and except for doors serving a house or an individual dwelling unit, exit doors that are required to swing shall swing in the direction of exit travel.

ON Full: When two or more classes of liquid are stored in the same individual storage area, the maximum quantity permitted in the individual storage area shall be that permitted for the liquid with the lowest limit set out in Sentence (4).
ON Variations: When two or more classes of liquid are stored in the same individual storage area, the maximum quantity permitted in the individual storage area shall be that permitted for the liquid with the lowest limit set out in Sentence (4).

ON Full: Every pressurized distribution pipe shall be self-draining so as to prevent freezing of its contents.
ON Variations: Every pressurized distribution pipe shall be self-draining so as to prevent freezing of its contents.

ON Full: Single studs are permitted to be used on either side of openings,(a) in non-loadbearing interior walls not required to have fire-resistance ratings, provided the studs extend from the top wall plate to the bottom wall plate, or (b) in loadbearing or non-loadbearing interior or exterior walls, provided, (i) the opening is less than and within the required stud spacing, and (ii) no two such openings of full stud space width are located in adjacent stud spaces. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Single studs are permitted to be used on either side of openings,(a) in non-loadbearing interior walls not required to have fire-resistance ratings, provided the studs extend from the top wall plate to the bottom wall plate, or (b) in loadbearing or non-loadbearing interior or exterior walls, provided, (i) the opening is less than and within the required stud spacing, and (ii) no two such openings of full stud space width are located in adjacent stud spaces. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: The top plates in loadbearing walls shall be lapped or otherwise suitably tied at corners and intersecting walls in accordance with Sentence (4).
ON Variations: The top plates in loadbearing walls shall be lapped or otherwise suitably tied at corners and intersecting walls in accordance with Sentence (4).

ON Full: Except as provided in Articles 9.10.21.2. to 9.10.21.9., camps for housing of workers shall conform to Subsections 9.10.1. to 9.10.20.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Articles 9.10.21.2. to 9.10.21.9., camps for housing of workers shall conform to Subsections 9.10.1. to 9.10.20.

ON Full: No openings shall occur within 1.2 m of interior and exterior corners of exterior loadbearing flat insulating concrete form walls.
ON Variations: No openings shall occur within 1.2 m of interior and exterior corners of exterior loadbearing flat insulating concrete form walls.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (6), where two or more means of egress converge, the required egress capacity beyond that point shall be cumulative.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (6), where two or more means of egress converge, the required egress capacity beyond that point shall be cumulative.

ON Full: Where inspection shows that a deep foundation unit is damaged or not consistent with design or good engineering practice, (a) such a unit shall be reassessed by the designer, and (b) any necessary changes shall be made and action taken as required.
ON Variations: Where inspection shows that a deep foundation unit is damaged or not consistent with design or good engineering practice, (a) such a unit shall be reassessed by the designer, and (b) any necessary changes shall be made and action taken as required.

ON Full: In factories manufacturing articles of cellulose nitrate plastics, sprinklered and vented cabinets, vaults or storage rooms shall be provided to prevent the accumulation of excessive quantities of such material in workrooms.
ON Variations: In factories manufacturing articles of cellulose nitrate plastics, sprinklered and vented cabinets, vaults or storage rooms shall be provided to prevent the accumulation of excessive quantities of such material in workrooms.

ON Full: If a standpipe system is required in a building, 38 mm diam hose connections shall be provided in each storey in the building.
ON Variations: If a standpipe system is required in a building, 38 mm diam hose connections shall be provided in each storey in the building.

ON Full: Openings or access doors equipped with explosion release hardware shall be acceptable as explosion vents.
ON Variations: Openings or access doors equipped with explosion release hardware shall be acceptable as explosion vents.

ON Full: Except for stairs with winders, where a flight of stairs within a house or an individual dwelling unit consists of tapered treads, or a mix of tapered treads and rectangular treads, one handrail shall be installed along the narrow end of the treads.
ON Variations: Except for stairs with winders, where a flight of stairs within a house or an individual dwelling unit consists of tapered treads, or a mix of tapered treads and rectangular treads, one handrail shall be installed along the narrow end of the treads.

ON Full: Where buildings are used or intended to be used for seasonal tourist accommodation or for rent, they shall comply with Sections 9.5. to 9.8. in addition to the requirements of this Section.
ON Variations: Where buildings are used or intended to be used for seasonal tourist accommodation or for rent, they shall comply with Sections 9.5. to 9.8. in addition to the requirements of this Section.

ON Full: The requirements of this Section are in addition to the requirements of other Parts of this Division as they apply to the proposed construction.
ON Variations: The requirements of this Section are in addition to the requirements of other Parts of this Division as they apply to the proposed construction.

ON Full: Quantities of loose combustible fibres stored in an individual room referred to in Sentence (4) shall be arranged so that an individual pile does not exceed 250 m2 in area and is separated from other piles by aisles that are at least 2.4 m wide.
ON Variations: Quantities of loose combustible fibres stored in an individual room referred to in Sentence (4) shall be arranged so that an individual pile does not exceed 250 m2 in area and is separated from other piles by aisles that are at least 2.4 m wide.

ON Full: When electrostatic-type filters are used, they shall be installed so as to ensure that the electric circuit is automatically de-energized when filter access doors are opened and, in dwelling units, when the system circulating fan is not operating.
ON Variations: When electrostatic-type filters are used, they shall be installed so as to ensure that the electric circuit is automatically de-energized when filter access doors are opened and, in dwelling units, when the system circulating fan is not operating.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (2), exhaust ducts of nonmechanical ventilating systems serving separate rooms or spaces shall not be combined.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (2), exhaust ducts of nonmechanical ventilating systems serving separate rooms or spaces shall not be combined.

ON Full: Smoke detectors installed at the entrance to a walkway in conformance with Article 3.1.8.12. are deemed to meet the requirements of Sentence (5).
ON Variations: Smoke detectors installed at the entrance to a walkway in conformance with Article 3.1.8.12. are deemed to meet the requirements of Sentence (5).

ON Full: Materials used for exterior waterproofing shall conform to,(a) ASTM D1227, "Emulsified Asphalt Used as a Protective Coating for Roofing", in which case, they shall be installed in accordance with Sentence 9.13.3.3.(3), (b) ASTM D3019, "Lap Cement Used with Asphalt Roll Roofing, Non-Fibered, Asbestos-Fibered, and Non-Asbestos-Fibered", but only with respect to non-fibered and non-asbestos-fibered (Types I and asphalt roll roofing, (c) ASTM D4479 / D4479M, "Asphalt Roof Coatings - Asbestos-Free", in which case, they shall be installed in accordance with Sentence 9.13.3.3.(3) and with reinforcing material, (d) ASTM D4637 / D4637M, "EPDM Sheet Used In Single-Ply Roof Membrane", (e) ASTM D4811 / D4811M, "Nonvulcanized (Uncured) Rubber Sheet Used as Roof Flashing", (f) ASTM D6878 / D6878M, "Thermoplastic Polyolefin Based Sheet Roofing", (g) CGSB 37-GP-9Ma, "Primer, Asphalt, Unfilled, for Asphalt Roofing, Dampproofing and Waterproofing", where a primer is required, (h) CAN/CGSB-37.50-M, "Hot-Applied, Rubberized Asphalt for Roofing and Waterproofing", (i) CAN/CGSB-37.54, "Polyvinyl Chloride Roofing and Waterproofing Membrane", (j) CGSB 37-GP-56M, "Membrane, Modified, Bituminous, Prefabricated, and Reinforced for Roofing", (k) CAN/CGSB-37.58-M, "Membrane, Elastomeric, Cold-Applied Liquid, for Non-Exposed Use in Roofing and Waterproofing", (l) CAN/CSA-A123.2, "Asphalt-Coated Roofing Sheets", (m) CAN/CSA-A123.4, "Asphalt for Constructing Built-Up Roof Coverings and Waterproofing Systems", in which case, they shall be installed with reinforcing material, or (n) CSA A123.17, "Asphalt Glass Felt Used in Roofing and Waterproofing".
ON Variations: Materials used for exterior waterproofing shall conform to,(a) ASTM D1227, "Emulsified Asphalt Used as a Protective Coating for Roofing", in which case, they shall be installed in accordance with Sentence 9.13.3.3.(3), (b) ASTM D3019, "Lap Cement Used with Asphalt Roll Roofing, Non-Fibered, Asbestos-Fibered, and Non-Asbestos-Fibered", but only with respect to non-fibered and non-asbestos-fibered (Types I and asphalt roll roofing, (c) ASTM D4479 / D4479M, "Asphalt Roof Coatings - Asbestos-Free", in which case, they shall be installed in accordance with Sentence 9.13.3.3.(3) and with reinforcing material, (d) ASTM D4637 / D4637M, "EPDM Sheet Used In Single-Ply Roof Membrane", (e) ASTM D4811 / D4811M, "Nonvulcanized (Uncured) Rubber Sheet Used as Roof Flashing", (f) ASTM D6878 / D6878M, "Thermoplastic Polyolefin Based Sheet Roofing", (g) CGSB 37-GP-9Ma, "Primer, Asphalt, Unfilled, for Asphalt Roofing, Dampproofing and Waterproofing", where a primer is required, (h) CAN/CGSB-37.50-M, "Hot-Applied, Rubberized Asphalt for Roofing and Waterproofing", (i) CAN/CGSB-37.54, "Polyvinyl Chloride Roofing and Waterproofing Membrane", (j) CGSB 37-GP-56M, "Membrane, Modified, Bituminous, Prefabricated, and Reinforced for Roofing", (k) CAN/CGSB-37.58-M, "Membrane, Elastomeric, Cold-Applied Liquid, for Non-Exposed Use in Roofing and Waterproofing", (l) CAN/CSA-A123.2, "Asphalt-Coated Roofing Sheets", (m) CAN/CSA-A123.4, "Asphalt for Constructing Built-Up Roof Coverings and Waterproofing Systems", in which case, they shall be installed with reinforcing material, or (n) CSA A123.17, "Asphalt Glass Felt Used in Roofing and Waterproofing".

ON Full: The bearing surface of a foundation need not be below the level of potential damage from frost where the foundation, (a) is designed against frost action, or (b) overlies material not susceptible to frost action.
ON Variations: The bearing surface of a foundation need not be below the level of potential damage from frost where the foundation, (a) is designed against frost action, or (b) overlies material not susceptible to frost action.

ON Full: Vents shall comply with CAN3-A93-M, "Natural Airflow Ventilators for Buildings".
ON Variations: Vents shall comply with CAN3-A93-M, "Natural Airflow Ventilators for Buildings".

ON Full: All masonry shall be supported on masonry, concrete or steel, except that masonry veneer walls are permitted to be supported on foundations of wood frame constructed in conformance with Sentence 9.15.2.4.(1). (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: All masonry shall be supported on masonry, concrete or steel, except that masonry veneer walls are permitted to be supported on foundations of wood frame constructed in conformance with Sentence 9.15.2.4.(1). (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Where the fire chamber floor is elevated more than 150 mm above the hearth, the dimension of the hearth measured perpendicular to the plane of the fireplace opening shall be increased by not less than,(a) 50 mm for an elevation above 150 mm and not more than 300 mm, and (b) an additional 25 mm for every 50 mm in elevation above 300 mm.
ON Variations: Where the fire chamber floor is elevated more than 150 mm above the hearth, the dimension of the hearth measured perpendicular to the plane of the fireplace opening shall be increased by not less than,(a) 50 mm for an elevation above 150 mm and not more than 300 mm, and (b) an additional 25 mm for every 50 mm in elevation above 300 mm.

ON Full: Air spaces required in Sentence (1) shall not be blocked by insulation, vapour barriers or air tight materials.
ON Variations: Air spaces required in Sentence (1) shall not be blocked by insulation, vapour barriers or air tight materials.

ON Full: Except as required by Sentence (7), combustible drain piping is permitted to penetrate a horizontal fire separation, provided it leads directly from a noncombustible water closet through a concrete floor slab and the piping is sealed at the penetration by a fire stop in conformance with Clause 3.1.9.1.(1)(a).
ON Variations: Except as required by Sentence (7), combustible drain piping is permitted to penetrate a horizontal fire separation, provided it leads directly from a noncombustible water closet through a concrete floor slab and the piping is sealed at the penetration by a fire stop in conformance with Clause 3.1.9.1.(1)(a).

ON Full: Voice communication systems that are not integrated with a fire alarm system shall be tested monthly in compliance with Sentences (2) and (3).
ON Variations: Voice communication systems that are not integrated with a fire alarm system shall be tested monthly in compliance with Sentences (2) and (3).

ON Full: Hot works or heating devices shall not be operated in storage yards.
ON Variations: Hot works or heating devices shall not be operated in storage yards.

ON Full: Once the pertinent indices and measurements referred to in Sentences (2) to (6) have been determined based on the type of construction, the apparent sound reduction index shall then be determined in accordance with ISO 15712-1, "Building Acoustics - Estimation of Acoustic Performance of Buildings From the Performance of Elements - Part 1: Airborne Sound Insulation Between Rooms".
ON Variations: Once the pertinent indices and measurements referred to in Sentences (2) to (6) have been determined based on the type of construction, the apparent sound reduction index shall then be determined in accordance with ISO 15712-1, "Building Acoustics - Estimation of Acoustic Performance of Buildings From the Performance of Elements - Part 1: Airborne Sound Insulation Between Rooms".

ON Full: The distance in Clause (6)(c) may be reduced to 15 m for a medium hazard industrial occupancy or a low hazard industrial occupancy if a firewall that has a fire-resistance rating not less than 2 h is provided between the storage facility and the building it exposes.
ON Variations: The distance in Clause (6)(c) may be reduced to 15 m for a medium hazard industrial occupancy or a low hazard industrial occupancy if a firewall that has a fire-resistance rating not less than 2 h is provided between the storage facility and the building it exposes.

ON Full: The thickness of wood strip flooring shall conform to Table 9.30.3.1.
ON Variations: The thickness of wood strip flooring shall conform to Table 9.30.3.1.

ON Full: Except as required by Sentence (5), the space above a mezzanine need not be considered as a storey in calculating the building height provided, the aggregate area of mezzanines that are not superimposed and do not meet the conditions of Sentence (3) does not exceed 10% of the floor area in which they are located, and the area of mezzanine in a suite does not exceed 10% of the area of that suite.
ON Variations: Except as required by Sentence (5), the space above a mezzanine need not be considered as a storey in calculating the building height provided, the aggregate area of mezzanines that are not superimposed and do not meet the conditions of Sentence (3) does not exceed 10% of the floor area in which they are located, and the area of mezzanine in a suite does not exceed 10% of the area of that suite.

ON Full: Eave protection shall conform to Subsection 9.26.5.
ON Variations: Eave protection shall conform to Subsection 9.26.5.

ON Full: Heavy timber and steel columns need not conform to the requirements of Sentence (1) provided the limiting distance is not less than 3 m.
ON Variations: Heavy timber and steel columns need not conform to the requirements of Sentence (1) provided the limiting distance is not less than 3 m.

ON Full: Where access to a building as required in Sentence (1) is provided by means of a roadway or yard, the design and location of such roadway or yard shall take into account connection with public thoroughfares, weight of firefighting equipment, width of roadway, radius of curves, overhead clearance, location of fire hydrants, location of fire department connections and vehicular parking.
ON Variations: Where access to a building as required in Sentence (1) is provided by means of a roadway or yard, the design and location of such roadway or yard shall take into account connection with public thoroughfares, weight of firefighting equipment, width of roadway, radius of curves, overhead clearance, location of fire hydrants, location of fire department connections and vehicular parking.

ON Full: If compliance with Clause (4)(b) is impracticable because of dimensional restrictions at the bottom of the public spa, the outlets may be located on two different planes of the public spa if, at least one of the outlets through which the public spa can be emptied to a full-size manifold is located on the bottom of the public spa, and the bottom of all outlets, other than skimmers, are not more than 75 mm from the floor of the public spa.
ON Variations: If compliance with Clause (4)(b) is impracticable because of dimensional restrictions at the bottom of the public spa, the outlets may be located on two different planes of the public spa if, at least one of the outlets through which the public spa can be emptied to a full-size manifold is located on the bottom of the public spa, and the bottom of all outlets, other than skimmers, are not more than 75 mm from the floor of the public spa.

ON Full: If a fire alarm system is required, smoke detectors shall be installed in, each sleeping room and each corridor serving as part of a means of egress from sleeping rooms in portions of a building classified as Group B major occupancy, each room in a contained use area and corridors serving those rooms, each corridor in portions of a building classified as Group A, Division 1 major occupancy, each public corridor in portions of a building classified as Group C major occupancy, each exit stair shaft, each corridor serving classrooms in elementary and secondary schools, and each elevator machine room or machinery space.
ON Variations: If a fire alarm system is required, smoke detectors shall be installed in, each sleeping room and each corridor serving as part of a means of egress from sleeping rooms in portions of a building classified as Group B major occupancy, each room in a contained use area and corridors serving those rooms, each corridor in portions of a building classified as Group A, Division 1 major occupancy, each public corridor in portions of a building classified as Group C major occupancy, each exit stair shaft, each corridor serving classrooms in elementary and secondary schools, and each elevator machine room or machinery space.

ON Full: Portable extinguishers having a gross weight of 18 kg or less shall be installed so that the top of the extinguisher is not more than 1.5 m above the floor.
ON Variations: Portable extinguishers having a gross weight of 18 kg or less shall be installed so that the top of the extinguisher is not more than 1.5 m above the floor.

ON Full: A potable water system that is directly connected to the heat transfer loop of a solar domestic hot water system that serves a residential occupancy within the scope of Part 9 shall be provided with a backflow preventer selected in accordance with CAN/CSA-F379.1, "Packaged Solar Domestic Hot Water Systems (Liquid-to-Liquid Heat for All-Season Use".
ON Variations: A potable water system that is directly connected to the heat transfer loop of a solar domestic hot water system that serves a residential occupancy within the scope of Part 9 shall be provided with a backflow preventer selected in accordance with CAN/CSA-F379.1, "Packaged Solar Domestic Hot Water Systems (Liquid-to-Liquid Heat for All-Season Use".

ON Full: Except as required in Articles 9.24.2.3. and 9.24.2.4., the size and spacing of steel studs for non-loadbearing interior walls shall conform to Table 9.24.2.1.
ON Variations: Except as required in Articles 9.24.2.3. and 9.24.2.4., the size and spacing of steel studs for non-loadbearing interior walls shall conform to Table 9.24.2.1.

ON Full: Stickered lumber piles, and piles of lumber and timber treated with combustible liquids shall not be stored beneath electrical power lines having a voltage in excess of 750 volts or that supply power to fire emergency systems.
ON Variations: Stickered lumber piles, and piles of lumber and timber treated with combustible liquids shall not be stored beneath electrical power lines having a voltage in excess of 750 volts or that supply power to fire emergency systems.

ON Full: Where an exit enclosure connects with a floor area through an enclosed vestibule or corridor separated from the floor area by fire separations having not less than a 45 min fire-resistance rating, the glazed areas described in Sentence (1) need not be limited as required in Sentence (2).
ON Variations: Where an exit enclosure connects with a floor area through an enclosed vestibule or corridor separated from the floor area by fire separations having not less than a 45 min fire-resistance rating, the glazed areas described in Sentence (1) need not be limited as required in Sentence (2).

ON Full: Openings through any guard that is required by Sentence (1) shall be of a size that will prevent the passage of a sphere having a diameter more than 100 mm unless it can be shown that the location and size of openings that exceed this limit do not represent a hazard.
ON Variations: Openings through any guard that is required by Sentence (1) shall be of a size that will prevent the passage of a sphere having a diameter more than 100 mm unless it can be shown that the location and size of openings that exceed this limit do not represent a hazard.

ON Full: If it is not possible to fill the connected underground storage tanks referred to in Sentence (1) simultaneously, or if the connected vents have a vapour recovery system, the vent piping shall be sized to accommodate the maximum vapour flow possible in the system.
ON Variations: If it is not possible to fill the connected underground storage tanks referred to in Sentence (1) simultaneously, or if the connected vents have a vapour recovery system, the vent piping shall be sized to accommodate the maximum vapour flow possible in the system.

ON Full: Where a pair of doors is installed in a corridor that provides access to exit in both directions, the doors shall,(a) swing in opposite directions, with the door on the right hand side swinging in the direction of exit travel, or (b) swing in both directions.
ON Variations: Where a pair of doors is installed in a corridor that provides access to exit in both directions, the doors shall,(a) swing in opposite directions, with the door on the right hand side swinging in the direction of exit travel, or (b) swing in both directions.

ON Full: Fire blocks required in Sentence (1) need not be provided, if,(a) the insulated wall assembly contains not more than one concealed air space and the horizontal thickness of that air space is not more than 25 mm, (b) the exposed construction materials within the space are noncombustible, or (c) the exposed construction materials within the space, including insulation, but not including wiring, piping or similar services, have a flame-spread rating of not more than 25.
ON Variations: Fire blocks required in Sentence (1) need not be provided, if,(a) the insulated wall assembly contains not more than one concealed air space and the horizontal thickness of that air space is not more than 25 mm, (b) the exposed construction materials within the space are noncombustible, or (c) the exposed construction materials within the space, including insulation, but not including wiring, piping or similar services, have a flame-spread rating of not more than 25.

ON Full: No open exterior stairway shall serve as a means of egress for residents above the second floor of a long-term care home.
ON Variations: No open exterior stairway shall serve as a means of egress for residents above the second floor of a long-term care home.

ON Full: If a fence is used, the fence shall be at least 1.8 m high and constructed to discourage climbing.
ON Variations: If a fence is used, the fence shall be at least 1.8 m high and constructed to discourage climbing.

ON Full: Except for fixture outlet pipes installed in conformance with Sentence 7.4.5.1.(3), the developed length of every fixture outlet pipe shall not exceed 1 200 mm.
ON Variations: Except for fixture outlet pipes installed in conformance with Sentence 7.4.5.1.(3), the developed length of every fixture outlet pipe shall not exceed 1 200 mm.

ON Full: Plastic pipe, fittings and solvent cement used inside or under a building in a sanitary drainage system or venting system shall be certified to,(a) ASTM F628, "Acrylonitrile-Butadiene-Styrene (ABS) Schedule 40 Plastic Drain, Waste, and Vent Pipe With a Cellular Core", (b) CAN/CSA-B181.1, "Acrylonitrile-Butadiene-Styrene (ABS) Drain, Waste, and Vent Pipe and Pipe Fittings", or (c) CAN/CSA-B181.2, "Polyvinylchloride (PVC) and Chlorinated Polyvinylchloride (CPVC) Drain, Waste, and Vent Pipe and Pipe Fittings".
ON Variations: Plastic pipe, fittings and solvent cement used inside or under a building in a sanitary drainage system or venting system shall be certified to,(a) ASTM F628, "Acrylonitrile-Butadiene-Styrene (ABS) Schedule 40 Plastic Drain, Waste, and Vent Pipe With a Cellular Core", (b) CAN/CSA-B181.1, "Acrylonitrile-Butadiene-Styrene (ABS) Drain, Waste, and Vent Pipe and Pipe Fittings", or (c) CAN/CSA-B181.2, "Polyvinylchloride (PVC) and Chlorinated Polyvinylchloride (CPVC) Drain, Waste, and Vent Pipe and Pipe Fittings".

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentences (2) and (3), outlet boxes are permitted to penetrate the membrane of an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating, provided they are sealed at the penetration by a fire stop that has an FT rating not less than the fire-resistance rating of the fire separation when subjected to the fire test method in CAN/ULC-S115, "Fire Tests of Firestop Systems".
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentences (2) and (3), outlet boxes are permitted to penetrate the membrane of an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating, provided they are sealed at the penetration by a fire stop that has an FT rating not less than the fire-resistance rating of the fire separation when subjected to the fire test method in CAN/ULC-S115, "Fire Tests of Firestop Systems".

ON Full: If during construction, climatic or any other conditions have changed the properties of the soil, rock or groundwater, the design shall be reassessed by the designer.
ON Variations: If during construction, climatic or any other conditions have changed the properties of the soil, rock or groundwater, the design shall be reassessed by the designer.

ON Full: Except for egress doorways described in Sentence 3.3.2.3.(4), an exit sign conforming to Sentences (2) to (6) shall be placed over or adjacent to every egress doorway from rooms with an occupant load more than 60 in Group A, Division 1 occupancies, dance halls, licensed beverage establishments and other similar occupancies that, when occupied, have lighting levels below the level that would provide easy identification of the egress doorway.
ON Variations: Except for egress doorways described in Sentence 3.3.2.3.(4), an exit sign conforming to Sentences (2) to (6) shall be placed over or adjacent to every egress doorway from rooms with an occupant load more than 60 in Group A, Division 1 occupancies, dance halls, licensed beverage establishments and other similar occupancies that, when occupied, have lighting levels below the level that would provide easy identification of the egress doorway.

ON Full: Visual signal devices permitted by Sentence 3.2.4.19.(5) shall be installed so that the signal from at least one device is visible throughout the compartment in which they are installed. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Visual signal devices permitted by Sentence 3.2.4.19.(5) shall be installed so that the signal from at least one device is visible throughout the compartment in which they are installed. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Except where otherwise stated in this Part, this Section shall not apply to the following: tubing or casings and piping for oil or gas wells, transmission pipelines, piping for vehicles, aircraft, watercraft and portable or stationary engines, piping systems in fuel dispensing stations and distilleries, and piping within the scope of the applicable provincial boiler and pressure vessel codes.
ON Variations: Except where otherwise stated in this Part, this Section shall not apply to the following: tubing or casings and piping for oil or gas wells, transmission pipelines, piping for vehicles, aircraft, watercraft and portable or stationary engines, piping systems in fuel dispensing stations and distilleries, and piping within the scope of the applicable provincial boiler and pressure vessel codes.

ON Full: Material shall not be placed nor shall equipment be operated or placed in or adjacent to an excavation in a manner that may endanger the integrity of the excavation or its supports.
ON Variations: Material shall not be placed nor shall equipment be operated or placed in or adjacent to an excavation in a manner that may endanger the integrity of the excavation or its supports.

ON Full: A cleanout shall be provided to serve vertical drainage piping from a wall hung urinal and shall extend above the flood level rim of the fixture.
ON Variations: A cleanout shall be provided to serve vertical drainage piping from a wall hung urinal and shall extend above the flood level rim of the fixture.

ON Full: When unstable liquids are stored, the effects of heat or gas resulting from polymerization, decomposition, condensation or self-reactivity shall be included in the determination of the total venting capacity.
ON Variations: When unstable liquids are stored, the effects of heat or gas resulting from polymerization, decomposition, condensation or self-reactivity shall be included in the determination of the total venting capacity.

ON Full: Every grease interceptor shall have a vent pipe that is not less than 1½ in. in size connected to the outlet pipe, that connects to the plumbing venting system.
ON Variations: Every grease interceptor shall have a vent pipe that is not less than 1½ in. in size connected to the outlet pipe, that connects to the plumbing venting system.

ON Full: Except as permitted by Sentence (5), combustible sprinkler piping may be located above a ceiling, provided that the distance between the edge of any ceiling opening that is not protected in conformance with Sentence (3) and the nearest sprinkler is not more than 300 mm.
ON Variations: Except as permitted by Sentence (5), combustible sprinkler piping may be located above a ceiling, provided that the distance between the edge of any ceiling opening that is not protected in conformance with Sentence (3) and the nearest sprinkler is not more than 300 mm.

ON Full: Storage areas described in Article 4.2.7.1. shall be ventilated in conformance with Subsection 4.1.7.
ON Variations: Storage areas described in Article 4.2.7.1. shall be ventilated in conformance with Subsection 4.1.7.

ON Full: Except as permitted by Article 3.2.2.16., the building referred to in Sentence (1) shall be of noncombustible construction, and, except as permitted by Sentence (3), floor assemblies shall be fire separations with a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, mezzanines shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, and loadbearing walls, columns and arches shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the supported assembly.
ON Variations: Except as permitted by Article 3.2.2.16., the building referred to in Sentence (1) shall be of noncombustible construction, and, except as permitted by Sentence (3), floor assemblies shall be fire separations with a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, mezzanines shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, and loadbearing walls, columns and arches shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the supported assembly.

ON Full: Piping shall be supported on pipe hangers or other supports so that allowable stresses in the pipe are not exceeded.
ON Variations: Piping shall be supported on pipe hangers or other supports so that allowable stresses in the pipe are not exceeded.

ON Full: When installed beneath jointed masonry window sills and jointed masonry copings or over the heads of openings, flashing shall extend from the front edge of the masonry up behind the sill or lintel.
ON Variations: When installed beneath jointed masonry window sills and jointed masonry copings or over the heads of openings, flashing shall extend from the front edge of the masonry up behind the sill or lintel.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentences (2) to (7), each exposing building face and any exterior wall located above an exposing building face that encloses an attic or roof space shall be constructed in conformance with Table 9.10.14.5. and Subsection 9.10.8.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentences (2) to (7), each exposing building face and any exterior wall located above an exposing building face that encloses an attic or roof space shall be constructed in conformance with Table 9.10.14.5. and Subsection 9.10.8.

ON Full: Cladding or sheathing, and interior finish shall be installed on steel stud framing and shall be fastened with screws,(a) spaced at the appropriate spacing described in Section 9.29., and (b) penetrating not less than 10 mm through the metal.
ON Variations: Cladding or sheathing, and interior finish shall be installed on steel stud framing and shall be fastened with screws,(a) spaced at the appropriate spacing described in Section 9.29., and (b) penetrating not less than 10 mm through the metal.

ON Full: Screws for fastening gypsum board to wood supports shall conform to ASTM C1002, "Steel Self-Piercing Tapping Screws for the Application of Gypsum Panel Products or Metal Plaster Bases to Wood Studs or Steel Studs".
ON Variations: Screws for fastening gypsum board to wood supports shall conform to ASTM C1002, "Steel Self-Piercing Tapping Screws for the Application of Gypsum Panel Products or Metal Plaster Bases to Wood Studs or Steel Studs".

ON Full: Internal combustion engine fire pumps shall be operated once a week for a sufficient time to bring the engine up to normal operating temperature.
ON Variations: Internal combustion engine fire pumps shall be operated once a week for a sufficient time to bring the engine up to normal operating temperature.

ON Full: Wood lattice or skirting around porches shall be separated from piers and soil by at least 50 mm.
ON Variations: Wood lattice or skirting around porches shall be separated from piers and soil by at least 50 mm.

ON Full: This Subsection applies to care occupancies, care and treatment occupancies and detention occupancies. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: This Subsection applies to care occupancies, care and treatment occupancies and detention occupancies. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentences (2), (3), (4) and (6), all guards shall be not less than 1 070 mm high.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentences (2), (3), (4) and (6), all guards shall be not less than 1 070 mm high.

ON Full: Hydrants shall be located in the access routes required in Sentence (2) so that, for a building provided with a fire department connection for a standpipe system or a sprinkler system, a fire department pumper vehicle can be located adjacent to a hydrant, and the unobstructed path of travel for the firefighter from the vehicle to the fire department connection is not more than 45 m, and for a building that is not sprinklered, a fire department pumper vehicle can be located in the access route so that the unobstructed path of travel for the firefighter is not more than, 45 m from the hydrant to the vehicle, and 45 m from the vehicle to every opening in the building.
ON Variations: Hydrants shall be located in the access routes required in Sentence (2) so that, for a building provided with a fire department connection for a standpipe system or a sprinkler system, a fire department pumper vehicle can be located adjacent to a hydrant, and the unobstructed path of travel for the firefighter from the vehicle to the fire department connection is not more than 45 m, and for a building that is not sprinklered, a fire department pumper vehicle can be located in the access route so that the unobstructed path of travel for the firefighter is not more than, 45 m from the hydrant to the vehicle, and 45 m from the vehicle to every opening in the building.

ON Full: A glass door shall be constructed of, laminated or tempered safety glass conforming to CAN/CGSB-12.1-M, "Tempered or Laminated Safety Glass", or wired glass conforming to CAN/CGSB-12.11-M, "Wired Safety Glass".
ON Variations: A glass door shall be constructed of, laminated or tempered safety glass conforming to CAN/CGSB-12.1-M, "Tempered or Laminated Safety Glass", or wired glass conforming to CAN/CGSB-12.11-M, "Wired Safety Glass".

ON Full: The height of piers described in Sentence (2) shall not exceed 3 times their least dimension at the base of the pier.
ON Variations: The height of piers described in Sentence (2) shall not exceed 3 times their least dimension at the base of the pier.

ON Full: During periods when demolition operations create a fire hazard to parts of the building not under demolition or to neighbouring occupied spaces or neighbouring properties, a firewatch shall be conducted.
ON Variations: During periods when demolition operations create a fire hazard to parts of the building not under demolition or to neighbouring occupied spaces or neighbouring properties, a firewatch shall be conducted.

ON Full: Where cladding materials or systems other than those described in Sentences (1) to (5) are installed, or where these are installed on substrates other than those identified in Sentences (1) to (5), the cladding materials or systems and their installation shall comply with Part 5.
ON Variations: Where cladding materials or systems other than those described in Sentences (1) to (5) are installed, or where these are installed on substrates other than those identified in Sentences (1) to (5), the cladding materials or systems and their installation shall comply with Part 5.

ON Full: The size of aggregate in unreinforced site-batched concrete mixes referred to in Sentence (1) shall not exceed,(a) 1/5 the distance between the sides of vertical forms, or (b) 1/3 the thickness of flatwork.
ON Variations: The size of aggregate in unreinforced site-batched concrete mixes referred to in Sentence (1) shall not exceed,(a) 1/5 the distance between the sides of vertical forms, or (b) 1/3 the thickness of flatwork.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (3), exterior stairs, ramps, landings, handrails and guards serving a single dwelling unit shall conform to the applicable requirements in Section 9.8. and Sentence 3.1.20.1.(1).
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (3), exterior stairs, ramps, landings, handrails and guards serving a single dwelling unit shall conform to the applicable requirements in Section 9.8. and Sentence 3.1.20.1.(1).

ON Full: Except for hotels, a door opening onto a public corridor that provides access to exit from suites shall be designed not to lock automatically when such doors are equipped with an automatic self-closing device.
ON Variations: Except for hotels, a door opening onto a public corridor that provides access to exit from suites shall be designed not to lock automatically when such doors are equipped with an automatic self-closing device.

ON Full: For concrete block walls required to be reinforced, a continuous horizontal bond beam containing at least one 15M bar shall be installed, (a) along the top of the wall, (b) at the sill and head of all openings greater than 1.2 m in width, and (c) at structurally connected floors.
ON Variations: For concrete block walls required to be reinforced, a continuous horizontal bond beam containing at least one 15M bar shall be installed, (a) along the top of the wall, (b) at the sill and head of all openings greater than 1.2 m in width, and (c) at structurally connected floors.

ON Full: Emergency lighting on walkways, platforms, unenclosed egress stairs and exits providing means of egress shall conform to not less than, the illumination level in Sentences 3.2.7.3.(2) and (3), and the duration in Sentence 3.2.7.4.(1).
ON Variations: Emergency lighting on walkways, platforms, unenclosed egress stairs and exits providing means of egress shall conform to not less than, the illumination level in Sentences 3.2.7.3.(2) and (3), and the duration in Sentence 3.2.7.4.(1).

ON Full: Lint traps in laundry equipment shall be cleaned to prevent the accumulation of lint that creates an undue fire hazard.
ON Variations: Lint traps in laundry equipment shall be cleaned to prevent the accumulation of lint that creates an undue fire hazard.

ON Full: A Class 5 sewage system may be installed in the following circumstances:(a) where the proposed use of the sewage system is for a temporary operation, excluding seasonal recreational use, not exceeding 12 months in duration, (b) to remedy an unsafe sewage system where the remediation of the unsafe condition by the installation of a Class 4 sewage system is impracticable, (c) to upgrade a sewage system serving an existing building, where upgrading through the use of a Class 4 sewage system is not possible due to lot size, site slope or clearance limitations, or (d) as an interim measure for a lot or parcel of land until municipal sewers are available, provided that the municipality undertakes to ensure the continued operation of an approved hauled sewage system until the municipal sewers are available.
ON Variations: A Class 5 sewage system may be installed in the following circumstances:(a) where the proposed use of the sewage system is for a temporary operation, excluding seasonal recreational use, not exceeding 12 months in duration, (b) to remedy an unsafe sewage system where the remediation of the unsafe condition by the installation of a Class 4 sewage system is impracticable, (c) to upgrade a sewage system serving an existing building, where upgrading through the use of a Class 4 sewage system is not possible due to lot size, site slope or clearance limitations, or (d) as an interim measure for a lot or parcel of land until municipal sewers are available, provided that the municipality undertakes to ensure the continued operation of an approved hauled sewage system until the municipal sewers are available.

ON Full: The classification of an existing building of multiple occupancy under Article 11.2.1.1. shall be applied according to Articles 3.2.2.5. to 3.2.2.8.
ON Variations: The classification of an existing building of multiple occupancy under Article 11.2.1.1. shall be applied according to Articles 3.2.2.5. to 3.2.2.8.

ON Full: A drinking water treatment system or device shall be certified to CAN/CSA-B483.1, "Drinking Water Treatment Systems".
ON Variations: A drinking water treatment system or device shall be certified to CAN/CSA-B483.1, "Drinking Water Treatment Systems".

ON Full: Flashing shall be installed in masonry and masonry veneer walls,(a) beneath jointed masonry window sills, (b) over the back and top of parapet walls, (c) over the heads of glass block panels, (d) beneath weep holes, and (e) over the heads of window and door openings in exterior walls when the vertical distance between the top of a window or door frame and the bottom edge of the eave exceeds one-quarter of the horizontal eave overhang.
ON Variations: Flashing shall be installed in masonry and masonry veneer walls,(a) beneath jointed masonry window sills, (b) over the back and top of parapet walls, (c) over the heads of glass block panels, (d) beneath weep holes, and (e) over the heads of window and door openings in exterior walls when the vertical distance between the top of a window or door frame and the bottom edge of the eave exceeds one-quarter of the horizontal eave overhang.

ON Full: All flooring in storage areas shall be of noncombustible materials.
ON Variations: All flooring in storage areas shall be of noncombustible materials.

ON Full: Where a fire alarm system is required in a hotel, heat detectors shall be installed in every room in a suite and in every room not located in a suite in a floor area containing a hotel, other than washrooms within a suite, saunas, refrigerated areas and swimming pools.
ON Variations: Where a fire alarm system is required in a hotel, heat detectors shall be installed in every room in a suite and in every room not located in a suite in a floor area containing a hotel, other than washrooms within a suite, saunas, refrigerated areas and swimming pools.

ON Full: Asbestos shall not be used in heating, ventilating or air-conditioning systems or equipment.
ON Variations: Asbestos shall not be used in heating, ventilating or air-conditioning systems or equipment.

ON Full: A visual inspection shall be made at least once during each day of operation of all aboveground piping systems, pumps and other ancillary equipment, to detect leakage, and any such leakage shall be repaired as quickly as practical.
ON Variations: A visual inspection shall be made at least once during each day of operation of all aboveground piping systems, pumps and other ancillary equipment, to detect leakage, and any such leakage shall be repaired as quickly as practical.

ON Full: For irregular structures requiring dynamic analysis in accordance with Article 4.1.8.7., Vd shall be taken as the larger of the Vd determined in Sentence (7) and 100% of V.
ON Variations: For irregular structures requiring dynamic analysis in accordance with Article 4.1.8.7., Vd shall be taken as the larger of the Vd determined in Sentence (7) and 100% of V.

ON Full: The outer course of the application referred to in Sentence (1) shall be fastened to the lath with nails of sufficient length to penetrate through the lath.
ON Variations: The outer course of the application referred to in Sentence (1) shall be fastened to the lath with nails of sufficient length to penetrate through the lath.

ON Full: Doors within dwelling units, other than vehicle garage doors, need not conform to Sentences (1) and (2).
ON Variations: Doors within dwelling units, other than vehicle garage doors, need not conform to Sentences (1) and (2).

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (4), the energy efficiency of a building or part of a building of residential occupancy that is within the scope of Part 9 and is intended for occupancy on a continuing basis during the winter months shall,(a) be designed to exceed by not less than 15% the energy efficiency levels required by Sentence 12.2.1.1.(3), or (b) conform to Chapters 1 and 3 of MMA Supplementary Standard SB-12, "Energy Efficiency for Housing".
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (4), the energy efficiency of a building or part of a building of residential occupancy that is within the scope of Part 9 and is intended for occupancy on a continuing basis during the winter months shall,(a) be designed to exceed by not less than 15% the energy efficiency levels required by Sentence 12.2.1.1.(3), or (b) conform to Chapters 1 and 3 of MMA Supplementary Standard SB-12, "Energy Efficiency for Housing".

ON Full: Unit masonry columns shall be built of masonry units,(a) conforming to CSA A165.1, "Concrete Block Masonry Units", and (b) having a compressive strength over the net area of the block of not less than 15 MPa.
ON Variations: Unit masonry columns shall be built of masonry units,(a) conforming to CSA A165.1, "Concrete Block Masonry Units", and (b) having a compressive strength over the net area of the block of not less than 15 MPa.

ON Full: Except as required in Sentence (7), every exit door shall have an exit sign placed over it or adjacent to it if the exit serves,(a) a building that is 3 storeys in building height, (b) a building having an occupant load of more than 150, or (c) a room or floor area that has a fire escape as part of a required means of egress.
ON Variations: Except as required in Sentence (7), every exit door shall have an exit sign placed over it or adjacent to it if the exit serves,(a) a building that is 3 storeys in building height, (b) a building having an occupant load of more than 150, or (c) a room or floor area that has a fire escape as part of a required means of egress.

ON Full: Transition solvent cement shall only be used for joining an ABS plumbing system to a PVC plumbing system.
ON Variations: Transition solvent cement shall only be used for joining an ABS plumbing system to a PVC plumbing system.

ON Full: Sentences (2) and (3) do not apply to a fixture located in an existing building where the chief building official is satisfied that compliance with the requirement is impracticable because of maintenance or operational difficulties. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Sentences (2) and (3) do not apply to a fixture located in an existing building where the chief building official is satisfied that compliance with the requirement is impracticable because of maintenance or operational difficulties. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Electrical equipment within the spraying area, including lighting fixtures, shall conform to Part 1, Sections 18 and 20 of the Electrical Safety Code made under the Electricity Act, 1998.
ON Variations: Electrical equipment within the spraying area, including lighting fixtures, shall conform to Part 1, Sections 18 and 20 of the Electrical Safety Code made under the Electricity Act, 1998.

ON Full: The water closet and lavatory provided in the universal washroom described in Sentence 3.8.3.12.(1) may be counted as part of the plumbing fixtures required for males and females in this Subsection if, more than one water closet is required for males, and more than one water closet is required for females.
ON Variations: The water closet and lavatory provided in the universal washroom described in Sentence 3.8.3.12.(1) may be counted as part of the plumbing fixtures required for males and females in this Subsection if, more than one water closet is required for males, and more than one water closet is required for females.

ON Full: Where there is a change of direction greater than 45° in a sanitary building drain or a sanitary building sewer, a cleanout shall be installed at each change in direction.
ON Variations: Where there is a change of direction greater than 45° in a sanitary building drain or a sanitary building sewer, a cleanout shall be installed at each change in direction.

ON Full: The requirement for hose rack and fire hose in Sentence 3.2.9.4.(2) does not apply in a rapid transit station.
ON Variations: The requirement for hose rack and fire hose in Sentence 3.2.9.4.(2) does not apply in a rapid transit station.

ON Full: A check valve shall be installed at the building end of the water service pipe where the pipe is made of plastic that is suitable for cold water use only. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: A check valve shall be installed at the building end of the water service pipe where the pipe is made of plastic that is suitable for cold water use only. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: A strip of material similar to that described in Sentence (1) not less than 450 mm wide shall be interlayed between each course of shakes with the bottom edge of the strip positioned above the butt line at a distance equal to double the exposure of the shakes.
ON Variations: A strip of material similar to that described in Sentence (1) not less than 450 mm wide shall be interlayed between each course of shakes with the bottom edge of the strip positioned above the butt line at a distance equal to double the exposure of the shakes.

ON Full: Activities that create a hazard and that are not allowed for in the original design shall not be carried out in a building unless approved provisions are made to control the hazard.
ON Variations: Activities that create a hazard and that are not allowed for in the original design shall not be carried out in a building unless approved provisions are made to control the hazard.

ON Full: The horizontal distance between the centre line of a diving board or diving platform and the vertical projection of the closest side or any ledge on the closest side of a public pool shall be at least, 3 m, where a diving board or diving platform is 1 000 mm or less in height above the water surface, and 3.6 m, where a diving board or diving platform is greater than 1 000 mm in height above the water surface.
ON Variations: The horizontal distance between the centre line of a diving board or diving platform and the vertical projection of the closest side or any ledge on the closest side of a public pool shall be at least, 3 m, where a diving board or diving platform is 1 000 mm or less in height above the water surface, and 3.6 m, where a diving board or diving platform is greater than 1 000 mm in height above the water surface.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentences (4) and (5), where a building drain or a branch may be subject to backflow,(a) a backwater valve shall be installed on every fixture drain connected to it when the fixture is located below the level of the adjoining street, or (b) a backwater valve shall be installed to protect fixtures which are below the upstream sanitary manhole cover when a residential building is served by a public sanitary sewer.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentences (4) and (5), where a building drain or a branch may be subject to backflow,(a) a backwater valve shall be installed on every fixture drain connected to it when the fixture is located below the level of the adjoining street, or (b) a backwater valve shall be installed to protect fixtures which are below the upstream sanitary manhole cover when a residential building is served by a public sanitary sewer.

ON Full: Ceiling joists referred to in Sentence (5) shall be fastened together with at least one more nail per joist splice than required for the rafter to joist connection shown in Table 9.23.13.8.
ON Variations: Ceiling joists referred to in Sentence (5) shall be fastened together with at least one more nail per joist splice than required for the rafter to joist connection shown in Table 9.23.13.8.

ON Full: Openable windows used for the venting required by Sentence (1) shall be permanently marked so that they are easily identifiable.
ON Variations: Openable windows used for the venting required by Sentence (1) shall be permanently marked so that they are easily identifiable.
