ON Full: Floor assemblies for which no fire-resistance rating is required by Subsection 9.10.8. and floors of mezzanines not required to be counted as storeys in Articles 9.10.4.1. and 9.10.4.2. need not be constructed as fire separations.
ON Variations: Floor assemblies for which no fire-resistance rating is required by Subsection 9.10.8. and floors of mezzanines not required to be counted as storeys in Articles 9.10.4.1. and 9.10.4.2. need not be constructed as fire separations.

ON Full: The flanking sound reduction index for each flanking path at each edge of the separating assembly shall be determined in accordance with Clause (a), (b) or (c), depending on the type of construction:(a) for a lightweight separating wall or floor assembly with wood or steel framing and connected lightweight flanking assemblies with wood or steel framing, the index shall be taken as equal to the normalized flanking level difference re-normalized for the ASTC field situation in accordance with Annex F of ISO 15712-1, "Building Acoustics - Estimation of Acoustic Performance of Buildings From the Performance of Elements - Part 1: Airborne Sound Insulation Between Rooms", (b) for a heavyweight separating wall or floor assembly of concrete or masonry and connected flanking assemblies of concrete or masonry, the index shall be determined in accordance with the detailed method for structure-borne transmission presented in ISO 15712-1, "Building Acoustics - Estimation of Acoustic Performance of Buildings From the Performance of Elements - Part 1: Airborne Sound Insulation Between Rooms", (c) for a mixture of lightweight framed assemblies and heavyweight concrete or masonry assemblies, the index shall be determined in accordance with Clause (a) or (b).
ON Variations: The flanking sound reduction index for each flanking path at each edge of the separating assembly shall be determined in accordance with Clause (a), (b) or (c), depending on the type of construction:(a) for a lightweight separating wall or floor assembly with wood or steel framing and connected lightweight flanking assemblies with wood or steel framing, the index shall be taken as equal to the normalized flanking level difference re-normalized for the ASTC field situation in accordance with Annex F of ISO 15712-1, "Building Acoustics - Estimation of Acoustic Performance of Buildings From the Performance of Elements - Part 1: Airborne Sound Insulation Between Rooms", (b) for a heavyweight separating wall or floor assembly of concrete or masonry and connected flanking assemblies of concrete or masonry, the index shall be determined in accordance with the detailed method for structure-borne transmission presented in ISO 15712-1, "Building Acoustics - Estimation of Acoustic Performance of Buildings From the Performance of Elements - Part 1: Airborne Sound Insulation Between Rooms", (c) for a mixture of lightweight framed assemblies and heavyweight concrete or masonry assemblies, the index shall be determined in accordance with Clause (a) or (b).

ON Full: The isolation system shall be configured to produce a restoring force such that the lateral force at the TDD at the centre of mass of the isolated structure above the isolation interface is at least 0.025Wb greater than the lateral force at 50% of the TDD at the same location, in each horizontal direction, where Wb is the portion of W above the isolation interface.
ON Variations: The isolation system shall be configured to produce a restoring force such that the lateral force at the TDD at the centre of mass of the isolated structure above the isolation interface is at least 0.025Wb greater than the lateral force at 50% of the TDD at the same location, in each horizontal direction, where Wb is the portion of W above the isolation interface.

ON Full: The requirement in Clause (1)(a) is considered to be met where the wires and cables exhibit a flame-spread of not more than 1.5 m, a smoke density of not more than 0.5 at peak optical density and a smoke density not more than 0.15 at average optical density when tested in conformance with the Flame and Smoke Test in the Appendix to CSA C22.2 No. 0.3, "Test Methods for Electrical Wires and Cables", (FT6 Rating).
ON Variations: The requirement in Clause (1)(a) is considered to be met where the wires and cables exhibit a flame-spread of not more than 1.5 m, a smoke density of not more than 0.5 at peak optical density and a smoke density not more than 0.15 at average optical density when tested in conformance with the Flame and Smoke Test in the Appendix to CSA C22.2 No. 0.3, "Test Methods for Electrical Wires and Cables", (FT6 Rating).

ON Full: The distance between buildings shall be not less than 9 m.
ON Variations: The distance between buildings shall be not less than 9 m.

ON Full: The design and construction of a building or part of a building intended for the storage of dangerous goods classified as explosives shall conform to the Explosives Act (Canada) and the regulations made under that Act.
ON Variations: The design and construction of a building or part of a building intended for the storage of dangerous goods classified as explosives shall conform to the Explosives Act (Canada) and the regulations made under that Act.

ON Full: Factory-built fireplaces and their installation shall conform to CAN/ULC-S610-M, "Factory-Built Fireplaces".
ON Variations: Factory-built fireplaces and their installation shall conform to CAN/ULC-S610-M, "Factory-Built Fireplaces".

ON Full: The total daily design flow for a Class 2 sewage system shall be calculated based on the fixtures discharging to the system as follows:(a) 200 L per fixture unit where there is a supply of pressurized water, and (b) 125 L per fixture unit where there is no supply of pressurized water.
ON Variations: The total daily design flow for a Class 2 sewage system shall be calculated based on the fixtures discharging to the system as follows:(a) 200 L per fixture unit where there is a supply of pressurized water, and (b) 125 L per fixture unit where there is no supply of pressurized water.

ON Full: Fill pipes referred to in Sentence (2) shall be installed in such a way as to minimize vibration of the pipe.
ON Variations: Fill pipes referred to in Sentence (2) shall be installed in such a way as to minimize vibration of the pipe.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (2), an exhaust ventilation system designed in conformance with the appropriate requirements of Part 6 shall be provided in a building or part of a building in which dust, fumes, gases, vapour or other impurities or contaminants have the potential to create a fire or explosion hazard.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (2), an exhaust ventilation system designed in conformance with the appropriate requirements of Part 6 shall be provided in a building or part of a building in which dust, fumes, gases, vapour or other impurities or contaminants have the potential to create a fire or explosion hazard.

ON Full: If a fire alarm system in a building is required by Sentence 3.2.4.9.(1) to have an annunciator, valves controlling water supplies in a standpipe system, other than hose valves, shall be electrically supervised in accordance with Sentence 3.2.4.10.(2).
ON Variations: If a fire alarm system in a building is required by Sentence 3.2.4.9.(1) to have an annunciator, valves controlling water supplies in a standpipe system, other than hose valves, shall be electrically supervised in accordance with Sentence 3.2.4.10.(2).

ON Full: Screwed malleable iron water fittings shall not be used in a drainage system.
ON Variations: Screwed malleable iron water fittings shall not be used in a drainage system.

ON Full: Insulation shall not be placed in building roof-ceiling or floor-ceiling assemblies, as described in Parts 3 and 9 of Division B of the Building Code, where the assemblies are required to have a fire-resistance rating unless the insulation does not reduce the fire-resistance rating of the assemblies.
ON Variations: Insulation shall not be placed in building roof-ceiling or floor-ceiling assemblies, as described in Parts 3 and 9 of Division B of the Building Code, where the assemblies are required to have a fire-resistance rating unless the insulation does not reduce the fire-resistance rating of the assemblies.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentences (2) and (3), welded and seamless steel pipe shall not be used in a plumbing system.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentences (2) and (3), welded and seamless steel pipe shall not be used in a plumbing system.

ON Full: A Group F, Division 2 major occupancy is permitted in a building containing only live/work units if the occupancy is for the exclusive use of the occupants of the live/work units.
ON Variations: A Group F, Division 2 major occupancy is permitted in a building containing only live/work units if the occupancy is for the exclusive use of the occupants of the live/work units.

ON Full: Where a wall-hung telephone is provided above the shelf or counter section described in Sentence (3), it shall be located so that the receiver and coin or card slot are not more than 1 200 mm from the finished floor.
ON Variations: Where a wall-hung telephone is provided above the shelf or counter section described in Sentence (3), it shall be located so that the receiver and coin or card slot are not more than 1 200 mm from the finished floor.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentences (2) and (3), turnstiles, checkout counters, railings or barriers shall not obstruct the exits or access to exits from any room, floor area or storey.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentences (2) and (3), turnstiles, checkout counters, railings or barriers shall not obstruct the exits or access to exits from any room, floor area or storey.

ON Full: All ventilation openings shall be protected in conformance with Sentences 6.2.3.12.(3) and (4) and the protection shall be installed in such a manner that it cannot be removed from the outside by the use of common tools and it is tamperproof.
ON Variations: All ventilation openings shall be protected in conformance with Sentences 6.2.3.12.(3) and (4) and the protection shall be installed in such a manner that it cannot be removed from the outside by the use of common tools and it is tamperproof.

ON Full: Despite Sentences (1) to (5), the aggregate width of exits and access to exits shall be provided.
ON Variations: Despite Sentences (1) to (5), the aggregate width of exits and access to exits shall be provided.

ON Full: Where loadbearing interior walls are not finished in accordance with Sentence (2), blocking or strapping shall be fastened to the studs at mid-height to prevent sideways buckling.
ON Variations: Where loadbearing interior walls are not finished in accordance with Sentence (2), blocking or strapping shall be fastened to the studs at mid-height to prevent sideways buckling.

ON Full: A fold-down grab bar described in Clause (3)(b) or (4)(a) shall, be mounted on the wall behind the water closet, with the horizontal component 750 mm above the finished floor, and not less than 390 mm and not more than 410 mm from the centre line of the water closet, not require a force of more than 22.2 N to pull it down, be at least 750 mm in length, be installed to resist a load of at least 1.3 kN applied vertically or horizontally, be not less than 30 mm and not more than 40 mm in diameter, and have a slip-resistant surface. (See A-3.8.3.8.(3) and A-3.8.3.8.(8) in Appendix A.)
ON Variations: A fold-down grab bar described in Clause (3)(b) or (4)(a) shall, be mounted on the wall behind the water closet, with the horizontal component 750 mm above the finished floor, and not less than 390 mm and not more than 410 mm from the centre line of the water closet, not require a force of more than 22.2 N to pull it down, be at least 750 mm in length, be installed to resist a load of at least 1.3 kN applied vertically or horizontally, be not less than 30 mm and not more than 40 mm in diameter, and have a slip-resistant surface. (See A-3.8.3.8.(3) and A-3.8.3.8.(8) in Appendix A.)

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentences (2) to (4), a laboratory shall conform with the requirements of Section 2.8.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentences (2) to (4), a laboratory shall conform with the requirements of Section 2.8.

ON Full: Except as permitted by Clause (c) and Article 3.2.2.16., the building referred to in Sentence (1) shall be of noncombustible construction, and, floor assemblies shall be fire separations with a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, mezzanines shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, and loadbearing walls, columns and arches shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the supported assembly, except that arches are permitted to be of heavy timber construction.
ON Variations: Except as permitted by Clause (c) and Article 3.2.2.16., the building referred to in Sentence (1) shall be of noncombustible construction, and, floor assemblies shall be fire separations with a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, mezzanines shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, and loadbearing walls, columns and arches shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the supported assembly, except that arches are permitted to be of heavy timber construction.

ON Full: Two or more heat recovery ventilators shall not be connected in parallel air flow to a common air supply duct unless specifically recommended by the manufacturer.
ON Variations: Two or more heat recovery ventilators shall not be connected in parallel air flow to a common air supply duct unless specifically recommended by the manufacturer.

ON Full: Except for a shallow buried trench, the distribution pipe within a leaching chamber shall be not less than 3 in. trade size for dosed systems.
ON Variations: Except for a shallow buried trench, the distribution pipe within a leaching chamber shall be not less than 3 in. trade size for dosed systems.

ON Full: The maximum travel distance on an elevated platform to the ground floor level, including the travel distance along unenclosed stairs, shall not exceed 45 m.
ON Variations: The maximum travel distance on an elevated platform to the ground floor level, including the travel distance along unenclosed stairs, shall not exceed 45 m.

ON Full: Subject to Sentences (2) and (3), this Subsection applies to the indoor general storage of combustible solids, noncombustible solids with combustible packaging or storage aids, including storage in bin boxes, shelves or racks.
ON Variations: Subject to Sentences (2) and (3), this Subsection applies to the indoor general storage of combustible solids, noncombustible solids with combustible packaging or storage aids, including storage in bin boxes, shelves or racks.

ON Full: Tents not occupied by the public need not be separated from one another, and are permitted to be erected less than 3 m from other structures on the same property, where such closer spacing does not create a hazard to the public.
ON Variations: Tents not occupied by the public need not be separated from one another, and are permitted to be erected less than 3 m from other structures on the same property, where such closer spacing does not create a hazard to the public.

ON Full: The flame-spread rating limits specified in Sentences (1) to (3) apply to occupancies in the corridor as well as to the corridor itself.
ON Variations: The flame-spread rating limits specified in Sentences (1) to (3) apply to occupancies in the corridor as well as to the corridor itself.

ON Full: The requirements of Sentence (3) do not apply if, there are not more than seven seats between any seat and the nearest aisle, where the seats are served by a single aisle, there are not more than 20 seats between any seat and the nearest aisle, where the seats are served by two aisles, each row has an unobstructed passage with minimum width of 400 mm plus 6.1 mm for each additional seat above 16 seats in the row, and the travel distance is not more than 45 m measured along the path of travel from any seat to an exit or to an egress doorway.
ON Variations: The requirements of Sentence (3) do not apply if, there are not more than seven seats between any seat and the nearest aisle, where the seats are served by a single aisle, there are not more than 20 seats between any seat and the nearest aisle, where the seats are served by two aisles, each row has an unobstructed passage with minimum width of 400 mm plus 6.1 mm for each additional seat above 16 seats in the row, and the travel distance is not more than 45 m measured along the path of travel from any seat to an exit or to an egress doorway.

ON Full: Except as permitted by Articles 3.2.3.10. to 3.2.3.12., the area of unprotected openings in an exposing building face for the applicable limiting distance shall be not more than the value determined in accordance with, Table 3.2.3.1.B. or Table 3.2.3.1.C. for an exposing building face conforming to Article 3.2.3.2. of a building or fire compartment that is not sprinklered, or Table 3.2.3.1.D. or Table 3.2.3.1.E. for an exposing building face conforming to Article 3.2.3.2. of a sprinklered fire compartment that is part of a building that is sprinklered in conformance with Section 3.2.
ON Variations: Except as permitted by Articles 3.2.3.10. to 3.2.3.12., the area of unprotected openings in an exposing building face for the applicable limiting distance shall be not more than the value determined in accordance with, Table 3.2.3.1.B. or Table 3.2.3.1.C. for an exposing building face conforming to Article 3.2.3.2. of a building or fire compartment that is not sprinklered, or Table 3.2.3.1.D. or Table 3.2.3.1.E. for an exposing building face conforming to Article 3.2.3.2. of a sprinklered fire compartment that is part of a building that is sprinklered in conformance with Section 3.2.

ON Full: Not less than 3 mm clearance shall be provided between hardboard siding and door or window frames.
ON Variations: Not less than 3 mm clearance shall be provided between hardboard siding and door or window frames.

ON Full: Hydraulic transfer systems referred to in Sentence (1) shall be designed to prevent water pressure in excess of the design pressure of the tank or piping.
ON Variations: Hydraulic transfer systems referred to in Sentence (1) shall be designed to prevent water pressure in excess of the design pressure of the tank or piping.

ON Full: Except as provided in Article 3.2.2.3., structural steel members used in construction required to have a fire-resistance rating shall be protected to provide the required fire-resistance rating.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Article 3.2.2.3., structural steel members used in construction required to have a fire-resistance rating shall be protected to provide the required fire-resistance rating.

ON Full: This Section applies to hot surface applications, in or on buildings, that use open flame torches, bitumen kettles or other heat-producing devices.
ON Variations: This Section applies to hot surface applications, in or on buildings, that use open flame torches, bitumen kettles or other heat-producing devices.

ON Full: Sway effects produced by vertical loads acting on the structure in its displaced configuration shall be taken into account in the design of buildings and their structural members.
ON Variations: Sway effects produced by vertical loads acting on the structure in its displaced configuration shall be taken into account in the design of buildings and their structural members.

ON Full: Except for roofs that support an occupancy, the requirements in Table 9.10.8.1. for roof assemblies to have a fire-resistance rating are permitted to be waived in sprinklered buildings where,(a) the sprinkler system is electrically supervised in conformance with Sentence 3.2.4.10.(3), and (b) the operation of the sprinkler system will cause a signal to be transmitted to the fire department in conformance with Sentence 3.2.4.8.(4).
ON Variations: Except for roofs that support an occupancy, the requirements in Table 9.10.8.1. for roof assemblies to have a fire-resistance rating are permitted to be waived in sprinklered buildings where,(a) the sprinkler system is electrically supervised in conformance with Sentence 3.2.4.10.(3), and (b) the operation of the sprinkler system will cause a signal to be transmitted to the fire department in conformance with Sentence 3.2.4.8.(4).

ON Full: Piping referred to in Sentence (1) shall not be installed under combustible flooring.
ON Variations: Piping referred to in Sentence (1) shall not be installed under combustible flooring.

ON Full: A dispensing room shall be equipped with self-closing doors hinged to swing outward on their vertical axis.
ON Variations: A dispensing room shall be equipped with self-closing doors hinged to swing outward on their vertical axis.

ON Full: Portable extinguishers in conformance with Section 6.2 shall be provided in transfer houses.
ON Variations: Portable extinguishers in conformance with Section 6.2 shall be provided in transfer houses.

ON Full: Except as permitted in Sentences (2) to (4), no fewer than two top plates shall be provided in loadbearing walls.
ON Variations: Except as permitted in Sentences (2) to (4), no fewer than two top plates shall be provided in loadbearing walls.

ON Full: A building is considered to face two streets provided not less than 50% of the building perimeter is located within 15 m of a street or streets.
ON Variations: A building is considered to face two streets provided not less than 50% of the building perimeter is located within 15 m of a street or streets.

ON Full: Insulation, an air barrier system and a vapour barrier shall be installed in the walls of heated crawl spaces in accordance with Section 9.25.
ON Variations: Insulation, an air barrier system and a vapour barrier shall be installed in the walls of heated crawl spaces in accordance with Section 9.25.

ON Full: Lead waste pipe and fittings shall not be used in a water system or for a building sewer.
ON Variations: Lead waste pipe and fittings shall not be used in a water system or for a building sewer.

ON Full: Loadbearing interior walls parallel to floor joists shall be supported by beams or walls of sufficient strength to transfer safely the design loads to vertical supports.
ON Variations: Loadbearing interior walls parallel to floor joists shall be supported by beams or walls of sufficient strength to transfer safely the design loads to vertical supports.

ON Full: Buildings not more than 4.3 m wide and not more than 1 storey in building height are permitted to be anchored in conformance with the requirements of CSA Z240.10.1, "Site Preparation, Foundation, and Installation of Buildings".
ON Variations: Buildings not more than 4.3 m wide and not more than 1 storey in building height are permitted to be anchored in conformance with the requirements of CSA Z240.10.1, "Site Preparation, Foundation, and Installation of Buildings".

ON Full: Where piping for flammable liquids or combustible liquids is installed within a building, the length of piping shall be as direct and as short as practicable.
ON Variations: Where piping for flammable liquids or combustible liquids is installed within a building, the length of piping shall be as direct and as short as practicable.

ON Full: No change in the size of a rain leader with a nominally horizontal offset is required if the offset,(a) is located immediately under the roof, (b) is not more than 6 m long, and (c) has a slope not less than 1 in 50.
ON Variations: No change in the size of a rain leader with a nominally horizontal offset is required if the offset,(a) is located immediately under the roof, (b) is not more than 6 m long, and (c) has a slope not less than 1 in 50.

ON Full: The height of guards shall be measured vertically to the top of the guard from, a line drawn through the outside edges of the tread nosings, or the surface of the ramp or landing.
ON Variations: The height of guards shall be measured vertically to the top of the guard from, a line drawn through the outside edges of the tread nosings, or the surface of the ramp or landing.

ON Full: Where the ability of a truss design to satisfy the requirements of Sentence (1) is demonstrated by analysis, it shall be carried out in accordance with good engineering practice such as described in TPIC, "Truss Design Procedures and Specifications for Light Metal Plate Connected Wood Trusses".
ON Variations: Where the ability of a truss design to satisfy the requirements of Sentence (1) is demonstrated by analysis, it shall be carried out in accordance with good engineering practice such as described in TPIC, "Truss Design Procedures and Specifications for Light Metal Plate Connected Wood Trusses".

ON Full: Tents located on fair grounds or similar open spaces, need not be separated from one another provided such closer spacing does not create a hazard to the public.
ON Variations: Tents located on fair grounds or similar open spaces, need not be separated from one another provided such closer spacing does not create a hazard to the public.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (3), the ridge beam referred to in Sentence (1) shall conform to the sizes and spans shown in Table A-12, provided,(a) the supported rafter or joist length does not exceed 4.9 m, and (b) the roof does not support any concentrated loads.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (3), the ridge beam referred to in Sentence (1) shall conform to the sizes and spans shown in Table A-12, provided,(a) the supported rafter or joist length does not exceed 4.9 m, and (b) the roof does not support any concentrated loads.

ON Full: Openings through fire blocks shall be protected to maintain the integrity of the construction.
ON Variations: Openings through fire blocks shall be protected to maintain the integrity of the construction.

ON Full: A cleanout shall be installed on a trap arm serving a kitchen sink as close as practical to the trap outlet and shall be readily accessible.
ON Variations: A cleanout shall be installed on a trap arm serving a kitchen sink as close as practical to the trap outlet and shall be readily accessible.

ON Full: Masonry veneer of solid masonry units resting on a bearing support shall not project more than one-third of the thickness of the veneer. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Masonry veneer of solid masonry units resting on a bearing support shall not project more than one-third of the thickness of the veneer. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: A firewall permitted to have a fire-resistance rating not more than 2 h need not be constructed of masonry or concrete provided, the assembly providing the fire-resistance rating is protected against damage that would compromise the integrity of the assembly, the design conforms to Article 4.1.5.17., the level of performance of the firewall is not less than of masonry or concrete in the areas of, performance during fire conditions, mechanical damage during the normal use of the building, and resistance to damage from moisture, the firewall separates buildings or buildings with floor areas that do not contain, a Group B, Division 1 major occupancy, or a Group B, Division 2 major occupancy, and the firewall does not separate a building regulated by the provisions of Subsection 3.2.6. or a building within the scope of Article 3.2.2.43A. or 3.2.2.50A. from another building unless the buildings on both sides of the firewall are sprinklered.
ON Variations: A firewall permitted to have a fire-resistance rating not more than 2 h need not be constructed of masonry or concrete provided, the assembly providing the fire-resistance rating is protected against damage that would compromise the integrity of the assembly, the design conforms to Article 4.1.5.17., the level of performance of the firewall is not less than of masonry or concrete in the areas of, performance during fire conditions, mechanical damage during the normal use of the building, and resistance to damage from moisture, the firewall separates buildings or buildings with floor areas that do not contain, a Group B, Division 1 major occupancy, or a Group B, Division 2 major occupancy, and the firewall does not separate a building regulated by the provisions of Subsection 3.2.6. or a building within the scope of Article 3.2.2.43A. or 3.2.2.50A. from another building unless the buildings on both sides of the firewall are sprinklered.

ON Full: When not in use, cellulose nitrate motion picture film shall be kept in closed, single-roll containers.
ON Variations: When not in use, cellulose nitrate motion picture film shall be kept in closed, single-roll containers.

ON Full: Valve supervisory switches, tank water level devices, building and tank water temperature supervisory devices and other sprinkler system supervisory devices shall be tested at least every six months.
ON Variations: Valve supervisory switches, tank water level devices, building and tank water temperature supervisory devices and other sprinkler system supervisory devices shall be tested at least every six months.

ON Full: Where necessary, flammable vapour indicators shall be used to detect leakage.
ON Variations: Where necessary, flammable vapour indicators shall be used to detect leakage.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (6) and Articles 3.3.2.8. and 3.3.4.7., a guard not less than 1 070 mm high shall be provided, around each roof to which access is provided for other than maintenance, at openings into smoke shafts referred to in Subsection 3.2.6. that are less than 1 070 mm above the floor, and at each raised floor, mezzanine, balcony, gallery, interior or exterior vehicular ramp, and at other locations where, the difference in level is more than 600 mm between the walking surface and the adjacent surface, or the adjacent surface within 1 200 mm of the walking surface has a slope of more than 1 in 2 away from the walking surface.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (6) and Articles 3.3.2.8. and 3.3.4.7., a guard not less than 1 070 mm high shall be provided, around each roof to which access is provided for other than maintenance, at openings into smoke shafts referred to in Subsection 3.2.6. that are less than 1 070 mm above the floor, and at each raised floor, mezzanine, balcony, gallery, interior or exterior vehicular ramp, and at other locations where, the difference in level is more than 600 mm between the walking surface and the adjacent surface, or the adjacent surface within 1 200 mm of the walking surface has a slope of more than 1 in 2 away from the walking surface.

ON Full: Where a fire alarm system is monitored by a central station to meet the requirements of the Building Code or this Code, the operator of the central station shall provide, upon request by the owner or Chief Fire Official, a document attesting that the monitoring service is in compliance with one of the standards identified in Sentence (2).
ON Variations: Where a fire alarm system is monitored by a central station to meet the requirements of the Building Code or this Code, the operator of the central station shall provide, upon request by the owner or Chief Fire Official, a document attesting that the monitoring service is in compliance with one of the standards identified in Sentence (2).

ON Full: Sealants shall be applied between window frames or trim and the exterior cladding or masonry in conformance with Subsection 9.27.4.
ON Variations: Sealants shall be applied between window frames or trim and the exterior cladding or masonry in conformance with Subsection 9.27.4.

ON Full: If an unenclosed exterior exit stair or ramp could be exposed to fire from an opening in the exterior wall of the building it serves, the opening in the exterior wall of the building shall be protected in conformance with the requirements of Sentence (4) where the opening in the exterior wall of the building is within 3 m horizontally and, less than 10 m below the exit stair or ramp, or less than 5 m above the exit stair or ramp.
ON Variations: If an unenclosed exterior exit stair or ramp could be exposed to fire from an opening in the exterior wall of the building it serves, the opening in the exterior wall of the building shall be protected in conformance with the requirements of Sentence (4) where the opening in the exterior wall of the building is within 3 m horizontally and, less than 10 m below the exit stair or ramp, or less than 5 m above the exit stair or ramp.

ON Full: Access openings for inspection purposes below deck shall be provided for valves required in Article 4.7.4.5. and for connections to pipelines, and suitable signs shall be posted indicating their locations.
ON Variations: Access openings for inspection purposes below deck shall be provided for valves required in Article 4.7.4.5. and for connections to pipelines, and suitable signs shall be posted indicating their locations.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentences (2) and (4), residential occupancies shall be separated from all other major occupancies by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 1 h.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentences (2) and (4), residential occupancies shall be separated from all other major occupancies by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 1 h.

ON Full: This Subsection applies to coating operations involving the use of combustible dry powders applied by fluidized beds or electrostatic fluidized beds.
ON Variations: This Subsection applies to coating operations involving the use of combustible dry powders applied by fluidized beds or electrostatic fluidized beds.

ON Full: The vertical height of a flight shall not exceed 3.7 m.
ON Variations: The vertical height of a flight shall not exceed 3.7 m.

ON Full: Corners and intersections shall be designed to provide adequate support for the vertical edges of interior finishes, sheathing and cladding materials, and in no instance shall exterior corners be framed with less than the equivalent of two studs.
ON Variations: Corners and intersections shall be designed to provide adequate support for the vertical edges of interior finishes, sheathing and cladding materials, and in no instance shall exterior corners be framed with less than the equivalent of two studs.

ON Full: Isolated suspended equipment and components, such as pendant lights, may be designed as a pendulum system provided that adequate chains or cables capable of supporting 2.0 times the weight of the suspended component are provided and the deflection requirements of Sentence (11) are satisfied.
ON Variations: Isolated suspended equipment and components, such as pendant lights, may be designed as a pendulum system provided that adequate chains or cables capable of supporting 2.0 times the weight of the suspended component are provided and the deflection requirements of Sentence (11) are satisfied.

ON Full: The contents of each receptacle referred to in Sentence (1) shall be removed daily and disposed of in an approved manner.
ON Variations: The contents of each receptacle referred to in Sentence (1) shall be removed daily and disposed of in an approved manner.

ON Full: Where groundwater levels may cause hydrostatic pressure beneath a floor-on-ground, the floor-on-ground shall be,(a) a cast-in-place concrete slab, and (b) designed to resist such pressures.
ON Variations: Where groundwater levels may cause hydrostatic pressure beneath a floor-on-ground, the floor-on-ground shall be,(a) a cast-in-place concrete slab, and (b) designed to resist such pressures.

ON Full: Fire detectors required by this Article shall be connected to the fire alarm system.
ON Variations: Fire detectors required by this Article shall be connected to the fire alarm system.

ON Full: Except as provided in Article 9.10.13.2., openings in required fire separations shall be protected with a closure conforming to Table 9.10.13.1. and shall be installed in conformance with NFPA 80, "Fire Doors and Other Opening Protectives", unless otherwise specified in this Part.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Article 9.10.13.2., openings in required fire separations shall be protected with a closure conforming to Table 9.10.13.1. and shall be installed in conformance with NFPA 80, "Fire Doors and Other Opening Protectives", unless otherwise specified in this Part.

ON Full: If there is a firewall in an elementary or secondary school, the travel distance shall not be measured to a door in the firewall, but shall be measured to an exterior exit door or an exit door to a stairway.
ON Variations: If there is a firewall in an elementary or secondary school, the travel distance shall not be measured to a door in the firewall, but shall be measured to an exterior exit door or an exit door to a stairway.

ON Full: Dead loads need not be considered in computing deflections referred to in Sentence (1).
ON Variations: Dead loads need not be considered in computing deflections referred to in Sentence (1).

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (3) and Sentence 3.3.2.8.(4), openings through any guard that is required by Sentence (1) shall be of a size that will prevent the passage of a sphere having a diameter more than 100 mm unless it can be shown that the location and size of openings that exceed this limit do not represent a hazard.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (3) and Sentence 3.3.2.8.(4), openings through any guard that is required by Sentence (1) shall be of a size that will prevent the passage of a sphere having a diameter more than 100 mm unless it can be shown that the location and size of openings that exceed this limit do not represent a hazard.

ON Full: Check valves shall be provided for both water and flammable liquid or combustible liquid piping to prevent back-flow in hydraulic transfer systems referred to in Sentence (1).
ON Variations: Check valves shall be provided for both water and flammable liquid or combustible liquid piping to prevent back-flow in hydraulic transfer systems referred to in Sentence (1).

ON Full: In a building that is not sprinklered, automatic emergency recall operation shall be provided for all elevators serving storeys above the first storey.
ON Variations: In a building that is not sprinklered, automatic emergency recall operation shall be provided for all elevators serving storeys above the first storey.

ON Full: Heated crawl spaces shall be ventilated in accordance with Section 9.32.
ON Variations: Heated crawl spaces shall be ventilated in accordance with Section 9.32.

ON Full: Capping required in Sentence (1) may be omitted where the roof framing is supported on a wood plate not less than 38 mm by 89 mm.
ON Variations: Capping required in Sentence (1) may be omitted where the roof framing is supported on a wood plate not less than 38 mm by 89 mm.

ON Full: Structural members of heavy timber construction, including beams, columns and arches, placed wholly or partly outside an exterior face of a building and 3 m or more from the property line or centreline of a public thoroughfare need not be covered with noncombustible cladding.
ON Variations: Structural members of heavy timber construction, including beams, columns and arches, placed wholly or partly outside an exterior face of a building and 3 m or more from the property line or centreline of a public thoroughfare need not be covered with noncombustible cladding.

ON Full: The principal exhaust required in this Article may be provided by means of a heat recovery ventilator installed in accordance with Article 9.32.3.11.
ON Variations: The principal exhaust required in this Article may be provided by means of a heat recovery ventilator installed in accordance with Article 9.32.3.11.

ON Full: The protection required by Sentence (1) for projections is permitted to be omitted if, the fire compartments behind the window and door openings are sprinklered in accordance with Article 3.2.5.13., and all rooms, including closets and bathrooms, having openings in the wall beneath the soffit are sprinklered, notwithstanding exceptions permitted in the standards referenced in Article 3.2.5.13. for the installation of automatic sprinkler systems.
ON Variations: The protection required by Sentence (1) for projections is permitted to be omitted if, the fire compartments behind the window and door openings are sprinklered in accordance with Article 3.2.5.13., and all rooms, including closets and bathrooms, having openings in the wall beneath the soffit are sprinklered, notwithstanding exceptions permitted in the standards referenced in Article 3.2.5.13. for the installation of automatic sprinkler systems.

ON Full: The reference velocity pressure, q, shall be the appropriate value determined in conformance with Subsection 1.1.2. based on a probability of being exceeded in any one year of 1-in-50.
ON Variations: The reference velocity pressure, q, shall be the appropriate value determined in conformance with Subsection 1.1.2. based on a probability of being exceeded in any one year of 1-in-50.

ON Full: Piping passing through secondary containment walls shall be designed to prevent excessive stress resulting from settlement or fire exposure.
ON Variations: Piping passing through secondary containment walls shall be designed to prevent excessive stress resulting from settlement or fire exposure.

ON Full: Hose connections shall not project beyond the face of piers and wharves.
ON Variations: Hose connections shall not project beyond the face of piers and wharves.

ON Full: A fire drill for supervisory staff shall be held at least every three months in a building to which Subsection 3.2.6. of Division B of the Building Code applies.
ON Variations: A fire drill for supervisory staff shall be held at least every three months in a building to which Subsection 3.2.6. of Division B of the Building Code applies.

ON Full: Subject to Sentences (2) and (3), this Section applies to suites of residential occupancy and sleeping rooms not within a dwelling unit.
ON Variations: Subject to Sentences (2) and (3), this Section applies to suites of residential occupancy and sleeping rooms not within a dwelling unit.

ON Full: Minimum thicknesses for sheet metal material required in this Part refer to the actual minimum base metal thicknesses measured at any point of the material, and in the case of galvanized steel described in Sentence 9.3.3.2.(1), include the thickness of the galvanizing coating unless otherwise indicated.
ON Variations: Minimum thicknesses for sheet metal material required in this Part refer to the actual minimum base metal thicknesses measured at any point of the material, and in the case of galvanized steel described in Sentence 9.3.3.2.(1), include the thickness of the galvanizing coating unless otherwise indicated.

ON Full: Where antifreeze solutions are used to maintain pumping systems operable under freezing conditions, the specific gravity shall be such that the solution will remain unfrozen at a temperature of 8°C below the expected minimum temperature of the surrounding atmosphere.
ON Variations: Where antifreeze solutions are used to maintain pumping systems operable under freezing conditions, the specific gravity shall be such that the solution will remain unfrozen at a temperature of 8°C below the expected minimum temperature of the surrounding atmosphere.

ON Full: The minimum distance between the egress doors described in Clause (5)(b) shall be not less than three-quarters of the maximum diagonal dimension of the room.
ON Variations: The minimum distance between the egress doors described in Clause (5)(b) shall be not less than three-quarters of the maximum diagonal dimension of the room.

ON Full: Except for clothes dryers, exhaust outlets shall be fitted with screens of mesh not larger than 15 mm, except where climatic conditions may require larger openings.
ON Variations: Except for clothes dryers, exhaust outlets shall be fitted with screens of mesh not larger than 15 mm, except where climatic conditions may require larger openings.

ON Full: A soil or waste pipe shall not be located directly above,(a) non-pressure potable water storage tanks, (b) manholes in pressure potable water storage tanks, or (c) food-handling or processing equipment.
ON Variations: A soil or waste pipe shall not be located directly above,(a) non-pressure potable water storage tanks, (b) manholes in pressure potable water storage tanks, or (c) food-handling or processing equipment.

ON Full: In a building referred to in Sentence (1) without a basement, the building area limits of Sentence (1) are permitted to be doubled provided a fire separation with a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h is used to separate the building into fire compartments, each one of which does not exceed the area limits of Clause (1)(b).
ON Variations: In a building referred to in Sentence (1) without a basement, the building area limits of Sentence (1) are permitted to be doubled provided a fire separation with a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h is used to separate the building into fire compartments, each one of which does not exceed the area limits of Clause (1)(b).

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (3), lighting outlets required in Sentence (1) shall be controlled by a wall switch near the doorway.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (3), lighting outlets required in Sentence (1) shall be controlled by a wall switch near the doorway.

ON Full: Mechanical ventilation systems provided in accordance with Sentence (1) shall be designed such that the pressure in the storage garage is less than the pressure in adjoining buildings of other occupancy, or in adjacent portions of the same building having a different occupancy.
ON Variations: Mechanical ventilation systems provided in accordance with Sentence (1) shall be designed such that the pressure in the storage garage is less than the pressure in adjoining buildings of other occupancy, or in adjacent portions of the same building having a different occupancy.

ON Full: A single pile of tires in a tire storage location shall occupy an area not greater than 500 m2 with a maximum length of 30 m.
ON Variations: A single pile of tires in a tire storage location shall occupy an area not greater than 500 m2 with a maximum length of 30 m.

ON Full: Flammable liquids and combustible liquids shall not be stored on exterior balconies.
ON Variations: Flammable liquids and combustible liquids shall not be stored on exterior balconies.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (3), where the interior finish of the exterior walls of a building is a type that may be damaged by moisture, exterior masonry walls, other than cavity walls or walls that are protected for their full height by a roof of a carport or porch, shall be,(a) parged on the interior surface, and (b) covered with No. 15 breather-type asphalt-saturated paper conforming to CAN/CGSB-51.32-M, "Sheathing, Membrane, Breather Type", and shall be lapped not less than 100 mm at the joints.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (3), where the interior finish of the exterior walls of a building is a type that may be damaged by moisture, exterior masonry walls, other than cavity walls or walls that are protected for their full height by a roof of a carport or porch, shall be,(a) parged on the interior surface, and (b) covered with No. 15 breather-type asphalt-saturated paper conforming to CAN/CGSB-51.32-M, "Sheathing, Membrane, Breather Type", and shall be lapped not less than 100 mm at the joints.

ON Full: A drainage pipe or fitting may be drilled or tapped,(a) to provide for the connection of a trap seal primer line, (b) to connect a device designed to dispense germicidal or odour control chemicals or trap seal water to a floor drain downstream of a vacuum breaker or flush valve in a flush tube connected to a sanitary unit, (c) to provide a hole for a branch connection to a drainage pipe, where the branch connection is made with a saddle hub as permitted by Article 7.2.10.5. and where the hole is drilled to provide a smooth clean hole of the required size and orientation, or (d) to provide for the connection of pipe or fittings to metal or rigid plastic pipe and fittings where the pipe or fittings are thick enough to be threaded or are bossed for tapping.
ON Variations: A drainage pipe or fitting may be drilled or tapped,(a) to provide for the connection of a trap seal primer line, (b) to connect a device designed to dispense germicidal or odour control chemicals or trap seal water to a floor drain downstream of a vacuum breaker or flush valve in a flush tube connected to a sanitary unit, (c) to provide a hole for a branch connection to a drainage pipe, where the branch connection is made with a saddle hub as permitted by Article 7.2.10.5. and where the hole is drilled to provide a smooth clean hole of the required size and orientation, or (d) to provide for the connection of pipe or fittings to metal or rigid plastic pipe and fittings where the pipe or fittings are thick enough to be threaded or are bossed for tapping.

ON Full: Sentences 8.7.4.2.(1), (2) and (4) to (11) apply to the construction of a filter bed.
ON Variations: Sentences 8.7.4.2.(1), (2) and (4) to (11) apply to the construction of a filter bed.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (5), air-supported structures are exempt from complying with Articles 3.2.2.20. to 3.2.2.83., except for maximum building size.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (5), air-supported structures are exempt from complying with Articles 3.2.2.20. to 3.2.2.83., except for maximum building size.

ON Full: An elevator satisfying the requirements of Sentence (1) shall be clearly identified on the main entrance level of the building.
ON Variations: An elevator satisfying the requirements of Sentence (1) shall be clearly identified on the main entrance level of the building.

ON Full: A building classified as Group C other than a retirement home is permitted to conform to Sentence (2) provided, it is not more than 3 storeys in building height, and it has a building area not more than the value in Table 3.2.2.47.
ON Variations: A building classified as Group C other than a retirement home is permitted to conform to Sentence (2) provided, it is not more than 3 storeys in building height, and it has a building area not more than the value in Table 3.2.2.47.

ON Full: Fire alarm and voice communication systems shall be maintained in operating condition.
ON Variations: Fire alarm and voice communication systems shall be maintained in operating condition.

ON Full: Treads and risers shall not differ significantly in run and rise in successive flights in any stair system. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Treads and risers shall not differ significantly in run and rise in successive flights in any stair system. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: The landlord shall test battery-operated smoke alarms after the battery is replaced.
ON Variations: The landlord shall test battery-operated smoke alarms after the battery is replaced.

ON Full: Doors described in Sentence (1) shall have not more than a 6 mm clearance beneath and not more than 3 mm at the sides and top.
ON Variations: Doors described in Sentence (1) shall have not more than a 6 mm clearance beneath and not more than 3 mm at the sides and top.

ON Full: A supplemental exhaust fan required by this Article shall be controlled by a manual switch located in the room served by the exhaust fan.
ON Variations: A supplemental exhaust fan required by this Article shall be controlled by a manual switch located in the room served by the exhaust fan.

ON Full: For the purposes of Table 7.5.8.3., the length of a continuous vent shall be its developed length from the vertical soil or waste pipe connection to a vent stack, stack vent, header or open air.
ON Variations: For the purposes of Table 7.5.8.3., the length of a continuous vent shall be its developed length from the vertical soil or waste pipe connection to a vent stack, stack vent, header or open air.

ON Full: A room containing a water closet shall be located where, it does not open directly into any room or area where food or drink for human consumption, or an ingredient of food or drink for human consumption, is intended to be stored, prepared, processed, distributed, served, sold or offered for sale, and it is not necessary for the public to go through the food preparation areas to gain access to the plumbing fixtures.
ON Variations: A room containing a water closet shall be located where, it does not open directly into any room or area where food or drink for human consumption, or an ingredient of food or drink for human consumption, is intended to be stored, prepared, processed, distributed, served, sold or offered for sale, and it is not necessary for the public to go through the food preparation areas to gain access to the plumbing fixtures.

ON Full: Where an atmospheric vacuum breaker is installed, it shall be located on the downstream side of the fixture control valve or faucet so that it will be subject to water supply pressure,(a) only when the fixture control valve or faucet is open, and (b) for periods of use not to exceed 12 h continuous.
ON Variations: Where an atmospheric vacuum breaker is installed, it shall be located on the downstream side of the fixture control valve or faucet so that it will be subject to water supply pressure,(a) only when the fixture control valve or faucet is open, and (b) for periods of use not to exceed 12 h continuous.

ON Full: Where a rapid transit station is erected entirely above the adjoining finished ground level and is a stand-alone building, the station shall be of noncombustible construction and shall conform to the requirements in Sentence (11).
ON Variations: Where a rapid transit station is erected entirely above the adjoining finished ground level and is a stand-alone building, the station shall be of noncombustible construction and shall conform to the requirements in Sentence (11).

ON Full: A symmetrically connected relief vent may serve as a combined relief vent for a maximum of two branches that are circuit vented, provided there are not more than eight circuit vented fixtures connected between the combined relief vent and each circuit vent.
ON Variations: A symmetrically connected relief vent may serve as a combined relief vent for a maximum of two branches that are circuit vented, provided there are not more than eight circuit vented fixtures connected between the combined relief vent and each circuit vent.

ON Full: Underground storage tanks shall not be placed in direct contact with reinforced concrete slabs but shall be separated by not less than 150 mm of sand or other suitable material to distribute evenly the weight of the tank on the supporting base.
ON Variations: Underground storage tanks shall not be placed in direct contact with reinforced concrete slabs but shall be separated by not less than 150 mm of sand or other suitable material to distribute evenly the weight of the tank on the supporting base.

ON Full: Quantities in excess of those permitted in Sentence (2) shall be stored in cabinets conforming to Subsection 4.2.10. or in a room conforming to Subsection 4.2.9.
ON Variations: Quantities in excess of those permitted in Sentence (2) shall be stored in cabinets conforming to Subsection 4.2.10. or in a room conforming to Subsection 4.2.9.

ON Full: A sign shall not be located so as to obstruct openings required for light and ventilation, any required means of egress or required access for firefighting in accordance with Sentence 3.2.5.3.(2).
ON Variations: A sign shall not be located so as to obstruct openings required for light and ventilation, any required means of egress or required access for firefighting in accordance with Sentence 3.2.5.3.(2).

ON Full: The annunciator at a rapid transit station shall be monitored simultaneously at the central supervising station.
ON Variations: The annunciator at a rapid transit station shall be monitored simultaneously at the central supervising station.

ON Full: Floors in washrooms, shower areas and passageways used by bathers shall slope to waste drains at not less than 1% and shall be of hard surfaced materials that do not become slippery when wet.
ON Variations: Floors in washrooms, shower areas and passageways used by bathers shall slope to waste drains at not less than 1% and shall be of hard surfaced materials that do not become slippery when wet.

ON Full: Signs prohibiting smoking that meet the requirements of Article 2.4.3.2. shall be conspicuously posted in any place where pin refinishing occurs.
ON Variations: Signs prohibiting smoking that meet the requirements of Article 2.4.3.2. shall be conspicuously posted in any place where pin refinishing occurs.

ON Full: The requirements in Sentence (2) do not apply where, the service room is sprinklered, or there is a vestibule between the service room and the means of egress.
ON Variations: The requirements in Sentence (2) do not apply where, the service room is sprinklered, or there is a vestibule between the service room and the means of egress.

ON Full: Any method of handling that may result in damage to the protective coating of the tank shall not be used.
ON Variations: Any method of handling that may result in damage to the protective coating of the tank shall not be used.

ON Full: The lower runner required in Sentence (3) shall be cut through the flanges and be bent at each end to extend upwards at least 150 mm and fastened to the adjacent studs.
ON Variations: The lower runner required in Sentence (3) shall be cut through the flanges and be bent at each end to extend upwards at least 150 mm and fastened to the adjacent studs.

ON Full: Smoke control equipment shall be maintained in a manner that ensures that it is fully operational.
ON Variations: Smoke control equipment shall be maintained in a manner that ensures that it is fully operational.

ON Full: The gravel stop referred to in Sentence (4) shall extend over the edge of the roof to form a drip or shall be flashed so that the flashing extends over the edge to form a drip.
ON Variations: The gravel stop referred to in Sentence (4) shall extend over the edge of the roof to form a drip or shall be flashed so that the flashing extends over the edge to form a drip.

ON Full: Joints in single top plates used with loadbearing walls shall be tied in accordance with Sentence (4).
ON Variations: Joints in single top plates used with loadbearing walls shall be tied in accordance with Sentence (4).

ON Full: Vertical lumber and stucco lath or reinforcing are permitted to be attached to sheathing only where the sheathing consists of not less than,(a) 14.3 mm lumber, (b) 12.5 mm plywood, or (c) 12.5 mm OSB or waferboard.
ON Variations: Vertical lumber and stucco lath or reinforcing are permitted to be attached to sheathing only where the sheathing consists of not less than,(a) 14.3 mm lumber, (b) 12.5 mm plywood, or (c) 12.5 mm OSB or waferboard.

ON Full: Despite Sentence (1), an existing laboratory that has fire separations consisting of membranes of lath and plaster or gypsum board is deemed to be in compliance with Sentence (1).
ON Variations: Despite Sentence (1), an existing laboratory that has fire separations consisting of membranes of lath and plaster or gypsum board is deemed to be in compliance with Sentence (1).

ON Full: Except as required in Article 9.21.2.1., two or more fuel-burning appliances are permitted to be connected to the same chimney flue provided adequate draft is maintained for the connected appliances and the connections are made as described in Sentences (2) and (3).
ON Variations: Except as required in Article 9.21.2.1., two or more fuel-burning appliances are permitted to be connected to the same chimney flue provided adequate draft is maintained for the connected appliances and the connections are made as described in Sentences (2) and (3).

ON Full: Sentence (2) does not apply if the time to recall all elevators under emergency power supply is not more than 5 min, each from its most remote storey to, the storey containing the entrance for firefighter access referred to in Articles 3.2.5.4 and 3.2.5.5., or to a transfer lobby.
ON Variations: Sentence (2) does not apply if the time to recall all elevators under emergency power supply is not more than 5 min, each from its most remote storey to, the storey containing the entrance for firefighter access referred to in Articles 3.2.5.4 and 3.2.5.5., or to a transfer lobby.

ON Full: The lateral deflections of a seismically isolated structure shall be calculated in accordance with Article 4.1.8.20.
ON Variations: The lateral deflections of a seismically isolated structure shall be calculated in accordance with Article 4.1.8.20.

ON Full: A non-inert gas pressure is permitted to be used in a closed piping system referred to in Sentence (1) provided it is the vapour or gas of the flammable liquid or combustible liquid being transferred, or it is a vapour or gas that will not support combustion reaction and is non-reactive with the flammable liquid or combustible liquid being transferred.
ON Variations: A non-inert gas pressure is permitted to be used in a closed piping system referred to in Sentence (1) provided it is the vapour or gas of the flammable liquid or combustible liquid being transferred, or it is a vapour or gas that will not support combustion reaction and is non-reactive with the flammable liquid or combustible liquid being transferred.

ON Full: Caulked lead drainage joints shall not be used except for cast iron pipe in a drainage system or venting system, or between such pipe and, (a) other ferrous pipe, (b) brass and copper pipe, (c) a caulking ferrule, or (d) a trap standard.
ON Variations: Caulked lead drainage joints shall not be used except for cast iron pipe in a drainage system or venting system, or between such pipe and, (a) other ferrous pipe, (b) brass and copper pipe, (c) a caulking ferrule, or (d) a trap standard.

ON Full: The inlet pipe of a hot water storage tank between the heat trap and the tank serving a non-recirculating system shall be insulated to provide a thermal resistance of not less than RSI 0.62.
ON Variations: The inlet pipe of a hot water storage tank between the heat trap and the tank serving a non-recirculating system shall be insulated to provide a thermal resistance of not less than RSI 0.62.

ON Full: For fires involving combustible metals, extinguishers or extinguishing agents with Class D fire ratings suitable for the combustible metal shall be provided.
ON Variations: For fires involving combustible metals, extinguishers or extinguishing agents with Class D fire ratings suitable for the combustible metal shall be provided.

ON Full: The minimum working capacity of a septic tank shall be the greater of 3 600 L and,(a) in residential occupancies, twice the daily design sanitary sewage flow, or (b) in non-residential occupancies, three times the daily design sanitary sewage flow.
ON Variations: The minimum working capacity of a septic tank shall be the greater of 3 600 L and,(a) in residential occupancies, twice the daily design sanitary sewage flow, or (b) in non-residential occupancies, three times the daily design sanitary sewage flow.

ON Full: Openings provided for access between an interconnected floor space and a building or a portion of a building containing Group B major occupancy sleeping rooms shall be provided with vestibules that are provided with a mechanical air supply and that are designed, to restrict the passage of smoke from the interconnected floor space into the area containing sleeping rooms in accordance with the limits described in Sentence 3.2.8.4.(1), and in conformance with Clause 3.2.8.4.(3)(a).
ON Variations: Openings provided for access between an interconnected floor space and a building or a portion of a building containing Group B major occupancy sleeping rooms shall be provided with vestibules that are provided with a mechanical air supply and that are designed, to restrict the passage of smoke from the interconnected floor space into the area containing sleeping rooms in accordance with the limits described in Sentence 3.2.8.4.(1), and in conformance with Clause 3.2.8.4.(3)(a).

ON Full: Not more than 20 suites need comply with Sentence (1).
ON Variations: Not more than 20 suites need comply with Sentence (1).

ON Full: In a building not more than 6 storeys in building height, doors providing access from exit stairs to a floor area containing a hotel are permitted to have locking devices to prevent entry into the floor area provided the requirements in Clause (4)(b) are complied with.
ON Variations: In a building not more than 6 storeys in building height, doors providing access from exit stairs to a floor area containing a hotel are permitted to have locking devices to prevent entry into the floor area provided the requirements in Clause (4)(b) are complied with.

ON Full: If more than one egress doorway is required from a room or suite referred to in Article 3.3.1.5., the travel distance within the room or suite to the nearest egress doorway shall not exceed the maximum travel distances specified in Clauses 3.4.2.5.(1)(a), (b), (c) and (f) for exits.
ON Variations: If more than one egress doorway is required from a room or suite referred to in Article 3.3.1.5., the travel distance within the room or suite to the nearest egress doorway shall not exceed the maximum travel distances specified in Clauses 3.4.2.5.(1)(a), (b), (c) and (f) for exits.

ON Full: All structural framing elements not considered to be part of the SFRS must be investigated and shown to behave elastically or to have sufficient non-linear capacity to support their gravity loads while undergoing earthquake-induced deformations calculated from the deflections determined in Article 4.1.8.13.
ON Variations: All structural framing elements not considered to be part of the SFRS must be investigated and shown to behave elastically or to have sufficient non-linear capacity to support their gravity loads while undergoing earthquake-induced deformations calculated from the deflections determined in Article 4.1.8.13.

ON Full: The protection of window and door openings against persons falling through the window or door opening shall conform to Article 9.8.8.1.
ON Variations: The protection of window and door openings against persons falling through the window or door opening shall conform to Article 9.8.8.1.

ON Full: Except as permitted by Sentence (4), if a building contains more than one major occupancy and a fire alarm system is required, a single system shall serve all occupancies.
ON Variations: Except as permitted by Sentence (4), if a building contains more than one major occupancy and a fire alarm system is required, a single system shall serve all occupancies.

ON Full: The backflow preventer required by Sentence (2) shall be installed upstream of the fire department pumper connection.
ON Variations: The backflow preventer required by Sentence (2) shall be installed upstream of the fire department pumper connection.

ON Full: The pit shall be constructed in such a manner as to prevent the collapse of its sidewalls.
ON Variations: The pit shall be constructed in such a manner as to prevent the collapse of its sidewalls.

ON Full: Except as required by Sentences (2) to (4) for bleacher seats, guards shall be installed in outdoor and indoor places of assembly with fixed seats so that, at the fascia of every box, balcony or gallery where the seats extend to the edge, the height of guards is not less than, 760 mm in front of the seats, and 920 mm if located at the end of aisles or at the foot of steps, the height of guards along every cross aisle other than those adjacent to the fascia of every box, balcony or gallery is not less than 660 mm, except that guards need not be provided if the backs of the seats along the front side of the aisle are not less than 600 mm above the floor of the aisle, and where the seating is arranged in successive tiers and the height of rise between platforms is more than 450 mm, the height of guards is not less than 660 mm along the entire row of seats at the edge of the platform.
ON Variations: Except as required by Sentences (2) to (4) for bleacher seats, guards shall be installed in outdoor and indoor places of assembly with fixed seats so that, at the fascia of every box, balcony or gallery where the seats extend to the edge, the height of guards is not less than, 760 mm in front of the seats, and 920 mm if located at the end of aisles or at the foot of steps, the height of guards along every cross aisle other than those adjacent to the fascia of every box, balcony or gallery is not less than 660 mm, except that guards need not be provided if the backs of the seats along the front side of the aisle are not less than 600 mm above the floor of the aisle, and where the seating is arranged in successive tiers and the height of rise between platforms is more than 450 mm, the height of guards is not less than 660 mm along the entire row of seats at the edge of the platform.

ON Full: Except as permitted in Sentence 5.16.1.1.(2), prior notice shall be given to the occupants of any premises adjacent to that in which fumigation or thermal insecticidal fogging is to take place.
ON Variations: Except as permitted in Sentence 5.16.1.1.(2), prior notice shall be given to the occupants of any premises adjacent to that in which fumigation or thermal insecticidal fogging is to take place.

ON Full: This Section applies to hot works that use open flames or produce heat or sparks, including cutting, welding, soldering, brazing, grinding, adhesive bonding, thermal spraying and thawing pipes.
ON Variations: This Section applies to hot works that use open flames or produce heat or sparks, including cutting, welding, soldering, brazing, grinding, adhesive bonding, thermal spraying and thawing pipes.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentences 3.1.8.9.(1) and 3.1.8.9A.(3), a hold-open device is permitted to be used on a closure in a required fire separation, other than on an exit stair door in a building more than 3 storeys in building height and on a door for a vestibule required by Article 3.3.5.7., provided the device is designed to release the closure in conformance with this Article.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentences 3.1.8.9.(1) and 3.1.8.9A.(3), a hold-open device is permitted to be used on a closure in a required fire separation, other than on an exit stair door in a building more than 3 storeys in building height and on a door for a vestibule required by Article 3.3.5.7., provided the device is designed to release the closure in conformance with this Article.

ON Full: If two or more liquids with different flash points are stored outdoors in containers that form a single pile, the maximum total quantity in the pile shall be equal to the maximum quantity permitted for the liquid with the lowest flash point.
ON Variations: If two or more liquids with different flash points are stored outdoors in containers that form a single pile, the maximum total quantity in the pile shall be equal to the maximum quantity permitted for the liquid with the lowest flash point.

ON Full: Cornices, sills or other trim of masonry material that project beyond the wall face shall have not less than 65% of their mass, but not less than 90 mm, within the wall or shall be adequately anchored to the wall with corrosion-resistant anchors.
ON Variations: Cornices, sills or other trim of masonry material that project beyond the wall face shall have not less than 65% of their mass, but not less than 90 mm, within the wall or shall be adequately anchored to the wall with corrosion-resistant anchors.

ON Full: Portable extinguishers having defects shall be repaired and, if necessary, recharged to ensure the extinguishers will operate effectively and safely.
ON Variations: Portable extinguishers having defects shall be repaired and, if necessary, recharged to ensure the extinguishers will operate effectively and safely.

ON Full: Every building or part of it shall be classified according to its major occupancy as belonging to one of the groups or divisions described in Table 9.10.2.1.
ON Variations: Every building or part of it shall be classified according to its major occupancy as belonging to one of the groups or divisions described in Table 9.10.2.1.

ON Full: Sealing or drainage are not required where it can be shown that the omission of sealing and drainage will not adversely affect any of,(a) the health or safety of building users, (b) the intended use of the building, or (c) the operation of building services.
ON Variations: Sealing or drainage are not required where it can be shown that the omission of sealing and drainage will not adversely affect any of,(a) the health or safety of building users, (b) the intended use of the building, or (c) the operation of building services.

ON Full: The height of guards for exterior stairs and landings more than 10 m above adjacent ground level shall be not less than 1 500 mm measured vertically to the top of the guard from the surface of the landing or a line drawn through the outside edges of the tread nosings.
ON Variations: The height of guards for exterior stairs and landings more than 10 m above adjacent ground level shall be not less than 1 500 mm measured vertically to the top of the guard from the surface of the landing or a line drawn through the outside edges of the tread nosings.

ON Full: Internal combustion engines, other devices capable of producing ignition and devices associated with either of the foregoing shall be kept at sufficient distance from combustible material so as to prevent ignition.
ON Variations: Internal combustion engines, other devices capable of producing ignition and devices associated with either of the foregoing shall be kept at sufficient distance from combustible material so as to prevent ignition.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (2), the requirements in Section 3.6. shall apply.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (2), the requirements in Section 3.6. shall apply.

ON Full: Direct acting water pressure reducing valves for domestic water supply systems shall conform to CAN/CSA-B356, "Water Pressure Reducing Valves for Domestic Water Supply Systems".
ON Variations: Direct acting water pressure reducing valves for domestic water supply systems shall conform to CAN/CSA-B356, "Water Pressure Reducing Valves for Domestic Water Supply Systems".

ON Full: Every dwelling unit shall be supplied with a water distribution system where a drinking water system is available.
ON Variations: Every dwelling unit shall be supplied with a water distribution system where a drinking water system is available.

ON Full: Except as permitted in Sentence (2), obstructions located within 1 980 mm of the floor shall not project horizontally more than 100 mm into exit passageways, corridors used by the public or public corridors in a manner that would create a hazard for persons with no or low vision travelling adjacent to walls.
ON Variations: Except as permitted in Sentence (2), obstructions located within 1 980 mm of the floor shall not project horizontally more than 100 mm into exit passageways, corridors used by the public or public corridors in a manner that would create a hazard for persons with no or low vision travelling adjacent to walls.

ON Full: The circuitry serving lighting for externally and internally illuminated exit signs shall, (a) serve no equipment other than emergency lighting in the area where the exit signs are installed, and (b) be connected to an emergency power supply as described in Sentences 9.9.12.3.(2), (3) and (7).
ON Variations: The circuitry serving lighting for externally and internally illuminated exit signs shall, (a) serve no equipment other than emergency lighting in the area where the exit signs are installed, and (b) be connected to an emergency power supply as described in Sentences 9.9.12.3.(2), (3) and (7).

ON Full: Concrete flue liners shall conform to Clause 4.2.6.4. of CAN/CSA-A405-M, "Design and Construction of Masonry Chimneys and Fireplaces".
ON Variations: Concrete flue liners shall conform to Clause 4.2.6.4. of CAN/CSA-A405-M, "Design and Construction of Masonry Chimneys and Fireplaces".

ON Full: Electromagnetic locks are permitted to be installed on an exterior door leading from an exit stairway in a building containing only a Group B, Division 2 major occupancy, a Group B, Division 3 major occupancy or a retirement home.
ON Variations: Electromagnetic locks are permitted to be installed on an exterior door leading from an exit stairway in a building containing only a Group B, Division 2 major occupancy, a Group B, Division 3 major occupancy or a retirement home.

ON Full: Flammable liquids and combustible liquids shall be kept in closed containers when not in use.
ON Variations: Flammable liquids and combustible liquids shall be kept in closed containers when not in use.

ON Full: Electric motors for exhaust fans shall not be placed inside spray booths, spray rooms or ducts.
ON Variations: Electric motors for exhaust fans shall not be placed inside spray booths, spray rooms or ducts.

ON Full: The person authorized by the manufacturer to service and maintain the treatment unit and who has entered into the agreement referred to in Sentence (2) with the person operating the treatment unit shall notify the chief building official if,(a) the agreement is terminated, or (b) access for service and maintenance of the treatment unit is denied by the person operating the treatment unit.
ON Variations: The person authorized by the manufacturer to service and maintain the treatment unit and who has entered into the agreement referred to in Sentence (2) with the person operating the treatment unit shall notify the chief building official if,(a) the agreement is terminated, or (b) access for service and maintenance of the treatment unit is denied by the person operating the treatment unit.

ON Full: Every suction system that serves a public spa shall be equipped with a vacuum relief mechanism that shall include, a vacuum release system, a vacuum limit system, or other engineered systems that are designed, constructed and installed to conform to good engineering practice appropriate to the circumstances.
ON Variations: Every suction system that serves a public spa shall be equipped with a vacuum relief mechanism that shall include, a vacuum release system, a vacuum limit system, or other engineered systems that are designed, constructed and installed to conform to good engineering practice appropriate to the circumstances.

ON Full: The loads described in Sentence (1) need not be considered to act simultaneously with the loads provided for in Article 4.1.5.14.
ON Variations: The loads described in Sentence (1) need not be considered to act simultaneously with the loads provided for in Article 4.1.5.14.

ON Full: Where a washroom required in Sentence 3.13.6.2.(1) contains more than one water closet, the washroom shall be designed in conformance with the requirements in Articles 3.8.3.8. to 3.8.3.11.
ON Variations: Where a washroom required in Sentence 3.13.6.2.(1) contains more than one water closet, the washroom shall be designed in conformance with the requirements in Articles 3.8.3.8. to 3.8.3.11.
