ON Full: In a building containing a hotel in which a trouble signal sounding device has a silencing switch, a trouble light shall be installed in, the main reception area serving the hotel, or another continually-supervised location.
ON Variations: In a building containing a hotel in which a trouble signal sounding device has a silencing switch, a trouble light shall be installed in, the main reception area serving the hotel, or another continually-supervised location.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentences (3) to (7) and Sentence 9.10.14.6.(1), the maximum aggregate area of unprotected openings in an exposing building face shall,(a) conform to Table 9.10.14.4., (b) conform to Subsection 3.2.3., or (c) where the limiting distance is not less than 1.2 m, be equal to or less than, (i) the limiting distance squared, for residential occupancies, business and personal services occupancies and low hazard industrial occupancies, and (ii) half the limiting distance squared, for mercantile occupancies and medium hazard industrial occupancies.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentences (3) to (7) and Sentence 9.10.14.6.(1), the maximum aggregate area of unprotected openings in an exposing building face shall,(a) conform to Table 9.10.14.4., (b) conform to Subsection 3.2.3., or (c) where the limiting distance is not less than 1.2 m, be equal to or less than, (i) the limiting distance squared, for residential occupancies, business and personal services occupancies and low hazard industrial occupancies, and (ii) half the limiting distance squared, for mercantile occupancies and medium hazard industrial occupancies.

ON Full: The fire-resistance rating of field-applied and factory-built grease duct enclosure assemblies shall be determined in conformance with CAN/ULC-S144, "Fire Resistance Test - Grease Duct Assemblies".
ON Variations: The fire-resistance rating of field-applied and factory-built grease duct enclosure assemblies shall be determined in conformance with CAN/ULC-S144, "Fire Resistance Test - Grease Duct Assemblies".

ON Full: Except as permitted by Sentences (2) to (4) and (7) fire blocks shall remain in place and prevent the passage of flames for not less than 15 min when subjected to the standard fire exposure in CAN/ULC-S101, "Fire Endurance Tests of Building Construction and Materials".
ON Variations: Except as permitted by Sentences (2) to (4) and (7) fire blocks shall remain in place and prevent the passage of flames for not less than 15 min when subjected to the standard fire exposure in CAN/ULC-S101, "Fire Endurance Tests of Building Construction and Materials".

ON Full: Where the effects due to lateral earth pressure, H, restraint effects from pre-stress, P, and imposed deformation, T, affect the structural safety, they shall be taken into account in the calculations, with load factors of 1.5, 1.0 and 1.25 assigned to H, P and T respectively. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Where the effects due to lateral earth pressure, H, restraint effects from pre-stress, P, and imposed deformation, T, affect the structural safety, they shall be taken into account in the calculations, with load factors of 1.5, 1.0 and 1.25 assigned to H, P and T respectively. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Except as required in this Subsection, at least one lavatory shall be provided in a room containing one or two water closets or urinals, and at least one additional lavatory shall be provided for each additional two water closets or urinals.
ON Variations: Except as required in this Subsection, at least one lavatory shall be provided in a room containing one or two water closets or urinals, and at least one additional lavatory shall be provided for each additional two water closets or urinals.

ON Full: In cases where IEFaSa(0.2) is equal to or greater than 0.35, the following requirements shall be satisfied: (a) piles or pile caps, drilled piers, and caissons shall be interconnected by continuous ties in no fewer than two directions, (See Appendix A.) (b) piles, drilled piers, and caissons shall be embedded a minimum of 100 mm into the pile cap or structure, and (c) piles, drilled piers, and caissons, other than wood piles, shall be connected to the pile cap or structure for a minimum tension force equal to 0.15 times the factored compression load on the pile.
ON Variations: In cases where IEFaSa(0.2) is equal to or greater than 0.35, the following requirements shall be satisfied: (a) piles or pile caps, drilled piers, and caissons shall be interconnected by continuous ties in no fewer than two directions, (See Appendix A.) (b) piles, drilled piers, and caissons shall be embedded a minimum of 100 mm into the pile cap or structure, and (c) piles, drilled piers, and caissons, other than wood piles, shall be connected to the pile cap or structure for a minimum tension force equal to 0.15 times the factored compression load on the pile.

ON Full: The minimum clear width of doorways serving residents in a retirement home shall be 860 mm.
ON Variations: The minimum clear width of doorways serving residents in a retirement home shall be 860 mm.

ON Full: Mirrored glass doors reinforced with a film backing shall meet the impact resistance requirements specified in CAN/CGSB-12.5-M, "Mirrors, Silvered".
ON Variations: Mirrored glass doors reinforced with a film backing shall meet the impact resistance requirements specified in CAN/CGSB-12.5-M, "Mirrors, Silvered".

ON Full: Where boxes referred to in Sentence (2) are located on both sides of walls required to provide a fire-resistance rating, they shall be offset where necessary to maintain the integrity of the fire separation.
ON Variations: Where boxes referred to in Sentence (2) are located on both sides of walls required to provide a fire-resistance rating, they shall be offset where necessary to maintain the integrity of the fire separation.

ON Full: Supply fittings shall conform to ASME A112.18.1 / CSA B125.1, "Plumbing Supply Fittings" or CSA B125.3, "Plumbing Fittings".
ON Variations: Supply fittings shall conform to ASME A112.18.1 / CSA B125.1, "Plumbing Supply Fittings" or CSA B125.3, "Plumbing Fittings".

ON Full: Mechanical Couplings for DWV and Sewer Pipe shall be certified to CSA B602, "Mechanical Couplings for Drain, Waste, and Vent Pipe and Sewer Pipe".
ON Variations: Mechanical Couplings for DWV and Sewer Pipe shall be certified to CSA B602, "Mechanical Couplings for Drain, Waste, and Vent Pipe and Sewer Pipe".

ON Full: A subsoil drainage pipe that drains into a sanitary drainage system that is subject to surcharge shall be connected in such a manner that sewage cannot back up into the subsoil drainage pipe.
ON Variations: A subsoil drainage pipe that drains into a sanitary drainage system that is subject to surcharge shall be connected in such a manner that sewage cannot back up into the subsoil drainage pipe.

ON Full: The performance level of an existing building is reduced where after proposed construction in all or part of an existing building,(a) the major occupancy will change to a different major occupancy, (b) the occupant load will increase by more than 15%, or (c) the live load will increase due to change in use within the same major occupancy, and the existing structural floor and roof framing systems and their supporting members after the construction are not adequate to support the proposed dead loads and live loads.
ON Variations: The performance level of an existing building is reduced where after proposed construction in all or part of an existing building,(a) the major occupancy will change to a different major occupancy, (b) the occupant load will increase by more than 15%, or (c) the live load will increase due to change in use within the same major occupancy, and the existing structural floor and roof framing systems and their supporting members after the construction are not adequate to support the proposed dead loads and live loads.

ON Full: Combustible piping for central vacuum cleaning systems is permitted to penetrate a fire separation, provided the installation conforms to the requirements that apply to combustible piping specified in Sentence (3).
ON Variations: Combustible piping for central vacuum cleaning systems is permitted to penetrate a fire separation, provided the installation conforms to the requirements that apply to combustible piping specified in Sentence (3).

ON Full: The minimum number of water closets, urinals and lavatories shall be determined from Article 3.7.4.3. and Table 3.7.4.3.C. for an occupant load based on, the formula in Sentence 3.1.17.3.(1) for all public pools, except a wave action pool, or the formula in Sentence 3.1.17.3.(2) for a wave action pool.
ON Variations: The minimum number of water closets, urinals and lavatories shall be determined from Article 3.7.4.3. and Table 3.7.4.3.C. for an occupant load based on, the formula in Sentence 3.1.17.3.(1) for all public pools, except a wave action pool, or the formula in Sentence 3.1.17.3.(2) for a wave action pool.

ON Full: Duct sealants shall have a flame-spread rating of not more than 25 and a smoke developed classification of not more than 50.
ON Variations: Duct sealants shall have a flame-spread rating of not more than 25 and a smoke developed classification of not more than 50.

ON Full: This Subsection applies to outdoor tire storage yards where tires or shredded tires are stored if the bulk volume of the stored product exceeds 300 m3.
ON Variations: This Subsection applies to outdoor tire storage yards where tires or shredded tires are stored if the bulk volume of the stored product exceeds 300 m3.

ON Full: The protection required by Sentences (3) and (4) is permitted to be waived where combustible sprinkler piping has been tested in conformance with ULC/ORD-C199P, "Combustible Piping for Sprinkler Systems", and has been shown to meet the requirements in that document without additional protection.
ON Variations: The protection required by Sentences (3) and (4) is permitted to be waived where combustible sprinkler piping has been tested in conformance with ULC/ORD-C199P, "Combustible Piping for Sprinkler Systems", and has been shown to meet the requirements in that document without additional protection.

ON Full: The slab shall be reinforced with 10M bars spaced not more than 200 mm o.c. in each direction, with 30 mm clear cover from the bottom of the slab to the first layer of bars, and the second layer of bars laid directly on top of the lower layer in the opposite direction.
ON Variations: The slab shall be reinforced with 10M bars spaced not more than 200 mm o.c. in each direction, with 30 mm clear cover from the bottom of the slab to the first layer of bars, and the second layer of bars laid directly on top of the lower layer in the opposite direction.

ON Full: Every rapid transit station shall be provided with an emergency ventilation system conforming to NFPA 130, "Fixed Guideway Transit and Passenger Rail Systems".
ON Variations: Every rapid transit station shall be provided with an emergency ventilation system conforming to NFPA 130, "Fixed Guideway Transit and Passenger Rail Systems".

ON Full: The stone layer required by Clause (1)(c) shall,(a) be comprised of washed septic stone, free of fine material, with gradation conforming to Table 8.7.3.3., (b) be not less than 500 mm in width, (c) extend not less than 150 mm below the distribution pipe, and (d) extend not less than 50 mm above the distribution pipe. (6) This Article does not apply to a distribution pipe within a leaching chamber.
ON Variations: The stone layer required by Clause (1)(c) shall,(a) be comprised of washed septic stone, free of fine material, with gradation conforming to Table 8.7.3.3., (b) be not less than 500 mm in width, (c) extend not less than 150 mm below the distribution pipe, and (d) extend not less than 50 mm above the distribution pipe. (6) This Article does not apply to a distribution pipe within a leaching chamber.

ON Full: Fire dampers are permitted to be used within the exhaust duct system of the ventilation system for a power-ventilated enclosure referred to in Article 6.2.13.3.
ON Variations: Fire dampers are permitted to be used within the exhaust duct system of the ventilation system for a power-ventilated enclosure referred to in Article 6.2.13.3.

ON Full: Where the area between adjacent tents or a tent and the property line is used as a means of egress, the minimum width between stake lines shall be the width necessary for means of egress, but not less than 3 m.
ON Variations: Where the area between adjacent tents or a tent and the property line is used as a means of egress, the minimum width between stake lines shall be the width necessary for means of egress, but not less than 3 m.

ON Full: For the purposes of this Subsection, the water in a public pool and its recirculation system is deemed not to be potable water.
ON Variations: For the purposes of this Subsection, the water in a public pool and its recirculation system is deemed not to be potable water.

ON Full: The mechanical ventilation described in Sentence (16) applies to rooms containing water closets, urinals, basins, showers or slop sinks.
ON Variations: The mechanical ventilation described in Sentence (16) applies to rooms containing water closets, urinals, basins, showers or slop sinks.

ON Full: If the quantity of stored product is 1200 m3 or more, the water supply system shall be capable of supplying at least 3780 L/min for a minimum of 3 h.
ON Variations: If the quantity of stored product is 1200 m3 or more, the water supply system shall be capable of supplying at least 3780 L/min for a minimum of 3 h.

ON Full: Except as provided in Section 11.5., the proposed construction within an existing suite shall comply with the requirements of Section 3.8. where, (a) new interior walls or floor assemblies are installed, (b) the suite has an area greater than 300 m2, and (c) the suite is located in, (i) a floor area where the existing difference in elevation between the adjacent ground level and the floor level is not more than 200 mm, or (ii) a normally occupied floor area which is accessible by a passenger type elevator or other platform equipped passenger elevating device from an entrance storey where the existing difference in elevation between the adjacent ground level and the entrance storey level is not more than 200 mm.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Section 11.5., the proposed construction within an existing suite shall comply with the requirements of Section 3.8. where, (a) new interior walls or floor assemblies are installed, (b) the suite has an area greater than 300 m2, and (c) the suite is located in, (i) a floor area where the existing difference in elevation between the adjacent ground level and the floor level is not more than 200 mm, or (ii) a normally occupied floor area which is accessible by a passenger type elevator or other platform equipped passenger elevating device from an entrance storey where the existing difference in elevation between the adjacent ground level and the entrance storey level is not more than 200 mm.

ON Full: After any alterations or repairs, an inspection shall be made to ensure valves are returned to the fully open position and are sealed, locked or electrically supervised.
ON Variations: After any alterations or repairs, an inspection shall be made to ensure valves are returned to the fully open position and are sealed, locked or electrically supervised.

ON Full: Except where no fire separation is required between major occupancies, air-supported structures shall contain not more than one major occupancy.
ON Variations: Except where no fire separation is required between major occupancies, air-supported structures shall contain not more than one major occupancy.

ON Full: Combustible sprinkler piping shall meet the requirements of ULC/ORD-C199P, "Combustible Piping for Sprinkler Systems".
ON Variations: Combustible sprinkler piping shall meet the requirements of ULC/ORD-C199P, "Combustible Piping for Sprinkler Systems".

ON Full: Where deep foundation units are load tested, as required in Clause 4.2.4.1.(1)(c), the determination of the number and type of load test and the interpretation of the results shall be carried out by a person especially qualified in this field of work. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Where deep foundation units are load tested, as required in Clause 4.2.4.1.(1)(c), the determination of the number and type of load test and the interpretation of the results shall be carried out by a person especially qualified in this field of work. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Except as required by Sentence (2) and as permitted by Sentence (3), the flame-spread rating and smoke developed classification of a material, assembly, or structural member shall be determined on the basis of no fewer than three tests conducted in conformance with CAN/ULC-S102, "Test for Surface Burning Characteristics of Building Materials and Assemblies".
ON Variations: Except as required by Sentence (2) and as permitted by Sentence (3), the flame-spread rating and smoke developed classification of a material, assembly, or structural member shall be determined on the basis of no fewer than three tests conducted in conformance with CAN/ULC-S102, "Test for Surface Burning Characteristics of Building Materials and Assemblies".

ON Full: All recirculating pumps used in a public pool shall be capable of being deactivated by an emergency stop button clearly labelled and located at, a Class A pool beside the telephone that is required in Sentence (7), and a Class B pool on the deck area.
ON Variations: All recirculating pumps used in a public pool shall be capable of being deactivated by an emergency stop button clearly labelled and located at, a Class A pool beside the telephone that is required in Sentence (7), and a Class B pool on the deck area.

ON Full: Backfill shall be placed to avoid damaging the foundation wall, the drainage tile, drainage layer, externally applied thermal insulation, waterproofing and dampproofing of the wall.
ON Variations: Backfill shall be placed to avoid damaging the foundation wall, the drainage tile, drainage layer, externally applied thermal insulation, waterproofing and dampproofing of the wall.

ON Full: Keys to operate the switches required by Sentences (2) and (3) shall be, provided in a suitably identified box conspicuously located on the outside of an elevator hoistway near the central alarm and control facility required by Article 3.2.6.7., and kept at the central alarm and control facility.
ON Variations: Keys to operate the switches required by Sentences (2) and (3) shall be, provided in a suitably identified box conspicuously located on the outside of an elevator hoistway near the central alarm and control facility required by Article 3.2.6.7., and kept at the central alarm and control facility.

ON Full: An internal combustion engine shall be continuously monitored at all times in a building where ammonium nitrate is stored unless the engine is located in an area that will prevent the spread of a fire originating in the engine.
ON Variations: An internal combustion engine shall be continuously monitored at all times in a building where ammonium nitrate is stored unless the engine is located in an area that will prevent the spread of a fire originating in the engine.

ON Full: Emergency lighting required in Sentence (1) shall be provided from a source of energy separate from the electrical supply for the building.
ON Variations: Emergency lighting required in Sentence (1) shall be provided from a source of energy separate from the electrical supply for the building.

ON Full: After a section of a potable water system has been completed, and before it is placed in operation, a water test or an air test shall be conducted.
ON Variations: After a section of a potable water system has been completed, and before it is placed in operation, a water test or an air test shall be conducted.

ON Full: Skimming devices shall be designed and suitably located to remove surface film when no waves are induced in a wave action pool.
ON Variations: Skimming devices shall be designed and suitably located to remove surface film when no waves are induced in a wave action pool.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentences (2) and (3) and Subsection 9.9.9., at least two exits shall be provided from every floor area, spaced so that the travel distance to the nearest exit is not more than,(a) 40 m in the case of business and personal services occupancies, (b) 45 m for all occupancies where the floor area is sprinklered, and (c) 30 m for all other occupancies.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentences (2) and (3) and Subsection 9.9.9., at least two exits shall be provided from every floor area, spaced so that the travel distance to the nearest exit is not more than,(a) 40 m in the case of business and personal services occupancies, (b) 45 m for all occupancies where the floor area is sprinklered, and (c) 30 m for all other occupancies.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (3), industrial trucks shall be refuelled only at designated locations outside buildings.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (3), industrial trucks shall be refuelled only at designated locations outside buildings.

ON Full: A room intended for the storage of flammable liquids or combustible liquids required by the Fire Code made under the Fire Protection and Prevention Act, 1997 shall not be located above or below the first storey of the building.
ON Variations: A room intended for the storage of flammable liquids or combustible liquids required by the Fire Code made under the Fire Protection and Prevention Act, 1997 shall not be located above or below the first storey of the building.

ON Full: Galvanized steel pipe and fittings shall not be welded.
ON Variations: Galvanized steel pipe and fittings shall not be welded.

ON Full: Except as permitted in Sentence (2), no foundation drain or subsoil drainage pipe shall connect to a sanitary drainage system.
ON Variations: Except as permitted in Sentence (2), no foundation drain or subsoil drainage pipe shall connect to a sanitary drainage system.

ON Full: Piping, ducts and totally enclosed noncombustible raceways shall be installed so that their collapse will not cause the collapse of the firewall.
ON Variations: Piping, ducts and totally enclosed noncombustible raceways shall be installed so that their collapse will not cause the collapse of the firewall.

ON Full: Wall and ceiling finishes of rooms and passageways shall be easy to clean.
ON Variations: Wall and ceiling finishes of rooms and passageways shall be easy to clean.

ON Full: The drift loads on the lower level roof against the two faces of an outside corner of an upper level roof or roof obstruction shall be extended radially around the corner as shown in Figure 4.1.6.8.A. and may be taken as the least severe of the drift loads lying against the two faces of the corner.
ON Variations: The drift loads on the lower level roof against the two faces of an outside corner of an upper level roof or roof obstruction shall be extended radially around the corner as shown in Figure 4.1.6.8.A. and may be taken as the least severe of the drift loads lying against the two faces of the corner.

ON Full: Where 38 mm members in built-up wood beams are not nailed together as provided in Sentence (7), they shall be bolted together with not less than 12.7 mm diam bolts equipped with washers and spaced not more than 1.2 m o.c., with the end bolts located not more than 600 mm from the ends of the members.
ON Variations: Where 38 mm members in built-up wood beams are not nailed together as provided in Sentence (7), they shall be bolted together with not less than 12.7 mm diam bolts equipped with washers and spaced not more than 1.2 m o.c., with the end bolts located not more than 600 mm from the ends of the members.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (2), shingles shall be fastened with at least four nails or staples for 1 000 mm wide shingles so that no nails or staples are exposed.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (2), shingles shall be fastened with at least four nails or staples for 1 000 mm wide shingles so that no nails or staples are exposed.

ON Full: Except as permitted by Sentences (2) to (4) and (6), every floor area intended for occupancy shall be served by at least two exits.
ON Variations: Except as permitted by Sentences (2) to (4) and (6), every floor area intended for occupancy shall be served by at least two exits.

ON Full: Piping systems shall be tested for leakage in conformance with Subsection 4.4.6. before being put into service and before reactivation when used on a seasonal basis.
ON Variations: Piping systems shall be tested for leakage in conformance with Subsection 4.4.6. before being put into service and before reactivation when used on a seasonal basis.

ON Full: Pneumatic test pressures applied to underground storage tanks shall be measured by an instrument calibrated in increments of not more than 1 kPa.
ON Variations: Pneumatic test pressures applied to underground storage tanks shall be measured by an instrument calibrated in increments of not more than 1 kPa.

ON Full: Fire pumps shall be tested annually at full rated capacity to ensure that they are capable of delivering the rated flow.
ON Variations: Fire pumps shall be tested annually at full rated capacity to ensure that they are capable of delivering the rated flow.

ON Full: Smoking shall not take place in areas described in Article 4.1.1.1., except as provided in Subsection 2.4.3.
ON Variations: Smoking shall not take place in areas described in Article 4.1.1.1., except as provided in Subsection 2.4.3.

ON Full: Except for wet vents, where a vent pipe is connected to a nominally horizontal soil or waste pipe, the connection shall be above the horizontal centre line of the soil or waste pipe.
ON Variations: Except for wet vents, where a vent pipe is connected to a nominally horizontal soil or waste pipe, the connection shall be above the horizontal centre line of the soil or waste pipe.

ON Full: If a second manual pull station or fire detector is operated in a fire alarm system with zone coding as permitted by Sentence (3), in a zone other than that for which the first alert signal was sounded, the coded alert signal for the first zone shall be completed before the coded alert signal for the second zone is repeated no fewer than four times.
ON Variations: If a second manual pull station or fire detector is operated in a fire alarm system with zone coding as permitted by Sentence (3), in a zone other than that for which the first alert signal was sounded, the coded alert signal for the first zone shall be completed before the coded alert signal for the second zone is repeated no fewer than four times.

ON Full: A circuit vented branch, including the fixture drain downstream of the circuit vent connection, shall be sized in accordance with Articles 7.4.10.7. and 7.4.10.8., except that it shall be not less than,(a) 2 in., where traps less than 2 in. in size are circuit vented, or (b) 3 in., where traps 2 in. in size or larger are circuit vented.
ON Variations: A circuit vented branch, including the fixture drain downstream of the circuit vent connection, shall be sized in accordance with Articles 7.4.10.7. and 7.4.10.8., except that it shall be not less than,(a) 2 in., where traps less than 2 in. in size are circuit vented, or (b) 3 in., where traps 2 in. in size or larger are circuit vented.

ON Full: A building classified as Group A, Division 2 is permitted to be of combustible construction or noncombustible construction used singly or in combination, provided, it is not more than 1 storey in building height, and except as permitted by Sentence (2), it has a building area not more than, 400 m2 if facing one street, 500 m2 if facing two streets, or 600 m2 if facing three streets.
ON Variations: A building classified as Group A, Division 2 is permitted to be of combustible construction or noncombustible construction used singly or in combination, provided, it is not more than 1 storey in building height, and except as permitted by Sentence (2), it has a building area not more than, 400 m2 if facing one street, 500 m2 if facing two streets, or 600 m2 if facing three streets.

ON Full: A building classified as Group A, Division 3 is permitted to be of combustible construction or noncombustible construction used singly or in combination, provided, except as permitted by Sentence 3.2.2.7.(1), the building is sprinklered, it is not more than 1 storey in building height, and it has a building area not more than 7 200 m2.
ON Variations: A building classified as Group A, Division 3 is permitted to be of combustible construction or noncombustible construction used singly or in combination, provided, except as permitted by Sentence 3.2.2.7.(1), the building is sprinklered, it is not more than 1 storey in building height, and it has a building area not more than 7 200 m2.

ON Full: After flushing and scrubbing contaminated areas very thoroughly to dissolve all material, the residue shall be washed away with hoses.
ON Variations: After flushing and scrubbing contaminated areas very thoroughly to dissolve all material, the residue shall be washed away with hoses.

ON Full: This Subsection applies to cooking, heating, ventilating, air-conditioning equipment and their associated appliances.
ON Variations: This Subsection applies to cooking, heating, ventilating, air-conditioning equipment and their associated appliances.

ON Full: There shall be sufficient supervisory staff available in care occupancies, care and treatment occupancies, detention occupancies and retirement homes to carry out the duties required in the fire safety plan.
ON Variations: There shall be sufficient supervisory staff available in care occupancies, care and treatment occupancies, detention occupancies and retirement homes to carry out the duties required in the fire safety plan.

ON Full: Sentence (1) does not apply to a firewall consisting of two separate wall assemblies each tied to its respective building frame but not to each other, provided each wall assembly is, a fire separation having one-half of the fire-resistance rating required for the firewall by Sentences 3.1.10.2.(1) and (2), and designed so that the collapse of one wall assembly will not cause the collapse of the other.
ON Variations: Sentence (1) does not apply to a firewall consisting of two separate wall assemblies each tied to its respective building frame but not to each other, provided each wall assembly is, a fire separation having one-half of the fire-resistance rating required for the firewall by Sentences 3.1.10.2.(1) and (2), and designed so that the collapse of one wall assembly will not cause the collapse of the other.

ON Full: Ventilation shall be provided to confine all flammable vapour concentrations exceeding 25% of the lower explosive limit to within 600 mm of the dip tank, drain board and freshly coated work.
ON Variations: Ventilation shall be provided to confine all flammable vapour concentrations exceeding 25% of the lower explosive limit to within 600 mm of the dip tank, drain board and freshly coated work.

ON Full: Noncombustible material described in Sentence (3) shall, (a) extend not less than 300 mm beyond the projection of a register opening, and (b) have turned-up edges.
ON Variations: Noncombustible material described in Sentence (3) shall, (a) extend not less than 300 mm beyond the projection of a register opening, and (b) have turned-up edges.

ON Full: Supplemental energy dissipation devices and other components of the supplemental energy dissipation system shall be designed in accordance with Sentence (1) with consideration of the following: (a) low-cycle, large-displacement degradation due to seismic loads, (b) high-cycle, small-displacement degradation due to wind, thermal, or other cyclic loads, (c) forces or displacements due to gravity loads, (d) adhesion of device parts due to corrosion or abrasion, biodegradation, moisture, or chemical exposure, (e) exposure to environmental conditions, including, but not limited to, temperature, humidity, moisture, radiation (e.g., ultraviolet light), and reactive or corrosive substances (e.g., salt water), (f) devices subject to failure due to low-cycle fatigue must resist wind forces without slip, movement, or inelastic cycling, (g) the range of thermal conditions, device wear, manufacturing tolerances, and other effects that cause device properties to vary during the design life of the device, and (h) connection points of devices must provide sufficient articulation to accommodate simultaneous longitudinal, lateral, and vertical displacements of the supplemental energy dissipation system.
ON Variations: Supplemental energy dissipation devices and other components of the supplemental energy dissipation system shall be designed in accordance with Sentence (1) with consideration of the following: (a) low-cycle, large-displacement degradation due to seismic loads, (b) high-cycle, small-displacement degradation due to wind, thermal, or other cyclic loads, (c) forces or displacements due to gravity loads, (d) adhesion of device parts due to corrosion or abrasion, biodegradation, moisture, or chemical exposure, (e) exposure to environmental conditions, including, but not limited to, temperature, humidity, moisture, radiation (e.g., ultraviolet light), and reactive or corrosive substances (e.g., salt water), (f) devices subject to failure due to low-cycle fatigue must resist wind forces without slip, movement, or inelastic cycling, (g) the range of thermal conditions, device wear, manufacturing tolerances, and other effects that cause device properties to vary during the design life of the device, and (h) connection points of devices must provide sufficient articulation to accommodate simultaneous longitudinal, lateral, and vertical displacements of the supplemental energy dissipation system.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentences (2) and (3), combustible interior wall and ceiling finishes described in Clause 3.1.13.1.(1)(b) that are not more than 1 mm thick are permitted in a building required to be of noncombustible construction.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentences (2) and (3), combustible interior wall and ceiling finishes described in Clause 3.1.13.1.(1)(b) that are not more than 1 mm thick are permitted in a building required to be of noncombustible construction.

ON Full: The outside air supply duct required by Sentence (5) shall not be considered to provide combustion and/or dilution air to fuel-burning appliances.
ON Variations: The outside air supply duct required by Sentence (5) shall not be considered to provide combustion and/or dilution air to fuel-burning appliances.

ON Full: The outside conditions to be used in designing heating, ventilating and air-conditioning systems shall be determined in conformance with MMAH Supplementary Standard SB-1, "Climatic and Seismic Data".
ON Variations: The outside conditions to be used in designing heating, ventilating and air-conditioning systems shall be determined in conformance with MMAH Supplementary Standard SB-1, "Climatic and Seismic Data".

ON Full: Where a protective enclosure is installed over the window well referred to in Sentence (5), such enclosure shall be openable from the inside without the use of keys, tools or special knowledge of the opening mechanism.
ON Variations: Where a protective enclosure is installed over the window well referred to in Sentence (5), such enclosure shall be openable from the inside without the use of keys, tools or special knowledge of the opening mechanism.

ON Full: Except as permitted by Sentence (2), spiral stairs shall not serve as an exit.
ON Variations: Except as permitted by Sentence (2), spiral stairs shall not serve as an exit.

ON Full: The hydraulic load from a fixture or equipment that produces a semi-continuous flow shall conform to Table 7.4.10.3.
ON Variations: The hydraulic load from a fixture or equipment that produces a semi-continuous flow shall conform to Table 7.4.10.3.

ON Full: The minimum aggregate width of exits serving floor areas intended for a care, care and treatment or detention occupancy shall be determined by multiplying the occupant load of the area served by 18.4 mm per person.
ON Variations: The minimum aggregate width of exits serving floor areas intended for a care, care and treatment or detention occupancy shall be determined by multiplying the occupant load of the area served by 18.4 mm per person.

ON Full: Except for stairs serving a house, an individual dwelling unit, service rooms or service spaces, a tactile attention indicator conforming to Article 3.8.3.18. shall be installed,(a) at the top of the stairs, starting one tread depth back from the edge of the top stair, and (b) at the leading edge of landings where a doorway opens onto stairs, starting one tread depth back from the edge of the landing.
ON Variations: Except for stairs serving a house, an individual dwelling unit, service rooms or service spaces, a tactile attention indicator conforming to Article 3.8.3.18. shall be installed,(a) at the top of the stairs, starting one tread depth back from the edge of the top stair, and (b) at the leading edge of landings where a doorway opens onto stairs, starting one tread depth back from the edge of the landing.

ON Full: The return-air system shall be designed so that the negative pressure from the circulating fan cannot affect the furnace combustion air supply nor draw combustion products from joints or openings in the furnace or flue pipe.
ON Variations: The return-air system shall be designed so that the negative pressure from the circulating fan cannot affect the furnace combustion air supply nor draw combustion products from joints or openings in the furnace or flue pipe.

ON Full: Every building in a camp for housing of workers providing sleeping accommodation for more than 30 persons shall be provided with a hose station that is protected from freezing and equipped with a hose of sufficient length so that every portion of the building is within the range of a hose stream.
ON Variations: Every building in a camp for housing of workers providing sleeping accommodation for more than 30 persons shall be provided with a hose station that is protected from freezing and equipped with a hose of sufficient length so that every portion of the building is within the range of a hose stream.

ON Full: Hay, straw, shavings, textiles, films or similar combustible materials shall not be used in the design and construction or as decorative features in outdoor public amusement areas unless approved provisions are made to control the hazard.
ON Variations: Hay, straw, shavings, textiles, films or similar combustible materials shall not be used in the design and construction or as decorative features in outdoor public amusement areas unless approved provisions are made to control the hazard.

ON Full: Except as permitted in Sentence (4), an underground station or an underground portion of a station in Sentence (2) shall be of noncombustible construction, and, floor assemblies shall be fire separations having a fire-resistance rating not less than 2 h, roof assemblies below ground level, shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 2 h, but a fire-resistance rating is not required where steel tunnel liners are left in place to form part of the assembly and the tunnel liners are in direct contact with soil, and all loadbearing walls, columns and arches shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the supported assembly.
ON Variations: Except as permitted in Sentence (4), an underground station or an underground portion of a station in Sentence (2) shall be of noncombustible construction, and, floor assemblies shall be fire separations having a fire-resistance rating not less than 2 h, roof assemblies below ground level, shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 2 h, but a fire-resistance rating is not required where steel tunnel liners are left in place to form part of the assembly and the tunnel liners are in direct contact with soil, and all loadbearing walls, columns and arches shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the supported assembly.

ON Full: Siding shall overlap not less than 1 mm per 16 mm width of lumber, but not less than,(a) 9.5 mm for matched siding, (b) 25 mm for lapped bevel siding, or (c) 12 mm for vertical battens.
ON Variations: Siding shall overlap not less than 1 mm per 16 mm width of lumber, but not less than,(a) 9.5 mm for matched siding, (b) 25 mm for lapped bevel siding, or (c) 12 mm for vertical battens.

ON Full: Sentences (1) and (3) do not apply if the existing door is approved and either does not endanger life safety or is modified to provide life safety.
ON Variations: Sentences (1) and (3) do not apply if the existing door is approved and either does not endanger life safety or is modified to provide life safety.

ON Full: A building classified as Group A, Division 3 is permitted to conform to Sentence (2) provided, it is not more than 2 storeys in building height, and it has a building area not more than the value in Table 3.2.2.30.
ON Variations: A building classified as Group A, Division 3 is permitted to conform to Sentence (2) provided, it is not more than 2 storeys in building height, and it has a building area not more than the value in Table 3.2.2.30.

ON Full: The building referred to in Sentence (1) is permitted to be of combustible construction or noncombustible construction used singly or in combination, and, floor assemblies shall be fire separations with a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min, and loadbearing walls, columns and arches shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the supported assembly.
ON Variations: The building referred to in Sentence (1) is permitted to be of combustible construction or noncombustible construction used singly or in combination, and, floor assemblies shall be fire separations with a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min, and loadbearing walls, columns and arches shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the supported assembly.

ON Full: All shower heads shall be supplied with potable water at a pressure of at least 140 kPa.
ON Variations: All shower heads shall be supplied with potable water at a pressure of at least 140 kPa.

ON Full: The method of installation and materials used for piping, valves and fittings shall conform to Section 4.4.
ON Variations: The method of installation and materials used for piping, valves and fittings shall conform to Section 4.4.

ON Full: Except for a modified pool and wave action pool, a public pool shall be equipped with overflow gutters or surface skimmers connected to the recirculation system that are capable of removing surface film from the surface of the water and withdrawing each day and discharging to the waste drains up to 15% of the total volume of pool water.
ON Variations: Except for a modified pool and wave action pool, a public pool shall be equipped with overflow gutters or surface skimmers connected to the recirculation system that are capable of removing surface film from the surface of the water and withdrawing each day and discharging to the waste drains up to 15% of the total volume of pool water.

ON Full: Every potable water system that supplies a fixture or tank that is not subject to pressures above atmospheric shall be protected against back-siphonage by a backflow preventer.
ON Variations: Every potable water system that supplies a fixture or tank that is not subject to pressures above atmospheric shall be protected against back-siphonage by a backflow preventer.

ON Full: Windows and skylights installed to provide required non-heating season ventilation shall conform to Article 9.32.2.1.
ON Variations: Windows and skylights installed to provide required non-heating season ventilation shall conform to Article 9.32.2.1.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence 3.11.6.1.(7) for a modified pool, openings in suction or gravity fittings shall, be such that the flow of water does not exceed 0.45 m/s and the velocity is calculated assuming all possible sources of suction flow are present at one time, and be such that every suction fitting located within 1 000 mm of the water surface, except for skimmers and gutter fittings, contain openings with a minimum aggregate area of 0.2 m2.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence 3.11.6.1.(7) for a modified pool, openings in suction or gravity fittings shall, be such that the flow of water does not exceed 0.45 m/s and the velocity is calculated assuming all possible sources of suction flow are present at one time, and be such that every suction fitting located within 1 000 mm of the water surface, except for skimmers and gutter fittings, contain openings with a minimum aggregate area of 0.2 m2.

ON Full: Every direct flush valve shall,(a) open fully and close positively under service pressure, (b) complete its cycle of operation automatically, (c) be provided with a means of regulating the volume of water that it discharges, and (d) be provided with a vacuum breaker unless the fixture is designed so that back-siphonage cannot occur.
ON Variations: Every direct flush valve shall,(a) open fully and close positively under service pressure, (b) complete its cycle of operation automatically, (c) be provided with a means of regulating the volume of water that it discharges, and (d) be provided with a vacuum breaker unless the fixture is designed so that back-siphonage cannot occur.

ON Full: No door closer or other device shall be installed so as to reduce the clear height of a doorway to less than 1 980 mm.
ON Variations: No door closer or other device shall be installed so as to reduce the clear height of a doorway to less than 1 980 mm.

ON Full: The requirements of this Subsection apply to all food premises.
ON Variations: The requirements of this Subsection apply to all food premises.

ON Full: In storage areas that exceed 200 m2, main access aisles referred to in Sentence (4) shall be accessible from at least two fire department access points, which shall be located such that, in the event one becomes unusable due to fire, the other will still allow emergency responders to access the building.
ON Variations: In storage areas that exceed 200 m2, main access aisles referred to in Sentence (4) shall be accessible from at least two fire department access points, which shall be located such that, in the event one becomes unusable due to fire, the other will still allow emergency responders to access the building.

ON Full: Except as otherwise specifically stated in this Part, this Section applies to masonry fireplaces constructed on site.
ON Variations: Except as otherwise specifically stated in this Part, this Section applies to masonry fireplaces constructed on site.

ON Full: Except as permitted in Article 3.3.2.10., pallets and dunnage not in use shall be stored outdoors and be located so as to avoid an exposure hazard.
ON Variations: Except as permitted in Article 3.3.2.10., pallets and dunnage not in use shall be stored outdoors and be located so as to avoid an exposure hazard.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (2), the performance level of a building or part of a building is reduced where the existing structural floor and roof framing systems and their supporting members are not adequate to support the proposed dead loads and live loads of the new major occupancy that the building is to support.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (2), the performance level of a building or part of a building is reduced where the existing structural floor and roof framing systems and their supporting members are not adequate to support the proposed dead loads and live loads of the new major occupancy that the building is to support.

ON Full: Except as permitted by Sentences (2) to (4), no fixture, turnstile or construction shall project into or be fixed within the required width of an exit.
ON Variations: Except as permitted by Sentences (2) to (4), no fixture, turnstile or construction shall project into or be fixed within the required width of an exit.

ON Full: Where storage tanks for flammable liquids or combustible liquids are located outside of storage rooms conforming to Subsection 4.3.13., provision shall be made, in conformance with Subsection 4.1.6., to contain a spill equal to at least 100% of the volume of the largest storage tank or to drain away spilled flammable liquids or combustible liquids, all electrical equipment and wiring in the vicinity of the storage tank and the exterior vent shall be installed in conformance with Subsection 4.1.4., and the area in which the storage tank is located shall be ventilated in conformance with Subsection 4.1.7., where designated a Class I, Zone 0, 1 or 2 hazardous location under the Electrical Safety Code made under the Electricity Act, 1998.
ON Variations: Where storage tanks for flammable liquids or combustible liquids are located outside of storage rooms conforming to Subsection 4.3.13., provision shall be made, in conformance with Subsection 4.1.6., to contain a spill equal to at least 100% of the volume of the largest storage tank or to drain away spilled flammable liquids or combustible liquids, all electrical equipment and wiring in the vicinity of the storage tank and the exterior vent shall be installed in conformance with Subsection 4.1.4., and the area in which the storage tank is located shall be ventilated in conformance with Subsection 4.1.7., where designated a Class I, Zone 0, 1 or 2 hazardous location under the Electrical Safety Code made under the Electricity Act, 1998.

ON Full: Portable extinguishers that are provided to protect a hazardous occupancy shall be those required in this Section for fighting Class A fires, Class B fires, Class C fires, Class D fires or Class K fires.
ON Variations: Portable extinguishers that are provided to protect a hazardous occupancy shall be those required in this Section for fighting Class A fires, Class B fires, Class C fires, Class D fires or Class K fires.

ON Full: A laboratory shall be separated from other parts of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 1 h.
ON Variations: A laboratory shall be separated from other parts of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 1 h.

ON Full: The requirements of this Article do not apply where foamed plastic insulation is used in an exterior wall assembly of a building and the insulation is protected in conformance with Sentences 3.2.3.8.(1) and (2).
ON Variations: The requirements of this Article do not apply where foamed plastic insulation is used in an exterior wall assembly of a building and the insulation is protected in conformance with Sentences 3.2.3.8.(1) and (2).

ON Full: Except as provided in Section 10.4., a building or part of a building subject to a change of major occupancy shall conform to the requirements of Subsection 3.2.6., Sections 3.7., 3.11. and 3.12., Sentences 6.2.2.1.(2), 6.2.3.9.(1) and 6.2.4.7.(1), Subsections 9.5.1. and 9.5.3. to 9.5.10., Sentences 9.6.1.4.(3), (4) and (7) to (9), Article 9.7.2.3., Sentences 9.8.8.1.(5) to (9) and 9.9.10.1.(1) to (7), Subsection 9.10.17., Sections 9.31. and 9.32., and Subsections 9.34.1. to 9.34.3. as they apply to the new major occupancy that the building or part of a building is to support.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Section 10.4., a building or part of a building subject to a change of major occupancy shall conform to the requirements of Subsection 3.2.6., Sections 3.7., 3.11. and 3.12., Sentences 6.2.2.1.(2), 6.2.3.9.(1) and 6.2.4.7.(1), Subsections 9.5.1. and 9.5.3. to 9.5.10., Sentences 9.6.1.4.(3), (4) and (7) to (9), Article 9.7.2.3., Sentences 9.8.8.1.(5) to (9) and 9.9.10.1.(1) to (7), Subsection 9.10.17., Sections 9.31. and 9.32., and Subsections 9.34.1. to 9.34.3. as they apply to the new major occupancy that the building or part of a building is to support.

ON Full: The fire safety plan shall include provisions respecting access within the fire department access routes for water supply systems or other measures that are approved under Article 3.2.1.10.
ON Variations: The fire safety plan shall include provisions respecting access within the fire department access routes for water supply systems or other measures that are approved under Article 3.2.1.10.

ON Full: If rows of seats discharge directly into the converging aisle, the width required by Sentence (8) shall be increased by 25 mm for each metre of length of the aisle where the rows of seats discharge into the aisle.
ON Variations: If rows of seats discharge directly into the converging aisle, the width required by Sentence (8) shall be increased by 25 mm for each metre of length of the aisle where the rows of seats discharge into the aisle.

ON Full: A normally occupied floor area that is not required by Article 3.8.2.1. to have a barrier-free path of travel shall meet the following requirements: interior walking surfaces throughout the normally occupied floor area shall comply with Clauses (2)(a) to (e), and where the headroom of an area in a corridor or aisle in the normally occupied floor area is reduced to less than 1 980 mm, a guardrail or other barrier with its leading edge at or below 680 mm from the finished floor shall be provided. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: A normally occupied floor area that is not required by Article 3.8.2.1. to have a barrier-free path of travel shall meet the following requirements: interior walking surfaces throughout the normally occupied floor area shall comply with Clauses (2)(a) to (e), and where the headroom of an area in a corridor or aisle in the normally occupied floor area is reduced to less than 1 980 mm, a guardrail or other barrier with its leading edge at or below 680 mm from the finished floor shall be provided. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: A building used for the storage of ammonium nitrate shall not be more than 1 storey in building height.
ON Variations: A building used for the storage of ammonium nitrate shall not be more than 1 storey in building height.

ON Full: In buildings containing a hotel, flow and pressure tests shall be conducted annually at the highest and most remote hose valve or hose connection to verify that the water supply for the standpipe system is provided as originally designed.
ON Variations: In buildings containing a hotel, flow and pressure tests shall be conducted annually at the highest and most remote hose valve or hose connection to verify that the water supply for the standpipe system is provided as originally designed.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (2), where a building component or assembly is exposed to precipitation, the component or assembly shall,(a) minimize ingress of precipitation into the component or assembly, and (b) prevent ingress of precipitation into interior space.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (2), where a building component or assembly is exposed to precipitation, the component or assembly shall,(a) minimize ingress of precipitation into the component or assembly, and (b) prevent ingress of precipitation into interior space.

ON Full: Handrails installed in addition to required handrails need not comply with Sentence (7).
ON Variations: Handrails installed in addition to required handrails need not comply with Sentence (7).

ON Full: Except as required in Sentences (8) and (9), where the inner and outer wythes of cavity walls are tied with individual wire ties, the ties shall be spaced not more than 900 mm apart horizontally and 400 mm apart vertically.
ON Variations: Except as required in Sentences (8) and (9), where the inner and outer wythes of cavity walls are tied with individual wire ties, the ties shall be spaced not more than 900 mm apart horizontally and 400 mm apart vertically.

ON Full: Cement-mortar lining for cast iron water pipes shall conform to ANSI/AWWA C104 / A21.4, "Cement-Mortar Lining for Ductile-Iron Pipe and Fittings".
ON Variations: Cement-mortar lining for cast iron water pipes shall conform to ANSI/AWWA C104 / A21.4, "Cement-Mortar Lining for Ductile-Iron Pipe and Fittings".

ON Full: A storage yard shall be provided with a hydrant system or mobile pumping equipment that can reach all parts of the storage yard with no more than 60 m of hose.
ON Variations: A storage yard shall be provided with a hydrant system or mobile pumping equipment that can reach all parts of the storage yard with no more than 60 m of hose.

ON Full: Dust-collecting systems shall be designed for an air velocity in the ducts of at least 1068 m/min.
ON Variations: Dust-collecting systems shall be designed for an air velocity in the ducts of at least 1068 m/min.

ON Full: Every seismically isolated structure and every portion thereof shall be analyzed and designed in accordance with, (a) the loads and requirements prescribed in this Article and Article 4.1.8.20., (b) other applicable requirements of this Subsection, and (c) appropriate engineering principles and current engineering practice. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Every seismically isolated structure and every portion thereof shall be analyzed and designed in accordance with, (a) the loads and requirements prescribed in this Article and Article 4.1.8.20., (b) other applicable requirements of this Subsection, and (c) appropriate engineering principles and current engineering practice. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Only grade 304/304L or 316/316L stainless steel pipe shall be used.
ON Variations: Only grade 304/304L or 316/316L stainless steel pipe shall be used.

ON Full: Ca is permitted to be calculated in accordance with Article 4.1.6.5. for larger projections. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Ca is permitted to be calculated in accordance with Article 4.1.6.5. for larger projections. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Grout used for reinforced masonry shall be placed in accordance with the requirements of CSA A371, "Masonry Construction for Buildings".
ON Variations: Grout used for reinforced masonry shall be placed in accordance with the requirements of CSA A371, "Masonry Construction for Buildings".

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentences (2), (4) and (5), guards shall be designed to resist the specified loads prescribed in Table 9.8.8.2.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentences (2), (4) and (5), guards shall be designed to resist the specified loads prescribed in Table 9.8.8.2.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (3), a compliance alternative to a requirement contained in Part 3, 4, 6 or 8 that is shown in Tables 11.5.1.1.A., 11.5.1.1.B., 11.5.1.1.C., 11.5.1.1.D/E. or 11.5.1.1.F. may be substituted for the requirement where the chief building official is satisfied that compliance with the requirement is impracticable because,(a) of structural or construction difficulties, or (b) it is detrimental to the preservation of a heritage building.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (3), a compliance alternative to a requirement contained in Part 3, 4, 6 or 8 that is shown in Tables 11.5.1.1.A., 11.5.1.1.B., 11.5.1.1.C., 11.5.1.1.D/E. or 11.5.1.1.F. may be substituted for the requirement where the chief building official is satisfied that compliance with the requirement is impracticable because,(a) of structural or construction difficulties, or (b) it is detrimental to the preservation of a heritage building.

ON Full: Where there is a building trap, the discharge pipe from the equipment shall be connected to the sanitary building drain downstream of the trap.
ON Variations: Where there is a building trap, the discharge pipe from the equipment shall be connected to the sanitary building drain downstream of the trap.

ON Full: Where the sleeping area within a live/work unit is on a mezzanine with no obstructions more than 1 070 mm above the floor, the window required in Sentence (1) may be provided on the main level of the live/work unit provided the mezzanine is not more than 25% of the area of the live/work unit or 20 m2, whichever is less, and an unobstructed direct path of travel is provided from the mezzanine to this window.
ON Variations: Where the sleeping area within a live/work unit is on a mezzanine with no obstructions more than 1 070 mm above the floor, the window required in Sentence (1) may be provided on the main level of the live/work unit provided the mezzanine is not more than 25% of the area of the live/work unit or 20 m2, whichever is less, and an unobstructed direct path of travel is provided from the mezzanine to this window.

ON Full: Cement shall meet the requirements of CSA A3001, "Cementitious Materials for Use in Concrete".
ON Variations: Cement shall meet the requirements of CSA A3001, "Cementitious Materials for Use in Concrete".

ON Full: Storage bins for solid fuel shall be designed and constructed so that the air temperature in the bin or the surface temperature of any part of the floor or walls is below 50°C.
ON Variations: Storage bins for solid fuel shall be designed and constructed so that the air temperature in the bin or the surface temperature of any part of the floor or walls is below 50°C.

ON Full: Except as provided in Article 7.5.7.1., the minimum size of an offset relief vent is permitted to be one size smaller than the size of the stack vent.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Article 7.5.7.1., the minimum size of an offset relief vent is permitted to be one size smaller than the size of the stack vent.

ON Full: Except as otherwise permitted in Sentences (2) and (3), every public pool shall be equipped with dressing rooms, locker rooms, shower heads, water closets, urinals, lavatories and drinking fountains that shall be designed, constructed and equipped to comply with Sentences (4) to (14).
ON Variations: Except as otherwise permitted in Sentences (2) and (3), every public pool shall be equipped with dressing rooms, locker rooms, shower heads, water closets, urinals, lavatories and drinking fountains that shall be designed, constructed and equipped to comply with Sentences (4) to (14).

ON Full: Buildings and their structural members made of plain and reinforced masonry shall conform to CSA S304, "Design of Masonry Structures".
ON Variations: Buildings and their structural members made of plain and reinforced masonry shall conform to CSA S304, "Design of Masonry Structures".

ON Full: Elevator machine rooms shall be equipped to provide illumination to an average level of not less than 100 lx at floor level.
ON Variations: Elevator machine rooms shall be equipped to provide illumination to an average level of not less than 100 lx at floor level.

ON Full: Required handrails shall be continuous throughout the length of, a ramp, and a flight, from the bottom riser to the top riser.
ON Variations: Required handrails shall be continuous throughout the length of, a ramp, and a flight, from the bottom riser to the top riser.

ON Full: Portable extinguishers shall be located so that they are easily seen and shall be accessible at all times, except as permitted in Sentences (2) and (3).
ON Variations: Portable extinguishers shall be located so that they are easily seen and shall be accessible at all times, except as permitted in Sentences (2) and (3).

ON Full: Written records shall be kept of inspections, maintenance and testing in conformance with Subsection 1.1.2.
ON Variations: Written records shall be kept of inspections, maintenance and testing in conformance with Subsection 1.1.2.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (12), the building shall be of noncombustible construction, and, floor assemblies shall be fire separations with a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, mezzanines shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, roof assemblies shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, and all loadbearing walls, columns and arches shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the supported assembly.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (12), the building shall be of noncombustible construction, and, floor assemblies shall be fire separations with a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, mezzanines shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, roof assemblies shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, and all loadbearing walls, columns and arches shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the supported assembly.

ON Full: Compliance with the required STC ratings shall be demonstrated through,(a) measurements carried out in accordance with Sentence 5.8.1.2.(1), or (b) the construction of separating assemblies conforming to Table 1 or 2 of MMAH Supplementary Standard SB-3, "Fire and Sound Resistance of Building Assemblies", as applicable.
ON Variations: Compliance with the required STC ratings shall be demonstrated through,(a) measurements carried out in accordance with Sentence 5.8.1.2.(1), or (b) the construction of separating assemblies conforming to Table 1 or 2 of MMAH Supplementary Standard SB-3, "Fire and Sound Resistance of Building Assemblies", as applicable.

ON Full: Structures designed in accordance with this Article need not comply with the seismic requirements stated in the applicable design standard referenced in Section 4.3.
ON Variations: Structures designed in accordance with this Article need not comply with the seismic requirements stated in the applicable design standard referenced in Section 4.3.

ON Full: Where a door from a service room opens onto a means of egress less than 5 m wide, the service room shall be sprinklered, or there shall be a vestibule between the service room and the means of egress.
ON Variations: Where a door from a service room opens onto a means of egress less than 5 m wide, the service room shall be sprinklered, or there shall be a vestibule between the service room and the means of egress.

ON Full: The requirements based on occupant load shall not apply.
ON Variations: The requirements based on occupant load shall not apply.

ON Full: All portions of a barrier-free path of travel shall be equipped to provide a level of illumination in accordance with Sentence 3.2.7.1.(1).
ON Variations: All portions of a barrier-free path of travel shall be equipped to provide a level of illumination in accordance with Sentence 3.2.7.1.(1).

ON Full: In addition to the requirements of Section 6.2, pressurized-water portable extinguishers having a rating of 2A or larger shall be installed.
ON Variations: In addition to the requirements of Section 6.2, pressurized-water portable extinguishers having a rating of 2A or larger shall be installed.

ON Full: Escalators forming part of a required means of egress shall, where equipped to run reverse to the direction of egress travel, be capable of being stopped remotely and locally, and have a vertical rise not more than 12 m between floors or landings.
ON Variations: Escalators forming part of a required means of egress shall, where equipped to run reverse to the direction of egress travel, be capable of being stopped remotely and locally, and have a vertical rise not more than 12 m between floors or landings.

ON Full: If no fire department standpipe connection exists in a building under demolition that is 4 storeys or more in building height, a temporary standpipe connection shall be provided.
ON Variations: If no fire department standpipe connection exists in a building under demolition that is 4 storeys or more in building height, a temporary standpipe connection shall be provided.

ON Full: Except for houses, combustible projections on the exterior of a wall that are more than 1 000 mm above ground level, such as balconies, platforms, canopies, eave projections and stairs, and that could expose an adjacent building to fire spread, shall not be permitted within,(a) 1.2 m of a property line or the centre line of a public way, or (b) 2.4 m of a combustible projection on another building on the same property.
ON Variations: Except for houses, combustible projections on the exterior of a wall that are more than 1 000 mm above ground level, such as balconies, platforms, canopies, eave projections and stairs, and that could expose an adjacent building to fire spread, shall not be permitted within,(a) 1.2 m of a property line or the centre line of a public way, or (b) 2.4 m of a combustible projection on another building on the same property.

ON Full: Beams described in Sentence (1) shall at least meet the requirements for Grade 350 W steel in CSA G40.21, "Structural Quality Steel".
ON Variations: Beams described in Sentence (1) shall at least meet the requirements for Grade 350 W steel in CSA G40.21, "Structural Quality Steel".

ON Full: Provision shall be made to prevent spillage resulting from the disconnection of hoses.
ON Variations: Provision shall be made to prevent spillage resulting from the disconnection of hoses.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (2) and Article 11.3.3.2., construction may be carried out to maintain the existing performance level of all or part of an existing building, by the reuse, relocation or extension of the same or similar materials or components, to retain the existing character, structural uniqueness, heritage value, or aesthetic appearance of all or part of the building, if the construction will not adversely affect the early warning and evacuation systems, fire separations or the structural adequacy or will not create an unhealthy environment in the building.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (2) and Article 11.3.3.2., construction may be carried out to maintain the existing performance level of all or part of an existing building, by the reuse, relocation or extension of the same or similar materials or components, to retain the existing character, structural uniqueness, heritage value, or aesthetic appearance of all or part of the building, if the construction will not adversely affect the early warning and evacuation systems, fire separations or the structural adequacy or will not create an unhealthy environment in the building.

ON Full: Floors and roofs acting as diaphragms shall satisfy the requirements for diaphragms stated in Article 4.1.8.15.
ON Variations: Floors and roofs acting as diaphragms shall satisfy the requirements for diaphragms stated in Article 4.1.8.15.

ON Full: Cables on the ground in areas used by the public in an air-supported structure shall be placed in trenches or protected by covers to prevent damage from traffic.
ON Variations: Cables on the ground in areas used by the public in an air-supported structure shall be placed in trenches or protected by covers to prevent damage from traffic.

ON Full: When fully open, doors described in Sentence (1) shall not decrease the required exit width by more than,(a) 100 mm in exit corridors, and (b) 50 mm for other exit facilities.
ON Variations: When fully open, doors described in Sentence (1) shall not decrease the required exit width by more than,(a) 100 mm in exit corridors, and (b) 50 mm for other exit facilities.

ON Full: The requirements of Sentence (1) may be achieved by replenishment as the result of the normal test program required in Article 6.7.1.1.
ON Variations: The requirements of Sentence (1) may be achieved by replenishment as the result of the normal test program required in Article 6.7.1.1.

ON Full: In a building not more than 3 storeys in building height, if not more than two dwelling units are contained together with a Group E major occupancy, the fire-resistance rating of the fire separation between the two major occupancies need not be more than 1 h.
ON Variations: In a building not more than 3 storeys in building height, if not more than two dwelling units are contained together with a Group E major occupancy, the fire-resistance rating of the fire separation between the two major occupancies need not be more than 1 h.

ON Full: Spilled ammonium nitrate material shall be disposed of in conformance with Sentences (2) to (5).
ON Variations: Spilled ammonium nitrate material shall be disposed of in conformance with Sentences (2) to (5).

ON Full: Bridging specified in Table A-2 shall consist of,(a) bridging as described in Sentence (2), or (b) 38 mm solid blocking located not more than 2.1 m from each support or other rows of bridging and securely fastened between the joists.
ON Variations: Bridging specified in Table A-2 shall consist of,(a) bridging as described in Sentence (2), or (b) 38 mm solid blocking located not more than 2.1 m from each support or other rows of bridging and securely fastened between the joists.

ON Full: Except as required by Sentence (8) and as permitted by Sentences (3) and (4), a dwelling unit containing more than 1 storey shall have an exit door or an egress door opening directly into a public access to exit from the uppermost storey and from the lowest storey of the dwelling unit so that each storey is served by an exit or egress door located not more than 1.5 m above or below its floor level.
ON Variations: Except as required by Sentence (8) and as permitted by Sentences (3) and (4), a dwelling unit containing more than 1 storey shall have an exit door or an egress door opening directly into a public access to exit from the uppermost storey and from the lowest storey of the dwelling unit so that each storey is served by an exit or egress door located not more than 1.5 m above or below its floor level.

ON Full: This Section applies to every public pool.
ON Variations: This Section applies to every public pool.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (2), the size of every fixture outlet pipe shall conform to Table 7.4.9.3.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (2), the size of every fixture outlet pipe shall conform to Table 7.4.9.3.

ON Full: At least one portable extinguisher having a rating of 80B:C shall be provided in the vicinity of pumps and ancillary equipment used for the transfer of flammable liquids or combustible liquids.
ON Variations: At least one portable extinguisher having a rating of 80B:C shall be provided in the vicinity of pumps and ancillary equipment used for the transfer of flammable liquids or combustible liquids.

ON Full: Supervisory staff shall be instructed in the fire emergency procedures as described in the fire safety plan before they are given any responsibility for fire safety.
ON Variations: Supervisory staff shall be instructed in the fire emergency procedures as described in the fire safety plan before they are given any responsibility for fire safety.

ON Full: If no standpipe system exists in a building under demolition that is 8 storeys or more in building height, a temporary standpipe shall be provided.
ON Variations: If no standpipe system exists in a building under demolition that is 8 storeys or more in building height, a temporary standpipe shall be provided.

ON Full: In all normally occupied spaces, the fire alarm signal sound pressure level, shall be not more than 100 dBA when measured at a distance of 3 m from the device, or is permitted to be more than 100 dBA provided the sound pressure level measured 2 000 mm above floor level is not more than 100 dBA.
ON Variations: In all normally occupied spaces, the fire alarm signal sound pressure level, shall be not more than 100 dBA when measured at a distance of 3 m from the device, or is permitted to be more than 100 dBA provided the sound pressure level measured 2 000 mm above floor level is not more than 100 dBA.

ON Full: The minimum specified horizontal load applied outward at the minimum required height of every required guard shall be, (a) 3.0 kN/m for open viewing stands without fixed seats and for means of egress in grandstands, stadia, bleachers and arenas, (b) a concentrated load of 1.0 kN applied at any point so as to produce the most critical effect, for access ways to equipment platforms, contiguous stairs and similar areas where the gathering of many people is improbable, and (c) 0.75 kN/m or a concentrated load of 1.0 kN applied at any point so as to produce the most critical effect, whichever governs for locations other than those described in Clauses (a) and (b).
ON Variations: The minimum specified horizontal load applied outward at the minimum required height of every required guard shall be, (a) 3.0 kN/m for open viewing stands without fixed seats and for means of egress in grandstands, stadia, bleachers and arenas, (b) a concentrated load of 1.0 kN applied at any point so as to produce the most critical effect, for access ways to equipment platforms, contiguous stairs and similar areas where the gathering of many people is improbable, and (c) 0.75 kN/m or a concentrated load of 1.0 kN applied at any point so as to produce the most critical effect, whichever governs for locations other than those described in Clauses (a) and (b).

ON Full: Storage tanks are permitted to be buried in piers and wharves of the solid-fill type provided they conform to Subsections 4.3.8. to 4.3.11.
ON Variations: Storage tanks are permitted to be buried in piers and wharves of the solid-fill type provided they conform to Subsections 4.3.8. to 4.3.11.

ON Full: In a two stage fire alarm system described in Sentence 3.2.4.4.(2), the same audible signal devices are permitted to be used to sound the alert signals and the alarm signals.
ON Variations: In a two stage fire alarm system described in Sentence 3.2.4.4.(2), the same audible signal devices are permitted to be used to sound the alert signals and the alarm signals.

ON Full: The sill and header for openings described in Sentence (1) shall consist of a runner track with right angle bends made on each end so as to extend 300 mm above the header or below the sill and fastened to the studs.
ON Variations: The sill and header for openings described in Sentence (1) shall consist of a runner track with right angle bends made on each end so as to extend 300 mm above the header or below the sill and fastened to the studs.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentences (2) and (3), the slopes on which roof coverings may be applied shall conform to Table 9.26.3.1.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentences (2) and (3), the slopes on which roof coverings may be applied shall conform to Table 9.26.3.1.

ON Full: The design, fabrication, assembly and inspection of piping and pumping systems containing distilled beverage alcohols shall be suitable for the anticipated maximum working pressures, operating temperatures, internal corrosion conditions and structural stresses to which they could be subjected.
ON Variations: The design, fabrication, assembly and inspection of piping and pumping systems containing distilled beverage alcohols shall be suitable for the anticipated maximum working pressures, operating temperatures, internal corrosion conditions and structural stresses to which they could be subjected.

ON Full: If a door is installed so that it could damage the integrity of a fire separation if its swing is unrestricted, door stops shall be installed to prevent the damage.
ON Variations: If a door is installed so that it could damage the integrity of a fire separation if its swing is unrestricted, door stops shall be installed to prevent the damage.

ON Full: A site evaluation shall be conducted on every site where a new or replacement sewage system is to be installed. (See Appendix A.)
