ON Variations: A site evaluation shall be conducted on every site where a new or replacement sewage system is to be installed. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Piles or containers with metal shavings, turnings and dusts shall be stored in an area separate from other salvage materials and identified with warning signs.
ON Variations: Piles or containers with metal shavings, turnings and dusts shall be stored in an area separate from other salvage materials and identified with warning signs.

ON Full: Where panel-type underlay is required to be installed over plywood, or OSB or waferboard, the joints in the underlay shall be offset at least 200 mm from the joints in the underlying subfloor.
ON Variations: Where panel-type underlay is required to be installed over plywood, or OSB or waferboard, the joints in the underlay shall be offset at least 200 mm from the joints in the underlying subfloor.

ON Full: Material that is susceptible to changes in volume due to freezing shall not be used as fill beneath floors-on-ground that will be subjected to freezing temperatures.
ON Variations: Material that is susceptible to changes in volume due to freezing shall not be used as fill beneath floors-on-ground that will be subjected to freezing temperatures.

ON Full: The entraining load for each platform shall be the sum of the entraining loads for each track serving that platform and the entraining load for each track shall be based on the entraining load per train headway multiplied by, a factor of 1.3 to account for surges, and in the peak direction for each route, an additional factor of 2 to account for a missed headway.
ON Variations: The entraining load for each platform shall be the sum of the entraining loads for each track serving that platform and the entraining load for each track shall be based on the entraining load per train headway multiplied by, a factor of 1.3 to account for surges, and in the peak direction for each route, an additional factor of 2 to account for a missed headway.

ON Full: Make-up water may be supplied to the non-potable water system by,(a) a reduced pressure backflow preventer, or (b) an air gap.
ON Variations: Make-up water may be supplied to the non-potable water system by,(a) a reduced pressure backflow preventer, or (b) an air gap.

ON Full: Where precipitation can accumulate on sloped or horizontal assemblies, provision shall be made for drainage conforming with Section 7.4.
ON Variations: Where precipitation can accumulate on sloped or horizontal assemblies, provision shall be made for drainage conforming with Section 7.4.

ON Full: The flame-spread rating requirements contained in the standards listed in Sentence (1) shall not apply. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: The flame-spread rating requirements contained in the standards listed in Sentence (1) shall not apply. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Cast iron fittings for cast iron or ductile-iron water pipes shall conform to ANSI/AWWA C110 / A21.10, "Ductile-Iron and Gray-Iron Fittings".
ON Variations: Cast iron fittings for cast iron or ductile-iron water pipes shall conform to ANSI/AWWA C110 / A21.10, "Ductile-Iron and Gray-Iron Fittings".

ON Full: A panel-type underlay shall be provided under resilient flooring, parquet flooring, ceramic tile, felted-synthetic-fibre floor coverings or carpeting laid over lumber subflooring.
ON Variations: A panel-type underlay shall be provided under resilient flooring, parquet flooring, ceramic tile, felted-synthetic-fibre floor coverings or carpeting laid over lumber subflooring.

ON Full: A chimney flue shall extend not less than,(a) 900 mm above the highest point at which the chimney comes in contact with the roof, and (b) 600 mm above the highest roof surface or structure within 3 m of the chimney. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: A chimney flue shall extend not less than,(a) 900 mm above the highest point at which the chimney comes in contact with the roof, and (b) 600 mm above the highest roof surface or structure within 3 m of the chimney. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Spray booth baffle plates shall be of noncombustible material and be removable or arranged to facilitate cleaning.
ON Variations: Spray booth baffle plates shall be of noncombustible material and be removable or arranged to facilitate cleaning.

ON Full: Where walls required to provide protection from precipitation comprise assemblies with first and second planes of protection,(a) the first plane of protection shall, (i) consist of cladding, with appropriate trim, accessory pieces and fasteners, and (ii) be designed and constructed to minimize the passage of rain and snow into the wall by minimizing holes and managing precipitation ingress caused by kinetic energy of raindrops, surface tension, capillarity, gravity, and air pressure differences, (b) the second plane of protection shall be designed and constructed to, (i) intercept all precipitation that gets past the first plane of protection, and (ii) effectively dissipate any precipitation to the exterior, and (c) the protection provided by the first and second planes of protection shall be maintained at, (i) wall penetrations created by the installation of components and services such as windows, doors, ventilation ducts, piping, wiring and electrical outlets, and (ii) the interface with other wall assemblies.
ON Variations: Where walls required to provide protection from precipitation comprise assemblies with first and second planes of protection,(a) the first plane of protection shall, (i) consist of cladding, with appropriate trim, accessory pieces and fasteners, and (ii) be designed and constructed to minimize the passage of rain and snow into the wall by minimizing holes and managing precipitation ingress caused by kinetic energy of raindrops, surface tension, capillarity, gravity, and air pressure differences, (b) the second plane of protection shall be designed and constructed to, (i) intercept all precipitation that gets past the first plane of protection, and (ii) effectively dissipate any precipitation to the exterior, and (c) the protection provided by the first and second planes of protection shall be maintained at, (i) wall penetrations created by the installation of components and services such as windows, doors, ventilation ducts, piping, wiring and electrical outlets, and (ii) the interface with other wall assemblies.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (8), the performance level of a building or part of a building is reduced in an existing building of combustible construction where,(a) the occupancy is changed to a residential occupancy in all or part of the building, and (b) if the building was new, it would have been required to be of noncombustible construction or to be constructed in accordance with Article 3.2.2.43A. or 3.2.2.50A.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (8), the performance level of a building or part of a building is reduced in an existing building of combustible construction where,(a) the occupancy is changed to a residential occupancy in all or part of the building, and (b) if the building was new, it would have been required to be of noncombustible construction or to be constructed in accordance with Article 3.2.2.43A. or 3.2.2.50A.

ON Full: Prior notification of water flow or other tests to be made to a sprinkler system shall be given to parties who could be affected by an alarm.
ON Variations: Prior notification of water flow or other tests to be made to a sprinkler system shall be given to parties who could be affected by an alarm.

ON Full: A buried water service pipe may pass under a building drain or building sewer if,(a) a vertical separation of not less than 500 mm is provided between the invert of the building drain or building sewer and the crown of the water service pipe, (b) adequate structural support is provided for the building drain or building sewer to prevent excessive deflection of joints and settling, and (c) the length of the water service pipe is located so that there are no joints within 2 440 mm measured horizontally from the intersection with the building drain or building sewer.
ON Variations: A buried water service pipe may pass under a building drain or building sewer if,(a) a vertical separation of not less than 500 mm is provided between the invert of the building drain or building sewer and the crown of the water service pipe, (b) adequate structural support is provided for the building drain or building sewer to prevent excessive deflection of joints and settling, and (c) the length of the water service pipe is located so that there are no joints within 2 440 mm measured horizontally from the intersection with the building drain or building sewer.

ON Full: Runners for interior and exterior non-loadbearing walls shall have a thickness of not less than the thickness of the corresponding studs and shall have not less than 30 mm flanges.
ON Variations: Runners for interior and exterior non-loadbearing walls shall have a thickness of not less than the thickness of the corresponding studs and shall have not less than 30 mm flanges.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (2), this Section applies to those process plants, including refineries, which contain industrial processes involving flammable liquids or combustible liquids.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (2), this Section applies to those process plants, including refineries, which contain industrial processes involving flammable liquids or combustible liquids.

ON Full: Except as permitted by Sentence (12), every door that provides a barrier-free path of travel through a barrier-free entrance required by Article 3.8.1.2. shall be equipped with a power door operator if the entrance serves a building containing a Group A, Group B, Division 2 or 3, Group C, Group D or Group E occupancy. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Except as permitted by Sentence (12), every door that provides a barrier-free path of travel through a barrier-free entrance required by Article 3.8.1.2. shall be equipped with a power door operator if the entrance serves a building containing a Group A, Group B, Division 2 or 3, Group C, Group D or Group E occupancy. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Measures to control spilled flammable liquids and combustible liquids shall be provided in conformance with Subsection 4.1.6.
ON Variations: Measures to control spilled flammable liquids and combustible liquids shall be provided in conformance with Subsection 4.1.6.

ON Full: Where an interior wall projects through a ceiling or extends to become an exterior wall, spaces in the wall shall be blocked to provide continuity across those spaces with the air barrier system in the abutting walls or ceiling by,(a) sealing each air barrier to the blocking, or (b) wrapping each air barrier around the transition and sealing in accordance with Sentences (1) and (2).
ON Variations: Where an interior wall projects through a ceiling or extends to become an exterior wall, spaces in the wall shall be blocked to provide continuity across those spaces with the air barrier system in the abutting walls or ceiling by,(a) sealing each air barrier to the blocking, or (b) wrapping each air barrier around the transition and sealing in accordance with Sentences (1) and (2).

ON Full: The force-deformation and damping characteristics of the isolation system used in the analysis and design of the seismically isolated structures shall be validated by testing at least two full-size specimens of each predominant type and size of isolator unit of the isolation system, which shall include, (a) the individual isolator units, (b) separate supplemental damping devices, if used, and (c) separate sacrificial wind-restraint systems, if used.
ON Variations: The force-deformation and damping characteristics of the isolation system used in the analysis and design of the seismically isolated structures shall be validated by testing at least two full-size specimens of each predominant type and size of isolator unit of the isolation system, which shall include, (a) the individual isolator units, (b) separate supplemental damping devices, if used, and (c) separate sacrificial wind-restraint systems, if used.

ON Full: Rectangular treads shall have uniform run with a maximum tolerance of, (a) 5 mm between adjacent treads, and (b) 10 mm between the deepest and shallowest treads in a flight.
ON Variations: Rectangular treads shall have uniform run with a maximum tolerance of, (a) 5 mm between adjacent treads, and (b) 10 mm between the deepest and shallowest treads in a flight.

ON Full: The sound patterns of alert signals shall be significantly different from the temporal patterns of alarm signals. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: The sound patterns of alert signals shall be significantly different from the temporal patterns of alarm signals. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Subject to Sentence (2), if vent piping connects two or more underground storage tanks, pipe sizes shall be designed to vent the combined vapours produced in the connected underground storage tanks without exceeding the allowable stresses of the tanks when being filled simultaneously.
ON Variations: Subject to Sentence (2), if vent piping connects two or more underground storage tanks, pipe sizes shall be designed to vent the combined vapours produced in the connected underground storage tanks without exceeding the allowable stresses of the tanks when being filled simultaneously.

ON Full: A building classified as Group A, Division 2 is permitted to conform to Sentence (2) provided, it is not more than 2 storeys in building height, and it has a building area not more than the value in Table 3.2.2.25.
ON Variations: A building classified as Group A, Division 2 is permitted to conform to Sentence (2) provided, it is not more than 2 storeys in building height, and it has a building area not more than the value in Table 3.2.2.25.

ON Full: The effects of wind loads on exterior ornamentations, equipment and appendages, including the increase in exposed area as a result of ice buildup as described in CSA S37, "Antennas, Towers, and Antenna-Supporting Structures", shall be considered in the structural design of the connections and the building.
ON Variations: The effects of wind loads on exterior ornamentations, equipment and appendages, including the increase in exposed area as a result of ice buildup as described in CSA S37, "Antennas, Towers, and Antenna-Supporting Structures", shall be considered in the structural design of the connections and the building.

ON Full: For the purposes of Sentence (3), the combined width of the openings shall be considered as a single opening if the average width is greater than the width of solid wall between them.
ON Variations: For the purposes of Sentence (3), the combined width of the openings shall be considered as a single opening if the average width is greater than the width of solid wall between them.

ON Full: Except as provided by Sentence (2), openable windows in suites of residential occupancy shall be protected by, a guard with a minimum height of 1 070 mm constructed in accordance with Article 3.3.1.17., or a mechanism capable of controlling the free swinging or sliding of the openable part of the window so as to limit any clear unobstructed opening to a size that will prevent the passage of a sphere having a diameter more than 100 mm.
ON Variations: Except as provided by Sentence (2), openable windows in suites of residential occupancy shall be protected by, a guard with a minimum height of 1 070 mm constructed in accordance with Article 3.3.1.17., or a mechanism capable of controlling the free swinging or sliding of the openable part of the window so as to limit any clear unobstructed opening to a size that will prevent the passage of a sphere having a diameter more than 100 mm.

ON Full: The main valve of the hydrant shall be fully opened and the hydrant operated with one port open and the water flow checked.
ON Variations: The main valve of the hydrant shall be fully opened and the hydrant operated with one port open and the water flow checked.

ON Full: Except as provided in Subsection 9.38.3., a manufactured building used or intended to be used as a seasonal recreational building of residential occupancy is deemed to comply with this Code if it is designed and constructed in conformance with CAN/CSA-Z241 Series, "Park Model Trailers".
ON Variations: Except as provided in Subsection 9.38.3., a manufactured building used or intended to be used as a seasonal recreational building of residential occupancy is deemed to comply with this Code if it is designed and constructed in conformance with CAN/CSA-Z241 Series, "Park Model Trailers".

ON Full: Portable extinguishers required in Sentences (1), (2) and (3) shall be maintained in conformance with Section 6.2.
ON Variations: Portable extinguishers required in Sentences (1), (2) and (3) shall be maintained in conformance with Section 6.2.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentences (2) and (3) and Article 9.10.10.5., fuel-fired appliances shall be located in a service room separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having not less than a 1 h fire-resistance rating.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentences (2) and (3) and Article 9.10.10.5., fuel-fired appliances shall be located in a service room separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having not less than a 1 h fire-resistance rating.

ON Full: Sentence (1) does not apply to hoods, ducts or filters in an exhaust or ventilating system that serves only a single suite of residential occupancy.
ON Variations: Sentence (1) does not apply to hoods, ducts or filters in an exhaust or ventilating system that serves only a single suite of residential occupancy.

ON Full: The number of water closets required for elementary and secondary schools shall be at least one fixture for each 30 males and one fixture for each 26 females.
ON Variations: The number of water closets required for elementary and secondary schools shall be at least one fixture for each 30 males and one fixture for each 26 females.

ON Full: The size of the air break shall be at least 25 mm.
ON Variations: The size of the air break shall be at least 25 mm.

ON Full: The number of water closets required for dance halls and recreational establishments shall be at least one fixture for each 100 males and one fixture for each 75 females.
ON Variations: The number of water closets required for dance halls and recreational establishments shall be at least one fixture for each 100 males and one fixture for each 75 females.

ON Full: Except as provided by Sentences (2) and (3), the space above a mezzanine shall be served by at least two means of egress leading to exits accessible at the mezzanine level on the same basis as floor areas.
ON Variations: Except as provided by Sentences (2) and (3), the space above a mezzanine shall be served by at least two means of egress leading to exits accessible at the mezzanine level on the same basis as floor areas.

ON Full: The programmable thermostatic control device required in Sentence (1) shall,(a) allow the setting of different air temperatures for at least, (i) four time periods per day, and (ii) two different day-types per week, (b) include a manual override, and (c) allow the setting of the air temperature to, (i) 13°C or lower in heating mode, and (ii) 29°C or higher in cooling mode, where air-conditioning is provided.
ON Variations: The programmable thermostatic control device required in Sentence (1) shall,(a) allow the setting of different air temperatures for at least, (i) four time periods per day, and (ii) two different day-types per week, (b) include a manual override, and (c) allow the setting of the air temperature to, (i) 13°C or lower in heating mode, and (ii) 29°C or higher in cooling mode, where air-conditioning is provided.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentences (2) and (3), exterior columns and posts shall be anchored to resist uplift and lateral movement.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentences (2) and (3), exterior columns and posts shall be anchored to resist uplift and lateral movement.

ON Full: Carbon steel connectors required to be corrosion-resistant shall be galvanized to at least the minimum standards in Table 9.20.16.1.
ON Variations: Carbon steel connectors required to be corrosion-resistant shall be galvanized to at least the minimum standards in Table 9.20.16.1.

ON Full: Measures to control spilled flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be provided in conformance with Subsection 4.1.6.
ON Variations: Measures to control spilled flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be provided in conformance with Subsection 4.1.6.

ON Full: Spill control procedures shall be prominently posted and maintained where flammable liquids or combustible liquids are stored, handled, processed or used.
ON Variations: Spill control procedures shall be prominently posted and maintained where flammable liquids or combustible liquids are stored, handled, processed or used.

ON Full: Hydrants shall be maintained free of snow and ice accumulations.
ON Variations: Hydrants shall be maintained free of snow and ice accumulations.

ON Full: A hose is permitted to penetrate an exit in order to provide the required coverage to, a service room referred to in Sentence 3.2.9.1.(4), a rooftop enclosure referred to in Sentence 3.2.9.1.(5), a room not more than 50 m2 in area, or a room or group of rooms not more than 200 m2 in area in a sprinklered floor area.
ON Variations: A hose is permitted to penetrate an exit in order to provide the required coverage to, a service room referred to in Sentence 3.2.9.1.(4), a rooftop enclosure referred to in Sentence 3.2.9.1.(5), a room not more than 50 m2 in area, or a room or group of rooms not more than 200 m2 in area in a sprinklered floor area.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence 9.9.7.3.(1), where an egress door from a dwelling unit opens onto a public corridor or exterior passageway it shall be possible from the location where the egress door opens onto the corridor or exterior passageway to go in opposite directions to two separate exits unless the dwelling unit has a second and separate means of egress.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence 9.9.7.3.(1), where an egress door from a dwelling unit opens onto a public corridor or exterior passageway it shall be possible from the location where the egress door opens onto the corridor or exterior passageway to go in opposite directions to two separate exits unless the dwelling unit has a second and separate means of egress.

ON Full: Where a doorway or stair empties onto a ramp through an end wall, there shall be a level area extending across the full width of the ramp and along its length for not less than 900 mm.
ON Variations: Where a doorway or stair empties onto a ramp through an end wall, there shall be a level area extending across the full width of the ramp and along its length for not less than 900 mm.

ON Full: Except as provided in Subsection 9.9.9., a single exit is permitted from each storey in buildings of 1 and 2 storeys in building height provided the floor area and travel distance requirements conform to those required in Article 9.9.7.4. and the total occupant load served by an exit facility does not exceed 60 persons.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Subsection 9.9.9., a single exit is permitted from each storey in buildings of 1 and 2 storeys in building height provided the floor area and travel distance requirements conform to those required in Article 9.9.7.4. and the total occupant load served by an exit facility does not exceed 60 persons.

ON Full: Where the roof described in Sentence (1) slopes upwards from the masonry, the flashing shall extend up the roof slope to a point equal in height to the flashing on the masonry, but not less than 1.5 times the shingle exposure.
ON Variations: Where the roof described in Sentence (1) slopes upwards from the masonry, the flashing shall extend up the roof slope to a point equal in height to the flashing on the masonry, but not less than 1.5 times the shingle exposure.

ON Full: Combustible piping not located in a vertical shaft is permitted to penetrate a fire separation required to have a fire-resistance rating or a membrane that forms part of an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating, provided the piping is sealed at the penetration by a fire stop system that has an F rating not less than the fire-resistance rating required for the fire separation.
ON Variations: Combustible piping not located in a vertical shaft is permitted to penetrate a fire separation required to have a fire-resistance rating or a membrane that forms part of an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating, provided the piping is sealed at the penetration by a fire stop system that has an F rating not less than the fire-resistance rating required for the fire separation.

ON Full: Where the top of any storage is above the lower chords of floor or roof structural framing members, a horizontal clear space of at least 300 mm shall be maintained between the storage and the structural members.
ON Variations: Where the top of any storage is above the lower chords of floor or roof structural framing members, a horizontal clear space of at least 300 mm shall be maintained between the storage and the structural members.

ON Full: Glass sidelights greater than 500 mm wide that could be mistaken for doors, glass in storm doors and glass in sliding doors within or at every entrance to a house or an individual dwelling unit and in public areas shall be,(a) safety glass of the tempered or laminated type conforming to CAN/CGSB-12.1-M, "Tempered or Laminated Safety Glass", or (b) wired glass conforming to CAN/CGSB-12.11-M, "Wired Safety Glass".
ON Variations: Glass sidelights greater than 500 mm wide that could be mistaken for doors, glass in storm doors and glass in sliding doors within or at every entrance to a house or an individual dwelling unit and in public areas shall be,(a) safety glass of the tempered or laminated type conforming to CAN/CGSB-12.1-M, "Tempered or Laminated Safety Glass", or (b) wired glass conforming to CAN/CGSB-12.11-M, "Wired Safety Glass".

ON Full: Every operator of a treatment unit shall obtain, from the manufacturer or distributor of the treatment unit, literature that describes the unit in detail and provides complete instructions regarding the operation, servicing, and maintenance requirements of the unit and its related components necessary to ensure the continued proper operation in accordance with the original design and specifications.
ON Variations: Every operator of a treatment unit shall obtain, from the manufacturer or distributor of the treatment unit, literature that describes the unit in detail and provides complete instructions regarding the operation, servicing, and maintenance requirements of the unit and its related components necessary to ensure the continued proper operation in accordance with the original design and specifications.

ON Full: Where more than one drinking fountain is provided, at least one shall be a barrier-free fountain that conforms to Sentences (2) and (3).
ON Variations: Where more than one drinking fountain is provided, at least one shall be a barrier-free fountain that conforms to Sentences (2) and (3).

ON Full: The alternate floor recall feature required by Sentence (1) is not required if the floor area containing the recall level is sprinklered.
ON Variations: The alternate floor recall feature required by Sentence (1) is not required if the floor area containing the recall level is sprinklered.

ON Full: When any alterations, additions or repairs are to be made involving interruption to a sprinkler system or part thereof, the Chief Fire Official shall be notified.
ON Variations: When any alterations, additions or repairs are to be made involving interruption to a sprinkler system or part thereof, the Chief Fire Official shall be notified.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentences (7) and (8), portions of an interconnected floor space that have floor levels more than 18 m above grade shall be served by exits that provide at least 0.3 m2 of area of treads, landings and floor surface for each occupant of such portions of an interconnected floor space. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentences (7) and (8), portions of an interconnected floor space that have floor levels more than 18 m above grade shall be served by exits that provide at least 0.3 m2 of area of treads, landings and floor surface for each occupant of such portions of an interconnected floor space. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: The horizontal projection of an obstruction in Sentence (1) is permitted to exceed 100 mm where the obstruction extends to less than 680 mm above the floor.
ON Variations: The horizontal projection of an obstruction in Sentence (1) is permitted to exceed 100 mm where the obstruction extends to less than 680 mm above the floor.

ON Full: Except as permitted by Articles 3.2.2.7. and 3.2.2.8. and Sentences 3.2.2.43A.(5) and 3.2.2.50A.(4), in a building containing more than one major occupancy, the requirements of this Subsection for the most restricted major occupancy contained shall apply to the whole building.
ON Variations: Except as permitted by Articles 3.2.2.7. and 3.2.2.8. and Sentences 3.2.2.43A.(5) and 3.2.2.50A.(4), in a building containing more than one major occupancy, the requirements of this Subsection for the most restricted major occupancy contained shall apply to the whole building.

ON Full: A building and its structural components, including connections, shall be checked for fatigue failure under the effect of the cyclical loads, as required in the standards listed in Section 4.3. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: A building and its structural components, including connections, shall be checked for fatigue failure under the effect of the cyclical loads, as required in the standards listed in Section 4.3. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: The opening protection referred to in Sentences (1) to (3) shall consist of, glass block conforming to the requirements of Article 3.1.8.14., a wired glass assembly conforming to MMAH Supplementary Standard SB-2, "Fire Performance Ratings", or a closure conforming to the requirements of Subsection 3.1.8. and Articles 3.2.3.1. and 3.2.3.14.
ON Variations: The opening protection referred to in Sentences (1) to (3) shall consist of, glass block conforming to the requirements of Article 3.1.8.14., a wired glass assembly conforming to MMAH Supplementary Standard SB-2, "Fire Performance Ratings", or a closure conforming to the requirements of Subsection 3.1.8. and Articles 3.2.3.1. and 3.2.3.14.

ON Full: A door in an access to exit or an exit door may be equipped with an electromagnetic locking device that is approved or complies with the Building Code, unless the door is located in an elementary or secondary school or is an egress or exit door that serves a high hazard industrial occupancy.
ON Variations: A door in an access to exit or an exit door may be equipped with an electromagnetic locking device that is approved or complies with the Building Code, unless the door is located in an elementary or secondary school or is an egress or exit door that serves a high hazard industrial occupancy.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (2), flashing shall be installed at,(a) every horizontal junction between claddings elements, (b) every horizontal offset in the cladding, and (c) every horizontal line where the cladding substrates change and where, (i) the substrates differ sufficiently for stresses to be concentrated along that line, or (ii) the installation of the cladding on the lower substrate may compromise the drainage of moisture from behind the cladding above. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (2), flashing shall be installed at,(a) every horizontal junction between claddings elements, (b) every horizontal offset in the cladding, and (c) every horizontal line where the cladding substrates change and where, (i) the substrates differ sufficiently for stresses to be concentrated along that line, or (ii) the installation of the cladding on the lower substrate may compromise the drainage of moisture from behind the cladding above. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Where the conditions in Sentence (1) are exceeded for wood construction, the design of the framing and fastening shall conform to Subsection 4.3.1.
ON Variations: Where the conditions in Sentence (1) are exceeded for wood construction, the design of the framing and fastening shall conform to Subsection 4.3.1.

ON Full: The unobstructed path of travel for the firefighter required by Sentence (2) from the vehicle to the building shall be measured from the vehicle to the fire department connection provided for the building, except that if no fire department connection is provided, the path of travel shall be measured to the principal entrance of the building.
ON Variations: The unobstructed path of travel for the firefighter required by Sentence (2) from the vehicle to the building shall be measured from the vehicle to the fire department connection provided for the building, except that if no fire department connection is provided, the path of travel shall be measured to the principal entrance of the building.

ON Full: The egress capacity in Sentence (5) need not be cumulative after converging where it can be shown that the platform clearance time in Sentence (3) is not exceeded.
ON Variations: The egress capacity in Sentence (5) need not be cumulative after converging where it can be shown that the platform clearance time in Sentence (3) is not exceeded.

ON Full: Flaming meals or drinks shall not be served in care occupancies, care and treatment occupancies and retirement homes.
ON Variations: Flaming meals or drinks shall not be served in care occupancies, care and treatment occupancies and retirement homes.

ON Full: Connections to circuit vents and additional circuit vents in accordance with Sentence (6) shall conform to Sentence 7.5.4.5.(1).
ON Variations: Connections to circuit vents and additional circuit vents in accordance with Sentence (6) shall conform to Sentence 7.5.4.5.(1).

ON Full: If the horizontal offset is more than 6 m long, the rain leader shall conform to Table 7.4.10.9.
ON Variations: If the horizontal offset is more than 6 m long, the rain leader shall conform to Table 7.4.10.9.

ON Full: No trough urinal shall be used as part of a plumbing system.
ON Variations: No trough urinal shall be used as part of a plumbing system.

ON Full: The procedures described in Sentence (1) shall be made available to the Chief Fire Official upon request.
ON Variations: The procedures described in Sentence (1) shall be made available to the Chief Fire Official upon request.

ON Full: The companion-load factor for live loads, L in Table 4.1.3.2.A. and LXC in Table 4.1.3.2.B. shall be increased by 0.5 for storage areas and for equipment areas and service rooms referred to in Table 4.1.5.3.
ON Variations: The companion-load factor for live loads, L in Table 4.1.3.2.A. and LXC in Table 4.1.3.2.B. shall be increased by 0.5 for storage areas and for equipment areas and service rooms referred to in Table 4.1.5.3.

ON Full: Where the hydraulic load is to be expressed in gal/min, fixture units shall be converted in accordance with Table 7.4.10.5.
ON Variations: Where the hydraulic load is to be expressed in gal/min, fixture units shall be converted in accordance with Table 7.4.10.5.

ON Full: In a process plant, an area intended as a location where unstable liquids are handled or small scale unit chemical processes occur shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 2 h.
ON Variations: In a process plant, an area intended as a location where unstable liquids are handled or small scale unit chemical processes occur shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 2 h.

ON Full: The STC ratings of separating assemblies shall be determined in accordance with ASTM E413, "Classification for Rating Sound Insulation", using the results from measurements carried out in accordance with ASTM E90, "Laboratory Measurement of Airborne Sound Transmission Loss of Building Partitions and Elements".
ON Variations: The STC ratings of separating assemblies shall be determined in accordance with ASTM E413, "Classification for Rating Sound Insulation", using the results from measurements carried out in accordance with ASTM E90, "Laboratory Measurement of Airborne Sound Transmission Loss of Building Partitions and Elements".

ON Full: The use of cam-locking connections up to 100 mm in size shall be permitted.
ON Variations: The use of cam-locking connections up to 100 mm in size shall be permitted.

ON Full: Except as required by Sentence (5), fastening of sheathing and subflooring shall conform to Table 9.23.3.5.
ON Variations: Except as required by Sentence (5), fastening of sheathing and subflooring shall conform to Table 9.23.3.5.

ON Full: The drainage layer required in Sentence (2) is not required, (a) when the foundation wall is not required to be dampproofed, or (b) when the foundation wall is waterproofed.
ON Variations: The drainage layer required in Sentence (2) is not required, (a) when the foundation wall is not required to be dampproofed, or (b) when the foundation wall is waterproofed.

ON Full: Where conditions of permafrost are encountered or proven to exist, the design of the foundation shall be based upon analysis of these conditions by a person especially qualified in that field of work.
ON Variations: Where conditions of permafrost are encountered or proven to exist, the design of the foundation shall be based upon analysis of these conditions by a person especially qualified in that field of work.

ON Full: Sanitary privies, chemical closets or other means for the disposal of human waste may be provided in lieu of toilet fixtures.
ON Variations: Sanitary privies, chemical closets or other means for the disposal of human waste may be provided in lieu of toilet fixtures.

ON Full: A door that is required to be readily opened in Sentence (4) or (5) shall have a sign attached to it that, displays the words EMERGENCY EXIT with the letters not less than 25 mm high, and is visible from the exit approach.
ON Variations: A door that is required to be readily opened in Sentence (4) or (5) shall have a sign attached to it that, displays the words EMERGENCY EXIT with the letters not less than 25 mm high, and is visible from the exit approach.

ON Full: Salvage tanks shall be used only for temporary storage purposes.
ON Variations: Salvage tanks shall be used only for temporary storage purposes.

ON Full: Ovens shall not be located in any storey below grade.
ON Variations: Ovens shall not be located in any storey below grade.

ON Full: The total amount of cellulose nitrate plastic materials, including the material in containers and on tables, in any one workroom shall not exceed 70 kg.
ON Variations: The total amount of cellulose nitrate plastic materials, including the material in containers and on tables, in any one workroom shall not exceed 70 kg.

ON Full: Stiffness imparted to the structure from elements not part of the SFRS, other than those described in Sentence (6), shall not be used to resist earthquake deflections but shall be accounted for, (a) in calculating the period of the structure for determining forces if the added stiffness decreases the fundamental lateral period by more than 15%, (b) in determining the irregularity of the structure, except the additional stiffness shall not be used to make an irregular SFRS regular or to reduce the effects of torsion, and (See Appendix A.) (c) in designing the SFRS if inclusion of the elements not part of the SFRS in the analysis has an adverse effect on the SFRS. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Stiffness imparted to the structure from elements not part of the SFRS, other than those described in Sentence (6), shall not be used to resist earthquake deflections but shall be accounted for, (a) in calculating the period of the structure for determining forces if the added stiffness decreases the fundamental lateral period by more than 15%, (b) in determining the irregularity of the structure, except the additional stiffness shall not be used to make an irregular SFRS regular or to reduce the effects of torsion, and (See Appendix A.) (c) in designing the SFRS if inclusion of the elements not part of the SFRS in the analysis has an adverse effect on the SFRS. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Smoking shall not take place in a room where pin refinishing occurs.
ON Variations: Smoking shall not take place in a room where pin refinishing occurs.

ON Full: The evaluation in Sentence (1) shall result in the identification of measures that will minimize fires and explosions from occurring and mitigate the effects of a fire or explosion should it occur.
ON Variations: The evaluation in Sentence (1) shall result in the identification of measures that will minimize fires and explosions from occurring and mitigate the effects of a fire or explosion should it occur.

ON Full: An ancillary space in a rapid transit station shall be separated from the remainder of the floor area by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.
ON Variations: An ancillary space in a rapid transit station shall be separated from the remainder of the floor area by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.

ON Full: Sentence (8) does not apply to suction and gravity outlets that are equipped with anti-entrapment covers that comply with the requirements of ASME A112.19.8, "Suction Fittings for Use in Swimming Pools, Wading Pools, Spas, and Hot Tubs".
ON Variations: Sentence (8) does not apply to suction and gravity outlets that are equipped with anti-entrapment covers that comply with the requirements of ASME A112.19.8, "Suction Fittings for Use in Swimming Pools, Wading Pools, Spas, and Hot Tubs".

ON Full: A converging aisle shall terminate at, an egress doorway from the seating area, or an exit from the seating area.
ON Variations: A converging aisle shall terminate at, an egress doorway from the seating area, or an exit from the seating area.

ON Full: Except as provided in Article 11.3.3.1. and Section 11.5., the design and construction of a new building system or the extension of an existing building system, shall comply with all other Parts. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Except as provided in Article 11.3.3.1. and Section 11.5., the design and construction of a new building system or the extension of an existing building system, shall comply with all other Parts. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Where the sewage system is specifically designed for the biological decomposition of non-waterborne biodegradable kitchen wastes or requires the addition of small quantities of plant matter to improve the decomposition of human body waste, it may receive such wastes in addition to human body waste.
ON Variations: Where the sewage system is specifically designed for the biological decomposition of non-waterborne biodegradable kitchen wastes or requires the addition of small quantities of plant matter to improve the decomposition of human body waste, it may receive such wastes in addition to human body waste.

ON Full: Roof trusses that are not designed in accordance with Part 4 shall,(a) be capable of supporting a total ceiling load (dead load plus live of 0.35 kPa plus two and two-thirds times the specified live roof load for 24 h, and (b) not exceed the deflections shown in Table 9.23.13.11. when loaded with the ceiling load plus one and one-third times the specified roof snow load for 1 h.
ON Variations: Roof trusses that are not designed in accordance with Part 4 shall,(a) be capable of supporting a total ceiling load (dead load plus live of 0.35 kPa plus two and two-thirds times the specified live roof load for 24 h, and (b) not exceed the deflections shown in Table 9.23.13.11. when loaded with the ceiling load plus one and one-third times the specified roof snow load for 1 h.

ON Full: Where the performance level of an existing building is reduced under Clause 11.4.2.3.(1)(a), (b), (c), (d), (e), or (g), additional upgrading shall be required in conformance with Table 11.4.3.4.A. and so that the construction index of the building is increased to at least equal the hazard index of the new major occupancy that the building is to support.
ON Variations: Where the performance level of an existing building is reduced under Clause 11.4.2.3.(1)(a), (b), (c), (d), (e), or (g), additional upgrading shall be required in conformance with Table 11.4.3.4.A. and so that the construction index of the building is increased to at least equal the hazard index of the new major occupancy that the building is to support.

ON Full: Where insulation is exposed to the weather and subject to mechanical damage, it shall be protected with not less than,(a) reserved, (b) 6 mm preservative-treated plywood, or (c) 12 mm cement parging on wire lath applied to the exposed face and edge.
ON Variations: Where insulation is exposed to the weather and subject to mechanical damage, it shall be protected with not less than,(a) reserved, (b) 6 mm preservative-treated plywood, or (c) 12 mm cement parging on wire lath applied to the exposed face and edge.

ON Full: A space not less than 10 mm wide shall be left between a chimney liner and the surrounding masonry.
ON Variations: A space not less than 10 mm wide shall be left between a chimney liner and the surrounding masonry.

ON Full: Exterior steel beams susceptible to corrosion shall be shop primed with rust-inhibitive paint.
ON Variations: Exterior steel beams susceptible to corrosion shall be shop primed with rust-inhibitive paint.

ON Full: At least 90% of the exposed surface of every ceiling in an exit or unsprinklered ceiling in a public corridor shall have a surface flame-spread rating of not more than 25.
ON Variations: At least 90% of the exposed surface of every ceiling in an exit or unsprinklered ceiling in a public corridor shall have a surface flame-spread rating of not more than 25.

ON Full: Except as permitted in Article 9.10.19.8., smoke alarms conforming to CAN/ULC-S531, "Smoke Alarms", shall be installed in,(a) each dwelling unit, (b) each sleeping room not within a dwelling unit, and (c) each interior shared means of egress and common area in a house.
ON Variations: Except as permitted in Article 9.10.19.8., smoke alarms conforming to CAN/ULC-S531, "Smoke Alarms", shall be installed in,(a) each dwelling unit, (b) each sleeping room not within a dwelling unit, and (c) each interior shared means of egress and common area in a house.

ON Full: Bends in copper tubing of soft or bending temper shall be made with tools manufactured and sized for the purpose.
ON Variations: Bends in copper tubing of soft or bending temper shall be made with tools manufactured and sized for the purpose.

ON Full: A floor drain shall be installed in a basement forming part of a dwelling unit.
ON Variations: A floor drain shall be installed in a basement forming part of a dwelling unit.

ON Full: Where a covering or a lining is used with a duct, such lining or covering shall have a flame-spread rating conforming to Part 6.
ON Variations: Where a covering or a lining is used with a duct, such lining or covering shall have a flame-spread rating conforming to Part 6.

ON Full: Stainless steel butt weld pipe fittings shall conform to,(a) ASME B16.9, "Factory-Made Wrought Buttwelding Fittings", and (b) ASTM A403 / A403M, "Wrought Austenitic Stainless Steel Piping Fittings".
ON Variations: Stainless steel butt weld pipe fittings shall conform to,(a) ASME B16.9, "Factory-Made Wrought Buttwelding Fittings", and (b) ASTM A403 / A403M, "Wrought Austenitic Stainless Steel Piping Fittings".

ON Full: A permanent sign shall be posted in a conspicuous location to indicate the maximum permissible design loads for each shelf and rack storage system.
ON Variations: A permanent sign shall be posted in a conspicuous location to indicate the maximum permissible design loads for each shelf and rack storage system.

ON Full: Flammable liquids or combustible liquids stored in cabinets or rooms shall be separated from other dangerous goods in conformance with Article 4.2.2.3.
ON Variations: Flammable liquids or combustible liquids stored in cabinets or rooms shall be separated from other dangerous goods in conformance with Article 4.2.2.3.

ON Full: Sentences (1), (2) and (3) do not apply in rapid transit stations which comply with the Building Code.
ON Variations: Sentences (1), (2) and (3) do not apply in rapid transit stations which comply with the Building Code.

ON Full: This Subsection applies to buildings used for the storage of tires in which the bulk volume of tires stored in one fire compartment exceeds 425 m3.
ON Variations: This Subsection applies to buildings used for the storage of tires in which the bulk volume of tires stored in one fire compartment exceeds 425 m3.

ON Full: A building containing an interconnected floor space shall be provided with, a fire alarm system and electrically supervised annunciator conforming to Subsection 3.2.4., a system of smoke detectors located, on the ceiling of each storey in the vicinity of the openings through floor assemblies described in Article 3.2.8.3., except within dwelling units, heat detectors may be installed instead of smoke detectors, and as required for the activation of the smoke control system described in Sentences 3.2.8.9.(3), (4), (6) and (7), and (See Appendix A.) facilities for transmitting a signal to the fire department in conformance with Article 3.2.4.8.
ON Variations: A building containing an interconnected floor space shall be provided with, a fire alarm system and electrically supervised annunciator conforming to Subsection 3.2.4., a system of smoke detectors located, on the ceiling of each storey in the vicinity of the openings through floor assemblies described in Article 3.2.8.3., except within dwelling units, heat detectors may be installed instead of smoke detectors, and as required for the activation of the smoke control system described in Sentences 3.2.8.9.(3), (4), (6) and (7), and (See Appendix A.) facilities for transmitting a signal to the fire department in conformance with Article 3.2.4.8.

ON Full: Except as required by Sentence 3.16.3.2.(3), a shelf and rack storage system shall not exceed 24 m in height.
ON Variations: Except as required by Sentence 3.16.3.2.(3), a shelf and rack storage system shall not exceed 24 m in height.

ON Full: Location-specific information for structural design, including snow and wind loads and seismic spectral response accelerations, shall be determined according to MMAH Supplementary Standard SB-1, "Climatic and Seismic Data". (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Location-specific information for structural design, including snow and wind loads and seismic spectral response accelerations, shall be determined according to MMAH Supplementary Standard SB-1, "Climatic and Seismic Data". (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Where flights or ramps of different widths adjoin a single landing, the minimum width of the landing shall be, (a) not less than the greater required stair or ramp width, where one or more of the stair or ramp widths do not exceed their respective required widths, or (b) not less than the lesser actual stair or ramp width, where all of the widths of the stairs or ramps exceed their respective required widths.
ON Variations: Where flights or ramps of different widths adjoin a single landing, the minimum width of the landing shall be, (a) not less than the greater required stair or ramp width, where one or more of the stair or ramp widths do not exceed their respective required widths, or (b) not less than the lesser actual stair or ramp width, where all of the widths of the stairs or ramps exceed their respective required widths.

ON Full: Air under pressure shall not be used to fill or agitate oil in quench tanks.
ON Variations: Air under pressure shall not be used to fill or agitate oil in quench tanks.

ON Full: Dip tanks shall not be located in basements.
ON Variations: Dip tanks shall not be located in basements.

ON Full: Elements of the supplemental energy dissipation system, except the supplemental energy dissipation devices themselves, shall be designed to remain elastic for the design loads.
ON Variations: Elements of the supplemental energy dissipation system, except the supplemental energy dissipation devices themselves, shall be designed to remain elastic for the design loads.

ON Full: Except as permitted in Subsection 9.10.15., this Subsection applies to all buildings.
ON Variations: Except as permitted in Subsection 9.10.15., this Subsection applies to all buildings.

ON Full: If dispensing or hand-operated washroom accessories, other than those located in water closet stalls or enclosures and those described in Clause (1)(g), are provided, they shall be mounted so that, the dispensing height is not less than 900 mm and not more than 1 200 mm above the finished floor, the controls or operating mechanisms are mounted not less than 900 mm and not more than 1 200 mm above the finished floor, and a minimum 1 370 mm deep floor space is provided in front of the controls or operating mechanisms to allow for a front approach.
ON Variations: If dispensing or hand-operated washroom accessories, other than those located in water closet stalls or enclosures and those described in Clause (1)(g), are provided, they shall be mounted so that, the dispensing height is not less than 900 mm and not more than 1 200 mm above the finished floor, the controls or operating mechanisms are mounted not less than 900 mm and not more than 1 200 mm above the finished floor, and a minimum 1 370 mm deep floor space is provided in front of the controls or operating mechanisms to allow for a front approach.

ON Full: A fire separation is not required between a rooftop appliance and the building it serves.
ON Variations: A fire separation is not required between a rooftop appliance and the building it serves.

ON Full: Direct access from at least one street shall be provided from the outdoors to each basement, that is not sprinklered, and that has horizontal dimension more than 25 m.
ON Variations: Direct access from at least one street shall be provided from the outdoors to each basement, that is not sprinklered, and that has horizontal dimension more than 25 m.

ON Full: Cast iron soil pipe and fittings shall not be welded.
ON Variations: Cast iron soil pipe and fittings shall not be welded.

ON Full: A building classified as Group D is permitted to conform to Sentence (2) provided, it is not more than 2 storeys in building height, and it has a building area not more than the value in Table 3.2.2.55.
ON Variations: A building classified as Group D is permitted to conform to Sentence (2) provided, it is not more than 2 storeys in building height, and it has a building area not more than the value in Table 3.2.2.55.

ON Full: Play activity rooms in a child care facility and work areas in live/work units shall have one or more windows that conform to Clause (2)(a).
ON Variations: Play activity rooms in a child care facility and work areas in live/work units shall have one or more windows that conform to Clause (2)(a).

ON Full: When provided by incandescent lighting, illumination required in Sentence (1) shall conform to Table 9.34.2.7.
ON Variations: When provided by incandescent lighting, illumination required in Sentence (1) shall conform to Table 9.34.2.7.

ON Full: The bottom of the stone layer shall be at least 600 mm above the high ground water table, rock or soil with a percolation time greater than 50 min.
ON Variations: The bottom of the stone layer shall be at least 600 mm above the high ground water table, rock or soil with a percolation time greater than 50 min.

ON Full: Every water closet shall be provided with a shut-off valve on its water supply pipe.
ON Variations: Every water closet shall be provided with a shut-off valve on its water supply pipe.

ON Full: The increased displacements of the structure resulting from foundation movement shall be shown to be within acceptable limits for both the SFRS and the structural framing elements not considered to be part of the SFRS. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: The increased displacements of the structure resulting from foundation movement shall be shown to be within acceptable limits for both the SFRS and the structural framing elements not considered to be part of the SFRS. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: At least one portable extinguisher having a rating of 30B:C shall be located on each industrial lift truck.
ON Variations: At least one portable extinguisher having a rating of 30B:C shall be located on each industrial lift truck.

ON Full: Except where each roof joist space referred to in Sentence (2) is separately vented, roof joist spaces shall be interconnected by installing purlins not less than 38 mm by 38 mm on the top of the roof joists.
ON Variations: Except where each roof joist space referred to in Sentence (2) is separately vented, roof joist spaces shall be interconnected by installing purlins not less than 38 mm by 38 mm on the top of the roof joists.

ON Full: A barrier-free path of travel shall be provided to barrier-free washrooms designed to accommodate persons with disabilities in conformance with the requirements in Articles 3.8.3.8. to 3.8.3.12.
ON Variations: A barrier-free path of travel shall be provided to barrier-free washrooms designed to accommodate persons with disabilities in conformance with the requirements in Articles 3.8.3.8. to 3.8.3.12.

ON Full: Coatings applied to materials other than gypsum wallboard to provide required resistance to vapour diffusion shall conform to the requirements of Sentence (1) when tested in accordance with ASTM E96 / E96M, "Water Vapor Transmission of Materials" by the desiccant method (dry cup).
ON Variations: Coatings applied to materials other than gypsum wallboard to provide required resistance to vapour diffusion shall conform to the requirements of Sentence (1) when tested in accordance with ASTM E96 / E96M, "Water Vapor Transmission of Materials" by the desiccant method (dry cup).

ON Full: Tanks or drums shall be stored in piles separate from piles of other materials.
ON Variations: Tanks or drums shall be stored in piles separate from piles of other materials.

ON Full: Additional supplemental exhaust capacity shall be installed as necessary so that the total capacity of all kitchen, bathroom, water closet room and other supplemental exhaust air intakes is not less than the total ventilation capacity, as required in Article 9.32.3.3., minus the principal exhaust fan capacity, as required in Article 9.32.3.4.
ON Variations: Additional supplemental exhaust capacity shall be installed as necessary so that the total capacity of all kitchen, bathroom, water closet room and other supplemental exhaust air intakes is not less than the total ventilation capacity, as required in Article 9.32.3.3., minus the principal exhaust fan capacity, as required in Article 9.32.3.4.

ON Full: Every excavation shall be undertaken in such a manner as to prevent movement that would cause damage to adjacent buildings at all phases of construction.
ON Variations: Every excavation shall be undertaken in such a manner as to prevent movement that would cause damage to adjacent buildings at all phases of construction.

ON Full: Exterior openings for outdoor air intakes and exhaust outlets shall be shielded from the entry of snow and rain and shall be fitted with corrosion-resistant screens of mesh having openings not larger than 15 mm, except where experience has shown that climatic conditions require larger openings to avoid icing over of the screen openings.
ON Variations: Exterior openings for outdoor air intakes and exhaust outlets shall be shielded from the entry of snow and rain and shall be fitted with corrosion-resistant screens of mesh having openings not larger than 15 mm, except where experience has shown that climatic conditions require larger openings to avoid icing over of the screen openings.

ON Full: For the purposes of this Part, existing buildings shall be classified as to their construction and occupancy as provided for in Sentence 11.2.1.1.(1).
ON Variations: For the purposes of this Part, existing buildings shall be classified as to their construction and occupancy as provided for in Sentence 11.2.1.1.(1).

ON Full: Where more than one fixture is located on a storey and all are connected to the same branch, the backwater valve may be installed on the branch.
ON Variations: Where more than one fixture is located on a storey and all are connected to the same branch, the backwater valve may be installed on the branch.

ON Full: Sentence (1) does not apply to a force main.
ON Variations: Sentence (1) does not apply to a force main.

ON Full: Sprinkler protection shall be provided under all platforms and walkways.
ON Variations: Sprinkler protection shall be provided under all platforms and walkways.

ON Full: The colour coding referred to in Sentence (10) shall be yellow for chlorine and green for potable water.
ON Variations: The colour coding referred to in Sentence (10) shall be yellow for chlorine and green for potable water.

ON Full: All electrically conductive objects in a spraying area shall be grounded.
ON Variations: All electrically conductive objects in a spraying area shall be grounded.

ON Full: The clear height of stairways shall be measured vertically, over the clear width of the stairway, from a straight line tangent to the tread and landing nosings to the lowest point above, and shall not be less than 2 050 mm.
ON Variations: The clear height of stairways shall be measured vertically, over the clear width of the stairway, from a straight line tangent to the tread and landing nosings to the lowest point above, and shall not be less than 2 050 mm.

ON Full: Except for a modified pool and wave action pool, the perimeter of the pool deck shall be clearly delineated by a tactile attention indicator conforming to Article 3.8.3.18. and located where any area contiguous to the pool deck may be confused with the deck.
ON Variations: Except for a modified pool and wave action pool, the perimeter of the pool deck shall be clearly delineated by a tactile attention indicator conforming to Article 3.8.3.18. and located where any area contiguous to the pool deck may be confused with the deck.

ON Full: Smoke alarms shall be maintained in operating condition.
ON Variations: Smoke alarms shall be maintained in operating condition.

ON Full: Every roof drain shall be securely connected to a leader and provision shall be made for expansion.
ON Variations: Every roof drain shall be securely connected to a leader and provision shall be made for expansion.

ON Full: Where gravity flow is not practical, automatic pumps shall be installed on drain lines from dip tanks.
ON Variations: Where gravity flow is not practical, automatic pumps shall be installed on drain lines from dip tanks.

ON Full: Except as permitted in Sentence (2), sections of sprinkler systems subject to freezing shall be converted to a dry-pipe or antifreeze system with a separate control valve for that part of the system.
ON Variations: Except as permitted in Sentence (2), sections of sprinkler systems subject to freezing shall be converted to a dry-pipe or antifreeze system with a separate control valve for that part of the system.

ON Full: Bags of ammonium nitrate shall not be stored closer than 400 mm from walls and partitions and not closer than 900 mm from a roof, overhead supporting beam or a sprinkler head deflector.
ON Variations: Bags of ammonium nitrate shall not be stored closer than 400 mm from walls and partitions and not closer than 900 mm from a roof, overhead supporting beam or a sprinkler head deflector.

ON Full: Ties referred to in Sentences (2) and (3) shall be the equivalent of not less than 75 mm by 150 mm by 0.91 mm thick galvanized steel nailed to each wall with at least three 63 mm nails.
ON Variations: Ties referred to in Sentences (2) and (3) shall be the equivalent of not less than 75 mm by 150 mm by 0.91 mm thick galvanized steel nailed to each wall with at least three 63 mm nails.

ON Full: A privy vault or a pail privy shall be constructed in the following manner:(a) the container or structure that is to be used for the holding or storage of sanitary sewage shall be watertight and made of a material that can be easily cleaned, (b) the soil or leaching bed fill around the base of the sides of the superstructure shall be raised or mounded to a height of at least 150 mm above ground level, and (c) the surface of the ground in the area of the privy vault or pail privy shall be so graded that surface drainage will be diverted away from the privy.
ON Variations: A privy vault or a pail privy shall be constructed in the following manner:(a) the container or structure that is to be used for the holding or storage of sanitary sewage shall be watertight and made of a material that can be easily cleaned, (b) the soil or leaching bed fill around the base of the sides of the superstructure shall be raised or mounded to a height of at least 150 mm above ground level, and (c) the surface of the ground in the area of the privy vault or pail privy shall be so graded that surface drainage will be diverted away from the privy.

ON Full: The floor in an area intended for the storage of dangerous goods shall be constructed of impermeable materials to prevent the absorption of chemicals.
ON Variations: The floor in an area intended for the storage of dangerous goods shall be constructed of impermeable materials to prevent the absorption of chemicals.

ON Full: Storage yards shall be maintained free of combustible ground vegetation, including grass and weeds, for 4.5 m from the stored material and 30 m from brush and forested areas.
ON Variations: Storage yards shall be maintained free of combustible ground vegetation, including grass and weeds, for 4.5 m from the stored material and 30 m from brush and forested areas.

ON Full: This Section applies to those areas or buildings in distilleries where distilled beverage alcohols are concentrated, blended, mixed, stored or packaged.
ON Variations: This Section applies to those areas or buildings in distilleries where distilled beverage alcohols are concentrated, blended, mixed, stored or packaged.

ON Full: Except in a Group F occupancy, at each hose station, hose connections, valves, fire hose, nozzle and hose rack shall be in a hose cabinet.
ON Variations: Except in a Group F occupancy, at each hose station, hose connections, valves, fire hose, nozzle and hose rack shall be in a hose cabinet.

ON Full: A sign containing the words NON-POTABLE WATER, DO NOT DRINK shall be in letters at least 25 mm high with a 5 mm stroke and posted immediately above a fixture that is permitted to receive non-potable water.
ON Variations: A sign containing the words NON-POTABLE WATER, DO NOT DRINK shall be in letters at least 25 mm high with a 5 mm stroke and posted immediately above a fixture that is permitted to receive non-potable water.

ON Full: Where the direction of exit travel changes at a landing, the landing is permitted to be chamfered or curved in plan, provided the required width of the stair is maintained where measured perpendicular to the direction of exit travel across the landing.
ON Variations: Where the direction of exit travel changes at a landing, the landing is permitted to be chamfered or curved in plan, provided the required width of the stair is maintained where measured perpendicular to the direction of exit travel across the landing.

ON Full: If a firewatch is required, the demolition site shall be toured by firewatch personnel at least once each hour.
ON Variations: If a firewatch is required, the demolition site shall be toured by firewatch personnel at least once each hour.

ON Full: At seasons of the year that will not permit hydrostatic pressure testing, the procedure outlined in Sentence 6.5.1.6.(4) may be followed.
ON Variations: At seasons of the year that will not permit hydrostatic pressure testing, the procedure outlined in Sentence 6.5.1.6.(4) may be followed.

ON Full: A voice communication system required by Sentence (1) that is installed in a building that is not intended to be staffed, at times when the building will be occupied, with persons trained to provide instructions over loudspeakers described in Sentence (2) shall include a pre-recorded message.
ON Variations: A voice communication system required by Sentence (1) that is installed in a building that is not intended to be staffed, at times when the building will be occupied, with persons trained to provide instructions over loudspeakers described in Sentence (2) shall include a pre-recorded message.

ON Full: Except as permitted by Sentence (4), in a Group B, Division 3 occupancy, walls separating corridors serving sleeping rooms from adjacent rooms shall be constructed as fire separations having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, except that the fire-resistance rating need not be more than 45 min where the floor assembly is not required to be more than 45 min.
ON Variations: Except as permitted by Sentence (4), in a Group B, Division 3 occupancy, walls separating corridors serving sleeping rooms from adjacent rooms shall be constructed as fire separations having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, except that the fire-resistance rating need not be more than 45 min where the floor assembly is not required to be more than 45 min.

ON Full: Fasteners for cladding other than that described in Sentence (1) shall penetrate through the nail-holding base or not less than 25 mm into the framing.
ON Variations: Fasteners for cladding other than that described in Sentence (1) shall penetrate through the nail-holding base or not less than 25 mm into the framing.

ON Full: Thinners and solvents shall be dispensed only from listed and labelled safety cans.
ON Variations: Thinners and solvents shall be dispensed only from listed and labelled safety cans.

ON Full: The mechanical ventilation system required in Article 9.32.1.2. shall comply with,(a) Part 6, or (b) this Subsection for a mechanical ventilation system in a Type I, Type II or Type IV dwelling unit.
ON Variations: The mechanical ventilation system required in Article 9.32.1.2. shall comply with,(a) Part 6, or (b) this Subsection for a mechanical ventilation system in a Type I, Type II or Type IV dwelling unit.

ON Full: Overflow pipes shall be connected to dip tanks by a flared outlet.
ON Variations: Overflow pipes shall be connected to dip tanks by a flared outlet.

ON Full: Except as required by Articles, 3.3.2.9. and 3.3.2.10., aisles leading to egress doors or exits shall be provided in conformance with Sentences (2) to (27) in places of assembly that contain fixed seats.
ON Variations: Except as required by Articles, 3.3.2.9. and 3.3.2.10., aisles leading to egress doors or exits shall be provided in conformance with Sentences (2) to (27) in places of assembly that contain fixed seats.

ON Full: A laboratory shall be provided with continuous mechanical ventilation designed and maintained to ensure that flammable vapours do not accumulate in the laboratory, are prevented from migrating to other parts of the building, do not accumulate in the ventilation system, are exhausted to the outdoors, and are not returned to the building.
ON Variations: A laboratory shall be provided with continuous mechanical ventilation designed and maintained to ensure that flammable vapours do not accumulate in the laboratory, are prevented from migrating to other parts of the building, do not accumulate in the ventilation system, are exhausted to the outdoors, and are not returned to the building.

ON Full: Where sprinkler systems are installed, a supply of spare sprinkler heads and equipment shall be maintained in conformance with Sentences (2) to (5).
ON Variations: Where sprinkler systems are installed, a supply of spare sprinkler heads and equipment shall be maintained in conformance with Sentences (2) to (5).

ON Full: Where a vent pipe passes through a roof, it shall,(a) be terminated high enough to prevent the entry of roof drainage but not less than 150 mm above the roof or above the surface of storm water, which could pond on the roof, and (b) be equipped with flashing to prevent the entry of water between the vent pipe and the roof or the wall.
ON Variations: Where a vent pipe passes through a roof, it shall,(a) be terminated high enough to prevent the entry of roof drainage but not less than 150 mm above the roof or above the surface of storm water, which could pond on the roof, and (b) be equipped with flashing to prevent the entry of water between the vent pipe and the roof or the wall.

ON Full: In a building referred to in Sentence (2) or (3), manual pull stations shall be installed near doorways leading from shared interior corridors to the exterior.
ON Variations: In a building referred to in Sentence (2) or (3), manual pull stations shall be installed near doorways leading from shared interior corridors to the exterior.

ON Full: Except as provided by Sentences (3) and (4), a room intended for the storage or dispensing of Class IA or Class IB liquids in open containers shall be designed to prevent critical structural and mechanical damage from an internal explosion in accordance with good engineering practice, such as that described in NFPA 68, "Explosion Protection by Deflagration Venting". (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Except as provided by Sentences (3) and (4), a room intended for the storage or dispensing of Class IA or Class IB liquids in open containers shall be designed to prevent critical structural and mechanical damage from an internal explosion in accordance with good engineering practice, such as that described in NFPA 68, "Explosion Protection by Deflagration Venting". (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Except as permitted by Articles 3.2.2.21. and 3.2.2.22., a building classified as Group A, Division 1 shall conform to Sentence (2).
ON Variations: Except as permitted by Articles 3.2.2.21. and 3.2.2.22., a building classified as Group A, Division 1 shall conform to Sentence (2).

ON Full: The return-air system shall be designed to handle the entire air supply.
ON Variations: The return-air system shall be designed to handle the entire air supply.

ON Full: Subsection 9.13.3. applies to below-ground walls, floors-on-ground and roofs of underground structures that are subject to hydrostatic pressure.
ON Variations: Subsection 9.13.3. applies to below-ground walls, floors-on-ground and roofs of underground structures that are subject to hydrostatic pressure.

ON Full: A standpipe riser shall be located in, an exit stair shaft, or a vertical service space separated from the adjacent floor area by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating conforming to Table 3.6.3.1.
ON Variations: A standpipe riser shall be located in, an exit stair shaft, or a vertical service space separated from the adjacent floor area by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating conforming to Table 3.6.3.1.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence 9.23.12.3.(2), where two or more members are used in lintels, they shall be fastened together with not less than 82 mm nails in a double row, with nails not more than 450 mm apart in each row.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence 9.23.12.3.(2), where two or more members are used in lintels, they shall be fastened together with not less than 82 mm nails in a double row, with nails not more than 450 mm apart in each row.

ON Full: Where the diameter of a storage tank exceeds 45 m, the storage tank shall be provided with protection against fire or explosion in conformance with Sentence (2).
ON Variations: Where the diameter of a storage tank exceeds 45 m, the storage tank shall be provided with protection against fire or explosion in conformance with Sentence (2).

ON Full: Where plastic pipe or a composite pipe incorporating a plastic component is installed,(a) the pipe shall be aligned without added strain on the piping, (b) the pipe shall not be bent or pulled into position after being welded or joined, and (c) hangers shall not compress, cut or abrade the pipe.
ON Variations: Where plastic pipe or a composite pipe incorporating a plastic component is installed,(a) the pipe shall be aligned without added strain on the piping, (b) the pipe shall not be bent or pulled into position after being welded or joined, and (c) hangers shall not compress, cut or abrade the pipe.

ON Full: An automatic sprinkler system conforming to this Article shall be installed in a floor area containing a shelf and rack storage system.
ON Variations: An automatic sprinkler system conforming to this Article shall be installed in a floor area containing a shelf and rack storage system.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence 6.2.2.1.(3), exhaust air shall be provided for fixtures in dwelling units in accordance with ANSI/ASHRAE 62.1, "Ventilation for Acceptable Indoor Air Quality".
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence 6.2.2.1.(3), exhaust air shall be provided for fixtures in dwelling units in accordance with ANSI/ASHRAE 62.1, "Ventilation for Acceptable Indoor Air Quality".

ON Full: The total weight of additional snow resulting from sliding shall be taken as half the total weight of snow resulting from the uniform load case prescribed in Article 4.1.6.2. with, (a) the accumulation factor Ca = 1.0 for the relevant part of the upper roof, (b) the slope factor, Cs, based on the slope of the lower roof, as prescribed in Sentences 4.1.6.2.(5) and (6), and (c) the sliding snow distributed on the lower roof such that it is a maximum for x = 0 and decreases linearly to 0 at x = xd, as shown in Figure 4.1.6.11., where x and xd are as defined in Article 4.1.6.5.
ON Variations: The total weight of additional snow resulting from sliding shall be taken as half the total weight of snow resulting from the uniform load case prescribed in Article 4.1.6.2. with, (a) the accumulation factor Ca = 1.0 for the relevant part of the upper roof, (b) the slope factor, Cs, based on the slope of the lower roof, as prescribed in Sentences 4.1.6.2.(5) and (6), and (c) the sliding snow distributed on the lower roof such that it is a maximum for x = 0 and decreases linearly to 0 at x = xd, as shown in Figure 4.1.6.11., where x and xd are as defined in Article 4.1.6.5.

ON Full: Except as permitted in Sentence (7), the maximum travel distance from the bottom of an unenclosed stair to an exit along a main aisle on the ground floor level shall not exceed 45 m.
ON Variations: Except as permitted in Sentence (7), the maximum travel distance from the bottom of an unenclosed stair to an exit along a main aisle on the ground floor level shall not exceed 45 m.
