ON Variations: A beam may be considered to be laterally supported if, (a) the wood joists bear on its top flange at intervals of 610 mm or less over its entire length, (b) the load being applied to this beam is transmitted through the joists, and (c) 19 mm by 38 mm wood strips in contact with the top flange are nailed on both sides of the beam to the bottom of the joist supported.

ON Full: In a building required to be of noncombustible construction, fire blocks conforming to Article 3.1.11.7. shall be provided in the concealed spaces created by the wood members permitted by Sentence 3.1.5.8.(2), so that the maximum area of a concealed space is not more than 10 m2.
ON Variations: In a building required to be of noncombustible construction, fire blocks conforming to Article 3.1.11.7. shall be provided in the concealed spaces created by the wood members permitted by Sentence 3.1.5.8.(2), so that the maximum area of a concealed space is not more than 10 m2.

ON Full: Equipment used in a building and the ventilation of the building shall be designed so as to limit flammable vapour-air mixtures under normal operating conditions to the interior of equipment, and to not more than 1.5 m from such equipment.
ON Variations: Equipment used in a building and the ventilation of the building shall be designed so as to limit flammable vapour-air mixtures under normal operating conditions to the interior of equipment, and to not more than 1.5 m from such equipment.

ON Full: Drainage systems shall be protected by the installation of a system as provided in Subsections 7.5.4. and 7.5.5. by the installation of,(a) additional circuit vents, (b) branch vents, (c) circuit vents, (d) continuous vents, (e) dual vents, (f) fresh air inlets, (g) headers, (h) individual vents, (i) offset relief vents, (j) relief vents, (k) stack vents, (l) vent stacks, (m) wet vents, or (n) yoke vents.
ON Variations: Drainage systems shall be protected by the installation of a system as provided in Subsections 7.5.4. and 7.5.5. by the installation of,(a) additional circuit vents, (b) branch vents, (c) circuit vents, (d) continuous vents, (e) dual vents, (f) fresh air inlets, (g) headers, (h) individual vents, (i) offset relief vents, (j) relief vents, (k) stack vents, (l) vent stacks, (m) wet vents, or (n) yoke vents.

ON Full: For the purposes of Table 7.5.8.3., the length of a circuit vent shall be its developed length from the horizontal soil or waste pipe connection to a vent stack, stack vent, header or open air.
ON Variations: For the purposes of Table 7.5.8.3., the length of a circuit vent shall be its developed length from the horizontal soil or waste pipe connection to a vent stack, stack vent, header or open air.

ON Full: The landlord shall test smoke alarms that are connected to an electrical circuit after any change is made to the electrical circuit.
ON Variations: The landlord shall test smoke alarms that are connected to an electrical circuit after any change is made to the electrical circuit.

ON Full: A door acting as a closure in the fire separation in Sentence (2) is not required to be equipped with a self-closing device.
ON Variations: A door acting as a closure in the fire separation in Sentence (2) is not required to be equipped with a self-closing device.

ON Full: Where a fixture or equipment discharges sewage or waste that may damage or impair the sanitary drainage system or the functioning of a sanitary sewage works or sanitary sewage system, provision shall be made for treatment of the sewage or waste before it is discharged to the sanitary drainage system.
ON Variations: Where a fixture or equipment discharges sewage or waste that may damage or impair the sanitary drainage system or the functioning of a sanitary sewage works or sanitary sewage system, provision shall be made for treatment of the sewage or waste before it is discharged to the sanitary drainage system.

ON Full: In addition to Sentence (2), intermediate handrails shall be provided so that, a handrail is reachable within 825 mm of all portions of the required exit width, and at least one portion of the stair or ramp between two handrails is the required exit width for stairs or ramps as described in Sentences 3.4.3.2.(7) and 3.4.3.4.(4).
ON Variations: In addition to Sentence (2), intermediate handrails shall be provided so that, a handrail is reachable within 825 mm of all portions of the required exit width, and at least one portion of the stair or ramp between two handrails is the required exit width for stairs or ramps as described in Sentences 3.4.3.2.(7) and 3.4.3.4.(4).

ON Full: Except as permitted in Sentence (2), cargo pumps shall be located on shore or on piers and wharves either of noncombustible construction or of the solid-fill type, and not less than 3 m from other buildings or structures.
ON Variations: Except as permitted in Sentence (2), cargo pumps shall be located on shore or on piers and wharves either of noncombustible construction or of the solid-fill type, and not less than 3 m from other buildings or structures.

ON Full: The flame-spread rating on any exposed surface of combustible insulation, or any surface that would be exposed by cutting through it in any direction, shall be not more than 500.
ON Variations: The flame-spread rating on any exposed surface of combustible insulation, or any surface that would be exposed by cutting through it in any direction, shall be not more than 500.

ON Full: Precautions shall be taken during all stages of construction to ensure that the building is not damaged or distorted due to loads applied during construction.
ON Variations: Precautions shall be taken during all stages of construction to ensure that the building is not damaged or distorted due to loads applied during construction.

ON Full: The value of Vsp shall be doubled for unreinforced masonry elements.
ON Variations: The value of Vsp shall be doubled for unreinforced masonry elements.

ON Full: Access for fire department equipment shall be provided to each building by means of a street, private roadway or yard. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Access for fire department equipment shall be provided to each building by means of a street, private roadway or yard. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: The fire-resistance ratings of floors, roofs, loadbearing walls, columns and arches need not conform to this Subsection if such assemblies conform in all respects to the appropriate requirements in Section 3.2.
ON Variations: The fire-resistance ratings of floors, roofs, loadbearing walls, columns and arches need not conform to this Subsection if such assemblies conform in all respects to the appropriate requirements in Section 3.2.

ON Full: Cast iron soil pipe and fittings shall not be used in a water system.
ON Variations: Cast iron soil pipe and fittings shall not be used in a water system.

ON Full: Where not more than 2 dwelling units or live/work units are located in a building containing a mercantile occupancy, such mercantile occupancy shall be separated from the dwelling units or live/work units by a fire separation having not less than 1 h fire-resistance rating.
ON Variations: Where not more than 2 dwelling units or live/work units are located in a building containing a mercantile occupancy, such mercantile occupancy shall be separated from the dwelling units or live/work units by a fire separation having not less than 1 h fire-resistance rating.

ON Full: Except for a modified pool, wave action pool or a pool installed at a recreational camp, a Class A pool shall be provided with, where the water surface area is greater than 150 m2 but not greater than 230 m2, at least one lifeguard control station, and where the water surface area is greater than 230 m2, at least two lifeguard control stations.
ON Variations: Except for a modified pool, wave action pool or a pool installed at a recreational camp, a Class A pool shall be provided with, where the water surface area is greater than 150 m2 but not greater than 230 m2, at least one lifeguard control station, and where the water surface area is greater than 230 m2, at least two lifeguard control stations.

ON Full: Bins containing solid fuel shall be located at least 1.2 m from any appliance.
ON Variations: Bins containing solid fuel shall be located at least 1.2 m from any appliance.

ON Full: The water supply to each fixture in a washroom for public use shall be individually valved and each valve shall be accessible.
ON Variations: The water supply to each fixture in a washroom for public use shall be individually valved and each valve shall be accessible.

ON Full: When sizing an additional circuit vent, offset relief vent, relief vent, yoke vent and the vent pipe for an interceptor, dilution tank, sanitary sewage tank or sump, or manhole, length is not taken into consideration.
ON Variations: When sizing an additional circuit vent, offset relief vent, relief vent, yoke vent and the vent pipe for an interceptor, dilution tank, sanitary sewage tank or sump, or manhole, length is not taken into consideration.

ON Full: Except in a retirement home, an egress door from an individual dwelling unit or from a suite of residential occupancy is permitted to be provided with additional devices that require a releasing operation additional to the main door release hardware, provided the devices are readily operable from the inside without the use of keys, special devices or specialized knowledge. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Except in a retirement home, an egress door from an individual dwelling unit or from a suite of residential occupancy is permitted to be provided with additional devices that require a releasing operation additional to the main door release hardware, provided the devices are readily operable from the inside without the use of keys, special devices or specialized knowledge. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Temperature relief, pressure relief, combined temperature and pressure relief and vacuum relief valves shall conform to ANSI Z21.22 / CSA 4.4, "Relief Valves for Hot Water Supply Systems".
ON Variations: Temperature relief, pressure relief, combined temperature and pressure relief and vacuum relief valves shall conform to ANSI Z21.22 / CSA 4.4, "Relief Valves for Hot Water Supply Systems".

ON Full: Sentence (1) does not apply to the front edges of stages.
ON Variations: Sentence (1) does not apply to the front edges of stages.

ON Full: Except for the area designed to be slip proof in such fixtures, every exposed area of a fixture shall have a smooth, hard corrosion-resistant surface that is free from flaws and blemishes that may interfere with cleaning.
ON Variations: Except for the area designed to be slip proof in such fixtures, every exposed area of a fixture shall have a smooth, hard corrosion-resistant surface that is free from flaws and blemishes that may interfere with cleaning.

ON Full: Except as provided by Sentence (6) or (7), in dining, alcoholic beverage and cafeteria spaces the occupant load shall be determined from Table 3.1.17.1.
ON Variations: Except as provided by Sentence (6) or (7), in dining, alcoholic beverage and cafeteria spaces the occupant load shall be determined from Table 3.1.17.1.

ON Full: Where a building containing a repair garage also contains a dwelling unit, an air barrier system conforming to Subsection 9.25.3. shall be installed between the dwelling unit and the suite containing the garage to provide an effective air barrier to gas and exhaust fumes.
ON Variations: Where a building containing a repair garage also contains a dwelling unit, an air barrier system conforming to Subsection 9.25.3. shall be installed between the dwelling unit and the suite containing the garage to provide an effective air barrier to gas and exhaust fumes.

ON Full: An automatic means shall be provided for grounding the electrode system when it is de-energized.
ON Variations: An automatic means shall be provided for grounding the electrode system when it is de-energized.

ON Full: The site to which the leaching bed fill is added shall be generally clear of vegetation.
ON Variations: The site to which the leaching bed fill is added shall be generally clear of vegetation.

ON Full: Except as provided in Articles 7.2.11.2. to 7.2.11.4., and 7.3.7.2, the design, construction, installation and testing of fire service mains and water service pipe combined with fire service mains shall be in conformance with NFPA 24, "Installation of Private Fire Service Mains and Their Appurtenances".
ON Variations: Except as provided in Articles 7.2.11.2. to 7.2.11.4., and 7.3.7.2, the design, construction, installation and testing of fire service mains and water service pipe combined with fire service mains shall be in conformance with NFPA 24, "Installation of Private Fire Service Mains and Their Appurtenances".

ON Full: This Article applies if the bulk volume of stored tires and shredded tires in a storage yard is more than 4800 m3.
ON Variations: This Article applies if the bulk volume of stored tires and shredded tires in a storage yard is more than 4800 m3.

ON Full: The mechanical ventilation system shall introduce air to and circulate air throughout the dwelling unit in compliance with this Article.
ON Variations: The mechanical ventilation system shall introduce air to and circulate air throughout the dwelling unit in compliance with this Article.

ON Full: In a building or part of it classified as a residential occupancy, separate circuits shall be provided for audible signal devices on each floor area, and audible signal devices within dwelling units or suites of residential occupancy shall be wired on separate signal circuits from those not within suites of residential occupancy or dwelling units.
ON Variations: In a building or part of it classified as a residential occupancy, separate circuits shall be provided for audible signal devices on each floor area, and audible signal devices within dwelling units or suites of residential occupancy shall be wired on separate signal circuits from those not within suites of residential occupancy or dwelling units.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (5), in areas of a building where partitions other than permanent partitions are shown on the drawings, or where partitions might be added in the future, allowance shall be made for the weight of such partitions.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (5), in areas of a building where partitions other than permanent partitions are shown on the drawings, or where partitions might be added in the future, allowance shall be made for the weight of such partitions.

ON Full: A standpipe system is not required to be installed in the lowest storey in a building if this storey is a service room that has an area not more than 50 m2.
ON Variations: A standpipe system is not required to be installed in the lowest storey in a building if this storey is a service room that has an area not more than 50 m2.

ON Full: Where a ramp that is not submerged is adjacent to the pool wall and is used for access to the water, the pool shall be constructed so that, the landing at the bottom of the ramp is at least 450 mm but not more than 550 mm below the top of the wall separating the ramp from the pool, the landing is equipped with a floor drain at its lowest point, the top of the wall between the pool and the ramp is at least 250 mm and not more than 300 mm in width, the pool deck is capable of accommodating a movable barrier separating the deck from the ramp, the water depth at the landing is accurately and clearly marked at the landing in figures at least 100 mm high on the top of the wall separating the pool from the ramp, and the ramp has a slope not exceeding 1 in 12.
ON Variations: Where a ramp that is not submerged is adjacent to the pool wall and is used for access to the water, the pool shall be constructed so that, the landing at the bottom of the ramp is at least 450 mm but not more than 550 mm below the top of the wall separating the ramp from the pool, the landing is equipped with a floor drain at its lowest point, the top of the wall between the pool and the ramp is at least 250 mm and not more than 300 mm in width, the pool deck is capable of accommodating a movable barrier separating the deck from the ramp, the water depth at the landing is accurately and clearly marked at the landing in figures at least 100 mm high on the top of the wall separating the pool from the ramp, and the ramp has a slope not exceeding 1 in 12.

ON Full: When exposed piping systems are subjected to a pneumatic leakage test, it shall be in conformance with Article 4.4.6.4., and the piping, including the joints, shall be soaped to assist in the detection of leaks.
ON Variations: When exposed piping systems are subjected to a pneumatic leakage test, it shall be in conformance with Article 4.4.6.4., and the piping, including the joints, shall be soaped to assist in the detection of leaks.

ON Full: Subject to Sentence (4), there shall be no openings in a secondary containment.
ON Variations: Subject to Sentence (4), there shall be no openings in a secondary containment.

ON Full: When a steel fireplace liner is used with an air circulating chamber surrounding the firebox, the back and sides of the fireplace shall consist of,(a) solid masonry units not less than 90 mm thick, or (b) hollow masonry units not less than 190 mm thick.
ON Variations: When a steel fireplace liner is used with an air circulating chamber surrounding the firebox, the back and sides of the fireplace shall consist of,(a) solid masonry units not less than 90 mm thick, or (b) hollow masonry units not less than 190 mm thick.

ON Full: Fireplace liners shall be not less than,(a) 50 mm thick for the sides and back, and (b) 25 mm thick for the floor.
ON Variations: Fireplace liners shall be not less than,(a) 50 mm thick for the sides and back, and (b) 25 mm thick for the floor.

ON Full: Horizontal reinforcement in above-grade flat insulating concrete form walls shall,(a) consist of, (i) one 10M bar placed not more than 300 mm from the top of the wall, and (ii) 10M bars spaced not more than 600 mm o.c., and (b) be placed in the middle third of the wall section.
ON Variations: Horizontal reinforcement in above-grade flat insulating concrete form walls shall,(a) consist of, (i) one 10M bar placed not more than 300 mm from the top of the wall, and (ii) 10M bars spaced not more than 600 mm o.c., and (b) be placed in the middle third of the wall section.

ON Full: A compliance alternative shown in Table 11.5.1.1.A., 11.5.1.1.B., 11.5.1.1.C., 11.5.1.1.D/E. or 11.5.1.1.F. may be substituted for a requirement contained in Part 3, 4, 6 or 8 where the chief building official is satisfied that compliance with the requirement is impracticable because,(a) of structural or construction difficulties, or (b) it is detrimental to the preservation of a heritage building.
ON Variations: A compliance alternative shown in Table 11.5.1.1.A., 11.5.1.1.B., 11.5.1.1.C., 11.5.1.1.D/E. or 11.5.1.1.F. may be substituted for a requirement contained in Part 3, 4, 6 or 8 where the chief building official is satisfied that compliance with the requirement is impracticable because,(a) of structural or construction difficulties, or (b) it is detrimental to the preservation of a heritage building.

ON Full: If self-contained emergency lighting units are used, they shall conform to CSA C22.2 No. 141, "Emergency Lighting Equipment".
ON Variations: If self-contained emergency lighting units are used, they shall conform to CSA C22.2 No. 141, "Emergency Lighting Equipment".

ON Full: Except as permitted by Sentence (4), the combustible vertical glazing permitted by Sentence (2) shall have a flame-spread rating not more than 75.
ON Variations: Except as permitted by Sentence (4), the combustible vertical glazing permitted by Sentence (2) shall have a flame-spread rating not more than 75.

ON Full: Flashing need not be installed as described in Sentence (1),(a) where the upper cladding elements overlap the lower cladding elements by not less than 25 mm, (b) where, (i) the cladding above and below the joint is installed outboard of a drained and vented air space, and (ii) the horizontal detail is constructed so as to minimize ingress of precipitation into the air space, or (c) at horizontal construction joints in stucco, where, (i) the joint is finished with an expansion-contraction strip, and (ii) the cladding is installed outboard of a drained and vented air space.
ON Variations: Flashing need not be installed as described in Sentence (1),(a) where the upper cladding elements overlap the lower cladding elements by not less than 25 mm, (b) where, (i) the cladding above and below the joint is installed outboard of a drained and vented air space, and (ii) the horizontal detail is constructed so as to minimize ingress of precipitation into the air space, or (c) at horizontal construction joints in stucco, where, (i) the joint is finished with an expansion-contraction strip, and (ii) the cladding is installed outboard of a drained and vented air space.

ON Full: The total daily design sanitary sewage flow shall not exceed,(a) 5 000 L where the treatment unit is a septic tank, or (b) 10 000 L where the treatment unit is a Level II, Level III or Level IV treatment unit as described in Table 8.6.2.2.
ON Variations: The total daily design sanitary sewage flow shall not exceed,(a) 5 000 L where the treatment unit is a septic tank, or (b) 10 000 L where the treatment unit is a Level II, Level III or Level IV treatment unit as described in Table 8.6.2.2.

ON Full: Except as permitted in Sentence (3), where individual members of a built-up beam are butted together to form a joint, the joint shall occur over a support.
ON Variations: Except as permitted in Sentence (3), where individual members of a built-up beam are butted together to form a joint, the joint shall occur over a support.

ON Full: Sentence (1) does not apply, to the front edges of stages, to loading docks, to floor pits in repair garages, or where access is provided for maintenance purposes only.
ON Variations: Sentence (1) does not apply, to the front edges of stages, to loading docks, to floor pits in repair garages, or where access is provided for maintenance purposes only.

ON Full: In a building that is more than 18 m in height, measured between grade and the floor level of the top storey, an emergency power supply capable of operating under a full load for at least 2 h shall be provided by an emergency generator or by a separate service not supplied by the same substation as the primary source for fans required for smoke control purposes in Articles 3.2.8.4., 3.2.8.5., 3.2.8.6. and 3.2.8.9.
ON Variations: In a building that is more than 18 m in height, measured between grade and the floor level of the top storey, an emergency power supply capable of operating under a full load for at least 2 h shall be provided by an emergency generator or by a separate service not supplied by the same substation as the primary source for fans required for smoke control purposes in Articles 3.2.8.4., 3.2.8.5., 3.2.8.6. and 3.2.8.9.

ON Full: Where slab-on-ground construction is used, a construction joint shall be provided between the main building slab and the garage or breezeway or carport slab.
ON Variations: Where slab-on-ground construction is used, a construction joint shall be provided between the main building slab and the garage or breezeway or carport slab.

ON Full: Except for skimmers and gutters, all submerged suction and gravity fittings shall be clearly and permanently marked with a 50 mm wide band in a contrasting colour.
ON Variations: Except for skimmers and gutters, all submerged suction and gravity fittings shall be clearly and permanently marked with a 50 mm wide band in a contrasting colour.

ON Full: Buildings of residential occupancy within the scope of Part 9 are not required to be isolated unless they have access to an auxiliary water supply.
ON Variations: Buildings of residential occupancy within the scope of Part 9 are not required to be isolated unless they have access to an auxiliary water supply.

ON Full: Connections to potable water systems shall be designed and installed so that non-potable water or substances that may render the water non-potable cannot enter the system.
ON Variations: Connections to potable water systems shall be designed and installed so that non-potable water or substances that may render the water non-potable cannot enter the system.

ON Full: Air-supported structures shall not be used for Groups B, C or Group F, Division 1 major occupancies or for classrooms.
ON Variations: Air-supported structures shall not be used for Groups B, C or Group F, Division 1 major occupancies or for classrooms.

ON Full: Hot work operations shall not be undertaken on a totally enclosed container.
ON Variations: Hot work operations shall not be undertaken on a totally enclosed container.

ON Full: The unobstructed height in dwelling units and sleeping rooms in Group C occupancies shall conform to Subsection 9.5.3.
ON Variations: The unobstructed height in dwelling units and sleeping rooms in Group C occupancies shall conform to Subsection 9.5.3.

ON Full: Where an ambulatory water closet stall or enclosure is required by Sentence 3.8.2.3.(6), it shall, be at least 1 500 mm in depth and be not less than 890 mm and not more than 940 mm in width, be equipped with a door that shall, be capable of being latched from the inside with a mechanism that is operable using a closed fist, when the door is in an open position, have a clear opening of at least 810 mm, swing outward, unless the minimum dimensions in Clause (a) are not located within the door swing, be provided with spring-type or gravity hinges so that the door closes automatically, be provided with a door pull on both sides of the door, near the latch side of the door, located at a height not less than 900 mm and not more than 1 100 mm above the finished floor, and be capable of having the latch required by Subclause (i) released from the outside in the case of an emergency, be equipped with a water closet conforming to Article 3.8.3.9. and located so that its centre line is centred between the partition walls, be equipped on each side of the water closet with grab bars conforming to Clause (3)(a), and be equipped with a coat hook conforming to Clause (1)(e).
ON Variations: Where an ambulatory water closet stall or enclosure is required by Sentence 3.8.2.3.(6), it shall, be at least 1 500 mm in depth and be not less than 890 mm and not more than 940 mm in width, be equipped with a door that shall, be capable of being latched from the inside with a mechanism that is operable using a closed fist, when the door is in an open position, have a clear opening of at least 810 mm, swing outward, unless the minimum dimensions in Clause (a) are not located within the door swing, be provided with spring-type or gravity hinges so that the door closes automatically, be provided with a door pull on both sides of the door, near the latch side of the door, located at a height not less than 900 mm and not more than 1 100 mm above the finished floor, and be capable of having the latch required by Subclause (i) released from the outside in the case of an emergency, be equipped with a water closet conforming to Article 3.8.3.9. and located so that its centre line is centred between the partition walls, be equipped on each side of the water closet with grab bars conforming to Clause (3)(a), and be equipped with a coat hook conforming to Clause (1)(e).

ON Full: Except as permitted by Article 3.1.8.17., the maximum temperature rise on the opaque portion of the unexposed side of a door used as a closure in a fire separation in a location shown in Table 3.1.8.15., shall conform to the Table when tested in conformance with Sentence 3.1.8.4.(1).
ON Variations: Except as permitted by Article 3.1.8.17., the maximum temperature rise on the opaque portion of the unexposed side of a door used as a closure in a fire separation in a location shown in Table 3.1.8.15., shall conform to the Table when tested in conformance with Sentence 3.1.8.4.(1).

ON Full: Stainless steel welded joints shall conform to ASME B31.9, "Building Services Piping".
ON Variations: Stainless steel welded joints shall conform to ASME B31.9, "Building Services Piping".

ON Full: The occupant load for public areas within a rapid transit station shall be, determined in conformance with this Subsection, and based on peak hour patronage as projected for design of the transit system.
ON Variations: The occupant load for public areas within a rapid transit station shall be, determined in conformance with this Subsection, and based on peak hour patronage as projected for design of the transit system.

ON Full: Every water service pipe shall be sized according to the peak demand flow but shall not be less than ¾ in. in size.
ON Variations: Every water service pipe shall be sized according to the peak demand flow but shall not be less than ¾ in. in size.

ON Full: Underground piping shall be located not less than 300 mm away from the foundations of any building or structure, except where such piping enters the building as permitted in Article 4.4.7.7.
ON Variations: Underground piping shall be located not less than 300 mm away from the foundations of any building or structure, except where such piping enters the building as permitted in Article 4.4.7.7.

ON Full: Every caulked lead drainage joint shall be firmly packed with oakum and tightly caulked with lead to a depth of at least 25 mm.
ON Variations: Every caulked lead drainage joint shall be firmly packed with oakum and tightly caulked with lead to a depth of at least 25 mm.

ON Full: Dampproofing material referred to in Sentence (1) is not required where the wood member is at least 150 mm above the ground.
ON Variations: Dampproofing material referred to in Sentence (1) is not required where the wood member is at least 150 mm above the ground.

ON Full: Where dressing and locker rooms, water closets and urinals are provided in conjunction with a public pool, they shall be located in such a manner that bathers, after using them, shall pass through or by a shower area to reach the pool deck.
ON Variations: Where dressing and locker rooms, water closets and urinals are provided in conjunction with a public pool, they shall be located in such a manner that bathers, after using them, shall pass through or by a shower area to reach the pool deck.

ON Full: Subject to Sentences (2) to (4) and Subsection 4.12.10., Class I liquids shall not be stored, handled or used in basements or pits.
ON Variations: Subject to Sentences (2) to (4) and Subsection 4.12.10., Class I liquids shall not be stored, handled or used in basements or pits.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (2), a system for solar heating of potable water shall be installed in accordance with good engineering practice.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (2), a system for solar heating of potable water shall be installed in accordance with good engineering practice.

ON Full: Backflow preventers shall be provided in conformance with Sentence 7.2.10.10.(1).
ON Variations: Backflow preventers shall be provided in conformance with Sentence 7.2.10.10.(1).

ON Full: Where a storage tank is to be permanently disposed of, sufficient openings shall be cut in the tank to render it unfit for further use.
ON Variations: Where a storage tank is to be permanently disposed of, sufficient openings shall be cut in the tank to render it unfit for further use.

ON Full: An emergency sign containing the words IN THE EVENT OF AN EMERGENCY PUSH EMERGENCY STOP BUTTON AND USE EMERGENCY PHONE, AUDIBLE AND VISUAL SIGNAL WILL ACTIVATE shall be in letters at least 25 mm high with a 5 mm stroke and posted above the emergency stop button.
ON Variations: An emergency sign containing the words IN THE EVENT OF AN EMERGENCY PUSH EMERGENCY STOP BUTTON AND USE EMERGENCY PHONE, AUDIBLE AND VISUAL SIGNAL WILL ACTIVATE shall be in letters at least 25 mm high with a 5 mm stroke and posted above the emergency stop button.

ON Full: An outdoor area used for aboveground storage tanks, container storage, ancillary equipment and unloading facilities for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be surrounded by a firmly anchored fence that is substantially constructed to discourage climbing and unauthorized entry, not less than 1.8 m high, and provided with gates that shall be locked when the storage area is not staffed.
ON Variations: An outdoor area used for aboveground storage tanks, container storage, ancillary equipment and unloading facilities for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be surrounded by a firmly anchored fence that is substantially constructed to discourage climbing and unauthorized entry, not less than 1.8 m high, and provided with gates that shall be locked when the storage area is not staffed.

ON Full: The ground motion histories used in Sentence (4) shall be, (a) appropriately selected and scaled following good engineering practice, (b) compatible with a 5% damped response spectrum derived from the design spectral acceleration values, S(T), defined in Sentence 4.1.8.4.(9), and (c) amplitude-scaled in an appropriate manner over the period range of 0.2 T1 to 1.5 T1, where T1 is the fundamental lateral period of the structure with the supplemental energy dissipation system. (See Appendix Note A-.4.1.8.19.(4))
ON Variations: The ground motion histories used in Sentence (4) shall be, (a) appropriately selected and scaled following good engineering practice, (b) compatible with a 5% damped response spectrum derived from the design spectral acceleration values, S(T), defined in Sentence 4.1.8.4.(9), and (c) amplitude-scaled in an appropriate manner over the period range of 0.2 T1 to 1.5 T1, where T1 is the fundamental lateral period of the structure with the supplemental energy dissipation system. (See Appendix Note A-.4.1.8.19.(4))

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (2), this Section applies to plumbing facilities and plumbing systems serving dwelling units.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (2), this Section applies to plumbing facilities and plumbing systems serving dwelling units.

ON Full: Plain, reinforced or prestressed concrete used in foundations or in support of soil or rock shall conform to the requirements of Subsection 4.3.3.
ON Variations: Plain, reinforced or prestressed concrete used in foundations or in support of soil or rock shall conform to the requirements of Subsection 4.3.3.

ON Full: Communication from at least one remote firefighter emergency telephone location to the control unit shall be tested monthly on a rotational basis so that communication from all remote firefighter emergency telephone locations are tested at least once per year.
ON Variations: Communication from at least one remote firefighter emergency telephone location to the control unit shall be tested monthly on a rotational basis so that communication from all remote firefighter emergency telephone locations are tested at least once per year.

ON Full: A vapour barrier used as an air barrier shall comply with the requirements of this Subsection.
ON Variations: A vapour barrier used as an air barrier shall comply with the requirements of this Subsection.

ON Full: Air intakes shall be clearly labelled as such for identification from locations outside the dwelling unit.
ON Variations: Air intakes shall be clearly labelled as such for identification from locations outside the dwelling unit.

ON Full: Each fire compartment referred to in Sentence (2) shall be capable of accommodating, in addition to its own occupants, the occupants of the largest adjacent fire compartment based on a clear floor space of 1.5 m2 per resident in the adjacent fire compartment.
ON Variations: Each fire compartment referred to in Sentence (2) shall be capable of accommodating, in addition to its own occupants, the occupants of the largest adjacent fire compartment based on a clear floor space of 1.5 m2 per resident in the adjacent fire compartment.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (2) and elsewhere in this Part, nails specified in this Section shall be common steel wire nails or common spiral nails, conforming to,(a) ASTM F1667, "Driven Fasteners: Nails, Spikes and Staples", or (b) CSA B111, "Wire Nails, Spikes and Staples".
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (2) and elsewhere in this Part, nails specified in this Section shall be common steel wire nails or common spiral nails, conforming to,(a) ASTM F1667, "Driven Fasteners: Nails, Spikes and Staples", or (b) CSA B111, "Wire Nails, Spikes and Staples".

ON Full: The recirculation system of a public pool shall be designed, constructed and equipped to comply with Sentences (5) to (20).
ON Variations: The recirculation system of a public pool shall be designed, constructed and equipped to comply with Sentences (5) to (20).

ON Full: A 90° elbow that is part of the pre-engineered wastewater heat recovery system is permitted to have a centre-line radius that is less than the size of the pipe.
ON Variations: A 90° elbow that is part of the pre-engineered wastewater heat recovery system is permitted to have a centre-line radius that is less than the size of the pipe.

ON Full: Where the manual pull stations are relocated, alternate approved measures shall be used to maintain the level of life safety.
ON Variations: Where the manual pull stations are relocated, alternate approved measures shall be used to maintain the level of life safety.

ON Full: This Section applies to spray operations involving the use of flammable liquids, combustible liquids or combustible dry powders.
ON Variations: This Section applies to spray operations involving the use of flammable liquids, combustible liquids or combustible dry powders.

ON Full: Where a barrier-free path of travel conforming to 3.8. is provided into a suite of residential occupancy and where a bathroom within the suite is at the level of the suite entrance door, the doorway to such bathroom and to each bedroom at the same level as such bathroom shall have, when the door is in the open position, a clear width of not less than, (a) 760 mm where the door is served by a corridor or space not less than 1 060 mm wide, and (b) 810 mm where the door is served by a corridor or space less than 1 060 mm wide.
ON Variations: Where a barrier-free path of travel conforming to 3.8. is provided into a suite of residential occupancy and where a bathroom within the suite is at the level of the suite entrance door, the doorway to such bathroom and to each bedroom at the same level as such bathroom shall have, when the door is in the open position, a clear width of not less than, (a) 760 mm where the door is served by a corridor or space not less than 1 060 mm wide, and (b) 810 mm where the door is served by a corridor or space less than 1 060 mm wide.

ON Full: Covers for sump pits shall be,(a) designed to resist removal by children, and (b) sealed in accordance with Sentence 9.25.3.3.(16).
ON Variations: Covers for sump pits shall be,(a) designed to resist removal by children, and (b) sealed in accordance with Sentence 9.25.3.3.(16).

ON Full: Penetrations of a fire separation in conformance with Sentence 3.6.4.2.(2) shall be sealed by a fire stop that, when subjected to the fire test method in CAN/ULC-S115, "Fire Tests of Firestop Systems", has an FT rating not less than the fire-resistance rating required for the fire separation of the assembly.
ON Variations: Penetrations of a fire separation in conformance with Sentence 3.6.4.2.(2) shall be sealed by a fire stop that, when subjected to the fire test method in CAN/ULC-S115, "Fire Tests of Firestop Systems", has an FT rating not less than the fire-resistance rating required for the fire separation of the assembly.

ON Full: A public spa shall be surrounded by a hard-surfaced pool deck that, shall have a minimum clear deck space of not less than 1.8 m at the main entrance point, shall have a clear deck space of 900 mm on all sides, except as required by Clause (a) and permitted by Sentence (5), shall be sloped away from the pool to waste drains or to adjacent lower ground at a slope of between 2% and 4%, in the case of an outdoor public spa, and shall be impervious and sloped away from the pool to waste drains at a slope of between 1% and 4%, in the case of an indoor public spa.
ON Variations: A public spa shall be surrounded by a hard-surfaced pool deck that, shall have a minimum clear deck space of not less than 1.8 m at the main entrance point, shall have a clear deck space of 900 mm on all sides, except as required by Clause (a) and permitted by Sentence (5), shall be sloped away from the pool to waste drains or to adjacent lower ground at a slope of between 2% and 4%, in the case of an outdoor public spa, and shall be impervious and sloped away from the pool to waste drains at a slope of between 1% and 4%, in the case of an indoor public spa.

ON Full: Where the supplemental exhaust is provided by a principal exhaust fan serving multiple exhaust air intakes required in rooms described in Sentence (2), the principal exhaust fan shall be controlled by a manual switch located in each room served by that exhaust fan and wired in parallel with the manual switch required in Sentence 9.32.3.4.(4).
ON Variations: Where the supplemental exhaust is provided by a principal exhaust fan serving multiple exhaust air intakes required in rooms described in Sentence (2), the principal exhaust fan shall be controlled by a manual switch located in each room served by that exhaust fan and wired in parallel with the manual switch required in Sentence 9.32.3.4.(4).

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (2), doors described in Sentence (1) shall be provided with,(a) a deadbolt lock with a cylinder having no fewer than five pins, and (b) a bolt throw not less than 25 mm long, protected with a solid or hardened free-turning ring or bevelled cylinder housing.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (2), doors described in Sentence (1) shall be provided with,(a) a deadbolt lock with a cylinder having no fewer than five pins, and (b) a bolt throw not less than 25 mm long, protected with a solid or hardened free-turning ring or bevelled cylinder housing.

ON Full: Where a difference in elevation between levels in a walkway is not more than 200 mm, a curb ramp conforming to Sentences (3) and (4) may be provided.
ON Variations: Where a difference in elevation between levels in a walkway is not more than 200 mm, a curb ramp conforming to Sentences (3) and (4) may be provided.

ON Full: This Section applies to buildings, parts of buildings or equipment where combustible dusts are produced in quantities or concentrations that create an explosion or fire hazard.
ON Variations: This Section applies to buildings, parts of buildings or equipment where combustible dusts are produced in quantities or concentrations that create an explosion or fire hazard.

ON Full: Existing ventilation systems where make-up air is provided are deemed to be in compliance with Article 4.1.7.5.
ON Variations: Existing ventilation systems where make-up air is provided are deemed to be in compliance with Article 4.1.7.5.

ON Full: The surface temperature of equipment in a spraying area shall not exceed 66°C.
ON Variations: The surface temperature of equipment in a spraying area shall not exceed 66°C.

ON Full: In-car emergency service switches shall be provided in all elevator cars.
ON Variations: In-car emergency service switches shall be provided in all elevator cars.

ON Full: Where roof sheathing supports are spaced at more than 406 mm o.c., the maximum spacing of fasteners for roof sheathing shall be 150 mm along edges and intermediate supports.
ON Variations: Where roof sheathing supports are spaced at more than 406 mm o.c., the maximum spacing of fasteners for roof sheathing shall be 150 mm along edges and intermediate supports.

ON Full: Except as permitted in Sentence 7.2.5.7.(1), polyethylene water pipe shall not be used except for a water service pipe.
ON Variations: Except as permitted in Sentence 7.2.5.7.(1), polyethylene water pipe shall not be used except for a water service pipe.

ON Full: Hot water pipes that are vertically connected to a hot water storage tank shall have heat traps on both inlet and outlet piping as close as practical to the tank, except where the tank,(a) has an integral heat trap, or (b) serves a recirculating system.
ON Variations: Hot water pipes that are vertically connected to a hot water storage tank shall have heat traps on both inlet and outlet piping as close as practical to the tank, except where the tank,(a) has an integral heat trap, or (b) serves a recirculating system.

ON Full: Except as required by Sentence (4), the height of guards for exit stairs and exit ramps, as well as their landings, shall be not less than 1 070 mm.
ON Variations: Except as required by Sentence (4), the height of guards for exit stairs and exit ramps, as well as their landings, shall be not less than 1 070 mm.

ON Full: Where a fire alarm system has been installed with no provisions to transmit a signal to the fire department, a legible notice, that is not easily removed, shall be affixed to the wall near each manual pull station with wording that the fire department is to be notified in the event of a fire emergency and including the emergency telephone number for the municipality or the telephone number of the fire department.
ON Variations: Where a fire alarm system has been installed with no provisions to transmit a signal to the fire department, a legible notice, that is not easily removed, shall be affixed to the wall near each manual pull station with wording that the fire department is to be notified in the event of a fire emergency and including the emergency telephone number for the municipality or the telephone number of the fire department.

ON Full: Brass pipe shall conform to ASTM B43, "Seamless Red Brass Pipe, Standard Sizes".
ON Variations: Brass pipe shall conform to ASTM B43, "Seamless Red Brass Pipe, Standard Sizes".

ON Full: In ventilating systems that exhaust air to the outdoors, provision shall be made for the admission of a supply of make-up air in sufficient quantity so that the operation of the exhaust system and other exhaust equipment or combustion equipment is not adversely affected.
ON Variations: In ventilating systems that exhaust air to the outdoors, provision shall be made for the admission of a supply of make-up air in sufficient quantity so that the operation of the exhaust system and other exhaust equipment or combustion equipment is not adversely affected.

ON Full: A vent from a holding tank may connect into the venting system of the building served by the holding tank provided that,(a) the vent is not less than 3 in. trade size, and (b) the installation of the vent shall conform to the requirements in Part 7.
ON Variations: A vent from a holding tank may connect into the venting system of the building served by the holding tank provided that,(a) the vent is not less than 3 in. trade size, and (b) the installation of the vent shall conform to the requirements in Part 7.

ON Full: Despite the definition of owner in Article 1.4.1.2. of Division A, in the case of a rental suite of residential occupancy, only the landlord shall be considered to be the owner for the purpose of applying Article 1.2.1.1. of Division A to this Subsection.
ON Variations: Despite the definition of owner in Article 1.4.1.2. of Division A, in the case of a rental suite of residential occupancy, only the landlord shall be considered to be the owner for the purpose of applying Article 1.2.1.1. of Division A to this Subsection.

ON Full: Where a prefabricated system is installed as part of a drainage system and venting system, all other plumbing work shall be tested and inspected and a final test shall be carried out on the complete system.
ON Variations: Where a prefabricated system is installed as part of a drainage system and venting system, all other plumbing work shall be tested and inspected and a final test shall be carried out on the complete system.

ON Full: Western cedar shakes shall be not less than No. 1 grade or Handsplit grade, and western cedar shingles not less than No. 2 grade, except that No. 3 grade may be used for undercoursing.
ON Variations: Western cedar shakes shall be not less than No. 1 grade or Handsplit grade, and western cedar shingles not less than No. 2 grade, except that No. 3 grade may be used for undercoursing.

ON Full: This Section applies to buildings of residential occupancy used or intended to be used as seasonal recreational buildings.
ON Variations: This Section applies to buildings of residential occupancy used or intended to be used as seasonal recreational buildings.

ON Full: Where step footings are used,(a) the vertical rise between horizontal portions shall not exceed 600 mm, and (b) the horizontal distance between risers shall be not less than 600 mm.
ON Variations: Where step footings are used,(a) the vertical rise between horizontal portions shall not exceed 600 mm, and (b) the horizontal distance between risers shall be not less than 600 mm.

ON Full: Fire alarm audible signal devices shall be supplemented by visual signal devices in any floor area in which, the ambient noise level is more than 87 dBA, or the occupants of the floor area, use ear protective devices, are located within an audiometric booth, or are located within sound insulated enclosures.
ON Variations: Fire alarm audible signal devices shall be supplemented by visual signal devices in any floor area in which, the ambient noise level is more than 87 dBA, or the occupants of the floor area, use ear protective devices, are located within an audiometric booth, or are located within sound insulated enclosures.

ON Full: Where the specified live load exceeds 2.4 kPa footings shall be designed in accordance with Section 4.2.
ON Variations: Where the specified live load exceeds 2.4 kPa footings shall be designed in accordance with Section 4.2.

ON Full: Wall clearances of at least 600 mm shall be maintained where stored commodities may swell or expand with the absorption of water.
ON Variations: Wall clearances of at least 600 mm shall be maintained where stored commodities may swell or expand with the absorption of water.

ON Full: A fire alarm system shall be verified in conformance with CAN/ULC-S537, "Verification of Fire Alarm Systems", to ensure satisfactory operation.
ON Variations: A fire alarm system shall be verified in conformance with CAN/ULC-S537, "Verification of Fire Alarm Systems", to ensure satisfactory operation.

ON Full: Every pipe that supplies a fixture shall have a capacity that will produce a flow in the fixture that will flush the fixture and keep it in a sanitary condition.
ON Variations: Every pipe that supplies a fixture shall have a capacity that will produce a flow in the fixture that will flush the fixture and keep it in a sanitary condition.

ON Full: The header line and distribution pipes within a leaching bed shall be designed and constructed so that they can be detected by,(a) magnetic means, (b) means of a 14 gauge TW solid copper light coloured plastic coated tracer wire, or (c) other means of subsurface detection.
ON Variations: The header line and distribution pipes within a leaching bed shall be designed and constructed so that they can be detected by,(a) magnetic means, (b) means of a 14 gauge TW solid copper light coloured plastic coated tracer wire, or (c) other means of subsurface detection.

ON Full: Lintels described in Sentence (2) shall be constructed in accordance with Table A-17, A-18 or A-19.
ON Variations: Lintels described in Sentence (2) shall be constructed in accordance with Table A-17, A-18 or A-19.

ON Full: Despite Sentence (1), other approved means may be used to ensure adequate fire department access to the piles.
ON Variations: Despite Sentence (1), other approved means may be used to ensure adequate fire department access to the piles.

ON Full: If a room or group of rooms is intended for different occupancies at different times, the value to be used from Table 3.1.17.1. shall be the value that gives the greatest number of persons for the occupancies concerned.
ON Variations: If a room or group of rooms is intended for different occupancies at different times, the value to be used from Table 3.1.17.1. shall be the value that gives the greatest number of persons for the occupancies concerned.

ON Full: All treatment units referred to in Sentences (1) and (2) that contain mechanical components shall be equipped with an audible and visual warning alarm so located to warn the occupants of the building served or the operator of the treatment unit of a malfunction in the operation of the treatment unit.
ON Variations: All treatment units referred to in Sentences (1) and (2) that contain mechanical components shall be equipped with an audible and visual warning alarm so located to warn the occupants of the building served or the operator of the treatment unit of a malfunction in the operation of the treatment unit.

ON Full: Fire alarm systems, including those incorporating a voice communication system, shall be provided with an emergency power supply conforming to Sentences (2) to (4).
ON Variations: Fire alarm systems, including those incorporating a voice communication system, shall be provided with an emergency power supply conforming to Sentences (2) to (4).

ON Full: Powder transport, application and recovery equipment shall be grounded.
ON Variations: Powder transport, application and recovery equipment shall be grounded.

ON Full: Except as otherwise noted in this Part, this Subsection applies to industrial occupancies where the use, storage and handling of flammable liquids or combustible liquids is secondary to the principal activity.
ON Variations: Except as otherwise noted in this Part, this Subsection applies to industrial occupancies where the use, storage and handling of flammable liquids or combustible liquids is secondary to the principal activity.

ON Full: Except as permitted in Sentence (2), the fire chamber floor and hearth shall be supported on a reinforced concrete slab not less than a 100 mm thick at its supports and, if cantilevered, not less than 50 mm thick at its unsupported edge.
ON Variations: Except as permitted in Sentence (2), the fire chamber floor and hearth shall be supported on a reinforced concrete slab not less than a 100 mm thick at its supports and, if cantilevered, not less than 50 mm thick at its unsupported edge.

ON Full: Primary and secondary power supplies that serve carbon monoxide alarms shall be maintained in operating condition.
ON Variations: Primary and secondary power supplies that serve carbon monoxide alarms shall be maintained in operating condition.

ON Full: Totally enclosed nonmetallic raceways used in a plenum in a building permitted to be of combustible construction shall meet the requirements of Clause 3.1.5.20.(1)(a).
ON Variations: Totally enclosed nonmetallic raceways used in a plenum in a building permitted to be of combustible construction shall meet the requirements of Clause 3.1.5.20.(1)(a).

ON Full: The requirements of Sentence (1) are waived for wall assemblies that comply with the requirements of Article 3.1.5.5.
ON Variations: The requirements of Sentence (1) are waived for wall assemblies that comply with the requirements of Article 3.1.5.5.

ON Full: Where hardboard cladding is grooved, the grooves shall not extend more than 1.5 mm into the minimum required thickness. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Where hardboard cladding is grooved, the grooves shall not extend more than 1.5 mm into the minimum required thickness. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Except as permitted by Sentence (2), the connections and supports for structural framing members that are connected to or supported on a firewall and have a fire-resistance rating less than that required for the firewall, shall be designed so that the failure of the framing systems during a fire will not affect the integrity of the firewall during the fire.
ON Variations: Except as permitted by Sentence (2), the connections and supports for structural framing members that are connected to or supported on a firewall and have a fire-resistance rating less than that required for the firewall, shall be designed so that the failure of the framing systems during a fire will not affect the integrity of the firewall during the fire.

ON Full: Rooms for storage tanks and the information described in Sentence (2) shall be identified in the fire safety plan required in Article 4.1.5.6.
ON Variations: Rooms for storage tanks and the information described in Sentence (2) shall be identified in the fire safety plan required in Article 4.1.5.6.

ON Full: Sheathing membrane is permitted to be omitted beneath cladding when the joints in the cladding are formed to effectively prevent the passage of wind and rain in conformance with Sentence (2) or (3), as applicable.
ON Variations: Sheathing membrane is permitted to be omitted beneath cladding when the joints in the cladding are formed to effectively prevent the passage of wind and rain in conformance with Sentence (2) or (3), as applicable.

ON Full: Class I liquids stored in refrigerators shall be kept in closed containers.
ON Variations: Class I liquids stored in refrigerators shall be kept in closed containers.

ON Full: Waterproofing materials, components, assemblies or systems installed to provide the required protection shall form a continuous and impervious barrier to the ingress of ground water and be capable of accommodating,(a) imperfections, construction joints, control joints and expansion joints, (See Appendix A.) (b) junctions between different building assemblies, and (c) elements penetrating building assemblies.
ON Variations: Waterproofing materials, components, assemblies or systems installed to provide the required protection shall form a continuous and impervious barrier to the ingress of ground water and be capable of accommodating,(a) imperfections, construction joints, control joints and expansion joints, (See Appendix A.) (b) junctions between different building assemblies, and (c) elements penetrating building assemblies.

ON Full: Tubular metal or plastic traps that conform to ASME A112.18.2 / CSA B125.2, "Plumbing Waste Fittings" shall be used in accessible locations.
ON Variations: Tubular metal or plastic traps that conform to ASME A112.18.2 / CSA B125.2, "Plumbing Waste Fittings" shall be used in accessible locations.

ON Full: Sentence (1) does not apply where a silencing switch is part of an approved integrated voice communication system and signal silencing takes place to allow fire emergency instructions to be heard.
ON Variations: Sentence (1) does not apply where a silencing switch is part of an approved integrated voice communication system and signal silencing takes place to allow fire emergency instructions to be heard.

ON Full: Matches shall not be stored within 3 m of any elevator shaft opening, stairway or other vertical opening.
ON Variations: Matches shall not be stored within 3 m of any elevator shaft opening, stairway or other vertical opening.

ON Full: The curb required by Sentence (3) shall have, a height of 50 mm, rounded edges, a coved base, and a raised nosing at the top to serve as a fingerhold for a bather in the water.
ON Variations: The curb required by Sentence (3) shall have, a height of 50 mm, rounded edges, a coved base, and a raised nosing at the top to serve as a fingerhold for a bather in the water.

ON Full: A rooftop enclosure for a stairway need not have a fire-resistance rating nor be constructed as a fire separation.
ON Variations: A rooftop enclosure for a stairway need not have a fire-resistance rating nor be constructed as a fire separation.

ON Full: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.2.3.7.(6), cladding for a building within the scope of Article 3.2.2.43A. or 3.2.2.50A. that exceeds 4 storeys in building height or cladding for a fire compartment in such a building shall be noncombustible.
ON Variations: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.2.3.7.(6), cladding for a building within the scope of Article 3.2.2.43A. or 3.2.2.50A. that exceeds 4 storeys in building height or cladding for a fire compartment in such a building shall be noncombustible.

ON Full: Where the percolation time is determined by a percolation test, there shall be a minimum of 3 locations selected, suitably spaced to accurately evaluate the leaching bed area, with the highest percolation time of the tests being used. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Where the percolation time is determined by a percolation test, there shall be a minimum of 3 locations selected, suitably spaced to accurately evaluate the leaching bed area, with the highest percolation time of the tests being used. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: No vertical leg of the drainage pipe from a water closet or other fixture that has an integral siphonic flushing action shall exceed 1 000 mm.
ON Variations: No vertical leg of the drainage pipe from a water closet or other fixture that has an integral siphonic flushing action shall exceed 1 000 mm.

ON Full: Piping, fixtures, tanks or devices shall be supported independently of each other.
ON Variations: Piping, fixtures, tanks or devices shall be supported independently of each other.

ON Full: Permissible deviations from the design alignment and the location of the top of deep foundation units shall be determined by design analysis and shall be indicated on the drawings.
ON Variations: Permissible deviations from the design alignment and the location of the top of deep foundation units shall be determined by design analysis and shall be indicated on the drawings.

ON Full: Portable extinguishers shall be provided for storage rooms described in Article 4.2.9.1. in conformance with Section 6.2.
ON Variations: Portable extinguishers shall be provided for storage rooms described in Article 4.2.9.1. in conformance with Section 6.2.

ON Full: Where the beam referred to in Sentence (1) is supported below the top of the foundation walls, the ends of such beams shall be protected from the weather.
ON Variations: Where the beam referred to in Sentence (1) is supported below the top of the foundation walls, the ends of such beams shall be protected from the weather.

ON Full: The uniformly distributed live load shall be not less than the value listed in Table 4.1.5.3., which may be reduced as provided in Article 4.1.5.8., applied uniformly over the entire area, or on any portions of the area, whichever produces the most critical effects in the members concerned.
ON Variations: The uniformly distributed live load shall be not less than the value listed in Table 4.1.5.3., which may be reduced as provided in Article 4.1.5.8., applied uniformly over the entire area, or on any portions of the area, whichever produces the most critical effects in the members concerned.

ON Full: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.3.2.13.(1), every flight of interior stairs shall have no fewer than 3 risers.
ON Variations: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.3.2.13.(1), every flight of interior stairs shall have no fewer than 3 risers.

ON Full: Wall studs shall be continuous for the full storey height except at openings and shall not be spliced except by finger-jointing with a structural adhesive. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Wall studs shall be continuous for the full storey height except at openings and shall not be spliced except by finger-jointing with a structural adhesive. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Openings in loadbearing walls greater than the required stud spacing shall be framed with lintels designed to carry the superimposed loads to adjacent studs.
ON Variations: Openings in loadbearing walls greater than the required stud spacing shall be framed with lintels designed to carry the superimposed loads to adjacent studs.

ON Full: Buildings described in Article 9.38.1.1. shall comply with Article 9.1.1.5.
ON Variations: Buildings described in Article 9.38.1.1. shall comply with Article 9.1.1.5.

ON Full: An access hatch installed through an assembly constructed with an air barrier system shall be weatherstripped around the perimeter to minimize air leakage.
ON Variations: An access hatch installed through an assembly constructed with an air barrier system shall be weatherstripped around the perimeter to minimize air leakage.

ON Full: Where containers for two or more liquids having different flash points are stored together in a single individual storage area, the maximum quantity permitted in the individual storage area shall equal that permitted for the liquid with the lowest flash point.
ON Variations: Where containers for two or more liquids having different flash points are stored together in a single individual storage area, the maximum quantity permitted in the individual storage area shall equal that permitted for the liquid with the lowest flash point.

ON Full: Where dampproofing is provided as described in Article 9.13.2.7., the concrete used for floors-on-ground shall have a compressive strength of not less than 15 MPa after 28 days.
ON Variations: Where dampproofing is provided as described in Article 9.13.2.7., the concrete used for floors-on-ground shall have a compressive strength of not less than 15 MPa after 28 days.

ON Full: In loadbearing exterior and interior walls of 38 mm by 64 mm framing members, lintels shall consist of,(a) solid 64 mm thick members on edge, or (b) 38 mm thick and 19 mm thick members fastened together with a double row of nails not less than 63 mm long and spaced not more than 450 mm apart.
ON Variations: In loadbearing exterior and interior walls of 38 mm by 64 mm framing members, lintels shall consist of,(a) solid 64 mm thick members on edge, or (b) 38 mm thick and 19 mm thick members fastened together with a double row of nails not less than 63 mm long and spaced not more than 450 mm apart.

ON Full: A dwelling unit with a water distribution system shall contain,(a) a kitchen sink, (b) a lavatory, (c) a bathtub or shower stall, and (d) a water closet or a drainless composting toilet.
ON Variations: A dwelling unit with a water distribution system shall contain,(a) a kitchen sink, (b) a lavatory, (c) a bathtub or shower stall, and (d) a water closet or a drainless composting toilet.

ON Full: For cases where Cg and Cp are combined into a single product, CpCg, as provided in Article 4.1.7.6., the values Cp and Cg need not be independently specified. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: For cases where Cg and Cp are combined into a single product, CpCg, as provided in Article 4.1.7.6., the values Cp and Cg need not be independently specified. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Penetrations of the air barrier system, such as those created by the installation of doors, windows and other fenestration shall be sealed to maintain the integrity of the air barrier system over the entire surface.
ON Variations: Penetrations of the air barrier system, such as those created by the installation of doors, windows and other fenestration shall be sealed to maintain the integrity of the air barrier system over the entire surface.

ON Full: Where a building contains more than one establishment, the total daily design sanitary sewage flow shall be the sum of the total daily design sanitary sewage flow for each establishment.
ON Variations: Where a building contains more than one establishment, the total daily design sanitary sewage flow shall be the sum of the total daily design sanitary sewage flow for each establishment.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (4), outdoor processing equipment having emergency relief venting and a working pressure more than 17 kPa (gauge) shall be separated from property lines and buildings on the same property by distances 1.5 times those in Table 4.3.2.A. for stable liquids, and four times those in Table 4.3.2.A. for unstable liquids.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (4), outdoor processing equipment having emergency relief venting and a working pressure more than 17 kPa (gauge) shall be separated from property lines and buildings on the same property by distances 1.5 times those in Table 4.3.2.A. for stable liquids, and four times those in Table 4.3.2.A. for unstable liquids.

ON Full: The fire emergency systems required by this Code and the Building Code shall be checked, inspected, tested and maintained in accordance with Sections 7.2 and 7.3.
ON Variations: The fire emergency systems required by this Code and the Building Code shall be checked, inspected, tested and maintained in accordance with Sections 7.2 and 7.3.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (6), the design elastic base shear, Ved, is equal to the elastic base shear, Ve, obtained from a Linear Dynamic Analysis.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (6), the design elastic base shear, Ved, is equal to the elastic base shear, Ve, obtained from a Linear Dynamic Analysis.

ON Full: Where a room or space is not provided with natural ventilation as described in Sentence (1), mechanical ventilation shall be provided to exhaust inside air from or to introduce outside air to that room or space at the rate of one-half air change per hour if the room or space is mechanically cooled in summer, and one air change per hour if it is not.
ON Variations: Where a room or space is not provided with natural ventilation as described in Sentence (1), mechanical ventilation shall be provided to exhaust inside air from or to introduce outside air to that room or space at the rate of one-half air change per hour if the room or space is mechanically cooled in summer, and one air change per hour if it is not.

ON Full: All exterior joints between logs shall be rendered water-tight by methods such as machined joints, oakum packing, cement parging, chinking, caulking or a combination of these.
ON Variations: All exterior joints between logs shall be rendered water-tight by methods such as machined joints, oakum packing, cement parging, chinking, caulking or a combination of these.

ON Full: If the results of the sampling required by Sentence (1) do not comply with Sentence (3), the person operating the treatment unit shall, (a) resample the effluent in accordance with Clauses (1)(a) and (b) within 6 months after the previous sampling has been completed, and (b) promptly submit the results of the resampling required by Clause (a) to the chief building official.
ON Variations: If the results of the sampling required by Sentence (1) do not comply with Sentence (3), the person operating the treatment unit shall, (a) resample the effluent in accordance with Clauses (1)(a) and (b) within 6 months after the previous sampling has been completed, and (b) promptly submit the results of the resampling required by Clause (a) to the chief building official.

ON Full: A fireplace insert installed in a masonry fireplace shall have, (a) a listed metal chimney liner installed from the insert collar to the top of the chimney, or (b) a direct sealed connection to the chimney flue where such provision is part of an insert conforming to Sentence 9.22.10.1.(1).
ON Variations: A fireplace insert installed in a masonry fireplace shall have, (a) a listed metal chimney liner installed from the insert collar to the top of the chimney, or (b) a direct sealed connection to the chimney flue where such provision is part of an insert conforming to Sentence 9.22.10.1.(1).

ON Full: A principal exhaust fan required under this Article may be controlled by a dehumidistat or other automatic control device where the manual switch required in Sentence (2) is capable of activating the fan regardless of the setting of the automatic control.
ON Variations: A principal exhaust fan required under this Article may be controlled by a dehumidistat or other automatic control device where the manual switch required in Sentence (2) is capable of activating the fan regardless of the setting of the automatic control.

ON Full: Supplemental exhaust required in this Article may be provided by means of a heat recovery ventilator installed in accordance with Article 9.32.3.11.
ON Variations: Supplemental exhaust required in this Article may be provided by means of a heat recovery ventilator installed in accordance with Article 9.32.3.11.

ON Full: This Section applies to garages and carports serving a house or an individual dwelling unit.
ON Variations: This Section applies to garages and carports serving a house or an individual dwelling unit.

ON Full: Spare sprinkler heads shall be kept in a cabinet where the temperature does not exceed 38°C.
ON Variations: Spare sprinkler heads shall be kept in a cabinet where the temperature does not exceed 38°C.

ON Full: Except in basements of houses, each unsprinklered basement exceeding 25 m in length or width shall be provided with direct access to the outdoors to at least one street.
ON Variations: Except in basements of houses, each unsprinklered basement exceeding 25 m in length or width shall be provided with direct access to the outdoors to at least one street.

ON Full: The design spectral acceleration values of S(T) shall be determined as follows, using linear interpolation for intermediate values of T: S(T) = F(0.2)Sa(0.2) or F(0.5)Sa(0.5), whichever is larger, for T   0.2 s = F(0.5)Sa(0.5) for T = 0.5 s = F(1.0)Sa(1.0) for T = 1.0 s = F(2.0)Sa(2.0) for T = 2.0 s = F(5.0)Sa(5.0) for T = 5.0 s = F(10.0)Sa(10.0) for T   10.0 s
ON Variations: The design spectral acceleration values of S(T) shall be determined as follows, using linear interpolation for intermediate values of T: S(T) = F(0.2)Sa(0.2) or F(0.5)Sa(0.5), whichever is larger, for T   0.2 s = F(0.5)Sa(0.5) for T = 0.5 s = F(1.0)Sa(1.0) for T = 1.0 s = F(2.0)Sa(2.0) for T = 2.0 s = F(5.0)Sa(5.0) for T = 5.0 s = F(10.0)Sa(10.0) for T   10.0 s

ON Full: Where dampproofing is installed between a floor-on-ground and a finished floor, it shall consist of,(a) rigid extruded/expanded polystyrene with sealed or ship-lapped joints that has, (i) sufficient compressive strength to support the floor assembly, and (ii) a water vapour permeance complying with Clause 9.13.2.2.(2)(b), or (b) polyethylene not less than 0.05 mm with joints lapped not less than 100 mm.
ON Variations: Where dampproofing is installed between a floor-on-ground and a finished floor, it shall consist of,(a) rigid extruded/expanded polystyrene with sealed or ship-lapped joints that has, (i) sufficient compressive strength to support the floor assembly, and (ii) a water vapour permeance complying with Clause 9.13.2.2.(2)(b), or (b) polyethylene not less than 0.05 mm with joints lapped not less than 100 mm.

ON Full: Units described in Sentence (1) shall extend not less than 90 mm into adjacent wythes.
ON Variations: Units described in Sentence (1) shall extend not less than 90 mm into adjacent wythes.

ON Full: The protection required by Sentence (1) is permitted to be waived if the building is sprinklered.
ON Variations: The protection required by Sentence (1) is permitted to be waived if the building is sprinklered.

ON Full: For purposes of Sentences (6) and (7), the volume of an interconnected floor space need not include the aggregate volume of those floor areas or portions of floor areas designed to have zoned air extraction in accordance with Sentence (4).
ON Variations: For purposes of Sentences (6) and (7), the volume of an interconnected floor space need not include the aggregate volume of those floor areas or portions of floor areas designed to have zoned air extraction in accordance with Sentence (4).

ON Full: Rubber gasket joints for cast iron and ductile-iron pressure pipe for water piping shall conform to ANSI/AWWA C111 / A21.11, "Rubber-Gasket Joints for Ductile-Iron Pressure Pipe and Fittings".
ON Variations: Rubber gasket joints for cast iron and ductile-iron pressure pipe for water piping shall conform to ANSI/AWWA C111 / A21.11, "Rubber-Gasket Joints for Ductile-Iron Pressure Pipe and Fittings".

ON Full: A vent pipe shall be provided within 1 500 mm of the inlet to a grease interceptor complete with a cleanout to provide cleaning of the vent pipe.
ON Variations: A vent pipe shall be provided within 1 500 mm of the inlet to a grease interceptor complete with a cleanout to provide cleaning of the vent pipe.

ON Full: Where marine vessels are loading or unloading flammable liquids or combustible liquids or are being refuelled, portable extinguishers with a rating of not less than 40B:C shall be placed on the pier or wharf in the vicinity of loading or unloading operations, so that they are accessible in the event of a fire emergency.
ON Variations: Where marine vessels are loading or unloading flammable liquids or combustible liquids or are being refuelled, portable extinguishers with a rating of not less than 40B:C shall be placed on the pier or wharf in the vicinity of loading or unloading operations, so that they are accessible in the event of a fire emergency.

ON Full: Water flow alarm tests using the most hydraulically remote test connection shall be performed annually on wet sprinkler systems.
ON Variations: Water flow alarm tests using the most hydraulically remote test connection shall be performed annually on wet sprinkler systems.

ON Full: A tank shall be securely anchored when located in an area subject to flooding or where ground water levels may cause hydrostatic pressures.
ON Variations: A tank shall be securely anchored when located in an area subject to flooding or where ground water levels may cause hydrostatic pressures.

ON Full: Where a vent pipe is installed as a result of additions or alterations to a plumbing system in an existing building, the vent pipe may be erected outside the building, provided that, (a) no single change of direction of the vent pipe exceeds 45°, (b) all parts of the vent pipe are nominally vertical, (c) the vent pipe is increased to not less than 3 in. in size before penetrating a wall or roof, and (d) where the building is 4 storeys or less in height, the vent pipe terminates above the roof of the building.
ON Variations: Where a vent pipe is installed as a result of additions or alterations to a plumbing system in an existing building, the vent pipe may be erected outside the building, provided that, (a) no single change of direction of the vent pipe exceeds 45°, (b) all parts of the vent pipe are nominally vertical, (c) the vent pipe is increased to not less than 3 in. in size before penetrating a wall or roof, and (d) where the building is 4 storeys or less in height, the vent pipe terminates above the roof of the building.

ON Full: Dry-pipe valves shall be tested to ensure that they are in operating condition.
ON Variations: Dry-pipe valves shall be tested to ensure that they are in operating condition.

ON Full: Unless controlled in a manner that will not create a fire or explosion hazard, a device, operation or activity that produces open flames, sparks or heat shall not be used or carried out in an area described in Article 4.1.1.1.
ON Variations: Unless controlled in a manner that will not create a fire or explosion hazard, a device, operation or activity that produces open flames, sparks or heat shall not be used or carried out in an area described in Article 4.1.1.1.
