ON Full: The provision of make-up air is not required for mechanical exhausting devices operating a subfloor depressurization system installed for the purpose of reducing the risk of radon ingress.
ON Variations: The provision of make-up air is not required for mechanical exhausting devices operating a subfloor depressurization system installed for the purpose of reducing the risk of radon ingress.

ON Full: No pipe fitting, joint or connection that would tend to intercept solids or reduce the flow through a pipe by more than 10 percent shall be used in a plumbing system.
ON Variations: No pipe fitting, joint or connection that would tend to intercept solids or reduce the flow through a pipe by more than 10 percent shall be used in a plumbing system.

ON Full: An opening for access required by Sentence (1) shall, have a sill no higher than 1 070 mm above the inside floor, and be not less than 1 100 mm high by not less than, 550 mm wide for a building not designed for the storage or use of dangerous goods, or 750 mm wide for a building designed for the storage or use of dangerous goods.
ON Variations: An opening for access required by Sentence (1) shall, have a sill no higher than 1 070 mm above the inside floor, and be not less than 1 100 mm high by not less than, 550 mm wide for a building not designed for the storage or use of dangerous goods, or 750 mm wide for a building designed for the storage or use of dangerous goods.

ON Full: A building that is more than 18 m in height, measured between grade and the floor level of the top storey, and that contains an interconnected floor space, shall be designed to limit the passage of smoke from a fire into exit stairshafts opening into an interconnected floor space so that during a 2 h period after the start of fire, such stairshafts will not contain more than 1% by volume of contaminated air from the fire floor, assuming an outdoor temperature equal to the January design temperature on a 2.5% basis.
ON Variations: A building that is more than 18 m in height, measured between grade and the floor level of the top storey, and that contains an interconnected floor space, shall be designed to limit the passage of smoke from a fire into exit stairshafts opening into an interconnected floor space so that during a 2 h period after the start of fire, such stairshafts will not contain more than 1% by volume of contaminated air from the fire floor, assuming an outdoor temperature equal to the January design temperature on a 2.5% basis.

ON Full: If a building is sprinklered, sprinkler protection need not be provided in the space below a raised floor in a computer room, if the optical fibre cables and electrical wires and cables in this space conform to the test requirements in Article 3.1.5.21., if the building is of noncombustible construction and other combustible components are limited to those permitted in Subsection 3.1.5., if this space is used to circulate conditioned air and the air handling system is designed to prevent the circulation of smoke upon a signal from a smoke detector, if all of this space is easily accessible by providing access sections or panels in the raised floor, and if the computer room is more than 2 000 m2 and the annunciator has separate zone indicators of the actuation of smoke detectors located in this space so that the coverage for each zone is not more than 2 000 m2.
ON Variations: If a building is sprinklered, sprinkler protection need not be provided in the space below a raised floor in a computer room, if the optical fibre cables and electrical wires and cables in this space conform to the test requirements in Article 3.1.5.21., if the building is of noncombustible construction and other combustible components are limited to those permitted in Subsection 3.1.5., if this space is used to circulate conditioned air and the air handling system is designed to prevent the circulation of smoke upon a signal from a smoke detector, if all of this space is easily accessible by providing access sections or panels in the raised floor, and if the computer room is more than 2 000 m2 and the annunciator has separate zone indicators of the actuation of smoke detectors located in this space so that the coverage for each zone is not more than 2 000 m2.

ON Full: Sentence (1) does not apply to fireplaces and cooking appliances.
ON Variations: Sentence (1) does not apply to fireplaces and cooking appliances.

ON Full: Except as permitted by Sentences (2) and (3), if a storey classified as a Group E or Group F, Division 1 or 2 major occupancy is required to be separated from the storey above by a fire separation, every opening in the exterior wall of the lower storey that is located vertically below an opening in the storey above shall be separated from the storey above by a canopy projecting not less than 1 m from the face of the building at the intervening floor level, and the canopy required by Clause (a) shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the floor assembly but need not be more than 1 h, except as required elsewhere in this Subsection.
ON Variations: Except as permitted by Sentences (2) and (3), if a storey classified as a Group E or Group F, Division 1 or 2 major occupancy is required to be separated from the storey above by a fire separation, every opening in the exterior wall of the lower storey that is located vertically below an opening in the storey above shall be separated from the storey above by a canopy projecting not less than 1 m from the face of the building at the intervening floor level, and the canopy required by Clause (a) shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the floor assembly but need not be more than 1 h, except as required elsewhere in this Subsection.

ON Full: There shall be identification on a fire department connection for a sprinkler system in a rapid transit station to indicate that the connection is part of the station system.
ON Variations: There shall be identification on a fire department connection for a sprinkler system in a rapid transit station to indicate that the connection is part of the station system.

ON Full: Joints in sheet-type ground cover required in Sentence (1) shall be lapped not less than 100 mm and weighted down.
ON Variations: Joints in sheet-type ground cover required in Sentence (1) shall be lapped not less than 100 mm and weighted down.

ON Full: The design forces associated with the lateral capacity of the SFRS need not exceed the forces determined in accordance with Sentence 4.1.8.7.(1) with RdRo taken as 1.0, unless otherwise provided by the applicable referenced design standards for elements, in which case the design forces associated with the lateral capacity of the SFRS need not exceed the forces determined in accordance with Sentence 4.1.8.7.(1) with RdRo taken as less than or equal to 1.3. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: The design forces associated with the lateral capacity of the SFRS need not exceed the forces determined in accordance with Sentence 4.1.8.7.(1) with RdRo taken as 1.0, unless otherwise provided by the applicable referenced design standards for elements, in which case the design forces associated with the lateral capacity of the SFRS need not exceed the forces determined in accordance with Sentence 4.1.8.7.(1) with RdRo taken as less than or equal to 1.3. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Drip plates and screens subject to paint deposits shall be removable for cleaning.
ON Variations: Drip plates and screens subject to paint deposits shall be removable for cleaning.

ON Full: Except as permitted by Sentences (2) and 3.2.2.9.(2), suites of residential occupancy shall be separated from each other and the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.
ON Variations: Except as permitted by Sentences (2) and 3.2.2.9.(2), suites of residential occupancy shall be separated from each other and the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.

ON Full: Manual emergency recall operation shall be provided for all elevators.
ON Variations: Manual emergency recall operation shall be provided for all elevators.

ON Full: Where the performance level of an existing building is reduced under Clause 11.4.2.3.(1)(f), the following requirements apply: (a) the retirement home shall be sprinklered, (b) a voice communication system conforming to Article 3.2.4.23. shall be provided in the building, and (c) doors to suites and sleeping rooms not within suites in the retirement home, other than doors leading directly to the exterior, shall be equipped with self-closing devices.
ON Variations: Where the performance level of an existing building is reduced under Clause 11.4.2.3.(1)(f), the following requirements apply: (a) the retirement home shall be sprinklered, (b) a voice communication system conforming to Article 3.2.4.23. shall be provided in the building, and (c) doors to suites and sleeping rooms not within suites in the retirement home, other than doors leading directly to the exterior, shall be equipped with self-closing devices.

ON Full: A floor drain shall be installed in a washroom for public use that contains a urinal or a water closet equipped with an automatic flushing device. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: A floor drain shall be installed in a washroom for public use that contains a urinal or a water closet equipped with an automatic flushing device. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Exposed pipe risers shall be protected against mechanical damage by installing such risers adjacent to walls or pilasters, between flanges of steel columns, or within securely anchored larger perforated pipe, and providing mechanical guards where the risers are exposed to mobile equipment.
ON Variations: Exposed pipe risers shall be protected against mechanical damage by installing such risers adjacent to walls or pilasters, between flanges of steel columns, or within securely anchored larger perforated pipe, and providing mechanical guards where the risers are exposed to mobile equipment.

ON Full: If the clearance below the base of a storage tank exceeds 300 mm, the supports for the storage tank shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 2 h.
ON Variations: If the clearance below the base of a storage tank exceeds 300 mm, the supports for the storage tank shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 2 h.

ON Full: Where a final test is made,(a) every trap shall be filled with water, (b) the bottom of the system being tested shall terminate at the building trap, test plug or cap, (c) except as provided in Sentence (2), smoke from smoke-generating machines shall be forced into the system, (d) when the smoke appears from all roof terminals they shall be closed, and (e) a pressure equivalent to a 25 mm water column shall be maintained for 15 min without the addition of more smoke.
ON Variations: Where a final test is made,(a) every trap shall be filled with water, (b) the bottom of the system being tested shall terminate at the building trap, test plug or cap, (c) except as provided in Sentence (2), smoke from smoke-generating machines shall be forced into the system, (d) when the smoke appears from all roof terminals they shall be closed, and (e) a pressure equivalent to a 25 mm water column shall be maintained for 15 min without the addition of more smoke.

ON Full: All structural components of a shelf and rack storage system, including posts, beams, decks, walkways, connections and their supports such as concrete slabs and foundations, shall be designed in accordance with Part 4.
ON Variations: All structural components of a shelf and rack storage system, including posts, beams, decks, walkways, connections and their supports such as concrete slabs and foundations, shall be designed in accordance with Part 4.

ON Full: A Class 2 sewage system shall be designed and constructed so that the loading rate to the side walls shall be not more than the value calculated using the formula, where, LR = loading rate of the sidewalls in litres per day/m2, and T = percolation time.
ON Variations: A Class 2 sewage system shall be designed and constructed so that the loading rate to the side walls shall be not more than the value calculated using the formula, where, LR = loading rate of the sidewalls in litres per day/m2, and T = percolation time.

ON Full: An arena type building intended for occasional use for trade shows and similar exhibition purposes shall be classified as Group A, Division 3 occupancy.
ON Variations: An arena type building intended for occasional use for trade shows and similar exhibition purposes shall be classified as Group A, Division 3 occupancy.

ON Full: Windows and doors described in Sentence (1) do not require a thermal break where they are installed as,(a) vehicular access doors, (b) storm windows and doors, or (c) windows and doors that are required to have a fire-resistance rating.
ON Variations: Windows and doors described in Sentence (1) do not require a thermal break where they are installed as,(a) vehicular access doors, (b) storm windows and doors, or (c) windows and doors that are required to have a fire-resistance rating.

ON Full: Non-potable water systems for re-use purposes shall be designed, constructed and installed to conform to good engineering practice appropriate to the circumstances such as described in, (a) the ASHRAE Handbooks, (b) ASPE Data Books, or (c) CAN/CSA-B128.1, "Design and Installation of Non-Potable Water Systems".
ON Variations: Non-potable water systems for re-use purposes shall be designed, constructed and installed to conform to good engineering practice appropriate to the circumstances such as described in, (a) the ASHRAE Handbooks, (b) ASPE Data Books, or (c) CAN/CSA-B128.1, "Design and Installation of Non-Potable Water Systems".

ON Full: Combustible tubing for pneumatic controls may be used in buildings required to be of noncombustible construction provided it has an outside diameter not exceeding 10 mm.
ON Variations: Combustible tubing for pneumatic controls may be used in buildings required to be of noncombustible construction provided it has an outside diameter not exceeding 10 mm.

ON Full: The Chief Fire Official shall be notified when bowling alleys are to be resurfaced.
ON Variations: The Chief Fire Official shall be notified when bowling alleys are to be resurfaced.

ON Full: Except in a retirement home, storage lockers in storage rooms are permitted to be constructed of wood in a building of residential occupancy required to be of noncombustible construction.
ON Variations: Except in a retirement home, storage lockers in storage rooms are permitted to be constructed of wood in a building of residential occupancy required to be of noncombustible construction.

ON Full: Accumulations of waste dust from dry powder finishes shall be removed using the methods set out in Article 5.10.1.2.
ON Variations: Accumulations of waste dust from dry powder finishes shall be removed using the methods set out in Article 5.10.1.2.

ON Full: The energy supply to hand-held spray guns shall be controlled by a switch that also controls the coating material supply.
ON Variations: The energy supply to hand-held spray guns shall be controlled by a switch that also controls the coating material supply.

ON Full: A fire alarm system that includes waterflow indicating devices shall be designed to notify the fire department, in conformance with Sentence (4), that an alarm has been initiated.
ON Variations: A fire alarm system that includes waterflow indicating devices shall be designed to notify the fire department, in conformance with Sentence (4), that an alarm has been initiated.

ON Full: Booths and kiosks that are not more than 20 m2 in area and are used only by the transit agency for fare collection, dissemination of information or similar non-mercantile occupancies shall be of noncombustible construction and are not required to be separated from the remainder of the floor area by a fire separation.
ON Variations: Booths and kiosks that are not more than 20 m2 in area and are used only by the transit agency for fare collection, dissemination of information or similar non-mercantile occupancies shall be of noncombustible construction and are not required to be separated from the remainder of the floor area by a fire separation.

ON Full: The Chief Fire Official may approve an alternative to a requirement of Sentence (4) or (5) if, in the opinion of the Chief Fire Official, the alternative provides life safety protection equivalent to or greater than the life safety protection that would be provided by the requirement.
ON Variations: The Chief Fire Official may approve an alternative to a requirement of Sentence (4) or (5) if, in the opinion of the Chief Fire Official, the alternative provides life safety protection equivalent to or greater than the life safety protection that would be provided by the requirement.

ON Full: The stairway lighting for basements that do not contain finished space or lead to an outside entrance or built-in garage and that serve not more than one dwelling unit is permitted to be controlled by a single switch located at the head of the stairs.
ON Variations: The stairway lighting for basements that do not contain finished space or lead to an outside entrance or built-in garage and that serve not more than one dwelling unit is permitted to be controlled by a single switch located at the head of the stairs.

ON Full: Flashing shall consist of not less than,(a) 1.73 mm thick sheet lead, (b) 0.33 mm thick galvanized steel, (c) 0.46 mm thick copper, (d) 0.46 mm thick zinc, (e) 0.48 mm thick aluminum, or (f) 1.02 mm thick vinyl.
ON Variations: Flashing shall consist of not less than,(a) 1.73 mm thick sheet lead, (b) 0.33 mm thick galvanized steel, (c) 0.46 mm thick copper, (d) 0.46 mm thick zinc, (e) 0.48 mm thick aluminum, or (f) 1.02 mm thick vinyl.

ON Full: Maximum spacing of supports for gypsum board applied as a single layer shall conform to Table 9.29.5.3.
ON Variations: Maximum spacing of supports for gypsum board applied as a single layer shall conform to Table 9.29.5.3.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentences (2) and (3), a building is permitted to be classified as not dynamically sensitive.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentences (2) and (3), a building is permitted to be classified as not dynamically sensitive.

ON Full: Where flammable liquids and combustible liquids contained in dip tanks are heated or have a flash point below 43°C, the electrical installation shall conform to the Electrical Safety Code made under the Electricity Act, 1998.
ON Variations: Where flammable liquids and combustible liquids contained in dip tanks are heated or have a flash point below 43°C, the electrical installation shall conform to the Electrical Safety Code made under the Electricity Act, 1998.

ON Full: ° elbows of 4 in. size or less in sanitary drainage systems may be used,(a) to change the direction of piping from horizontal to vertical, in the direction of flow, (b) where a trap arm enters a wall, or (c) to connect trap arms as permitted by Sentence 7.5.6.3.(2).
ON Variations: ° elbows of 4 in. size or less in sanitary drainage systems may be used,(a) to change the direction of piping from horizontal to vertical, in the direction of flow, (b) where a trap arm enters a wall, or (c) to connect trap arms as permitted by Sentence 7.5.6.3.(2).

ON Full: Urinals shall be equipped with a device capable of preventing automatic flush cycles when not in use.
ON Variations: Urinals shall be equipped with a device capable of preventing automatic flush cycles when not in use.

ON Full: Except as required by Article 6.2.6.9., portable extinguishers for Class B fires shall be provided as required in Table 6.2.6.B.
ON Variations: Except as required by Article 6.2.6.9., portable extinguishers for Class B fires shall be provided as required in Table 6.2.6.B.

ON Full: A ventilation duct or opening, that penetrates the fire separation to the outdoors, need not be protected by a closure at the penetration.
ON Variations: A ventilation duct or opening, that penetrates the fire separation to the outdoors, need not be protected by a closure at the penetration.

ON Full: The acceptance criteria for a material tested in accordance with Sentence (3) shall be based on the cumulative emissions from all layers, which must not exceed the criteria stated in Clauses (2)(a) and (b).
ON Variations: The acceptance criteria for a material tested in accordance with Sentence (3) shall be based on the cumulative emissions from all layers, which must not exceed the criteria stated in Clauses (2)(a) and (b).

ON Full: Site-batched concrete used for garage floors, carport floors and exterior flatwork shall have air entrainment of 5 to 8%.
ON Variations: Site-batched concrete used for garage floors, carport floors and exterior flatwork shall have air entrainment of 5 to 8%.

ON Full: The performance level of an existing building of combustible construction is reduced where the existing building is extended by adding a storey or storeys such that the extended building will be more than four storeys in building height.
ON Variations: The performance level of an existing building of combustible construction is reduced where the existing building is extended by adding a storey or storeys such that the extended building will be more than four storeys in building height.

ON Full: Portable extinguishers in conformance with Section 6.2 shall be provided in each building located in a salvage yard.
ON Variations: Portable extinguishers in conformance with Section 6.2 shall be provided in each building located in a salvage yard.

ON Full: Every sanitary drainage system shall be connected to a public sanitary sewer, a public combined sewer or a private sewage disposal system.
ON Variations: Every sanitary drainage system shall be connected to a public sanitary sewer, a public combined sewer or a private sewage disposal system.

ON Full: A secured access opening to allow for regular maintenance of the effluent filter shall be provided at the ground surface.
ON Variations: A secured access opening to allow for regular maintenance of the effluent filter shall be provided at the ground surface.

ON Full: Every fixture, plumbing appliance, interceptor, cleanout, valve, device or piece of equipment shall be so located that it is readily accessible for use, cleaning and maintenance.
ON Variations: Every fixture, plumbing appliance, interceptor, cleanout, valve, device or piece of equipment shall be so located that it is readily accessible for use, cleaning and maintenance.

ON Full: For the design of flat roofs with steps in elevation, the values of CpCg are provided in Figure 4.1.7.6.D.
ON Variations: For the design of flat roofs with steps in elevation, the values of CpCg are provided in Figure 4.1.7.6.D.

ON Full: The area limits of Clause (2)(a) are waived for an interior undivided open space used as an arena, a rink or a swimming pool provided that other spaces in the building that are separated from the open space are individually zoned in accordance with the requirements of Sentence (2).
ON Variations: The area limits of Clause (2)(a) are waived for an interior undivided open space used as an arena, a rink or a swimming pool provided that other spaces in the building that are separated from the open space are individually zoned in accordance with the requirements of Sentence (2).

ON Full: Air admittance valves shall,(a) only vent fixtures located on the same storey, and (b) be connected to the horizontal fixture drain.
ON Variations: Air admittance valves shall,(a) only vent fixtures located on the same storey, and (b) be connected to the horizontal fixture drain.

ON Full: Thermal electrical conduction heating conforming to Sentence (2) is permitted to be used by passing a low-voltage alternating current through the pipe.
ON Variations: Thermal electrical conduction heating conforming to Sentence (2) is permitted to be used by passing a low-voltage alternating current through the pipe.

ON Full: The height of storage of flammable liquids and combustible liquids shall be not more than those permitted for unprotected storage in Table 4.2.7.A.
ON Variations: The height of storage of flammable liquids and combustible liquids shall be not more than those permitted for unprotected storage in Table 4.2.7.A.

ON Full: Material compatibility and deterioration resistance are not required where it can be shown that incompatibility or uncontrolled deterioration will not adversely affect any of,(a) the health or safety of building users, (b) the intended use of the building, or (c) the operation of building services.
ON Variations: Material compatibility and deterioration resistance are not required where it can be shown that incompatibility or uncontrolled deterioration will not adversely affect any of,(a) the health or safety of building users, (b) the intended use of the building, or (c) the operation of building services.

ON Full: Ties required in Sentence (1) shall be anchored to the wood framing at one end and shaped to provide a mechanical key at the other end to develop the strength of the tie.
ON Variations: Ties required in Sentence (1) shall be anchored to the wood framing at one end and shaped to provide a mechanical key at the other end to develop the strength of the tie.

ON Full: Where a special fire suppression system is installed after November 21, 2007 to comply with this Code, the system shall conform to one of the standards set out in Sentences (3) and (4).
ON Variations: Where a special fire suppression system is installed after November 21, 2007 to comply with this Code, the system shall conform to one of the standards set out in Sentences (3) and (4).

ON Full: None of the specified loads prescribed in Table 9.8.8.2. need be considered to act simultaneously.
ON Variations: None of the specified loads prescribed in Table 9.8.8.2. need be considered to act simultaneously.

ON Full: Materials, design, construction and installation of windows, doors and skylights that separate conditioned space from unconditioned space or the exterior but that are not within the scope of AAMA/WDMA/CSA 101/I.S.2/A440, "NAFS - North American Fenestration Standard/Specification for Windows, Doors, and Skylights" shall,(a) conform to, (i) this Subsection or Subsection 9.7.4., and (ii) the applicable requirements in Subsection 9.7.6., or (b) conform to Part 5.
ON Variations: Materials, design, construction and installation of windows, doors and skylights that separate conditioned space from unconditioned space or the exterior but that are not within the scope of AAMA/WDMA/CSA 101/I.S.2/A440, "NAFS - North American Fenestration Standard/Specification for Windows, Doors, and Skylights" shall,(a) conform to, (i) this Subsection or Subsection 9.7.4., and (ii) the applicable requirements in Subsection 9.7.6., or (b) conform to Part 5.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (5), the requirements in Sentence 3.4.6.16.(1) for doors to be readily opened from the inside apply to required exit doors in a rapid transit station.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (5), the requirements in Sentence 3.4.6.16.(1) for doors to be readily opened from the inside apply to required exit doors in a rapid transit station.

ON Full: Valves and their connections to a storage tank shall be made of steel, except that when the chemical characteristics of the liquid stored are incompatible with steel, materials other than steel shall be used.
ON Variations: Valves and their connections to a storage tank shall be made of steel, except that when the chemical characteristics of the liquid stored are incompatible with steel, materials other than steel shall be used.

ON Full: Where a shallow foundation unit has not been placed or located as indicated on the drawings, (a) the error shall be corrected, or (b) the design of the foundation unit shall be recalculated for the altered conditions by the designer.
ON Variations: Where a shallow foundation unit has not been placed or located as indicated on the drawings, (a) the error shall be corrected, or (b) the design of the foundation unit shall be recalculated for the altered conditions by the designer.

ON Full: This Subsection applies to windows, doors and skylights that are within the scope of AAMA/WDMA/CSA 101/I.S.2/A440, "NAFS - North American Fenestration Standard/Specification for Windows, Doors, and Skylights".
ON Variations: This Subsection applies to windows, doors and skylights that are within the scope of AAMA/WDMA/CSA 101/I.S.2/A440, "NAFS - North American Fenestration Standard/Specification for Windows, Doors, and Skylights".

ON Full: This Section applies to public amusement areas located outdoors.
ON Variations: This Section applies to public amusement areas located outdoors.

ON Full: An area used for assembly occupancies designed for a live load of less than 4.8 kPa and roofs designed for the minimum loading specified in Table 4.1.5.3. shall have no reduction for tributary area.
ON Variations: An area used for assembly occupancies designed for a live load of less than 4.8 kPa and roofs designed for the minimum loading specified in Table 4.1.5.3. shall have no reduction for tributary area.

ON Full: Unless the wall around an opening is reinforced to withstand earth pressure, the portion of the foundation wall beneath an opening shall be considered laterally unsupported, if,(a) the opening is more than 1.2 m wide, or (b) the total width of the openings in the foundation wall constitutes more than 25% of the length of the wall.
ON Variations: Unless the wall around an opening is reinforced to withstand earth pressure, the portion of the foundation wall beneath an opening shall be considered laterally unsupported, if,(a) the opening is more than 1.2 m wide, or (b) the total width of the openings in the foundation wall constitutes more than 25% of the length of the wall.

ON Full: Subject to Sentence (2), compressed air or other non-inert gas pressure shall not be used in the transfer of flammable liquids or combustible liquids in a closed piping system.
ON Variations: Subject to Sentence (2), compressed air or other non-inert gas pressure shall not be used in the transfer of flammable liquids or combustible liquids in a closed piping system.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (3), the minimum number of water closets for tents shall be determined in accordance with Table 3.7.4.3.E.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (3), the minimum number of water closets for tents shall be determined in accordance with Table 3.7.4.3.E.

ON Full: Bonding required in Sentence (1) shall consist of a metallic bond wire connected to the fill stem or to some part of the loading structure in electrical contact with the fill stem in conformance with Subsection 4.1.4.
ON Variations: Bonding required in Sentence (1) shall consist of a metallic bond wire connected to the fill stem or to some part of the loading structure in electrical contact with the fill stem in conformance with Subsection 4.1.4.

ON Full: A water distribution system supplying hot water to any bathtub, shower or hand basin that is accessible to a patient or resident in a Group B, Division 2 or 3 occupancy or a resident of a group home, home for special care or residence for adults with developmental disabilities shall have one or more temperature gauges and control devices that are, (a) accessible only to supervisory staff, and (b) capable of being adjusted to ensure that the temperature of the water supplied to the fixtures does not exceed 49°C.
ON Variations: A water distribution system supplying hot water to any bathtub, shower or hand basin that is accessible to a patient or resident in a Group B, Division 2 or 3 occupancy or a resident of a group home, home for special care or residence for adults with developmental disabilities shall have one or more temperature gauges and control devices that are, (a) accessible only to supervisory staff, and (b) capable of being adjusted to ensure that the temperature of the water supplied to the fixtures does not exceed 49°C.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (3), compensating construction required under this Subsection applies to the part of the building being altered and shall include,(a) fire separations, with the required fire-resistance ratings, separating the part being altered from the floor areas immediately above and below and from the immediate adjacent areas, and (b) access to exits and exits from the building, where the alteration adversely affects the exit system of the building.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (3), compensating construction required under this Subsection applies to the part of the building being altered and shall include,(a) fire separations, with the required fire-resistance ratings, separating the part being altered from the floor areas immediately above and below and from the immediate adjacent areas, and (b) access to exits and exits from the building, where the alteration adversely affects the exit system of the building.

ON Full: A principal-load factor of 1.5 shall be applied to the weight of saturated soil used in load combination case 1 of Table 4.1.3.2.A.
ON Variations: A principal-load factor of 1.5 shall be applied to the weight of saturated soil used in load combination case 1 of Table 4.1.3.2.A.

ON Full: Except where the flooring consists of ceramic tiles applied with adhesive, where a separate panel-type underlay or concrete topping is applied to a subfloor on joists spaced not more than 406 mm o.c., the subfloor may consist of not less than,(a) 12.5 mm thick plywood, (b) 12.5 mm thick OSB conforming to O-2 grade, (c) 12.7 mm thick OSB conforming to O-1 grade, (d) 12.7 mm thick waferboard conforming to R-1 grade, or (e) OSB conforming to 2R32 / 2F16 grade.
ON Variations: Except where the flooring consists of ceramic tiles applied with adhesive, where a separate panel-type underlay or concrete topping is applied to a subfloor on joists spaced not more than 406 mm o.c., the subfloor may consist of not less than,(a) 12.5 mm thick plywood, (b) 12.5 mm thick OSB conforming to O-2 grade, (c) 12.7 mm thick OSB conforming to O-1 grade, (d) 12.7 mm thick waferboard conforming to R-1 grade, or (e) OSB conforming to 2R32 / 2F16 grade.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentences (4) and (5), required exit doors and doors in required means of egress, except doors in means of egress within dwelling units, shall swing on the vertical axis.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentences (4) and (5), required exit doors and doors in required means of egress, except doors in means of egress within dwelling units, shall swing on the vertical axis.

ON Full: Masonry veneer individually supported by masonry or wood frame back-up shall be secured to the back-up in conformance with Subsection 4.3.2.
ON Variations: Masonry veneer individually supported by masonry or wood frame back-up shall be secured to the back-up in conformance with Subsection 4.3.2.

ON Full: Elevator hoistways shall not be designed for the venting required by Sentence (1).
ON Variations: Elevator hoistways shall not be designed for the venting required by Sentence (1).

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence 3.3.4.11.(10) and except for corridors served by a single exit as described in Sentence 3.3.4.4.(6), a dead end public corridor is permitted in a residential occupancy provided it is not more than 6 m long.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence 3.3.4.11.(10) and except for corridors served by a single exit as described in Sentence 3.3.4.4.(6), a dead end public corridor is permitted in a residential occupancy provided it is not more than 6 m long.

ON Full: This Section applies to,(a) rectangular masonry or concrete chimneys not more than 12 m in height serving fireplaces or serving appliances having a combined total rated heat output of 120 kW or less, and (b) flue pipes serving solid fuel-burning appliances.
ON Variations: This Section applies to,(a) rectangular masonry or concrete chimneys not more than 12 m in height serving fireplaces or serving appliances having a combined total rated heat output of 120 kW or less, and (b) flue pipes serving solid fuel-burning appliances.

ON Full: The access required by Sentence (1) is permitted to be provided by, doors, windows or other means that provide an opening not less than 1 100 mm high and 550 mm wide, with a sill no higher than 900 mm above the inside floor, or an interior stairway immediately accessible from the outdoors
ON Variations: The access required by Sentence (1) is permitted to be provided by, doors, windows or other means that provide an opening not less than 1 100 mm high and 550 mm wide, with a sill no higher than 900 mm above the inside floor, or an interior stairway immediately accessible from the outdoors

ON Full: Where reinforcement for masonry is required in this Section, it shall be installed in conformance with the requirements for reinforced masonry as contained in CSA A371, "Masonry Construction for Buildings".
ON Variations: Where reinforcement for masonry is required in this Section, it shall be installed in conformance with the requirements for reinforced masonry as contained in CSA A371, "Masonry Construction for Buildings".

ON Full: Except as otherwise provided in this Section, an exit from any floor area shall be one of the following used singly or in combination:(a) an exterior doorway, (b) an exterior passageway, (c) an exterior ramp, (d) an exterior stairway, (e) a fire escape (as described in Subsection 3.4.7.), (f) a horizontal exit, (g) an interior passageway, (h) an interior ramp, or (i) an interior stairway.
ON Variations: Except as otherwise provided in this Section, an exit from any floor area shall be one of the following used singly or in combination:(a) an exterior doorway, (b) an exterior passageway, (c) an exterior ramp, (d) an exterior stairway, (e) a fire escape (as described in Subsection 3.4.7.), (f) a horizontal exit, (g) an interior passageway, (h) an interior ramp, or (i) an interior stairway.

ON Full: Where the performance level of an existing building is reduced under Subsection 11.4.2., compensating construction shall be carried out in accordance with this Subsection.
ON Variations: Where the performance level of an existing building is reduced under Subsection 11.4.2., compensating construction shall be carried out in accordance with this Subsection.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (4), the energy efficiency of a building or part of a building of residential occupancy that is within the scope of Part 9 and is intended for occupancy on a continuing basis during the winter months shall, (a) meet the performance level that is equal to a rating of 80 or more when evaluated in accordance with NRCan, "EnerGuide for New Houses: Administrative and Technical Procedures", or (b) conform to Chapters 1 and 2 of MMA Supplementary Standard SB-12, "Energy Efficiency for Housing".
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (4), the energy efficiency of a building or part of a building of residential occupancy that is within the scope of Part 9 and is intended for occupancy on a continuing basis during the winter months shall, (a) meet the performance level that is equal to a rating of 80 or more when evaluated in accordance with NRCan, "EnerGuide for New Houses: Administrative and Technical Procedures", or (b) conform to Chapters 1 and 2 of MMA Supplementary Standard SB-12, "Energy Efficiency for Housing".

ON Full: Where a heat recovery ventilator is connected to a forced air heating system, the supply side of the ventilator shall be directly connected to the return air side of the forced air heating system.
ON Variations: Where a heat recovery ventilator is connected to a forced air heating system, the supply side of the ventilator shall be directly connected to the return air side of the forced air heating system.

ON Full: The electrical system and equipment in an air-supported structure, including electrical fuses and switches, shall be inaccessible to the public.
ON Variations: The electrical system and equipment in an air-supported structure, including electrical fuses and switches, shall be inaccessible to the public.

ON Full: Rubbish shall not be burned on the premises unless permitted in accordance with Article 2.4.4.4.
ON Variations: Rubbish shall not be burned on the premises unless permitted in accordance with Article 2.4.4.4.

ON Full: This Section applies to the operation and maintenance of all sewage systems.
ON Variations: This Section applies to the operation and maintenance of all sewage systems.

ON Full: The controls for the remote release of a locking device permitted by Sentence (3) shall be in an area that is readily accessible to supervisory staff.
ON Variations: The controls for the remote release of a locking device permitted by Sentence (3) shall be in an area that is readily accessible to supervisory staff.

ON Full: A public spa water heater shall be equipped with an upper limit cut-off device, that is independent of the normal public spa water temperature thermostat, and that limits the maximum water temperature of the public spa to 40°C.
ON Variations: A public spa water heater shall be equipped with an upper limit cut-off device, that is independent of the normal public spa water temperature thermostat, and that limits the maximum water temperature of the public spa to 40°C.

ON Full: A portion of a roof that supports an occupancy shall be constructed in conformance with the fire separation requirements of Articles 3.2.2.20. to 3.2.2.83. for floor assemblies.
ON Variations: A portion of a roof that supports an occupancy shall be constructed in conformance with the fire separation requirements of Articles 3.2.2.20. to 3.2.2.83. for floor assemblies.

ON Full: A soil or waste stack that serves as a wet vent does not require a vent stack.
ON Variations: A soil or waste stack that serves as a wet vent does not require a vent stack.

ON Full: An effluent filter shall be installed in the outlet flow path of every septic tank that discharges effluent to a leaching bed.
ON Variations: An effluent filter shall be installed in the outlet flow path of every septic tank that discharges effluent to a leaching bed.

ON Full: The amount of fuel stored and connected to the emergency power system shall be sufficient to operate the engine for at least 2 h.
ON Variations: The amount of fuel stored and connected to the emergency power system shall be sufficient to operate the engine for at least 2 h.

ON Full: Except for a modified pool and wave action pool, at least, one ladder or set of steps shall be provided in both the deep and shallow areas of a public pool for entry into and egress from the pool water, and one barrier-free access shall be provided for entry into and egress from the water of a public pool as required by Article 3.11.3.3.
ON Variations: Except for a modified pool and wave action pool, at least, one ladder or set of steps shall be provided in both the deep and shallow areas of a public pool for entry into and egress from the pool water, and one barrier-free access shall be provided for entry into and egress from the water of a public pool as required by Article 3.11.3.3.

ON Full: A basement used primarily as a storage garage is permitted to be considered as a separate building for the purposes of Subsection 3.2.2. and Sentences 3.2.5.13.(2) and (3), provided the floor and roof assemblies above the basement and, except as permitted by Sentence (2), the exterior walls of the basement above the adjoining ground level are constructed as fire separations of, masonry or concrete having a fire-resistance rating not less than 2 h, or noncombustible construction having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 2 h, where the building conforms to Clauses 3.1.10.2.(4)(a) and (c) to (e).
ON Variations: A basement used primarily as a storage garage is permitted to be considered as a separate building for the purposes of Subsection 3.2.2. and Sentences 3.2.5.13.(2) and (3), provided the floor and roof assemblies above the basement and, except as permitted by Sentence (2), the exterior walls of the basement above the adjoining ground level are constructed as fire separations of, masonry or concrete having a fire-resistance rating not less than 2 h, or noncombustible construction having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 2 h, where the building conforms to Clauses 3.1.10.2.(4)(a) and (c) to (e).

ON Full: For the design of buildings that are classified as dynamically sensitive in accordance with Sentence 4.1.7.2.(2), one of the following procedures shall be used to determine the specified wind loads: (a) the Dynamic Procedure described in Article 4.1.7.8., or (b) the Wind Tunnel Procedure described in Article 4.1.7.12.
ON Variations: For the design of buildings that are classified as dynamically sensitive in accordance with Sentence 4.1.7.2.(2), one of the following procedures shall be used to determine the specified wind loads: (a) the Dynamic Procedure described in Article 4.1.7.8., or (b) the Wind Tunnel Procedure described in Article 4.1.7.12.

ON Full: Handrails shall be terminated in a manner that will not obstruct pedestrian travel or create a hazard.
ON Variations: Handrails shall be terminated in a manner that will not obstruct pedestrian travel or create a hazard.

ON Full: Sentence (1) does not apply to an industrial occupancy where the welding and cutting operations do not present a fire or explosion hazard to adjacent areas.
ON Variations: Sentence (1) does not apply to an industrial occupancy where the welding and cutting operations do not present a fire or explosion hazard to adjacent areas.

ON Full: Emergency lighting shall be provided to average levels not less than 10 lx at floor or tread level in public areas in a rapid transit station.
ON Variations: Emergency lighting shall be provided to average levels not less than 10 lx at floor or tread level in public areas in a rapid transit station.

ON Full: A ball test shall be carried out on a sanitary building drain, sanitary building sewer, storm building drain and a storm building sewer buried underground.
ON Variations: A ball test shall be carried out on a sanitary building drain, sanitary building sewer, storm building drain and a storm building sewer buried underground.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (2) and Articles 9.8.4.5. and 9.8.4.5A., tapered treads shall have a run that,(a) is not less than 150 mm at the narrow end of the tread, and (b) complies with the dimensions for rectangular treads specified in Table 9.8.4.1. when measured at a point 300 mm from the centre line of the inside handrail.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (2) and Articles 9.8.4.5. and 9.8.4.5A., tapered treads shall have a run that,(a) is not less than 150 mm at the narrow end of the tread, and (b) complies with the dimensions for rectangular treads specified in Table 9.8.4.1. when measured at a point 300 mm from the centre line of the inside handrail.

ON Full: If a service building is required by Sentence (1) it shall contain lavatories as required by Sentence 3.7.4.2.(5) and at least, one laundry tray or similar facility, and one bathtub or shower for each sex.
ON Variations: If a service building is required by Sentence (1) it shall contain lavatories as required by Sentence 3.7.4.2.(5) and at least, one laundry tray or similar facility, and one bathtub or shower for each sex.

ON Full: The independent emergency lighting system required in Sentence (4) shall be capable of illuminating the pool deck, washroom, shower, locker areas, pool water surface and all means of egress to a level of at least 10 lx.
ON Variations: The independent emergency lighting system required in Sentence (4) shall be capable of illuminating the pool deck, washroom, shower, locker areas, pool water surface and all means of egress to a level of at least 10 lx.

ON Full: The lines of distribution pipes or leaching chambers shall be evenly spaced over the surface of the filter medium to which the sanitary sewage is applied, with a maximum spacing between the centrelines of the distribution pipes or leaching chambers in accordance with Table 8.7.5.3. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: The lines of distribution pipes or leaching chambers shall be evenly spaced over the surface of the filter medium to which the sanitary sewage is applied, with a maximum spacing between the centrelines of the distribution pipes or leaching chambers in accordance with Table 8.7.5.3. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: The treatment unit used in conjunction with a leaching bed constructed as a shallow buried trench shall provide an effluent quality that does not exceed the maximum concentrations set out opposite a Level IV treatment unit in Columns 2 and 3 of Table 8.6.2.2.
ON Variations: The treatment unit used in conjunction with a leaching bed constructed as a shallow buried trench shall provide an effluent quality that does not exceed the maximum concentrations set out opposite a Level IV treatment unit in Columns 2 and 3 of Table 8.6.2.2.

ON Full: Once activated, a fire alarm system shall not be manually silenced unless it has been confirmed by supervisory staff, in accordance with approved procedures as detailed in the fire safety plan, that no fire emergency exists.
ON Variations: Once activated, a fire alarm system shall not be manually silenced unless it has been confirmed by supervisory staff, in accordance with approved procedures as detailed in the fire safety plan, that no fire emergency exists.

ON Full: A door between an attached or built-in garage and the house or the individual dwelling unit it serves shall be tight-fitting and weatherstripped to provide an effective barrier against the passage of gases and exhaust fumes and shall be fitted with a self-closing device.
ON Variations: A door between an attached or built-in garage and the house or the individual dwelling unit it serves shall be tight-fitting and weatherstripped to provide an effective barrier against the passage of gases and exhaust fumes and shall be fitted with a self-closing device.

ON Full: The floor area on either side of a horizontal exit conforming to Article 3.4.6.10. is permitted to be considered as a fire compartment in applying the requirements of this Article.
ON Variations: The floor area on either side of a horizontal exit conforming to Article 3.4.6.10. is permitted to be considered as a fire compartment in applying the requirements of this Article.

ON Full: In the case of a care occupancy, care and treatment occupancy and retirement home, any training of supervisory staff carried out under a fire safety plan shall be recorded.
ON Variations: In the case of a care occupancy, care and treatment occupancy and retirement home, any training of supervisory staff carried out under a fire safety plan shall be recorded.

ON Full: The washrooms required in Sentence 3.13.6.2.(4) shall be designed in conformance with the requirements in Articles 3.8.3.8. to 3.8.3.11.
ON Variations: The washrooms required in Sentence 3.13.6.2.(4) shall be designed in conformance with the requirements in Articles 3.8.3.8. to 3.8.3.11.

ON Full: Walls supporting other than drained earth shall be designed, (a) for the pressure described in Clause (1)(a) plus the fluid pressure of the surcharge, or (b) in accordance with 4.2. so as to be able to resist the loads and effects described in Article 4.1.2.1.
ON Variations: Walls supporting other than drained earth shall be designed, (a) for the pressure described in Clause (1)(a) plus the fluid pressure of the surcharge, or (b) in accordance with 4.2. so as to be able to resist the loads and effects described in Article 4.1.2.1.

ON Full: The automatic sprinkler system shall be designed to notify the fire department that a waterflow switch has been activated.
ON Variations: The automatic sprinkler system shall be designed to notify the fire department that a waterflow switch has been activated.

ON Full: Exhaust systems shall discharge directly to the outdoors.
ON Variations: Exhaust systems shall discharge directly to the outdoors.

ON Full: Except where the area is sprinklered, fire detectors shall be installed in every service room, ancillary space, leased space, booth and kiosk.
ON Variations: Except where the area is sprinklered, fire detectors shall be installed in every service room, ancillary space, leased space, booth and kiosk.

ON Full: In a building required to be of noncombustible construction, wood nailing elements described in Article 3.1.5.6. need not be tested in conformance with Sentence (1).
ON Variations: In a building required to be of noncombustible construction, wood nailing elements described in Article 3.1.5.6. need not be tested in conformance with Sentence (1).

ON Full: Every pressurized distribution pipe within a leaching chamber shall,(a) extend over the entire length of the leaching chamber, (b) be not less than 1½ in. trade size, (c) have orifices of at least 6 mm in diameter, spaced equally along the length of the pipe to provide even distribution of the effluent, (d) be supported, (e) be self-draining so as to prevent freezing of its contents, and (f) have cleanouts installed at the downstream end of each line of leaching chamber to allow for servicing of the system.
ON Variations: Every pressurized distribution pipe within a leaching chamber shall,(a) extend over the entire length of the leaching chamber, (b) be not less than 1½ in. trade size, (c) have orifices of at least 6 mm in diameter, spaced equally along the length of the pipe to provide even distribution of the effluent, (d) be supported, (e) be self-draining so as to prevent freezing of its contents, and (f) have cleanouts installed at the downstream end of each line of leaching chamber to allow for servicing of the system.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (3.1), where the exposing building face has a limiting distance of not more than 0.45 m, projecting roof soffits shall not be constructed above the exposing building face. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (3.1), where the exposing building face has a limiting distance of not more than 0.45 m, projecting roof soffits shall not be constructed above the exposing building face. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Buildings or parts of them used for the storage of baled combustible fibres shall be classified as medium hazard industrial occupancies.
ON Variations: Buildings or parts of them used for the storage of baled combustible fibres shall be classified as medium hazard industrial occupancies.

ON Full: Except as required by Sentence (11), the values of elastic storey shears, storey forces, member forces, and deflections obtained from the Linear Dynamic Analysis, including the effect of accidental torsion determined in Sentence (4), shall be multiplied by Vd/Ve to determine their design values, where Vd is the base shear.
ON Variations: Except as required by Sentence (11), the values of elastic storey shears, storey forces, member forces, and deflections obtained from the Linear Dynamic Analysis, including the effect of accidental torsion determined in SentenceÃ (4), shall be multiplied by Vd/Ve to determine their design values, where Vd is the base shear.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (1), the hydraulic load from a fixture that is not listed in Table 7.4.9.3. is the number of fixture units set forth in Table 7.4.10.2. for the trap of the size that serves the fixture.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (1), the hydraulic load from a fixture that is not listed in Table 7.4.9.3. is the number of fixture units set forth in Table 7.4.10.2. for the trap of the size that serves the fixture.

ON Full: A process plant intended as a location where Class I and Class II liquids are handled shall not contain a basement or a covered pit.
ON Variations: A process plant intended as a location where Class I and Class II liquids are handled shall not contain a basement or a covered pit.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (2), a horizontal service space or other concealed space located above a required vertical fire separation shall be divided at the fire separation by an equivalent fire separation within the space.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (2), a horizontal service space or other concealed space located above a required vertical fire separation shall be divided at the fire separation by an equivalent fire separation within the space.

ON Full: Ducts in or beneath concrete slabs-on-ground shall be watertight, corrosion-, decay- and mildew-resistant.
ON Variations: Ducts in or beneath concrete slabs-on-ground shall be watertight, corrosion-, decay- and mildew-resistant.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (2), materials, components, assemblies, joints in materials, junctions between components and junctions between assemblies exposed to precipitation shall be,(a) sealed to prevent ingress of precipitation, or (b) drained to direct precipitation to the exterior.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (2), materials, components, assemblies, joints in materials, junctions between components and junctions between assemblies exposed to precipitation shall be,(a) sealed to prevent ingress of precipitation, or (b) drained to direct precipitation to the exterior.

ON Full: Vents to vestibules that are permitted to be manually openable shall be maintained in operable condition.
ON Variations: Vents to vestibules that are permitted to be manually openable shall be maintained in operable condition.

ON Full: Except for dwelling units, except for devices on doors serving a contained use area or an impeded egress zone designed to be released in conformance with Article 3.3.1.12., and except as permitted by Sentence (4), locking, latching and other fastening devices on every exit door shall permit the door to be readily opened from the inside with not more than one releasing operation and without requiring keys, special devices or specialized knowledge of the door opening mechanism. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Except for dwelling units, except for devices on doors serving a contained use area or an impeded egress zone designed to be released in conformance with Article 3.3.1.12., and except as permitted by Sentence (4), locking, latching and other fastening devices on every exit door shall permit the door to be readily opened from the inside with not more than one releasing operation and without requiring keys, special devices or specialized knowledge of the door opening mechanism. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Magnetic or pneumatic separators shall be installed to prevent the entrance of foreign materials that may cause sparks in equipment such as shellers, crackers, crushers, grinding machines, pulverizers or similar machines that produce combustible dusts.
ON Variations: Magnetic or pneumatic separators shall be installed to prevent the entrance of foreign materials that may cause sparks in equipment such as shellers, crackers, crushers, grinding machines, pulverizers or similar machines that produce combustible dusts.

ON Full: The emergency power supply required by Sentence (1) shall be designed so that, in the event of a failure of the normal power source, there is an immediate automatic transfer to emergency power with no loss of information.
ON Variations: The emergency power supply required by Sentence (1) shall be designed so that, in the event of a failure of the normal power source, there is an immediate automatic transfer to emergency power with no loss of information.

ON Full: OSB conforming to O-1 grade, waferboard conforming to R-1 grade and particleboard shall be,(a) not less than 6.35 mm thick on supports not more than 406 mm o.c., (b) not less than 9.5 mm thick on supports not more than 610 mm o.c., and (c) not less than 6.35 mm thick on supports not more than 610 mm o.c. in walls where blocking is provided at midwall height.
ON Variations: OSB conforming to O-1 grade, waferboard conforming to R-1 grade and particleboard shall be,(a) not less than 6.35 mm thick on supports not more than 406 mm o.c., (b) not less than 9.5 mm thick on supports not more than 610 mm o.c., and (c) not less than 6.35 mm thick on supports not more than 610 mm o.c. in walls where blocking is provided at midwall height.

ON Full: Glued-laminated columns shall conform to Section 4.3.
ON Variations: Glued-laminated columns shall conform to Section 4.3.

ON Full: Doorways serving a house or an individual dwelling unit need not comply with Sentences (1) and (2).
ON Variations: Doorways serving a house or an individual dwelling unit need not comply with Sentences (1) and (2).

ON Full: Gauges or alarms that indicate when the air velocity is less than the air velocity required by Article 5.12.3.2. or 5.12.3.3. shall be installed for spray booths.
ON Variations: Gauges or alarms that indicate when the air velocity is less than the air velocity required by Article 5.12.3.2. or 5.12.3.3. shall be installed for spray booths.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentences (4) and (5), where the insulation on a foundation wall extends to more than 900 mm below the adjacent exterior ground level,(a) a drainage layer shall be installed adjacent to the exterior surface of a foundation wall consisting of, (i) not less than 19 mm mineral fibre insulation with a density of not less than 57 kg/m3, or (ii) not less than 100 mm of free draining granular material, or (b) a system shall be installed that can be shown to provide equivalent performance to that provided by the materials described in Clause (a). (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentences (4) and (5), where the insulation on a foundation wall extends to more than 900 mm below the adjacent exterior ground level,(a) a drainage layer shall be installed adjacent to the exterior surface of a foundation wall consisting of, (i) not less than 19 mm mineral fibre insulation with a density of not less than 57 kg/m3, or (ii) not less than 100 mm of free draining granular material, or (b) a system shall be installed that can be shown to provide equivalent performance to that provided by the materials described in Clause (a). (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: The foundation depths required in Sentence (1) are permitted to be decreased where experience with local soil conditions shows that lesser depths are satisfactory, or where the foundation is designed for lesser depths.
ON Variations: The foundation depths required in Sentence (1) are permitted to be decreased where experience with local soil conditions shows that lesser depths are satisfactory, or where the foundation is designed for lesser depths.

ON Full: Emergency vent outlets for storage tanks shall discharge outside buildings not less than 1.5 m from any building opening and from any combustible component of a building exterior wall.
ON Variations: Emergency vent outlets for storage tanks shall discharge outside buildings not less than 1.5 m from any building opening and from any combustible component of a building exterior wall.

ON Full: Access to exit within floor areas shall conform to Subsections 3.3.2. to 3.3.6., in addition to the requirements of this Subsection.
ON Variations: Access to exit within floor areas shall conform to Subsections 3.3.2. to 3.3.6., in addition to the requirements of this Subsection.

ON Full: Floor surfaces around a water closet shall be protected from deterioration by impervious and durable material for a distance not less than 900 mm from the projected outline of the water closet on to the floor.
ON Variations: Floor surfaces around a water closet shall be protected from deterioration by impervious and durable material for a distance not less than 900 mm from the projected outline of the water closet on to the floor.

ON Full: The landlord shall test carbon monoxide alarms annually and after every change in tenancy.
ON Variations: The landlord shall test carbon monoxide alarms annually and after every change in tenancy.

ON Full: Where material alterations to a public pool or the equipment installed in a public pool affect the bottom slope, the water volume or the capacity of the recirculation system, the adversely affected portions shall comply with the requirements of this Division.
ON Variations: Where material alterations to a public pool or the equipment installed in a public pool affect the bottom slope, the water volume or the capacity of the recirculation system, the adversely affected portions shall comply with the requirements of this Division.

ON Full: Back-siphonage preventers (anti-siphon fill for tank type water closets shall be certified to CSA B125.3, "Plumbing Fittings".
ON Variations: Back-siphonage preventers (anti-siphon fill for tank type water closets shall be certified to CSA B125.3, "Plumbing Fittings".

ON Full: A roof covering is not required to have a Class A, B or C classification for, a tent, an air-supported structure, a building of Group A, Division 2 occupancy not more than 2 storeys in building height and not more than 1 000 m2 in building area, provided the roof covering is underlaid with noncombustible material, or a steel building system described in Article 4.3.4.3., provided the roof covering consists of metal sheets, metal shingles or other noncombustible roofing materials.
ON Variations: A roof covering is not required to have a Class A, B or C classification for, a tent, an air-supported structure, a building of Group A, Division 2 occupancy not more than 2 storeys in building height and not more than 1 000 m2 in building area, provided the roof covering is underlaid with noncombustible material, or a steel building system described in Article 4.3.4.3., provided the roof covering consists of metal sheets, metal shingles or other noncombustible roofing materials.

ON Full: For the purpose of using Table 9.10.14.4. to determine the maximum aggregate area of unprotected openings permitted in an irregularly-shaped or skewed exterior wall, the location of the exposing building face shall be taken as a vertical plane located so that there are no unprotected openings between the vertical plane and the line to which limiting distance is measured.
ON Variations: For the purpose of using Table 9.10.14.4. to determine the maximum aggregate area of unprotected openings permitted in an irregularly-shaped or skewed exterior wall, the location of the exposing building face shall be taken as a vertical plane located so that there are no unprotected openings between the vertical plane and the line to which limiting distance is measured.

ON Full: Where the Chief Fire Official determines that it is impractical to remove an underground storage tank described in Sentence 4.3.17.4.(1), such tank shall be filled with an inert material.
ON Variations: Where the Chief Fire Official determines that it is impractical to remove an underground storage tank described in Sentence 4.3.17.4.(1), such tank shall be filled with an inert material.

ON Full: The performance level of an existing building or part of an existing building is reduced where, (a) the use of the building or part of the building is changed to a retirement home, and (b) any of the following applies: (i) the retirement home is not sprinklered, (ii) Clause 3.2.6.8.(1)(b) or (c), as applicable, requires that a voice communication system conforming to Article 3.2.4.23. be provided in the building and such a system is not provided in the building, or (iii) the retirement home contains one or more doors to suites or sleeping rooms not within suites, other than doors leading directly to the exterior, that are not equipped with self-closing devices.
ON Variations: The performance level of an existing building or part of an existing building is reduced where, (a) the use of the building or part of the building is changed to a retirement home, and (b) any of the following applies: (i) the retirement home is not sprinklered, (ii) Clause 3.2.6.8.(1)(b) or (c), as applicable, requires that a voice communication system conforming to Article 3.2.4.23. be provided in the building and such a system is not provided in the building, or (iii) the retirement home contains one or more doors to suites or sleeping rooms not within suites, other than doors leading directly to the exterior, that are not equipped with self-closing devices.

ON Full: The size of every vent pipe for a sanitary sewage sump or tank, or dilution tank shall be not less than 2 in., but need not be greater than 4 in.
ON Variations: The size of every vent pipe for a sanitary sewage sump or tank, or dilution tank shall be not less than 2 in., but need not be greater than 4 in.

ON Full: Sentences (1) to (3) do not apply to a building containing electrical equipment and electrical installations used exclusively in the generation, transformation or transmission of electrical power or energy intended for sale or distribution to the public.
ON Variations: Sentences (1) to (3) do not apply to a building containing electrical equipment and electrical installations used exclusively in the generation, transformation or transmission of electrical power or energy intended for sale or distribution to the public.

ON Full: Except as provided in Articles 4.3.15.4. and 4.3.15.5., when a leakage test is required by Sentence (1) on an underground storage tank, it shall be done by qualified personnel using equipment conforming to ULC/ORD-C58.12, Leak Detection Devices or (Volumetric for Underground Flammable Liquid Storage Tanks, or ULC/ORD-C58.14, Nonvolumetric Leak Detection Devices for Underground Flammable Liquid Storage Tanks.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Articles 4.3.15.4. and 4.3.15.5., when a leakage test is required by Sentence (1) on an underground storage tank, it shall be done by qualified personnel using equipment conforming to ULC/ORD-C58.12, Leak Detection Devices or (Volumetric for Underground Flammable Liquid Storage Tanks, or ULC/ORD-C58.14, Nonvolumetric Leak Detection Devices for Underground Flammable Liquid Storage Tanks.

ON Full: Stainless steel tube shall conform to,(a) ASME B16.9, "Factory-Made Wrought Buttwelding Fittings", and (b) ASTM A269, "Seamless and Welded Austenitic Stainless Steel Tubing for General Service".
ON Variations: Stainless steel tube shall conform to,(a) ASME B16.9, "Factory-Made Wrought Buttwelding Fittings", and (b) ASTM A269, "Seamless and Welded Austenitic Stainless Steel Tubing for General Service".

ON Full: Piping, tubing, ducts, chimneys, wiring, conduit, electrical outlet boxes and other similar service equipment that penetrate a required fire separation shall be tightly fitted or fire stopped to maintain the integrity of the separation. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Piping, tubing, ducts, chimneys, wiring, conduit, electrical outlet boxes and other similar service equipment that penetrate a required fire separation shall be tightly fitted or fire stopped to maintain the integrity of the separation. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Exit doors need not conform to Sentence (1) or (2), where, (a) the doors serve accessory buildings where life safety is not adversely affected, or (b) the doors serve storage garages or other accessory buildings serving a house or an individual dwelling unit.
ON Variations: Exit doors need not conform to Sentence (1) or (2), where, (a) the doors serve accessory buildings where life safety is not adversely affected, or (b) the doors serve storage garages or other accessory buildings serving a house or an individual dwelling unit.

ON Full: If electrical supervision is provided for a sprinkler system, it shall be tested by operating the supervisory signal devices in conformance with Sentences (2) and (3).
ON Variations: If electrical supervision is provided for a sprinkler system, it shall be tested by operating the supervisory signal devices in conformance with Sentences (2) and (3).

ON Full: Floor joists and building frames supported on top of flat insulating concrete form walls shall be anchored in conformance with Article 9.23.6.1.
ON Variations: Floor joists and building frames supported on top of flat insulating concrete form walls shall be anchored in conformance with Article 9.23.6.1.

ON Full: In a hot water distribution system of a developed length of more than 30 m or supplying more than 4 storeys, the water temperature shall be maintained by, (a) recirculation, or (b) a self-regulating heat tracing system.
ON Variations: In a hot water distribution system of a developed length of more than 30 m or supplying more than 4 storeys, the water temperature shall be maintained by, (a) recirculation, or (b) a self-regulating heat tracing system.

ON Full: Access panels required in Sentence (1) shall be readily openable from both inside and outside or be glazed with plain glass.
ON Variations: Access panels required in Sentence (1) shall be readily openable from both inside and outside or be glazed with plain glass.

ON Full: No exit door shall open directly onto a step except that, if there is danger of blockage from ice or snow, an exit door is permitted to open onto not more than one step which shall be not more than 150 mm high.
ON Variations: No exit door shall open directly onto a step except that, if there is danger of blockage from ice or snow, an exit door is permitted to open onto not more than one step which shall be not more than 150 mm high.

ON Full: Where the ability of a truss design to satisfy the requirements of Sentence (1) is demonstrated by testing, it shall consist of a full scale load test carried out in conformance with CSA S307-M, "Load Test Procedure for Wood Trusses for Houses and Small Buildings".
ON Variations: Where the ability of a truss design to satisfy the requirements of Sentence (1) is demonstrated by testing, it shall consist of a full scale load test carried out in conformance with CSA S307-M, "Load Test Procedure for Wood Trusses for Houses and Small Buildings".

ON Full: Quench tanks shall be provided with a noncombustible hood and vent exhausting to the outside to prevent the accumulation and condensation of vapours from the process.
ON Variations: Quench tanks shall be provided with a noncombustible hood and vent exhausting to the outside to prevent the accumulation and condensation of vapours from the process.

ON Full: An exterior lighting outlet with fixture controlled by a wall switch located within the building shall be provided at every entrance to buildings of residential occupancy.
ON Variations: An exterior lighting outlet with fixture controlled by a wall switch located within the building shall be provided at every entrance to buildings of residential occupancy.

ON Full: The performance level of a building after the change of major occupancy shall not be less than the performance level prior to the change of major occupancy.
ON Variations: The performance level of a building after the change of major occupancy shall not be less than the performance level prior to the change of major occupancy.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (2), eave protection shall be provided on shingle, shake or tile roofs, extending from the edge of the roof a minimum of 900 mm up the roof slope to a line not less than 300 mm inside the inner face of the exterior wall.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (2), eave protection shall be provided on shingle, shake or tile roofs, extending from the edge of the roof a minimum of 900 mm up the roof slope to a line not less than 300 mm inside the inner face of the exterior wall.

ON Full: Where wood is required by this Article to be treated to resist termites or decay, such treatment shall be in accordance with Table 2, "Use Categories for Specific Products, Uses, and Exposures", of CAN/CSA-O80.1, "Specification of Treated Wood", as follows:(a) Use Category 1, where the wood member is used in, (i) interior construction, (ii) above-ground applications, and (iii) applications where the wood member remains dry, (b) Use Category 2, where the wood member is used in, (i) interior construction, (ii) above-ground applications, and (iii) applications where the wood member may be subjected to occasional sources of moisture, (c) Use Category 3.2, where the wood member is used in, (i) exterior construction, (ii) above-ground applications, and (iii) applications where the wood member is uncoated or is used in a configuration conducive to moisture accumulation, (d) Use Category 4.1, where, (i) the wood member is used in contact with the ground, (ii) the wood member is used in contact with fresh water, or (iii) the vertical clearance between the wood element and the finished ground level is less than 150 mm and the wood elements are not separated from permeable supporting materials by a moisture barrier, or (e) Use Category 4.2, where the wood member is used in critical structural components, including permanent wood foundations.
ON Variations: Where wood is required by this Article to be treated to resist termites or decay, such treatment shall be in accordance with Table 2, "Use Categories for Specific Products, Uses, and Exposures", of CAN/CSA-O80.1, "Specification of Treated Wood", as follows:(a) Use Category 1, where the wood member is used in, (i) interior construction, (ii) above-ground applications, and (iii) applications where the wood member remains dry, (b) Use Category 2, where the wood member is used in, (i) interior construction, (ii) above-ground applications, and (iii) applications where the wood member may be subjected to occasional sources of moisture, (c) Use Category 3.2, where the wood member is used in, (i) exterior construction, (ii) above-ground applications, and (iii) applications where the wood member is uncoated or is used in a configuration conducive to moisture accumulation, (d) Use Category 4.1, where, (i) the wood member is used in contact with the ground, (ii) the wood member is used in contact with fresh water, or (iii) the vertical clearance between the wood element and the finished ground level is less than 150 mm and the wood elements are not separated from permeable supporting materials by a moisture barrier, or (e) Use Category 4.2, where the wood member is used in critical structural components, including permanent wood foundations.

ON Full: Staples for panel-type underlay shall, (a) have not less than a 1.2 mm shank diameter or thickness with a 4.7 mm crown, and (b) be not less than, (i) 22 mm long for 6 mm underlay, and (ii) 28 mm long for 7.9 mm and 9.5 mm underlay.
ON Variations: Staples for panel-type underlay shall, (a) have not less than a 1.2 mm shank diameter or thickness with a 4.7 mm crown, and (b) be not less than, (i) 22 mm long for 6 mm underlay, and (ii) 28 mm long for 7.9 mm and 9.5 mm underlay.

ON Full: Except as otherwise permitted in Sentence (5), chimney saddles shall be installed where the upper side of a chimney on a sloping roof is more than 750 mm wide.
ON Variations: Except as otherwise permitted in Sentence (5), chimney saddles shall be installed where the upper side of a chimney on a sloping roof is more than 750 mm wide.

ON Full: The fire drill procedures required in Sentence (1) shall be prepared in consultation with the Chief Fire Official.
ON Variations: The fire drill procedures required in Sentence (1) shall be prepared in consultation with the Chief Fire Official.
