ON Full: Except as provided in Section 9.12., foundations for attached unheated garages or carports shall be below frost level.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Section 9.12., foundations for attached unheated garages or carports shall be below frost level.

ON Full: Metal parts of spray booths, exhaust ducts and piping systems conveying flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be electrically grounded.
ON Variations: Metal parts of spray booths, exhaust ducts and piping systems conveying flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be electrically grounded.

ON Full: Except where exterior walls are protected from precipitation or where it can be shown that ingress will not adversely affect occupant health or safety, exterior walls shall be designed and constructed to,(a) minimize the ingress of precipitation into the assembly, and (b) prevent ingress into interior space. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Except where exterior walls are protected from precipitation or where it can be shown that ingress will not adversely affect occupant health or safety, exterior walls shall be designed and constructed to,(a) minimize the ingress of precipitation into the assembly, and (b) prevent ingress into interior space. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: The area of an exposing building face shall be,(a) taken as the exterior wall area facing in one direction on any side of a house, and (b) calculated as, (i) the total area measured from the finished ground level to the uppermost ceiling, (ii) the area for each fire compartment where a house is divided into fire compartments by fire separations with fire-resistance ratings not less than 45 min, or (iii) where Table 9.10.15.4. is used to determine maximum area of glazed openings, the area of any number of individual vertical portions of the wall measured from the finished ground level to the uppermost ceiling.
ON Variations: The area of an exposing building face shall be,(a) taken as the exterior wall area facing in one direction on any side of a house, and (b) calculated as, (i) the total area measured from the finished ground level to the uppermost ceiling, (ii) the area for each fire compartment where a house is divided into fire compartments by fire separations with fire-resistance ratings not less than 45 min, or (iii) where Table 9.10.15.4. is used to determine maximum area of glazed openings, the area of any number of individual vertical portions of the wall measured from the finished ground level to the uppermost ceiling.

ON Full: Flashing fabricated on site for vent pipes shall be fabricated from,(a) copper sheet at least 0.33 mm thick, (b) aluminum sheet at least 0.48 mm thick, (c) alloyed zinc sheet at least 0.35 mm thick, (d) lead sheet at least 1.73 mm thick, (e) galvanized steel sheet at least 0.33 mm thick, or (f) polychloroprene (neoprene) at least 2.89 mm thick.
ON Variations: Flashing fabricated on site for vent pipes shall be fabricated from,(a) copper sheet at least 0.33 mm thick, (b) aluminum sheet at least 0.48 mm thick, (c) alloyed zinc sheet at least 0.35 mm thick, (d) lead sheet at least 1.73 mm thick, (e) galvanized steel sheet at least 0.33 mm thick, or (f) polychloroprene (neoprene) at least 2.89 mm thick.

ON Full: Except as permitted by Sentence (2) and by Articles 3.2.2.20. to 3.2.2.83. for mixed types of construction, all loadbearing walls, columns and arches in the storey immediately below a floor or roof assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the supported floor or roof assembly.
ON Variations: Except as permitted by Sentence (2) and by Articles 3.2.2.20. to 3.2.2.83. for mixed types of construction, all loadbearing walls, columns and arches in the storey immediately below a floor or roof assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the supported floor or roof assembly.

ON Full: Except as otherwise required in Subsections 3.11.4., 3.11.5., 3.11.6. and 3.11.7. or otherwise exempted in Sentences (2) and (3), Class A pools and Class B pools shall be designed and constructed to comply with Sentences (2) to (26) and Articles 3.11.3.2. and 3.11.3.3.
ON Variations: Except as otherwise required in Subsections 3.11.4., 3.11.5., 3.11.6. and 3.11.7. or otherwise exempted in Sentences (2) and (3), Class A pools and Class B pools shall be designed and constructed to comply with Sentences (2) to (26) and Articles 3.11.3.2. and 3.11.3.3.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentences (3), (4) and (5), tents shall not be erected closer than 3 m to other tents or structures on the same property.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentences (3), (4) and (5), tents shall not be erected closer than 3 m to other tents or structures on the same property.

ON Full: Fire blocks are deemed to comply with Sentence (1), if they are constructed of not less than,(a) 0.38 mm sheet steel, (b) 12.7 mm gypsum wallboard, (c) 12.5 mm plywood, OSB or waferboard, with joints having continuous supports, (d) 2 layers of 19 mm lumber with joints staggered, or (e) 38 mm lumber.
ON Variations: Fire blocks are deemed to comply with Sentence (1), if they are constructed of not less than,(a) 0.38 mm sheet steel, (b) 12.7 mm gypsum wallboard, (c) 12.5 mm plywood, OSB or waferboard, with joints having continuous supports, (d) 2 layers of 19 mm lumber with joints staggered, or (e) 38 mm lumber.

ON Full: A building classified as Group E is permitted to conform to Sentence (2) provided, it is not more than 3 storeys in building height, and it has a building area not more than the value in Table 3.2.2.59.
ON Variations: A building classified as Group E is permitted to conform to Sentence (2) provided, it is not more than 3 storeys in building height, and it has a building area not more than the value in Table 3.2.2.59.

ON Full: The portion of a deep foundation unit that is not permanently in contact with soil or rock shall be structurally designed as a laterally unsupported compression member.
ON Variations: The portion of a deep foundation unit that is not permanently in contact with soil or rock shall be structurally designed as a laterally unsupported compression member.

ON Full: Escalators forming part of a required means of egress shall not comprise more than one-half of the required egress capacity from any one level.
ON Variations: Escalators forming part of a required means of egress shall not comprise more than one-half of the required egress capacity from any one level.

ON Full: Materials installed to provide required waterproofing shall be,(a) compatible with adjoining materials, and (b) resistant to mechanisms of deterioration that may reasonably be expected, given the nature, function and exposure of the materials.
ON Variations: Materials installed to provide required waterproofing shall be,(a) compatible with adjoining materials, and (b) resistant to mechanisms of deterioration that may reasonably be expected, given the nature, function and exposure of the materials.

ON Full: Where a potable water supply is connected to a boiler, tank, cooling jacket, lawn sprinkler system or other device where a non-potable fluid may be under pressure that is above atmospheric or the water outlet may be submerged in the non-potable fluid, the water supply shall be protected against backflow by a backflow preventer.
ON Variations: Where a potable water supply is connected to a boiler, tank, cooling jacket, lawn sprinkler system or other device where a non-potable fluid may be under pressure that is above atmospheric or the water outlet may be submerged in the non-potable fluid, the water supply shall be protected against backflow by a backflow preventer.

ON Full: There shall be no unused open ends in a drainage system and dead ends shall be so graded that water will not collect in them.
ON Variations: There shall be no unused open ends in a drainage system and dead ends shall be so graded that water will not collect in them.

ON Full: Recreational camps shall have an area in the sleeping quarters of not less than 3.72 m2 per camper or, if double or triple tier bunk units are used, 2.79 m2 per camper.
ON Variations: Recreational camps shall have an area in the sleeping quarters of not less than 3.72 m2 per camper or, if double or triple tier bunk units are used, 2.79 m2 per camper.

ON Full: Grab bars that are installed shall resist a minimum load of 1.3 kN applied vertically or horizontally.
ON Variations: Grab bars that are installed shall resist a minimum load of 1.3 kN applied vertically or horizontally.

ON Full: Where a lead water closet stub is used, the length of the stub below the floor flange shall be at least 75 mm.
ON Variations: Where a lead water closet stub is used, the length of the stub below the floor flange shall be at least 75 mm.

ON Full: A record of the hydrant operation as described in Article 6.6.5.7. shall be kept in conformance with Subsection 1.1.2.
ON Variations: A record of the hydrant operation as described in Article 6.6.5.7. shall be kept in conformance with Subsection 1.1.2.

ON Full: Unless the flame-spread rating is referred to in this Part as a "surface flame-spread rating", it shall apply to any surface of the element being considered that would be exposed by cutting through it as well as to the exposed surface of the element.
ON Variations: Unless the flame-spread rating is referred to in this Part as a "surface flame-spread rating", it shall apply to any surface of the element being considered that would be exposed by cutting through it as well as to the exposed surface of the element.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentences (2) to (4), windows, doors and skylights and their components separating conditioned space from unconditioned space or the exterior shall be designed, constructed and installed so that, when in the closed position, they,(a) resist the ingress of precipitation into interior space, (b) resist wind loads, (c) control air leakage, (d) resist the ingress of insects and vermin, (e) where required, resist forced entry, and (f) are easily operable, unless they are fixed units.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentences (2) to (4), windows, doors and skylights and their components separating conditioned space from unconditioned space or the exterior shall be designed, constructed and installed so that, when in the closed position, they,(a) resist the ingress of precipitation into interior space, (b) resist wind loads, (c) control air leakage, (d) resist the ingress of insects and vermin, (e) where required, resist forced entry, and (f) are easily operable, unless they are fixed units.

ON Full: Subject to the application limitations defined elsewhere in this Part, structural members and their connections shall,(a) conform to requirements provided elsewhere in this Part, (b) be designed according to good engineering practice such as provided in the CWC, "Engineering Guide for Wood Frame Construction", or (c) be designed according to Part 4 using the loads and deflection and vibration limits specified in, (i) this Part, or (ii) Part 4.
ON Variations: Subject to the application limitations defined elsewhere in this Part, structural members and their connections shall,(a) conform to requirements provided elsewhere in this Part, (b) be designed according to good engineering practice such as provided in the CWC, "Engineering Guide for Wood Frame Construction", or (c) be designed according to Part 4 using the loads and deflection and vibration limits specified in, (i) this Part, or (ii) Part 4.

ON Full: Overriding manual controls for the smoke control system shall be provided for fire department use at an acceptable location in the vicinity of the fire alarm annunciator.
ON Variations: Overriding manual controls for the smoke control system shall be provided for fire department use at an acceptable location in the vicinity of the fire alarm annunciator.

ON Full: Except as required by Article 3.3.4.8., stairs, ramps, landings, handrails and interior guards within a dwelling unit shall conform to the applicable requirements in Section 9.8.
ON Variations: Except as required by Article 3.3.4.8., stairs, ramps, landings, handrails and interior guards within a dwelling unit shall conform to the applicable requirements in Section 9.8.

ON Full: Locked doors intended to prevent entry into a floor area from an exit stair shall, be identified by a permanently mounted sign on the stair side to indicate the location of the nearest unlocked door in each direction of travel, and be openable with a master key that fits all locking devices and is kept in a designated location accessible to firefighters or be provided with a wired glass panel not less than 0.0645 m2 in area and located not more than 300 mm from the door opening hardware.
ON Variations: Locked doors intended to prevent entry into a floor area from an exit stair shall, be identified by a permanently mounted sign on the stair side to indicate the location of the nearest unlocked door in each direction of travel, and be openable with a master key that fits all locking devices and is kept in a designated location accessible to firefighters or be provided with a wired glass panel not less than 0.0645 m2 in area and located not more than 300 mm from the door opening hardware.

ON Full: This Article applies to interconnected smoke alarm systems in all residential occupancies and care occupancies, except in individual dwelling units and in buildings regulated by Section 9.8.
ON Variations: This Article applies to interconnected smoke alarm systems in all residential occupancies and care occupancies, except in individual dwelling units and in buildings regulated by Section 9.8.

ON Full: A laboratory shall be provided with continuous mechanical ventilation designed to ensure that flammable vapours,(a) do not accumulate in the laboratory, (b) are prevented from migrating to other parts of the building, (c) do not accumulate in the ventilation system, (d) are exhausted to the outdoors, and (e) are not returned to the building.
ON Variations: A laboratory shall be provided with continuous mechanical ventilation designed to ensure that flammable vapours,(a) do not accumulate in the laboratory, (b) are prevented from migrating to other parts of the building, (c) do not accumulate in the ventilation system, (d) are exhausted to the outdoors, and (e) are not returned to the building.

ON Full: Steel angle lintels supporting masonry veneer above openings shall conform to Table 9.20.5.2.B.
ON Variations: Steel angle lintels supporting masonry veneer above openings shall conform to Table 9.20.5.2.B.

ON Full: The fire separation required by Sentence 3.3.5.5.(1) between a care, care and treatment or detention occupancy and a repair garage shall have no openings.
ON Variations: The fire separation required by Sentence 3.3.5.5.(1) between a care, care and treatment or detention occupancy and a repair garage shall have no openings.

ON Full: A building classified as Group C other than a retirement home is permitted to conform to Sentence (2) provided, it is not more than, 3 storeys in building height, or 4 storeys in building height provided there is not more than one dwelling unit above another dwelling unit, and vertical fire separations of adjacent dwelling units conform to Sentence (4), and it has a building area not more than the value in Table 3.2.2.44.
ON Variations: A building classified as Group C other than a retirement home is permitted to conform to Sentence (2) provided, it is not more than, 3 storeys in building height, or 4 storeys in building height provided there is not more than one dwelling unit above another dwelling unit, and vertical fire separations of adjacent dwelling units conform to Sentence (4), and it has a building area not more than the value in Table 3.2.2.44.

ON Full: Bitumen roofing felts shall be not less than No.15 felt.
ON Variations: Bitumen roofing felts shall be not less than No.15 felt.

ON Full: The top plates need not be provided in a section of loadbearing wall containing a lintel provided the lintel is tied to the adjacent wall section with,(a) not less than 75 mm by 150 mm by 0.91 mm thick galvanized steel, or (b) 19 mm by 89 mm by 300 mm wood splice nailed to each wall section with at least three 63 mm nails.
ON Variations: The top plates need not be provided in a section of loadbearing wall containing a lintel provided the lintel is tied to the adjacent wall section with,(a) not less than 75 mm by 150 mm by 0.91 mm thick galvanized steel, or (b) 19 mm by 89 mm by 300 mm wood splice nailed to each wall section with at least three 63 mm nails.

ON Full: Where a seating area is not required to be separated by Sentences 3.3.2.2.(1) and (2) or 3.3.2.2.(8), the travel distance shall be not more than 45 m measured from the most remote point of the aisle to an exit.
ON Variations: Where a seating area is not required to be separated by Sentences 3.3.2.2.(1) and (2) or 3.3.2.2.(8), the travel distance shall be not more than 45 m measured from the most remote point of the aisle to an exit.

ON Full: The design procedures described in 4.2. are permitted to be used in lieu of the design procedures in this Subsection.
ON Variations: The design procedures described in 4.2. are permitted to be used in lieu of the design procedures in this Subsection.

ON Full: Mechanical ventilation systems provided in accordance with Clause (1)(a) shall be controlled automatically by carbon monoxide monitoring devices and systems provided in accordance with Clause (1)(b) shall be controlled automatically by nitrogen dioxide or other acceptable monitoring devices, located so as to provide full protection throughout the storage garage. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Mechanical ventilation systems provided in accordance with Clause (1)(a) shall be controlled automatically by carbon monoxide monitoring devices and systems provided in accordance with Clause (1)(b) shall be controlled automatically by nitrogen dioxide or other acceptable monitoring devices, located so as to provide full protection throughout the storage garage. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Where an existing building is extended,(a) this Part applies to the existing portion of the building, and (b) the extended portion of the building shall comply with all other Parts.
ON Variations: Where an existing building is extended,(a) this Part applies to the existing portion of the building, and (b) the extended portion of the building shall comply with all other Parts.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentences (2) and (3), piping in any building shall be connected to the public services separately from piping of any other building. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentences (2) and (3), piping in any building shall be connected to the public services separately from piping of any other building. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (3), all metal-framed glazed assemblies separating interior conditioned space from interior unconditioned space or exterior space shall incorporate a thermal break to minimize condensation.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (3), all metal-framed glazed assemblies separating interior conditioned space from interior unconditioned space or exterior space shall incorporate a thermal break to minimize condensation.

ON Full: Where bridging and strapping are specified in Table A-1, (a) bridging shall, (i) comply with Sentence (2), or (ii) consist of 38 mm solid blocking located not more than 2.1 m from each support or other rows of bridging and securely fastened between the joists, and (b) except as provided in Sentence (5), strapping shall comply with Sentence (1) and be installed under the bridging.
ON Variations: Where bridging and strapping are specified in Table A-1, (a) bridging shall, (i) comply with Sentence (2), or (ii) consist of 38 mm solid blocking located not more than 2.1 m from each support or other rows of bridging and securely fastened between the joists, and (b) except as provided in Sentence (5), strapping shall comply with Sentence (1) and be installed under the bridging.

ON Full: Where plywood, OSB or waferboard roof sheathing is used, the dry layer of felt required in Sentence (1) may be omitted when the joints are taped and the sheathing is primed with asphalt.
ON Variations: Where plywood, OSB or waferboard roof sheathing is used, the dry layer of felt required in Sentence (1) may be omitted when the joints are taped and the sheathing is primed with asphalt.

ON Full: Subsection 9.13.2. applies to below-ground walls and floors-on-ground where drainage is provided in accordance with Section 9.14. over and along the entire below-ground portion of the foundation wall.
ON Variations: Subsection 9.13.2. applies to below-ground walls and floors-on-ground where drainage is provided in accordance with Section 9.14. over and along the entire below-ground portion of the foundation wall.

ON Full: Above ground flat insulating concrete form walls shall be protected from precipitation and damage in conformance with Section 9.27.
ON Variations: Above ground flat insulating concrete form walls shall be protected from precipitation and damage in conformance with Section 9.27.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentences (2) and (3) and Article 7.4.5.2., every fixture shall be protected by a separate trap.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentences (2) and (3) and Article 7.4.5.2., every fixture shall be protected by a separate trap.

ON Full: Separate air intake and exhaust outlet openings, when located on the same wall or roof, shall be installed so as to avoid contamination of the ventilation air by the exhaust air.
ON Variations: Separate air intake and exhaust outlet openings, when located on the same wall or roof, shall be installed so as to avoid contamination of the ventilation air by the exhaust air.

ON Full: Except as required in Sentence (2), fireplaces shall have a noncombustible hearth extending not less than 400 mm in front of the fireplace opening measured from the facing, and not less than 200 mm beyond each side of the fireplace opening.
ON Variations: Except as required in Sentence (2), fireplaces shall have a noncombustible hearth extending not less than 400 mm in front of the fireplace opening measured from the facing, and not less than 200 mm beyond each side of the fireplace opening.

ON Full: All supply piping shall have a diameter not less than 100 mm.
ON Variations: All supply piping shall have a diameter not less than 100 mm.

ON Full: Where a room contains a limited quantity of service equipment and the service equipment does not constitute a fire hazard, the requirements in Sentence (1) shall not apply.
ON Variations: Where a room contains a limited quantity of service equipment and the service equipment does not constitute a fire hazard, the requirements in Sentence (1) shall not apply.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (2), where storage tanks for flammable liquids or combustible liquids are installed inside buildings, the supports, foundations and anchorage for such storage tanks shall be in conformance with Subsection 4.3.3.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (2), where storage tanks for flammable liquids or combustible liquids are installed inside buildings, the supports, foundations and anchorage for such storage tanks shall be in conformance with Subsection 4.3.3.

ON Full: In the design of interior walls and partitions, due consideration shall be given to differences in air pressure on opposite sides of the wall or partition that may result from, (a) pressure differences between the windward and leeward sides of a building, (b) stack effects due to a difference in air temperature between the exterior and interior of the building, and (c) air pressurization by the mechanical services of the building.
ON Variations: In the design of interior walls and partitions, due consideration shall be given to differences in air pressure on opposite sides of the wall or partition that may result from, (a) pressure differences between the windward and leeward sides of a building, (b) stack effects due to a difference in air temperature between the exterior and interior of the building, and (c) air pressurization by the mechanical services of the building.

ON Full: Signs in exits and underground walkways shall have a flame-spread rating not more than 25.
ON Variations: Signs in exits and underground walkways shall have a flame-spread rating not more than 25.

ON Full: Where the building has an essentially uniform distribution of paths for air leakage, including operable openings, but no large openings that would permit wind gusts to rapidly enter the building and the building is not in an exceptionally exposed location such as a hilltop, the maximum area of individual panes of glass for windows is permitted to conform to,(a) Tables 9.6.1.3.A. to 9.6.1.3.C., where the building has a height from grade to the uppermost roof of 12 m or less and is located in a built-up area, no less than 120 m away from the boundary between this area and open terrain, or (b) Tables 9.6.1.3.D. to 9.6.1.3.F. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Where the building has an essentially uniform distribution of paths for air leakage, including operable openings, but no large openings that would permit wind gusts to rapidly enter the building and the building is not in an exceptionally exposed location such as a hilltop, the maximum area of individual panes of glass for windows is permitted to conform to,(a) Tables 9.6.1.3.A. to 9.6.1.3.C., where the building has a height from grade to the uppermost roof of 12 m or less and is located in a built-up area, no less than 120 m away from the boundary between this area and open terrain, or (b) Tables 9.6.1.3.D. to 9.6.1.3.F. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Where hold-open devices are used on doors in required fire separations, they shall be installed in accordance with Article 3.1.8.12.
ON Variations: Where hold-open devices are used on doors in required fire separations, they shall be installed in accordance with Article 3.1.8.12.

ON Full: An interior stair extending to street level is permitted to be protected by a combustible roof.
ON Variations: An interior stair extending to street level is permitted to be protected by a combustible roof.

ON Full: Except as permitted by Article 7.4.10.7., the hydraulic load that is drained to a horizontal sanitary drainage pipe shall conform to Table 7.4.10.8., based on the size and slope.
ON Variations: Except as permitted by Article 7.4.10.7., the hydraulic load that is drained to a horizontal sanitary drainage pipe shall conform to Table 7.4.10.8., based on the size and slope.

ON Full: Lateral deflections obtained from a linear elastic analysis using the methods given in Articles 4.1.8.11. and 4.1.8.12. and incorporating the effects of torsion, including accidental torsional moments, shall be multiplied by RdRo/IE and increased as required by Sentences 4.1.8.10.(6) and 4.1.8.16.(1) to give realistic values of anticipated deflections.
ON Variations: Lateral deflections obtained from a linear elastic analysis using the methods given in Articles 4.1.8.11. and 4.1.8.12. and incorporating the effects of torsion, including accidental torsional moments, shall be multiplied by RdRo/IE and increased as required by Sentences 4.1.8.10.(6) and 4.1.8.16.(1) to give realistic values of anticipated deflections.

ON Full: Except as provided in Articles 9.9.4.4. and 9.9.4.6., this Subsection applies to the fire protection of all exits except exits serving an individual dwelling unit.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Articles 9.9.4.4. and 9.9.4.6., this Subsection applies to the fire protection of all exits except exits serving an individual dwelling unit.

ON Full: Columns shall be centrally located on a footing conforming to Section 9.15.
ON Variations: Columns shall be centrally located on a footing conforming to Section 9.15.

ON Full: When there is more than one Type B dispersal bed in a leaching bed, the Type B dispersal beds shall be separated by at least 5 m measured from the edge of the stone layers.
ON Variations: When there is more than one Type B dispersal bed in a leaching bed, the Type B dispersal beds shall be separated by at least 5 m measured from the edge of the stone layers.

ON Full: A standpipe system is not required to be installed in a dwelling unit that, extends not more than 3 storeys above adjacent ground level, is completely cut off from the remainder of the building so that there is no access to the remainder of the building, and has direct access to its interior by means of an exterior doorway located not more than 1 500 mm above or below adjacent finished ground level.
ON Variations: A standpipe system is not required to be installed in a dwelling unit that, extends not more than 3 storeys above adjacent ground level, is completely cut off from the remainder of the building so that there is no access to the remainder of the building, and has direct access to its interior by means of an exterior doorway located not more than 1 500 mm above or below adjacent finished ground level.

ON Full: Article 3.5.1.7. does not apply where the fire protection that is provided by the municipal hydrants and mobile pumping equipment is approved as being adequate in the circumstances.
ON Variations: Article 3.5.1.7. does not apply where the fire protection that is provided by the municipal hydrants and mobile pumping equipment is approved as being adequate in the circumstances.

ON Full: Outdoor storage receptacles, such as dumpsters, used for combustible materials shall be located so that they do not create a fire hazard to buildings.
ON Variations: Outdoor storage receptacles, such as dumpsters, used for combustible materials shall be located so that they do not create a fire hazard to buildings.

ON Full: Piping conveying the non-potable water described in Sentence (2) shall be installed in conformance with Section 7.7.
ON Variations: Piping conveying the non-potable water described in Sentence (2) shall be installed in conformance with Section 7.7.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (4), transparent panels that could be mistaken as a means of egress shall be protected by barriers or railings.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (4), transparent panels that could be mistaken as a means of egress shall be protected by barriers or railings.

ON Full: Individual showers that are provided for use by patients or residents in buildings of Group B, Division 2 or 3 occupancy shall conform to Sentence (2).
ON Variations: Individual showers that are provided for use by patients or residents in buildings of Group B, Division 2 or 3 occupancy shall conform to Sentence (2).

ON Full: At the time of installation, aboveground storage tanks and associated piping shall be tested for leakage in conformance with Subsections 4.3.15. and 4.4.6.
ON Variations: At the time of installation, aboveground storage tanks and associated piping shall be tested for leakage in conformance with Subsections 4.3.15. and 4.4.6.

ON Full: Fire alarm systems, including those with voice communication capability, shall be installed in conformance with CAN/ULC-S524, "Installation of Fire Alarm Systems".
ON Variations: Fire alarm systems, including those with voice communication capability, shall be installed in conformance with CAN/ULC-S524, "Installation of Fire Alarm Systems".

ON Full: Rectangular masonry or concrete chimneys not more than 12 m in height shall conform to Part 9 if they serve,(a) appliances with a combined total rated heat output of 120 kW or less, or (b) fireplaces.
ON Variations: Rectangular masonry or concrete chimneys not more than 12 m in height shall conform to Part 9 if they serve,(a) appliances with a combined total rated heat output of 120 kW or less, or (b) fireplaces.

ON Full: A building classified as Group E is permitted to conform to Sentence (2) provided, it is not more than 2 storeys in building height, and it has a building area not more than the value in Table 3.2.2.61.
ON Variations: A building classified as Group E is permitted to conform to Sentence (2) provided, it is not more than 2 storeys in building height, and it has a building area not more than the value in Table 3.2.2.61.

ON Full: In calculating the required width of corridors and ramps with a grade of less than 4%, 300 mm at each sidewall shall be added to the width determined based on required egress capacity.
ON Variations: In calculating the required width of corridors and ramps with a grade of less than 4%, 300 mm at each sidewall shall be added to the width determined based on required egress capacity.

ON Full: Tanks, piping and machinery reservoirs at a demolition site that contain flammable liquids or combustible liquids or that are likely to contain flammable vapours shall be drained, purged with inert materials and then removed before demolition is commenced.
ON Variations: Tanks, piping and machinery reservoirs at a demolition site that contain flammable liquids or combustible liquids or that are likely to contain flammable vapours shall be drained, purged with inert materials and then removed before demolition is commenced.

ON Full: Except for suite doors opening directly to the exterior, every exit serving a hotel shall have an exit sign placed over or adjacent to it.
ON Variations: Except for suite doors opening directly to the exterior, every exit serving a hotel shall have an exit sign placed over or adjacent to it.

ON Full: Where the underlying soil has a percolation time of more than 15 min, the sand layer referred to in Sentence (4) shall,(a) extend to at least 15 m beyond the perimeter of the treatment unit, or the centrelines of the outer distribution pipes or leaching chambers if utilized, in any direction in which the effluent entering the soil or leaching bed fill will move horizontally, and (b) have an area that is not less than the value determined by the formula, where, A = the area of contact in square metres between the base of the sand and the underlying soil, or leaching bed fill if utilized, Q = the total daily design sanitary sewage flow in litres, and T = the lesser of 50 and the percolation time of the underlying soil. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Where the underlying soil has a percolation time of more than 15 min, the sand layer referred to in Sentence (4) shall,(a) extend to at least 15 m beyond the perimeter of the treatment unit, or the centrelines of the outer distribution pipes or leaching chambers if utilized, in any direction in which the effluent entering the soil or leaching bed fill will move horizontally, and (b) have an area that is not less than the value determined by the formula, where, A = the area of contact in square metres between the base of the sand and the underlying soil, or leaching bed fill if utilized, Q = the total daily design sanitary sewage flow in litres, and T = the lesser of 50 and the percolation time of the underlying soil. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Fixtures may be connected to a vent stack provided,(a) the total hydraulic load of the connected fixtures does not exceed eight fixture units, (b) at least one fixture is connected to a vertical portion of the vent stack and upstream of any other fixtures, (c) no other fixture is connected downstream of a water closet, (d) all fixtures are located in the lowest storey served by the vent stack, and (e) the section of the vent pipe that acts as a wet vent conforms to the requirements regarding wet vents.
ON Variations: Fixtures may be connected to a vent stack provided,(a) the total hydraulic load of the connected fixtures does not exceed eight fixture units, (b) at least one fixture is connected to a vertical portion of the vent stack and upstream of any other fixtures, (c) no other fixture is connected downstream of a water closet, (d) all fixtures are located in the lowest storey served by the vent stack, and (e) the section of the vent pipe that acts as a wet vent conforms to the requirements regarding wet vents.

ON Full: A fire separation required by Sentence (9) shall not contain any grilles, louvres or other openings.
ON Variations: A fire separation required by Sentence (9) shall not contain any grilles, louvres or other openings.

ON Full: In addition to the requirements of Section 3.4, industrial trucks used or stored within the building shall be maintained so that fuels or hydraulic fluids do not contaminate the ammonium nitrate.
ON Variations: In addition to the requirements of Section 3.4, industrial trucks used or stored within the building shall be maintained so that fuels or hydraulic fluids do not contaminate the ammonium nitrate.

ON Full: The original or a copy of at least the most recent and the immediately preceding record referred to in Sentence (7) shall be retained in the building for a period of at least two years after being prepared and shall be made available to the Chief Fire Official for examination on request.
ON Variations: The original or a copy of at least the most recent and the immediately preceding record referred to in Sentence (7) shall be retained in the building for a period of at least two years after being prepared and shall be made available to the Chief Fire Official for examination on request.

ON Full: Starter strips required in Sentence (1) shall be laid in a continuous band of cement not less than 200 mm wide.
ON Variations: Starter strips required in Sentence (1) shall be laid in a continuous band of cement not less than 200 mm wide.

ON Full: The space between wall and facing described in Sentence (2) shall be filled with mortar.
ON Variations: The space between wall and facing described in Sentence (2) shall be filled with mortar.

ON Full: Mortar, grout, mortar joints, corbelling and protection for unit masonry shall conform to Section 9.20.
ON Variations: Mortar, grout, mortar joints, corbelling and protection for unit masonry shall conform to Section 9.20.

ON Full: No stairs or steps shall be used at a horizontal exit.
ON Variations: No stairs or steps shall be used at a horizontal exit.

ON Full: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.3.5.9.(1), openings through any guard that is required by Sentence (1) and that is installed in a building of industrial occupancy shall be of a size which will prevent the passage of a sphere having a diameter more than 200 mm unless it can be shown that the location and size of openings that exceed this limit do not represent a hazard.
ON Variations: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.3.5.9.(1), openings through any guard that is required by Sentence (1) and that is installed in a building of industrial occupancy shall be of a size which will prevent the passage of a sphere having a diameter more than 200 mm unless it can be shown that the location and size of openings that exceed this limit do not represent a hazard.

ON Full: Where the clear space provided for an adult-size change table is adjacent to a wall, reinforcement shall be installed in the wall to permit the future installation of the change table.
ON Variations: Where the clear space provided for an adult-size change table is adjacent to a wall, reinforcement shall be installed in the wall to permit the future installation of the change table.

ON Full: (3) In addition to the requirements of Sentence (2), outlet boxes on opposite sides of a vertical fire separation having a fire-resistance rating shall be separated by, a horizontal distance of not less than 600 mm, or a fire block conforming to Article 3.1.11.7.
ON Variations: (3) In addition to the requirements of Sentence (2), outlet boxes on opposite sides of a vertical fire separation having a fire-resistance rating shall be separated by, a horizontal distance of not less than 600 mm, or a fire block conforming to Article 3.1.11.7.

ON Full: Subsection 9.13.4. applies to walls, roofs and floors that are in contact with the ground.
ON Variations: Subsection 9.13.4. applies to walls, roofs and floors that are in contact with the ground.

ON Full: For shapes not addressed in Sentence (8), Ca corresponding to the non-uniform snow load case shall be established based on applicable field observations, special analyses including local climatic effects, appropriate model tests or a combination of these methods.
ON Variations: For shapes not addressed in Sentence (8), Ca corresponding to the non-uniform snow load case shall be established based on applicable field observations, special analyses including local climatic effects, appropriate model tests or a combination of these methods.

ON Full: Where the limits on the area of glazed openings are determined for individual portions of the exterior wall, as described in Subclause 9.10.15.2.(1)(b)(iii), the maximum aggregate area of glazed openings for any portion shall not exceed the values in the row of Table 9.10.15.4. for the total area of the entire exposing building face based on the limiting distance of the individual portion. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Where the limits on the area of glazed openings are determined for individual portions of the exterior wall, as described in Subclause 9.10.15.2.(1)(b)(iii), the maximum aggregate area of glazed openings for any portion shall not exceed the values in the row of Table 9.10.15.4. for the total area of the entire exposing building face based on the limiting distance of the individual portion. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Where it is necessary to change elevators to reach the entrance described in Sentence (1), the elevator system shall be designed so that not more than one change of elevator is required between, a platform and a fare-paid area control, and the fare-paid area control and the entrance.
ON Variations: Where it is necessary to change elevators to reach the entrance described in Sentence (1), the elevator system shall be designed so that not more than one change of elevator is required between, a platform and a fare-paid area control, and the fare-paid area control and the entrance.

ON Full: Cargo hose shall be of adequate length to allow for the movement of the marine vessel.
ON Variations: Cargo hose shall be of adequate length to allow for the movement of the marine vessel.

ON Full: Where bleachers are provided in tents, they shall be designed in conformance with Articles 3.3.2.8., 3.3.2.10. and Subsection 4.1.5.
ON Variations: Where bleachers are provided in tents, they shall be designed in conformance with Articles 3.3.2.8., 3.3.2.10. and Subsection 4.1.5.

ON Full: If combustible fibres are stored in a building, automatic smoke venting hatches that are manually operable from remote locations and have a combined opening area of 64 cm2 for each square metre of floor area shall be provided.
ON Variations: If combustible fibres are stored in a building, automatic smoke venting hatches that are manually operable from remote locations and have a combined opening area of 64 cm2 for each square metre of floor area shall be provided.

ON Full: Despite the requirements of the standards referenced in Sentences (1) and (2) for the installation of automatic sprinkler systems, sprinklers shall be provided for all balconies and decks forming part of a building within the scope of Article 3.2.2.43A. or 3.2.2.50A., other than, (a) balconies or decks that are not more than 610 mm in depth measured perpendicular to the exterior wall of the building, or decks on the uppermost roof of the building. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Despite the requirements of the standards referenced in Sentences (1) and (2) for the installation of automatic sprinkler systems, sprinklers shall be provided for all balconies and decks forming part of a building within the scope of Article 3.2.2.43A. or 3.2.2.50A., other than, (a) balconies or decks that are not more than 610 mm in depth measured perpendicular to the exterior wall of the building, or decks on the uppermost roof of the building. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: The clear height over stairs shall be measured vertically, over the clear width of the stair, from a straight line tangent to the tread and landing nosings to the lowest point above. (See A-3.4.3.4. in Appendix A.)
ON Variations: The clear height over stairs shall be measured vertically, over the clear width of the stair, from a straight line tangent to the tread and landing nosings to the lowest point above. (See A-3.4.3.4. in Appendix A.)

ON Full: For the purposes of this Article, existing buildings shall be classified as to their construction and occupancy as provided for in Sentence 11.2.1.1.(1).
ON Variations: For the purposes of this Article, existing buildings shall be classified as to their construction and occupancy as provided for in Sentence 11.2.1.1.(1).

ON Full: Two or more fixture outlet pipes that serve outlets from a single fixture that is listed in Clause 7.4.2.1.(1)(d) may be directly connected to a branch that,(a) has a size of at least 1¼ in., and (b) is terminated above the flood level rim of a directly connected fixture with a minimum diameter waste of 1½ in. to form an air break.
ON Variations: Two or more fixture outlet pipes that serve outlets from a single fixture that is listed in Clause 7.4.2.1.(1)(d) may be directly connected to a branch that,(a) has a size of at least 1¼ in., and (b) is terminated above the flood level rim of a directly connected fixture with a minimum diameter waste of 1½ in. to form an air break.

ON Full: Sentence (2) does not apply to tight-filled storage tanks that were installed on or before December 31, 2014 and that meet the requirements of this Code as it read on December 31, 2014.
ON Variations: Sentence (2) does not apply to tight-filled storage tanks that were installed on or before December 31, 2014 and that meet the requirements of this Code as it read on December 31, 2014.

ON Full: Where exhaust ducts containing air from conditioned spaces pass through or are adjacent to unconditioned spaces, the ducts shall be constructed to prevent condensation from forming inside or outside of the ducts.
ON Variations: Where exhaust ducts containing air from conditioned spaces pass through or are adjacent to unconditioned spaces, the ducts shall be constructed to prevent condensation from forming inside or outside of the ducts.

ON Full: The installation of windows, doors and skylights shall conform to CAN/CSA-A440.4, "Window, Door, and Skylight Installation", except that,(a) shims used to support windows, doors and skylights are permitted to be of treated plywood, and (b) protection from precipitation for walls incorporating windows or doors and for roofs incorporating skylights, and the interfaces of these walls with windows or doors and of roofs with skylights, shall conform to Section 9.27.
ON Variations: The installation of windows, doors and skylights shall conform to CAN/CSA-A440.4, "Window, Door, and Skylight Installation", except that,(a) shims used to support windows, doors and skylights are permitted to be of treated plywood, and (b) protection from precipitation for walls incorporating windows or doors and for roofs incorporating skylights, and the interfaces of these walls with windows or doors and of roofs with skylights, shall conform to Section 9.27.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence 4.1.8.20.(7), the values of Rd and Ro and the corresponding system restrictions shall conform to Table 4.1.8.9. and the requirements of this Subsection.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence 4.1.8.20.(7), the values of Rd and Ro and the corresponding system restrictions shall conform to Table 4.1.8.9. and the requirements of this Subsection.

ON Full: The use of buildings or structures that do not conform with the provisions of Sentences (6) to (8) may be approved where the buildings or structures do not constitute a hazard to life or property from fire or explosion.
ON Variations: The use of buildings or structures that do not conform with the provisions of Sentences (6) to (8) may be approved where the buildings or structures do not constitute a hazard to life or property from fire or explosion.

ON Full: Sprinkler systems shall conform with the requirements of Articles 3.2.5.13 to 3.2.5.16.
ON Variations: Sprinkler systems shall conform with the requirements of Articles 3.2.5.13 to 3.2.5.16.

ON Full: This Section does not apply if smoke alarms have been installed in the dwelling unit or sleeping room not within a dwelling unit in accordance with the Building Code as it read on or after April 6, 1998.
ON Variations: This Section does not apply if smoke alarms have been installed in the dwelling unit or sleeping room not within a dwelling unit in accordance with the Building Code as it read on or after April 6, 1998.

ON Full: Where the building area conforms to Clause 3.10.4.2.(1)(b), the limiting distance requirements shall not apply between individual buildings.
ON Variations: Where the building area conforms to Clause 3.10.4.2.(1)(b), the limiting distance requirements shall not apply between individual buildings.

ON Full: The clearances from combustible material and supply plenums, supply ducts, boots and register boxes of heating systems shall conform to the requirements of Subsection 6.2.4.
ON Variations: The clearances from combustible material and supply plenums, supply ducts, boots and register boxes of heating systems shall conform to the requirements of Subsection 6.2.4.

ON Full: Except as permitted in Sentences (2) to (6), combustible piping shall not be used where any part of a piping system partly or wholly penetrates a fire separation required to have a fire-resistance rating or penetrates a membrane that contributes to the required fire-resistance rating of an assembly.
ON Variations: Except as permitted in Sentences (2) to (6), combustible piping shall not be used where any part of a piping system partly or wholly penetrates a fire separation required to have a fire-resistance rating or penetrates a membrane that contributes to the required fire-resistance rating of an assembly.

ON Full: Capacity ratings for required fans shall be based on a static pressure differential of 50 Pa, 25 Pa or 7.5 Pa depending on whether the fan is installed with ductwork connected on both sides, one side or neither side, respectively.
ON Variations: Capacity ratings for required fans shall be based on a static pressure differential of 50 Pa, 25 Pa or 7.5 Pa depending on whether the fan is installed with ductwork connected on both sides, one side or neither side, respectively.

ON Full: Subject to Sentence (3), material standards, access and construction methods and practices for a tank used for other Classes of sewage systems shall conform to the requirements of CSA B66, "Design, Material, and Manufacturing Requirements for Prefabricated Septic Tanks and Sewage Holding Tanks".
ON Variations: Subject to Sentence (3), material standards, access and construction methods and practices for a tank used for other Classes of sewage systems shall conform to the requirements of CSA B66, "Design, Material, and Manufacturing Requirements for Prefabricated Septic Tanks and Sewage Holding Tanks".

ON Full: Closures in vent openings into smoke shafts from each floor area shall be inspected sequentially over a period not to exceed five years.
ON Variations: Closures in vent openings into smoke shafts from each floor area shall be inspected sequentially over a period not to exceed five years.

ON Full: Subject to Sentence (2), this Section applies to day care centres for children, including day nurseries as defined in the Day Nurseries Act.
ON Variations: Subject to Sentence (2), this Section applies to day care centres for children, including day nurseries as defined in the Day Nurseries Act.

ON Full: A plumbing fixture may have a smoke developed classification more than 300 but not more than 500 if, it is in a room where the wall surfaces have a smoke developed classification not more than 200, and it is located in, a Group C occupancy, or a Group B occupancy and the building is sprinklered.
ON Variations: A plumbing fixture may have a smoke developed classification more than 300 but not more than 500 if, it is in a room where the wall surfaces have a smoke developed classification not more than 200, and it is located in, a Group C occupancy, or a Group B occupancy and the building is sprinklered.

ON Full: The spectral acceleration values used in the Modal Response Spectrum Method shall be the design spectral acceleration values, S(T), defined in Sentence 4.1.8.4.(7).
ON Variations: The spectral acceleration values used in the Modal Response Spectrum Method shall be the design spectral acceleration values, S(T), defined in Sentence 4.1.8.4.(7).

ON Full: Permitted tolerances in head and bed joints shall be -5 mm to +10 mm.
ON Variations: Permitted tolerances in head and bed joints shall be -5 mm to +10 mm.

ON Full: A door equipped with a latching mechanism in an access to exit from a room or suite of assembly occupancy containing an occupant load more than 100 shall be equipped with a device that will release the latch and allow the door to swing wide open when a force not more than that specified in Sentence 3.8.3.3.(7) is applied to the device in the direction of travel to the exit.
ON Variations: A door equipped with a latching mechanism in an access to exit from a room or suite of assembly occupancy containing an occupant load more than 100 shall be equipped with a device that will release the latch and allow the door to swing wide open when a force not more than that specified in Sentence 3.8.3.3.(7) is applied to the device in the direction of travel to the exit.

ON Full: The fire separation required by Sentence (1) is not required to have a fire-resistance rating if the floor area in which the laundry room is located is sprinklered.
ON Variations: The fire separation required by Sentence (1) is not required to have a fire-resistance rating if the floor area in which the laundry room is located is sprinklered.

ON Full: Where gravity drainage is not practical, a covered sump with an automatic pump shall be installed to discharge the water into a sewer, drainage ditch or dry well.
ON Variations: Where gravity drainage is not practical, a covered sump with an automatic pump shall be installed to discharge the water into a sewer, drainage ditch or dry well.

ON Full: Shingles referred to in Sentence (1) shall be cemented to the roof shingles and to each other with a coat of cement and fastened with nails or staples located 40 mm above the butt of the overlying shingle and 50 mm from each edge.
ON Variations: Shingles referred to in Sentence (1) shall be cemented to the roof shingles and to each other with a coat of cement and fastened with nails or staples located 40 mm above the butt of the overlying shingle and 50 mm from each edge.

ON Full: A membrane ceiling forming part of an assembly assigned a fire-resistance rating on the basis of Table 2 of MMAH Supplementary Standard SB-3, "Fire and Sound Resistance of Building Assemblies", is permitted to be pierced by openings leading to ducts within the ceiling space provided the ducts, the amount of openings and their protection conform to Sentence 9.10.13.1.4.(1) and the requirements in MMAH Supplementary Standard SB-2, "Fire Performance Ratings".
ON Variations: A membrane ceiling forming part of an assembly assigned a fire-resistance rating on the basis of Table 2 of MMAH Supplementary Standard SB-3, "Fire and Sound Resistance of Building Assemblies", is permitted to be pierced by openings leading to ducts within the ceiling space provided the ducts, the amount of openings and their protection conform to Sentence 9.10.13.1.4.(1) and the requirements in MMAH Supplementary Standard SB-2, "Fire Performance Ratings".

ON Full: Except for dwelling units, lavatories required by Sentence (5) shall be equipped with faucets that, operate automatically, or have a manual control that, has a lever type handle or is otherwise operable with a closed fist, does not require the application of continuous force to maintain water flow, and where metered, provides at least 10 s of water flow.
ON Variations: Except for dwelling units, lavatories required by Sentence (5) shall be equipped with faucets that, operate automatically, or have a manual control that, has a lever type handle or is otherwise operable with a closed fist, does not require the application of continuous force to maintain water flow, and where metered, provides at least 10 s of water flow.

ON Full: No bore of a vent stack or stack vent shall be reduced or obstructed by the installation of a flashing.
ON Variations: No bore of a vent stack or stack vent shall be reduced or obstructed by the installation of a flashing.

ON Full: Flames and other sources of ignition shall be eliminated in a building undergoing fumigation or thermal insecticidal fogging.
ON Variations: Flames and other sources of ignition shall be eliminated in a building undergoing fumigation or thermal insecticidal fogging.

ON Full: Protection against thermal expansion shall be required when a check valve is required by Article 7.6.1.10., a backflow preventer is required by Article 7.6.2.2., or a pressure reducing valve is required by Article 7.6.3.3. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Protection against thermal expansion shall be required when a check valve is required by Article 7.6.1.10., a backflow preventer is required by Article 7.6.2.2., or a pressure reducing valve is required by Article 7.6.3.3. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Except as permitted by Article 3.2.8.2. and Sentence 3.3.4.2.(3), the portions of a floor area or a mezzanine that do not terminate at an exterior wall, a firewall or a vertical shaft shall, terminate at a vertical fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the floor assembly and extending from the floor assembly to the underside of the floor or roof assembly above, or be protected in conformance with the requirements of Articles 3.2.8.3. to 3.2.8.11.
ON Variations: Except as permitted by Article 3.2.8.2. and Sentence 3.3.4.2.(3), the portions of a floor area or a mezzanine that do not terminate at an exterior wall, a firewall or a vertical shaft shall, terminate at a vertical fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the floor assembly and extending from the floor assembly to the underside of the floor or roof assembly above, or be protected in conformance with the requirements of Articles 3.2.8.3. to 3.2.8.11.

ON Full: Portable extinguishers with a gross weight greater than 18 kg shall be installed so that the top of the extinguisher is not more than 1.1 m above the floor when the extinguisher is not equipped with wheels.
ON Variations: Portable extinguishers with a gross weight greater than 18 kg shall be installed so that the top of the extinguisher is not more than 1.1 m above the floor when the extinguisher is not equipped with wheels.

ON Full: In proportioning structural members to limit serviceability problems resulting from deflections, consideration shall be given to, (a) the intended use of the building or member, (b) limiting damage to non-structural members made of materials whose physical properties are known at the time of design, (c) limiting damage to the structure itself, and (d) creep, shrinkage, temperature changes and prestress. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: In proportioning structural members to limit serviceability problems resulting from deflections, consideration shall be given to, (a) the intended use of the building or member, (b) limiting damage to non-structural members made of materials whose physical properties are known at the time of design, (c) limiting damage to the structure itself, and (d) creep, shrinkage, temperature changes and prestress. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Penetrations of a firewall shall be sealed at the penetration by a fire stop that, when subjected to the fire test method in CAN/ULC-S115, "Fire Tests of Firestop Systems", has an FT rating not less than the fire-resistance rating for the fire separation.
ON Variations: Penetrations of a firewall shall be sealed at the penetration by a fire stop that, when subjected to the fire test method in CAN/ULC-S115, "Fire Tests of Firestop Systems", has an FT rating not less than the fire-resistance rating for the fire separation.

ON Full: A Type B dispersal bed shall not be located in an area that has an average slope that exceeds one unit vertically to seven units horizontally.
ON Variations: A Type B dispersal bed shall not be located in an area that has an average slope that exceeds one unit vertically to seven units horizontally.

ON Full: Private water supply pipes shall be designed and installed according to MOE PIBS 6881e, "Design Guidelines for Drinking-Water Systems".
ON Variations: Private water supply pipes shall be designed and installed according to MOE PIBS 6881e, "Design Guidelines for Drinking-Water Systems".

ON Full: This Article applies to construction for which a permit has been applied for before January 1, 2017.
ON Variations: This Article applies to construction for which a permit has been applied for before January 1, 2017.

ON Full: Materials and components installed to provide the required resistance to heat transfer or the means implemented to dissipate heat shall,(a) provide sufficient resistance or dissipation, (i) to minimize surface condensation on the warm side of the component or assembly, (ii) in conjunction with other materials and components in the assembly, to minimize condensation within the component or assembly, (iii) in conjunction with systems installed for space conditioning, to meet the interior design thermal conditions for the intended occupancy, and (iv) to minimize ice damming on sloped roofs, and (b) take into account the conditions on either side of the environmental separator. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Materials and components installed to provide the required resistance to heat transfer or the means implemented to dissipate heat shall,(a) provide sufficient resistance or dissipation, (i) to minimize surface condensation on the warm side of the component or assembly, (ii) in conjunction with other materials and components in the assembly, to minimize condensation within the component or assembly, (iii) in conjunction with systems installed for space conditioning, to meet the interior design thermal conditions for the intended occupancy, and (iv) to minimize ice damming on sloped roofs, and (b) take into account the conditions on either side of the environmental separator. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: In a house containing two dwelling units, return-air from one dwelling unit may be recirculated to the other dwelling unit, provided a duct-type smoke detector is installed in the supply or return air duct system serving the entire house which would turn off the fuel supply and electrical power to the heating system upon activation of such detector.
ON Variations: In a house containing two dwelling units, return-air from one dwelling unit may be recirculated to the other dwelling unit, provided a duct-type smoke detector is installed in the supply or return air duct system serving the entire house which would turn off the fuel supply and electrical power to the heating system upon activation of such detector.

ON Full: Clause (1)(c) does not apply to the use of a sewage system designed and operated such that properly treated effluent is discharged into soil.
ON Variations: Clause (1)(c) does not apply to the use of a sewage system designed and operated such that properly treated effluent is discharged into soil.

ON Full: An on site constructed interceptor shall be constructed to the requirements of a manufactured interceptor.
ON Variations: An on site constructed interceptor shall be constructed to the requirements of a manufactured interceptor.

ON Full: Except as permitted in Sentence (7), no bottle trap shall be used in a plumbing system.
ON Variations: Except as permitted in Sentence (7), no bottle trap shall be used in a plumbing system.

ON Full: Flanking wall assemblies connected to a separating floor or ceiling assembly shall be constructed with, (a) concrete or concrete block having a mass per area greater than 200 kg/m2, or (b) gypsum board finish that, (i) is supported on wood or steel framing, and (ii) ends or is interrupted where it meets the structure of the separating floor or ceiling assembly.
ON Variations: Flanking wall assemblies connected to a separating floor or ceiling assembly shall be constructed with, (a) concrete or concrete block having a mass per area greater than 200 kg/m2, or (b) gypsum board finish that, (i) is supported on wood or steel framing, and (ii) ends or is interrupted where it meets the structure of the separating floor or ceiling assembly.

ON Full: The building referred to in Sentence (1) is permitted to be of combustible construction or noncombustible construction used singly or in combination, and, floor assemblies shall be fire separations and, if of combustible construction, shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min, and loadbearing walls, columns and arches supporting an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating shall, have a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min, or be of noncombustible construction.
ON Variations: The building referred to in Sentence (1) is permitted to be of combustible construction or noncombustible construction used singly or in combination, and, floor assemblies shall be fire separations and, if of combustible construction, shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min, loadbearing walls, columns and arches supporting an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating shall, have a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min, or be of noncombustible construction.

ON Full: Except as provided in Article 9.20.1.2., this Section applies to,(a) unreinforced masonry and masonry veneer walls not in contact with the ground, where, (i) the height of the walls constructed on the foundation walls does not exceed 11 m, and (ii) the roof or floor assembly above the first storey is not of concrete construction, and (b) flat insulating concrete form walls not in contact with the ground that, (i) have a maximum floor to floor height of 3 m, (ii) are erected in houses not more than 2 storeys in building height, and (iii) are erected in locations where the seismic spectral response acceleration, Sa(0.2), is not greater than 0.4. (See Appendix Note A-9.15.1.1(1)(c))
ON Variations: Except as provided in Article 9.20.1.2., this Section applies to,(a) unreinforced masonry and masonry veneer walls not in contact with the ground, where, (i) the height of the walls constructed on the foundation walls does not exceed 11 m, and (ii) the roof or floor assembly above the first storey is not of concrete construction, and (b) flat insulating concrete form walls not in contact with the ground that, (i) have a maximum floor to floor height of 3 m, (ii) are erected in houses not more than 2 storeys in building height, and (iii) are erected in locations where the seismic spectral response acceleration, Sa(0.2), is not greater than 0.4. (See Appendix Note A-9.15.1.1(1)(c))

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (3), the upper end of every vent pipe that is not terminated in open air shall be connected to a venting system that terminates through a roof to open air.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (3), the upper end of every vent pipe that is not terminated in open air shall be connected to a venting system that terminates through a roof to open air.

ON Full: Exterior guards serving a house or an individual dwelling unit shall be not less than 900 mm high where the walking surface served by the guard is not more than 1 800 mm above the finished ground level.
ON Variations: Exterior guards serving a house or an individual dwelling unit shall be not less than 900 mm high where the walking surface served by the guard is not more than 1 800 mm above the finished ground level.

ON Full: Every soil or waste stack shall be provided with a cleanout fitting, (a) at the bottom of the stack, (b) not more than 1 000 mm upstream of the bottom of the stack, or (c) on a Y fitting connecting the stack to the building drain or branch.
ON Variations: Every soil or waste stack shall be provided with a cleanout fitting, (a) at the bottom of the stack, (b) not more than 1 000 mm upstream of the bottom of the stack, or (c) on a Y fitting connecting the stack to the building drain or branch.

ON Full: Quantities of flammable liquids and combustible liquids in excess of those permitted in Sentences (2) to (4) shall be kept in a storage area conforming to Subsection 4.2.7.
ON Variations: Quantities of flammable liquids and combustible liquids in excess of those permitted in Sentences (2) to (4) shall be kept in a storage area conforming to Subsection 4.2.7.

ON Full: During loading and unloading operations, a tank vehicle and its delivery equipment shall be separated from other ignition sources by not less than 6 m.
ON Variations: During loading and unloading operations, a tank vehicle and its delivery equipment shall be separated from other ignition sources by not less than 6 m.

ON Full: In addition to the requirements in Sentence (4), hose stations shall be located in each tunnel not more than 20 m from the end of the platform.
ON Variations: In addition to the requirements in Sentence (4), hose stations shall be located in each tunnel not more than 20 m from the end of the platform.

ON Full: Buildings and their structural members shall be designed for serviceability, in accordance with Articles 4.1.3.4. to 4.1.3.6. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Buildings and their structural members shall be designed for serviceability, in accordance with Articles 4.1.3.4. to 4.1.3.6. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Where an access is provided between a rapid transit station and an adjacent building, and the building is regulated by the provisions of Subsection 3.2.6. or 3.2.8., these provisions are not required in the rapid transit station.
ON Variations: Where an access is provided between a rapid transit station and an adjacent building, and the building is regulated by the provisions of Subsection 3.2.6. or 3.2.8., these provisions are not required in the rapid transit station.

ON Full: Shields shall be provided that will prevent stored material from coming within 300 mm of any part of a heating system heat distribution network.
ON Variations: Shields shall be provided that will prevent stored material from coming within 300 mm of any part of a heating system heat distribution network.

ON Full: (2) The building referred to in Sentence (1) is permitted to be of combustible construction or noncombustible construction used singly or in combination, and, except as permitted by Sentences (3) and (4), floor assemblies shall be fire separations with a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, mezzanines shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, roof assemblies shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, and loadbearing walls, columns and arches shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the supported assembly.
ON Variations: (2) The building referred to in Sentence (1) is permitted to be of combustible construction or noncombustible construction used singly or in combination, and, except as permitted by Sentences (3) and (4), floor assemblies shall be fire separations with a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, mezzanines shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, roof assemblies shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, and loadbearing walls, columns and arches shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the supported assembly.

ON Full: When applied without sheathing, furring referred to in Sentence (1) shall be not less than,(a) 19 mm by 64 mm lumber on supports spaced not more than 406 mm o.c., or (b) 19 mm by 89 mm on supports spaced not more than 610 mm o.c.
ON Variations: When applied without sheathing, furring referred to in Sentence (1) shall be not less than,(a) 19 mm by 64 mm lumber on supports spaced not more than 406 mm o.c., or (b) 19 mm by 89 mm on supports spaced not more than 610 mm o.c.

ON Full: A solar collector system is permitted to be installed above roofing materials conforming to Sentence 9.26.2.1.(1).
ON Variations: A solar collector system is permitted to be installed above roofing materials conforming to Sentence 9.26.2.1.(1).

ON Full: A sign required in Clause (3)(b) shall be located, at the doors from the rapid transit station to the adjoining building, and in the means of egress to the adjoining building, at the last point where there is a choice of direction to travel to at least one other exit.
ON Variations: A sign required in Clause (3)(b) shall be located, at the doors from the rapid transit station to the adjoining building, and in the means of egress to the adjoining building, at the last point where there is a choice of direction to travel to at least one other exit.

ON Full: Where two or more solid fuel-burning appliances are connected to the same chimney flue, the appliances must be located on the same storey.
ON Variations: Where two or more solid fuel-burning appliances are connected to the same chimney flue, the appliances must be located on the same storey.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (2), buildings and their structural members shall be designed in conformance with the procedures and practices provided in this Part.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (2), buildings and their structural members shall be designed in conformance with the procedures and practices provided in this Part.

ON Full: A treatment unit that is used in conjunction with a leaching bed constructed as a shallow buried trench, Type A dispersal bed or Type B dispersal bed shall be designed such that the effluent does not exceed the maximum concentrations set out opposite a Level IV treatment unit in Columns 2 and 3 of Table 8.6.2.2.
ON Variations: A treatment unit that is used in conjunction with a leaching bed constructed as a shallow buried trench, Type A dispersal bed or Type B dispersal bed shall be designed such that the effluent does not exceed the maximum concentrations set out opposite a Level IV treatment unit in Columns 2 and 3 of Table 8.6.2.2.

ON Full: A reference in this Code to a document set out in Table 1.2.1.A. is to the edition designated in the table.
ON Variations: A reference in this Code to a document set out in Table 1.2.1.A. is to the edition designated in the table.

ON Full: The roof and floor of ovens and heaters and associated ductwork shall have sufficient clearance or be insulated where necessary to prevent the temperature from exceeding 90°C at any combustible part of the building assembly.
ON Variations: The roof and floor of ovens and heaters and associated ductwork shall have sufficient clearance or be insulated where necessary to prevent the temperature from exceeding 90°C at any combustible part of the building assembly.

ON Full: If an elevator is installed to conform to the requirements of Article 3.3.1.7., or if one or more elevators are provided in a building more than three storeys in building height, each storey having elevator service shall be served by at least one elevator that has inside dimensions that will accommodate and provide adequate access for a patient stretcher 2 010 mm long and 610 mm wide in the prone position. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: If an elevator is installed to conform to the requirements of Article 3.3.1.7., or if one or more elevators are provided in a building more than three storeys in building height, each storey having elevator service shall be served by at least one elevator that has inside dimensions that will accommodate and provide adequate access for a patient stretcher 2 010 mm long and 610 mm wide in the prone position. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Starter strips need not be provided where eave protection of not less than Type M mineral-surfaced roll roofing is provided or self-sealing composite membranes consisting of polyethylene and bituminous material is provided.
ON Variations: Starter strips need not be provided where eave protection of not less than Type M mineral-surfaced roll roofing is provided or self-sealing composite membranes consisting of polyethylene and bituminous material is provided.

ON Full: Passenger elevators, other than those provided for firefighters in accordance with Article 3.2.6.5., are permitted to be located within or adjacent to the opening of an interconnected floor space protected in conformance with the requirements of Articles 3.2.8.3. to 3.2.8.11., Sentences 3.2.8.2.(4) and (6) without being enclosed in a hoistway separated from the remainder of the interconnected floor space provided the elevator machinery is located in a room separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation whose fire-resistance rating is not less than that required for hoistways by Sentence (1).
ON Variations: Passenger elevators, other than those provided for firefighters in accordance with Article 3.2.6.5., are permitted to be located within or adjacent to the opening of an interconnected floor space protected in conformance with the requirements of Articles 3.2.8.3. to 3.2.8.11., Sentences 3.2.8.2.(4) and (6) without being enclosed in a hoistway separated from the remainder of the interconnected floor space provided the elevator machinery is located in a room separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation whose fire-resistance rating is not less than that required for hoistways by Sentence (1).

ON Full: In a rapid transit station, a public address system shall be installed and shall include loudspeakers that, can be operated from the central supervising station, can be operated from the rapid transit station in which they are located, and designed and located so that voice messages can be heard intelligibly throughout the public area in a rapid transit station.
ON Variations: In a rapid transit station, a public address system shall be installed and shall include loudspeakers that, can be operated from the central supervising station, can be operated from the rapid transit station in which they are located, and designed and located so that voice messages can be heard intelligibly throughout the public area in a rapid transit station.

ON Full: Buildings and their structural members and connections including formwork and falsework shall be designed to have sufficient structural capacity and structural integrity to safely and effectively resist all loads, effects of loads and influences that may reasonably be expected, having regard to the expected service life of buildings, and shall in any case satisfy the requirements of this Section. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Buildings and their structural members and connections including formwork and falsework shall be designed to have sufficient structural capacity and structural integrity to safely and effectively resist all loads, effects of loads and influences that may reasonably be expected, having regard to the expected service life of buildings, and shall in any case satisfy the requirements of this Section. (See Appendix A.)
