ON Full: Trim, millwork and doors in an exit stairway, a vestibule to an exit stairway, a lobby described in Sentence 3.4.4.2.(2), or a corridor not within a suite need not conform to the flame-spread rating and smoke developed classification requirements of Sentence (1), provided they have, a flame-spread rating not more than 150, a smoke developed classification not more than 300, and an aggregate area not more than 10% of the area of the wall or ceiling on which they occur.
ON Variations: Trim, millwork and doors in an exit stairway, a vestibule to an exit stairway, a lobby described in Sentence 3.4.4.2.(2), or a corridor not within a suite need not conform to the flame-spread rating and smoke developed classification requirements of Sentence (1), provided they have, a flame-spread rating not more than 150, a smoke developed classification not more than 300, and an aggregate area not more than 10% of the area of the wall or ceiling on which they occur.

ON Full: If it is necessary to change elevators to reach any floor referred to in Sentence (4), the system shall be designed so that not more than one change of elevator is required when travelling to any floor in the building from the storey containing the entrance for firefighter access referred to in Articles 3.2.5.4. and 3.2.5.5.
ON Variations: If it is necessary to change elevators to reach any floor referred to in Sentence (4), the system shall be designed so that not more than one change of elevator is required when travelling to any floor in the building from the storey containing the entrance for firefighter access referred to in Articles 3.2.5.4. and 3.2.5.5.

ON Full: Despite Sentence (1), an existing exhaust or fire protection system may be approved.
ON Variations: Despite Sentence (1), an existing exhaust or fire protection system may be approved.

ON Full: Moveable tanks may be used to dispense flammable liquids or combustible liquids into the fuel tanks of vehicles or other motorized equipment if the moveable tanks are used in accordance with the requirements of this Part for storage tanks.
ON Variations: Moveable tanks may be used to dispense flammable liquids or combustible liquids into the fuel tanks of vehicles or other motorized equipment if the moveable tanks are used in accordance with the requirements of this Part for storage tanks.

ON Full: Buildings and their structural members made of cold-formed steel shall conform to CSA S136, "North American Specification for the Design of Cold-Formed Steel Structural Members". (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Buildings and their structural members made of cold-formed steel shall conform to CSA S136, "North American Specification for the Design of Cold-Formed Steel Structural Members". (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Subject to Sentence (4) and Articles 4.2.4.5. and 4.2.4.6., the maximum quantity of flammable liquids or combustible liquids stored in a building or in a single fire compartment having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h shall meet the requirements of Sentences (2) and (3).
ON Variations: Subject to Sentence (4) and Articles 4.2.4.5. and 4.2.4.6., the maximum quantity of flammable liquids or combustible liquids stored in a building or in a single fire compartment having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h shall meet the requirements of Sentences (2) and (3).

ON Full: When hot work is to be carried out near piping containing flammable gas, the section of the piping located within 1 m of the torch shall be covered with wet noncombustible insulating material 6 mm thick.
ON Variations: When hot work is to be carried out near piping containing flammable gas, the section of the piping located within 1 m of the torch shall be covered with wet noncombustible insulating material 6 mm thick.

ON Full: Where clearance for expansion is required in Article 9.24.3.2., attachment required in Sentence (1) shall be applied between studs and bottom runners only.
ON Variations: Where clearance for expansion is required in Article 9.24.3.2., attachment required in Sentence (1) shall be applied between studs and bottom runners only.

ON Full: Except where the omission will not adversely affect adjacent supported or supporting elements, flashing shall be installed at junctions between roofs and,(a) walls that rise above the roof, and (b) guards that are connected to the roof by other than pickets or posts.
ON Variations: Except where the omission will not adversely affect adjacent supported or supporting elements, flashing shall be installed at junctions between roofs and,(a) walls that rise above the roof, and (b) guards that are connected to the roof by other than pickets or posts.

ON Full: Except as permitted by Sentence (5), combustible sprinkler piping shall be separated from the area served by the sprinkler system, and from any other fire compartment, by ceilings, walls, or soffits consisting of, as a minimum, lath and plaster, gypsum board not less than 9.5 mm thick, plywood not less than 13 mm thick, or a suspended membrane ceiling with, steel suspension grids, and lay-in panels or tiles having a mass not less than 1.7 kg/m2.
ON Variations: Except as permitted by Sentence (5), combustible sprinkler piping shall be separated from the area served by the sprinkler system, and from any other fire compartment, by ceilings, walls, or soffits consisting of, as a minimum, lath and plaster, gypsum board not less than 9.5 mm thick, plywood not less than 13 mm thick, or a suspended membrane ceiling with, steel suspension grids, and lay-in panels or tiles having a mass not less than 1.7 kg/m2.

ON Full: Along the slope of the roof, the flashing required in Sentence (1) shall be stepped with not less than a 75 mm head lap.
ON Variations: Along the slope of the roof, the flashing required in Sentence (1) shall be stepped with not less than a 75 mm head lap.

ON Full: Except for a crawl space conforming to Sentence 3.1.11.6.(1), a horizontal concealed space within a floor assembly or roof assembly of combustible construction, in which sprinklers are not installed, shall be separated by construction conforming to Article 3.1.11.7. into compartments not more than, 600 m2 in area with no dimension more than 60 m, if the exposed construction materials within the space have a flame-spread rating not more than 25, and 300 m2 in area with no dimension more than 20 m, if the exposed construction materials within the space have a flame-spread rating more than 25.
ON Variations: Except for a crawl space conforming to Sentence 3.1.11.6.(1), a horizontal concealed space within a floor assembly or roof assembly of combustible construction, in which sprinklers are not installed, shall be separated by construction conforming to Article 3.1.11.7. into compartments not more than, 600 m2 in area with no dimension more than 60 m, if the exposed construction materials within the space have a flame-spread rating not more than 25, and 300 m2 in area with no dimension more than 20 m, if the exposed construction materials within the space have a flame-spread rating more than 25.

ON Full: Portland cement shall conform to CSA A3001, "Cementitious Materials for Use in Concrete".
ON Variations: Portland cement shall conform to CSA A3001, "Cementitious Materials for Use in Concrete".

ON Full: A sign shall not be located in proximity to existing above ground electrical conductors, unless the sign meets the clearance requirements of Subsection 3.1.19.
ON Variations: A sign shall not be located in proximity to existing above ground electrical conductors, unless the sign meets the clearance requirements of Subsection 3.1.19.

ON Full: Anchor bolts shall be used to secure ledger boards to flat insulating concrete form walls and shall be,(a) embedded in the wall to a depth not less than 100 mm, and (b) spaced in accordance with Table 9.20.17.5.
ON Variations: Anchor bolts shall be used to secure ledger boards to flat insulating concrete form walls and shall be,(a) embedded in the wall to a depth not less than 100 mm, and (b) spaced in accordance with Table 9.20.17.5.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentences (3) and (4), the energy efficiency of all buildings shall conform to Division 1 and Division 2 or 4 of MMA Supplementary Standard SB-10, "Energy Efficiency Requirements".
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentences (3) and (4), the energy efficiency of all buildings shall conform to Division 1 and Division 2 or 4 of MMA Supplementary Standard SB-10, "Energy Efficiency Requirements".

ON Full: Each rapid transit station shall be monitored by a central supervising station conforming to CAN/ULC-S561, "Installation and Services for Fire Signal Receiving Centres and Systems".
ON Variations: Each rapid transit station shall be monitored by a central supervising station conforming to CAN/ULC-S561, "Installation and Services for Fire Signal Receiving Centres and Systems".

ON Full: The heating and cooling equipment capacities shall be determined in accordance with the requirements of CSA F280, "Determining the Required Capacity of Residential Space Heating and Cooling Appliances".
ON Variations: The heating and cooling equipment capacities shall be determined in accordance with the requirements of CSA F280, "Determining the Required Capacity of Residential Space Heating and Cooling Appliances".

ON Full: Handrails shall be continuously graspable along their entire length, shall be free of any sharp or abrasive elements, and shall have, a circular cross-section with an outside diameter not less than 30 mm and not more than 43 mm, or any non-circular cross-section with a perimeter not less than 100 mm and not more than 125 mm and whose largest cross-sectional dimension is not more than 45 mm.
ON Variations: Handrails shall be continuously graspable along their entire length, shall be free of any sharp or abrasive elements, and shall have, a circular cross-section with an outside diameter not less than 30 mm and not more than 43 mm, or any non-circular cross-section with a perimeter not less than 100 mm and not more than 125 mm and whose largest cross-sectional dimension is not more than 45 mm.

ON Full: Every venting system shall be capable of withstanding without leakage a water test, air test and final test.
ON Variations: Every venting system shall be capable of withstanding without leakage a water test, air test and final test.

ON Full: Where one water closet is required for males and one water closet is required for females, the following may be provided in lieu of the water closets otherwise required by this Subsection: one universal washroom conforming to Sentence 3.8.3.12.(1), and one washroom containing one water closet that is permitted to be used by both sexes provided the door to the room can be locked from the inside.
ON Variations: Where one water closet is required for males and one water closet is required for females, the following may be provided in lieu of the water closets otherwise required by this Subsection: one universal washroom conforming to Sentence 3.8.3.12.(1), and one washroom containing one water closet that is permitted to be used by both sexes provided the door to the room can be locked from the inside.

ON Full: This Section applies to the design and construction of site assembled and manufactured pools that are intended for use as public pools.
ON Variations: This Section applies to the design and construction of site assembled and manufactured pools that are intended for use as public pools.

ON Full: The trap arm of water closets, S-trap standards or any other fixture that also discharges vertically and depends on siphonic action for its proper functioning shall not have a cumulative change in direction of more than 225°.
ON Variations: The trap arm of water closets, S-trap standards or any other fixture that also discharges vertically and depends on siphonic action for its proper functioning shall not have a cumulative change in direction of more than 225°.

ON Full: The design of excavations and of supports for the sides of excavations shall conform to the requirements of Subsection 4.2.4. and this Subsection. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: The design of excavations and of supports for the sides of excavations shall conform to the requirements of Subsection 4.2.4. and this Subsection. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Aisles shall terminate in a cross aisle, foyer or exit and the width of such cross aisle, foyer or exit shall be at least the required width of the widest aisle plus 50% of the total required width of the remaining aisles that it serves.
ON Variations: Aisles shall terminate in a cross aisle, foyer or exit and the width of such cross aisle, foyer or exit shall be at least the required width of the widest aisle plus 50% of the total required width of the remaining aisles that it serves.

ON Full: A clearance space that is equivalent to twice the sparking distance shall be maintained between the articles being painted and any electrodes or conductors.
ON Variations: A clearance space that is equivalent to twice the sparking distance shall be maintained between the articles being painted and any electrodes or conductors.

ON Full: Columns of sizes other than as specified in Sentence (1) are permitted to be used where the loadbearing capacities are shown to be adequate.
ON Variations: Columns of sizes other than as specified in Sentence (1) are permitted to be used where the loadbearing capacities are shown to be adequate.

ON Full: All joints in the sheathing membrane required in Sentence (1) shall occur over framing, and the membrane shall be fastened to the framing with roofing nails or staples spaced not more than 150 mm along the edges of the outer layer of sheathing paper.
ON Variations: All joints in the sheathing membrane required in Sentence (1) shall occur over framing, and the membrane shall be fastened to the framing with roofing nails or staples spaced not more than 150 mm along the edges of the outer layer of sheathing paper.

ON Full: Unless otherwise permitted by Articles 3.2.2.20. to 3.2.2.83., a roof assembly in a building up to 2 storeys in building height is permitted to be of heavy timber construction regardless of building area or type of construction required, provided the building is sprinklered.
ON Variations: Unless otherwise permitted by Articles 3.2.2.20. to 3.2.2.83., a roof assembly in a building up to 2 storeys in building height is permitted to be of heavy timber construction regardless of building area or type of construction required, provided the building is sprinklered.

ON Full: Unless otherwise approved, combustible insulation shall be protected as prescribed in the Building Code.
ON Variations: Unless otherwise approved, combustible insulation shall be protected as prescribed in the Building Code.

ON Full: Transmitters and water-flow-actuated devices shall be tested every two months.
ON Variations: Transmitters and water-flow-actuated devices shall be tested every two months.

ON Full: Relief valves on the air and water supply lines of pressure tanks shall be inspected weekly.
ON Variations: Relief valves on the air and water supply lines of pressure tanks shall be inspected weekly.

ON Full: Wheeled carts shall be stored after use so as not to obstruct access to exits in retail outlets where wheeled carts are used by customers.
ON Variations: Wheeled carts shall be stored after use so as not to obstruct access to exits in retail outlets where wheeled carts are used by customers.

ON Full: Leaching chambers are permitted for use in conjunction with an absorption trench, shallow buried trench, filter bed or Type A dispersal bed.
ON Variations: Leaching chambers are permitted for use in conjunction with an absorption trench, shallow buried trench, filter bed or Type A dispersal bed.

ON Full: Except as required by Sentence 3.16.3.2.(2), platform and walkway levels shall be of, solid construction consisting of steel plate or steel roof decking with a top substrate that forms a serviceable floor area, or open construction consisting of steel grating or open steel floor planking.
ON Variations: Except as required by Sentence 3.16.3.2.(2), platform and walkway levels shall be of, solid construction consisting of steel plate or steel roof decking with a top substrate that forms a serviceable floor area, or open construction consisting of steel grating or open steel floor planking.

ON Full: Openings that are independent of the fill pipe and are used for measuring the liquid level in storage tanks containing Class I or II liquids shall be equipped with a vapour-tight cap which shall be opened only when measuring the liquid level.
ON Variations: Openings that are independent of the fill pipe and are used for measuring the liquid level in storage tanks containing Class I or II liquids shall be equipped with a vapour-tight cap which shall be opened only when measuring the liquid level.

ON Full: In an access to exit from a floor area used or intended to be used for patients or residents in a Group B, Division 2 or Division 3 occupancy, the required width of corridors, doorways, and ramps shall be based on not less than 18.4 mm per person.
ON Variations: In an access to exit from a floor area used or intended to be used for patients or residents in a Group B, Division 2 or Division 3 occupancy, the required width of corridors, doorways, and ramps shall be based on not less than 18.4 mm per person.

ON Full: All start-up procedures recommended by the manufacturer including air balancing and air-flow determination shall be followed.
ON Variations: All start-up procedures recommended by the manufacturer including air balancing and air-flow determination shall be followed.

ON Full: Pilasters required in Sentence (1) shall be bonded or tied to masonry walls.
ON Variations: Pilasters required in Sentence (1) shall be bonded or tied to masonry walls.

ON Full: The emergency power receptacle described in Sentence (7) shall be identified with a legible sign having the words EMERGENCY POWER OUTLET permanently mounted on the wall beside the receptacle.
ON Variations: The emergency power receptacle described in Sentence (7) shall be identified with a legible sign having the words EMERGENCY POWER OUTLET permanently mounted on the wall beside the receptacle.

ON Full: Table 9.10.8.1. does not apply to houses.
ON Variations: Table 9.10.8.1. does not apply to houses.

ON Full: A grab bar described in Clause (3)(a) shall, be continuous L-shaped with 750 mm long horizontal and vertical components, and be wall mounted with the horizontal component 750 mm above the finished floor and the vertical component 150 mm in front of the water closet. (See A-3.8.3.8.(3) and A-3.8.3.8.(5) in Appendix A.)
ON Variations: A grab bar described in Clause (3)(a) shall, be continuous L-shaped with 750 mm long horizontal and vertical components, and be wall mounted with the horizontal component 750 mm above the finished floor and the vertical component 150 mm in front of the water closet. (See A-3.8.3.8.(3) and A-3.8.3.8.(5) in Appendix A.)

ON Full: No fire-resistance rating is required for floors of exterior passageways serving, (a) a house or an individual dwelling unit in a house, or (b) an individual dwelling unit in a building other than a house where no suite is located above or below the dwelling unit.
ON Variations: No fire-resistance rating is required for floors of exterior passageways serving, (a) a house or an individual dwelling unit in a house, or (b) an individual dwelling unit in a building other than a house where no suite is located above or below the dwelling unit.

ON Full: The operating instructions of portable extinguishers shall face outward when the extinguishers are located in cabinets, in wall recesses or on shelves.
ON Variations: The operating instructions of portable extinguishers shall face outward when the extinguishers are located in cabinets, in wall recesses or on shelves.

ON Full: Except as required by Sentence (9) or (12), if the base shear, Vd, obtained in Sentence (7) is less than 80% of the lateral earthquake design force, V, of Article 4.1.8.11., Vd shall be taken as 0.8 V.
ON Variations: Except as required by Sentence (9) or (12), if the base shear, Vd, obtained in Sentence (7) is less than 80% of the lateral earthquake design force, V, of Article 4.1.8.11., Vd shall be taken as 0.8 V.

ON Full: Where a crawl space is unheated, a ground cover shall be provided consisting of not less than,(a) 50 mm of asphalt paving material, (b) 100 mm of 15 MPa Portland cement concrete, (c) Type S roll roofing, or (d) 0.10 mm polyethylene.
ON Variations: Where a crawl space is unheated, a ground cover shall be provided consisting of not less than,(a) 50 mm of asphalt paving material, (b) 100 mm of 15 MPa Portland cement concrete, (c) Type S roll roofing, or (d) 0.10 mm polyethylene.

ON Full: Where supplemental energy dissipation devices are used across the isolation interface of a seismically isolated structure, displacements, velocities, and accelerations shall be determined in accordance with Article 4.1.8.20.
ON Variations: Where supplemental energy dissipation devices are used across the isolation interface of a seismically isolated structure, displacements, velocities, and accelerations shall be determined in accordance with Article 4.1.8.20.

ON Full: The maximum spacing of supports shall be 7.5 m.
ON Variations: The maximum spacing of supports shall be 7.5 m.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (2), standpipe and hose systems shall be provided and installed in distilleries in accordance with the Building Code.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (2), standpipe and hose systems shall be provided and installed in distilleries in accordance with the Building Code.

ON Full: An earth pit privy shall be constructed in the following manner:(a) the bottom of the pit shall be at least 900 mm above the high ground water table, (b) the sides of the pit shall be reinforced so as to prevent their collapse, (c) the pit shall be surrounded on all sides and on its bottom by not less than 600 mm of soil or leaching bed fill, and (d) the soil or leaching bed fill around the base of the sides of the superstructure of the earth pit privy shall be raised or mounded to a height of at least 150 mm above ground level.
ON Variations: An earth pit privy shall be constructed in the following manner:(a) the bottom of the pit shall be at least 900 mm above the high ground water table, (b) the sides of the pit shall be reinforced so as to prevent their collapse, (c) the pit shall be surrounded on all sides and on its bottom by not less than 600 mm of soil or leaching bed fill, and (d) the soil or leaching bed fill around the base of the sides of the superstructure of the earth pit privy shall be raised or mounded to a height of at least 150 mm above ground level.

ON Full: Except in dwelling units, corridors providing access to exit from sleeping rooms in every building in a camp for housing of workers with sleeping accommodation for more than 10 persons shall have a smoke detector connected to the building alarm system.
ON Variations: Except in dwelling units, corridors providing access to exit from sleeping rooms in every building in a camp for housing of workers with sleeping accommodation for more than 10 persons shall have a smoke detector connected to the building alarm system.

ON Full: Mirrored glass doors are permitted to be used only at the entrance to clothes closets and shall conform to the requirements of CAN/CGSB-82.6-M, "Doors, Mirrored Glass, Sliding or Folding, Wardrobe". (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Mirrored glass doors are permitted to be used only at the entrance to clothes closets and shall conform to the requirements of CAN/CGSB-82.6-M, "Doors, Mirrored Glass, Sliding or Folding, Wardrobe". (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: The substructure and deck of a pier or wharf shall be designed for its intended use and shall be of heavy timber construction or other material that will provide adequate flexibility, resistance to shock, durability, strength and fire resistance.
ON Variations: The substructure and deck of a pier or wharf shall be designed for its intended use and shall be of heavy timber construction or other material that will provide adequate flexibility, resistance to shock, durability, strength and fire resistance.

ON Full: Where there is more than one filter bed in a leaching bed, the filter beds shall be separated by at least 5 m between the distribution pipes or leaching chambers of the filter beds.
ON Variations: Where there is more than one filter bed in a leaching bed, the filter beds shall be separated by at least 5 m between the distribution pipes or leaching chambers of the filter beds.

ON Full: A dead end public corridor is permitted in a business and personal services occupancy where, the dead end corridor, serves an occupant load of not more than 30 persons, is not more than 9 m long, and is provided with doors having self-closing devices, or there is a second and separate egress doorway from each room or suite not leading into a dead end corridor.
ON Variations: A dead end public corridor is permitted in a business and personal services occupancy where, the dead end corridor, serves an occupant load of not more than 30 persons, is not more than 9 m long, and is provided with doors having self-closing devices, or there is a second and separate egress doorway from each room or suite not leading into a dead end corridor.

ON Full: A clear deck space located parallel with the seat for the pool lift and on the side of the seat opposite the water shall, be at least 915 mm wide, and extend forward not less than 1 220 mm from a line located 305 mm behind the rear edge of the seat.
ON Variations: A clear deck space located parallel with the seat for the pool lift and on the side of the seat opposite the water shall, be at least 915 mm wide, and extend forward not less than 1 220 mm from a line located 305 mm behind the rear edge of the seat.

ON Full: Flashing plies shall extend not less than 150 mm up the wall referred to in Sentence (1) behind the sheathing paper.
ON Variations: Flashing plies shall extend not less than 150 mm up the wall referred to in Sentence (1) behind the sheathing paper.

ON Full: Except as provided elsewhere in this Part, the compressive strength of unreinforced concrete after 28 days shall be not less than,(a) 32 MPa for garage floors, carport floors and all exterior flatwork, (b) 20 MPa for interior floors other than those for garages and carports, and (c) 15 MPa for all other applications.
ON Variations: Except as provided elsewhere in this Part, the compressive strength of unreinforced concrete after 28 days shall be not less than,(a) 32 MPa for garage floors, carport floors and all exterior flatwork, (b) 20 MPa for interior floors other than those for garages and carports, and (c) 15 MPa for all other applications.

ON Full: Where the performance level of an existing building is reduced under Sentence 11.4.2.3.(4), upgrading of the fire separations shall be required in conformance with the applicable requirements of Article 3.1.3.1. and Table 11.4.3.4.B.
ON Variations: Where the performance level of an existing building is reduced under Sentence 11.4.2.3.(4), upgrading of the fire separations shall be required in conformance with the applicable requirements of Article 3.1.3.1. and Table 11.4.3.4.B.

ON Full: Piers referred to in Sentence (1) shall project not less than 25 mm beyond the base of the column but in no case be less than 190 mm by 190 mm in size.
ON Variations: Piers referred to in Sentence (1) shall project not less than 25 mm beyond the base of the column but in no case be less than 190 mm by 190 mm in size.

ON Full: Plumbing shall be designed and installed to accommodate the maximum relative structural movement provided for in the construction of the building.
ON Variations: Plumbing shall be designed and installed to accommodate the maximum relative structural movement provided for in the construction of the building.

ON Full: Earthquake load, E, in load combination case 5 of Table 4.1.3.2.A. and case 6 of Table 4.1.3.2.B. includes horizontal earth pressure due to earthquake determined in accordance with Sentence 4.1.8.16.(4).
ON Variations: Earthquake load, E, in load combination case 5 of Table 4.1.3.2.A. and case 6 of Table 4.1.3.2.B. includes horizontal earth pressure due to earthquake determined in accordance with Sentence 4.1.8.16.(4).

ON Full: Compliance with the performance requirements described in Sentences (1) to (4) shall be demonstrated by,(a) compliance with the requirements in, (i) Subsection 9.7.4. or 9.7.5., and (ii) Subsection 9.7.6., or (b) design and construction conforming to Part 5.
ON Variations: Compliance with the performance requirements described in Sentences (1) to (4) shall be demonstrated by,(a) compliance with the requirements in, (i) Subsection 9.7.4. or 9.7.5., and (ii) Subsection 9.7.6., or (b) design and construction conforming to Part 5.

ON Full: Firewalls shall be designed to resist the maximum effect due to, (a) the appropriate lateral design loads prescribed elsewhere in this Section, or (b) a factored lateral load of 0.5 kPa under fire conditions, as described in Sentence (2).
ON Variations: Firewalls shall be designed to resist the maximum effect due to, (a) the appropriate lateral design loads prescribed elsewhere in this Section, or (b) a factored lateral load of 0.5 kPa under fire conditions, as described in Sentence (2).

ON Full: A roof covering classification shall be determined in conformance with CAN/ULC-S107, "Fire Tests of Roof Coverings". (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: A roof covering classification shall be determined in conformance with CAN/ULC-S107, "Fire Tests of Roof Coverings". (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Vertical wall reinforcement in flat insulating concrete form foundation walls shall,(a) conform to, (i) Table 9.15.4.5.A. for 140 mm walls, (ii) Table 9.15.4.5.B. for 190 mm walls, and (iii) Table 9.15.4.5.C. for 240 mm walls, (b) be located in the inside half of the wall section with a minimum cover of 30 mm from the inside face of the concrete wall, and (c) where interrupted by wall openings, be placed not more than 600 mm from each side of the openings.
ON Variations: Vertical wall reinforcement in flat insulating concrete form foundation walls shall,(a) conform to, (i) Table 9.15.4.5.A. for 140 mm walls, (ii) Table 9.15.4.5.B. for 190 mm walls, and (iii) Table 9.15.4.5.C. for 240 mm walls, (b) be located in the inside half of the wall section with a minimum cover of 30 mm from the inside face of the concrete wall, and (c) where interrupted by wall openings, be placed not more than 600 mm from each side of the openings.

ON Full: Conductors leading from a distribution panel referred to in Sentence (10) to emergency lighting units located on other storeys shall be protected in accordance with Sentence (2) between the distribution panel and the floor area where the emergency lighting units are located.
ON Variations: Conductors leading from a distribution panel referred to in Sentence (10) to emergency lighting units located on other storeys shall be protected in accordance with Sentence (2) between the distribution panel and the floor area where the emergency lighting units are located.

ON Full: Where a storage tank containing stable liquids or unstable liquids has a working pressure greater than 17 kPa (gauge), the distances from a property line and any building on the same property shall be those specified in Sentences (2) and (3) multiplied by 1.5, but shall be not less than 7.5 m.
ON Variations: Where a storage tank containing stable liquids or unstable liquids has a working pressure greater than 17 kPa (gauge), the distances from a property line and any building on the same property shall be those specified in Sentences (2) and (3) multiplied by 1.5, but shall be not less than 7.5 m.

ON Full: One means of egress from a mezzanine is permitted, where,(a) the mezzanine is not required to terminate at a vertical fire separation, as permitted by Sentence 9.10.12.1.(2), (b) the occupant load of the mezzanine is not more than 60, (c) the area of the mezzanine does not exceed the area limits of Clause 9.9.7.4.(1)(a), and (d) the distance limits of Clause 9.9.7.4.(1)(b) measured along the path of travel, are not exceeded from any point on the mezzanine to, (i) an egress door serving the space that the mezzanine overlooks if the space is served by a single egress door, or (ii) an egress stairway leading to an access to exit in the space below if that space is required to be served by two or more egress doorways in conformance with Sentence 9.9.7.4.(1).
ON Variations: One means of egress from a mezzanine is permitted, where,(a) the mezzanine is not required to terminate at a vertical fire separation, as permitted by Sentence 9.10.12.1.(2), (b) the occupant load of the mezzanine is not more than 60, (c) the area of the mezzanine does not exceed the area limits of Clause 9.9.7.4.(1)(a), and (d) the distance limits of Clause 9.9.7.4.(1)(b) measured along the path of travel, are not exceeded from any point on the mezzanine to, (i) an egress door serving the space that the mezzanine overlooks if the space is served by a single egress door, or (ii) an egress stairway leading to an access to exit in the space below if that space is required to be served by two or more egress doorways in conformance with Sentence 9.9.7.4.(1).

ON Full: The storage, handling and use of flammable liquids or combustible liquids, other than distilled beverage alcohols, in a distillery shall conform to this Part.
ON Variations: The storage, handling and use of flammable liquids or combustible liquids, other than distilled beverage alcohols, in a distillery shall conform to this Part.

ON Full: A tire storage location shall be classified as a medium hazard industrial occupancy.
ON Variations: A tire storage location shall be classified as a medium hazard industrial occupancy.

ON Full: The design, construction, installation and alteration of each indoor incinerator shall conform to NFPA 82, "Incinerators and Waste and Linen Handling Systems and Equipment".
ON Variations: The design, construction, installation and alteration of each indoor incinerator shall conform to NFPA 82, "Incinerators and Waste and Linen Handling Systems and Equipment".

ON Full: In a building required to be of noncombustible construction, the flame-spread ratings required by Subsection 3.1.5. shall apply in addition to the requirements in this Subsection, and the flame-spread ratings for exits in this Subsection shall also apply to any surface in the exit that would be exposed by cutting through the material in any direction, except that this requirement does not apply to doors, heavy timber construction in a sprinklered building and fire-retardant treated wood.
ON Variations: In a building required to be of noncombustible construction, the flame-spread ratings required by Subsection 3.1.5. shall apply in addition to the requirements in this Subsection, and the flame-spread ratings for exits in this Subsection shall also apply to any surface in the exit that would be exposed by cutting through the material in any direction, except that this requirement does not apply to doors, heavy timber construction in a sprinklered building and fire-retardant treated wood.

ON Full: Floor systems susceptible to vibration shall be designed so that vibrations will have no significant adverse effects on the intended occupancy of the building. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Floor systems susceptible to vibration shall be designed so that vibrations will have no significant adverse effects on the intended occupancy of the building. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Sealants shall be,(a) non-hardening types suitable for exterior use, (b) selected for their ability to resist the effects of weathering, and (c) compatible with, and adhere to, the substrate to which they are applied. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Sealants shall be,(a) non-hardening types suitable for exterior use, (b) selected for their ability to resist the effects of weathering, and (c) compatible with, and adhere to, the substrate to which they are applied. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Construction to resist leakage of soil gas into the building is not required for,(a) garages and unenclosed portions of buildings, (b) buildings constructed in areas where it can be demonstrated that soil gas does not constitute a hazard, or (c) houses that are constructed to provide for subfloor depressurization in accordance with MMAH Supplementary Standard SB-9, "Requirements for Soil Gas Control".
ON Variations: Construction to resist leakage of soil gas into the building is not required for,(a) garages and unenclosed portions of buildings, (b) buildings constructed in areas where it can be demonstrated that soil gas does not constitute a hazard, or (c) houses that are constructed to provide for subfloor depressurization in accordance with MMAH Supplementary Standard SB-9, "Requirements for Soil Gas Control".

ON Full: Fasteners used for attachment described in Sentence (2) shall consist of the equivalent of 63 mm nails or 25 mm screws.
ON Variations: Fasteners used for attachment described in Sentence (2) shall consist of the equivalent of 63 mm nails or 25 mm screws.

ON Full: Except as permitted in Sentence (5), a corridor serving residents who are not ambulatory in a Group B, Division 2 or 3 occupancy shall be not less than 1 650 mm wide.
ON Variations: Except as permitted in Sentence (5), a corridor serving residents who are not ambulatory in a Group B, Division 2 or 3 occupancy shall be not less than 1 650 mm wide.

ON Full: Wired glass or glass block shall not be used for a closure referred to in Sentence (1).
ON Variations: Wired glass or glass block shall not be used for a closure referred to in Sentence (1).

ON Full: For the purposes of Sentence (1), reduction of performance level shall be determined in accordance with Articles 11.4.2.1., 11.4.2.3., 11.4.2.5. and 11.4.2.6.
ON Variations: For the purposes of Sentence (1), reduction of performance level shall be determined in accordance with Articles 11.4.2.1., 11.4.2.3., 11.4.2.5. and 11.4.2.6.

ON Full: A door in a fire separation required by Sentence (9) is permitted to be equipped with a roller latch.
ON Variations: A door in a fire separation required by Sentence (9) is permitted to be equipped with a roller latch.

ON Full: One of the means of egress from a mezzanine that is not required to terminate at a fire separation as permitted by Sentence 9.10.12.1.(2) and that exceeds the limits of Sentence (2), is permitted to lead through the room in which the mezzanine is located provided all other means of egress from that mezzanine lead to exits accessible at the mezzanine level.
ON Variations: One of the means of egress from a mezzanine that is not required to terminate at a fire separation as permitted by Sentence 9.10.12.1.(2) and that exceeds the limits of Sentence (2), is permitted to lead through the room in which the mezzanine is located provided all other means of egress from that mezzanine lead to exits accessible at the mezzanine level.

ON Full: Where a foundation is to rest on, in or near sloping ground, this particular condition shall be provided for in the design.
ON Variations: Where a foundation is to rest on, in or near sloping ground, this particular condition shall be provided for in the design.

ON Full: Non-loadbearing interior walls at right angles to the floor joists are not restricted as to location.
ON Variations: Non-loadbearing interior walls at right angles to the floor joists are not restricted as to location.

ON Full: The minimum specified horizontal load applied inward at the minimum required height of every required guard shall be half that specified in Sentence (1).
ON Variations: The minimum specified horizontal load applied inward at the minimum required height of every required guard shall be half that specified in Sentence (1).

ON Full: Except as required in Sentences (2) and (3) and in Article 4.3.2.3., the minimum distance between every combination of two aboveground storage tanks shall be 0.25 times the sum of their diameters, but shall be not less than 1 m.
ON Variations: Except as required in Sentences (2) and (3) and in Article 4.3.2.3., the minimum distance between every combination of two aboveground storage tanks shall be 0.25 times the sum of their diameters, but shall be not less than 1 m.

ON Full: Nothing in this Part relieves an applicant from complying with the requirements of Article 3.1.3.2. or 9.10.9.12.
ON Variations: Nothing in this Part relieves an applicant from complying with the requirements of Article 3.1.3.2. or 9.10.9.12.

ON Full: Except as provided in Article 6.5.5.7., the alarm on all sprinkler systems shall be tested monthly by flowing water through the test connection located at the sprinkler valve.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Article 6.5.5.7., the alarm on all sprinkler systems shall be tested monthly by flowing water through the test connection located at the sprinkler valve.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (3), where the exterior cladding of a wall is required to be noncombustible, a plastic sign face or a group of contiguous plastic sign faces may be placed over such cladding provided each such sign face or group of contiguous sign faces, does not exceed 30% of the wall area of the storey on which it is installed, does not exceed 15 m2 in area or 1 200 mm in height at each storey, and when located above the first storey, is vertically separated from other plastic sign faces by 1 200 mm of noncombustible construction unless separated by a horizontal noncombustible projection such as a canopy, extending the full width of, and projecting at least 900 mm beyond the exterior sign face.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (3), where the exterior cladding of a wall is required to be noncombustible, a plastic sign face or a group of contiguous plastic sign faces may be placed over such cladding provided each such sign face or group of contiguous sign faces, does not exceed 30% of the wall area of the storey on which it is installed, does not exceed 15 m2 in area or 1 200 mm in height at each storey, and when located above the first storey, is vertically separated from other plastic sign faces by 1 200 mm of noncombustible construction unless separated by a horizontal noncombustible projection such as a canopy, extending the full width of, and projecting at least 900 mm beyond the exterior sign face.

ON Full: Except as permitted by Sentences (2) to (4) and Articles 3.1.5.2. to 3.1.5.25., 3.1.13.4. and 3.2.2.16., a building or part of a building required to be of noncombustible construction, shall be constructed with noncombustible materials.
ON Variations: Except as permitted by Sentences (2) to (4) and Articles 3.1.5.2. to 3.1.5.25., 3.1.13.4. and 3.2.2.16., a building or part of a building required to be of noncombustible construction, shall be constructed with noncombustible materials.

ON Full: Flat insulating concrete form foundation walls shall be considered to be laterally supported at the bottom where the foundation wall,(a) supports backfill not more than 1.2 m in height, (b) is supported at the footing by a shear key and is supported at the top by the ground floor framing, or (c) is dowelled to the footing with not less than 15M bars spaced not more than 1.2 m o.c.
ON Variations: Flat insulating concrete form foundation walls shall be considered to be laterally supported at the bottom where the foundation wall,(a) supports backfill not more than 1.2 m in height, (b) is supported at the footing by a shear key and is supported at the top by the ground floor framing, or (c) is dowelled to the footing with not less than 15M bars spaced not more than 1.2 m o.c.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentences 8.2.1.4.(1) and (2), a treatment unit shall not be located closer than the minimum horizontal distances set out in Table 8.2.1.6.A.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentences 8.2.1.4.(1) and (2), a treatment unit shall not be located closer than the minimum horizontal distances set out in Table 8.2.1.6.A.

ON Full: Portable extinguishers shall be provided in conformance with Section 6.2.
ON Variations: Portable extinguishers shall be provided in conformance with Section 6.2.

ON Full: Vents for quench tanks shall conform to the requirements for flue pipes in Section 2.6.
ON Variations: Vents for quench tanks shall conform to the requirements for flue pipes in Section 2.6.

ON Full: No water system between the point of connection with the water service pipe or the water meter and the first branch that supplies a water heater that serves more than one fixture shall be less than ¾ in. in size.
ON Variations: No water system between the point of connection with the water service pipe or the water meter and the first branch that supplies a water heater that serves more than one fixture shall be less than ¾ in. in size.

ON Full: Testing described in Sentence (2) shall be carried out at the driving rain wind pressure as calculated in accordance with CSA A440S1, "Canadian Supplement to AAMA/WDMA/CSA 101/I.S.2/A440-11, NAFS - North American Fenestration Standard/Specification for Windows, Doors, and Skylights".
ON Variations: Testing described in Sentence (2) shall be carried out at the driving rain wind pressure as calculated in accordance with CSA A440S1, "Canadian Supplement to AAMA/WDMA/CSA 101/I.S.2/A440-11, NAFS - North American Fenestration Standard/Specification for Windows, Doors, and Skylights".

ON Full: Where a shelf is installed above a lavatory required by Sentence (1), it shall, be located not more than 200 mm above the top of the lavatory and not more than 1 100 mm above the finished floor, and project not more than 100 mm from the wall.
ON Variations: Where a shelf is installed above a lavatory required by Sentence (1), it shall, be located not more than 200 mm above the top of the lavatory and not more than 1 100 mm above the finished floor, and project not more than 100 mm from the wall.

ON Full: Splitting of wood members shall be minimized by staggering the nails in the direction of the grain and by keeping nails well in from the edges. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Splitting of wood members shall be minimized by staggering the nails in the direction of the grain and by keeping nails well in from the edges. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Except as required by Sentence (9), NFPA 13D, "Installation of Sprinkler Systems in One- and Two-Family Dwellings and Manufactured Homes", is permitted to be used for the design, construction, installation and testing of an automatic sprinkler system installed in a building of residential occupancy that contains not more than two dwelling units.
ON Variations: Except as required by Sentence (9), NFPA 13D, "Installation of Sprinkler Systems in One- and Two-Family Dwellings and Manufactured Homes", is permitted to be used for the design, construction, installation and testing of an automatic sprinkler system installed in a building of residential occupancy that contains not more than two dwelling units.

ON Full: Closed valley flashing shall consist of sheet metal, self sealing composite membranes consisting of polyethylene and bituminous material or one layer of either Type S smooth surface roll roofing or Type M mineral surface roll roofing (mineral surface not less than 600 mm wide, and nails shall not penetrate the flashing within 75 mm of its edge or 124 mm of the bottom of the valley centreline.
ON Variations: Closed valley flashing shall consist of sheet metal, self sealing composite membranes consisting of polyethylene and bituminous material or one layer of either Type S smooth surface roll roofing or Type M mineral surface roll roofing (mineral surface not less than 600 mm wide, and nails shall not penetrate the flashing within 75 mm of its edge or 124 mm of the bottom of the valley centreline.

ON Full: A Group A, Division 4 occupancy and each tier or balcony that has a capacity of more than, 1 000 persons shall have no fewer than three separate exits, or 4 000 persons shall have no fewer than four separate exits.
ON Variations: A Group A, Division 4 occupancy and each tier or balcony that has a capacity of more than, 1 000 persons shall have no fewer than three separate exits, or 4 000 persons shall have no fewer than four separate exits.

ON Full: Where a storage garage is located in a building containing a residential occupancy, a carbon monoxide alarm shall be installed adjacent to each sleeping area in every suite of residential occupancy that is adjacent to the storage garage.
ON Variations: Where a storage garage is located in a building containing a residential occupancy, a carbon monoxide alarm shall be installed adjacent to each sleeping area in every suite of residential occupancy that is adjacent to the storage garage.

ON Full: Where a part to be coated is preheated prior to the application of the powder, the temperature of the part shall not exceed the ignition temperature of the powder being used.
ON Variations: Where a part to be coated is preheated prior to the application of the powder, the temperature of the part shall not exceed the ignition temperature of the powder being used.

ON Full: At least one copy of the fire emergency procedures shall be prominently posted and maintained at the storage yard.
ON Variations: At least one copy of the fire emergency procedures shall be prominently posted and maintained at the storage yard.

ON Full: Not less than a 50 mm clearance shall be provided between the back and sides of the smoke chamber of a solid fuel-burning fireplace and combustible framing, except that a 25 mm clearance is permitted where the fireplace is located in an exterior wall.
ON Variations: Not less than a 50 mm clearance shall be provided between the back and sides of the smoke chamber of a solid fuel-burning fireplace and combustible framing, except that a 25 mm clearance is permitted where the fireplace is located in an exterior wall.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence 7.4.10.3.(2), where the hydraulic load is to be expressed in litres, fixture units shall be converted as follows:(a) when the number of fixture units is 260 or fewer, the load is 2 360 L, and (b) when the number of fixture units exceeds 260, the load is 9.1 L for each fixture unit.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence 7.4.10.3.(2), where the hydraulic load is to be expressed in litres, fixture units shall be converted as follows:(a) when the number of fixture units is 260 or fewer, the load is 2 360 L, and (b) when the number of fixture units exceeds 260, the load is 9.1 L for each fixture unit.

ON Full: Exterior passageways, exterior stairways and fire escapes in occupied buildings shall be maintained in good repair and operational and kept free of snow and ice accumulations.
ON Variations: Exterior passageways, exterior stairways and fire escapes in occupied buildings shall be maintained in good repair and operational and kept free of snow and ice accumulations.

ON Full: Except for markings for safety or competition purposes, submerged surfaces in public pools shall be finished white or light in colour.
ON Variations: Except for markings for safety or competition purposes, submerged surfaces in public pools shall be finished white or light in colour.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (2), the size and spacing of studs shall conform to Table 9.23.10.1.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (2), the size and spacing of studs shall conform to Table 9.23.10.1.

ON Full: Where lumber, wood shingles, shakes, fibre-cement shingles, planks and sheets, plywood, OSB, waferboard, hardboard, vinyl, aluminum and steel, including trim and soffits, are installed as cladding on wood frame walls exposed to precipitation, the cladding assembly shall comply with,(a) Subsections 9.27.2. to 9.27.12., or (b) Part 5.
ON Variations: Where lumber, wood shingles, shakes, fibre-cement shingles, planks and sheets, plywood, OSB, waferboard, hardboard, vinyl, aluminum and steel, including trim and soffits, are installed as cladding on wood frame walls exposed to precipitation, the cladding assembly shall comply with,(a) Subsections 9.27.2. to 9.27.12., or (b) Part 5.

ON Full: The connection referred to in Sentence (2) for a solid fuel-burning appliance shall be made below connections for appliances burning other fuels.
ON Variations: The connection referred to in Sentence (2) for a solid fuel-burning appliance shall be made below connections for appliances burning other fuels.

ON Full: The ledger boards described in Sentence (1) shall be not less than,(a) 38 mm thick, and (b) the depth of the floor joists.
ON Variations: The ledger boards described in Sentence (1) shall be not less than,(a) 38 mm thick, and (b) the depth of the floor joists.

ON Full: Piles exceeding 150 m in length shall be surrounded by fire department access routes at least 9 m wide.
ON Variations: Piles exceeding 150 m in length shall be surrounded by fire department access routes at least 9 m wide.

ON Full: The minimum width of platforms shall be, 3.2 m for side platforms, and 6.4 m for island platforms.
ON Variations: The minimum width of platforms shall be, 3.2 m for side platforms, and 6.4 m for island platforms.

ON Full: A saddle hub or saddle clamp may be installed in a building drain or building sewer of nominal diameter not less than 8 in. and that is in service provided that the connecting branch is at least two pipe sizes smaller than the run of the building drain or building sewer to which it is connected.
ON Variations: A saddle hub or saddle clamp may be installed in a building drain or building sewer of nominal diameter not less than 8 in. and that is in service provided that the connecting branch is at least two pipe sizes smaller than the run of the building drain or building sewer to which it is connected.

ON Full: Horizontal reinforcement in flat insulating concrete form foundation walls shall,(a) consist of, (i) one 10M bar placed not more than 300 mm from the top of the wall, and (ii) 10M bars spaced not more than 600 mm o.c., and (b) be located, (i) in the inside half of the wall section, and (ii) with a minimum cover of 30 mm from the inside face of the concrete.
ON Variations: Horizontal reinforcement in flat insulating concrete form foundation walls shall,(a) consist of, (i) one 10M bar placed not more than 300 mm from the top of the wall, and (ii) 10M bars spaced not more than 600 mm o.c., and (b) be located, (i) in the inside half of the wall section, and (ii) with a minimum cover of 30 mm from the inside face of the concrete.

ON Full: Where the lobby referred to in Sentence (1) and adjacent occupancies that are permitted to open into the lobby are sprinklered, the fire separation between such occupancies and the lobby need not have a fire-resistance rating.
ON Variations: Where the lobby referred to in Sentence (1) and adjacent occupancies that are permitted to open into the lobby are sprinklered, the fire separation between such occupancies and the lobby need not have a fire-resistance rating.

ON Full: Except as provided in Subsection 6.2.13., systems serving spaces that contain hazardous gases, dusts or liquids shall be designed, constructed and installed in conformance with the provisions of the Fire Code made under the Fire Protection and Prevention Act, 1997, or in the absence of requirements pertinent to such systems in the Fire Code, to good engineering practice such as is described in the publications of the National Fire Protection Association and in the CCBFC NRCC 56192, "National Fire Code of Canada". (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Except as provided in Subsection 6.2.13., systems serving spaces that contain hazardous gases, dusts or liquids shall be designed, constructed and installed in conformance with the provisions of the Fire Code made under the Fire Protection and Prevention Act, 1997, or in the absence of requirements pertinent to such systems in the Fire Code, to good engineering practice such as is described in the publications of the National Fire Protection Association and in the CCBFC NRCC 56192, "National Fire Code of Canada". (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: (0.1) Except as provided in Article 3.2.4.22A., smoke alarms shall be installed in accordance with this Article. Except as permitted by Sentence (6), smoke alarms conforming to CAN/ULC-S531, "Smoke Alarms", shall be installed in each dwelling unit and, except for care, care and treatment or detention occupancies required to have a fire alarm system, in each sleeping room not within a dwelling unit.
ON Variations: (0.1) Except as provided in Article 3.2.4.22A., smoke alarms shall be installed in accordance with this Article. Except as permitted by Sentence (6), smoke alarms conforming to CAN/ULC-S531, "Smoke Alarms", shall be installed in each dwelling unit and, except for care, care and treatment or detention occupancies required to have a fire alarm system, in each sleeping room not within a dwelling unit.

ON Full: The following need not comply with Sentence (2):(a) interior windows and interior doors that do not serve as environmental separators, (b) vehicular access doors, including garage doors, (c) storm windows and storm doors, (d) commercial entrance systems, (e) revolving doors, (f) smoke and relief air vents, (g) site-built door systems, and (h) commercial steel doors.
ON Variations: The following need not comply with Sentence (2):(a) interior windows and interior doors that do not serve as environmental separators, (b) vehicular access doors, including garage doors, (c) storm windows and storm doors, (d) commercial entrance systems, (e) revolving doors, (f) smoke and relief air vents, (g) site-built door systems, and (h) commercial steel doors.

ON Full: Except as required in Sentence 7.5.7.7.(2), where a plumbing system is installed in a building, every storey in which plumbing is or may be installed, including the basement of the building, shall have extended into it or passing through it a vent pipe that is at least 1½ in. in size for the provision of future connections.
ON Variations: Except as required in Sentence 7.5.7.7.(2), where a plumbing system is installed in a building, every storey in which plumbing is or may be installed, including the basement of the building, shall have extended into it or passing through it a vent pipe that is at least 1½ in. in size for the provision of future connections.

ON Full: Except as permitted in Sentence (2), the bulk transfer of flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall take place only on piers and wharves used exclusively for that purpose.
ON Variations: Except as permitted in Sentence (2), the bulk transfer of flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall take place only on piers and wharves used exclusively for that purpose.

ON Full: This Section applies to the construction of a Class 2 sewage system.
ON Variations: This Section applies to the construction of a Class 2 sewage system.

ON Full: The depth of water in the area directly below a horizontal semi-circle in front of a diving board or diving platform having a radius of 3 m measured from any point on the front end of the board or platform shall not be less than, 2 750 mm, where a board is 600 mm or less in height above the water surface, 3 m, where a board or platform is greater than 600 mm but not more than 1 000 mm in height above the water surface, and 3.65 m, where a board or platform is greater than 1 000 mm but not more than 3 m in height above the water surface.
ON Variations: The depth of water in the area directly below a horizontal semi-circle in front of a diving board or diving platform having a radius of 3 m measured from any point on the front end of the board or platform shall not be less than, 2 750 mm, where a board is 600 mm or less in height above the water surface, 3 m, where a board or platform is greater than 600 mm but not more than 1 000 mm in height above the water surface, and 3.65 m, where a board or platform is greater than 1 000 mm but not more than 3 m in height above the water surface.

ON Full: The leakage rate of a door assembly shall be determined in accordance with ANSI/UL-1784, "Air Leakage Tests of Door Assemblies and Other Opening Protectives".
ON Variations: The leakage rate of a door assembly shall be determined in accordance with ANSI/UL-1784, "Air Leakage Tests of Door Assemblies and Other Opening Protectives".

ON Full: Minimum sizes of doorways and doors within a barrier-free path of travel shall conform to Section 9.5.
ON Variations: Minimum sizes of doorways and doors within a barrier-free path of travel shall conform to Section 9.5.

ON Full: Except as permitted in Article 5.12.9.4., spray booths, spray rooms or other enclosures used for spraying operations shall not be used for drying by any arrangement that could cause an increase in the surface temperatures of the spray booths, spray rooms or other enclosures.
ON Variations: Except as permitted in Article 5.12.9.4., spray booths, spray rooms or other enclosures used for spraying operations shall not be used for drying by any arrangement that could cause an increase in the surface temperatures of the spray booths, spray rooms or other enclosures.

ON Full: Portable extinguishers having a rating of 40B:C shall be provided in the vicinity of Class I liquid pumps and fuel dispensers in conformance with Section 6.2.
ON Variations: Portable extinguishers having a rating of 40B:C shall be provided in the vicinity of Class I liquid pumps and fuel dispensers in conformance with Section 6.2.

ON Full: Yoke vents required by Sentence 7.5.4.3.(1) are permitted to be one size smaller than the size of the smallest pipe to which they are connected.
ON Variations: Yoke vents required by Sentence 7.5.4.3.(1) are permitted to be one size smaller than the size of the smallest pipe to which they are connected.

ON Full: Factory built water hammer arresters shall conform to ANSI/ASSE 1010, "Water Hammer Arresters".
ON Variations: Factory built water hammer arresters shall conform to ANSI/ASSE 1010, "Water Hammer Arresters".

ON Full: Except for cabinetry described in Article 9.10.22.2., cabinetry located not less than 450 mm above the level of the heating elements or burners need not be protected as described in Sentence (1).
ON Variations: Except for cabinetry described in Article 9.10.22.2., cabinetry located not less than 450 mm above the level of the heating elements or burners need not be protected as described in Sentence (1).

ON Full: The thickness of concrete in flat insulating concrete form walls not in contact with the ground shall be,(a) not less than 140 mm, and (b) constant for the entire height of the wall.
ON Variations: The thickness of concrete in flat insulating concrete form walls not in contact with the ground shall be,(a) not less than 140 mm, and (b) constant for the entire height of the wall.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentences (2) and (3), on drainage piping of 4 in. size and smaller, the minimum size cleanout opening shall be the same size as the drainage pipe and on drainage piping larger than the 4 in. size, the cleanout opening shall be 4 in. or larger and the maximum spacing between cleanouts on horizontal pipe shall be,(a) in the case of a sink waste pipe, 6 m, (b) in the case of a horizontal sanitary drainage pipe, or storm drainage pipe, other than a waste pipe from a sink, 15 m, and (c) in the case of a horizontal sanitary drainage pipe or storm drainage pipe larger than 4 in. size, 30 m.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentences (2) and (3), on drainage piping of 4 in. size and smaller, the minimum size cleanout opening shall be the same size as the drainage pipe and on drainage piping larger than the 4 in. size, the cleanout opening shall be 4 in. or larger and the maximum spacing between cleanouts on horizontal pipe shall be,(a) in the case of a sink waste pipe, 6 m, (b) in the case of a horizontal sanitary drainage pipe, or storm drainage pipe, other than a waste pipe from a sink, 15 m, and (c) in the case of a horizontal sanitary drainage pipe or storm drainage pipe larger than 4 in. size, 30 m.

ON Full: Wash fountains in circular or straight trough form are permitted to be provided in lieu of required lavatories provided each 500 mm of circumference or trough length is considered to be the equivalent of one lavatory.
ON Variations: Wash fountains in circular or straight trough form are permitted to be provided in lieu of required lavatories provided each 500 mm of circumference or trough length is considered to be the equivalent of one lavatory.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (3), every floor flange shall be of brass.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (3), every floor flange shall be of brass.

ON Full: All edges of sheathing described in Sentence (3) shall be supported by blocking or framing.
ON Variations: All edges of sheathing described in Sentence (3) shall be supported by blocking or framing.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (3) and Articles 7.6.2.4. to 7.6.2.6., where a backflow preventer is required by this Subsection, the backflow preventer shall be selected, installed and tested in conformance with CSA B64.10, "Selection and Installation of Backflow Preventers".
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (3) and Articles 7.6.2.4. to 7.6.2.6., where a backflow preventer is required by this Subsection, the backflow preventer shall be selected, installed and tested in conformance with CSA B64.10, "Selection and Installation of Backflow Preventers".

ON Full: Piping referred to in Sentence (1) shall be provided with inside and outside shut-off valves.
ON Variations: Piping referred to in Sentence (1) shall be provided with inside and outside shut-off valves.

ON Full: Except as permitted in Sentences (2) to (4), all floor assemblies shall be constructed as fire separations.
ON Variations: Except as permitted in Sentences (2) to (4), all floor assemblies shall be constructed as fire separations.

ON Full: The sides of an excavation in soil or rock may be unsupported where a design is prepared by a person especially qualified in this field of work in conformance with the requirements of Articles 4.2.5.1. and 4.2.5.2.
ON Variations: The sides of an excavation in soil or rock may be unsupported where a design is prepared by a person especially qualified in this field of work in conformance with the requirements of Articles 4.2.5.1. and 4.2.5.2.

ON Full: A mechanical exhaust shall be provided to remove air at the top of an interconnected floor space at the rate of at least six air changes per hour, except that where the volume of the interconnected floor space exceeds 17 000 m3, only four air changes per hour need be provided.
ON Variations: A mechanical exhaust shall be provided to remove air at the top of an interconnected floor space at the rate of at least six air changes per hour, except that where the volume of the interconnected floor space exceeds 17 000 m3, only four air changes per hour need be provided.

ON Full: Every area where food is intended to be processed, prepared or manufactured and where equipment or utensils are intended to be cleaned shall be equipped to provide illumination to a level of not less than 500 lx measured at the floor level.
ON Variations: Every area where food is intended to be processed, prepared or manufactured and where equipment or utensils are intended to be cleaned shall be equipped to provide illumination to a level of not less than 500 lx measured at the floor level.

ON Full: This Subsection applies to the location of buildings, the grading of building sites, the directing of surface water away from building assemblies and the provision of means for drainage.
ON Variations: This Subsection applies to the location of buildings, the grading of building sites, the directing of surface water away from building assemblies and the provision of means for drainage.

ON Full: For a restaurant classified as mercantile occupancy, the number of water closets and lavatories required shall conform to Article 3.7.4.3.
ON Variations: For a restaurant classified as mercantile occupancy, the number of water closets and lavatories required shall conform to Article 3.7.4.3.

ON Full: Every floor or wall mounted water closet bowl shall be securely attached to the floor or wall by means of a flange and shall be stable.
ON Variations: Every floor or wall mounted water closet bowl shall be securely attached to the floor or wall by means of a flange and shall be stable.

ON Full: This Subsection applies to any tank used in a sewage system for collecting, treating, holding or storing sanitary sewage.
ON Variations: This Subsection applies to any tank used in a sewage system for collecting, treating, holding or storing sanitary sewage.

ON Full: Except as permitted in Sentence (3), the principal exhaust fan shall be controlled by a manual switch.
ON Variations: Except as permitted in Sentence (3), the principal exhaust fan shall be controlled by a manual switch.

ON Full: Weep holes spaced not more than 800 mm apart shall be provided at the bottom of,(a) cavities in cavity walls, and (b) cavities or air spaces in masonry veneer walls.
ON Variations: Weep holes spaced not more than 800 mm apart shall be provided at the bottom of,(a) cavities in cavity walls, and (b) cavities or air spaces in masonry veneer walls.

ON Full: Except as permitted by Sentence (3), columns shall be laterally supported,(a) directly, or (b) by connection to the supported members. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Except as permitted by Sentence (3), columns shall be laterally supported,(a) directly, or (b) by connection to the supported members. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (3), 3-way wall switches located at the head and foot of every stairway shall be provided to control at least one lighting outlet with fixture for stairways with four or more risers in a house or an individual dwelling unit.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (3), 3-way wall switches located at the head and foot of every stairway shall be provided to control at least one lighting outlet with fixture for stairways with four or more risers in a house or an individual dwelling unit.

ON Full: Heat recovery ventilators installed in unheated spaces shall be installed so as to avoid condensation of moisture on fans and motors in exhaust air, in accordance with the manufacturer's instructions.
ON Variations: Heat recovery ventilators installed in unheated spaces shall be installed so as to avoid condensation of moisture on fans and motors in exhaust air, in accordance with the manufacturer's instructions.

ON Full: Existing ventilation systems that maintain a negative pressure within the ventilation system with respect to the surroundings are deemed to be in compliance with Article 4.1.7.7.
ON Variations: Existing ventilation systems that maintain a negative pressure within the ventilation system with respect to the surroundings are deemed to be in compliance with Article 4.1.7.7.

ON Full: Every hot water tank of a storage-type service water heater shall be equipped with a temperature relief valve with a temperature sensing element,(a) located within the top 150 mm of the tank, and (b) designed to open and discharge sufficient water from the tank to keep the temperature of the water in the tank from exceeding 99°C under all operating conditions.
ON Variations: Every hot water tank of a storage-type service water heater shall be equipped with a temperature relief valve with a temperature sensing element,(a) located within the top 150 mm of the tank, and (b) designed to open and discharge sufficient water from the tank to keep the temperature of the water in the tank from exceeding 99°C under all operating conditions.

ON Full: A dead end corridor is permitted in a low or medium hazard industrial occupancy where, the dead end corridor, serves an occupant load of not more than 30 persons, is not more than 9 m long, and is provided with doors having self-closing devices, or there is a second and separate egress doorway from each room or suite not leading into a dead end corridor.
ON Variations: A dead end corridor is permitted in a low or medium hazard industrial occupancy where, the dead end corridor, serves an occupant load of not more than 30 persons, is not more than 9 m long, and is provided with doors having self-closing devices, or there is a second and separate egress doorway from each room or suite not leading into a dead end corridor.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentences (2) to (12), the requirements in Section 3.3. shall apply.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentences (2) to (12), the requirements in Section 3.3. shall apply.

ON Full: Overflow pipe sizes for dip tanks shall conform to Table 5.13.3.A.
ON Variations: Overflow pipe sizes for dip tanks shall conform to Table 5.13.3.A.

ON Full: Plastic fixtures shall conform to CSA B45.5 / IAPMO Z124, "Plastic Plumbing Fixtures".
ON Variations: Plastic fixtures shall conform to CSA B45.5 / IAPMO Z124, "Plastic Plumbing Fixtures".

ON Full: This Section applies to floors that are supported on ground or granular fill and that do not provide structural support for the superstructure.
ON Variations: This Section applies to floors that are supported on ground or granular fill and that do not provide structural support for the superstructure.

ON Full: Separate fire compartments required by Sentence (5) need not be provided, if the area intended for the storage of cylinders containing compressed gases that are heavier than air is separated by a concrete or masonry wall having a height of at least 1.5 m and projecting such that the minimum distance that vapour can travel between two cylinders of gas that may react with each other is not less than 15 m, measured horizontally.
ON Variations: Separate fire compartments required by Sentence (5) need not be provided, if the area intended for the storage of cylinders containing compressed gases that are heavier than air is separated by a concrete or masonry wall having a height of at least 1.5 m and projecting such that the minimum distance that vapour can travel between two cylinders of gas that may react with each other is not less than 15 m, measured horizontally.

ON Full: Insulating joints shall be placed in all rails where entering upon the pier or wharf.
ON Variations: Insulating joints shall be placed in all rails where entering upon the pier or wharf.

ON Full: Tank type water closet valves shall be provided with a back-siphonage preventer in conformance with Sentence 7.2.10.10.(2).
ON Variations: Tank type water closet valves shall be provided with a back-siphonage preventer in conformance with Sentence 7.2.10.10.(2).

ON Full: The liquid level in a dip tank shall be kept not less than 150 mm below the top of the tank.
ON Variations: The liquid level in a dip tank shall be kept not less than 150 mm below the top of the tank.

ON Full: Granular material used to drain the bottom of a foundation shall consist of a continuous layer of crushed stone or other coarse clean granular material containing,(a) not more than 10% of material that will pass a 4 mm sieve, and (b) no pyritic material in a concentration that would adversely affect its stability or the performance of assemblies separating dissimilar environments.
ON Variations: Granular material used to drain the bottom of a foundation shall consist of a continuous layer of crushed stone or other coarse clean granular material containing,(a) not more than 10% of material that will pass a 4 mm sieve, and (b) no pyritic material in a concentration that would adversely affect its stability or the performance of assemblies separating dissimilar environments.

ON Full: This Section applies to the design and construction of interior and exterior stairs, steps, ramps, landings, handrails and guards.
ON Variations: This Section applies to the design and construction of interior and exterior stairs, steps, ramps, landings, handrails and guards.

ON Full: Flammable gases shall not be used to inflate balloons.
ON Variations: Flammable gases shall not be used to inflate balloons.

ON Full: Where a door at the top of a stair in a dwelling unit swings away from the stair, no landing is required between the doorway and the stair.
ON Variations: Where a door at the top of a stair in a dwelling unit swings away from the stair, no landing is required between the doorway and the stair.

ON Full: Except in storage garages and repair garages covered by Article 6.2.2.3., the rates at which outdoor air is supplied in buildings by ventilation systems shall be not less than the rates required by ANSI/ASHRAE 62.1, "Ventilation for Acceptable Indoor Air Quality". (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Except in storage garages and repair garages covered by Article 6.2.2.3., the rates at which outdoor air is supplied in buildings by ventilation systems shall be not less than the rates required by ANSI/ASHRAE 62.1, "Ventilation for Acceptable Indoor Air Quality". (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: The performance level of an existing building is reduced where the proposed major occupancy in the building is not separated from the adjoining major occupancies by fire separations having fire-resistance ratings conforming to Tables 3.1.3.1. and 11.4.3.4.B.
ON Variations: The performance level of an existing building is reduced where the proposed major occupancy in the building is not separated from the adjoining major occupancies by fire separations having fire-resistance ratings conforming to Tables 3.1.3.1. and 11.4.3.4.B.

ON Full: Air-supported structures may be designed with interior walls, mezzanines, or similar construction.
ON Variations: Air-supported structures may be designed with interior walls, mezzanines, or similar construction.

ON Full: Exterior areas accessible to vehicular traffic shall be designed for their intended use, including the weight of firefighting equipment, but not for less than the snow and rain loads prescribed in Subsection 4.1.6.
ON Variations: Exterior areas accessible to vehicular traffic shall be designed for their intended use, including the weight of firefighting equipment, but not for less than the snow and rain loads prescribed in Subsection 4.1.6.

ON Full: The building shall be located, the building site shall be graded or surface water shall be directed away from building assemblies so as to,(a) minimize the accumulation of surface water against the building in a manner that does not adversely affect adjacent buildings or properties, or (b) accommodate the accumulation of surface water on the property in a manner that does not adversely affect the building or adjacent buildings or properties.
ON Variations: The building shall be located, the building site shall be graded or surface water shall be directed away from building assemblies so as to,(a) minimize the accumulation of surface water against the building in a manner that does not adversely affect adjacent buildings or properties, or (b) accommodate the accumulation of surface water on the property in a manner that does not adversely affect the building or adjacent buildings or properties.

ON Full: Glass and transparent panels in an exit shall conform to the appropriate requirements of Article 3.3.1.18. for glass and transparent panels in an access to exit.
