ON Full: This Subsection applies to electrostatic spray-coating processes involving the use of flammable liquids or combustible liquids.
ON Variations: This Subsection applies to electrostatic spray-coating processes involving the use of flammable liquids or combustible liquids.

ON Full: In addition to the requirements of Part 6, components of fire emergency systems shall be maintained in accordance with Sentences (2) to (7).
ON Variations: In addition to the requirements of Part 6, components of fire emergency systems shall be maintained in accordance with Sentences (2) to (7).

ON Full: Footings for masonry and concrete fireplaces shall conform to Section 9.15.
ON Variations: Footings for masonry and concrete fireplaces shall conform to Section 9.15.

ON Full: If a building is erected entirely below the adjoining finished ground level and does not extend more than 1 storey below that ground level, the minimum precautions against fire spread and collapse shall be the same as are required for basements under a building of 1 storey in building height having the same occupancy and building area.
ON Variations: If a building is erected entirely below the adjoining finished ground level and does not extend more than 1 storey below that ground level, the minimum precautions against fire spread and collapse shall be the same as are required for basements under a building of 1 storey in building height having the same occupancy and building area.

ON Full: The flame-spread rating of panels required in Clause (2)(c) shall be determined by subjecting a sample panel with an assembled joint typical of field installation to the applicable test described in Subsection 3.1.12.
ON Variations: The flame-spread rating of panels required in Clause (2)(c) shall be determined by subjecting a sample panel with an assembled joint typical of field installation to the applicable test described in Subsection 3.1.12.

ON Full: Floors-on-ground constructed of wood shall conform to CSA S406, "Permanent Wood Foundations for Housing and Small Buildings".
ON Variations: Floors-on-ground constructed of wood shall conform to CSA S406, "Permanent Wood Foundations for Housing and Small Buildings".

ON Full: For all gable roofs, the full and partial load cases defined in Article 4.1.6.3. shall be considered.
ON Variations: For all gable roofs, the full and partial load cases defined in Article 4.1.6.3. shall be considered.

ON Full: Portions of walls over openings in non-loadbearing flat insulating concrete form walls shall have a minimum depth of concrete of not less than 200 mm over the width of the opening.
ON Variations: Portions of walls over openings in non-loadbearing flat insulating concrete form walls shall have a minimum depth of concrete of not less than 200 mm over the width of the opening.

ON Full: Buildings in a camp for housing of workers shall be separated from each other by a distance of not less than 10 m unless otherwise permitted in Subsection 9.10.14.
ON Variations: Buildings in a camp for housing of workers shall be separated from each other by a distance of not less than 10 m unless otherwise permitted in Subsection 9.10.14.

ON Full: Except as permitted in Sentence (4), steel shut-off valves shall be provided at connections to all aboveground storage tanks, on supply piping where it enters buildings or structures, on branch lines from the main supply line, on supply lines at dispensing locations, to isolate one part of a piping system from another, and to isolate meters and air eliminators.
ON Variations: Except as permitted in Sentence (4), steel shut-off valves shall be provided at connections to all aboveground storage tanks, on supply piping where it enters buildings or structures, on branch lines from the main supply line, on supply lines at dispensing locations, to isolate one part of a piping system from another, and to isolate meters and air eliminators.

ON Full: Except as provided in Article 4.3.16.2., the liquid level in any storage tank shall be measured at intervals not greater than seven days in conformance with Sentences (2) to (4), except that at fuel dispensing stations, the measurements shall be taken each day the station is in operation.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Article 4.3.16.2., the liquid level in any storage tank shall be measured at intervals not greater than seven days in conformance with Sentences (2) to (4), except that at fuel dispensing stations, the measurements shall be taken each day the station is in operation.

ON Full: The sides of an excavation in soil or rock shall be supported by a retaining structure conforming with the requirements of Articles 4.2.5.1. and 4.2.5.2., except as permitted in Article 4.2.5.4.
ON Variations: The sides of an excavation in soil or rock shall be supported by a retaining structure conforming with the requirements of Articles 4.2.5.1. and 4.2.5.2., except as permitted in Article 4.2.5.4.

ON Full: The operability of the interconnected system shall be confirmed monthly, by testing at least one smoke alarm using its test function, on a rotational basis.
ON Variations: The operability of the interconnected system shall be confirmed monthly, by testing at least one smoke alarm using its test function, on a rotational basis.

ON Full: The lateral deflections of a structure with supplemental energy dissipation shall be calculated in accordance with Article 4.1.8.22.
ON Variations: The lateral deflections of a structure with supplemental energy dissipation shall be calculated in accordance with Article 4.1.8.22.

ON Full: Electrical equipment shall conform with Subsection 4.1.4.
ON Variations: Electrical equipment shall conform with Subsection 4.1.4.

ON Full: Cylinders containing poisonous compressed gas shall not be stored in a room containing combustible or flammable material.
ON Variations: Cylinders containing poisonous compressed gas shall not be stored in a room containing combustible or flammable material.

ON Full: Provision shall be made for the free flow of air to all rooms by leaving gaps beneath doors, using louvred doors or installing grilles in doors.
ON Variations: Provision shall be made for the free flow of air to all rooms by leaving gaps beneath doors, using louvred doors or installing grilles in doors.

ON Full: Horizontal and vertical strip aluminum siding, including flashing and trim accessories, shall conform to CAN/CGSB-93.2-M, "Prefinished Aluminum Siding, Soffits and Fascia, for Residential Use". (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Horizontal and vertical strip aluminum siding, including flashing and trim accessories, shall conform to CAN/CGSB-93.2-M, "Prefinished Aluminum Siding, Soffits and Fascia, for Residential Use". (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Compliance with the heat transfer performance requirements described in Sentence (1) shall be demonstrated by,(a) compliance with the requirements in Article 9.7.3.3., or (b) design and construction conforming to Part 5.
ON Variations: Compliance with the heat transfer performance requirements described in Sentence (1) shall be demonstrated by,(a) compliance with the requirements in Article 9.7.3.3., or (b) design and construction conforming to Part 5.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (2), a fire alarm system shall be installed,(a) in every building that contains more than 3 storeys, including storeys below the first storey, (b) where the total occupant load exceeds 300, or (c) when the occupant load for any major occupancy in Table 9.10.18.2. is exceeded.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (2), a fire alarm system shall be installed,(a) in every building that contains more than 3 storeys, including storeys below the first storey, (b) where the total occupant load exceeds 300, or (c) when the occupant load for any major occupancy in Table 9.10.18.2. is exceeded.

ON Full: Stainless steel threaded fittings shall be Schedule 40 or greater and shall conform to,(a) ASTM A182 / A182M, "Forged or Rolled Alloy and Stainless Steel Pipe Flanges, Forged Fittings, and Valves and Parts for High-Temperature Service", or (b) ASTM A351 / A351M, "Castings, Austenitic, for Pressure-Containing Parts".
ON Variations: Stainless steel threaded fittings shall be Schedule 40 or greater and shall conform to,(a) ASTM A182 / A182M, "Forged or Rolled Alloy and Stainless Steel Pipe Flanges, Forged Fittings, and Valves and Parts for High-Temperature Service", or (b) ASTM A351 / A351M, "Castings, Austenitic, for Pressure-Containing Parts".

ON Full: If the hydrant barrel is found to contain water because of poor drainage that is impractical to correct, approved measures shall be taken to prevent freezing during winter conditions.
ON Variations: If the hydrant barrel is found to contain water because of poor drainage that is impractical to correct, approved measures shall be taken to prevent freezing during winter conditions.

ON Full: No replacement equipment and devices provided for special fire suppression systems shall be used unless suitable for the installation in which they are to be placed.
ON Variations: No replacement equipment and devices provided for special fire suppression systems shall be used unless suitable for the installation in which they are to be placed.

ON Full: Electric power supply shall be shut off to the premises undergoing fumigation or thermal insecticidal fogging.
ON Variations: Electric power supply shall be shut off to the premises undergoing fumigation or thermal insecticidal fogging.

ON Full: Standpipe hose stations shall be conspicuously identified and unobstructed.
ON Variations: Standpipe hose stations shall be conspicuously identified and unobstructed.

ON Full: Stairs described in Sentence (1), when cantilevered from the foundation wall, shall be constructed and installed in conformance with Subsection 9.8.10.
ON Variations: Stairs described in Sentence (1), when cantilevered from the foundation wall, shall be constructed and installed in conformance with Subsection 9.8.10.

ON Full: The mechanical system in this Article shall include a heat recovery ventilator installed in accordance with Article 9.32.3.11.
ON Variations: The mechanical system in this Article shall include a heat recovery ventilator installed in accordance with ArticleÃ 9.32.3.11.

ON Full: Shingles and shakes shall conform to,(a) CSA O118.1, "Western Red Cedar Shakes and Shingles", or (b) CSA O118.2-M, "Eastern White Cedar Shingles".
ON Variations: Shingles and shakes shall conform to,(a) CSA O118.1, "Western Red Cedar Shakes and Shingles", or (b) CSA O118.2-M, "Eastern White Cedar Shingles".

ON Full: The minimum size of vent stack or stack vent shall be one-half the size of the soil or waste stack at its base.
ON Variations: The minimum size of vent stack or stack vent shall be one-half the size of the soil or waste stack at its base.

ON Full: Where gravity drainage to a sanitary drainage system is possible, a floor drain shall be installed in a basement forming part of a dwelling unit.
ON Variations: Where gravity drainage to a sanitary drainage system is possible, a floor drain shall be installed in a basement forming part of a dwelling unit.

ON Full: The pool lift shall be, designed to be operable without assistance from both the deck and water, and designed so that, when in use, its controls and operating mechanisms are unobstructed.
ON Variations: The pool lift shall be, designed to be operable without assistance from both the deck and water, and designed so that, when in use, its controls and operating mechanisms are unobstructed.

ON Full: If average shear wave velocity,, is not known, Site Class shall be determined from energy-corrected Average Standard Penetration Resistance, , or from soil average undrained shear strength, su, as noted in Table 4.1.8.4.A., and su being calculated based on rational analysis. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: If average shear wave velocity,, is not known, Site Class shall be determined from energy-corrected Average Standard Penetration Resistance, , or from soil average undrained shear strength, su, as noted in Table 4.1.8.4.A., and su being calculated based on rational analysis. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Nonfixed row seating in an assembly occupancy shall be arranged as described in Sentences (2) to (8).
ON Variations: Nonfixed row seating in an assembly occupancy shall be arranged as described in Sentences (2) to (8).

ON Full: Sentence (1) does not apply in a Group C occupancy where the new total occupant load is,(a) 14 persons or fewer in a boarding, lodging or rooming house, except that where the occupant load is between 10 and 15 persons, an interconnected system of smoke alarms in corridors near stairways is required, or (b) 16 persons or fewer in a building containing residential suites which are dwelling units, except that where the occupant load is between 10 and 17 persons, an interconnected system of smoke alarms in corridors near stairways is required.
ON Variations: Sentence (1) does not apply in a Group C occupancy where the new total occupant load is,(a) 14 persons or fewer in a boarding, lodging or rooming house, except that where the occupant load is between 10 and 15 persons, an interconnected system of smoke alarms in corridors near stairways is required, or (b) 16 persons or fewer in a building containing residential suites which are dwelling units, except that where the occupant load is between 10 and 17 persons, an interconnected system of smoke alarms in corridors near stairways is required.

ON Full: Smoking shall not take place in, on or near a building under demolition, except as provided in Subsection 2.4.3.
ON Variations: Smoking shall not take place in, on or near a building under demolition, except as provided in Subsection 2.4.3.

ON Full: Where there are conflicts between this Part and the regulations made under the Excise Act (Canada) with regard to security of the product and measurement methods, the Excise Act (Canada) shall prevail.
ON Variations: Where there are conflicts between this Part and the regulations made under the Excise Act (Canada) with regard to security of the product and measurement methods, the Excise Act (Canada) shall prevail.

ON Full: Pumps for flammable liquid or combustible liquid piping systems installed aboveground and outside of buildings shall be located not less than 3 m from the property line, and 1.5 m from building openings.
ON Variations: Pumps for flammable liquid or combustible liquid piping systems installed aboveground and outside of buildings shall be located not less than 3 m from the property line, and 1.5 m from building openings.

ON Full: Every interceptor shall be designed so that it can be readily cleaned.
ON Variations: Every interceptor shall be designed so that it can be readily cleaned.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (4), roof rafters and joists shall be supported at the ridge of the roof by,(a) a loadbearing wall extending from the ridge to suitable bearing, or (b) a ridge beam supported by not less than 89 mm length of bearing.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (4), roof rafters and joists shall be supported at the ridge of the roof by,(a) a loadbearing wall extending from the ridge to suitable bearing, or (b) a ridge beam supported by not less than 89 mm length of bearing.

ON Full: The flame-spread rating of interior wall and ceiling finishes for a bathroom in a suite of residential occupancy shall be not more than 200.
ON Variations: The flame-spread rating of interior wall and ceiling finishes for a bathroom in a suite of residential occupancy shall be not more than 200.

ON Full: An exit door serving a Group B, Division 1 occupancy, or an impeded egress zone in other occupancies, is permitted to be a sliding door that does not conform to Sentence 3.3.1.11.(1) provided it is designed to be released in conformance with Article 3.3.1.12.
ON Variations: An exit door serving a Group B, Division 1 occupancy, or an impeded egress zone in other occupancies, is permitted to be a sliding door that does not conform to Sentence 3.3.1.11.(1) provided it is designed to be released in conformance with Article 3.3.1.12.

ON Full: A soil or waste pipe having a hydraulic load not greater than six fixture units may act as a relief vent for a branch that is being circuit vented.
ON Variations: A soil or waste pipe having a hydraulic load not greater than six fixture units may act as a relief vent for a branch that is being circuit vented.

ON Full: The first 2.5 m of hot water outlet piping of a hot water storage tank serving a non-recirculating system shall be insulated to provide a thermal resistance of not less than RSI 0.62.
ON Variations: The first 2.5 m of hot water outlet piping of a hot water storage tank serving a non-recirculating system shall be insulated to provide a thermal resistance of not less than RSI 0.62.

ON Full: Except as permitted in Sentence (2), duct penetration of fire separations separating exits from the remainder of the building shall be in accordance with Article 3.4.4.4.
ON Variations: Except as permitted in Sentence (2), duct penetration of fire separations separating exits from the remainder of the building shall be in accordance with Article 3.4.4.4.

ON Full: Surface drainage shall be directed away from the location of a water supply well or leaching bed.
ON Variations: Surface drainage shall be directed away from the location of a water supply well or leaching bed.

ON Full: Every septic tank shall be constructed in such a manner that any sanitary sewage flowing through the tank will pass through at least 2 compartments.
ON Variations: Every septic tank shall be constructed in such a manner that any sanitary sewage flowing through the tank will pass through at least 2 compartments.

ON Full: In kitchens containing commercial cooking equipment used in processes producing grease-laden vapours, the equipment shall be designed and installed in conformance with Part 6. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: In kitchens containing commercial cooking equipment used in processes producing grease-laden vapours, the equipment shall be designed and installed in conformance with Part 6. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Glass blocks permitted by Sentence (1) shall be installed in accordance with Subsection 4.3.2. and reinforced with steel reinforcement in each horizontal joint.
ON Variations: Glass blocks permitted by Sentence (1) shall be installed in accordance with Subsection 4.3.2. and reinforced with steel reinforcement in each horizontal joint.

ON Full: Aboveground outdoor piping shall not be located on the exterior of walls except on those of noncombustible construction, or above windows and doors.
ON Variations: Aboveground outdoor piping shall not be located on the exterior of walls except on those of noncombustible construction, or above windows and doors.

ON Full: Portable extinguishers required in this Part shall be in accordance with Section 6.2.
ON Variations: Portable extinguishers required in this Part shall be in accordance with Section 6.2.

ON Full: Ramps in a barrier-free path of travel shall conform to the requirements in Article 3.8.3.4.
ON Variations: Ramps in a barrier-free path of travel shall conform to the requirements in Article 3.8.3.4.

ON Full: Doors forming part of an exit or a public means of egress shall conform to Subsection 9.9.6. in addition to this Subsection.
ON Variations: Doors forming part of an exit or a public means of egress shall conform to Subsection 9.9.6. in addition to this Subsection.

ON Full: Crawl spaces shall be considered to be heated where the space,(a) is used as a warm air plenum, (b) contains heating ducts or heating pipes that are not sealed and insulated to minimize heat loss to the space, or (c) is not separated from heated space in accordance with Section 9.25.
ON Variations: Crawl spaces shall be considered to be heated where the space,(a) is used as a warm air plenum, (b) contains heating ducts or heating pipes that are not sealed and insulated to minimize heat loss to the space, or (c) is not separated from heated space in accordance with Section 9.25.

ON Full: Where the specified live load for a floor is reduced in accordance with Sentence (2) or (3), the structural drawings shall indicate that a live load reduction factor for tributary area has been applied.
ON Variations: Where the specified live load for a floor is reduced in accordance with Sentence (2) or (3), the structural drawings shall indicate that a live load reduction factor for tributary area has been applied.

ON Full: A platform in an aisle shall be level, except that a slope not more than 1 in 50 is permitted for a platform that is not less than 430 mm deep in the direction of exit travel.
ON Variations: A platform in an aisle shall be level, except that a slope not more than 1 in 50 is permitted for a platform that is not less than 430 mm deep in the direction of exit travel.

ON Full: A deep foundation unit shall provide support for a building by transferring loads by end-bearing to a competent stratum at considerable depth below the structure, or by mobilizing resistance by adhesion or friction, or both, in the soil or rock in which it is placed. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: A deep foundation unit shall provide support for a building by transferring loads by end-bearing to a competent stratum at considerable depth below the structure, or by mobilizing resistance by adhesion or friction, or both, in the soil or rock in which it is placed. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Where pipes for exhaust gases from emergency power systems penetrate required fire separations, they shall be enclosed in a separate service space having a fire-resistance rating equal to that of the penetrated floor assembly, but not less than 45 min.
ON Variations: Where pipes for exhaust gases from emergency power systems penetrate required fire separations, they shall be enclosed in a separate service space having a fire-resistance rating equal to that of the penetrated floor assembly, but not less than 45 min.

ON Full: If the building is less than 84 m high, measured between grade and the ceiling level of the top storey, the water supply required in Sentence (1) is permitted to be supplied through the fire department connection.
ON Variations: If the building is less than 84 m high, measured between grade and the ceiling level of the top storey, the water supply required in Sentence (1) is permitted to be supplied through the fire department connection.

ON Full: Outdoor air intakes and exhaust outlets on the exterior of buildings shall be designed or located so that the air entering the building system will not contain more contaminants than the normal exterior air of the locality in which the building is situated.
ON Variations: Outdoor air intakes and exhaust outlets on the exterior of buildings shall be designed or located so that the air entering the building system will not contain more contaminants than the normal exterior air of the locality in which the building is situated.

ON Full: Building frames shall be anchored to the foundation unless a structural analysis of wind and earth pressures shows anchorage is not required.
ON Variations: Building frames shall be anchored to the foundation unless a structural analysis of wind and earth pressures shows anchorage is not required.

ON Full: The values of storey shears, storey forces, member forces, and deflections for the design of all structural framing elements and all supplemental energy dissipation devices shall be obtained from analysis conforming to Sentence 4.1.8.21.(4) using one of the following values, whichever produces the most critical effect: (a) mean plus IE times the standard deviation of the results of all Non-Linear Dynamic Analyses, or (b) times the mean of the results of all Non-Linear Dynamic Analyses.
ON Variations: The values of storey shears, storey forces, member forces, and deflections for the design of all structural framing elements and all supplemental energy dissipation devices shall be obtained from analysis conforming to Sentence 4.1.8.21.(4) using one of the following values, whichever produces the most critical effect: (a) mean plus IE times the standard deviation of the results of all Non-Linear Dynamic Analyses, or (b) times the mean of the results of all Non-Linear Dynamic Analyses.

ON Full: For single-layer application on walls, where gypsum board is required to provide bracing, lateral support or fire protection, nails shall be spaced not more than 200 mm o.c. on,(a) vertical wall supports, and (b) top and bottom plates.
ON Variations: For single-layer application on walls, where gypsum board is required to provide bracing, lateral support or fire protection, nails shall be spaced not more than 200 mm o.c. on,(a) vertical wall supports, and (b) top and bottom plates.

ON Full: Drainage piping, vent piping and fittings made of cast iron shall be certified to CAN/CSA-B70, "Cast Iron Soil Pipe, Fittings and Means of Joining".
ON Variations: Drainage piping, vent piping and fittings made of cast iron shall be certified to CAN/CSA-B70, "Cast Iron Soil Pipe, Fittings and Means of Joining".

ON Full: The water level in the fire pump reservoir shall be checked weekly.
ON Variations: The water level in the fire pump reservoir shall be checked weekly.

ON Full: Extinguishing agent containers provided for special fire suppression systems shall be fully charged with the proper quantity of extinguishing agent and the necessary operating pressure maintained.
ON Variations: Extinguishing agent containers provided for special fire suppression systems shall be fully charged with the proper quantity of extinguishing agent and the necessary operating pressure maintained.

ON Full: Except as permitted in Sentence (8), the water depth in a public pool shall be at least 1 350 mm at the horizontal arc having a radius of 9 m measured from any point on the front end of the diving board or diving platform and intersecting the vertical projections of the walls of the pool.
ON Variations: Except as permitted in Sentence (8), the water depth in a public pool shall be at least 1 350 mm at the horizontal arc having a radius of 9 m measured from any point on the front end of the diving board or diving platform and intersecting the vertical projections of the walls of the pool.

ON Full: An exterior sign shall not be located so as to overhang a sidewalk or other pedestrian walkway unless the vertical distance, measured from the bottom of the overhanging portion of the sign to the surface of the sidewalk, is at least 2 400 mm.
ON Variations: An exterior sign shall not be located so as to overhang a sidewalk or other pedestrian walkway unless the vertical distance, measured from the bottom of the overhanging portion of the sign to the surface of the sidewalk, is at least 2 400 mm.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (3), a compliance alternative to a requirement contained in Part 9 or 12 shown in Tables 11.5.1.1.C., 11.5.1.1.D/E. or 11.5.1.1.F. may be substituted for the requirement without satisfying the chief building official that the requirement is impracticable.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (3), a compliance alternative to a requirement contained in Part 9 or 12 shown in Tables 11.5.1.1.C., 11.5.1.1.D/E. or 11.5.1.1.F. may be substituted for the requirement without satisfying the chief building official that the requirement is impracticable.

ON Full: Subject to Article 5.12.4.3., a clearance of 457 mm shall be maintained between unprotected combustible materials and ducts venting spray booths and spray rooms.
ON Variations: Subject to Article 5.12.4.3., a clearance of 457 mm shall be maintained between unprotected combustible materials and ducts venting spray booths and spray rooms.

ON Full: Spraying areas shall be located in rooms protected by listed and labelled automatic fixed extinguishing equipment.
ON Variations: Spraying areas shall be located in rooms protected by listed and labelled automatic fixed extinguishing equipment.

ON Full: Where multiple tanks are to be used to meet the requirements of Sentences (2) and (3), the tanks shall be connected in series such that,(a) the first tank in the series shall have at least a capacity as calculated in Clause (3)(a), however at no time shall a tank having a working capacity of less than 3 600 L be used, (b) all additional tanks after the first tank, excluding pump or dosing tanks shall have at least a working capacity equal to the volume required by Clause (3)(b), (c) the pipe between the outlet of one tank and the inlet of the next tank in the series shall have a minimum slope of 2 percent, (d) there shall be no partitions in the tank except where a partition is required to maintain the structural integrity of the tank, in which case openings within the partition shall be provided to allow the free movement of sanitary sewage throughout the tank, and (e) all piping between tanks shall be continuous and shall be connected to the tank through the use of flexible watertight seals that will permit differential movement between the tanks.
ON Variations: Where multiple tanks are to be used to meet the requirements of Sentences (2) and (3), the tanks shall be connected in series such that,(a) the first tank in the series shall have at least a capacity as calculated in Clause (3)(a), however at no time shall a tank having a working capacity of less than 3 600 L be used, (b) all additional tanks after the first tank, excluding pump or dosing tanks shall have at least a working capacity equal to the volume required by Clause (3)(b), (c) the pipe between the outlet of one tank and the inlet of the next tank in the series shall have a minimum slope of 2 percent, (d) there shall be no partitions in the tank except where a partition is required to maintain the structural integrity of the tank, in which case openings within the partition shall be provided to allow the free movement of sanitary sewage throughout the tank, and (e) all piping between tanks shall be continuous and shall be connected to the tank through the use of flexible watertight seals that will permit differential movement between the tanks.

ON Full: Peat and humus are not acceptable materials for compacted earth cover in Sentence (1).
ON Variations: Peat and humus are not acceptable materials for compacted earth cover in Sentence (1).

ON Full: This Subsection applies to roll-coating processes in which flammable liquids or combustible liquids are applied to products or materials by bringing them into contact with a roller that is coated with the coating liquid.
ON Variations: This Subsection applies to roll-coating processes in which flammable liquids or combustible liquids are applied to products or materials by bringing them into contact with a roller that is coated with the coating liquid.

ON Full: The net wind load for the building as a whole shall be the algebraic difference of the loads on the windward and the leeward surfaces, and in some cases may be calculated as the sum of the products of the external pressures or suctions and the areas of the surfaces over which they are averaged as provided in Sentence (1).
ON Variations: The net wind load for the building as a whole shall be the algebraic difference of the loads on the windward and the leeward surfaces, and in some cases may be calculated as the sum of the products of the external pressures or suctions and the areas of the surfaces over which they are averaged as provided in Sentence (1).

ON Full: A retail food premises is exempt from compliance with this Article if its eating and drinking area does not exceed 56 m2 and any one or more of the following applies: it is designed to sell only cold drinks in or from the original container, it is designed to sell only frozen confections in the original package or wrapper, it is designed to prepare and sell only hot beverages, it is designed to prepare and sell only popped corn, roasted nuts or french-fried potatoes, it is designed to sell only food or drink for human consumption that, is pre-packaged at a premises other than the food premises at which it is being offered for sale, and is not capable of supporting the growth of pathogenic organisms or the production of the toxins of such organisms.
ON Variations: A retail food premises is exempt from compliance with this Article if its eating and drinking area does not exceed 56 m2 and any one or more of the following applies: it is designed to sell only cold drinks in or from the original container, it is designed to sell only frozen confections in the original package or wrapper, it is designed to prepare and sell only hot beverages, it is designed to prepare and sell only popped corn, roasted nuts or french-fried potatoes, it is designed to sell only food or drink for human consumption that, is pre-packaged at a premises other than the food premises at which it is being offered for sale, and is not capable of supporting the growth of pathogenic organisms or the production of the toxins of such organisms.

ON Full: A carbon monoxide alarm that is installed adjacent to a sleeping area shall be equipped with an alarm that is audible throughout the sleeping area, even if any doors between the carbon monoxide alarm and any parts of the sleeping area are closed.
ON Variations: A carbon monoxide alarm that is installed adjacent to a sleeping area shall be equipped with an alarm that is audible throughout the sleeping area, even if any doors between the carbon monoxide alarm and any parts of the sleeping area are closed.

ON Full: Individual combustible skylights in a corridor that is required to be separated from the remainder of the storey by a fire separation shall be not more than 1 m2 in area and not less than 1.2 m apart.
ON Variations: Individual combustible skylights in a corridor that is required to be separated from the remainder of the storey by a fire separation shall be not more than 1 m2 in area and not less than 1.2 m apart.

ON Full: Except as permitted by Sentence (3), a walkway connected to a building required to be of noncombustible construction shall also be of noncombustible construction.
ON Variations: Except as permitted by Sentence (3), a walkway connected to a building required to be of noncombustible construction shall also be of noncombustible construction.

ON Full: Where an emergency power supply is supplied by a generator, it shall supply at least one emergency power receptacle in at least one of the suites having a barrier-free path of travel required by Sentence (1). (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Where an emergency power supply is supplied by a generator, it shall supply at least one emergency power receptacle in at least one of the suites having a barrier-free path of travel required by Sentence (1). (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Except as permitted by Sentence (2), the ventilation required by Article 6.2.2.1. shall be provided by mechanical ventilation except that it can be provided by natural ventilation or a combination of natural and mechanical ventilation in,(a) buildings of other than residential occupancy having an occupant load of not more than one person per 40 m² during normal use, (b) buildings of industrial occupancy where the nature of the process contained in them permits or requires the use of large openings in the building envelope even during the winter, or (c) seasonal buildings not intended to be occupied during the winter.
ON Variations: Except as permitted by Sentence (2), the ventilation required by Article 6.2.2.1. shall be provided by mechanical ventilation except that it can be provided by natural ventilation or a combination of natural and mechanical ventilation in,(a) buildings of other than residential occupancy having an occupant load of not more than one person per 40 m² during normal use, (b) buildings of industrial occupancy where the nature of the process contained in them permits or requires the use of large openings in the building envelope even during the winter, or (c) seasonal buildings not intended to be occupied during the winter.

ON Full: Where proposed construction will result in a change of use described in Subclauses 3.17.1.1.(1)(a)(i) to (iv) and (vi), additional construction shall be required in order that the building or part of a building subject to the change of use conforms to the requirements of Subsection 3.2.6. and Sections 3.7., 3.11. and 3.12. as they apply to the new major occupancy that the building or part of a building is to support.
ON Variations: Where proposed construction will result in a change of use described in Subclauses 3.17.1.1.(1)(a)(i) to (iv) and (vi), additional construction shall be required in order that the building or part of a building subject to the change of use conforms to the requirements of Subsection 3.2.6. and Sections 3.7., 3.11. and 3.12. as they apply to the new major occupancy that the building or part of a building is to support.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (2), nailing of framing shall conform to Table 9.23.3.4.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (2), nailing of framing shall conform to Table 9.23.3.4.

ON Full: A door in a fire separation is permitted to be equipped with pivot hinges in conformance with NFPA 80, "Fire Doors and Other Opening Protectives".
ON Variations: A door in a fire separation is permitted to be equipped with pivot hinges in conformance with NFPA 80, "Fire Doors and Other Opening Protectives".

ON Full: Sentence (2) does not apply to a tank that is an integral part of a prefabricated Class 1 sewage system.
ON Variations: Sentence (2) does not apply to a tank that is an integral part of a prefabricated Class 1 sewage system.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentences 11.4.2.5.(2) and (3), the performance level of an existing building is reduced where proposed construction will increase the occupant load of an existing building by more than 15%.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentences 11.4.2.5.(2) and (3), the performance level of an existing building is reduced where proposed construction will increase the occupant load of an existing building by more than 15%.

ON Full: A grease interceptor shall be located as close as possible to the fixture or fixtures it serves.
ON Variations: A grease interceptor shall be located as close as possible to the fixture or fixtures it serves.

ON Full: Except for Eastern-Style toilets, where a water closet is installed in a washroom for public use it shall be of the elongated type and provided with a seat of the open front type.
ON Variations: Except for Eastern-Style toilets, where a water closet is installed in a washroom for public use it shall be of the elongated type and provided with a seat of the open front type.

ON Full: For the design of cladding and secondary structural members, one of the following procedures shall be used to determine the specified wind loads: (a) the Static Procedure described in Article 4.1.7.3., or (b) the Wind Tunnel Procedure described in Article 4.1.7.12.
ON Variations: For the design of cladding and secondary structural members, one of the following procedures shall be used to determine the specified wind loads: (a) the Static Procedure described in Article 4.1.7.3., or (b) the Wind Tunnel Procedure described in Article 4.1.7.12.

ON Full: A building classified as Group A, Division 2 occupancy that is not more than 1 storey in building height, and in which the building area is not more than 3 200 m2 if not sprinklered, or 6 400 m2 if sprinklered, is permitted to be constructed with a roof of heavy timber construction and have columns of heavy timber construction.
ON Variations: A building classified as Group A, Division 2 occupancy that is not more than 1 storey in building height, and in which the building area is not more than 3 200 m2 if not sprinklered, or 6 400 m2 if sprinklered, is permitted to be constructed with a roof of heavy timber construction and have columns of heavy timber construction.

ON Full: (15) A ramp shall have handrails on both sides.
ON Variations: (15) A ramp shall have handrails on both sides.

ON Full: Electrical components, including transformers, power packs and control equipment for the electrostatic removal of excess coating material (detearing), shall be located in an area where the vapour concentration of flammable liquids or combustible liquids cannot exceed 25% of the lower explosive limit.
ON Variations: Electrical components, including transformers, power packs and control equipment for the electrostatic removal of excess coating material (detearing), shall be located in an area where the vapour concentration of flammable liquids or combustible liquids cannot exceed 25% of the lower explosive limit.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (2), the number of water closets required for business and personal services occupancies shall conform to Table 3.7.4.7.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (2), the number of water closets required for business and personal services occupancies shall conform to Table 3.7.4.7.

ON Full: Fire compartments referred to in this Subsection shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 2 h.
ON Variations: Fire compartments referred to in this Subsection shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 2 h.

ON Full: The ground cover required in Sentence (1) shall,(a) have its joints lapped not less than 300 mm, and sealed and weighted down, or (b) be covered with a concrete skim coat not less than 50 mm thick.
ON Variations: The ground cover required in Sentence (1) shall,(a) have its joints lapped not less than 300 mm, and sealed and weighted down, or (b) be covered with a concrete skim coat not less than 50 mm thick.

ON Full: Where the top of a foundation wall is reduced in thickness to permit the installation of a masonry exterior facing, the reduced section shall be,(a) not less than 90 mm thick, and (b) tied to the facing material with metal ties conforming to Sentence 9.20.9.4.(3) spaced not more than, (i) 200 mm o.c. vertically, and (ii) 900 mm o.c. horizontally.
ON Variations: Where the top of a foundation wall is reduced in thickness to permit the installation of a masonry exterior facing, the reduced section shall be,(a) not less than 90 mm thick, and (b) tied to the facing material with metal ties conforming to Sentence 9.20.9.4.(3) spaced not more than, (i) 200 mm o.c. vertically, and (ii) 900 mm o.c. horizontally.

ON Full: Where a building component or assembly separates interior conditioned space from exterior space, interior space from the ground, or environmentally dissimilar interior spaces, the properties and position of the materials and components in those components or assemblies shall be such that they control air leakage or permit venting to the exterior so as to,(a) provide acceptable conditions for the building occupants, (b) maintain appropriate conditions for the intended use of the building, (c) minimize the accumulation of condensation in and penetration of precipitation into the building component or assembly, (d) control heat transfer to roofs where ice damming can occur, and (e) not compromise the operation of building services.
ON Variations: Where a building component or assembly separates interior conditioned space from exterior space, interior space from the ground, or environmentally dissimilar interior spaces, the properties and position of the materials and components in those components or assemblies shall be such that they control air leakage or permit venting to the exterior so as to,(a) provide acceptable conditions for the building occupants, (b) maintain appropriate conditions for the intended use of the building, (c) minimize the accumulation of condensation in and penetration of precipitation into the building component or assembly, (d) control heat transfer to roofs where ice damming can occur, and (e) not compromise the operation of building services.

ON Full: Where gravity drainage to a sanitary drainage system is not possible, the floor drain required by Sentence (1) may be connected to a storm drainage system, dry well or drainage ditch provided it is located where it can receive only clear water waste or storm sewage.
ON Variations: Where gravity drainage to a sanitary drainage system is not possible, the floor drain required by Sentence (1) may be connected to a storm drainage system, dry well or drainage ditch provided it is located where it can receive only clear water waste or storm sewage.

ON Full: A trap need not be protected by a vent pipe,(a) where it serves, (i) a subsoil drainage pipe, or (ii) a storm drainage system, or (b) where it forms part of an indirect drainage system.
ON Variations: A trap need not be protected by a vent pipe,(a) where it serves, (i) a subsoil drainage pipe, or (ii) a storm drainage system, or (b) where it forms part of an indirect drainage system.

ON Full: The trap seal depth on fixtures draining to an acid waste system shall be a minimum of 50 mm.
ON Variations: The trap seal depth on fixtures draining to an acid waste system shall be a minimum of 50 mm.

ON Full: Where a lift-gate is incorporated along an egress route, a maximum of two lift-gates may be within a single egress route, each lift-gate shall be equipped with a positive lock when open, and it shall be designed to automatically stop the conveyor belt that it serves when the lift-gate is open.
ON Variations: Where a lift-gate is incorporated along an egress route, a maximum of two lift-gates may be within a single egress route, each lift-gate shall be equipped with a positive lock when open, and it shall be designed to automatically stop the conveyor belt that it serves when the lift-gate is open.

ON Full: A leaching bed shall be designed to be protected from compaction or any stress or pressure that may result in, (a) the impairment or destruction of any pipe in the leaching bed, or (b) the smearing of the soil or leaching bed fill.
ON Variations: A leaching bed shall be designed to be protected from compaction or any stress or pressure that may result in, (a) the impairment or destruction of any pipe in the leaching bed, or (b) the smearing of the soil or leaching bed fill.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (6), openings through any guard that is required by Sentence (1) shall be of a size that will prevent the passage of a sphere having a diameter more than 100 mm unless it can be shown that the location and size of openings that exceed this limit do not represent a hazard.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (6), openings through any guard that is required by Sentence (1) shall be of a size that will prevent the passage of a sphere having a diameter more than 100 mm unless it can be shown that the location and size of openings that exceed this limit do not represent a hazard.

ON Full: Leaks or defects found in hot work equipment shall be repaired prior to use.
ON Variations: Leaks or defects found in hot work equipment shall be repaired prior to use.

ON Full: Where a portable extinguisher is tested, a label shall be fixed to the extinguisher after testing that indicates the month and year the hydrostatic pressure test was performed, the test pressure used and the name of the person or agency performing the test.
ON Variations: Where a portable extinguisher is tested, a label shall be fixed to the extinguisher after testing that indicates the month and year the hydrostatic pressure test was performed, the test pressure used and the name of the person or agency performing the test.

ON Full: Where earthquake effects can produce forces in a column or wall due to lateral loading along both orthogonal axes, account shall be taken of the effects of potential concurrent yielding of other elements framing into the column or wall from all directions at the level under consideration and as appropriate at other levels. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Where earthquake effects can produce forces in a column or wall due to lateral loading along both orthogonal axes, account shall be taken of the effects of potential concurrent yielding of other elements framing into the column or wall from all directions at the level under consideration and as appropriate at other levels. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: No person shall disable a carbon monoxide alarm.
ON Variations: No person shall disable a carbon monoxide alarm.

ON Full: Cylinders containing compressed gas shall be stored in areas where the ambient air temperature does not exceed 52°C.
ON Variations: Cylinders containing compressed gas shall be stored in areas where the ambient air temperature does not exceed 52°C.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (5), openings in a wall having a limiting distance of less than 1.2 m shall be protected by closures, of other than wired glass or glass block, whose fire-protection rating is in conformance with the fire-resistance rating required for the wall.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (5), openings in a wall having a limiting distance of less than 1.2 m shall be protected by closures, of other than wired glass or glass block, whose fire-protection rating is in conformance with the fire-resistance rating required for the wall.

ON Full: Where a crawl space is heated, a ground cover consisting of not less than 0.15 mm polyethylene sheet conforming to CAN/CGSB-51.34-M, "Vapour Barrier, Polyethylene Sheet, for Use in Building Construction", shall be installed as part of an air barrier system in accordance with Subsection 9.25.3.
ON Variations: Where a crawl space is heated, a ground cover consisting of not less than 0.15 mm polyethylene sheet conforming to CAN/CGSB-51.34-M, "Vapour Barrier, Polyethylene Sheet, for Use in Building Construction", shall be installed as part of an air barrier system in accordance with Subsection 9.25.3.

ON Full: Except as otherwise required by this Part or as permitted by Sentence (4), a public corridor shall be separated from the remainder of the storey by a fire separation. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Except as otherwise required by this Part or as permitted by Sentence (4), a public corridor shall be separated from the remainder of the storey by a fire separation. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: (2) The building referred to in Sentence (1) is permitted to be of combustible construction or noncombustible construction used singly or in combination, and, except as permitted by Sentences (3) and (4), floor assemblies shall be fire separations with a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min, mezzanines shall have, if of combustible construction, a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min, and loadbearing walls, columns and arches shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the supported assembly.
ON Variations: (2) The building referred to in Sentence (1) is permitted to be of combustible construction or noncombustible construction used singly or in combination, and, except as permitted by Sentences (3) and (4), floor assemblies shall be fire separations with a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min, mezzanines shall have, if of combustible construction, a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min, and loadbearing walls, columns and arches shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the supported assembly.

ON Full: A doorway between an attached or built-in garage and the house or the individual dwelling unit it serves shall not be located in a room intended for sleeping.
ON Variations: A doorway between an attached or built-in garage and the house or the individual dwelling unit it serves shall not be located in a room intended for sleeping.

ON Full: Dressing and locker room floors shall have non-slip surfaces that permit convenient and thorough cleaning and disinfecting.
ON Variations: Dressing and locker room floors shall have non-slip surfaces that permit convenient and thorough cleaning and disinfecting.

ON Full: Glass used in buildings shall be designed in conformance with, (a) CAN/CGSB-12.20-M, "Structural Design of Glass for Buildings", using an adjustment factor on the wind load, W, of not less than 0.75, or (b) ASTM E1300, "Determining Load Resistance of Glass in Buildings", using an adjustment factor on the wind load, W, of not less than 1.0. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Glass used in buildings shall be designed in conformance with, (a) CAN/CGSB-12.20-M, "Structural Design of Glass for Buildings", using an adjustment factor on the wind load, W, of not less than 0.75, or (b) ASTM E1300, "Determining Load Resistance of Glass in Buildings", using an adjustment factor on the wind load, W, of not less than 1.0. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Deep foundation units shall be installed in such a manner as not to impair, (a) the strength of the deep foundation units and the properties of the soil or rock on or in which they are placed beyond the calculated or anticipated limits, (b) the integrity of previously installed deep foundation units, or (c) the integrity of neighbouring buildings.
ON Variations: Deep foundation units shall be installed in such a manner as not to impair, (a) the strength of the deep foundation units and the properties of the soil or rock on or in which they are placed beyond the calculated or anticipated limits, (b) the integrity of previously installed deep foundation units, or (c) the integrity of neighbouring buildings.

ON Full: Illuminated signs conforming to Sentence 3.4.5.1.(2) or (7) shall be provided to indicate the direction to egress points in a service space referred to in Sentence 3.2.1.1.(9).
ON Variations: Illuminated signs conforming to Sentence 3.4.5.1.(2) or (7) shall be provided to indicate the direction to egress points in a service space referred to in Sentence 3.2.1.1.(9).

ON Full: The top layer of roofing required in Sentence (4) shall consist of not less than Type M mineral surface roll roofing (mineral surface up), 914 mm wide, centred in the valley, applied over a 100 mm wide strip of cement along each edge of the bottom layer, and fastened with a sufficient number of nails to hold it in place until the shingles are applied.
ON Variations: The top layer of roofing required in Sentence (4) shall consist of not less than Type M mineral surface roll roofing (mineral surface up), 914 mm wide, centred in the valley, applied over a 100 mm wide strip of cement along each edge of the bottom layer, and fastened with a sufficient number of nails to hold it in place until the shingles are applied.

ON Full: Platform and walkway levels shall not be of open construction.
ON Variations: Platform and walkway levels shall not be of open construction.

ON Full: Connections for all openings in storage tanks in buildings shall be liquid and vapour tight.
ON Variations: Connections for all openings in storage tanks in buildings shall be liquid and vapour tight.

ON Full: Emergency lighting shall conform to Subsection 9.9.12.
ON Variations: Emergency lighting shall conform to Subsection 9.9.12.

ON Full: The air admittance valves shall be located,(a) above the flood level rim of the fixture it serves, (b) within the maximum developed length permitted for the vent, (c) not less than 150 mm above insulation materials, and (d) installed in a location not subject to back pressure.
ON Variations: The air admittance valves shall be located,(a) above the flood level rim of the fixture it serves, (b) within the maximum developed length permitted for the vent, (c) not less than 150 mm above insulation materials, and (d) installed in a location not subject to back pressure.

ON Full: For a rapid transit station, the required aggregate egress capacity from each platform shall be determined by dividing the platform occupant load det--------------------ermined in accordance with Sentences 3.13.4.1.(2) to (6) by the required platform clearance time determined in accordance with Sentence (3).
ON Variations: For a rapid transit station, the required aggregate egress capacity from each platform shall be determined by dividing the platform occupant load det--------------------ermined in accordance with Sentences 3.13.4.1.(2) to (6) by the required platform clearance time determined in accordance with Sentence (3).

ON Full: Where a water test is made, all joints shall be tested with a water column of not less than 3 m.
ON Variations: Where a water test is made, all joints shall be tested with a water column of not less than 3 m.

ON Full: The leaching bed fill that is added shall be compacted in layers in such a manner as to avoid uneven settlement of the distribution pipes or leaching chambers.
ON Variations: The leaching bed fill that is added shall be compacted in layers in such a manner as to avoid uneven settlement of the distribution pipes or leaching chambers.

ON Full: Fixtures with fixture outlet pipes less than 2 in. in size shall be separately vented or separately circuit vented.
ON Variations: Fixtures with fixture outlet pipes less than 2 in. in size shall be separately vented or separately circuit vented.

ON Full: The water velocity in a suction pipe shall not exceed 1.8 m/s.
ON Variations: The water velocity in a suction pipe shall not exceed 1.8 m/s.

ON Full: Where a storm drainage system is not available or soil conditions prevent drainage to a culvert or dry well, a foundation drain or subsoil drainage pipe may connect to a sanitary drainage system.
ON Variations: Where a storm drainage system is not available or soil conditions prevent drainage to a culvert or dry well, a foundation drain or subsoil drainage pipe may connect to a sanitary drainage system.

ON Full: Except as permitted in Sentence (3), no drainage pipe that is of minimum size required by this Part for the purpose for which it is installed shall be so connected as to drain to other drainage pipe of lesser size.
ON Variations: Except as permitted in Sentence (3), no drainage pipe that is of minimum size required by this Part for the purpose for which it is installed shall be so connected as to drain to other drainage pipe of lesser size.

ON Full: Ventilation required in Sentence (1) shall be sufficient to ensure that flammable vapour concentrations outside the zone identified as Class I, Division I in conformance with Article 4.1.4.1. do not exceed 25% of the lower explosive limit of the flammable vapour.
ON Variations: Ventilation required in Sentence (1) shall be sufficient to ensure that flammable vapour concentrations outside the zone identified as Class I, Division I in conformance with Article 4.1.4.1. do not exceed 25% of the lower explosive limit of the flammable vapour.

ON Full: In a building that is sprinklered, a manual pull station is not required at an exterior egress doorway from a suite that does not lead to an interior shared means of egress in a hotel not more than 3 storeys in building height, provided each suite is served by an exterior exit facility leading directly to ground level.
ON Variations: In a building that is sprinklered, a manual pull station is not required at an exterior egress doorway from a suite that does not lead to an interior shared means of egress in a hotel not more than 3 storeys in building height, provided each suite is served by an exterior exit facility leading directly to ground level.

ON Full: The construction of plumbing systems shall conform to Part 7.
ON Variations: The construction of plumbing systems shall conform to Part 7.

ON Full: The specified dead load for a structural member consists of, (a) the weight of the member itself, (b) the weight of all materials of construction incorporated into the building to be supported permanently by the member, (c) the weight of partitions, (d) the weight of permanent equipment, and (e) the vertical load due to earth, plants and trees.
ON Variations: The specified dead load for a structural member consists of, (a) the weight of the member itself, (b) the weight of all materials of construction incorporated into the building to be supported permanently by the member, (c) the weight of partitions, (d) the weight of permanent equipment, and (e) the vertical load due to earth, plants and trees.

ON Full: Guards for flights, except in required exit stairs, shall be not less than 900 mm high.
ON Variations: Guards for flights, except in required exit stairs, shall be not less than 900 mm high.

ON Full: A manufacturing tolerance of -0.4 mm may be applied to the thicknesses listed in Table 9.29.6.1.
ON Variations: A manufacturing tolerance of -0.4 mm may be applied to the thicknesses listed in Table 9.29.6.1.

ON Full: Gypsum board applications not described in this Subsection shall conform to CSA A82.31-M, "Gypsum Board Application".
ON Variations: Gypsum board applications not described in this Subsection shall conform to CSA A82.31-M, "Gypsum Board Application".

ON Full: Where the intended use of the interior space will result in high moisture generation, the assembly shall be designed according to Part 5. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Where the intended use of the interior space will result in high moisture generation, the assembly shall be designed according to Part 5. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Not more than 50% of the total perimeter of a public spa may be replaced by one or more ramps that permit a bather seated in a wheelchair to enter the water with or without the wheelchair.
ON Variations: Not more than 50% of the total perimeter of a public spa may be replaced by one or more ramps that permit a bather seated in a wheelchair to enter the water with or without the wheelchair.

ON Full: Piping and equipment shall be mechanically secure and accessible for cleaning and maintenance.
ON Variations: Piping and equipment shall be mechanically secure and accessible for cleaning and maintenance.

ON Full: Where a rapid transit station is erected above and below the adjoining finished ground level, the above ground portion of the station shall be of noncombustible construction and shall conform to the requirements in Sentence (10).
ON Variations: Where a rapid transit station is erected above and below the adjoining finished ground level, the above ground portion of the station shall be of noncombustible construction and shall conform to the requirements in Sentence (10).

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (4), the specified load, S, due to the accumulation of rainwater on a surface whose position, shape and deflection under load make such an accumulation possible, is that resulting from the one-day rainfall determined in conformance with Subsection 1.1.2. and applied over the horizontal projection of the surface and all tributary surfaces. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (4), the specified load, S, due to the accumulation of rainwater on a surface whose position, shape and deflection under load make such an accumulation possible, is that resulting from the one-day rainfall determined in conformance with Subsection 1.1.2. and applied over the horizontal projection of the surface and all tributary surfaces. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Firewalls and interior vertical fire separations required to have fire-resistance ratings shall be rated for exposure to fire on each side.
ON Variations: Firewalls and interior vertical fire separations required to have fire-resistance ratings shall be rated for exposure to fire on each side.

ON Full: The number of studs in a wall directly below a girder truss or roof beam shall conform to Tables A-34 to A-37, provided,(a) the studs are fastened together to form a post in accordance with Sentence 9.17.4.2.(2), (b) the wall is not less than 1.2 m long and sheathed on at least one side with plywood, OSB, waferboard or gypsum sheathing, and (c) the wall sheathing is fastened to the stud post with at least one row of fasteners conforming to Article 9.23.3.5. and spaced not more than 150 mm o.c. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: The number of studs in a wall directly below a girder truss or roof beam shall conform to Tables A-34 to A-37, provided,(a) the studs are fastened together to form a post in accordance with Sentence 9.17.4.2.(2), (b) the wall is not less than 1.2 m long and sheathed on at least one side with plywood, OSB, waferboard or gypsum sheathing, and (c) the wall sheathing is fastened to the stud post with at least one row of fasteners conforming to Article 9.23.3.5. and spaced not more than 150 mm o.c. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Except as provided in this Subsection and Subsection 3.13.4., the requirements in Subsections 3.3.1. and 3.6.2. apply to a rapid transit station.
ON Variations: Except as provided in this Subsection and Subsection 3.13.4., the requirements in Subsections 3.3.1. and 3.6.2. apply to a rapid transit station.

ON Full: Except as permitted by Articles 3.2.2.50. to 3.2.2.56., a building classified as Group D shall conform to Sentence (2).
ON Variations: Except as permitted by Articles 3.2.2.50. to 3.2.2.56., a building classified as Group D shall conform to Sentence (2).

ON Full: Standpipe hose shall be unracked, unreeled or unrolled and inspected at least annually and after use, and any worn hose or gaskets in the couplings at the hose valves and at the nozzle replaced.
ON Variations: Standpipe hose shall be unracked, unreeled or unrolled and inspected at least annually and after use, and any worn hose or gaskets in the couplings at the hose valves and at the nozzle replaced.

ON Full: For all arch roofs, curved roofs and domes, the slope factor, Cs, shall be as prescribed in Sentences 4.1.6.2.(5) and (6).
ON Variations: For all arch roofs, curved roofs and domes, the slope factor, Cs, shall be as prescribed in Sentences 4.1.6.2.(5) and (6).

ON Full: PE/AL/PE pipe with a pressure rating of 690 kPa or greater at 82ºC shall be permitted in a hot water system.
ON Variations: PE/AL/PE pipe with a pressure rating of 690 kPa or greater at 82ºC shall be permitted in a hot water system.

ON Full: All other buildings intended for occupancy in the winter months on a continuing basis should be insulated and shall be equipped with heating facilities to maintain a minimum indoor air temperature of 18°C or commensurate with the use of the building at the outside winter design temperature described in Article 6.2.1.7.
ON Variations: All other buildings intended for occupancy in the winter months on a continuing basis should be insulated and shall be equipped with heating facilities to maintain a minimum indoor air temperature of 18°C or commensurate with the use of the building at the outside winter design temperature described in Article 6.2.1.7.

ON Full: Variations are permitted in riser height provided, the height of adjacent risers does not vary by more than 6 mm, and the depth of a tread or a platform in the direction of travel is not less than 430 mm.
ON Variations: Variations are permitted in riser height provided, the height of adjacent risers does not vary by more than 6 mm, and the depth of a tread or a platform in the direction of travel is not less than 430 mm.

ON Full: If it is not possible to cover or close openings described in Clause (1)(b), combustibles in the area exposed by the opening shall be protected against ignition.
ON Variations: If it is not possible to cover or close openings described in Clause (1)(b), combustibles in the area exposed by the opening shall be protected against ignition.

ON Full: Where a wall mounted tactile sign is provided in a building, characters, symbols or pictographs on the sign shall be located not less than 1 200 mm and not more than 1 500 mm above the finished floor. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Where a wall mounted tactile sign is provided in a building, characters, symbols or pictographs on the sign shall be located not less than 1 200 mm and not more than 1 500 mm above the finished floor. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: The continuity of the air barrier system shall extend throughout the basement.
ON Variations: The continuity of the air barrier system shall extend throughout the basement.

ON Full: Where fire blocks are penetrated by construction elements or by service equipment, a fire stop shall be used to seal the penetration. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Where fire blocks are penetrated by construction elements or by service equipment, a fire stop shall be used to seal the penetration. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Ancillary rooms such as storage rooms, washrooms, toilet rooms, laundry rooms and service rooms shall not open directly into an exit.
ON Variations: Ancillary rooms such as storage rooms, washrooms, toilet rooms, laundry rooms and service rooms shall not open directly into an exit.

ON Full: Documentation on piping systems for flammable liquids or combustible liquids, including tank and pumping arrangements, shall be made available to the fire department upon request.
ON Variations: Documentation on piping systems for flammable liquids or combustible liquids, including tank and pumping arrangements, shall be made available to the fire department upon request.

ON Full: For the purposes of this Subsection, the occupant load shall be determined in accordance with the provisions in Subsection 3.1.17. except that in a Group D occupancy, the area per person shall be 14 m2. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: For the purposes of this Subsection, the occupant load shall be determined in accordance with the provisions in Subsection 3.1.17. except that in a Group D occupancy, the area per person shall be 14 m2. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Except as described in Sentence (2), every door in a fire separation shall have a self-closing device.
ON Variations: Except as described in Sentence (2), every door in a fire separation shall have a self-closing device.

ON Full: If a material referred to in Sentence (2) consists of a number of discrete layers and testing reveals that the surface layer or layers protect the underlying layers such that the complete combustion of the underlying layers does not occur, the test shall be repeated by removing the outer layers sequentially until all layers have been exposed during testing, or until complete combustion has occurred.
ON Variations: If a material referred to in Sentence (2) consists of a number of discrete layers and testing reveals that the surface layer or layers protect the underlying layers such that the complete combustion of the underlying layers does not occur, the test shall be repeated by removing the outer layers sequentially until all layers have been exposed during testing, or until complete combustion has occurred.

ON Full: The maximum aggregate area of unprotected openings in an exposing building face of a storage garage need not comply with Sentence (1) where, (a) all storeys are constructed as open-air storeys, and (b) the storage garage has a limiting distance of not less than 3 m.
ON Variations: The maximum aggregate area of unprotected openings in an exposing building face of a storage garage need not comply with Sentence (1) where, (a) all storeys are constructed as open-air storeys, and (b) the storage garage has a limiting distance of not less than 3 m.

ON Full: When a particular va1ue of Rd is required by this Article, the corresponding Ro shall be used.
ON Variations: When a particular va1ue of Rd is required by this Article, the corresponding Ro shall be used.

ON Full: The depth of the tactile attention indicator shall be not less than 300 mm and not more than 610 mm.
ON Variations: The depth of the tactile attention indicator shall be not less than 300 mm and not more than 610 mm.

ON Full: Except for exterior doors to garages and to other ancillary spaces, this Article applies to,(a) swinging entrance doors to dwelling units, (b) swinging doors between dwelling units and attached garages or other ancillary spaces, and (c) swinging doors that provide access directly or indirectly from a storage garage to a dwelling unit. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Except for exterior doors to garages and to other ancillary spaces, this Article applies to,(a) swinging entrance doors to dwelling units, (b) swinging doors between dwelling units and attached garages or other ancillary spaces, and (c) swinging doors that provide access directly or indirectly from a storage garage to a dwelling unit. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (3), the effect of factored loads for a building or structural component shall be determined in accordance with the requirements of this Article and the following load combination cases, the applicable combination being that which results in the most critical effect: (a) for load cases without crane loads, the load combinations listed in Table 4.1.3.2.A., and (b) for load cases with crane loads, the load combinations listed in Table 4.1.3.2.B. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (3), the effect of factored loads for a building or structural component shall be determined in accordance with the requirements of this Article and the following load combination cases, the applicable combination being that which results in the most critical effect: (a) for load cases without crane loads, the load combinations listed in Table 4.1.3.2.A., and (b) for load cases with crane loads, the load combinations listed in Table 4.1.3.2.B. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (2), every surface to which access is provided, including but not limited to flights, ramps, exterior landings, porches, balconies, mezzanines, galleries and raised walkways, shall be protected by a guard on each side that is not protected by a wall for the length, where,(a) there is a difference in elevation of more than 600 mm between the walking surface and the adjacent surface, or (b) the adjacent surface within 1.2 m from the walking surface has a slope of more than 1 in 2.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (2), every surface to which access is provided, including but not limited to flights, ramps, exterior landings, porches, balconies, mezzanines, galleries and raised walkways, shall be protected by a guard on each side that is not protected by a wall for the length, where,(a) there is a difference in elevation of more than 600 mm between the walking surface and the adjacent surface, or (b) the adjacent surface within 1.2 m from the walking surface has a slope of more than 1 in 2.

ON Full: Except as permitted by Sentences (3) to (5), an annunciator shall be installed in close proximity to a building entrance that faces a street or an access route for fire department vehicles that complies with Sentence 3.2.5.5.(1).
ON Variations: Except as permitted by Sentences (3) to (5), an annunciator shall be installed in close proximity to a building entrance that faces a street or an access route for fire department vehicles that complies with Sentence 3.2.5.5.(1).

ON Full: Except as permitted by Sentence (2), horizontal exits shall not comprise more than one-half of the required number of exits from any floor area.
ON Variations: Except as permitted by Sentence (2), horizontal exits shall not comprise more than one-half of the required number of exits from any floor area.

ON Full: Displays of cellulose nitrate plastic articles in stores that are not in showcases or show windows shall be displayed only when placed on tables or counters not more than 1 m wide and 3 m long, and the spaces underneath the tables or counters shall be kept free of combustible materials.
ON Variations: Displays of cellulose nitrate plastic articles in stores that are not in showcases or show windows shall be displayed only when placed on tables or counters not more than 1 m wide and 3 m long, and the spaces underneath the tables or counters shall be kept free of combustible materials.

ON Full: Hose stations shall be located so that every portion of the rapid transit station can be reached by a hose stream and is within 3 m of a hose nozzle when the hose is extended.
ON Variations: Hose stations shall be located so that every portion of the rapid transit station can be reached by a hose stream and is within 3 m of a hose nozzle when the hose is extended.

ON Full: In addition to the barrier-free entrances required by Sentence (1), a suite of assembly occupancy, business and personal services occupancy or mercantile occupancy that is located in the first storey of a building or in a storey to which a barrier-free path of travel is provided, and that is separated from the remainder of the building so that there is no access to the remainder of the building, shall have at least one barrier-free entrance.
ON Variations: In addition to the barrier-free entrances required by Sentence (1), a suite of assembly occupancy, business and personal services occupancy or mercantile occupancy that is located in the first storey of a building or in a storey to which a barrier-free path of travel is provided, and that is separated from the remainder of the building so that there is no access to the remainder of the building, shall have at least one barrier-free entrance.

ON Full: Except as provided in Articles 9.15.1.2. and 9.15.1.3., this Section applies to,(a) concrete or unit masonry foundation walls and concrete footings not subject to surcharge, (i) on stable soils with an allowable bearing pressure of 75 kPa or greater, and (ii) for buildings of wood frame or masonry construction, (b) wood frame foundation walls and wood or concrete footings not subject to surcharge, (i) on stable soils with an allowable bearing pressure of 75 kPa or greater, and (ii) for buildings of wood frame construction, and (c) flat insulating concrete form foundation walls and concrete footings not subject to surcharge, (i) on stable soils with an allowable bearing pressure of 75 kPa or greater, and (ii) for houses of light frame or flat insulating concrete form construction that are not more than 2 storeys in building height, with a maximum floor to floor height of 3 m. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Except as provided in Articles 9.15.1.2. and 9.15.1.3., this Section applies to,(a) concrete or unit masonry foundation walls and concrete footings not subject to surcharge, (i) on stable soils with an allowable bearing pressure of 75 kPa or greater, and (ii) for buildings of wood frame or masonry construction, (b) wood frame foundation walls and wood or concrete footings not subject to surcharge, (i) on stable soils with an allowable bearing pressure of 75 kPa or greater, and (ii) for buildings of wood frame construction, and (c) flat insulating concrete form foundation walls and concrete footings not subject to surcharge, (i) on stable soils with an allowable bearing pressure of 75 kPa or greater, and (ii) for houses of light frame or flat insulating concrete form construction that are not more than 2 storeys in building height, with a maximum floor to floor height of 3 m. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Except as permitted by Sentence (3), a storage room referred to in Sentence (1) shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.
ON Variations: Except as permitted by Sentence (3), a storage room referred to in Sentence (1) shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.

ON Full: Electrical installations conforming to the requirements for dip tanks in Article 5.13.5.6. shall be provided for quench tanks of over 1900 L capacity whose liquid surface area exceeds 2.5 m2.
ON Variations: Electrical installations conforming to the requirements for dip tanks in Article 5.13.5.6. shall be provided for quench tanks of over 1900 L capacity whose liquid surface area exceeds 2.5 m2.
