ON Full: This Subsection applies to a building, of Group A, D, E or F major occupancy classification that is more than, 36 m high, measured between grade and the floor level of the top storey, or 18 m high, measured between grade and the floor level of the top storey, and in which the cumulative or total occupant load on or above any storey above grade, other than the first storey, divided by 1.8 times the width in metres of all exit stairs at that storey, exceeds 300, containing a Group B major occupancy in which the floor level of the highest storey of that major occupancy is more than 18 m above grade, containing a floor area or part of a floor area located above the third storey designed or intended as a Group B, Division 2 or 3 occupancy, containing a Group C major occupancy in which the floor level of the highest storey of that major occupancy is more than 18 m above grade, or containing a retirement home, where the floor level of the highest storey of the retirement home is more than 18 m above grade.
ON Variations: This Subsection applies to a building, of Group A, D, E or F major occupancy classification that is more than, 36 m high, measured between grade and the floor level of the top storey, or 18 m high, measured between grade and the floor level of the top storey, and in which the cumulative or total occupant load on or above any storey above grade, other than the first storey, divided by 1.8 times the width in metres of all exit stairs at that storey, exceeds 300, containing a Group B major occupancy in which the floor level of the highest storey of that major occupancy is more than 18 m above grade, containing a floor area or part of a floor area located above the third storey designed or intended as a Group B, Division 2 or 3 occupancy, containing a Group C major occupancy in which the floor level of the highest storey of that major occupancy is more than 18 m above grade, or containing a retirement home, where the floor level of the highest storey of the retirement home is more than 18 m above grade.

ON Full: Class I liquids shall not be used for pressure testing of piping systems, except that piping normally containing Class I liquids under pressure is permitted to be tested with such liquids at pressures not exceeding their maximum operating pressures.
ON Variations: Class I liquids shall not be used for pressure testing of piping systems, except that piping normally containing Class I liquids under pressure is permitted to be tested with such liquids at pressures not exceeding their maximum operating pressures.

ON Full: Except as permitted by Article 3.2.2.16., the building referred to in Sentence (1) shall be of noncombustible construction, and, except as permitted by Sentence 3.2.2.7.(1), the building shall be sprinklered if it is regulated by Subsection 3.2.6., floor assemblies shall be fire separations with a fire-resistance rating not less than 2 h, mezzanines shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, if the building is not sprinklered, roof assemblies shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, and loadbearing walls, columns and arches shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the supported assembly.
ON Variations: Except as permitted by Article 3.2.2.16., the building referred to in Sentence (1) shall be of noncombustible construction, and, except as permitted by Sentence 3.2.2.7.(1), the building shall be sprinklered if it is regulated by Subsection 3.2.6., floor assemblies shall be fire separations with a fire-resistance rating not less than 2 h, mezzanines shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, if the building is not sprinklered, roof assemblies shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, and loadbearing walls, columns and arches shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the supported assembly.

ON Full: Except as otherwise required or permitted by this Subsection, the flame-spread rating of interior wall and ceiling finishes, including glazing and skylights, shall be not more than 150 and shall conform to Table 3.1.13.2.
ON Variations: Except as otherwise required or permitted by this Subsection, the flame-spread rating of interior wall and ceiling finishes, including glazing and skylights, shall be not more than 150 and shall conform to Table 3.1.13.2.

ON Full: Where a sleeve flashing is installed on a flat roof, it shall extend at least 150 mm above the flood level and on a sloped roof shall be at least 150 mm high on the short side.
ON Variations: Where a sleeve flashing is installed on a flat roof, it shall extend at least 150 mm above the flood level and on a sloped roof shall be at least 150 mm high on the short side.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (2), escalators conforming to the requirements of Sentences 3.13.4.5.(3) and 3.13.4.6.(1) shall be acceptable as part of a required means of egress in a rapid transit station.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (2), escalators conforming to the requirements of Sentences 3.13.4.5.(3) and 3.13.4.6.(1) shall be acceptable as part of a required means of egress in a rapid transit station.

ON Full: Materials subject to spontaneous ignition, such as greasy or oily rags, shall be deposited in a receptacle conforming to Sentence (3) or be removed from the premises.
ON Variations: Materials subject to spontaneous ignition, such as greasy or oily rags, shall be deposited in a receptacle conforming to Sentence (3) or be removed from the premises.

ON Full: Lumber and timber treated with combustible liquids shall be stored in piles that are separated from other stored material so that the distance between piles is at least twice the height of the treated pile, but not less than 4.5 m.
ON Variations: Lumber and timber treated with combustible liquids shall be stored in piles that are separated from other stored material so that the distance between piles is at least twice the height of the treated pile, but not less than 4.5 m.

ON Full: Sprinkler heads shall be checked at least once per year to ensure that they are free from damage, corrosion, grease, dust, paint or whitewash.
ON Variations: Sprinkler heads shall be checked at least once per year to ensure that they are free from damage, corrosion, grease, dust, paint or whitewash.

ON Full: The surface of the ground in the area of the pit shall be so graded that surface drainage in the area will be diverted away from the pit.
ON Variations: The surface of the ground in the area of the pit shall be so graded that surface drainage in the area will be diverted away from the pit.

ON Full: The fire pump discharge pressure, suction pressure, lubricating oil level, operative condition of relief valves, priming water level and general operating conditions shall be inspected during the weekly operation of fire pumps.
ON Variations: The fire pump discharge pressure, suction pressure, lubricating oil level, operative condition of relief valves, priming water level and general operating conditions shall be inspected during the weekly operation of fire pumps.

ON Full: Pilasters required in Sentence (1) shall be not less than 90 mm by 290 mm and shall be bonded or tied into the wall.
ON Variations: Pilasters required in Sentence (1) shall be not less than 90 mm by 290 mm and shall be bonded or tied into the wall.

ON Full: Piping systems shall be used only for the transfer of products.
ON Variations: Piping systems shall be used only for the transfer of products.

ON Full: Key-operated switches located outside an elevator shaft shall be tested to ensure that actuation of the switch will render the emergency stop switch in each car inoperative and bring all cars to the street floor or transfer lobby by cancelling all other calls after the car has stopped at the next floor at which it can make a normal stop.
ON Variations: Key-operated switches located outside an elevator shaft shall be tested to ensure that actuation of the switch will render the emergency stop switch in each car inoperative and bring all cars to the street floor or transfer lobby by cancelling all other calls after the car has stopped at the next floor at which it can make a normal stop.

ON Full: If each dwelling unit has direct access to an exterior exit facility leading to ground level, a fire alarm system is not required in an apartment building, in which not more than four dwelling units share a common means of egress, or that is not more than 3 storeys in building height.
ON Variations: If each dwelling unit has direct access to an exterior exit facility leading to ground level, a fire alarm system is not required in an apartment building, in which not more than four dwelling units share a common means of egress, or that is not more than 3 storeys in building height.

ON Full: Sentence (1) does not apply to vent risers and vertical fill piping systems.
ON Variations: Sentence (1) does not apply to vent risers and vertical fill piping systems.

ON Full: The flow rate through a grease interceptor shall not exceed its rated capacity and the flow rate shall be determined using the following: where: Q is the flow rate to a grease interceptor in L/s. V is the volume of the fixture in L. DDT is the drain down time, 60 or 120 seconds. PD is any pump discharge in L/s. N is the number of fixtures to go through the interceptor.
ON Variations: The flow rate through a grease interceptor shall not exceed its rated capacity and the flow rate shall be determined using the following: where: Q is the flow rate to a grease interceptor in L/s. V is the volume of the fixture in L. DDT is the drain down time, 60 or 120 seconds. PD is any pump discharge in L/s. N is the number of fixtures to go through the interceptor.

ON Full: In addition to the requirements of this Subsection, public spas shall comply with the requirements of Sentences 3.11.3.1.(13) to (17), (19), (20) and (22) and Clause 3.11.3.1.(24)(a).
ON Variations: In addition to the requirements of this Subsection, public spas shall comply with the requirements of Sentences 3.11.3.1.(13) to (17), (19), (20) and (22) and Clause 3.11.3.1.(24)(a).

ON Full: Where suspended maintenance and window cleaning operations are intended to be carried out on the exterior of a building described in Article 1.1.2.2. of Division A, anchor systems shall be provided where any portion of the roof is more than 8 m above adjacent ground level.
ON Variations: Where suspended maintenance and window cleaning operations are intended to be carried out on the exterior of a building described in Article 1.1.2.2. of Division A, anchor systems shall be provided where any portion of the roof is more than 8 m above adjacent ground level.

ON Full: Except as otherwise required in this Subsection, the required width of means of egress serving platforms in a rapid transit station shall be determined based on, the required egress capacity determined in conformance with Article 3.13.4.4., and the pedestrian flow rate for the type of means of egress facility listed in Table 3.13.4.5.
ON Variations: Except as otherwise required in this Subsection, the required width of means of egress serving platforms in a rapid transit station shall be determined based on, the required egress capacity determined in conformance with Article 3.13.4.4., and the pedestrian flow rate for the type of means of egress facility listed in Table 3.13.4.5.

ON Full: An underground walkway shall not be designed or used for any purpose other than pedestrian travel unless, the purpose is permitted, and sprinklers are installed in any space in the walkway containing an occupancy.
ON Variations: An underground walkway shall not be designed or used for any purpose other than pedestrian travel unless, the purpose is permitted, and sprinklers are installed in any space in the walkway containing an occupancy.

ON Full: The design and installation of a shallow buried trench, Type A dispersal bed or Type B dispersal bed shall be carried out by a person competent in this field of work.
ON Variations: The design and installation of a shallow buried trench, Type A dispersal bed or Type B dispersal bed shall be carried out by a person competent in this field of work.

ON Full: The width of the stud post shall be not less than the width of the girder or beam that it supports.
ON Variations: The width of the stud post shall be not less than the width of the girder or beam that it supports.

ON Full: The cesspool shall be surrounded on all sides and on its bottom by at least 600 mm of soil or leaching bed fill, except the top where the cesspool extends to the surface of the ground.
ON Variations: The cesspool shall be surrounded on all sides and on its bottom by at least 600 mm of soil or leaching bed fill, except the top where the cesspool extends to the surface of the ground.

ON Full: If there is a conflict between the requirements of this Section and any other requirement in this Part, other than a requirement of Section 4.12, this Section shall prevail.
ON Variations: If there is a conflict between the requirements of this Section and any other requirement in this Part, other than a requirement of Section 4.12, this Section shall prevail.

ON Full: Exhaust ducts connected to laundry-drying equipment shall be,(a) independent of other exhaust ducts, (b) accessible for cleaning, and (c) constructed of a smooth corrosion-resistant material.
ON Variations: Exhaust ducts connected to laundry-drying equipment shall be,(a) independent of other exhaust ducts, (b) accessible for cleaning, and (c) constructed of a smooth corrosion-resistant material.

ON Full: An indoor pool or an outdoor pool that is intended to be open for use after sundown shall be equipped with a lighting system, that will maintain at any point on the pool deck and on the pool water surface an illumination level of at least, 200 lx in the case of an indoor pool, and 100 lx in the case of an outdoor pool, and that makes the underwater areas of the pool clearly visible from any point on the pool deck.
ON Variations: An indoor pool or an outdoor pool that is intended to be open for use after sundown shall be equipped with a lighting system, that will maintain at any point on the pool deck and on the pool water surface an illumination level of at least, 200 lx in the case of an indoor pool, and 100 lx in the case of an outdoor pool, and that makes the underwater areas of the pool clearly visible from any point on the pool deck.

ON Full: Where a storage garage serves only the dwelling unit to which it is attached or built in, a carbon monoxide alarm shall be installed adjacent to each sleeping area in the dwelling unit.
ON Variations: Where a storage garage serves only the dwelling unit to which it is attached or built in, a carbon monoxide alarm shall be installed adjacent to each sleeping area in the dwelling unit.

ON Full: Every platform or walkway level shall be provided with fire extinguishers installed in conformance with the Fire Code made under the Fire Protection and Prevention Act, 1997.
ON Variations: Every platform or walkway level shall be provided with fire extinguishers installed in conformance with the Fire Code made under the Fire Protection and Prevention Act, 1997.

ON Full: If the Building Code requires a visual signalling component that is integral with or connected to a smoke alarm, the visual signalling component shall be maintained in operating condition.
ON Variations: If the Building Code requires a visual signalling component that is integral with or connected to a smoke alarm, the visual signalling component shall be maintained in operating condition.

ON Full: Heating of heated crawl spaces shall conform to Section 9.33.
ON Variations: Heating of heated crawl spaces shall conform to Section 9.33.

ON Full: Disconnect switches for power supplies which serve only fire alarm systems or interconnected smoke alarms shall be in a locked secure area or otherwise secured in an approved manner.
ON Variations: Disconnect switches for power supplies which serve only fire alarm systems or interconnected smoke alarms shall be in a locked secure area or otherwise secured in an approved manner.

ON Full: Where storage areas are fenced or otherwise enclosed, gates having a clear width of 3.5 m shall be provided to permit the entry of fire department vehicles.
ON Variations: Where storage areas are fenced or otherwise enclosed, gates having a clear width of 3.5 m shall be provided to permit the entry of fire department vehicles.

ON Full: At least one handrail shall, in the case of a stair, extend horizontally at the required height, not less than 300 mm beyond the top riser, and continue to slope for a depth of one tread beyond the bottom riser followed by a 300 mm horizontal extension, and in the case of a ramp, extend horizontally at the required height, not less than 300 mm beyond the top and bottom edges of the incline.
ON Variations: At least one handrail shall, in the case of a stair, extend horizontally at the required height, not less than 300 mm beyond the top riser, and continue to slope for a depth of one tread beyond the bottom riser followed by a 300 mm horizontal extension, and in the case of a ramp, extend horizontally at the required height, not less than 300 mm beyond the top and bottom edges of the incline.

ON Full: For the purposes of Sentences (2), (3) and (4), smoke alarms shall be tested by activating the smoke alarm test feature.
ON Variations: For the purposes of Sentences (2), (3) and (4), smoke alarms shall be tested by activating the smoke alarm test feature.

ON Full: The flame-spread rating of doors containing foamed plastics shall comply with Sentences 3.1.13.2.(1) to (3).
ON Variations: The flame-spread rating of doors containing foamed plastics shall comply with Sentences 3.1.13.2.(1) to (3).

ON Full: Doors in the fire separation or in the wired glass assembly in Clause (1)(b) are not required to have latches where close spaced sprinkler protection is provided on the station side.
ON Variations: Doors in the fire separation or in the wired glass assembly in Clause (1)(b) are not required to have latches where close spaced sprinkler protection is provided on the station side.

ON Full: Where up to three foam-type portable extinguishers rated for Class B fires are used to satisfy the requirements of Article 6.2.6.9., the sum of the basic extinguisher ratings shall satisfy the requirements in Table 6.2.6.B.
ON Variations: Where up to three foam-type portable extinguishers rated for Class B fires are used to satisfy the requirements of Article 6.2.6.9., the sum of the basic extinguisher ratings shall satisfy the requirements in Table 6.2.6.B.

ON Full: Where a fuel-burning appliance is installed in a suite of residential occupancy, a carbon monoxide alarm shall be installed adjacent to each sleeping area in the suite.
ON Variations: Where a fuel-burning appliance is installed in a suite of residential occupancy, a carbon monoxide alarm shall be installed adjacent to each sleeping area in the suite.

ON Full: Grout mix proportions shall conform to Table 9.20.3.2.C., with sufficient water to provide a suitable flow to fill all voids completely, without excessive segregation or bleeding.
ON Variations: Grout mix proportions shall conform to Table 9.20.3.2.C., with sufficient water to provide a suitable flow to fill all voids completely, without excessive segregation or bleeding.

ON Full: The location and protection of windows, doors and skylights in order to control the spread of fire shall conform to Subsection 9.10.12.
ON Variations: The location and protection of windows, doors and skylights in order to control the spread of fire shall conform to Subsection 9.10.12.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentences (10) and (11), every septic tank shall be installed in such a manner that the access openings are located not more than 300 mm below the ground surface.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentences (10) and (11), every septic tank shall be installed in such a manner that the access openings are located not more than 300 mm below the ground surface.

ON Full: Where a building containing an interconnected floor space is more than 75 m in height, measured between grade and the floor level of the top storey, the exit stairshaft protection required in Sentence (1) shall be accomplished by the provision, between each floor area and each exit stairshaft, of a vestibule provided with a mechanical air supply or with a vent opening to the outdoors.
ON Variations: Where a building containing an interconnected floor space is more than 75 m in height, measured between grade and the floor level of the top storey, the exit stairshaft protection required in Sentence (1) shall be accomplished by the provision, between each floor area and each exit stairshaft, of a vestibule provided with a mechanical air supply or with a vent opening to the outdoors.

ON Full: Two or more areas may be considered as a combination room if the opening between the areas occupies the larger of 3 m2 or 40% or more of the wall measured on the side of the dependent area.
ON Variations: Two or more areas may be considered as a combination room if the opening between the areas occupies the larger of 3 m2 or 40% or more of the wall measured on the side of the dependent area.

ON Full: Combustible materials are permitted in the power-ventilated enclosure described in Sentence (1) and its exhaust duct system if,(a) such materials are required by the corrosive or reactive properties of the chemicals or liquids being used, and (b) their flame-spread rating is not more than 25.
ON Variations: Combustible materials are permitted in the power-ventilated enclosure described in Sentence (1) and its exhaust duct system if,(a) such materials are required by the corrosive or reactive properties of the chemicals or liquids being used, and (b) their flame-spread rating is not more than 25.

ON Full: Solvent cement for transition joints shall conform to,(a) CAN/CSA-B181.1, "Acrylonitrile-Butadiene-Styrene (ABS) Drain, Waste, and Vent Pipe and Pipe Fittings", or (b) CAN/CSA-B181.2, "Polyvinylchloride (PVC) and Chlorinated Polyvinylchloride (CPVC) Drain, Waste, and Vent Pipe and Pipe Fittings".
ON Variations: Solvent cement for transition joints shall conform to,(a) CAN/CSA-B181.1, "Acrylonitrile-Butadiene-Styrene (ABS) Drain, Waste, and Vent Pipe and Pipe Fittings", or (b) CAN/CSA-B181.2, "Polyvinylchloride (PVC) and Chlorinated Polyvinylchloride (CPVC) Drain, Waste, and Vent Pipe and Pipe Fittings".

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (2), this Part applies to the design and construction of plumbing.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (2), this Part applies to the design and construction of plumbing.

ON Full: Storage tank supports having less than a 2 h fire-resistance rating shall be protected by an automatic fire suppression system conforming to an applicable standard set out in Article 6.8.1.1.
ON Variations: Storage tank supports having less than a 2 h fire-resistance rating shall be protected by an automatic fire suppression system conforming to an applicable standard set out in Article 6.8.1.1.

ON Full: Smoking shall not take place in salvage yards, except as provided in Subsection 2.4.3.
ON Variations: Smoking shall not take place in salvage yards, except as provided in Subsection 2.4.3.

ON Full: Each connection to an aboveground storage tank through which liquid can normally flow shall be provided with an internal or external shut-off valve located as close as practical to the shell of the tank.
ON Variations: Each connection to an aboveground storage tank through which liquid can normally flow shall be provided with an internal or external shut-off valve located as close as practical to the shell of the tank.

ON Full: Except as provided by Sentences (4) to (7), combustible piping is permitted to penetrate a fire separation required to have a fire-resistance rating or is permitted to penetrate a membrane that forms part of an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating, provided the piping is sealed at the penetration by a fire stop that has an F rating not less than the fire-resistance rating required for the fire separation when subjected to the fire test method in CAN/ULC-S115, "Fire Tests of Firestop Systems", with a pressure differential of 50 Pa between the exposed and unexposed sides, with the higher pressure on the exposed side.
ON Variations: Except as provided by Sentences (4) to (7), combustible piping is permitted to penetrate a fire separation required to have a fire-resistance rating or is permitted to penetrate a membrane that forms part of an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating, provided the piping is sealed at the penetration by a fire stop that has an F rating not less than the fire-resistance rating required for the fire separation when subjected to the fire test method in CAN/ULC-S115, "Fire Tests of Firestop Systems", with a pressure differential of 50 Pa between the exposed and unexposed sides, with the higher pressure on the exposed side.

ON Full: Supervisory staff shall be available on notification of a fire emergency to fulfil their obligation as described in the fire safety plan.
ON Variations: Supervisory staff shall be available on notification of a fire emergency to fulfil their obligation as described in the fire safety plan.

ON Full: Doors to public water closet rooms shall be not less than 810 mm wide and 2 030 mm high.
ON Variations: Doors to public water closet rooms shall be not less than 810 mm wide and 2 030 mm high.

ON Full: Portable extinguishers with a minimum rating of 4A:40B:C shall be located no further than 7.6 m and no closer than 1.5 m from a bitumen kettle.
ON Variations: Portable extinguishers with a minimum rating of 4A:40B:C shall be located no further than 7.6 m and no closer than 1.5 m from a bitumen kettle.

ON Full: The hydraulic load that is drained to a horizontal storm drainage pipe shall conform to Table 7.4.10.9., based on the size and slope.
ON Variations: The hydraulic load that is drained to a horizontal storm drainage pipe shall conform to Table 7.4.10.9., based on the size and slope.

ON Full: Rectangular panels in plenums and ducts more than 300 mm wide shall be shaped to provide sufficient stiffness.
ON Variations: Rectangular panels in plenums and ducts more than 300 mm wide shall be shaped to provide sufficient stiffness.

ON Full: Except as permitted in Sentence (3), the size of a supply pipe that serves a fixture or device shall conform to Table 7.6.3.2.A.
ON Variations: Except as permitted in Sentence (3), the size of a supply pipe that serves a fixture or device shall conform to Table 7.6.3.2.A.

ON Full: High voltage components, including atomizing heads, shall be insulated and protected against mechanical damage and accidental contact or grounding.
ON Variations: High voltage components, including atomizing heads, shall be insulated and protected against mechanical damage and accidental contact or grounding.

ON Full: Except as permitted by Sentences (2) and (3), if a fire alarm system is installed, a manual pull station shall be installed, near the principal entrance to the building, and near every required exit.
ON Variations: Except as permitted by Sentences (2) and (3), if a fire alarm system is installed, a manual pull station shall be installed, near the principal entrance to the building, and near every required exit.

ON Full: Only pipes or ducts necessary for fire protection or the proper operation of the electrical installation shall penetrate the fire separations surrounding the electrical equipment vault.
ON Variations: Only pipes or ducts necessary for fire protection or the proper operation of the electrical installation shall penetrate the fire separations surrounding the electrical equipment vault.

ON Full: Every wiped flanged joint shall be reinforced with a lead flange that is at least 19 mm wide.
ON Variations: Every wiped flanged joint shall be reinforced with a lead flange that is at least 19 mm wide.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (2), wood doors described in Sentence (1) shall, (a) be solid core or stile-and-rail type, (b) be not less than 45 mm thick, and (c) if of the stile-and-rail panel type, have a panel thickness of not less than 19 mm, with a total panel area not more than half of the door area.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (2), wood doors described in Sentence (1) shall, (a) be solid core or stile-and-rail type, (b) be not less than 45 mm thick, and (c) if of the stile-and-rail panel type, have a panel thickness of not less than 19 mm, with a total panel area not more than half of the door area.

ON Full: In an elementary or secondary school, where a stair lift is installed in an exit stair, an intermediate handrail shall be installed between the path of travel of the stair lift and the remainder of the stair to ensure that the stair lift will not reduce the required width of the exit stair.
ON Variations: In an elementary or secondary school, where a stair lift is installed in an exit stair, an intermediate handrail shall be installed between the path of travel of the stair lift and the remainder of the stair to ensure that the stair lift will not reduce the required width of the exit stair.

ON Full: Except as otherwise specified in this Part, this Section applies only to dwelling units that are intended for use on a continuing or year-round basis as the principal residence of the occupant.
ON Variations: Except as otherwise specified in this Part, this Section applies only to dwelling units that are intended for use on a continuing or year-round basis as the principal residence of the occupant.

ON Full: Mezzanines shall not be considered as storeys for the purpose of determining building height where they occupy an aggregate area not exceeding 40% of the area of the room or the storey in which they are located provided the space above the mezzanine floor has no visual obstructions more than 1 070 mm above such floors.
ON Variations: Mezzanines shall not be considered as storeys for the purpose of determining building height where they occupy an aggregate area not exceeding 40% of the area of the room or the storey in which they are located provided the space above the mezzanine floor has no visual obstructions more than 1 070 mm above such floors.

ON Full: OSB, waferboard and plywood used for roof sheathing, wall sheathing and subflooring shall be legibly identified on the face of the material indicating,(a) the manufacturer of the material, (b) the standard to which it is produced, and (c) that the material is of an exterior type.
ON Variations: OSB, waferboard and plywood used for roof sheathing, wall sheathing and subflooring shall be legibly identified on the face of the material indicating,(a) the manufacturer of the material, (b) the standard to which it is produced, and (c) that the material is of an exterior type.

ON Full: Open flame or spark producing devices shall not be used within a spraying area, unless separated from the area by a vapour-tight fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.
ON Variations: Open flame or spark producing devices shall not be used within a spraying area, unless separated from the area by a vapour-tight fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.

ON Full: This Section does not apply to buildings that are subject to Part 9.
ON Variations: This Section does not apply to buildings that are subject to Part 9.

ON Full: For fixed seats with backs and with folding tablet arms, the value of 400 mm required by Clause (1)(c) shall be measured when the tablet arms are in the use position, but is permitted to be measured in the stored position provided, there are not more than seven seats between any seat and the nearest aisle, the seats are located in a lecture hall or an auditorium used for instructional purposes, and the tablet arm, when raised manually to a vertical position, falls by the force of gravity to the stored position.
ON Variations: For fixed seats with backs and with folding tablet arms, the value of 400 mm required by Clause (1)(c) shall be measured when the tablet arms are in the use position, but is permitted to be measured in the stored position provided, there are not more than seven seats between any seat and the nearest aisle, the seats are located in a lecture hall or an auditorium used for instructional purposes, and the tablet arm, when raised manually to a vertical position, falls by the force of gravity to the stored position.

ON Full: A sign shall be conspicuously posted indicating the necessity of grounding the equipment and objects identified in Sentence (1).
ON Variations: A sign shall be conspicuously posted indicating the necessity of grounding the equipment and objects identified in Sentence (1).

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (1), where the leaching bed is constructed as a shallow buried trench, the total length of leaching chamber shall not be less than the value determined by Table 8.7.3.1A.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (1), where the leaching bed is constructed as a shallow buried trench, the total length of leaching chamber shall not be less than the value determined by Table 8.7.3.1A.

ON Full: For all arch roofs, curved roofs and domes, the full and partial load cases defined in Article 4.1.6.3. shall be considered.
ON Variations: For all arch roofs, curved roofs and domes, the full and partial load cases defined in Article 4.1.6.3. shall be considered.

ON Full: Propane cylinders shall be stored in conformance with Section 5.6.
ON Variations: Propane cylinders shall be stored in conformance with Section 5.6.

ON Full: The STC ratings shall be determined in accordance with ASTM E413, "Classification for Rating Sound Insulation", using the results from measurements carried out in accordance with ASTM E90, "Laboratory Measurement of Airborne Sound Transmission Loss of Building Partitions and Elements".
ON Variations: The STC ratings shall be determined in accordance with ASTM E413, "Classification for Rating Sound Insulation", using the results from measurements carried out in accordance with ASTM E90, "Laboratory Measurement of Airborne Sound Transmission Loss of Building Partitions and Elements".

ON Full: Capping required in Sentence (1) is permitted to be omitted,(a) in localities where termites are not known to occur, (b) when the joists are supported on a wood plate not less than 38 mm by 89 mm, and (c) when the siding overlaps the foundation wall not less than 12 mm.
ON Variations: Capping required in Sentence (1) is permitted to be omitted,(a) in localities where termites are not known to occur, (b) when the joists are supported on a wood plate not less than 38 mm by 89 mm, and (c) when the siding overlaps the foundation wall not less than 12 mm.

ON Full: The recirculation system of a public pool shall be capable of filtering, disinfecting and passing through the pool each day a volume of water of at least, in the case of a Class A pool, other than a modified pool or a wave action pool, six times the total water volume of the pool, in the case of a Class B pool, other than a wave action pool, four times the total water volume of the pool, in the case of a modified pool, three times the total water volume of the pool, and in the case of a wave action pool, six times the total water volume of the pool.
ON Variations: The recirculation system of a public pool shall be capable of filtering, disinfecting and passing through the pool each day a volume of water of at least, in the case of a Class A pool, other than a modified pool or a wave action pool, six times the total water volume of the pool, in the case of a Class B pool, other than a wave action pool, four times the total water volume of the pool, in the case of a modified pool, three times the total water volume of the pool, and in the case of a wave action pool, six times the total water volume of the pool.

ON Full: Where the height of the parapet is more than 150 mm or exceeds the height of the adjacent wall flashing,(a) emergency roof overflows or scuppers described in Clause (2) (c) shall be provided, and (b) there shall be a minimum of two roof drains.
ON Variations: Where the height of the parapet is more than 150 mm or exceeds the height of the adjacent wall flashing,(a) emergency roof overflows or scuppers described in Clause (2) (c) shall be provided, and (b) there shall be a minimum of two roof drains.

ON Full: The ceiling heights of rooms or spaces in residential occupancies and live/work units shall conform to Table 9.5.3.1.
ON Variations: The ceiling heights of rooms or spaces in residential occupancies and live/work units shall conform to Table 9.5.3.1.

ON Full: An air barrier system is not required where it can be shown that uncontrolled air leakage will not adversely affect any of, (a) the health or safety of building users, (b) the intended use of the building, or (c) the operation of building services.
ON Variations: An air barrier system is not required where it can be shown that uncontrolled air leakage will not adversely affect any of, (a) the health or safety of building users, (b) the intended use of the building, or (c) the operation of building services.

ON Full: Openings referred to in Sentence (1) shall be protected against overflow and vapour pressure by means of a spring-loaded check valve.
ON Variations: Openings referred to in Sentence (1) shall be protected against overflow and vapour pressure by means of a spring-loaded check valve.

ON Full: In anaesthetizing locations, electrical systems shall be designed, constructed, installed and tested in conformance with CSA Z32, "Electrical Safety and Essential Electrical Systems in Health Care Facilities".
ON Variations: In anaesthetizing locations, electrical systems shall be designed, constructed, installed and tested in conformance with CSA Z32, "Electrical Safety and Essential Electrical Systems in Health Care Facilities".

ON Full: A door acting as a closure in the fire separation in Clause (1)(b) is not required to be equipped with a self-closing device.
ON Variations: A door acting as a closure in the fire separation in Clause (1)(b) is not required to be equipped with a self-closing device.

ON Full: The requirements in Sentence (3) shall apply to, a rapid transit station erected entirely below the adjoining finished ground level, and the underground portion of a rapid transit station.
ON Variations: The requirements in Sentence (3) shall apply to, a rapid transit station erected entirely below the adjoining finished ground level, and the underground portion of a rapid transit station.

ON Full: Calculations related to the transfer of heat, air and moisture and the transmission of sound shall conform to good engineering practice such as that described in the ASHRAE Fundamentals Handbook.
ON Variations: Calculations related to the transfer of heat, air and moisture and the transmission of sound shall conform to good engineering practice such as that described in the ASHRAE Fundamentals Handbook.

ON Full: Air filters for air duct systems shall conform to the requirements for Class 2 air filter units as described in CAN/ULC-S111, "Fire Tests For Air Filter Units".
ON Variations: Air filters for air duct systems shall conform to the requirements for Class 2 air filter units as described in CAN/ULC-S111, "Fire Tests For Air Filter Units".

ON Full: Except as provided by Articles 3.1.2.3. to 3.1.2.7., every building or part of it shall be classified according to its major occupancy as belonging to one of the Groups or Divisions described in Table 3.1.2.1. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Except as provided by Articles 3.1.2.3. to 3.1.2.7., every building or part of it shall be classified according to its major occupancy as belonging to one of the Groups or Divisions described in Table 3.1.2.1. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Combustible roof coverings on buildings within the scope of Article 3.2.2.43A. or 3.2.2.50A. shall have a Class A classification.
ON Variations: Combustible roof coverings on buildings within the scope of Article 3.2.2.43A. or 3.2.2.50A. shall have a Class A classification.

ON Full: Where an exterior insulation finish system is installed as cladding on wood-frame, masonry, cold-formed steel stud or cast-in-place concrete walls exposed to precipitation, the cladding assembly shall comply with,(a) Subsections 9.25.5., 9.27.2. to 9.27.4. and 9.27.13., or (b) Part 5. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Where an exterior insulation finish system is installed as cladding on wood-frame, masonry, cold-formed steel stud or cast-in-place concrete walls exposed to precipitation, the cladding assembly shall comply with,(a) Subsections 9.25.5., 9.27.2. to 9.27.4. and 9.27.13., or (b) Part 5. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (2), an inactive leaf in double doors used in locations specified in Sentence (1) shall be provided with heavy-duty bolts top and bottom having an engagement of not less than 15 mm.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (2), an inactive leaf in double doors used in locations specified in Sentence (1) shall be provided with heavy-duty bolts top and bottom having an engagement of not less than 15 mm.

ON Full: Except as permitted by Sentences (2) and 3.3.1.10.(5), a sliding door provided in the locations described in Article 3.3.1.10. shall, be designed and installed to swing on the vertical axis in the direction of travel to the exit when pressure is applied, and be identified as a swinging door by means of a label or decal affixed to it.
ON Variations: Except as permitted by Sentences (2) and 3.3.1.10.(5), a sliding door provided in the locations described in Article 3.3.1.10. shall, be designed and installed to swing on the vertical axis in the direction of travel to the exit when pressure is applied, and be identified as a swinging door by means of a label or decal affixed to it.

ON Full: Bottom drains from dip tanks shall be trapped and shall discharge to a closed, vented salvage tank.
ON Variations: Bottom drains from dip tanks shall be trapped and shall discharge to a closed, vented salvage tank.

ON Full: Except as permitted in Sentence (2), where plywood for interior finish is grooved, the grooves shall not extend through the face ply and into the plies below the face ply unless the groove is supported by framing or furring.
ON Variations: Except as permitted in Sentence (2), where plywood for interior finish is grooved, the grooves shall not extend through the face ply and into the plies below the face ply unless the groove is supported by framing or furring.

ON Full: Except for a chimney flue constructed to serve a masonry fireplace, a cleanout opening with a metal frame and tight-fitting metal door shall be installed near the base of the chimney flue.
ON Variations: Except for a chimney flue constructed to serve a masonry fireplace, a cleanout opening with a metal frame and tight-fitting metal door shall be installed near the base of the chimney flue.

ON Full: The horizontal projection of an obstruction referred to in Sentence (3) is permitted to be more than 100 mm provided the clearance between the obstruction and the floor is less than 680 mm. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: The horizontal projection of an obstruction referred to in Sentence (3) is permitted to be more than 100 mm provided the clearance between the obstruction and the floor is less than 680 mm. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Applicable values of external pressure coefficients, Cp, are provided in, (a) Sentences (2) to (5), and (b) Article 4.1.7.6. for certain shapes of low buildings.
ON Variations: Applicable values of external pressure coefficients, Cp, are provided in, (a) Sentences (2) to (5), and (b) Article 4.1.7.6. for certain shapes of low buildings.

ON Full: Paired doors in a corridor serving patients or residents shall, swing in opposite directions, the right hand door swinging in the direction of travel, and be not less than 1 100 mm wide.
ON Variations: Paired doors in a corridor serving patients or residents shall, swing in opposite directions, the right hand door swinging in the direction of travel, and be not less than 1 100 mm wide.

ON Full: Structures having any of the features listed in Table 4.1.8.6. shall be designated irregular.
ON Variations: Structures having any of the features listed in Table 4.1.8.6. shall be designated irregular.

ON Full: Standpipe system piping which normally remains dry shall be hydrostatically tested in accordance with Article 6.4.3.2. at intervals of not more than five years.
ON Variations: Standpipe system piping which normally remains dry shall be hydrostatically tested in accordance with Article 6.4.3.2. at intervals of not more than five years.

ON Full: Except as provided in Section 9.26., continuous lumber or panel-type roof sheathing shall be installed to support the roofing.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Section 9.26., continuous lumber or panel-type roof sheathing shall be installed to support the roofing.

ON Full: Every pressurized distribution pipe shall, (a) be not less than 1 in. trade size, and (b) have orifices of at least 3 mm in diameter, spaced equally along the length of the pipe to provide even distribution of the effluent.
ON Variations: Every pressurized distribution pipe shall, (a) be not less than 1 in. trade size, and (b) have orifices of at least 3 mm in diameter, spaced equally along the length of the pipe to provide even distribution of the effluent.

ON Full: Except as required by Articles 3.2.7.6. and 3.2.7.7., an emergency electrical power system shall be installed in conformance with CSA C282, "Emergency Electrical Power Supply for Buildings".
ON Variations: Except as required by Articles 3.2.7.6. and 3.2.7.7., an emergency electrical power system shall be installed in conformance with CSA C282, "Emergency Electrical Power Supply for Buildings".

ON Full: Where a balcony is provided to meet the requirements of Sentence (3) or (4), the balcony shall have, a solid floor having a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for a floor assembly between suites, and an area providing not less than 1.5 m2 per suite occupant, based on occupant load, and a minimum dimension of 1 200 mm.
ON Variations: Where a balcony is provided to meet the requirements of Sentence (3) or (4), the balcony shall have, a solid floor having a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for a floor assembly between suites, and an area providing not less than 1.5 m2 per suite occupant, based on occupant load, and a minimum dimension of 1 200 mm.

ON Full: Smoke detectors required by Sentence (1) shall be designed as part of the building fire alarm system.
ON Variations: Smoke detectors required by Sentence (1) shall be designed as part of the building fire alarm system.

ON Full: In localities where termites are known to occur,(a) clearance between structural wood elements and the finished ground level directly below them shall be not less than 450 mm and, except as provided in Sentence (2), all sides of the supporting elements shall be visible to permit inspection, or (b) structural wood elements, supported by elements in contact with the ground or exposed over bare soil, shall be pressure-treated with a chemical that is toxic to termites.
ON Variations: In localities where termites are known to occur,(a) clearance between structural wood elements and the finished ground level directly below them shall be not less than 450 mm and, except as provided in Sentence (2), all sides of the supporting elements shall be visible to permit inspection, or (b) structural wood elements, supported by elements in contact with the ground or exposed over bare soil, shall be pressure-treated with a chemical that is toxic to termites.

ON Full: Except as permitted by Sentence (2) and Articles 3.1.7.2. and 3.6.3.5., the rating of a material, assembly of materials or a structural member that is required to have a fire-resistance rating, shall be determined on the basis of the results of tests conducted in conformance with CAN/ULC-S101, "Fire Endurance Tests of Building Construction and Materials".
ON Variations: Except as permitted by Sentence (2) and Articles 3.1.7.2. and 3.6.3.5., the rating of a material, assembly of materials or a structural member that is required to have a fire-resistance rating, shall be determined on the basis of the results of tests conducted in conformance with CAN/ULC-S101, "Fire Endurance Tests of Building Construction and Materials".

ON Full: The use of copper tube shall conform to Table 7.2.7.4.
ON Variations: The use of copper tube shall conform to Table 7.2.7.4.

ON Full: Subject to Article 2.8.2.2., supervisory staff are not required to be in the building on a continual basis.
ON Variations: Subject to Article 2.8.2.2., supervisory staff are not required to be in the building on a continual basis.

ON Full: Drainage shall be provided to direct surface water away from building assemblies separating interior space from the ground, except,(a) where the building assembly is designed in accordance with Subsection 5.7.2. to withstand continuous hydrostatic pressure, or (b) where it can be shown that the lack of drainage will not adversely affect any of, (i) the health or safety of building users, (ii) the intended use of the building, or (iii) the operation of building services. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: Drainage shall be provided to direct surface water away from building assemblies separating interior space from the ground, except,(a) where the building assembly is designed in accordance with Subsection 5.7.2. to withstand continuous hydrostatic pressure, or (b) where it can be shown that the lack of drainage will not adversely affect any of, (i) the health or safety of building users, (ii) the intended use of the building, or (iii) the operation of building services. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: In determining the required cladding-sheathing assembly and fire-resistance rating for an irregularly-shaped or skewed exterior wall, the location of the exposing building face shall be taken as a vertical plane located so that no portion of the actual exposing building face is between the vertical plane and the line to which the limiting distance is measured.
ON Variations: In determining the required cladding-sheathing assembly and fire-resistance rating for an irregularly-shaped or skewed exterior wall, the location of the exposing building face shall be taken as a vertical plane located so that no portion of the actual exposing building face is between the vertical plane and the line to which the limiting distance is measured.

ON Full: An egress door that serves a contained use area or impeded egress zone may be equipped with a locking device that can be released either locally or remotely in accordance with Sentences (4) to (6).
ON Variations: An egress door that serves a contained use area or impeded egress zone may be equipped with a locking device that can be released either locally or remotely in accordance with Sentences (4) to (6).

ON Full: With the exception of charging electrodes and their connections, transformers, power packs, control apparatus and all other electrical components shall be located outside the powder-coating area.
ON Variations: With the exception of charging electrodes and their connections, transformers, power packs, control apparatus and all other electrical components shall be located outside the powder-coating area.

ON Full: When a storage tank referred to in Sentence (1) contains flammable liquids or combustible liquids, the liquid level in the tank shall be measured and the readings compared at intervals not greater than one month.
ON Variations: When a storage tank referred to in Sentence (1) contains flammable liquids or combustible liquids, the liquid level in the tank shall be measured and the readings compared at intervals not greater than one month.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (4), outdoor processing equipment having emergency relief venting and a working pressure of not more than 17 kPa (gauge) shall be separated from property lines and buildings on the same property by distances equal to those in Table 4.3.2.A. for stable liquids, and 2.5 times those in Table 4.3.2.A. for unstable liquids.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (4), outdoor processing equipment having emergency relief venting and a working pressure of not more than 17 kPa (gauge) shall be separated from property lines and buildings on the same property by distances equal to those in Table 4.3.2.A. for stable liquids, and 2.5 times those in Table 4.3.2.A. for unstable liquids.

ON Full: Loadbearing walls, columns and arches supporting a service room or service space need not conform to Sentence (1).
ON Variations: Loadbearing walls, columns and arches supporting a service room or service space need not conform to Sentence (1).

ON Full: The clearance between sprinkler head deflectors and the tops of storage piles shall not be less than 457 mm.
ON Variations: The clearance between sprinkler head deflectors and the tops of storage piles shall not be less than 457 mm.

ON Full: All spaces within dwelling units, except crawl spaces, shall be provided with a floor-on-ground, where,(a) access is provided to the space, and (b) a floor supported by the structure is not provided.
ON Variations: All spaces within dwelling units, except crawl spaces, shall be provided with a floor-on-ground, where,(a) access is provided to the space, and (b) a floor supported by the structure is not provided.

ON Full: Except as provided in this Article, the number of water closets required for employees in mercantile occupancies shall conform to Table 3.7.4.8.
ON Variations: Except as provided in this Article, the number of water closets required for employees in mercantile occupancies shall conform to Table 3.7.4.8.

ON Full: When determining the size of a wet vent, the hydraulic load from the most downstream fixture or symmetrically connected fixtures shall not be included.
ON Variations: When determining the size of a wet vent, the hydraulic load from the most downstream fixture or symmetrically connected fixtures shall not be included.

ON Full: Columns for garages and carports shall conform to Section 9.17., except that 89 mm by 89 mm wood columns may be used.
ON Variations: Columns for garages and carports shall conform to Section 9.17., except that 89 mm by 89 mm wood columns may be used.

ON Full: For the purposes of Table 7.5.8.3., the length of a header shall be its developed length from the most distant soil or waste pipe connection to open air.
ON Variations: For the purposes of Table 7.5.8.3., the length of a header shall be its developed length from the most distant soil or waste pipe connection to open air.

ON Full: The removal, abandonment in place, disposal or temporary taking out of service of an underground piping system shall be performed in accordance with good engineering practice.
ON Variations: The removal, abandonment in place, disposal or temporary taking out of service of an underground piping system shall be performed in accordance with good engineering practice.

ON Full: This Subsection applies to the design of sewage systems.
ON Variations: This Subsection applies to the design of sewage systems.

ON Full: Buildings and their structural members made of aluminum shall conform to CAN/CSA-S157 / S157.1, "Strength Design in Aluminum/Commentary on CSA S157-05, Strength Design in Aluminum", using the loads stipulated in Section 4.1., in accordance with limit states design in Subsection 4.1.3.
ON Variations: Buildings and their structural members made of aluminum shall conform to CAN/CSA-S157 / S157.1, "Strength Design in Aluminum/Commentary on CSA S157-05, Strength Design in Aluminum", using the loads stipulated in Section 4.1., in accordance with limit states design in Subsection 4.1.3.

ON Full: Where swelling or shrinking soils, in which movements resulting from moisture content changes may be sufficient to cause damage to a structure, are encountered or known to exist, such a condition shall be fully investigated and provided for in the design.
ON Variations: Where swelling or shrinking soils, in which movements resulting from moisture content changes may be sufficient to cause damage to a structure, are encountered or known to exist, such a condition shall be fully investigated and provided for in the design.

ON Full: Where rock that expands or deteriorates when subjected to unfavourable environmental conditions or to stress release is known to exist, this condition shall be fully investigated and provided for in the design.
ON Variations: Where rock that expands or deteriorates when subjected to unfavourable environmental conditions or to stress release is known to exist, this condition shall be fully investigated and provided for in the design.

ON Full: The construction requirements for the exposing building face that are listed in Table 3.2.3.7. shall be satisfied before the area of unprotected openings may be increased as permitted by Sentence 3.2.3.12.(1).
ON Variations: The construction requirements for the exposing building face that are listed in Table 3.2.3.7. shall be satisfied before the area of unprotected openings may be increased as permitted by Sentence 3.2.3.12.(1).

ON Full: At least one copy of the fire emergency procedures shall be prominently posted and maintained on each floor area.
ON Variations: At least one copy of the fire emergency procedures shall be prominently posted and maintained on each floor area.

ON Full: Where a building component or assembly is subjected to differentials in temperature and water vapour pressure, the properties and position of the materials and components in those components or assemblies shall be such that they control vapour diffusion or permit venting to the exterior so as to minimize accumulation of condensation in the building component or assembly.
ON Variations: Where a building component or assembly is subjected to differentials in temperature and water vapour pressure, the properties and position of the materials and components in those components or assemblies shall be such that they control vapour diffusion or permit venting to the exterior so as to minimize accumulation of condensation in the building component or assembly.

ON Full: A corridor used by the public or serving patients or residents shall have no dead-end portion unless the area served by the dead-end portion has a second and separate means of egress.
ON Variations: A corridor used by the public or serving patients or residents shall have no dead-end portion unless the area served by the dead-end portion has a second and separate means of egress.

ON Full: Where fixtures are supplied with both hot and cold water, the hydraulic loads for maximum separate demands shall be 75% of the hydraulic load of the fixture units given in Tables 7.6.3.2.A. and 7.6.3.2.D. when using a detailed engineering design method.
ON Variations: Where fixtures are supplied with both hot and cold water, the hydraulic loads for maximum separate demands shall be 75% of the hydraulic load of the fixture units given in Tables 7.6.3.2.A. and 7.6.3.2.D. when using a detailed engineering design method.

ON Full: In a building used for a public assembly, open flames shall not be used in such quantity or manner as to create a fire hazard unless the use has been approved.
ON Variations: In a building used for a public assembly, open flames shall not be used in such quantity or manner as to create a fire hazard unless the use has been approved.

ON Full: A smoke control system conforming to Sentences (2) to (8) shall be designed to control the movement of smoke within a building containing an interconnected floor space.
ON Variations: A smoke control system conforming to Sentences (2) to (8) shall be designed to control the movement of smoke within a building containing an interconnected floor space.

ON Full: The land in the vicinity of a sewage system shall be maintained in a condition that will not cause damage to, or impair the functioning of, the sewage system.
ON Variations: The land in the vicinity of a sewage system shall be maintained in a condition that will not cause damage to, or impair the functioning of, the sewage system.

ON Full: A single stage fire alarm system shall, upon the operation of any manual pull station or fire detector, cause an alarm signal to sound on all audible signal devices in the system. (See Appendix A.)
ON Variations: A single stage fire alarm system shall, upon the operation of any manual pull station or fire detector, cause an alarm signal to sound on all audible signal devices in the system. (See Appendix A.)

ON Full: Liquids, debris and precipitation shall not be accumulated in the contained space created by the secondary containment.
ON Variations: Liquids, debris and precipitation shall not be accumulated in the contained space created by the secondary containment.

ON Full: No obstructions shall be placed so as to interfere with the effectiveness of water discharge from sprinklers.
ON Variations: No obstructions shall be placed so as to interfere with the effectiveness of water discharge from sprinklers.

ON Full: The number of water closets required for non-residential college buildings shall be at least one fixture for each 100 males and one fixture for each 75 females.
ON Variations: The number of water closets required for non-residential college buildings shall be at least one fixture for each 100 males and one fixture for each 75 females.

ON Full: Wooden stair stringers shall,(a) have a minimum effective depth of 90 mm, measured perpendicularly to the bottom of the stringer at the point of minimum cross-section, and an overall depth of not less than 235 mm, (b) be supported and secured top and bottom, (c) be not less than 25 mm actual thickness if supported along their length and 38 mm actual thickness if unsupported along their length, and (d) except as permitted in Sentence (2), be spaced not more than 900 mm o.c. for stairs serving a house or an individual dwelling unit, and 600 mm o.c. in other stairs.
ON Variations: Wooden stair stringers shall,(a) have a minimum effective depth of 90 mm, measured perpendicularly to the bottom of the stringer at the point of minimum cross-section, and an overall depth of not less than 235 mm, (b) be supported and secured top and bottom, (c) be not less than 25 mm actual thickness if supported along their length and 38 mm actual thickness if unsupported along their length, and (d) except as permitted in Sentence (2), be spaced not more than 900 mm o.c. for stairs serving a house or an individual dwelling unit, and 600 mm o.c. in other stairs.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentences (3) and (4), the energy efficiency of all buildings shall,(a) be designed to exceed by not less than 13% the energy efficiency levels required by Sentence 12.2.1.1.(2), or (b) conform to Division 1 and Division 3 or 5 of MMA Supplementary Standard SB-10, "Energy Efficiency Requirements".
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentences (3) and (4), the energy efficiency of all buildings shall,(a) be designed to exceed by not less than 13% the energy efficiency levels required by Sentence 12.2.1.1.(2), or (b) conform to Division 1 and Division 3 or 5 of MMA Supplementary Standard SB-10, "Energy Efficiency Requirements".

ON Full: In addition to the requirements of this Subsection, service rooms shall comply with the requirements of Sentences 3.6.2.1.(5), 3.6.2.1.(7) and 3.6.2.1.(8) and Articles 3.5.3.3. and 3.6.2.2.
ON Variations: In addition to the requirements of this Subsection, service rooms shall comply with the requirements of Sentences 3.6.2.1.(5), 3.6.2.1.(7) and 3.6.2.1.(8) and Articles 3.5.3.3. and 3.6.2.2.

ON Full: Section 6.2 does not apply to dwelling units.
ON Variations: Section 6.2 does not apply to dwelling units.

ON Full: Closed sprinkler control valves and closed valves controlling fire protection water supplies for sprinkler systems shall be tagged or identified in an approved manner.
ON Variations: Closed sprinkler control valves and closed valves controlling fire protection water supplies for sprinkler systems shall be tagged or identified in an approved manner.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence 11.4.2.5.(4), the performance level of an existing building is reduced where proposed construction will result in,(a) the change of the major occupancy of all or part of an existing building to another major occupancy of a greater hazard index, (b) the conversion of a suite of a Group C major occupancy into more than one suite of Group C major occupancy, (c) the conversion of a suite or part of a suite of a Group A, Division 2 or a Group A, Division 4 major occupancy into a gaming premises, (d) the change of a farm building or part of a farm building to a major occupancy, (e) the change of a building or part of a building to a post-disaster building, (f) the change of a building or part of a building to a retirement home, or (g) the change in use of a building or part of a building where the previous major occupancy of the building or part of the building cannot be determined.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence 11.4.2.5.(4), the performance level of an existing building is reduced where proposed construction will result in,(a) the change of the major occupancy of all or part of an existing building to another major occupancy of a greater hazard index, (b) the conversion of a suite of a Group C major occupancy into more than one suite of Group C major occupancy, (c) the conversion of a suite or part of a suite of a Group A, Division 2 or a Group A, Division 4 major occupancy into a gaming premises, (d) the change of a farm building or part of a farm building to a major occupancy, (e) the change of a building or part of a building to a post-disaster building, (f) the change of a building or part of a building to a retirement home, or (g) the change in use of a building or part of a building where the previous major occupancy of the building or part of the building cannot be determined.

ON Full: A ramp shall have, along each side a handrail that, has a height of not less than 865 mm and not more than 965 mm, and runs parallel to the slope of the ramp, a width of at least 1 100 mm, a curb or other means to prevent a wheelchair from falling off the side of the ramp, surface finishes capable of being kept clean, sanitary and free from slipperiness, and a landing at the bottom at least 1 500 mm in length and the same width as the ramp.
ON Variations: A ramp shall have, along each side a handrail that, has a height of not less than 865 mm and not more than 965 mm, and runs parallel to the slope of the ramp, a width of at least 1 100 mm, a curb or other means to prevent a wheelchair from falling off the side of the ramp, surface finishes capable of being kept clean, sanitary and free from slipperiness, and a landing at the bottom at least 1 500 mm in length and the same width as the ramp.

ON Full: Under fire conditions, where the fire-resistance rating of the structure is less than that of the firewall, (a) lateral support shall be assumed to be provided by the structure on one side only, or (b) another structural support system capable of resisting the loads imposed by a fire on either side of the firewall shall be provided.
ON Variations: Under fire conditions, where the fire-resistance rating of the structure is less than that of the firewall, (a) lateral support shall be assumed to be provided by the structure on one side only, or (b) another structural support system capable of resisting the loads imposed by a fire on either side of the firewall shall be provided.

ON Full: Where a crawl space exceeds 1 800 mm in height or is used for any occupancy or as a plenum in combustible construction or for the passage of flue pipes, it shall be considered as a basement in applying the requirements in Article 9.10.8.1.
ON Variations: Where a crawl space exceeds 1 800 mm in height or is used for any occupancy or as a plenum in combustible construction or for the passage of flue pipes, it shall be considered as a basement in applying the requirements in Article 9.10.8.1.

ON Full: The location of outdoor processing equipment in process plants shall be based on its flammable liquid and combustible liquid capacity as described in Sentences (2) to (4).
ON Variations: The location of outdoor processing equipment in process plants shall be based on its flammable liquid and combustible liquid capacity as described in Sentences (2) to (4).

ON Full: Where the length of compression web members in roof trusses described in Sentence (1) exceeds 1.83 m, such web members shall be provided with continuous bracing to prevent buckling.
ON Variations: Where the length of compression web members in roof trusses described in Sentence (1) exceeds 1.83 m, such web members shall be provided with continuous bracing to prevent buckling.

ON Full: The combined thickness of the sand layer and the stone layer if utilized of a Type A dispersal bed shall not be less than 500 mm.
ON Variations: The combined thickness of the sand layer and the stone layer if utilized of a Type A dispersal bed shall not be less than 500 mm.

ON Full: A dispensing room shall be located in a floor area that has at least two exits.
ON Variations: A dispensing room shall be located in a floor area that has at least two exits.

ON Full: Except as permitted by Sentence (3), the canopy required by Sentence (1) is permitted to be omitted if the exterior wall of the upper storey is recessed not less than 1 m behind the exterior wall containing the opening in the lower storey.
ON Variations: Except as permitted by Sentence (3), the canopy required by Sentence (1) is permitted to be omitted if the exterior wall of the upper storey is recessed not less than 1 m behind the exterior wall containing the opening in the lower storey.

ON Full: Non-potable water system for re-use purposes shall be marked in accordance with 12 of CAN/CSA-B128.1, "Design and Installation of Non-Potable Water Systems".
ON Variations: Non-potable water system for re-use purposes shall be marked in accordance with 12 of CAN/CSA-B128.1, "Design and Installation of Non-Potable Water Systems".

ON Full: Where the hydrant barrel is found to contain water under Article 6.6.5.3., the drain valve shall be inspected for operation.
ON Variations: Where the hydrant barrel is found to contain water under Article 6.6.5.3., the drain valve shall be inspected for operation.

ON Full: The flame-spread rating of combustible light diffusers and lenses in all occupancies other than Group A, Division 1 is permitted to be more than the flame-spread rating limits required elsewhere in this Subsection, provided the light diffusers and lenses, have a flame-spread rating not more than 250 and a smoke developed classification not more than 600 when tested in conformance with CAN/ULC-S102.2, "Test for Surface Burning Characteristics of Flooring, Floor Coverings, and Miscellaneous Materials and Assemblies", fall to the bottom of the test apparatus before igniting when tested in conformance with ULC-S102.3, "Fire Test of Light Diffusers and Lenses", are not prevented from falling from the ceiling by construction located beneath the elements, and are not used in a corridor that is required to be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation or in an exit shaft unless individual diffusers or lenses are not more than 1 m2 in area and are not less than 1.2 m apart.
ON Variations: The flame-spread rating of combustible light diffusers and lenses in all occupancies other than Group A, Division 1 is permitted to be more than the flame-spread rating limits required elsewhere in this Subsection, provided the light diffusers and lenses, have a flame-spread rating not more than 250 and a smoke developed classification not more than 600 when tested in conformance with CAN/ULC-S102.2, "Test for Surface Burning Characteristics of Flooring, Floor Coverings, and Miscellaneous Materials and Assemblies", fall to the bottom of the test apparatus before igniting when tested in conformance with ULC-S102.3, "Fire Test of Light Diffusers and Lenses", are not prevented from falling from the ceiling by construction located beneath the elements, and are not used in a corridor that is required to be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation or in an exit shaft unless individual diffusers or lenses are not more than 1 m2 in area and are not less than 1.2 m apart.

ON Full: In addition to the provisions of this Section, the method of storage of flammable liquids and combustible liquids shall be determined to ensure the physical and chemical stability of the stored products.
ON Variations: In addition to the provisions of this Section, the method of storage of flammable liquids and combustible liquids shall be determined to ensure the physical and chemical stability of the stored products.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (3.1), where the exposing building face has a limiting distance of more than 0.45 m, the face of roof soffits above the exposing building face shall not project to less than 0.45 m from the property line.(3.1) Subject to Sentence (4), the face of a roof soffit is permitted to project to the property line, where it faces a street, lane or public thoroughfare.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (3.1), where the exposing building face has a limiting distance of more than 0.45 m, the face of roof soffits above the exposing building face shall not project to less than 0.45 m from the property line.(3.1) Subject to Sentence (4), the face of a roof soffit is permitted to project to the property line, where it faces a street, lane or public thoroughfare.

ON Full: Except as provided in Sentence (4), Subsection 9.15.4. and Section 9.39., reinforced concrete shall be designed to conform to the requirements of Part 4.
ON Variations: Except as provided in Sentence (4), Subsection 9.15.4. and Section 9.39., reinforced concrete shall be designed to conform to the requirements of Part 4.

ON Full: Measures shall be taken to guard against the hazards associated with pneumatic leakage testing where explosive mixtures of vapours from flammable liquids or combustible liquids and air may be present in the area of a tank that has been in use.
ON Variations: Measures shall be taken to guard against the hazards associated with pneumatic leakage testing where explosive mixtures of vapours from flammable liquids or combustible liquids and air may be present in the area of a tank that has been in use.

ON Full: Cargo pumps shall be designed and installed in conformance with Subsection 4.4.10.
ON Variations: Cargo pumps shall be designed and installed in conformance with Subsection 4.4.10.

ON Full: Where an exhaust air intake for the principal exhaust fan is located in the kitchen, it shall be located in the ceiling or on the wall within 300 mm of the ceiling.
ON Variations: Where an exhaust air intake for the principal exhaust fan is located in the kitchen, it shall be located in the ceiling or on the wall within 300 mm of the ceiling.

ON Full: Furring referred to in Sentence (1) shall be,(a) securely fastened to the framing, and (b) spaced not more than 610 mm o.c.
ON Variations: Furring referred to in Sentence (1) shall be,(a) securely fastened to the framing, and (b) spaced not more than 610 mm o.c.

ON Full: Flammable liquids and combustible liquids shall be stored in conformance with Part 4 and in areas inaccessible to children.
ON Variations: Flammable liquids and combustible liquids shall be stored in conformance with Part 4 and in areas inaccessible to children.

ON Full: A Type A dispersal bed shall be backfilled with leaching bed fill so as to ensure that, after the leaching bed fill settles, the surface of the leaching bed will not form any depressions.
ON Variations: A Type A dispersal bed shall be backfilled with leaching bed fill so as to ensure that, after the leaching bed fill settles, the surface of the leaching bed will not form any depressions.

ON Full: A rooftop enclosure provided for elevator machinery, a stairway or a service room used for no purpose other than for service to the building, shall not be considered as a storey in calculating the building height.
ON Variations: A rooftop enclosure provided for elevator machinery, a stairway or a service room used for no purpose other than for service to the building, shall not be considered as a storey in calculating the building height.

ON Full: Portable extinguishers required in Article 6.2.4.1. shall be located in conformance with this Subsection.
ON Variations: Portable extinguishers required in Article 6.2.4.1. shall be located in conformance with this Subsection.

ON Full: Materials for fabrics used in connection with air-supported structures are exempt from compliance with the requirements for flame-spread ratings for interior finishes in Subsection 3.1.13.
ON Variations: Materials for fabrics used in connection with air-supported structures are exempt from compliance with the requirements for flame-spread ratings for interior finishes in Subsection 3.1.13.

ON Full: The ridge beam referred to in Sentence (1) need not comply with Sentence (2) where,(a) the beam is of not less than 38 mm by 140 mm material, and (b) the beam is supported at intervals not exceeding 1.2 m by not less than 38 mm by 89 mm members extending vertically from the ridge to suitable bearing.
ON Variations: The ridge beam referred to in Sentence (1) need not comply with Sentence (2) where,(a) the beam is of not less than 38 mm by 140 mm material, and (b) the beam is supported at intervals not exceeding 1.2 m by not less than 38 mm by 89 mm members extending vertically from the ridge to suitable bearing.

ON Full: Slab and panel facings of precast concrete and natural or artificial stone shall conform to Subsection 4.3.2.
ON Variations: Slab and panel facings of precast concrete and natural or artificial stone shall conform to Subsection 4.3.2.

ON Full: Where a storm drainage system is connected to a public combined sewer, a trap shall be installed between any opening in the system and the drain or sewer, except that no trap is required if the opening is the upper end of a leader that terminates,(a) at a roof that is used only for weather protection, (b) not less than 1 000 mm above or not less than 3.5 m in any other direction from any air inlet, openable window or door, and (c) not less than 1 800 mm from a property line.
ON Variations: Where a storm drainage system is connected to a public combined sewer, a trap shall be installed between any opening in the system and the drain or sewer, except that no trap is required if the opening is the upper end of a leader that terminates,(a) at a roof that is used only for weather protection, (b) not less than 1 000 mm above or not less than 3.5 m in any other direction from any air inlet, openable window or door, and (c) not less than 1 800 mm from a property line.

ON Full: In cases where the dead load of the partition is counteractive, the load allowances referred to in Sentences (2) and (3) shall not be included in the design calculations.
